analyzed: aṣṭasāhasrikā prajñāpāramitā
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines

analyzed: om namaḥ bhagavatyai ārya prajñāpāramitāyai
translated: Om. Homage to the Blessed Noble Perfection of Wisdom.

analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā caryā prathamaḥ parivartaḥ
translated: The Practice of the Knowledge of All Modes. Chapter One.

analyzed: evam mayā śrutam
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekasmin samaye bhagavān rājagṛhe viharati sma gṛdhakūṭe parvate mahatā bhikṣusaṃghena sārdhamardhatrayodaśabhirbhikṣuśataiḥ /
analyzed: ekasmin samaye bhagavān rājagṛhe viharati sma gṛdhakūṭe parvate mahatā bhikṣu saṃghena sārdham ardha trayodaśabhiḥ bhikṣu śataiḥ
translated: At one time the Blessed One was dwelling at Rajagriha on the Vulture Peak mountain together with a great community of monks, with twelve hundred and fifty monks,

original: sarvairarhadbhiḥ kṣīṇāsravairniḥkleśairvaśībhūtaiḥ suvimuktacittaiḥ suvimuktaprajñairājñairājāneyairmahānāgaiḥ kṛtakṛtyaiḥ kṛtakaraṇīyairapahṛtabhārairanuprāptasvakārthaiḥ parikṣīṇabhavasaṃyojanaiḥ samyagājñāsuvimuktacittaiḥ sarvacetovaśiparamapāramiprāptairekaṃ pudgalaṃ sthāpayitvā yaduta āyuṣmantamānandam //
analyzed: sarvaiḥ arhadbhiḥ kṣīṇa āsravaiḥ niḥkleśaiḥ vaśībhūtaiḥ su vimukta cittaiḥ su vimukta prajñaiḥ ājñaiḥ ājāneyaiḥ mahā nāgaiḥ kṛtakṛtyaiḥ kṛta karaṇīyaiḥ apahṛta bhāraiḥ anuprāpta svaka arthaiḥ parikṣīṇa bhava saṃyojanaiḥ samyagājñā su vimukta cittaiḥ sarva cetaḥ vaśi parama pārami prāptaiḥ ekam pudgalam sthāpayitvā yat uta āyuṣmantam ānandam
translated: all of them arhats, with taints destroyed, without afflictions, self-controlled, with well-liberated minds, with well-liberated wisdom, great leaders, leaders of the herd, great nagas, their work done, their task accomplished, their burden laid down, their own goal attained, with fetters that bound them to existence destroyed, their minds well-liberated by right knowledge, having attained the utmost perfection of control over all their thoughts, except for one person, namely the Venerable Ananda.

original: tatra khalu bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ subhūtiṃ sthaviramāmantrayate smapratibhātu te subhūte bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ prajñāpāramitāmārabhya yathā bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitā niryāyuriti //
analyzed: tatra khalu bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim sthaviram āmantrayate sma pratibhātu te subhūte bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām prajñāpāramitām ārabhya yathā bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāḥ niryāyuḥ iti
translated: There the Blessed One addressed the elder venerable Subhūti, “Subhūti, it occurs to you to teach the perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattva great beings, so that the bodhisattva great beings will leave by way of the perfection of wisdom.”

original: atha khalvāyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasyaitadabhavatkimayamāyuṣmān subhūtiḥ sthavira ātmīyena svakena prajñāpratibhānabalādhānena svakena prajñāpratibhānabalādhiṣṭhānena bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ prajñāpāramitāmupadekṣyati utāho buddhānubhāveneti /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasya etat abhavat kim ayam āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ sthaviraḥ ātmīyena svakena prajñā pratibhāna bala ādhānena svakena prajñā pratibhāna bala adhiṣṭhānena bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām prajñāpāramitām upadekṣyati uta aho buddha anubhāvena iti
translated: Then this occurred to the venerable Śāriputra: “Will the elder venerable Subhūti teach the perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattva great beings by way of his own power of wisdom and eloquence, by way of his own power of wisdom and eloquence, or by the power of the Buddha?”

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān subhūtirbuddhānubhāvena āyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasya imamevarūpaṃ cetasaiva cetaḥparivitarkamājñāya āyuṣmantaṃ śāriputrametadavocatyatkiṃcidāyuṣman śāriputra bhagavataḥ śrāvakā bhāṣante deśayanti upadiśanti udīrayanti prakāśayanti saṃprakāśayanti /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ buddha anubhāvena āyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasya imam eva rūpam cetasā eva cetaḥ parivitarkam ājñāya āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat yat kiṃcid āyuṣman śāriputra bhagavataḥ śrāvakāḥ bhāṣante deśayanti upadiśanti udīrayanti prakāśayanti saṃprakāśayanti
translated: Then the Venerable Subhūti, through the Buddha's power, knowing the Venerable Śāriputra's thoughts like this, said to the Venerable Śāriputra: Venerable Śāriputra, whatever the Blessed One's disciples speak, teach, explain, proclaim, reveal, and make clear,

analyzed: sa sarvaḥ tathāgatasya puruṣakāraḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: all that should be known as the Tathāgata's work.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: yaḥ hi tathāgatena dharmaḥ deśitaḥ
translated: Because whatever Dharma is taught by the Tathāgata,

original: tatra dharmadeśanāyāṃ śikṣamāṇāste tāṃ dharmatāṃ sākṣātkurvanti dhārayanti /
analyzed: tatra dharma deśanāyām śikṣamāṇāḥ te tām dharmatām sākṣātkurvanti dhārayanti
translated: in that Dharma teaching, those who are training directly realize and uphold that reality.

original: tāṃ dharmatāṃ sākṣātkṛtya dhārayitvā yadyadeva bhāṣante /🔽yadyadeva deśayanti /
analyzed: tām dharmatām sākṣātkṛtya dhārayitvā yat yat eva bhāṣante  yat yat eva deśayanti
translated: Having directly realized and upheld that reality, whatever they speak,🔽whatever they teach,

analyzed: yat yat eva upadiśanti  yat yat eva udīrayanti  yat yat eva prakāśayanti
translated: whatever they explain,🔽whatever they proclaim,🔽whatever they reveal,

analyzed: yat yat eva saṃprakāśayanti
translated: whatever they make clear,

analyzed: sarvam tat dharmatayā a viruddham
translated: all that is not in contradiction with reality.

original: tathāgatadharmadeśanāyā eva āyuṣman śāriputra eṣa niṣyandaḥ yatte kulaputrā upadiśantastāṃ dharmatāṃ dharmatayā na virodhayanti //
analyzed: tathāgata dharma deśanāyāḥ eva āyuṣman śāriputra eṣa nisyandaḥ yat te kula putrāḥ upadiśantaḥ tām dharmatām dharmatayā na virodhayanti
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, this is the outflow of the Tathāgata's Dharma teaching, that those sons of good family, when teaching, do not contradict that reality with reality.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān subhūtirbuddhānubhāvena bhagavantametadavocatyadbhagavānevamāhapratibhātu te subhūte bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ prajñāpāramitāmārabhya yathā bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāṃ niryāyuriti /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ buddha anubhāvena bhagavantam etat avocat yat bhagavān evam āha pratibhātu te subhūte bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām prajñāpāramitām ārabhya yathā bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitām niryāyuḥ iti
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti, through the Buddha's power, said this to the Blessed One: The Blessed One says, 'May it occur to you, Subhūti, about the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, so that the bodhisattva mahāsattvas may depart through the perfection of wisdom.'

analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ bodhisattvaḥ iti yat idam bhagavan ucyate
translated: If, Blessed One, it is said 'bodhisattva, bodhisattva,'

analyzed: katamasya etat bhagavan dharmasya adhivacanam yat uta bodhisattvaḥ iti
translated: Blessed One, what is the designation of this dharma called 'bodhisattva'?

original: nāhaṃ bhagavaṃstaṃ dharmaṃ samanupaśyāmi yaduta bodhisattva iti /
analyzed: na aham bhagavan tam dharmam samanupaśyāmi yat uta bodhisattvaḥ iti
translated: Blessed One, I do not see that dharma called 'bodhisattva.'

original: tamapyahaṃ bhagavan dharmaṃ na samanupaśyāmi yaduta prajñāpāramitā nāma /
analyzed: tam api aham bhagavan dharmam na samanupaśyāmi yat uta prajñāpāramitā nāma
translated: Blessed One, I also do not see that dharma called 'perfection of wisdom.'

original: so'haṃ bhagavan bodhisattvaṃ vā bodhisattvadharmaṃ vā avindan anupalabhamāno'samanupaśyan /
analyzed: saḥ uham bhagavan bodhisattvam vā bodhisattva dharmam vā a vindan
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, not finding a bodhisattva, not apprehending a bodhisattva, not seeing a bodhisattva,

original: prajñāpāramitāmapyavindan anupalabhamāno'samanupaśyan katamaṃ bodhisattvaṃ katamasyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāmavavadiṣyāmi anuśāsiṣyāmi /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitām api a vindan an upalabhamānaḥ ū amanupaśyan katamam bodhisattvam katamasyām prajñāpāramitāyām avavadiṣyāmi anuśāsiṣyāmi
translated: Not finding, not apprehending, not observing even the perfection of wisdom, which bodhisattva, in which perfection of wisdom, should I instruct and admonish?

original: api tu khalu punarbhagavan sacedevaṃ bhāṣyamāṇe deśyamāne upadiśyamāne bodhisattvasya cittaṃ nāvalīyate na saṃlīyate na viṣīdati na viṣādamāpadyate /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar bhagavan saced evam bhāṣyamāṇe deśyamāne upadiśyamāne bodhisattvasya cittam na avalīyate na saṃlīyate na viṣīdati na viṣādam āpadyate
translated: Moreover, Blessed One, if, when this is being taught, being shown, being pointed out, the mind of the bodhisattva does not become cowed, does not become crushed, does not become dejected, does not become overwhelmed,

analyzed: na asya vipṛṣṭhībhavati mānasam
translated: and his mind does not turn away,

analyzed: na bhagna pṛṣṭhībhavati
translated: does not turn back,

analyzed: na utrasyati na saṃtrasyati na saṃtrāsam āpadyate
translated: does not tremble, does not quake, does not quake violently,

analyzed: eṣaḥ eva bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām anuśāsanīyaḥ
translated: this very bodhisattva, this very great being, should be instructed in the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: eṣā eva asya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitā veditavyā
translated: This very perfection of wisdom of this bodhisattva, this very great being, should be known.

analyzed: eṣa uvavādaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: This is the instruction in the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: saced evam tiṣṭhati
translated: If he stands thus,

analyzed: eṣā eva asya avavāda anuśāsanī
translated: this is his instruction and admonition.

original: punaraparaṃ bhagavan bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caratā prajñāpāramitāyāṃ bhāvayatā evaṃ śikṣitavyaṃ yathā asau śikṣyamāṇastenāpi bodhicittena na manyeta /
analyzed: punar aparam bhagavan bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām caratā prajñāpāramitāyām bhāvayatā evam śikṣitavyam yathā asau śikṣyamāṇaḥ tena api bodhi cittena na manyeta
translated: Furthermore, Blessed One, a bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom, cultivating the perfection of wisdom, should train like this: while training in that way, he should not think with that thought of enlightenment.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

analyzed: tathā hita cittam acittam
translated: Because that thought is a non-thought.

original: prakṛtiścittasya prabhāsvarā //🔽atha khalvāyuṣmān śāriputra āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocatkiṃ punarāyuṣman subhūte asti taccittaṃ yaccittamacittam /🔽evamukte āyuṣmān subhūtirāyuṣmantaṃ śāriputrametadavocat kiṃ punarāyuṣman śāriputra yā acittatā /
analyzed: prakṛtiḥ cittasya prabhāsvarā  atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat kim punar āyuṣman subhūte asti tat cittam yat cittam acittam  evam ukte āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat kim punar āyuṣman śāriputra yā acitta tā
translated: The nature of the mind is luminous.🔽Then the Venerable Śāriputra said this to the Venerable Subhūti: But, Venerable Subhūti, is there that thought which is a non-thought?

original: tatra acittatāyāmastitā vā nāstitā vā vidyate vā upalabhyate vā /
analyzed: tatra acitta tāyām astitā vā nāstitā vā vidyate vā upalabhyate vā
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Subhūti said this to the Venerable Śāriputra: But, Venerable Śāriputra, is there existence or non-existence in that non-thought, or is it found or apprehended?

analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha na hi etat āyuṣman subhūte
translated: Śāriputra said, No, Venerable Subhūti.

original: subhūtirāhasacedāyuṣman śāriputra tatra acittatāyāmastitā vā nāstitā vā na vidyate vā nopalabhyate vā /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha saced āyuṣman śāriputra tatra acitta tāyām astitā vā na astitā vā na vidyate vā na upalabhyate vā
translated: Subhūti said, If, Venerable Śāriputra, there is no existence or non-existence in that non-thought, or it is not found or apprehended,

original: api nu te yukta eṣa paryanuyogo bhavati yadāyuṣmān śāriputra evamāhaasti taccittaṃ yaccittamacittamiti /
analyzed: api nu te yuktaḥ eṣa paryanuyogaḥ bhavati yat āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ evam āha asti tat cittam yat cittam acittam iti
translated: Is this reproach appropriate for you, when the Venerable Śāriputra says, 'Is there a mind that is a non-mind?'

original: evamukte āyuṣmān śāriputra āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocatkā punareṣā āyuṣman subhūte acittatā /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat kā punar eṣā āyuṣman subhūte acitta tā
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Śāriputra said to the Venerable Subhūti, 'But what, Venerable Subhūti, is this non-mind?'

analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha avikārā āyuṣman śāriputra avikalpā acitta tā
translated: Subhūti said, 'Venerable Śāriputra, non-mind is changeless and non-discriminating.'

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān śāriputra āyuṣmate subhūtaye sādhukāramadātsādhu sādhvāyuṣman subhūte /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ āyuṣmate subhūtaye sādhukāram adāt sādhu sādhu āyuṣman subhūte
translated: Then the Venerable Śāriputra applauded the Venerable Subhūti: 'Excellent, excellent, Venerable Subhūti!

original: yathāpi nāma tvaṃ bhagavatā araṇāvihāriṇāmagratāyāṃ nirdiṣṭo nirdiśasi /🔽ataśca bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'vinivartanīyo'nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodherupaparīkṣitavyaḥ /
analyzed: yathā api nāma tvam bhagavatā araṇā vihāriṇām agra tāyām nirdiṣṭaḥ nirdiśasi  atas ca bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ vinivartanīyaḥ anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ upaparīkṣitavyaḥ
translated: Just as you have been declared by the Blessed One as foremost among those who dwell in the absence of conflict, so you teach.🔽And from this, a bodhisattva mahāsattva should be examined as irreversible from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: avirahitaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: And a bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as inseparable from the perfection of wisdom.

original: śrāvakabhūmāvapi śikṣitukāmena iyameva prajñāpāramitā śrotavyā udgrahītavyā dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā pravartayitavyā /
analyzed: śrāvaka bhūmau api śikṣitu kāmena iyam eva prajñāpāramitā śrotavyā udgrahītavyā dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā pravartayitavyā
translated: One who wishes to train in the stage of the śrāvakas should listen to this very perfection of wisdom, should take it up, bear it in mind, recite it, master it, and teach it.

analyzed: iha eva prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣitavyam yogam āpattavyam
translated: One should train in this very perfection of wisdom and apply oneself to it.

original: pratyekabuddhabhūmāvapi śikṣitukāmena iyameva prajñāpāramitā śrotavyā udgrahītavyā dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā pravartayitavyā /
analyzed: pratyekabuddha bhūmau api śikṣitu kāmena iyam eva prajñāpāramitā śrotavyā udgrahītavyā dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā pravartayitavyā
translated: One who wishes to train in the stage of the pratyekabuddhas should listen to this very perfection of wisdom, should take it up, bear it in mind, recite it, master it, and teach it.

analyzed: iha eva prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣitavyam yogam āpattavyam
translated: One should train in this very perfection of wisdom and apply oneself to it.

original: bodhisattvabhūmāvapi śikṣitukāmena iyameva prajñāpāramitā śrotavyā udgrahītavyā dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā pravartayitavyā /
analyzed: bodhisattva bhūmau api śikṣitu kāmena iyam eva prajñāpāramitā śrotavyā udgrahītavyā dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā pravartayitavyā
translated: One who wishes to train in the stage of the bodhisattva should listen to this very perfection of wisdom, should take it up, bear it in mind, recite it, master it, and teach it.

analyzed: iha eva prajñāpāramitāyām upāya kauśalya samanvāgatena sarva bodhisattva dharma samudāgamāya yogaḥ karaṇīyaḥ
translated: In this very perfection of wisdom, one should apply oneself with skillful means in order to attain all the qualities of a bodhisattva.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: ihaiva hi prajñāpāramitāyāṃ vistareṇa sarvabodhisattvadharmā upadiṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: iha eva hi prajñāpāramitāyām vistareṇa sarva bodhisattva dharmāḥ upadiṣṭāḥ
translated: For in this very perfection of wisdom are taught in detail all the dharmas of the Bodhisattvas,

analyzed: yatra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena śikṣitavyam yogam āpattavyam
translated: where the Bodhisattva, the great being, should train, should exert himself.

original: anuttarāyāmapi samyaksaṃbodhau śikṣitukāmena iyameva prajñāpāramitā śrotavyā udgrahītavyā dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā pravartayitavyā
analyzed: anuttarāyām api samyaksaṃbodhau śikṣitu kāmena iyam eva prajñāpāramitā śrotavyā udgrahītavyā dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā pravartayitavyā
translated: Even by one who wishes to train in unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, this very perfection of wisdom should be listened to, grasped, borne in mind, recited, understood, and promulgated.

analyzed: iha eva prajñāpāramitāyām upāya kauśalya samanvāgatena sarva buddha dharma samudāgamāya yogaḥ karaṇīyaḥ
translated: In this very perfection of wisdom, endowed with skill in means, one should exert oneself for the attainment of all the Buddhadharmas.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: ihaiva hi prajñāpāramitāyāṃ vistareṇa sarvabuddha dharmā upadiṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: iha eva hi prajñāpāramitāyām vistareṇa sarva buddha dharmāḥ upadiṣṭāḥ
translated: For in this very perfection of wisdom are taught in detail all the Buddhadharmas,

analyzed: yatra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena śikṣitavyam yogam āpattavyam
translated: where the Bodhisattva, the great being, should train, should exert himself.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān subhūtirbhagavantametadavocatyo'haṃ bhagavan etadeva bodhisattvanāmadheyaṃ na vedmi nopalabhe na samanupaśyāmi /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat yā u ham bhagavan etat eva bodhisattva nāmadheyam na vedmi nā upalabhe na samanupaśyāmi
translated: Then the Venerable Subhuti said to the Blessed One: Blessed One, I do not know, do not perceive, do not see even the name of this Bodhisattva.

original: prajñāpāramitāmapi na vedmi nopalabhe na samanupaśyāmi /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitām api na vedmi nā upalabhe na samanupaśyāmi
translated: I do not know, do not apprehend, do not see the perfection of wisdom.

original: so'haṃ bhagavan etadeva bodhisattvanāmadheyamavindan anupalabhamāno'samanupaśyan prajñāpāramitāmapi avindan anupalabhamāno'samanupaśyan katamaṃ bodhisattvaṃ katamasyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāmavavadiṣyāmi anuśāsiṣyāmi /
analyzed: saḥ uham bhagavan etat eva bodhisattva nāmadheyam a vindan an upalabhamānaḥ u samanupaśyan prajñāpāramitām api a vindan an upalabhamānaḥ u samanupaśyan katamam bodhisattvam katamasyām prajñāpāramitāyām avavadiṣyāmi anuśāsiṣyāmi
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, not finding this very name of a bodhisattva, not apprehending it, not seeing it, not finding the perfection of wisdom, not apprehending it, not seeing it, which bodhisattva should I instruct and admonish in which perfection of wisdom?

analyzed: etat eva bhagavan kaukṛtyam syāt
translated: Blessed One, this would be a source of regret.

original: yo'haṃ vastvavindan anupalabhamāno'samanupaśyan nāmadheyamātreṇa āyavyayaṃ kuryāṃ yaduta bodhisattva iti /
analyzed: yaḥ ham vastu avindan nāmadheya mātreṇa āya vyayam kuryām yat uta bodhisattvaḥ iti
translated: I, not finding, not apprehending, not seeing a thing, would engage in coming and going merely by a name, namely 'bodhisattva.'

original: api tu khalu punarbhagavaṃstadapi nāmadheyaṃ na sthitaṃ nāsthitaṃ na viṣṭhitaṃ nāviṣṭhitam /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar bhagavan tat api nāmadheyam na sthitam na asthitam na viṣṭhitam na a viṣṭhitam
translated: Moreover, Blessed One, that name also is not existent, not non-existent, not manifest, not unmanifest.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: a vidyamāna tvena tasya nāmadheyasya
translated: Because that name does not exist.

original: evaṃ tannāmadheyaṃ na sthitaṃ nāsthitaṃ na viṣṭhitaṃ nāviṣṭhitam /
analyzed: evam tat nāmadheyam na sthitam na asthitam na viṣṭhitam na a viṣṭhitam
translated: Thus that name is not existent, not non-existent, not manifest, not unmanifest.

original: sacedbodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya evaṃ gambhīrāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāyāṃ deśyamānāyāmupadiśyamānāyāṃ cittaṃ nāvalīyate na saṃlīyate na viṣīdati na viṣādamāpadyate /
analyzed: saced bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya evam gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām bhāṣyamāṇāyām deśyamānāyām upadiśyamānāyām cittam na avalīyate na saṃlīyate na viṣīdati na viṣādam āpadyate
translated: If, when this profound perfection of wisdom is being taught, being shown, being expounded, the mind of the bodhisattva mahāsattva does not become cowed, does not become stooped, does not become timid, does not become frightened,

analyzed: na asya vipṛṣṭhībhavati mānasam
translated: his mind does not turn away,

analyzed: na bhagna pṛṣṭhībhavati
translated: does not turn back,

analyzed: na utrasyati na saṃtrasyati na saṃtrāsam āpadyate
translated: does not tremble, does not quake, does not quake violently,

original: adhimucyate'dhyāśayena avirahito bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyā veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: adhimucyate idhyāśayena avirahitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: he is resolved with superior intention, and should be known as a bodhisattva mahāsattva who is not separated from the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: sthitaḥ vinivartanīyāyām bodhisattva bhūmau
translated: He is established in the irreversible bodhisattva stage.

analyzed: su sthitaḥ sthāna yogena
translated: Well-established in the yoga of non-abiding.

original: punaraparaṃ bhagavan bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caratā prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāvayatā na rūpe sthātavyaṃ na vedanāyāṃ na saṃjñāyāṃ na saṃskāreṣu /
analyzed: punar aparam bhagavan bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām caratā prajñāpāramitām bhāvayatā na rūpe sthātavyam na vedanāyām na saṃjñāyām na saṃskāreṣu
translated: Moreover, Blessed One, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva practices the perfection of wisdom, cultivates the perfection of wisdom, he should not stand in form, feeling, perception, volitional formations,

analyzed: na vijñāne sthātavyam
translated: or consciousness.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

analyzed: saced rūpe tiṣṭhati
translated: If he stands in form,

analyzed: rūpa abhisaṃskāre carati
translated: he practices the formation of form.

analyzed: na carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: He does not practice the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: evam saced vedanāyām saṃjñāyām saṃskāreṣu
translated: Similarly, if he abides in feeling, perception, volitional formations,

analyzed: saced vijñāne tiṣṭhati
translated: if he abides in consciousness,

analyzed: vijñāna abhisaṃskāre carati
translated: he practices the fabrication of consciousness.

analyzed: na carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: He does not practice the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: na hi abhisaṃskāre caran prajñāpāramitāṃ parigṛhṇāti /🔽nāpi prajñāpāramitāyāṃ yogamāpadyate /
analyzed: na hi abhisaṃskāre caran prajñāpāramitām parigṛhṇāti  na api prajñāpāramitāyām yogam āpadyate
translated: Because one who practices fabrication does not take up the perfection of wisdom,🔽nor does one engage in union with the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: na api prajñāpāramitām paripūrayate
translated: nor does one perfect the perfection of wisdom.

original: aparipūrayamāṇaḥ prajñāpāramitāṃ na niryāsyati sarvajñatāyāmaparigṛhītaṃ parigṛhṇan /
analyzed: a paripūrayamāṇaḥ prajñāpāramitām na niryāsyati sarvajña tāyām a parigṛhītam parigṛhṇan
translated: Not perfecting the perfection of wisdom, one does not depart from the apprehension of the non-apprehended in omniscience.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: rūpam hi a parigṛhītam prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: Because form is not apprehended in the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: evam vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ
translated: Similarly, feeling, perception, volitional formations,

analyzed: vijñānam hi a parigṛhītam prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: consciousness is not apprehended in the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: yaḥ ca rūpasya aparigrahaḥ
translated: And the non-apprehension of form,

analyzed: na tad rūpam
translated: that is not form.

analyzed: evam yaḥ vedanāyāḥ saṃjñāyāḥ saṃskārāṇām
translated: Similarly, the non-apprehension of feeling, perception, volitional formations,

analyzed: yaḥ vijñānasya aparigrahaḥ
translated: the non-apprehension of consciousness,

analyzed: na tat vijñānam
translated: that is not consciousness.

analyzed: sā api prajñāpāramitā a parigṛhītā
translated: That perfection of wisdom is also non-apprehended.

original: evaṃ hyatra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caritavyam /
analyzed: evam hi atra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām caritavyam
translated: Thus, a bodhisattva mahāsattva should practice the perfection of wisdom here.

original: ayaṃ ca bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya sarvadharmāparigṛhīto nāma samādhirvipulaḥ puraskṛtaḥ apramāṇaniyato'sādhāraṇaḥ /
analyzed: ayam ca bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya sarva dharma a parigṛhītaḥ nāma samādhiḥ vipulaḥ puraskṛtaḥ a pramāṇa niyataḥ usādhāraṇaḥ
translated: And this is the bodhisattva mahāsattva's samādhi called Not Seizing Any Dharma, which is vast, preeminent, immeasurable, determined, and not shared with all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhaiḥ sā api sarvajña tā a parigṛhītā
translated: That omniscience is also not seized.

analyzed: na hi nimittataḥ grahītavyā
translated: For it should not be seized through a sign.

analyzed: saced nimittataḥ grahītavyā abhaviṣyat
translated: If it were to be seized through a sign,

analyzed: na ca iha śreṇikaḥ parivrājakaḥ śraddhām alapsyata
translated: then the wanderer Śreṇika would not have attained faith.

original: tatra hi śreṇikaḥ parivrājakaḥ sarvajñajñāne adhimucya śraddhānusārī prādeśikena jñānenāvatīrṇaḥ /
analyzed: tatra hi śreṇikaḥ parivrājakaḥ sarvajña jñāne adhimucya śraddhā anusārī prādeśikena jñānena avatīrṇaḥ
translated: For there, the wanderer Śreṇika, having been inspired by the knowledge of omniscience, entered through a limited knowledge as a follower of faith.

analyzed: saḥ uvatīrya na rūpam parigṛhṇīte
translated: Having entered, he did not seize form.

original: evaṃ na vedanāṃ na saṃjñāṃ na saṃskārān /
analyzed: evam na vedanām na saṃjñām na saṃskārān
translated: Likewise, he did not seize feeling, perception, volitional factors,

analyzed: na vijñānam parigṛhṇīte
translated: or consciousness.

original: nāpi tatra prītisukhena tajjñānaṃ samanupaśyati /🔽nādhyātmaṃ rūpasya tajjñānaṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: nā api tatra prīti sukhena tat jñānam samanupaśyati  na adhyātmam rūpasya tat jñānam samanupaśyati
translated: And he did not see that knowledge as joy and pleasure there.🔽He did not see that knowledge internally as form.

analyzed: na vahirdhā rūpasya tat jñānam samanupaśyati
translated: He did not see that knowledge externally as form.

analyzed: na adhyātma bahirdhā rūpasya tat jñānam samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see that knowledge of form as internal or external.

analyzed: na api anyatra rūpāt tat jñānam samanupaśyati
translated: Nor does he see that knowledge apart from form.

original: evaṃ nādhyātmaṃ vedanāyāḥ saṃjñāyāḥ saṃskārāṇām /🔽nādhyātmaṃ vijñānasya tajjñānaṃ samanupaśyati /🔽na vahirdhā vijñānasya tajjñānaṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: evam na adhyātmam vedanāyāḥ saṃjñāyāḥ saṃskārāṇām  na adhyātmam vijñānasya tat jñānam samanupaśyati  na vahirdhā vijñānasya tat jñānam samanupaśyati
translated: Similarly, he does not see that knowledge of feeling, perception, volitional formations,🔽or consciousness as internal.🔽He does not see that knowledge of consciousness as external.

analyzed: na adhyātma vahirdhā vijñānasya tat jñānam samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see that knowledge of consciousness as internal and external.

analyzed: na api anyatra vijñānāt tat jñānam samanupaśyati
translated: Nor does he see that knowledge apart from consciousness.

analyzed: atra pada paryāye śreṇikaḥ parivrājaka ūdhi muktaḥ
translated: In this series of words, the wandering ascetic Śreṇika had faith.

original: so'tra sarvatra śraddhānusārī sarvajñajñāne dharmatāṃ pramāṇīkṛtya evamadhimukta iti /
analyzed: saḥ utra sarvatra śraddhā anusārī sarvajña jñāne dharmatām pramāṇīkṛtya evam adhimuktaḥ iti
translated: He had faith in all this, taking the nature of omniscient knowledge as authoritative.

analyzed: tena na kaścid dharmaḥ parigṛhītaḥ
translated: By that, he did not grasp any dharma at all.

analyzed: nā api sa kaścid dharmaḥ yaḥ upalabdhaḥ
translated: Nor did he apprehend any dharma at all.

analyzed: yam gṛhṇīyāt muñcet vā
translated: Which he would grasp or let go.

analyzed: sa nirvāṇam api na manyate
translated: He did not even conceive of nirvana.

original: iyamapi bhagavan bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitā veditavyā yadrūpaṃ na parigṛhṇīte /
analyzed: iyam api bhagavan bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitā veditavyā yat rūpam na parigṛhṇīte
translated: Blessed One, this should also be known as the perfection of wisdom of a bodhisattva-mahāsattva, in that they do not grasp form.

analyzed: evam yat vedanām saṃjñām saṃskārān
translated: In the same way, he does not grasp feeling, perception, volitional formations,

analyzed: yat vijñānam na parigṛhṇīte
translated: or consciousness.

analyzed: na ca antarā parinirvāti
translated: But he does not attain final nirvāṇa in between.

analyzed: aparipūrṇaiḥ daśabhiḥ tathāgata balaiḥ caturbhiḥ tathāgata vaiśāradyaiḥ aṣṭādaśabhiḥ ca āveṇikaiḥ buddha dharmaiḥ
translated: Because he has not fulfilled the ten powers of the Tathāgata, the four confidences of the Tathāgata, and the eighteen dharmas exclusive to the Buddha.

original: tasmādiyamapi bhagavan bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitā veditavyā //
analyzed: tasmāt iyam api bhagavan bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitā veditavyā
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known.

original: punaraparaṃ bhagavan bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caratā prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāvayatā evamupaparīkṣitavyamevamupanidhyātavyamkatamaiṣā
analyzed: punar aparam bhagavan bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām caratā prajñāpāramitām bhāvayatā evam upaparīkṣitavyam evam upanidhyātavyam katamā eṣā
translated: Moreover, Blessed One, when the bodhisattva mahāsattva practices the perfection of wisdom and cultivates the perfection of wisdom, he should investigate and contemplate in this way: 'What is this?

analyzed: kasya ca eṣā prajñāpāramitā
translated: And whose is this perfection of wisdom?

original: kiṃ yo dharmo na vidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: kim yaḥ dharmaḥ na vidyate na upalabhyate
translated: Is it that which does not exist and is not perceived?

analyzed: sā prajñāpāramitā iti
translated: Is that the perfection of wisdom?'

original: sacedevamupaparīkṣamāṇaḥ evamupanidhyāyan nāvalīyate na saṃlīyate na viṣīdati na viṣādamāpadyate /
analyzed: saced evam upaparīkṣamāṇaḥ evam upanidhyāyan na avalīyate na saṃlīyate na viṣīdati na viṣādam āpadyate
translated: If, while investigating and contemplating in this way, he does not become timid, does not become fainthearted, does not become depressed, does not become downcast,

analyzed: na asya vipṛṣṭhībhavati mānasam
translated: and his mind does not turn away,

analyzed: na bhagna pṛṣṭhībhavati
translated: and he does not turn back,

analyzed: na utrasyati na saṃtrasyati na saṃtrāsam āpadyate
translated: does not tremble, is not frightened, and is not overcome with fear.

analyzed: avirahitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitayā veditavyaḥ
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as not separated from the perfection of wisdom.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān śāriputra āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocatkiṃ kāraṇamāyuṣman subhūte avirahito bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitayā veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat kim kāraṇam āyuṣman subhūte avirahitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitayā veditavyaḥ
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said this to the venerable Subhūti: Venerable Subhūti, what is the reason that the bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as not separated from the perfection of wisdom?

analyzed: yadā rūpam eva virahitam rūpa svabhāvena
translated: When form itself is separated from the nature of form,

original: evaṃ yadā vedanaiva saṃjñaiva saṃskārā eva /
analyzed: evam yadā vedanā eva saṃjñā eva saṃskārāḥ eva
translated: when feeling itself, perception itself, volitional factors themselves,

analyzed: yadā vijñānam eva virahitam vijñāna svabhāvena
translated: when consciousness itself is separated from the nature of consciousness,

analyzed: yadā prajñāpāramitā eva virahitā prajñāpāramitā svabhāvena
translated: when the perfection of wisdom itself is separated from the nature of the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: yadā sarvajña tā eva virahitā sarvajña tā svabhāvena
translated: when omniscience itself is separated from the nature of omniscience.

original: evamukte āyuṣmān subhūtirāyuṣmantaṃ śāriputrametadavocatetametadāyuṣman śāriputra evametat /

translated: When this was said, the venerable Subhūti said this to the venerable Śāriputra: Venerable Śāriputra, it is just so.

analyzed: rūpam eva āyuṣman śāriputra virahitam rūpa svabhāvena
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, form itself is separated from the nature of form,

analyzed: evam vedanā eva saṃjñā eva saṃskārāḥ eva
translated: feeling itself, perception itself, volitional factors themselves,

analyzed: vijñānam eva āyuṣman śāriputra virahitam vijñāna svabhāvena
translated: Consciousness itself, Venerable Śāriputra, is devoid of the nature of consciousness.

analyzed: prajñāpāramitā eva āyuṣman śāriputra virahitā prajñāpāramitā svabhāvena
translated: The perfection of wisdom itself, Venerable Śāriputra, is devoid of the nature of the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: sarvajña tā eva āyuṣman śāriputra virahitā sarvajña tā svabhāvena
translated: Omniscience itself, Venerable Śāriputra, is devoid of the nature of omniscience.

analyzed: prajñāpāramitā lakṣaṇena api prajñāpāramitā virahitā

original: svabhāvalakṣaṇenāpi svabhāvo virahitaḥ //🔽evamukte āyuṣmān śāriputra āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocatkiṃ punarāyuṣman subhūte yo bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'tra śikṣiṣyate /

analyzed: sa niryāsyati sarvajña tāyām
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Śāriputra said to the Venerable Subhūti: But, Venerable Subhūti, will the bodhisattva mahāsattva who trains in this attain omniscience?

analyzed: āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ āha evam etat āyuṣman śāriputra evam etat  yaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ atra śikṣiṣyate

analyzed: sa niryāsyati sarvajña tāyām
