analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat tena hi yathā aham āyuṣmataḥ subhūteḥ bhāṣitasya artham ājānāmi
translated: Then the Venerable Śāriputra said this to the Venerable Subhūti: Well then, as I understand the meaning of what the Venerable Subhūti has said,

analyzed: tathā bodhisattvaḥ api anutpādaḥ
translated: in that way, a bodhisattva is also non-arisen.

original: yadi ca āyuṣman subhūte bodhisattvo'pyanutpādaḥ kiṃ bodhisattvo duṣkaracārikāṃ carati /
analyzed: yadi ca āyuṣman subhūte bodhisattvaḥ api anutpādaḥ kim bodhisattvaḥ duṣkara cārikām carati
translated: And if, Venerable Subhūti, a bodhisattva is also non-arisen, then why does a bodhisattva practice the difficult practices,

original: yāni vā tāni sattvānāṃ kṛtaśo duḥkhānyutsahate pratyanubhavitum /
analyzed: yāni vā tāni sattvānām duḥkhāni utsahate pratyanubhavitum
translated: or why does he endure and experience those sufferings for the sake of beings?

original: evamukte āyuṣmān subhūtirāyuṣmantaṃ śāriputrametadavocatnāhamāyuṣman śāriputra icchāmi bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvaṃ duṣkaracārikāṃ carantam nāpi sa bodhisattvo mahāsattvo yo duṣkarasaṃjñayā carati /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat na aham āyuṣman śāriputra icchāmi bodhisattvam mahāsattvam duṣkara cārikām carantam nā api sa bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ yaḥ duṣkara saṃjñayā carati
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Subhūti said to the Venerable Śāriputra: Venerable Śāriputra, I do not wish for a bodhisattva mahāsattva to practice the difficult practices, nor is that a bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices with the notion of difficulty.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: na hi āyuṣman śāriputra duṣkarasaṃjñāṃ janayitvā śakyo'prameyāṇāmasaṃkhyeyānāṃ sattvānāmarthaḥ kartum /
analyzed: na hi āyuṣman śāriputra duṣkara saṃjñām janayitvā śakya uprameyāṇām asaṃkhyeyānām sattvānām arthaḥ kartum
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, it is not possible to accomplish the welfare of immeasurable, incalculable beings by generating the notion of difficulty.

analyzed: api tu sukha saṃjñām eva kṛtvā
translated: Rather, it is by creating the notion of happiness.

original: sarvasattvānāmantike mātṛsaṃjñāṃ pitṛsaṃjñāṃ putrasaṃjñāṃ duhitṛsaṃjñāṃ kṛtvā strīpuruṣeṣu /
analyzed: sarva sattvānām antike mātṛ saṃjñām pitṛ saṃjñām putra saṃjñām duhitṛ saṃjñām kṛtvā strī puruṣeṣu
translated: By creating the notion of mother, the notion of father, the notion of son, and the notion of daughter towards all beings, towards women and men.

original: evametāḥ saṃjñāḥ kṛtvā bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bodhisattvacārikāṃ carati /
analyzed: evam etāḥ saṃjñāḥ kṛtvā bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bodhisattva cārikām carati
translated: Having created these notions in this way, a bodhisattva mahāsattva practices the bodhisattva practice.

original: tasmānmātṛsaṃjñā pitṛsaṃjñā putrasaṃjñā duhitṛsaṃjñā bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sarvasattvānāmantike yāvadātmasaṃjñā utpādayitavyā /
analyzed: tasmāt mātṛ saṃjñā pitṛ saṃjñā putra saṃjñā duhitṛ saṃjñā bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sarva sattvānām antike yāvat ātma saṃjñā utpādayitavyā
translated: Therefore, a bodhisattva mahāsattva should arouse the perception of mother, the perception of father, the perception of son, the perception of daughter, and the perception of self towards all beings.

original: yathā ātmā sarveṇa sarvaṃ sarvathā sarvaṃ sarvaduḥkhebhyo mocayitavyaḥ /
analyzed: yathā ātmā sarveṇa sarvam sarvathā sarvam sarva duḥkhebhyaḥ mocayitavyaḥ
translated: Just as one should liberate oneself from all suffering in every way,

original: evaṃ sarvasattvāḥ sarveṇa sarvaṃ sarvathā sarvaṃ sarvaduḥkhebhyo mocayitavyā iti /
analyzed: evam sarva sattvāḥ sarveṇa sarvam sarvathā sarvam sarva duḥkhebhyaḥ mocayitavyāḥ iti
translated: in the same way, all beings should be liberated from all suffering in every way.

original: evaṃ ca sarvasattveṣu saṃjñā utpādayitavyāmayaite sarvasattvā na parityaktavyāḥ /
analyzed: evam ca sarva sattveṣu saṃjñā utpādayitavyā amayā ete sarva sattvāḥ na parityaktavyāḥ
translated: And one should arouse the perception towards all beings in this way: 'These all beings should not be abandoned by me.

analyzed: mayā ete sarva sattvāḥ parimocayitavyāḥ aparimāṇataḥ duḥkha skandhāt
translated: I should liberate these all beings from the immeasurable mass of suffering.

original: na ca mayaiteṣu cittapradoṣa utpādayitavya antaśaḥ śataśo'pi chidyamāneneti /
analyzed: na ca mayā eteṣu citta pradoṣaḥ utpādayitavyaḥ antaśas śataśas api chidyamānena iti
translated: And I should not arouse ill-will towards them, even if they were to cut me into a hundred pieces.'

original: evaṃ hi bodhisattvena mahāsattvena cittamutpādayitavyam sacedevaṃcitto vihariṣyati /🔽na duṣkarasaṃjñī cariṣyati /
analyzed: evam hi bodhisattvena mahāsattvena cittam utpādayitavyam saced evaṃcittaḥ vihariṣyati  na duṣkara saṃjñī cariṣyati
translated: If a bodhisattva mahāsattva abides with such a thought aroused,🔽he will not practice with the notion of difficulty.

analyzed: na duṣkara saṃjñī vihariṣyati
translated: He will abide with the notion of non-difficulty.

original: punaraparamāyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena evaṃ cittamutpādayitavyamyathā sarveṇa sarvaṃ sarvathā sarvamātmā na vidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: punar aparam āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena evam cittam utpādayitavyam yathā sarveṇa sarvam sarvathā sarvam ātmā na vidyate na upalabhyate
translated: Moreover, Venerable Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should arouse the following thought: 'Just as the self is not found or apprehended in any way at all, in any respect, in any manner, in any time,

original: evaṃ sarveṇa sarvaṃ sarvathā sarvaṃ sarvadharmā na saṃvidyante nopalabhyante /
analyzed: evam sarveṇa sarvam sarvathā sarvam sarva dharmāḥ na saṃvidyante na upalabhyante
translated: in the same way, all dharmas are not found or apprehended in any way at all, in any respect, in any manner, in any time.

analyzed: evam ādhyātmika bāhyeṣu sarva dharmeṣu saṃjñā utpādayitavyā
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva should arouse the perception of all internal and external dharmas.

analyzed: saced evaṃcittaḥ cariṣyati
translated: If he practices with this thought,

analyzed: na duṣkara saṃjñī cariṣyati
translated: he will not practice with the perception of difficulty.

analyzed: na duṣkara saṃjñī vihariṣyati
translated: He will dwell without the perception of difficulty.

analyzed: yat api āyuṣman śāriputra evam āha anutpādaḥ bodhisattvaḥ iti
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, as for what you said - 'The bodhisattva is non-arising' -

analyzed: evam etat āyuṣman śāriputra evam etat
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, it is so, it is so.

analyzed: anutpādaḥ bodhisattvaḥ iti
translated: The bodhisattva is non-arising.

original: śāriputra āhakiṃ punarāyuṣman subhūte bodhisattva evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha kim punar āyuṣman subhūte bodhisattvaḥ eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Śāriputra said, Venerable Subhūti, is the bodhisattva non-arising,

analyzed: uta aho bodhisattva dharmāḥ api anutpādaḥ
translated: or are the dharmas of the bodhisattva also non-arising?

original: subhūtirāhabodhisattvadharmā api āyuṣman śāriputra anutpādaḥ śāriputra āhakiṃ punarāyuṣman subhūte bodhisattvadharmā evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha bodhisattva dharmāḥ api āyuṣman śāriputra anutpādaḥ śāriputraḥ āha kim punar āyuṣman subhūte bodhisattva dharmāḥ eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Subhūti said, “Venerable Śāriputra, even the qualities of a bodhisattva are non-arising.” Śāriputra said, “Venerable Subhūti, are only the qualities of a bodhisattva non-arising?

analyzed: uta aho sarvajña tā api anutpādaḥ  subhūtiḥ āha sarvajña tā api āyuṣman śāriputra anutpādaḥ
translated: Or is omniscience also non-arising?”🔽Subhūti said, “Venerable Śāriputra, omniscience is also non-arising.”

analyzed: āha kim punar āyuṣman subhūte sarvajña tā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Śāriputra said, “Venerable Subhūti, is omniscience itself non-arising?

original: utāho sarvajñatādharmā apyanutpādaḥ /🔽āhasarvajñatādharmā apyāyuṣman śāriputra anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: uta aho sarvajña tā dharmāḥ api anutpādaḥ  āha sarvajña tā dharmāḥ api āyuṣman śāriputra anutpādaḥ
translated: Or are the qualities of omniscience also non-arising?”🔽Subhūti said, “Venerable Śāriputra, the qualities of omniscience are also non-arising.”

analyzed: āha kim punar āyuṣman subhūte sarvajña tā dharmāḥ eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Śāriputra said, “Venerable Subhūti, are only the qualities of omniscience non-arising?

analyzed: uta aho pṛthagjanaḥ api anutpādaḥ  āha pṛthagjanaḥ upi āyuṣman śāriputra anutpādaḥ
translated: Or is an ordinary person also non-arising?”🔽Subhūti said, “Venerable Śāriputra, an ordinary person is also non-arising.”

analyzed: āha kim punar āyuṣman subhūte pṛthagjanaḥ eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Śāriputra said, “Venerable Subhūti, is an ordinary person himself non-arising?

analyzed: uta aho pṛthagjana dharmāḥ api anutpādaḥ
translated: Or are the qualities of an ordinary person also non-arising?”

analyzed: āha pṛthagjana dharmāḥ āpi āyuṣman śāriputra anutpādaḥ
translated: Subhūti said, “Venerable Śāriputra, the qualities of an ordinary person are also non-arising.”

original: evamukte āyuṣmān śāriputra āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocatyadyāyuṣman subhūte bodhisattvo'pyanutpādaḥ /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat adya āyuṣman subhūte bodhisattvaḥ api anutpādaḥ
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Śāriputra said to the Venerable Subhūti: “Venerable Subhūti, today the bodhisattva is also non-arising.

analyzed: bodhisattva dharmāḥ api anutpādaḥ  sarvajña tā api anutpādaḥ
translated: The dharmas of the bodhisattva are also non-arising.🔽Omniscience is also non-arising.

analyzed: sarvajña tā dharmāḥ api anutpādaḥ
translated: The dharmas of omniscience are also non-arising.

analyzed: pṛthagjanaḥ upi anutpādaḥ
translated: The ordinary person is also non-arising.

analyzed: pṛthagjana dharmāḥ api anutpādaḥ
translated: The dharmas of the ordinary person are also non-arising.

original: nanvāyuṣman subhūte anuprāptaiva ayatnena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sarvajñatā bhavati /
analyzed: nanu āyuṣman subhūte anuprāptā eva ayatnena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sarvajña tā bhavati
translated: Venerable Subhūti, is it not the case that omniscience is effortlessly attained by the bodhisattva mahāsattva, who is also non-arising?

original: evamukte āyuṣmān subhūtirāyuṣmantaṃ śāriputrametadavocatnāhamāyuṣman śāriputra anutpannasya dharmasya prāptimicchāmi /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat na aham āyuṣman śāriputra anutpannasya dharmasya prāptim icchāmi
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Subhūti said to the Venerable Śāriputra: Venerable Śāriputra, I do not wish for the attainment of a non-arisen dharma.

analyzed: na api abhisamayam
translated: Nor do I wish for its realization.

analyzed: na api anutpannena dharmeṇa anutpannā prāptiḥ prāpyate
translated: The attainment of a non-arisen dharma is not attained by a non-arisen dharma.

original: āhakiṃ punarāyuṣman subhūte anutpannena dharmeṇa anutpannā prāptiḥ prāpyate /
analyzed: āha kim punar āyuṣman subhūte anutpannena dharmeṇa anutpannā prāptiḥ prāpyate
translated: He said: Venerable Subhūti, is the attainment of a non-arisen dharma attained by a non-arisen dharma?

original: utāho utpannena dharmeṇa anutpannā prāptiḥ prāpyate /
analyzed: uta aho utpannena dharmeṇa anutpannā prāptiḥ prāpyate
translated: Or is the attainment of a non-arisen dharma attained by an arisen dharma?

original: āhakiṃ punarāyuṣman śāriputra anutpanno dharma utpannaḥ /
analyzed: āha kim punar āyuṣman śāriputra anutpannaḥ dharmaḥ utpannaḥ
translated: He said, “Venerable Śāriputra, is an unarisen dharma arisen?

analyzed: uta aho anutpannaḥ eva dharmaḥ unutpannaḥ
translated: Or is an unarisen dharma itself unarisen?”

original: āhakiṃ punarāyuṣman subhūte utpāda eva dharmo'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: āha kim punar āyuṣman subhūte utpādaḥ eva dharmaḥ anutpādaḥ
translated: He said, “Venerable Subhūti, is arising itself a dharma that is unarisen?

analyzed: uta aho anutpādaḥ dharmaḥ utpādaḥ
translated: Or is non-arising a dharma that is arisen?”

original: āhautpādo dharmo'nutpādo dharma ityāyuṣman śāriputra na pratibhāti jalpitum /
analyzed: āha autpādaḥ dharmaḥ nutpādaḥ dharmaḥ iti āyuṣman śāriputra na pratibhāti jalpitum
translated: He said, “Venerable Śāriputra, it does not occur to me to speak of ‘arising is a dharma that is unarisen.’

original: āhaanutpādo'pi te āyuṣman subhūte pratibhāti jalpitum /
analyzed: āha anutpādaḥ api te āyuṣman subhūte pratibhāti jalpitum
translated: He said, “Venerable Subhūti, does it occur to you to speak of ‘non-arising’?”

original: āhaanutpāda evāyuṣman śāriputra jalpaḥ /🔽anutpāda eva āyuṣmān śāriputra pratibhāti /
analyzed: āha anutpādaḥ eva āyuṣman śāriputra jalpaḥ  anutpādaḥ eva āyuṣmān śāriputra pratibhāti
translated: He said, “Venerable Śāriputra, non-arising is speech.🔽Venerable Śāriputra, non-arising occurs.

analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva āyuṣman śāriputra pratibhānam
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, non-arising is eloquence.

analyzed: evam eva āyuṣman śāriputra atyantam pratibhāti
translated: In this way, Venerable Śāriputra, it occurs to me to speak of ‘non-arising.’”

original: evamukte āyuṣmān śāriputra āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocatdhārmakathikānāmāyuṣmān subhūtiragratāyāṃ sthāpitavyaḥ /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat dhārma kathikānām āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ agra tāyām sthāpitavyaḥ
translated: When this was said, the venerable Śāriputra said to the venerable Subhūti, “The venerable Subhūti should be placed at the head of the Dharma teachers.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hyāyuṣmān subhūtiḥ sthaviro yato yata eva paripraśnīkriyate /
analyzed: tathā hi āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ sthaviraḥ yatas yatas eva paripraśnīkriyate
translated: Because the elder venerable Subhūti, wherever he is questioned,

analyzed: tatas tatas eva niḥsarati
translated: It comes forth from just that.

analyzed: dharmatāyāḥ ca na calati
translated: And it does not move from the true nature of dharmas.

analyzed: tām ca dharmatām na virodhayati
translated: And it does not contradict that true nature of dharmas.

original: evamukte āyuṣmān subhūtirāyuṣmantaṃ śāriputrametadavocatdharmataiṣā āyuṣman śāriputra bhagavataḥ śrāvakāṇāmaniśritadharmāṇām /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat dharmatā eṣā āyuṣman śāriputra bhagavataḥ śrāvakāṇām a niśrita dharmāṇām
translated: When this had been said, the Venerable Subhūti said to the Venerable Śāriputra: Venerable Śāriputra, it is the nature of things that the Blessed One's disciples, whose dharmas are without support,

analyzed: te yatas yatas eva paripraśnīkriyante
translated: from wherever they are questioned,

original: tatastata eva niḥsaranti /🔽dharmatāṃ ca na virodhayanti /
analyzed: tatas tatas eva niḥsaranti  dharmatām ca na virodhayanti
translated: they come forth from just that.🔽And they do not contradict the true nature of dharmas.

analyzed: dharmatāyāḥ ca na vyativartante
translated: And they do not go beyond the true nature of dharmas.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: yathā api nāma a niśrita tvāt sarva dharmāṇām
translated: It is because all dharmas are indeed without support.

original: evamukte āyuṣmān śāriputra āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocatsādhu sādhu āyuṣman subhūte /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat sādhu sādhu āyuṣman subhūte
translated: When this had been said, the Venerable Śāriputra said to the Venerable Subhūti: Excellent, excellent, Venerable Subhūti!

analyzed: katamā eṣā sarva dharma a niśrita pāramitā bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām
translated: Which is this perfection of not relying on any dharma of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas?

analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha prajñāpāramitā eva āyuṣman śāriputra sārvayānikī
translated: Subhūti said: Venerable Śāriputra, the perfection of wisdom alone is the universal vehicle.

analyzed: sarva dharma a niśrita tayā sarva dharma a niśrita pāramitā ca
translated: Because of not relying on any dharma, it is the perfection of not relying on any dharma.

original: iti hi yasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya evaṃ gambhīrāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāyāmevaṃ deśyamānāyāmevamupadiśyamānāyāṃ na bhavati cittasya🔽na bhavati kāṅkṣāyitatvam /
analyzed: iti hi yasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya evam gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām bhāṣyamāṇāyām evam deśyamānāyām evam upadiśyamānāyām na bhavati cittasya  na bhavati kāṅkṣāyita tvam
translated: Thus, it should be known that when this profound perfection of wisdom is being taught, being shown, being revealed in this way, the mind of that bodhisattva mahāsattva🔽does not become doubtful,🔽does not become hesitant,

analyzed: na bhavati dhaṃdhāyita tvam  na bhavati cittasya anyathātvam
translated: does not become otherwise.

original: veditavyamayaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattvo viharatyanena prajñāpāramitāvihāreṇa avirahitaścānena manasikāreṇeti //
analyzed: veditavyam ayam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ viharati anena prajñāpāramitā vihāreṇa avirahitaḥ ca anena manasikāreṇa iti
translated: It should be known that this bodhisattva mahāsattva dwells in this dwelling of the perfection of wisdom, and is not separated from this mental attention.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān śāriputra āyuṣmataṃ subhūtimetadavocatkathamāyuṣman subhūte avirahito bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'virahito manasikāreṇa bhavati /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ āyuṣmatam subhūtim etat avocat katham āyuṣman subhūte avirahitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ virahitaḥ manasikāreṇa bhavati
translated: Then the Venerable Śāriputra said this to the Venerable Subhūti: Venerable Subhūti, how does a bodhisattva mahāsattva who is not separated from mental attention become not separated from the dwelling of the perfection of wisdom?🔽If, Venerable Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva is not separated from mental attention,

analyzed: yaḥ prajñāpāramitā vihāreṇa viharati
translated: then he is separated from the dwelling of the perfection of wisdom.

original: yadi hyāyuṣman subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'virahito manasikāreṇa bhavati /
analyzed: yadi hi āyuṣman subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ virahitaḥ manasikāreṇa bhavati
translated: Subhūti said, Venerable Śāriputra, if a bodhisattva mahāsattva who is not separated from mental attention🔽dwells in the dwelling of the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: evam sa virahitaḥ prajñāpāramitā vihāreṇa bhavati
translated: he is not separated from the dwelling of the perfection of wisdom.

original: yadi ca āyuṣman subhūte avirahito bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāvihāreṇa bhavati /
analyzed: yadi ca āyuṣman subhūte avirahitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitā vihāreṇa bhavati
translated: If, Venerable Subhūti, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva is inseparable from the dwelling in the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: evam sa virahitaḥ manasikāreṇa bhavati
translated: then he is inseparable from mental activity.

original: yadi ca āyuṣman subhūte manasikāreṇāvirahito bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ /
analyzed: yadi ca āyuṣman subhūte manasikāreṇa avirahitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: If, Venerable Subhūti, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva is inseparable from mental activity,

analyzed: avirahitaḥ eva prajñāpāramitā vihāreṇa bhavati
translated: then he is inseparable from the dwelling in the perfection of wisdom.

original: evaṃ sati sarvasattvā apyavirahitā bhaviṣyanti prajñāpāramitāvihāreṇa /
analyzed: evam sati sarva sattvāḥ api avirahitāḥ bhaviṣyanti prajñāpāramitā vihāreṇa
translated: If that is so, then all beings will also be inseparable from the dwelling in the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ api hi avirahitāḥ manasikāreṇa viharanti
translated: Because all beings also dwell inseparable from mental activity.

original: evamukte āyuṣmān subhūtirāyuṣmantaṃ śāriputrametadavocatsādhu sādhu āyuṣman śāriputra /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat sādhu sādhu āyuṣman śāriputra
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Subhūti said to the Venerable Śāriputra: Good, good it is, Venerable Śāriputra!

analyzed: api tu upālapsye tvā
translated: But I will reproach you.

original: artha eva tvāyuṣmatā śāriputreṇa bhūtapadābhidhānena parigṛhītaḥ /
analyzed: arthaḥ eva tu āyuṣmatā śāriputreṇa bhūta pada abhidhānena parigṛhītaḥ
translated: The meaning, Venerable Śāriputra, has been taken up by you through the expression of the true words.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: sattva asvabhāva tayā āyuṣman śāriputra manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, the nature of mental activity should be known as the nature of beings.

original: sattvāsadbhāvatayā āyuṣman śāriputra manasikārāsadbhāvatā veditavyā /🔽sattvaviviktatayā āyuṣman śāriputra manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: sattva asadbhāva tayā āyuṣman śāriputra manasikāra asadbhāva tā veditavyā  sattva vivikta tayā āyuṣman śāriputra manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, the non-existence of mental activity should be known due to the non-existence of sentient beings.🔽Venerable Śāriputra, the isolation of mental activity should be known due to the isolation of sentient beings.

original: sattvācintyatayā āyuṣman śāriputra manasikārācintyatā veditavyā /🔽sattvānabhisaṃbodhanatayā āyuṣman śāriputra manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: sattva acintya tayā āyuṣman śāriputra manasikāra acintya tā veditavyā  sattva an abhisaṃbodhana tayā āyuṣman śāriputra manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, the inconceivability of mental activity should be known due to the inconceivability of sentient beings.🔽Venerable Śāriputra, the non-realization of mental activity should be known due to the non-realization of sentient beings.

analyzed: sattva a yathābhūta artha abhisaṃbodhana tayā āyuṣman śāriputra manasikāra a yathābhūta artha abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, the realization of mental activity as it really is should be known due to the realization of sentient beings as they really are.

original: anena āyuṣman śāriputra evaṃrūpeṇa manasikāreṇa icchāmi bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvaṃ viharantamanena vihāreṇeti //
analyzed: anena āyuṣman śāriputra evaṃrūpeṇa manasikāreṇa icchāmi bodhisattvam mahāsattvam viharantam anena vihāreṇa iti
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, with this kind of mental activity, I wish for the bodhisattva mahāsattva to abide in this kind of dwelling.

analyzed: ārya aṣṭasāhasrikāyām prajñāpāramitāyām sarvākārajña tā caryā parivartaḥ nāma prathamaḥ
translated: In the noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines, the first chapter is named The Practice of the Knowledge of All Aspects.

analyzed: śakraparivartaḥ dvitīyaḥ
translated: The second chapter is named The Chapter on Śakra.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena śakro devānāmindrastasyāmeva parṣadi saṃnipatitaḥ saṃniṣaṇṇo'bhūt catvāriṃśatā trāyastriṃśatkāyikairdevaputrasahasraiḥ sārdham /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena śakraḥ devānām indraḥ tasyām eva parṣadi saṃnipatitaḥ saṃniṣaṇṇaḥ bhūt catvāriṃśatā trāyastriṃśat kāyikaiḥ devaputra sahasraiḥ sārdham
translated: At that time, Śakra, lord of the gods, was present in that very assembly, seated together with forty thousand gods from the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

analyzed: catvāraḥ ca lokapālāḥ viṃśatyā cāturmahārājakāyikaiḥ devaputra sahasraiḥ sārdham
translated: The Four Great Kings, together with twenty thousand gods from the Heaven of the Four Kings, were also present.

analyzed: brahmā api sahā patiḥ daśabhiḥ brahmakāyikaiḥ devaputra sahasraiḥ sārdham
translated: Brahmā, lord of the Sahā world, was present with ten thousand gods from the Heaven of the First Jhana.

original: pañca ca śuddhāvāsānāṃ devaputrāṇāṃ sahasrāṇi tasyāmeva parṣadi saṃnipatitāni saṃniṣaṇṇānyabhūvan /
analyzed: pañca ca śuddhāvāsānām deva putrāṇām sahasrāṇi tasyām eva parṣadi saṃnipatitāni saṃniṣaṇṇāni abhūvan
translated: Five thousand gods from the Pure Abodes were also gathered and seated in that very assembly.

analyzed: yaḥ pi ca devānām sva karma vipāka jaḥ uvabhāsaḥ
translated: The light that arises from the ripening of the gods' own karma

analyzed: saḥ api sarvaḥ buddha anubhāvena buddha tejasā buddha adhiṣṭhānena abhibhūtaḥ abhūt
translated: was all outshone by the Buddha's power, the Buddha's splendor, and the Buddha's blessing.

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmindra āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtiṃ sthavirametadavocatimānyārya subhūte saṃbahulāni devaputrasahasrāṇi asyāṃ parṣadi saṃnipatitāni saṃniṣaṇṇāni āryasya subhūterantikātprajñāpāramitāṃ śrotukāmāni bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāmupadeśamavavādānuśāsanīṃ ca /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ āyuṣmantam subhūtim sthaviram etat avocat imāni ārya subhūte saṃbahulāni deva putra sahasrāṇi asyām parṣadi saṃnipatitāni saṃniṣaṇṇāni āryasya subhūteḥ antikāt prajñāpāramitām śrotu kāmāni bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām upadeśam avavāda anuśāsanīm ca
translated: Then indeed Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the elder venerable Subhūti: Many thousands of sons of gods, noble Subhūti, have assembled in this assembly and are seated, wishing to hear from the noble Subhūti the instruction, advice, and instruction for bodhisattva-mahāsattvas in the perfection of wisdom.

original: tatkathaṃ bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ sthātavyam /🔽kathaṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: tat katham bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām sthātavyam  katham śikṣitavyam
translated: How then should a bodhisattva-mahāsattva stand in the perfection of wisdom?🔽How should they train?

analyzed: katham yogam āpattavyam
translated: How should they apply themselves?

analyzed: sakṛdāgāmī dakṣiṇīyaḥ iti na sthātavyam
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the once-returner is worthy of offerings.

original: sakṛdāgāmyapariniṣṭhitattvātsakṛdimaṃ lokamāgamya duḥkhasyāntaṃ kariṣyatīti na sthātavyam /

original: anāgāmī dakṣiṇīya iti na sthātavyam anāgāmī anāgamya imaṃ lokaṃ tatraiva parinirvāsyatīti na sthātavyam /

analyzed: arhan dakṣiṇīyaḥ iti na sthātavyam
translated: One should not dwell on the thought that an arhat is worthy of offerings.

original: arhannihaiva anupadhiśeṣe nirvāṇadhātau parinirvāsyatīti na sthātavyam /

translated: One should not dwell on the thought that an arhat will attain final nirvana in this very life in the realm of nirvana without remainder.

analyzed: pratyekabuddhaḥ dakṣiṇīyaḥ iti na sthātavyam
translated: One should not dwell on the thought that a pratyekabuddha is worthy of offerings.

original: pratyekabuddho'tikramya śrāvakabhūmimaprāpya buddhabhūmiṃ parinirvāsyatīti na sthātavyam /

translated: One should not dwell on the thought that a pratyekabuddha, having surpassed the stage of disciples but not yet attained the stage of a buddha, will attain final nirvana.

analyzed: buddhaḥ dakṣiṇīyaḥ iti na sthātavyam
translated: One should not dwell on the thought that a buddha is worthy of offerings.

original: buddho'tikramya pṛthagjanabhūmimatikramya śrāvakabhūmimatikramya pratyekabuddhabhūmimaprabheyāṇāmasaṃkhyeyānāṃ sattvānāmarthaṃ kṛtvā aprameyāṇyasaṃkhyeyāni sattvakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi parinirvāpya aprameyānasaṃkhyeyān sattvān śrāvakapratyekabuddhasamyaksaṃbuddhatvaniyatān kṛtvā buddhabhūmau sthitvā buddhakṛtyaṃ kṛtvā anupadhiśeṣe nirvāṇadhātau buddhaparinirvāṇena parinirvāsyati ityevamapyanena na sthātavyam //
analyzed: buddha utikramya pṛthagjana bhūmim atikramya śrāvaka bhūmim atikramya pratyekabuddha bhūmim aprabheyāṇām asaṃkhyeyānām sattvānām artham kṛtvā aprameyāṇi asaṃkhyeyāni sattva koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi parinirvāpya aprameyān asaṃkhyeyān sattvān śrāvaka pratyekabuddha samyaksaṃbuddha tva niyatān kṛtvā buddha bhūmau sthitvā buddha kṛtyam kṛtvā an upadhi śeṣe nirvāṇa dhātau buddha parinirvāṇena parinirvāsyati iti evam api anena na sthātavyam
translated: The Buddha, having transcended the stage of ordinary beings, having transcended the stage of śrāvakas, having transcended the stage of pratyekabuddhas, having worked for the welfare of innumerable, incalculable beings, having caused innumerable, incalculable hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭīs of beings to attain final nirvāṇa, having established innumerable, incalculable beings in the determination for śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and perfect buddhas, having remained in the stage of a buddha, having performed the duties of a buddha, will attain final nirvāṇa in the element of nirvāṇa without remainder through the parinirvāṇa of a buddha. One should not stand in such a way of seeing either.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasyaitadabhavatyadi buddho'tikramya pṛthagjanabhūmimatikramya śrāvakabhūmimatikramya pratyekabuddhabhūmimaprameyāṇāmasaṃkhyeyānāṃ sattvānāmarthaṃ kṛtvā aprameyāṇyasaṃkhyeyāni sattvakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi parinirvāpya aprameyānasaṃkhyeyān sattvān śrāvakapratyekabuddhasamyaksaṃbuddhatvaniyatān kṛtvā buddhabhūmau sthitvā buddhakṛtyaṃ kṛtvā anupadhiśeṣe nirvāṇadhātau buddhaparinirvāṇena parinirvāsyati ityevamapyanena na sthātavyam /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasya etat abhavati adi buddha utikramya pṛthagjana bhūmim atikramya śrāvaka bhūmim atikramya pratyekabuddha bhūmim aprameyāṇām asaṃkhyeyānām sattvānām artham kṛtvā aprameyāṇi asaṃkhyeyāni sattva koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi parinirvāpya aprameyān asaṃkhyeyān sattvān śrāvaka pratyekabuddha samyaksaṃbuddha tva niyatān kṛtvā buddha bhūmau sthitvā buddha kṛtyam kṛtvā an upadhi śeṣe nirvāṇa dhātau buddha parinirvāṇ
translated: Then indeed this occurred to the Venerable Śāriputra: If a Buddha, having transcended the stage of ordinary beings, having transcended the stage of śrāvakas, having transcended the stage of pratyekabuddhas, having worked for the welfare of immeasurable, incalculable beings, having caused immeasurable, incalculable hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭīs of beings to attain final nirvāṇa, having established immeasurable, incalculable beings in the determination for śrāvakahood, pratyekabuddhahood, and perfect buddhahood, having remained in the Buddha stage and performed the Buddha's work, will finally pass into complete nirvāṇa in the element of nirvāṇa without remainder through the Buddha's parinirvāṇa, then he should not remain in that way.

analyzed: tat katham punar anena sthātavyam
translated: But how should he remain?

analyzed: katham śikṣitavyam iti
translated: How should he train?

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān subhūtirbuddhānubhāvena āyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasya cetasaiva cetaḥparivitarkamājñāya āyuṣmantaṃ śāriputrametadavocattatkiṃ manyase āyuṣman śāriputra kva tathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sthitaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ buddha anubhāvena āyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasya cetasā eva cetaḥ parivitarkam ājñāya āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat tat kim manyase āyuṣman śāriputra kva tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sthitaḥ
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti, through the Buddha's power, knowing the thought that had occurred to the venerable Śāriputra, said this to the venerable Śāriputra: What do you think, Venerable Śāriputra, where is the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One?

original: āyuṣmān śāriputra āhana kvacidāyuṣman subhūte tathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sthitaḥ /
analyzed: āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ āha kvacid āyuṣman subhūte tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sthitaḥ
translated: The venerable Śāriputra said, Venerable Subhūti, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One is nowhere.

analyzed: tat kasya heto
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: a pratiṣṭhita mānasaḥ hi tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One has a mind that is not fixed.

original: sa naiva saṃskṛte dhātau sthito nāpyasaṃskṛte dhātau sthito na ca tato vyutthitaḥ //
analyzed: sa nā eva saṃskṛte dhātau sthitaḥ na api asaṃskṛte dhātau sthitaḥ na ca tatas vyutthitaḥ
translated: He is not fixed in the compounded element, nor is he fixed in the uncompounded element, nor has he emerged from them.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān subhūtirāyuṣmantaṃ śāriputrametadavocatevameva āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sthātavyam /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat evam eva āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sthātavyam
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said this to the venerable Śāriputra: Venerable Śāriputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva should stand like this.

original: evaṃ śikṣitavyamyathā tathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho na kvacitsthito nāsthito na viṣṭhito nāviṣṭhitaḥ /
analyzed: evam śikṣitavyam yathā tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ na kvacid sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ na viṣṭhitaḥ na a viṣṭhitaḥ
translated: He should train like this: 'Just as the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One is not fixed anywhere, is not unfixed, is not standing, is not not standing.'

analyzed: tathā sthāsyāmi iti evam anena śikṣitavyam
translated: Thus should he train himself, thinking, I will stand just as the Tathāgata stands.🔽Just as the Tathāgata stands, so will I stand.

original: yathā tathāgatasthānaṃ tathā sthāsyāmīti /🔽tathā śikṣiṣye iti /
analyzed: yathā tathāgata sthānam tathā sthāsyāmi iti  tathā śikṣiṣye iti
translated: Thus should he train himself, thinking, I will stand just as the Tathāgata stands.

original: yathā tathāgatasthānaṃ tathā sthāsyāmīti /🔽tathā śikṣiṣye iti /
analyzed: yathā tathāgata sthānam tathā sthāsyāmi iti  tathā śikṣiṣye iti
translated: Just as the Tathāgata stands, so will I stand.🔽Thus should he train himself, thinking, I will stand just as the Tathāgata stands.

original: yathā tathāgatasthānaṃ tathā sthāsyāmīti susthito'sthānayogeneti evamatra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sthātavyamevaṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: yathā tathāgata sthānam tathā sthāsyāmi iti susthita usthāna yogena iti evam atra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sthātavyam evam śikṣitavyam
translated: Thus should the Bodhisattva, the Great Being, stand here, thus should he train himself, thinking, I will stand just as the Tathāgata stands.

original: evaṃ hi śikṣamāṇo bodhisattvo mahāsattvo viharatyanena prajñāpāramitāvihāreṇa avirahitaścānena manasikāreṇeti //
analyzed: evam hi śikṣamāṇaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ viharati anena prajñāpāramitā vihāreṇa avirahitaḥ ca anena manasikāreṇa iti
translated: Thus, when the Bodhisattva, the Great Being, trains like this, he dwells in this dwelling of the perfection of wisdom, and is not separated from this mental activity.

original: atha khalu tatra parṣadi keṣāṃciddevaputrāṇāmetadabhūtyāni tāni yakṣāṇāṃ yakṣabhāṣitāni yakṣarutāni yakṣapadāni yakṣamantritāni yakṣapravyāhṛtāni /
analyzed: atha khalu tatra parṣadi keṣāṃcid deva putrāṇām etat abhūtyāni tāni yakṣāṇām yakṣa bhāṣitāni yakṣa rutāni yakṣa padāni yakṣa mantritāni yakṣa pravyāhṛtāni
translated: Then, in that assembly, some gods thought this: Those are the yakṣas' words, the yakṣas' sounds, the yakṣas' phrases, the yakṣas' mantras, the yakṣas' utterances.

analyzed: tāni vijñāyante jalpyamānāni
translated: Those are understood when spoken.

original: na punaridaṃ vijñāyate yatsubhūtiḥ sthaviro bhāṣate pravyāharati deśayatyupadiśati /
analyzed: na punar idam vijñāyate yat subhūtiḥ sthaviraḥ bhāṣate pravyāharati deśayati upadiśati
translated: But this is not understood, what the elder Subhūti speaks, utters, teaches, explains.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān subhūtirbuddhānubhāvena teṣāṃ devaputrāṇāmimamevaṃrūpaṃ cetasaiva cetaḥparivitarkamājñāya tān devaputrānāmantrayate smana vijñāyate na vijñāyate idaṃ devaputrāḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ buddha anubhāvena teṣām deva putrāṇām imam evaṃrūpam cetasā eva cetaḥ parivitarkam ājñāya tān deva putrān āmantrayate vijñāyate na vijñāyate idam deva putrāḥ
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti, through the Buddha's power, knowing the thoughts and reasoning in the minds of those gods, said to those gods, Gods, it is known and not known.

analyzed: tathā hi na atra kiṃcid sūcyate
translated: Because here nothing is indicated.

analyzed: na atra kiṃcid śrūyate
translated: Here nothing is heard.🔽Then those gods again thought, Will this noble Subhūti explain?

original: atha khalu teṣāṃ devaputrāṇāṃ punarevaitadabhūtuttānīkariṣyati bata ayamāryasubhūtiḥ /🔽uttānīkariṣyati batāyamāryasubhūtiriti /
analyzed: atha khalu teṣām deva putrāṇām punar eva etat abhūt uttānīkariṣyati bata ayam ārya subhūtiḥ  uttānīkariṣyati bata ayam ārya subhūtiḥ iti
translated: Will this noble Subhūti elucidate?

analyzed: dūrāt dūrataram ārya subhūtiḥ praviśati
translated: The noble Subhūti enters further and further from afar.

analyzed: sūkṣmāt sūkṣmataram
translated: From the subtlest of the subtle.

analyzed: gambhīrāt gambhīrataram ārya subhūtiḥ praviśati deśayati bhāṣate iti
translated: The noble Subhūti enters and teaches and explains from the most profound of the profound.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān subhūtirbuddhānubhāvena punarapi teṣāmeva devaputrāṇāṃ cetasaiva cetaḥparivitarkamājñāya tān devaputrānāmantrayate smatena hi devaputrāḥ yaḥ srotaāpattiphalaṃ prāptukāmaḥ srotaāpattiphale sthātukāmaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ buddha anubhāvena punar api teṣām eva deva putrāṇām cetasā eva cetaḥ parivitarkam ājñāya tān deva putrān āmantrayate smatena hi deva putrāḥ yaḥ srotaāpatti phalam prāptu kāmaḥ srotaāpatti phale sthātu kāmaḥ
translated: Then indeed the venerable Subhuti, through the Buddha's power, again knowing the thoughts of those gods, addressed those gods, saying: Therefore, gods, he who desires to attain the fruit of stream-entry, who desires to stand in the fruit of stream-entry,

analyzed: sa na imām kṣāntim anāgamya peyā alam
translated: he, not having come to this acceptance, etc.

analyzed: yaḥ sakṛdāgā abhiphalam prāptu kāmaḥ
translated: He who desires to attain the fruit of once-returning,

analyzed: sakṛdāgāmi phale sthātu kāmaḥ
translated: who desires to stand in the fruit of once-returning,

analyzed: yonāgāmi phalam prāptu kāmaḥ ūnāgāmi phale sthātu kāmaḥ
translated: he who desires to attain the fruit of non-returning, who desires to stand in the fruit of non-returning,

analyzed: yorhat tvam prāptu kāmaḥ ūrhat tve sthātu kāmaḥ
translated: he who desires to attain arhatship, who desires to stand in arhatship,

analyzed: yaḥ pratyeka bodhim prāptu kāmaḥ pratyeka bodhau sthātu kāmaḥ
translated: he who desires to attain individual enlightenment, who desires to stand in individual enlightenment,

analyzed: sa na imām kṣāntim an āgamya
translated: he, not having come to this acceptance, etc.

analyzed: yaḥ unuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim prāptu kāmaḥ ūnuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau sthātu kāmaḥ
translated: He who desires to attain supreme perfect enlightenment, who desires to stand in supreme perfect enlightenment,

analyzed: sa na imām kṣāntim an āgamya
translated: he, not having come to this acceptance, etc., etc.

original: atha khalu punarapi teṣāṃ devaputrāṇāmetadabhavatkiṃrūpā asya āryasubhūterdhārmaśravaṇikā eṣṭavyāḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu punar api teṣām deva putrāṇām etat abhavat kiṃrūpāḥ asya ārya subhūteḥ dhārmaśravaṇikāḥ eṣṭavyāḥ
translated: Then again, those gods thought, “What kind of Dharma listeners should we consider the noble Subhūti to have?”

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān subhūtirbuddhānubhāvena teṣāṃ devaputrāṇāṃ cetasaiva cetaḥparivitarkamājñāya tān devaputrānāmantrayate smamāyānirmitasadṛśā hi devaputrā mama dhārmaśravaṇikā eṣṭavyāḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ buddha anubhāvena teṣām deva putrāṇām cetasā eva cetaḥ parivitarkam ājñāya tān deva putrān āmantrayate sma māyā nirmita sadṛśāḥ hi deva putrāḥ mama dhārmaśravaṇikāḥ eṣṭavyāḥ
translated: Then, by the Buddha’s power, the venerable Subhūti, knowing the thoughts that were occurring in the minds of those gods, said to those gods, “Gods, you should consider my Dharma listeners to be like magical creations.”

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi te naiva śroṣyanti na ca sākṣātkariṣyanti //🔽atha khalu te devaputrā āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocankiṃ punarārya subhūte māyopamāste sattvā na te māyā /
analyzed: tathā hi te na eva śroṣyanti na ca sākṣātkariṣyanti  atha khalu te deva putrāḥ āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocan kim punar ārya subhūte māyā upamāḥ te sattvāḥ na te māyā
translated: Because they will neither hear nor actualize it.”🔽Then those gods said to the venerable Subhūti, “But, noble Subhūti, are those beings like an illusion or is an illusion not those beings?”

original: evamukte āyuṣmān subhūtistān devaputrānetadavocatmāyopamāste devaputrāḥ sattvāḥ /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ tān deva putrān etat avocat māyā upamāḥ te deva putrāḥ sattvāḥ
translated: When that was said, the venerable Subhūti said to those gods, “Gods, those beings are like an illusion.

original: svapnopamāste devaputrāḥ sattvāḥ /🔽iti hi māyā ca sattvāśca advayametadadvaidhīkāram /
analyzed: svapna upamāḥ te deva putrāḥ sattvāḥ  iti hi māyā ca sattvāḥ ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram
translated: Gods, those beings are like a dream.”🔽Thus, an illusion and beings are non-dual, they are not divided into two.

analyzed: iti hi svapnaḥ ca sattvāḥ ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram
translated: Thus, a dream and beings are non-dual, they are not divided into two.

analyzed: sarva dharmāḥ api deva putrāḥ māyā upamāḥ svapna upamāḥ
translated: All dharmas, O sons of gods, are like an illusion, like a dream.

analyzed: srotaāpannaḥ api māyā upamaḥ svapna upamaḥ
translated: Even one who has entered the stream is like an illusion, like a dream.

analyzed: srotaāpatti phalam api māyā upamam svapna upamam
translated: Even the fruit of entering the stream is like an illusion, like a dream.

analyzed: evam sakṛdāgāmī api sakṛdāgāmi phalam api
translated: Thus, even one who returns once and the fruit of returning once,

analyzed: anāgāmi api anāgāmi phalam api
translated: even one who does not return and the fruit of not returning,

original: arhannapi arhattvamapi māyopamaṃ svapnopamam /🔽pratyekabuddho'pi māyopamaḥ svapnopamaḥ /
analyzed: arhan api arhat tvam api māyā upamam svapna upamam  pratyekabuddhaḥ upi māyā upamaḥ svapna upamaḥ
translated: even an arhat and arhatship are like an illusion, like a dream.🔽Even a pratyekabuddha is like an illusion, like a dream.

analyzed: pratyekabuddha tvam api māyā upamam svapna upamam  samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ upi māyā upamaḥ svapna upamaḥ
translated: Even pratyekabuddhahood is like an illusion, like a dream.🔽Even a perfectly enlightened one is like an illusion, like a dream.

analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddha tvam api māyā upamam svapna upamam
translated: Even perfect enlightenment is like an illusion, like a dream.

original: atha khalu devaputrā āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocansamyaksaṃbuddho'pyārya subhūte māyopamaḥ svapnopama iti vadasi /
analyzed: atha khalu deva putrāḥ āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ upi ārya subhūte māyā upamaḥ svapna upamaḥ iti vadasi
translated: Then the sons of gods said this to the Venerable Subhuti: Noble Subhuti, you say that even a perfectly enlightened one is like an illusion, like a dream.

analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddha tu api māyā upamam svapna upamam iti vadasi
translated: You say that even perfect enlightenment is like an illusion, like a dream.

analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha nirvāṇam api deva putrāḥ māyā upamam svapna upamam iti vadāmi
translated: Subhuti said: Sons of gods, I say that even nirvana is like an illusion, like a dream.

analyzed: kim punar anyam dharmam
translated: What then is another dharma?

original: te devaputrā āhuḥnirvāṇamapyārya subhūte māyopamaṃ svapnopamamiti vadasi /
analyzed: te deva putrāḥ āhuḥ nirvāṇam api ārya subhūte māyā upamam svapna upamam iti vadasi
translated: Those gods said, Noble Subhuti, you say that nirvana is also like an illusion, like a dream.

original: āyuṣmān subhūtirāhatadyadi devaputrā nirvāṇādapyanyaḥ kaściddharmo viśiṣṭataraḥ syāt /
analyzed: āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ āha tat yadi deva putrāḥ nirvāṇāt api anyaḥ kaścid dharmaḥ viśiṣṭataraḥ syāt
translated: The Venerable Subhuti said, Gods, if there were any dharma whatsoever superior to nirvana,

analyzed: tam api aham māyā upamam svapna upamam iti vadeyam
translated: I would say that too is like an illusion, like a dream.

original: iti hi devaputrā māyā ca nirvāṇaṃ ca advayametadadvaidhīkāram /
analyzed: iti hi devaputrāḥ māyā ca nirvāṇam ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram
translated: Thus, gods, illusion and nirvana are non-dual, they are not divided into two.

original: iti hi svapnaśca nirvāṇaṃ ca advayametadadvaidhīkāram //
analyzed: iti hi svapnaḥ ca nirvāṇam ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram
translated: Thus, dream and nirvana are non-dual, they are not divided into two.

analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ
translated: Then the Venerable Shariputra,

analyzed: āyuṣmān ca pūrṇaḥ maitrāyaṇīputraḥ
translated: the Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra,

analyzed: āyuṣmān ca mahākoṣṭhilaḥ  āyuṣmān ca mahākātyāyanaḥ
translated: the Venerable Mahākoṣṭhila,🔽the Venerable Mahākātyāyana,

analyzed: āyuṣmān ca mahākāśapaḥ
translated: the Venerable Mahākāśyapa,

original: anye ca mahāśrāvakā anekairbodhisattvasahasraiḥ sārdhamāyuṣmantaṃ subhūtiṃ sthaviramāmantrayante smake'syā āyuṣman subhūte prajñāpāramitāyā evaṃ nirdiśyamānāyāḥ pratyeṣakā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: anye ca mahāśrāvakāḥ anekaiḥ bodhisattva sahasraiḥ sārdham āyuṣmantam subhūtim sthaviram āmantrayante smaka isyāḥ āyuṣman subhūte prajñāpāramitāyāḥ evam nirdiśyamānāyāḥ pratyeṣakāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: and other great hearers, together with many thousands of bodhisattvas, addressed the elder Subhuti, saying, Venerable Subhuti, who will be the followers of this perfection of wisdom as it is being taught?

original: atha khalvāyuṣmānānandastān sthavirānetadavocatte khalvāyuṣmanto veditavyā avinivartanīyā bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān ānandaḥ tān sthavirān etat avocat te khalu āyuṣmantaḥ veditavyāḥ a vinivartanīyāḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda said this to those elders: Venerable ones, you should know that those irreversible bodhisattva mahāsattvas,

analyzed: dṛṣṭi saṃpannāḥ vā pudgalāḥ
translated: those individuals endowed with vision,

analyzed: arhantaḥ vā kṣīṇa āsravāḥ
translated: or those arhats whose defilements have ceased,

original: ye'syāḥ prajñāpāramitāyā evaṃ nirdiśyamānāyāḥ pratyeṣakā bhaviṣyanti //
analyzed: yesyāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ evam nirdiśyamānāyāḥ pratyeṣakāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: will be the ones who will understand this perfection of wisdom when it is taught in this way.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān subhūtiḥ sthavirastān sthavirānetadavocatnāsyā āyuṣmantaḥ prajñāpāramitāyā evaṃ nirdiśyamānāyāḥ kecitpratyeṣakā bhaviṣyanti
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ sthaviraḥ tān sthavirān etat avocat na asyāḥ āyuṣmantaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ evam nirdiśyamānāyāḥ kecid pratyeṣakāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Then the elder venerable Subhūti said this to those elders: Venerable ones, there will be no one who will understand this perfection of wisdom when it is taught in this way.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hiatra na kaściddharmaḥ sūcyate /🔽na kaściddharmaḥ paridīpyate /
analyzed: tathā hi atra na kaścid dharmaḥ sūcyate  na kaścid dharmaḥ paridīpyate
translated: Because in this [perfection of wisdom], no dharma is indicated at all,🔽no dharma is illuminated at all,

original: na kaściddharmaḥ prajñapyate /🔽tadyathaivātra na kaściddharmaḥ sūcyate /
analyzed: na kaścid dharmaḥ prajñapyate  tat yathā eva atra na kaścid dharmaḥ sūcyate
translated: no dharma is made known at all.🔽Just as in this [perfection of wisdom], no dharma is indicated at all,

analyzed: na kaścid dharmaḥ paridīpyate
translated: no dharma is illuminated at all,

analyzed: na kaścid dharmaḥ prajñapyate
translated: no dharma is made known at all,

original: tathaivāsyāḥ prajñāpāramitāyā evaṃ nirdiśyamānāyā na kaścitpratyeṣako bhaviṣyati //
analyzed: tathā eva asyāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ evam nirdiśyamānāyāḥ na kaścid pratyeṣakaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: in just the same way, there will be no one who will understand this perfection of wisdom when it is taught in this way.

original: atha khalu śakrasya devānāmindrasyaitadabhūt asya dharmaparyāyasya āryeṇa subhūnitā bhāṣyamāṇasya pūjārthaṃ yannvahaṃ puṣpāṇyabhinirmāya āryaṃ subhūtimabhyavakireyamiti /
analyzed: atha khalu śakrasya devānām indrasya etat abhūt asya dharmaparyāyasya āryeṇa subhūnitā bhāṣyamāṇasya pūjā artham yat nu aham puṣpāṇi abhinirmāya āryam subhūtim abhyavakireyam iti
translated: Then this occurred to Śakra, Lord of the Gods: “In order to worship this Dharma discourse being spoken by the noble Subhūti, let me create flowers and scatter them over the noble Subhūti.”

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmindrastasyāṃ velāyāṃ puṣpāṇyabhinirmāya āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimabhyavākirat /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ tasyām velāyām puṣpāṇi abhinirmāya āyuṣmantam subhūtim abhyavākirat
translated: Then at that time Śakra, Lord of the Gods, having created flowers, scattered them over the venerable Subhūti.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmataḥ subhūteḥ sthavirasya śakraṃ devānāmindramanuvyāharaṇāyaitadabhūtna khalu punarimāni puṣpāṇi mayā trāyastriṃśeṣu deveṣu pracaranti dṛṣṭapūrvāṇi /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmataḥ subhūteḥ sthavirasya śakram devānām indram anuvyāharaṇāya etat abhūt na khalu punar imāni puṣpāṇi mayā trāyastriṃśeṣu deveṣu pracaranti dṛṣṭa pūrvāṇi
translated: Then this occurred to the elder venerable Subhūti in order to instruct Śakra, Lord of the Gods: “These flowers have not been seen by me circulating among the gods of the Thirty-Three.

analyzed: yāni imāni śakreṇa devānām indreṇa abhyavakīrṇāni
translated: These have been scattered by Śakra, Lord of the Gods.

analyzed: nirmitāni etāni puṣpāṇi
translated: These flowers are created.

analyzed: na etāni puṣpāṇi vṛkṣa gulma latā nirjātāni
translated: These flowers have not arisen from trees, shrubs, or creepers.

analyzed: yāni śakreṇa devānām indreṇa abhyavakīrṇāni
translated: These have been scattered by Śakra, Lord of the Gods.

analyzed: manaḥ mayāni etāni puṣpāṇi iti
translated: These flowers are mind-made.”

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmindra āyuṣmataḥ subhūteścetasaiva cetaḥparivitarkamājñāya āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocatanirjātānyetānyārya subhūte puṣpāṇi /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ āyuṣmataḥ subhūteḥ cetasā eva cetaḥ parivitarkam ājñāya āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocata nirjātāni etāni ārya subhūte puṣpāṇi
translated: Then indeed Śakra, Lord of the Gods, having understood the thought of the Venerable Subhūti, said this to the Venerable Subhūti: Noble Subhūti, these flowers are not born.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: na hi manaḥ nirjātāni kānicid puṣpāṇi
translated: There are no flowers born from the mind.

analyzed: na api vṛkṣa gulma latā nirjātāni
translated: Nor are they born from trees, shrubs, or creepers.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān subhūtiḥ śakraṃ devānāmindrametadavocatyattvaṃ kauśika evaṃ vadasianirjātānyetāni puṣpāṇi /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ śakram devānām indram etat avocat yat tvam kauśika evam vadasi a nirjātāni etāni puṣpāṇi
translated: Then the Venerable Subhūti said this to Śakra, Lord of the Gods: Kauśika, you say thus: 'These flowers are not born.

analyzed: na etāni manaḥ nirjātāni
translated: They are not born from the mind.

analyzed: na api vṛkṣa gulma latā nirjātāni iti
translated: Nor are they born from trees, shrubs, or creepers.'

analyzed: yat kauśika a nirjātam na tat puṣpam
translated: Kauśika, what is not born is not a flower.

original: atha khalu śakrasya devānāmindrasyaitadabhūtgambhīraprajño batāyamāryaḥ subhūtiḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu śakrasya devānām indrasya etat abhūt gambhīra prajñaḥ bata ayam āryaḥ subhūtiḥ
translated: Then indeed this occurred to Śakra, Lord of the Gods: 'The noble Subhūti is indeed profound in wisdom.

analyzed: tām ca nāma pada prajñaptim nirdiśati
translated: And he indicates that designation by words.

analyzed: tām ca na virodhayati  tām ca uttānīkaroti
translated: And he does not contradict it.🔽And he makes it clear.

analyzed: tām eva ca upadiśati
translated: And he teaches it.

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmindra āyuṣmataṃ subhūtimetadavocatevametadārya subhūte / evametat /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ āyuṣmatam subhūtim etat avocat evam etat ārya subhūte evam etat
translated: Then indeed Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Venerable Subhūti: It is so, Noble Subhūti, it is so.

original: evaṃ cātra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena śikṣitavyaṃ yathā āryasubhūtirupadiśati /
analyzed: evam ca atra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena śikṣitavyam yathā ārya subhūtiḥ upadiśati
translated: And in this way the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva should train, as the Noble Subhūti teaches.

original: evamukte āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ śakraṃ devānāmindrametadavocatevametatkauśika / evametat /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ śakram devānām indram etat avocat evam etat kauśika evam etat
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Subhūti said this to Śakra, Lord of the Gods: It is so, Kauśika, it is so.

analyzed: evam atra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena śikṣitavyam
translated: The Bodhisattva Mahāsattva should train in this way in this.

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇaḥ kauśika bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na srotaāpattiphale śikṣate /🔽na sakṛdāgāmiphale /🔽na anāgāmiphale /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇaḥ kauśika bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na srotaāpatti phale śikṣate  na sakṛdāgāmi phale  na anāgāmi phale
translated: Kauśika, the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva who trains in this way does not train in the fruit of entering the stream,🔽does not train in the fruit of the once-returner,🔽does not train in the fruit of the non-returner,

analyzed: na ahar ṛtve śikṣate
translated: does not train in the fruit of arhatship,

analyzed: na pratyekabuddha tve śikṣate
translated: does not train in the state of a pratyekabuddha,

analyzed: na buddhatve śikṣate
translated: does not train in Buddhahood.

analyzed: yaḥ nā āsu bhūmiṣu śikṣate
translated: One who does not train in these stages

analyzed: sa buddhatve sarvajña tve vā śikṣate
translated: trains in Buddhahood or omniscience.

analyzed: yaḥ buddha tve sarvajña tve vā śikṣate
translated: One who trains in Buddhahood or omniscience

analyzed: sa uprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu buddha dharmeṣu śikṣate
translated: trains in immeasurable, incalculable Buddha qualities.

analyzed: yā uprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu buddha dharmeṣu śikṣate
translated: One who trains in immeasurable, incalculable Buddha qualities

analyzed: sa na rūpasya vivṛddhaye śikṣate
translated: He does not train in order to increase form.

analyzed: na parihāṇāya
translated: He does not train in order to diminish it.🔽Similarly, he does not train in order to increase feeling, perception, volitional formations, or consciousness.

original: evaṃ sa na vedanāyā na saṃjñāyā na saṃskārāṇām /🔽sa na vijñānasya vivṛddhaye śikṣate /
analyzed: evam sa na vedanāyāḥ na saṃjñāyāḥ na saṃskārāṇām  sa na vijñānasya vivṛddhaye śikṣate
translated: He does not train in order to increase form.

analyzed: na parihāṇāya
translated: He does not train in order to diminish it.🔽He who does not train in order to increase form,🔽in order to diminish it,🔽in order to grasp or abandon it,

original: yo na rūpasya vivṛddhaye śikṣate na parihāṇāya /
analyzed: yaḥ na rūpasya vivṛddhaye śikṣate na parihāṇāya
translated: in order to make it cease or not cease,

original: evaṃ na vedanāyā na saṃjñāyā na saṃskārāṇām /🔽yo na vijñānasya vivṛddhaye śikṣate na parihāṇāya /
analyzed: evam na vedanāyāḥ na saṃjñāyāḥ na saṃskārāṇām  yaḥ na vijñānasya vivṛddhaye śikṣate na parihāṇāya
translated: in order to produce it or not produce it,🔽in order to extinguish it or not extinguish it,🔽in order to manifest it or not manifest it,🔽in order to destroy it or not destroy it,🔽in order to make it grow or not grow,

original: sa na rūpasya parigrahāya śikṣate notsargāya /
analyzed: sa na rūpasya parigrahāya śikṣate na utsargāya
translated: in order to abandon it or not abandon it,🔽in order to make it come or go,🔽in order to make it arise or not arise,🔽in order to make it cease or not cease,

original: evaṃ sa na vedanāyā na saṃjñāyā na saṃskārāṇām /
analyzed: evam sa na vedanāyāḥ na saṃjñāyāḥ na saṃskārāṇām
translated: in order to make it diminish or not diminish,🔽in order to make it increase or not increase,🔽in order to make it arise or not arise,🔽in order to make it cease or not cease,

analyzed: sa na vijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate
translated: in order to make it diminish or not diminish,🔽in order to make it increase or not increase,🔽in order to make it arise or not arise,

analyzed: na utsargāya  na api kasyacid dharmasya parigrahāya śikṣate
translated: in order to make it cease or not cease,🔽in order to make it diminish or not diminish,🔽in order to make it increase or not increase,🔽in order to make it arise or not arise,🔽in order to make it cease or not cease,🔽in order to make it diminish or not diminish,

original: notpādāya nāntardhānāya śikṣate /🔽yo na kasyaciddharmasya parigrahāya śikṣate /
analyzed: na utpādāya na antardhānāya śikṣate  yaḥ na kasyacid dharmasya parigrahāya śikṣate
translated: in order to make it increase or not increase,🔽in order to make it arise or not arise,🔽in order to make it cease or not cease,🔽in order to make it diminish or not diminish,

original: notpādāya nāntardhānāya śikṣate /🔽sa na sarvajñatāyā api parigrahāya śikṣate /
analyzed: na utpādāya na antardhānāya śikṣate  sa na sarvajña tāyāḥ api parigrahāya śikṣate
translated: in order to make it increase or not increase,🔽in order to make it arise or not arise,🔽in order to make it cease or not cease,🔽in order to make it diminish or not diminish,🔽in order to make it increase or not increase,🔽in order to make it arise or not arise,🔽in order to make it cease or not cease,🔽in order to make it diminish or not diminish,

analyzed: na utpādāya na antardhānāya śikṣate
translated: in order to make it increase or not increase,🔽in order to make it arise or not arise,🔽in order to make it cease or not cease,🔽in

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇo bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvajñatāyāṃ śikṣate /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarvajña tāyām śikṣate
translated: Thus, Subhuti, a Bodhisattva who trains in this way trains in the knowledge of all modes.

analyzed: sarvajña tāyām niryāsyati
translated: He will enter on the certainty of a Bodhisattva.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān śāriputra āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocatya āyuṣman subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na kasyaciddharmasya parigrahāya śikṣate /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat yaḥ āyuṣman subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na kasyacid dharmasya parigrahāya śikṣate
translated: Then the Ven. Sariputra said to the Ven. Subhuti: The Bodhisattva, the great being, O Ven. Subhuti, trains not for the taking up of anything,

original: notpādāya nāntardhānāsya śikṣate /🔽sa na sarvajñatāyā api parigrahāya śikṣate /
analyzed: na utpādāya na antardhānā asya śikṣate  sa na sarvajña tāyāḥ api parigrahāya śikṣate
translated: not for the non-taking up of anything.🔽He trains not for the taking up of the knowledge of all modes,

analyzed: na utpādāya na antardhānāya śikṣate
translated: not for the non-taking up of the knowledge of all modes.

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇa āyuṣmān subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvajñatāyāṃ śikṣate /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇaḥ āyuṣmān subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarvajña tāyām śikṣate
translated: Thus, O Ven. Subhuti, a Bodhisattva who trains in this way trains in the knowledge of all modes.

analyzed: sarvajña tāyām niryāsyati
translated: He will enter on the certainty of a Bodhisattva.

analyzed: āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ āha evam etat āyuṣman śāriputra evam etat
translated: The Ven. Subhuti replied: So it is, O Ven. Sariputra, so it is.

original: ya āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na kasyaciddharmasya parigrahāya śikṣate /🔽notpādāya nāntardhānāya śikṣate /🔽sa na sarvajñatāyā api parigrahāya śikṣate /
analyzed: yaḥ āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na kasyacid dharmasya parigrahāya śikṣate  na utpādāya na antardhānāya śikṣate  sa na sarvajña tāyāḥ api parigrahāya śikṣate
translated: The Bodhisattva, the great being, O Ven. Sariputra, trains not for the taking up of anything,🔽not for the non-taking up of anything.🔽He trains not for the taking up of the knowledge of all modes,

analyzed: na utpādāya na antardhānāya śikṣate
translated: not for the non-taking up of the knowledge of all modes.

analyzed: sarva buddha dharmāṇām api na parigrahāya śikṣate
translated: He does not train for the sake of acquiring all the qualities of the Buddhas.

analyzed: na utpādāya na antardhānāya śikṣate
translated: He does not train for the sake of production or disappearance.

original: evaṃ cāyuṣman śāriputra śikṣamāṇo bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvajñatāyāṃ śikṣate /
analyzed: evam ca āyuṣman śāriputra śikṣamāṇaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarvajña tāyām śikṣate
translated: Thus, Venerable Śāriputra, when a Bodhisattva-Mahāsattva trains like this, he trains in omniscience.

analyzed: sarvajña tāyām niryāsyati
translated: He will emerge in omniscience.

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmindra āyuṣmantaṃ śāriputrametadavocatprajñāpāramitā ārya śāriputra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena kuto gaveṣitavyāḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat prajñāpāramitāḥ ārya śāriputra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena kutas gaveṣitavyāḥ
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Venerable Śāriputra: Venerable Śāriputra, where should a Bodhisattva-Mahāsattva seek the perfection of wisdom?

original: śāriputra āhaprajñāpāramitā kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena āyuṣmataḥ subhūteḥ parivartādgaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha prajñāpāramitā kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena āyuṣmataḥ subhūteḥ parivartāt gaveṣitavyā
translated: Śāriputra said, Kauśika, a Bodhisattva-Mahāsattva should seek the perfection of wisdom in the discourse of the Venerable Subhūti.

original: evamukte śakro devānāmindra āyuṣmantaṃ śāriputrametadavocatkasyaiṣa ārya śāriputra anubhāvo veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: evam ukte śakraḥ devānām indraḥ āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat kasya eṣa ārya śāriputra anubhāvaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: When this was said, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the Venerable Śāriputra: Venerable Śāriputra, whose power should this be known as?

analyzed: kasya etat adhiṣṭhānam veditavyam yadā ārya subhūtiḥ prajñāpāramitām bhāṣate
translated: Whose blessing should this be known as, that the noble Subhūti teaches the perfection of wisdom?

original: āyuṣmān śāriputra āhatathāgatasyaiṣa kauśika anubhāvo veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ āha tathāgatasya eṣa kauśika anubhāvaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: The Venerable Śāriputra said, Kauśika, this should be known as the power of the Tathāgata.

original: tathāgatasyaitadadhiṣṭhānaṃ veditavyaṃ yadāyuṣmān subhūtiḥ prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāṣate /
analyzed: tathāgatasya etat adhiṣṭhānam veditavyam yat āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ prajñāpāramitām bhāṣate
translated: It should be known that this is the empowerment of the Tathāgata that the Venerable Subhūti teaches the perfection of wisdom.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān subhūtiḥ śakraṃ devānāmindrametadavocatyatkauśika evaṃ vadasikasyaiṣo'nubhāvo veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ śakram devānām indram etat avocat yat kauśikaḥ evam vadasikasya eṣaḥ anubhāvaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: Then the Venerable Subhūti said to Śakra, Lord of the Gods, Kauśika, you say this is the power of someone.

original: kasyaitadanuṣṭhānaṃ veditavyaṃ yadāryasubhūtiḥ prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāṣate iti /
analyzed: kasya etat anuṣṭhānam veditavyam yadā ārya subhūtiḥ prajñāpāramitām bhāṣate iti
translated: It should be known that this is the practice of someone, that the noble Subhūti teaches the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: tathāgatasya eṣa kauśika anubhāvaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: Kauśika, this should be known as the power of the Tathāgata.

analyzed: tathāgatasya etat adhiṣṭhānam veditavyam yat aham prajñāpāramitām bhāṣe
translated: It should be known that this is the empowerment of the Tathāgata that I teach the perfection of wisdom.

original: yadapi kauśika evaṃ vadasiprajñāpāramitā bodhisattvena mahāsattvena kuto gaveṣitavyeti /
analyzed: yat api kauśika evam vadasi prajñāpāramitā bodhisattvena mahāsattvena kutas gaveṣitavyā iti
translated: Kauśika, you also say, 'Where should the perfection of wisdom be sought by a bodhisattva mahāsattva?'

original: prajñāpāramitā kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na rūpādgaveṣitavyā nāpyanyatra rūpādgaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na rūpāt gaveṣitavyā na api anyatra rūpāt gaveṣitavyā
translated: Kauśika, the perfection of wisdom should not be sought in form by a bodhisattva mahāsattva, nor should it be sought apart from form.

original: evaṃ na vedanāyā na saṃjñāyā na saṃskārebhyaḥ na vijñānādgaveṣitavyāḥ /
analyzed: evam na vedanāyāḥ na saṃjñāyāḥ na saṃskārebhyaḥ na vijñānāt gaveṣitavyāḥ
translated: Thus, it should not be sought in feeling, perception, volitional formations, or consciousness.

analyzed: na api anyatra vijñānāt gaveṣitavyā
translated: Nor should it be sought apart from consciousness.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

analyzed: tathā hi na rūpam prajñāpāramitā
translated: For example, form is not the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: na api anyatra rūpāt prajñāpāramitā
translated: Nor is the perfection of wisdom other than form.

original: evaṃ na vedanā na saṃjñā na saṃskārāḥ /
analyzed: evam na vedanā na saṃjñā na saṃskārāḥ
translated: Thus, feeling is not, perception is not, volitional formations are not,

analyzed: na vijñānam prajñāpāramitā
translated: consciousness is not the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: na api anyatra vijñānāt prajñāpāramitā
translated: Nor is the perfection of wisdom other than consciousness.

original: evamukte śakro devānāmindra āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocatmahāpāramiteyamārya subhūte yaduta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: evam ukte śakraḥ devānām indraḥ āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat mahā pāramitā iyam ārya subhūte yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: When this was said, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the Venerable Subhūti: This perfection of wisdom, noble Subhūti, is a great perfection.

original: apramāṇapāramiteyamārya subhūte yaduta prajñāpāramitā /🔽aparimāṇapāramiteyamārya subhūte yaduta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: a pramāṇa pāramitā iyam ārya subhūte yat uta prajñāpāramitā  aparimāṇa pāramitā iyam ārya subhūte yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: This perfection of wisdom, noble Subhūti, is an immeasurable perfection.🔽This perfection of wisdom, noble Subhūti, is an infinite perfection.

analyzed: ananta pāramitā iyam ārya subhūte yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: This perfection of wisdom, noble Subhūti, is an endless perfection.

analyzed: sthaviraḥ subhūtiḥ āha evam etat kauśika evam etat
translated: The elder Subhūti said, So it is, Kauśika, so it is.

original: mahāpāramiteyaṃ kauśika yaduta prajñāpāramitā /🔽apramāṇapāramiteyaṃ kauśika yaduta prajñāpāramitā /🔽aparimāṇapāramiteyaṃ kauśika yaduta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: mahā pāramitā iyam kauśika yat uta prajñāpāramitā  a pramāṇa pāramitā iyam kauśika yat uta prajñāpāramitā  aparimāṇa pāramitā iyam kauśika yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: This perfection of wisdom, Kauśika, is a great perfection.🔽This perfection of wisdom, Kauśika, is an immeasurable perfection.🔽This perfection of wisdom, Kauśika, is an infinite perfection.

analyzed: ananta pāramitā iyam kauśika yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: This perfection of wisdom, Kauśika, is an endless perfection.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: rūpamahattayā hi kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ yaduta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: rūpa mahā tayā hi kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom is a great perfection because of the greatness of form.

analyzed: evam vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ
translated: Likewise, because of the greatness of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness.

analyzed: vijñāna mahat tayā hi kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom is a great perfection because of the greatness of consciousness.

analyzed: rūpa apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom, namely the perfection of wisdom, is an immeasurable perfection because of the immeasurability of form.

analyzed: evam vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ
translated: Likewise, because of the immeasurability of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness.

analyzed: vijñāna apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam yat uta prajñapāramitā
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom, namely the perfection of wisdom, is an immeasurable perfection because of the immeasurability of consciousness.

analyzed: rūpa aparimāṇa tayā kauśika aparimāṇa pāramitā iyam yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom, namely the perfection of wisdom, is an infinite perfection because of the infinitude of form.

analyzed: evam vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ
translated: Likewise, because of the infinitude of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness.

analyzed: vijñāna aparimāṇa tayā kauśika aparimāṇa pāramitā iyam yat uta prajñapāramitā
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom, namely the perfection of wisdom, is an infinite perfection because of the infinitude of consciousness.

analyzed: rūpa ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom, namely the perfection of wisdom, is an endless perfection because of the endlessness of form.

analyzed: evam vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ
translated: Likewise, because of the endlessness of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness.

analyzed: vijñāna ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom, namely the perfection of wisdom, is an endless perfection because of the endlessness of consciousness.

analyzed: evam mahā pāramitā iti kauśika na abhiniviśate  evam apramāṇa pāramitā iti
translated: Thus, Kauśika, he does not settle down on the great perfection.🔽Thus, on the perfection of the immeasurable.

analyzed: evam aparimāṇa pāramitā iti
translated: Thus, on the perfection of the uncountable.

analyzed: evam ananta pāramitā iti na abhiniviśate
translated: Thus, on the perfection of the infinite, he does not settle down.

analyzed: tasmāt kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam  a pramāṇa pāramitā iyam
translated: Therefore, Kauśika, this is the great perfection.🔽This is the perfection of the immeasurable.

analyzed: aparimāṇa pāramitā iyam
translated: This is the perfection of the uncountable.

analyzed: ananta pāramitā iyam yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: This is the perfection of the infinite, namely the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: ārambaṇa ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom is an infinite perfection because of the infinity of objects.

analyzed: sattva ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom is an infinite perfection because of the infinity of beings.

original: kathaṃ punaḥ kauśika ārambaṇānantatayā anantapāramiteyaṃ yaduta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: katham punar kauśika ārambaṇa ananta tayā ananta pāramitā iyam yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: Kauśika, how is this perfection of wisdom an infinite perfection because of the infinity of objects?

original: sarvadharmāṇāṃ hi kauśika yato nānto na madhyaṃ na paryavasānamupalabhyate /🔽tataḥ kauśika anantapāramiteyaṃ yaduta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: sarva dharmāṇām hi kauśika yatas na antaḥ na madhyam na paryavasānam upalabhyate  tatas kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: Kauśika, because no end, middle, or end is perceived of all dharmas.🔽Therefore, Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom is an infinite perfection.

original: anena kauśika paryāyeṇa ārambaṇānantatayā anantapāramiteyaṃ yaduta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: anena kauśika paryāyeṇa ārambaṇa ananta tayā ananta pāramitā iyam yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: Kauśika, by this method, this perfection of wisdom is an infinite perfection because of the infinity of objects.

analyzed: punar aparam kauśika yasmāt sarva dharmāḥ anantāḥ aparyantāḥ
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, because all dharmas are endless and boundless,

original: na teṣāmanto vā madhyaṃ vā paryavasānaṃ vā upalabhyate /
analyzed: na teṣām antaḥ vā madhyam vā paryavasānam vā upalabhyate
translated: their end, middle, or conclusion is not perceived.

analyzed: tasmāt kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: Therefore, Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom is an endless perfection.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: rūpasya hi kauśika nānto na madhyaṃ na paryavasānamupalabhyate /🔽evaṃ vedanāyāḥ saṃjñāyāḥ saṃskārāṇām /
analyzed: rūpasya hi kauśika na antaḥ na madhyam na paryavasānam upalabhyate  evam vedanāyāḥ saṃjñāyāḥ saṃskārāṇām
translated: Because the end, middle, or conclusion of form is not perceived,🔽and likewise the end, middle, or conclusion of feeling, perception, volitional formations,

original: vijñānasya hi kauśika nānto na madhyaṃ na paryavasānamupalabhyate /
analyzed: vijñānasya hi kauśika na antaḥ na madhyam na paryavasānam upalabhyate
translated: and consciousness is not perceived.

original: anenāpi kauśika paryāyeṇa ārambaṇānantatayā anantapāramiteyaṃ yaduta prajñāpāramitā //
analyzed: anena api kauśika paryāyeṇa ārambaṇa ananta tayā ananta pāramitā iyam yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: By this method also, Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom is an endless perfection because of the endlessness of objects.

analyzed: punar aparam kauśika
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, a being is endless and boundless.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: na hi sattvasyānto vā madhyaṃ vā paryavasānaṃ vopalabhyate /
analyzed: na hi sattvasya antaḥ vā madhyam vā paryavasānam vā upalabhyate
translated: Because the end, middle, or conclusion of a being is not perceived.

analyzed: tasmāt kauśika sattva ananta tayā ananta pāramitā iyam yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: Therefore, Kauśika, because of the endlessness of beings, this perfection of wisdom is an endless perfection.

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmindra āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocatkathamāyuṣman subhūte sattvānantatayā anantapāramiteyaṃ yaduta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat katham āyuṣman subhūte sattva ananta tayā ananta pāramitā iyam yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: Then indeed Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Venerable Subhūti: Venerable Subhūti, how is this perfection of wisdom, which is infinite due to the infinity of beings?

original: sthaviraḥ subhūtirāhana hi kauśika gaṇanāyogena vā gaṇanābahutvena vā sattvānantatayā anantapāramiteyaṃ yaduta prajñāpāramitā //
analyzed: sthaviraḥ subhūtiḥ āha na hi kauśika gaṇanā yogena vā gaṇanā bahu tvena vā sattva ananta tayā ananta pāramitā iyam yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: The Elder Subhūti replied: Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom is infinite due to the infinity of beings, not by counting or by the multitude of beings.

original: śakra āhakathaṃ tarhīdānīmārya subhūte sattvānantatayā anantapāramiteyaṃ yaduta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: śakraḥ āha katham tarhi idānīm ārya subhūte sattva ananta tayā ananta pāramitā iyam yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: Śakra said: Well then, Noble Subhūti, how is this perfection of wisdom infinite due to the infinity of beings?

original: sthaviraḥ subhūtirāhatatkaṃ manyase kauśika katamasyaitaddharmasyādhivacanaṃ yaduta sattvaḥ sattva iti /
analyzed: sthaviraḥ subhūtiḥ āha tat kam manyase kauśika katamasya etat dharmasya adhivacanam yat uta sattvaḥ sattvaḥ iti
translated: The Elder Subhūti said: What do you think, Kauśika, is this the designation of some dharma, namely 'being, being'?

original: śakra āhanaitadārya subhūte dharmasyādhivacanaṃ na adharmādhivacanaṃ yaduta sattvaḥ sattva iti /
analyzed: śakraḥ āha na etat ārya subhūte dharmasya adhivacanam na adharma adhivacanam yat uta sattvaḥ sattvaḥ iti
translated: Śakra said: Noble Subhūti, this is not the designation of a dharma, nor the designation of a non-dharma, namely 'being, being'.

analyzed: āgantukam etat nāmadheyam prakṣiptam  avastukam etat nāmadheyam prakṣiptam
translated: This name is superimposed as an adventitious thing.🔽This name is superimposed as a non-thing.

analyzed: anātmīyam etat nāmadheyam prakṣiptam
translated: This name is superimposed as not belonging to a self.

original: anārambaṇametannāmadheyaṃ prakṣiptaṃ yaduta sattvaḥ sattva iti /
analyzed: anārambaṇam etat nāmadheyam prakṣiptam yat uta sattvaḥ sattvaḥ iti
translated: This name 'sentient being' is a mere designation, and has been put forth without any basis.

original: sthaviraḥ subhūtirāhatatkiṃ manyase kauśika kācidatra sattvaparidīpanā kṛtā /
analyzed: sthaviraḥ subhūtiḥ āha tat kim manyase kauśika kācid atra sattva paridīpanā kṛtā
translated: The elder Subhuti said, What do you think, Kausika, has any description of a sentient being been made here?

analyzed: śakraḥ āha no hi idam ārya subhūte
translated: Shakra said, No indeed, O noble Subhuti.

analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha yatra kauśika na kācid sattva paridīpanā kṛtā
translated: Subhuti said, Where, Kausika, no description of a sentient being has been made,

analyzed: tatra kā sattva ananta tā
translated: what is the infinitude of sentient beings there?

original: sacetkauśika tathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho'nantavijñaptighoṣeṇa gambhīranirghoṣeṇa svareṇa gaṅgānadīvālukopamān kalpānapi vitiṣṭhamānaḥ sattvaḥ sattva iti vācaṃ bhāṣeta /
analyzed: saced kauśika tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ ananta vijñapti ghoṣeṇa gambhīra nirghoṣeṇa svareṇa gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamān kalpān api vitiṣṭhamānaḥ sattvaḥ sattvaḥ iti vācam bhāṣeta
translated: If, Kausika, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the fully Enlightened One, for aeons as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, were to speak with a voice as deep as the voice of Brahma, saying 'sentient being, sentient being',

translated: Because a sentient being is pure from the very beginning, and has been pure from the very beginning.
