translated: When I, O gods, in the middle of the Antarabhadra road in the capital city of Dipta, was not separated from this perfection of wisdom, then I was predicted by the Tathagata Dipankara, the Arhat, the Fully Enlightened One, to supreme and perfect enlightenment: 'You will become, O young man, in the future, after innumerable eons, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Fully Enlightened One, the One of Perfect Wisdom and Conduct, the Well-Gone One, the Knower of the World, the Unexcelled Leader of Men to be Tamed, the Teacher of Gods and Men, the Buddha, the Blessed One, named Shakyamuni.'

original: atha khalu te devaputrā bhagavantametadavocanāścaryaṃ bhagavan /
analyzed: atha khalu te deva putrāḥ bhagavantam etat avocan āścaryam bhagavan
translated: Then those gods said to the Blessed One: 'It is wonderful, Blessed One!

analyzed: parama āścaryam sugata
translated: It is marvelous, Sugata!

original: yāvadiyaṃ prajñāpāramitā bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ sarvajñatāyā āhārikā anuparigrāhikā ceti //
analyzed: yāvat iyam prajñāpāramitā bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām sarvajña tāyāḥ āhārikā anuparigrāhikā ca iti
translated: As long as this perfection of wisdom is the provider and the supporter of the knowledge of all modes of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings.

analyzed: ārya aṣṭasāhasrikāyām prajñāpāramitāyām śakraparivartaḥ nāma dvitīyaḥ
translated: In the Noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines, the chapter called Shakra, the second.

analyzed: aprameya guṇa dhāraṇa pāramitā stu upasatkāra parivartaḥ tṛtīyaḥ
translated: The third chapter on the perfection of upholding immeasurable qualities and venerating stupas.

original: atha khalu bhagavān ye tatra devaputrāḥ parṣadi saṃnipatitāḥ saṃniṣaṇṇāścābhūvan /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān ye tatra deva putrāḥ parṣadi saṃnipatitāḥ saṃniṣaṇṇāḥ ca abhūvan
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing that the sons of gods who had assembled and were seated in that assembly,

analyzed: yāḥ ca bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikāḥ saṃnipatitāḥ saṃniṣaṇṇāḥ ca abhūvan
translated: and the monks, nuns, male and female lay followers who had assembled and were seated,

analyzed: tān deva putrān saṃnipatitān saṃniṣaṇṇān ca viditvā
translated: knowing that those sons of gods had assembled and were seated,

original: tāśca sarvāścatasraḥ parṣadaḥ saṃnipatitāḥ saṃniṣaṇṇāśca viditvā /
analyzed: tāḥ ca sarvāḥ catasraḥ parṣadaḥ saṃnipatitāḥ saṃniṣaṇṇāḥ ca viditvā
translated: and knowing that all four assemblies had assembled and were seated,

original: kāmāvacarān rūpāvacarāṃśca devaputrān brahmakāyikāṃśca devaputrān ābhāsvarāṃśca parīttaśubhāṃśca akaniṣṭhāṃśca devaputrān sākṣiṇaḥ sthāpayitvā /
analyzed: kāmāvacarān rūpāvacarān ca deva putrān brahmakāyikān ca deva putrān ābhāsvarān ca parītta śubhān ca akaniṣṭhān ca deva putrān sākṣiṇaḥ sthāpayitvā
translated: except for the sons of gods who were witnesses from the desire realm, the form realm, the Brahmakayika gods, the Abhasvara gods, the Parittashubha gods, and the Akanishtha gods,

original: śakradevendrapramukhān kāmāvacarān devaputrān mahābrahmapramukhāṃśca brahmakāyikān devaputrānābhāsvarāṃśca devaputrānāmantrayate smayo hi kaściddevaputrāḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati /
analyzed: śakra deva indra pramukhān kāmāvacarān deva putrān mahābrahma pramukhān ca brahmakāyikān deva putrān ābhāsvarān ca deva putrān āmantrayate sma yaḥ hi kaścid deva putrāḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati
translated: He addressed the gods of the desire realm headed by Shakra, the lord of the gods, and the gods of the Brahma realm headed by Mahabrahma, and the gods of the Abhasvara realm, saying: Indeed, O gods, if any son or daughter of good family will uphold, possess, recite, master, and practice this perfection of wisdom,

original: na tasya māro vā mārakāyikā vā devatā avatāraprekṣiṇyo'vatāragaveṣiṇyo'vatāraṃ lapsyante /
analyzed: na tasya māraḥ vā māra kāyikāḥ vā devatāḥ avatāra prekṣiṇyaḥ uvatāra gaveṣiṇyaḥ uvatāram lapsyante
translated: Mara or the gods of Mara's retinue who seek an opportunity and look for an opportunity will not find an opportunity in them.

original: nāpi tasya kulaputrasya vā kuladuhiturvā manuṣyā vā amanuṣyā vā avatāraprekṣiṇo'vatāragaveṣiṇo'vatāraṃ lapsyante /
analyzed: na api tasya kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā manuṣyāḥ vā amanuṣyāḥ vā avatāra prekṣiṇaḥ uvatāra gaveṣiṇaḥ uvatāram lapsyante
translated: And neither humans nor non-humans who seek an opportunity and look for an opportunity will find an opportunity in that son or daughter of good family.

original: nāpi sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā viṣamāparihāreṇa kālaṃ kariṣyati //
analyzed: na api sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā viṣama a parihāreṇa kālam kariṣyati
translated: And that son or daughter of good family will not die an untimely death due to an uneven avoidance.

original: punaraparaṃ devaputrāḥ ye devaputrā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau saṃprasthitāḥ /
analyzed: punar aparam deva putrāḥ ye deva putrāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau saṃprasthitāḥ
translated: Moreover, O gods, those gods who have set out for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

original: yaiśca devaputrairiyaṃ prajñāpāramitā nodgṛhītā na dhāritā na vācitā na paryavāptā na pravartitā /
analyzed: yaiḥ ca deva putraiḥ iyam prajñāpāramitā na udgṛhītā na dhāritā na vācitā na paryavāptā na pravartitā
translated: And those gods who have not taken up, borne in mind, recited aloud, mastered, or properly paid attention to this perfection of wisdom,

original: te devaputrāstaṃ kulaputra vā kuladuhitaraṃ vā upasaṃkramitavyaṃ maṃsyante /
analyzed: te deva putrāḥ tam kula putra vā kula duhitaram vā upasaṃkramitavyam maṃsyante
translated: those gods will want to approach that son of a good family or daughter of a good family.

original: tasya ca kulaputrasya vā kuladuhiturvā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgṛhṇato dhārayato vācayataḥ paryavāpnuvataḥ pravartayamānasyāntikācchroṣyanti /
analyzed: tasya ca kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā imām prajñāpāramitām udgṛhṇataḥ dhārayataḥ vācayataḥ paryavāpnuvataḥ pravartayamānasya antikāt śroṣyanti
translated: And those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family will hear this perfection of wisdom from the presence of that son of a good family or daughter of a good family who takes it up, bears it in mind, recites it aloud, masters it, and properly pays attention to it.

original: śrutvā codgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti /
analyzed: śrutvā ca udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti
translated: Having heard it, they will take it up, bear it in mind, recite it aloud, master it, and properly pay attention to it.

original: na ca khalu punardevaputrāstasya kulaputrasya vā kuladuhiturvā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgṛhṇato dhārayato vācayataḥ paryavāpnuvataḥ pravartayamānasya araṇyagatasya vā vṛkṣamūlagatasya vā śūnyāgāragatasya vā abhyavakāśagatasya vā pathi gatasya vā utpathagatasya vā aṭavīgatasya vā mahāsamudragatasya vā tatra tatropasaṃkrāmato vā caṃkramyamāṇasya vā sthitasya vā niṣaṇṇasya vā vipannasya vā bhayaṃ vā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: na ca khalu punar deva putrāḥ tasya kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā imām prajñāpāramitām udgṛhṇataḥ dhārayataḥ vācayataḥ paryavāpnuvataḥ pravartayamānasya araṇya gatasya vā vṛkṣa mūla gatasya vā śūnya āgāra gatasya vā abhyavakāśa gatasya vā pathi gatasya vā utpatha gatasya vā aṭavī gatasya vā mahā samudra gatasya vā tatra tatra upasaṃkrāmataḥ vā caṃkramyamāṇasya vā sthitasya vā niṣaṇṇasya vā vipannasya vā bhayam vā bhaviṣyati
translated: Moreover, sons of gods, for that son of a good family or that daughter of a good family who takes up, bears in mind, reads aloud, masters, and is intent on this perfection of wisdom, whether in the forest, at the foot of a tree, in an empty place, in the open air, on the road, off the road, in the wilderness, or on the great ocean, wherever they go, whether walking, standing, sitting, or lying down, there will be no fear.

analyzed: stambhita tvam vā bhaviṣyati
translated: There will be no paralysis.

analyzed: utpatsyate vā
translated: It will not arise.

original: atha khalu catvāro mahārājāno bhagavantametadavocanāścaryaṃ bhagavan yadimāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgṛhṇan dhārayan vācayan paryavāpnuvan pravartayan sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā yānatraye sattvān vinayati /
analyzed: atha khalu catvāraḥ mahā rājānaḥ bhagavantam etat avocan āścaryam bhagavan yat imām prajñāpāramitām udgṛhṇan dhārayan vācayan paryavāpnuvan pravartayan sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā yāna traye sattvān vinayati
translated: Then the four great kings said this to the Blessed One: It is amazing, Blessed One, that the son of a good family or the daughter of a good family who takes up, bears in mind, reads aloud, masters, and is intent on this perfection of wisdom, trains beings in the three vehicles,

analyzed: na ca sattva saṃjñām utpādayati
translated: but does not give rise to the notion of a being.

original: vayaṃ bhagavaṃstasya kulaputrasya vā kuladuhiturvā rakṣāvaraṇaguptiṃ saṃvidhāsyāmaḥ /
analyzed: vayam bhagavan tasya kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā rakṣā āvaraṇa guptim saṃvidhāsyāmaḥ
translated: “Bhagavān, we will give protection, guard, and safety to that noble man or noble woman.”

original: ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati //🔽atha khalu śakro devānāmindro bhagavantametadavocatahamapi bhagavaṃstasya kulaputrasya vā kuladuhiturvā rakṣāvaraṇaguptiṃ saṃvidhāsyāmi /🔽ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati //
analyzed: yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati  atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocata ham api bhagavan tasya kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā rakṣā āvaraṇa guptim saṃvidhāsyāmi  yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati
translated: We, Blessed One, will provide protection, guard, and defense for that son or daughter of good family who will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, study it, and practice it.🔽Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, I too will provide protection, guard, and defense for that son or daughter of good family who will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, study it, and practice it.

original: brahmāpi sahāpatiḥ sārdhaṃ brahmakāyikairdevaputrairbhagavantametadavocatahamapi bhagavaṃstasya kulaputrasya vā kuladuhiturvā rakṣāvaraṇaguptiṃ
analyzed: brahmā api sahā patiḥ sārdham brahmakāyikaiḥ deva putraiḥ bhagavantam etat avocata aham api bhagavan tasya kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā rakṣā āvaraṇa guptim
translated: Brahmā, Lord of the Sahā World, together with the gods of the Brahma group, said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, I too will provide protection, guard, and defense for that son or daughter of good family who will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, study it, and practice it.

original: ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati //
analyzed: yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati
translated: who will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, study it, and practice it.

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmindro bhagavantametadavocatāścaryaṃ bhagavan yadimāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgṛhṇan dhārayan vācayan paryavāpnuvan pravartayan sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imān yato dṛṣṭadhārmikān guṇān pratilabhate parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocata āścaryam bhagavan yat imām prajñāpāramitām udgṛhṇan dhārayan vācayan paryavāpnuvan pravartayan sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imān yatas dṛṣṭa dhārmikān guṇān pratilabhate parigṛhṇāti
translated: Then indeed Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Blessed One: It is wonderful, Blessed One, that the son or daughter of good family who takes up, bears in mind, recites, understands, and teaches this perfection of wisdom obtains and possesses these visible qualities.

original: kiṃ punarbhagavan prajñāpāramitāyāmudgṛhītāyāṃ sarvāḥ ṣaṭ pāramitā udgṛhītā bhavanti /
analyzed: kim punar bhagavan prajñāpāramitāyām udgṛhītāyām sarvāḥ ṣaḍ pāramitāḥ udgṛhītāḥ bhavanti
translated: But, Blessed One, when the perfection of wisdom is taken up, are all six perfections taken up?

analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān śakram devānām indram etat avocat evam etat kauśika evam etat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said this to Śakra, Lord of the Gods: So it is, Kauśika. So it is.

original: prajñāpāramitāyāṃ kauśika udgṛhītāyāṃ sarvāḥ ṣaṭ pāramitā udgṛhītā bhavanti /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām kauśika udgṛhītāyām sarvāḥ ṣaḍ pāramitāḥ udgṛhītāḥ bhavanti
translated: When the perfection of wisdom is taken up, Kauśika, all six perfections are taken up.

original: punaraparaṃ kauśika prajñāpāramitāyāmudgṛhītāyāṃ dhāritāyāṃ vācitāyāṃ paryavāptāyāṃ pravartitāyāṃ sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā dṛṣṭadhārmikān guṇān parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika prajñāpāramitāyām udgṛhītāyām dhāritāyām vācitāyām paryavāptāyām pravartitāyām sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā dṛṣṭa dhārmikān guṇān parigṛhṇāti
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, when the perfection of wisdom is taken up, borne in mind, recited, understood, and practiced, the son or daughter of good family obtains and possesses visible qualities.

analyzed: tān kauśik sarvān śṛṇu
translated: Listen to all of them, Kauśika!

original: sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasi kuru /
analyzed: sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasi kuru
translated: Listen well and remember!

analyzed: bhāṣiṣye iham te
translated: I will teach it to you.

original: sādhu bhagavanniti śakro devānāmindro bhagavataḥ pratyaśrauṣīt /
analyzed: sādhu bhagavan iti śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavataḥ pratyaśrauṣīt
translated: Very well, Blessed One, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, replied to the Blessed One.

original: bhagavānetadavocattatra kauśika ye mama dharmaṃ vigrahītavyaṃ maṃsyante /🔽vivaditavyaṃ maṃsyante /
analyzed: bhagavān etat avocat tatra kauśika ye mama dharmam vigrahītavyam maṃsyante  vivaditavyam maṃsyante
translated: The Blessed One said this: Kauśika, those who think they should dispute with my Dharma,🔽think they should argue,

original: virodhayitavyaṃ maṃsyante /🔽teṣāṃ vigrahītukāmānāṃ vivaditukāmānāṃ virodhayitukāmānāmutpannotpannā vigrahā vivādā virodhāḥ /
analyzed: virodhayitavyam maṃsyante  teṣām vigrahītu kāmānām vivaditu kāmānām virodhayitu kāmānām utpanna utpannāḥ vigrahāḥ vivādāḥ virodhāḥ
translated: think they should create opposition,

analyzed: punar eva antardhāsyanti
translated: for those who wish to dispute, wish to argue, wish to create opposition, the disputes, arguments, and oppositions that arise will disappear again,

analyzed: na sthāsyanti
translated: will not remain.

original: teṣāṃ vigrahītukāmānāṃ vivaditukāmānāṃ virodhayitukāmānāṃ na te'bhiprāyāḥ paripūriṃ gamiṣyanti /
analyzed: teṣām vigrahītu kāmānām vivaditu kāmānām virodhayitu kāmānām na tebhiprāyāḥ paripūrim gamiṣyanti
translated: For those who wish to dispute, wish to argue, wish to create opposition, their intentions will not be fulfilled.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: evaṃ hyetatkauśika bhavatiya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati svādhyāsyati /
analyzed: evam hi etat kauśika bhavati yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati su ādhyāsyati
translated: Because, Kauśika, it is like this: a son of good family or a daughter of good family who will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, study it, go forth in it, teach it, explain it, expound it, chant it, and master it,

analyzed: tasya evam tāni utpanna utpannāni adhikaraṇāni punar eva antardhāsyanti
translated: For him, those disputes that have arisen will again disappear.

analyzed: na sthāsyanti
translated: They will not remain.

original: teṣāṃ vigrahītukāmānāṃ vivaditukāmānāṃ virodhayitukāmānāṃ na te'bhiprāyāḥ paripūriṃ gamiṣyanti /
analyzed: teṣām vigrahītu kāmānām vivaditu kāmānām virodhayitu kāmānām na tebhiprāyāḥ paripūrim gamiṣyanti
translated: The wishes of those who desire to quarrel, who desire to dispute, who desire to be in conflict, will not be fulfilled.

original: imamapi sa kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā dṛṣṭadhārmikaṃ guṇaṃ parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: imam api sa kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā dṛṣṭa dhārmikam guṇam parigṛhṇāti
translated: Kauśika, that son of good family or daughter of good family also obtains this visible good quality,

original: ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgṛhṇāti dhārayati vācayati paryavāpnoti pravartayati deśayati upadiśati uddiśati svādhyāyati /
analyzed: yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām udgṛhṇāti dhārayati vācayati paryavāpnoti pravartayati deśayati upadiśati uddiśati su ādhyāyati
translated: who takes up this perfection of wisdom, bears it in mind, reads it aloud, masters it, teaches it, explains it, recites it, and repeats it.

original: tadyathāpi nāma kauśika maghī nāmauṣadhī sarvaviṣapraśamanī /🔽tatra āśīviṣeṇa jantunā bubhukṣitena āhārārthinā āhāragaveṣiṇā kaścideva prāṇakajāto janturdṛṣṭo bhavet /🔽sa āśīviṣastaṃ prāṇakajātaṃ gandhenānubadhnīyādanugacchedāhārahetorbhakṣayitukāmaḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika maghī nāma oṣadhī sarva viṣa praśamanī  tatra āśīviṣeṇa jantunā bubhukṣitena āhāra arthinā āhāra gaveṣiṇā kaścid eva prāṇaka jātaḥ jantuḥ dṛṣṭaḥ bhavet  saḥ āśīviṣaḥ tam prāṇaka jātam gandhena anubadhnīyāt anugacchet āhāra hetoḥ bhakṣayitu kāmaḥ
translated: Just as, Kauśika, there is a herb called 'abundant' that pacifies all poisons,🔽there a hungry and seeking-food snake, seeking food, would see some kind of living being.🔽That snake would follow the smell of that living being, going after it, desiring to eat it.

original: atha sa prāṇakajāto yena sā madhī nāmauṣadhī tenopasaṃkramet /
analyzed: atha sa prāṇaka jātaḥ yena sā madhī nāma oṣadhī tena upasaṃkramet
translated: Then that living being would approach that herb called 'abundant'.

analyzed: tena upasaṃkramya tiṣṭhet
translated: Therefore, he should approach and stand there.

original: atha sa āśīviṣastasyā oṣadhyā gandhenaiva pratyudāvarteta /
analyzed: atha saḥ āśīviṣaḥ tasyāḥ oṣadhyāḥ gandhena eva pratyudāvarteta
translated: Then, by the mere smell of that herb, the poisonous snake would turn back.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: tathā hi tasyā oṣasyā bhaiṣajyaguṇaḥ sa tādṛśo yastasyāśīviṣasya tadviṣamabhibhavati /
analyzed: tathā hi tasyāḥ oṣasyāḥ bhaiṣajya guṇaḥ sa tādṛśaḥ yaḥ tasya āśīviṣasya tat viṣam abhibhavati
translated: Because the medicinal qualities of that herb are such that they overpower the poison of that poisonous snake.

analyzed: evam balavatī hi sā oṣadhī
translated: For that herb is so powerful.

original: evameva kauśika yaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā va imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati svādhyāsyati /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika yaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati su ādhyāsyati
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, the son or daughter of good family who will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, understand it correctly, teach it, instruct in it, proclaim it, chant it, and meditate on it with one-pointed focus,

original: tasya kauśika yāni tānyutpannotpannānyadhikaraṇāni vigrahā vivādā virodhā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: tasya kauśika yāni tāni utpanna utpannāni adhikaraṇāni vigrahāḥ vivādāḥ virodhāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Kauśika, whatever disputes, quarrels, arguments, and disagreements arise for him,

original: te prajñāpāramitāyāstejasā balena sthāmataḥ prajñāpāramitābalādhānena kṣipraṃ tata evoparaṃsyanti upaśamiṣyanti antardhāsyanti na vivardhiṣyante
analyzed: te prajñāpāramitāyāḥ tejasā balena sthāmataḥ prajñāpāramitā bala ādhānena kṣipram tatas eva uparaṃsyanti upaśamiṣyanti antardhāsyanti na vivardhiṣyante
translated: by the brilliance, strength, and power of the perfection of wisdom, by the bestowal of the power of the perfection of wisdom, they will quickly cease right there, be pacified, disappear, and not increase,

analyzed: yatas yatas eva utpatsyante
translated: wherever they arise.

analyzed: tatra tatra eva nirotsyante antardhāsyanti
translated: Right there they will cease, disappear.

analyzed: na vivardhiṣyante na sthāsyanti
translated: they will not increase, they will not remain.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: prajñāpāramitā hi rāga ādīnām yāvat nirvāṇa grāhasya upaśamayitrī
translated: Because the perfection of wisdom is the pacifier of attachment and so on, up to the grasping of nirvana.

analyzed: na vivardhikā iti
translated: It is not an increaser.

original: catvāraśca tasya mahārājānaḥ śakraśca devānāmindro brahmā ca sahāpatiḥ sarve ca buddhā bhagavanto bodhisattvāśca rakṣāvaraṇaguptiṃ saṃvidhāsyanti /
analyzed: catvāraḥ ca tasya mahā rājānaḥ śakraḥ ca devānām indraḥ brahmā ca sahā patiḥ sarve ca buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ bodhisattvāḥ ca rakṣā āvaraṇa guptim saṃvidhāsyanti
translated: And the four great kings, and Sakra, lord of the gods, and Brahma, lord of the Sahā world, and all the Buddhas, Blessed Ones, and Bodhisattvas will provide protection, defense, and security.

original: ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyatiḥ uddekṣyati svādhyāsyati
analyzed: yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyatiḥ uddekṣyati su ādhyāsyati
translated: For the one who will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, master it, promote it, teach it, explain it, expound it, and repeat it to oneself,

original: ayaṃ tena kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitā vā dṛṣṭadhārmiko guṇaḥ parigṛhīto bhaviṣyati //
analyzed: ayam tena kula putreṇa vā kula duhitā vā dṛṣṭa dhārmikaḥ guṇaḥ parigṛhītaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: this is the visible quality that will be taken up by that son of a good family or daughter of a good family.

original: punaraparaṃ kauśika yaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati svādhyāsyati /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika yaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati su ādhyāsyati
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, the son of a good family or daughter of a good family who will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, master it, promote it, teach it, explain it, expound it, and repeat it to oneself,

analyzed: saḥ ādeya vacanaḥ ca bhaviṣyati  mṛdu vacanaḥ ca bhaviṣyati  mita vacanaḥ ca bhaviṣyati
translated: He will have acceptable speech.🔽He will have gentle speech.🔽He will have measured speech.

analyzed: a prakīrṇa vacanaḥ ca bhaviṣyati  na ca krodha abhibhūtaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: He will have unscattered speech.🔽He will not be overcome by anger.

analyzed: na ca māna abhibhūtaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: He will not be overcome by pride.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

analyzed: tathā hi tam prajñāpāramitā paridamayati
translated: Because the perfection of wisdom tames him like that.

analyzed: prajñāpāramitā pariṇamayati  na krodham vardhayati
translated: The perfection of wisdom transforms him.🔽He does not increase anger.

original: na mānaṃ vardhayati /🔽sa nopanāhaṃ parigṛhṇāti /🔽na vyāpādaṃ parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: na mānam vardhayati  sa na upanāham parigṛhṇāti  na vyāpādam parigṛhṇāti
translated: He does not increase pride.🔽He does not grasp at resentment.🔽He does not grasp at malice.

original: nānuśayaṃ dhārayati /🔽evaṃ carato'sya kulaputrasya vā kuladuhiturvā smṛtirmaitrī cotpadyate /
analyzed: na anuśayam dhārayati  evam carataḥ asya kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā smṛtiḥ maitrī ca utpadyate
translated: He does not hold on to latent tendencies.🔽When he practices like this, the son or daughter of good family will give rise to mindfulness and friendliness.

analyzed: tasya evam bhavati sa ced aham vyāpādam utpādayiṣyāmi
translated: He thinks like this: 'If I were to give rise to malice,

analyzed: tena indriyāṇi me pari bhetsyante
translated: then my faculties would be destroyed by that.

analyzed: mukha varṇaḥ ca me dhakṣyate
translated: And the color of my face would be burned.

analyzed: ayuktam ca etat mama yat aham anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau saṃprasthitaḥ
translated: And it is not appropriate for me, who has set out for supreme perfect enlightenment,

analyzed: tatra śikṣitu kāmaḥ
translated: who wishes to train in that,

analyzed: krodhasya vaśam gaccheyam
translated: to come under the sway of anger.'

analyzed: iti evam sa kṣipram eva smṛtim pratilabhate
translated: Thus, he quickly regains mindfulness.

original: imamapi sa kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā dṛṣṭadhārmikaṃ guṇaṃ parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: imam api sa kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā dṛṣṭa dhārmikam guṇam parigṛhṇāti
translated: Kauśika, that son of good family or daughter of good family also obtains this visible good quality,

original: ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati svādhyāsyati /
analyzed: yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati su ādhyāsyati
translated: who will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, study it, spread it, teach it, explain it, chant it, and memorize it.

original: evamukte śakro devānāmindro bhagavantametadavocatāścaryaṃ bhagavan yatheyaṃ prajñāpāramitā paridamanāya pratyupasthitā anunāmāya bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām //
analyzed: evam ukte śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocata āścaryam bhagavan yathā iyam prajñāpāramitā paridamanāya pratyupasthitā anunāmāya bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām
translated: When this was said, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, it is amazing how this perfection of wisdom is present for the taming and guidance of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: bhagavānāhapunaraparaṃ kauśika ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati svādhyāsyati /
analyzed: bhagavān āha punar aparam kauśika yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati su ādhyāsyati
translated: The Blessed One said, Moreover, Kauśika, that son of good family or daughter of good family who will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, study it, spread it, teach it, explain it, chant it, and memorize it,

original: sacetkulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmevamudgṛhṇan dhārayan vācayan paryavāpnuvan pravartayan deśayan upadiśayan uddiśan svādhyāyan saṃgrāme vartamāne saṃgrāmaśirasi samārūḍhaḥ syāt /
analyzed: saced kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām evam udgṛhṇan dhārayan vācayan paryavāpnuvan pravartayan deśayan upadiśayan uddiśan su ādhyāyan saṃgrāme vartamāne saṃgrāma śirasi samārūḍhaḥ syāt
translated: If a son of good family or a daughter of good family, while thus receiving, retaining, reading, mastering, teaching, explaining, reciting, and studying this perfection of wisdom, were to be in a battle, having mounted into the front of the battle,

original: tasya saṃgrāmamavatarato vā avatīrṇasya vā atikrāmato vā saṃgrāmamadhyagatasya vā tiṣṭhato vā niṣaṇṇasya vā asthānametatkauśika anavakāśo yattasya kulaputrasya vā kuladuhiturvā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ manasi kurvato vā udgṛhṇato vā dhārayato vā vācayato vā paryavāpnuvato vā pravartayato vā deśayato vā upadiśato vā uddiśato vā svādhyāyato vā jīvitāntarāyo vā bhavet /
analyzed: tasya saṃgrāmam avatarataḥ vā avatīrṇasya vā atikrāmataḥ vā saṃgrāma madhya gatasya vā tiṣṭhataḥ vā niṣaṇṇasya vā asthānam etat kauśika anavakāśaḥ yattasya kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā imām prajñāpāramitām manasi kurvataḥ vā udgṛhṇataḥ vā dhārayataḥ vā vācayataḥ vā paryavāpnuvataḥ vā pravartayataḥ vā deśayataḥ vā upadiśataḥ vā uddiśataḥ vā su ādhyāyataḥ vā jīvita antarāyaḥ vā bhavet
translated: it is not possible, Kauśika, it cannot happen, that for that son of good family or daughter of good family who is attending to this perfection of wisdom, whether receiving it, retaining it, reading it, mastering it, teaching it, explaining it, reciting it, and studying it, whether entering the battle, having entered, or passing by, whether in the midst of the battle, standing or sitting, there would be an obstacle to life.

analyzed: para upakrameṇa jīvita antarāyam saḥ anuprāpnuyāt
translated: He would not obtain an obstacle to life through the harm of others.

analyzed: na etat sthānam vidyate
translated: There is no such possibility.

original: sacetpunastasya kaścitkauśika tatra śastraṃ vā daṇḍaṃ vā loṣṭaṃ vā anyadvā kṣipet /
analyzed: saced punar tasya kaścid kauśika tatra śastram vā daṇḍam vā loṣṭam vā anyat vā kṣipet
translated: If someone were to throw a weapon, a stick, a clod, or anything else at him there,

analyzed: na etat tasya śarīre nipatet
translated: it would not strike his body.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: mahāvidyeyaṃ kauśika yaduta prajñāpāramitā /🔽apramāṇeyaṃ kauśika vidyā yaduta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: mahā vidyā iyam kauśika yat uta prajñāpāramitā  apramāṇā iyam kauśika vidyā yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: Kauśika, this is a great knowledge, namely the perfection of wisdom.🔽Kauśika, this is an immeasurable knowledge, namely the perfection of wisdom.

original: aparimāṇeyaṃ kauśika vidyā yaduta prajñāpāramitā /🔽anuttareyaṃ kauśika vidyā yaduta prajñāpāramitā /🔽asameyaṃ kauśika vidyā yaduta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: aparimāṇā iyam kauśika vidyā yat uta prajñāpāramitā  anuttarā iyam kauśika vidyā yat uta prajñāpāramitā  asamā iyam kauśika vidyā yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: Kauśika, this is an infinite knowledge, namely the perfection of wisdom.🔽Kauśika, this is an unsurpassed knowledge, namely the perfection of wisdom.🔽Kauśika, this is an unequaled knowledge, namely the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: asamasamā iyam kauśika vidyā yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: Kauśika, this is a knowledge unequaled by any other, namely the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: atra hi kauśika vidyāyāṃ śikṣamāṇaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā nātmavyābādhāya cetayate /🔽na paravyābādhāya cetayate /
analyzed: atra hi kauśika vidyāyām śikṣamāṇaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā na ātma vyābādhāya cetayate  na para vyābādhāya cetayate
translated: Kauśika, a son of good family or a daughter of good family who trains in this knowledge does not think to harm themselves,🔽does not think to harm others,

analyzed: na ubhaya vyābādhāya cetayate
translated: and does not think to harm either of the two.

original: atra hi kauśika vidyāyāṃ śikṣamāṇo bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyate /
analyzed: atra hi kauśika vidyāyām śikṣamāṇaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: Kauśika, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who trains in this knowledge will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

analyzed: sarvajña jñānam ca pratilapsyate
translated: And he will attain omniscient knowledge.

original: tena so'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhya sarvasattvānāṃ cittāni vyavalokayiṣyati /
analyzed: tena saḥ unuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhya sarva sattvānām cittāni vyavalokayiṣyati
translated: Having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, he will look into the minds of all beings.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: atra hi kauśika vidyāyāṃ śikṣamāṇasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya na tatkiṃcidasti /
analyzed: atra hi kauśika vidyāyām śikṣamāṇasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya na tat kiṃcid asti
translated: O Kauśika, for a bodhisattva mahāsattva who trains in this knowledge, there is nothing that is not attained,

original: yanna prāptaṃ vā na jñātaṃ vā na sākṣātkṛtaṃ vā syāt /
analyzed: yat na prāptam vā na jñātam vā na sākṣātkṛtam vā syāt
translated: not known, not directly realized.

original: tasmātsarvajñajñānamityucyate /🔽ayamapi kauśika tena kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā dṛṣṭadhārmiko guṇaḥ parigṛhīto bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tasmāt sarvajña jñānam iti ucyate  ayam api kauśika tena kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā dṛṣṭa dhārmikaḥ guṇaḥ parigṛhītaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Therefore, it is called the knowledge of omniscience.

original: ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati svādhyāsyati //
analyzed: yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati su ādhyāsyati
translated: O Kauśika, this son of noble family or daughter of noble family who will take up this perfection of wisdom, who will bear it in mind, recite it, master it, teach it, explain it, chant it, and study it, will acquire this visible quality.

original: punaraparaṃ kauśika yatreyaṃ prajñāpāramitā antaśo likhitvā pustakagatāṃ kṛtvā pūjāpūrvaṃgamaṃ sthāpayitvā na satkariṣyate /🔽nodgrahīṣyate /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika yatra iyam prajñāpāramitā antaśas likhitvā pustaka gatām kṛtvā pūjā pūrvaṃgamam sthāpayitvā na satkariṣyate  na udgrahīṣyate
translated: Moreover, O Kauśika, wherever this perfection of wisdom is written down, made into a book, and placed, having been worshipped,🔽it will not be honored,

analyzed: na dhārayiṣyate
translated: it will not be taken up,🔽it will not be borne in mind,

analyzed: na vācayiṣyate  na paryavāpsyate
translated: It will not be recited.🔽It will not be mastered.

analyzed: na pravartayiṣyate  na deśayiṣyate  na upadekṣyate
translated: It will not be taught.🔽It will not be explained.🔽It will not be demonstrated.

analyzed: na uddekṣyate
translated: It will not be pointed out.

analyzed: na su ādhyāsyate
translated: It will not be studied.

original: na tatra kauśika sattvānāṃ manuṣyo vā amanuṣyo vā avatārārthiko'vatāragaveṣī avatāraṃ lapsyate sthāpayitvā pūrvakarmavipākam /
analyzed: na tatra kauśika sattvānām manuṣyaḥ vā amanuṣyaḥ vā avatāra arthikaḥ uvatāra gaveṣī avatāram lapsyate sthāpayitvā pūrva karma vipākam
translated: Kauśika, there, for beings, whether human or non-human, seeking an opportunity, seeking a chance, will not find an opportunity, except for the ripening of former karma.

original: imamapi sa kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā dṛṣṭadhārmikaṃ guṇaṃ parigṛhṇāti //
analyzed: imam api sa kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā dṛṣṭa dhārmikam guṇam parigṛhṇāti
translated: Kauśika, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family obtains this visible good quality.

original: punaraparaṃ kauśika tadyathāpi nāma ye bodhimaṇḍagatā vā bodhimaṇḍaparisāmantagatā vā bodhimaṇḍābhyantaragatā vā bodhivṛkṣamūlagatā vā manuṣyā vā amanuṣyā vā /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika tat yathā api nāma ye bodhimaṇḍa gatāḥ vā bodhimaṇḍa parisāmanta gatāḥ vā bodhimaṇḍa abhyantara gatāḥ vā bodhivṛkṣa mūla gatāḥ vā manuṣyāḥ vā amanuṣyāḥ vā
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, just as those who are at the site of enlightenment, or around the site of enlightenment, or inside the site of enlightenment, or at the foot of the Bodhi tree, whether human or non-human,

analyzed: tiryagyoni gatān api upādāya
translated: including those born as animals,

original: yāvanna te śakyā manuṣyairvā amanuṣyairvā viheṭhayituṃ vā vyāpādayituṃ vā āveśayituṃ vā sthāpayitvā pūrvakarmavipākam /
analyzed: yāvat na te śakyāḥ manuṣyaiḥ vā amanuṣyaiḥ vā viheṭhayitum vā vyāpādayitum vā āveśayitum vā sthāpayitvā pūrva karma vipākam
translated: are not able to be harmed, injured, or possessed by humans or non-humans, except for the ripening of former karma.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tatra hi atītānāgatapratyutpannāstathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā abhisaṃbuddhā abhisaṃbhotsyante abhisaṃbudhyante ca /
analyzed: tatra hi atīta anāgata pratyutpannāḥ tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ abhisaṃbuddhāḥ abhisaṃbhotsyante abhisaṃbudhyante ca
translated: For there the Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones of the past, future, and present are fully awakened, will be fully awakened, and are being fully awakened.

analyzed: ye sarva sattvānām abhayam avairam anutrāsam prabhāvayanti prakāśayanti
translated: They proclaim and reveal to all beings fearlessness, freedom from enmity, and freedom from oppression.

original: evameva kauśika yatra kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati svādhyāsyati /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika yatra kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati su ādhyāsyati
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, wherever a son or daughter of good family will take up, bear in mind, read aloud, master, teach, explain, recite, and study this perfection of wisdom,

original: tatra hi kauśika sattvā na śakyā manuṣyairvā amanuṣyairvā viheṭhayituṃ vā vyāpādayituṃ vā āveśayituṃ vā /
analyzed: tatra hi kauśika sattvāḥ na śakyāḥ manuṣyaiḥ vā amanuṣyaiḥ vā viheṭhayitum vā vyāpādayitum vā āveśayitum vā
translated: there, Kauśika, beings cannot be harmed, killed, or possessed by humans or non-humans,

analyzed: sthāpayitvā pūrva karma vipākam
translated: except as a result of past karma.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: anayaiva hi kauśika prajñāpāramitayā pṛthivīpradeśaḥ sattvānāṃ caityabhūtaḥ kṛto vandanīyo mānanīyaḥ pūjanīyo'rcanīyo'pacāyanīyaḥ satkaraṇīyo
analyzed: anayā eva hi kauśika prajñāpāramitayā pṛthivī pradeśaḥ sattvānām caitya bhūtaḥ kṛtaḥ vandanīyaḥ mānanīyaḥ pūjanīya ūrcanīya upacāyanīyaḥ satkaraṇīyaḥ
translated: Kauśika, it is because by this very perfection of wisdom that region becomes a caitya for beings, to be worshipped, revered, honored, adored, venerated, and esteemed by them,

original: trāṇaṃ śaraṇaṃ layanaṃ parāyaṇaṃ kṛto bhaviṣyati tatropagatānāṃ sattvānām /
analyzed: trāṇam śaraṇam layanam parāyaṇam kṛtaḥ bhaviṣyati tatra upagatānām sattvānām
translated: will be a protector, a refuge, a place of rest, and a support for the beings who have come there.

original: imamapi sa kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā dṛṣṭadhārmikaṃ guṇaṃ parigṛhṇāti //
analyzed: imam api sa kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā dṛṣṭa dhārmikam guṇam parigṛhṇāti
translated: Kauśika, this son of good family or daughter of good family will also obtain this visible good quality.

original: evamukte śakro devānāmindro bhagavantametadavocatyo bhagavan kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ likhitvā pustakagatāṃ kṛtvā sthāpayet /
analyzed: evam ukte śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat yaḥ bhagavan kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām likhitvā pustaka gatām kṛtvā sthāpayet
translated: When this was said, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, if a son of good family or daughter of good family, having written this perfection of wisdom and made it into a book, were to place it

analyzed: enām ca divyābhiḥ puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja
translated: and with divine flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, flags,

analyzed: ghaṇṭā patākābhiḥ samantāt ca dīpa mālābhiḥ
translated: bells, and banners, and all around with garlands of lamps,

original: bahuvidhābhiśca pūjābhiḥ satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet arcayet apacāyet /
analyzed: bahuvidhābhiḥ ca pūjābhiḥ satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet arcayet apacāyet
translated: and with many kinds of worship, were to honor it, revere it, respect it, make offerings to it, worship it, and venerate it,

original: yaśca tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya parinirvṛtasya śarīrāṇi stūpeṣu pratiṣṭhāpayet parigṛhṇīyāt dhārayeddhā /
analyzed: yaḥ ca tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya parinirvṛtasya śarīrāṇi stūpeṣu pratiṣṭhāpayet parigṛhṇīyāt dhārayet hā
translated: and if someone were to place the relics of a Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One who has attained final nirvāṇa in stūpas, and were to take them up, hold them,

analyzed: tān ca tathā eva divyābhiḥ puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja ghaṇṭā patākābhiḥ
translated: and with divine flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, flags, banners, and lamps, and with many kinds of worship, he would honor them, respect them, revere them, and make offerings to them.

analyzed: samantāt ca dīpa mālābhiḥ
translated: And all around with garlands of lamps.

original: bahuvidhābhiśca pūjābhiḥ satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet arcayet apacāyet /
analyzed: bahuvidhābhiḥ ca pūjābhiḥ satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet arcayet apacāyet
translated: And with many kinds of worship, he would honor them, respect them, revere them, and make offerings to them.

original: katarastayoḥ kulaputrayoḥ kuladuhitrorvā bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavet /
analyzed: kataraḥ tayoḥ kula putrayoḥ kula duhitroḥ vā bahutaram puṇyam prasavet
translated: Which of those two, son of noble family or daughter of noble family, would generate more merit?

original: evamukte bhagavān śakraṃ devānāmindrametadavocattena hi kauśika tvāmevātra pratiprakṣyāmi /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān śakram devānām indram etat avocat tena hi kauśika tvām eva atra pratiprakṣyāmi
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said this to Śakra, Lord of the Gods: Well then, Kauśika, I will ask you about this.

analyzed: yathā te kṣamate
translated: As you are able,

original: tathā vyākuryāḥ /🔽tatkiṃ manyase kauśika yo'yaṃ tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya sarvajñatātmabhāvo'bhinirvartitaḥ /
analyzed: tathā vyākuryāḥ  tat kim manyase kauśika yaḥ yam tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya sarvajña tā ātmabhāvaḥ abhinirvartitaḥ
translated: so you should explain.🔽What do you think, Kauśika? This body of the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One, which is the attainment of omniscience,

original: sa katamasyāṃ pratipadi śikṣamāṇena tathāgatenārhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ sarvajñatā pratilabdhā abhisaṃbuddhā /
analyzed: sa katamasyām pratipadi śikṣamāṇena tathāgatena arhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ sarvajña tā pratilabdhā abhisaṃbuddhā
translated: in which practice, training, and application did the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One, while training in the past, attain supreme perfect enlightenment, omniscience?

original: evamukte śakro devānāmindro bhagavantametadavocatihaiva bhagavan bhagavatā prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣamāṇena tathāgatenārhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ sarvajñatā pratilabdhā abhisaṃbuddhā /
analyzed: evam ukte śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocati ha eva bhagavan bhagavatā prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣamāṇena tathāgatena arhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ sarvajña tā pratilabdhā abhisaṃbuddhā
translated: When this was said, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the Blessed One: Here, Blessed One, the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One, while training in the perfection of wisdom, attained and realized unsurpassed perfect enlightenment and omniscience.

original: bhagavānāhatasmāttarhi kauśika nānenātmabhāvaśarīrapratilambhena tathāgatastathāgata iti saṃkhyāṃ gacchati /
analyzed: bhagavān āha tasmāt tarhi kauśika na anena ātma bhāva śarīra pratilambhena tathāgataḥ tathāgataḥ iti saṃkhyām gacchati
translated: The Blessed One said: Therefore, Kauśika, the Tathāgata is not reckoned as a Tathāgata because of attaining this physical body,

original: sarvajñatāyāṃ tu pratilabdhāyāṃ tathāgatastathāgata iti saṃkhyāṃ gacchati /
analyzed: sarvajña tāyām tu pratilabdhāyām tathāgataḥ tathāgataḥ iti saṃkhyām gacchati
translated: but he is reckoned as a Tathāgata when he attains omniscience.

analyzed: yā iyam kauśika sarvajña tā tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya
translated: Kauśika, this omniscience of the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One,

analyzed: prajñāpāramitā nirjātā eṣā
translated: is born from the perfection of wisdom.

original: eṣa ca kauśika tathāgatasyātmabhāvaśarīrapratilambhaḥ prajñāpāramitopāyakauśalyanirjātaḥ san sarvajñajñānāśrayabhūto bhavati /
analyzed: eṣa ca kauśika tathāgatasya ātma bhāva śarīra pratilambhaḥ prajñāpāramitā upāya kauśalya nirjātaḥ san sarvajña jñāna āśraya bhūtaḥ bhavati
translated: And this physical body of the Tathāgata, Kauśika, being born from the skillful means of the perfection of wisdom, becomes the basis for the knowledge of omniscience.

original: enaṃ hyāśrayaṃ niśritya sarvajñajñānasya prabhāvanā bhavati /
analyzed: enam hi āśrayam niśritya sarvajña jñānasya prabhāvanā bhavati
translated: Relying on this basis, the manifestation of the knowledge of omniscience occurs.

analyzed: buddha śarīra prabhāvanā bhavati
translated: The manifestation of the Buddha's body occurs.

analyzed: dharma śarīra prabhāvanā bhavati
translated: It becomes the manifestation of the body of the Dharma.

analyzed: saṃgha śarīra prabhāvanā bhavati
translated: It becomes the manifestation of the body of the Saṅgha.

original: ityevaṃ sarvajñajñānahetuko'yamātmabhāvaśarīrapratilambhaḥ sarvajñajñānāśrayabhūtatvātsarvasattvānāṃ caityabhūto vandanīyaḥ satkaraṇīyo gurukaraṇīyo mānanīyaḥ pūjanīyo'rcanīyo'pacāyanīyaḥ saṃvṛtto bhavati /
analyzed: iti evam sarvajña jñāna hetukaḥ ayam ātma bhāva śarīra pratilambhaḥ sarvajña jñāna āśraya bhūta tvāt sarva sattvānām caitya bhūtaḥ vandanīyaḥ satkaraṇīyaḥ gurukaraṇīyaḥ mānanīyaḥ pūjanīya ūrcanīya upacāyanīyaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ bhavati
translated: Thus, this attainment of a body and form that is the cause of omniscient knowledge becomes an object of worship for all beings, because it is the basis of omniscient knowledge. It becomes an object of veneration, respect, honor, worship, reverence, and homage.

original: evaṃ ca mama parinirvṛtasyāpi sataḥ eṣāṃ śarīrāṇāṃ pūjā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: evam ca mama parinirvṛtasya api sataḥ eṣām śarīrāṇām pūjā bhaviṣyati
translated: And thus, even after my parinirvāṇa, these bodies will be worshipped.

original: tasmāttarhi kauśika yaḥ kaścitkulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ likhitvā pustakagatāṃ vā kṛtvā sthāpayet /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi kauśika yaḥ kaścid kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām likhitvā pustaka gatām vā kṛtvā sthāpayet
translated: Therefore, Kauśika, if any son or daughter of good family were to write out this perfection of wisdom, make it into a book, and enshrine it,

original: enāṃ ca divyābhiḥ puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajaghaṇṭāpatākābhiḥ satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet arcayet apacāyet /
analyzed: enām ca divyābhiḥ puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja ghaṇṭā patākābhiḥ satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet arcayet apacāyet
translated: and were to honor it with divine flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, flags, bells, and banners,

original: ayameva kauśika tayoḥ kulaputrayoḥ kuladuhitrorvā bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavet /
analyzed: ayam eva kauśika tayoḥ kula putrayoḥ kula duhitroḥ vā bahutaram puṇyam prasavet
translated: Kauśika, these two sons or daughters of good family would generate much more merit.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: sarvajñajñānasya hi kauśika tena kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: sarvajña jñānasya hi kauśika tena kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyati
translated: Kauśika, that son of good family or daughter of good family will have made an offering to the knowledge of omniscience.

original: yaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā iha prajñāpāramitāyāṃ likhyamānāyāṃ pustakagatāyāṃ vā satkāraṃ gurukāraṃ mānanāṃ pūjanāmarcanāmapacāyanāṃ pūjāṃ ca vividhāṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: yaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā iha prajñāpāramitāyām likhyamānāyām pustaka gatāyām vā satkāram gurukāram mānanām pūjanām arcanām apacāyanām pūjām ca vividhām kuryāt
translated: If a son of good family or daughter of good family, when this perfection of wisdom is being written, were to make various offerings to the book,

analyzed: ayam eva tatas bahutaram puṇyam prasavet
translated: he or she would produce merit that is much greater than that.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: sarvajñajñānasya hi kauśika tena pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: sarvajña jñānasya hi kauśika tena pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyati
translated: Kauśika, that is because an offering has been made to the knowledge of omniscience.

analyzed: yaḥ prajñāpāramitāyai pūjām kariṣyati
translated: One who makes an offering to the perfection of wisdom.

original: evamukte śakro devānāmindro bhagavantametadavocatya ime bhagavan jāmbūdvīpakā manuṣyā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ na likhiṣyanti /🔽nodgrahīṣyanti na dhārayiṣyanti /
analyzed: evam ukte śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat ye ime bhagavan jāmbūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ imām prajñāpāramitām na likhiṣyanti  na udgrahīṣyanti na dhārayiṣyanti
translated: When this was said, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, these people of Jambudvīpa will not write this perfection of wisdom,🔽they will not take it up, they will not bear it in mind,

original: na vācayiṣyanti na paryavāpsyanti na pravartayiṣyanti na deśayiṣyanti nopadekṣyanti noddekṣyanti na svādhyāsyanti /
analyzed: na vācayiṣyanti na paryavāpsyanti na pravartayiṣyanti na deśayiṣyanti na upadekṣyanti na uddekṣyanti na su ādhyāsyanti
translated: they will not recite it, they will not master it, they will not expound it, they will not teach it, they will not expound it, they will not chant it, they will not properly pay attention to it.

analyzed: tām ca enām prajñāpāramitām puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja ghaṇṭā patākābhiḥ
translated: And they will not honor that perfection of wisdom with flowers, incense, garlands, perfumes, ointments, aromatic powders, cloths, parasols, flags, bells, and banners,

analyzed: samantāt ca dīpa mālābhiḥ
translated: and with garlands of lamps all around,

analyzed: bahuvidhābhiḥ ca pūjābhiḥ na satkariṣyanti
translated: and with many kinds of worship.

analyzed: na gurukariṣyanti  na mānayiṣyanti
translated: They will not revere it.🔽They will not respect it.

analyzed: na pūjayiṣyanti  na arcayiṣyanti
translated: They will not worship it.🔽They will not adore it.

analyzed: na apacāyiṣyanti
translated: They will not venerate it.

original: kiṃ nu te bhagavan na jñāsyanti evaṃ mahārthikā bhagavatoktā prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyatīti /
analyzed: kim nu te bhagavat na jñāsyanti evam mahārthikā bhagavatā uktā prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyati iti
translated: What, Blessed One, will they not know: 'The worship of the perfection of wisdom, spoken of by the Blessed One as so greatly beneficial, will have been done'?

original: kiṃ nu te bhagavan na vetsyantievaṃ mahānuśaṃsā evaṃ mahāphalā evaṃ mahāvipākā bhagavatoktā prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyatīti /
analyzed: kim nu te bhagavat na vetsyanti evam mahā anuśaṃsāḥ evam mahā phalāḥ evam mahā vipākāḥ bhagavatā uktā prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyati iti
translated: What, Blessed One, will they not understand: 'The worship of the perfection of wisdom, spoken of by the Blessed One as having such great benefits, such great fruits, such great consequences, will have been done'?

analyzed: na ca te vedayiṣyanti
translated: And they will not feel it.

analyzed: uta jñāsyanti vetsyanti
translated: But they will know, they will understand,

analyzed: vedayiṣyanti
translated: they will feel.

analyzed: na ca punar śraddhāsyanti
translated: But they will not have faith.

original: evamukte bhagavān śakraṃ devānāmindrametadavocattatkiṃ manyase kauśika kiyantaste jāmbūdvīpakā manuṣyā te buddhe'vetya prasādena samanvāgatāḥ /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān śakram devānām indram etat avocat tat kim manyase kauśika kiyantaḥ te jāmbūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyā te buddhā iva itya prasādena samanvāgatāḥ
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to Śakra, Lord of the Gods, What do you think, Kauśika? How many of those human beings in Jambudvīpa are endowed with clear faith in the Buddha?

analyzed: ye prasādena samanvāgatāḥ
translated: How many are endowed with clear faith in the Dharma?

analyzed: ye saṃghā iva itya prasādena samanvāgatāḥ
translated: How many are endowed with clear faith in the Saṅgha?

original: evamukte śakro devānāmindro bhagavantametadavocatalpakāste bhagavan jāmbūdvīpakā manuṣyā ye buddhe'vetya prasādena samanvāgatāḥ /
analyzed: evam ukte śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat alpakāḥ te bhagavan jāmbūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ ye buddhā ivetya prasādena samanvāgatāḥ
translated: When this was said, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, those human beings in Jambudvīpa who are endowed with clear faith in the Buddha are few.

analyzed: ye prasādena samanvāgatāḥ
translated: Those who are endowed with clear faith in the Dharma are few.

analyzed: ye saṃghā iva itya prasādena samanvāgatāḥ
translated: Those who are endowed with clear faith in the Saṅgha are few.

analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān śakram devānām indram etat avocat evam etat kauśika evam etat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to Śakra, Lord of the Gods, So it is, Kauśika. So it is.

original: alpakāste jāmbūdvīpakā manuṣyā ye buddhe'vetya prasādena samanvāgatāḥ /
analyzed: alpakāḥ te jāmbūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ ye buddhā iva itya prasādena samanvāgatāḥ
translated: Those human beings in Jambudvīpa who are endowed with clear faith in the Buddha are few.

analyzed: ye prasādena samanvāgatāḥ
translated: Those who are endowed with clear faith in the Dharma are few.

analyzed: ye saṃghā iva itya prasādena samanvāgatāḥ
translated: Those who are endowed with clear faith in the Saṅgha are few.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ kauśika alpebhyaḥ ulpatarakāḥ te
translated: Kauśika, even fewer than those are

analyzed: ye srotaāpatti phalam prāpnuvanti  tatas sakṛdāgāmi phalam anāgāmi phalam
translated: Those who attain the fruit of stream-entry.🔽From them, fewer attain the fruit of once-returning and the fruit of non-returning.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ api alpebhyaḥ ulpatarakāḥ teyeḥ hat tva prāpnuvanti
translated: From them, even fewer attain arhatship.

original: tebhyo'pyalpebhyo'lpatarakāste ye pratyekabodhiṃ sākṣātkurvanti /🔽tebhyo'pyalpebhyo'lpatarakāste ye'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittānyutpādayanti /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ api alpebhyaḥ ulpatarakāḥ te ye pratyeka bodhim sākṣātkurvanti  tebhyaḥ api alpebhyaḥ ulpatarakāḥ te yena uttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpādayanti
translated: From them, even fewer directly realize individual enlightenment.🔽From them, even fewer generate the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: tebhyo'pyalpebhyo'lpatarakāste ye'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittānyutpādya taṃ cittotpādaṃ bṛṃhayanti /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ api alpebhyaḥ ulpatarakāḥ te yena uttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpādya tam citta utpādam bṛṃhayanti
translated: From them, even fewer, having generated the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, increase that generation of the mind.

original: tebhyo'pyalpebhyo'lpatarakāste ye'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittānyutpādya upabṛṃhayitvā ca ārabdhavīryā viharanti /🔽tebhyo'pyalpebhyo'lpatarakāste ye prajñāpāramitāyāṃ yogamāpadyante /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ api alpebhyaḥ ulpatarakāḥ te yena uttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpādya upabṛṃhayitvā ca ārabdha vīryāḥ viharanti  tebhyaḥ api alpebhyaḥ ulpatarakāḥ te ye prajñāpāramitāyām yogam āpadyante
translated: From them, even fewer, having generated the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment and increased it, dwell having undertaken vigor.🔽From them, even fewer apply themselves to the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ api alpebhyaḥ ulpatarakāḥ te ye prajñāpāramitāyām caranti
translated: From them, even fewer practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: tebhyo'pyalpebhyo'lpatarakāste ye prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caranto ghaṭamānā avinivartanīyāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmāvavatiṣṭhante /🔽tebhyo'pyalpebhyo'lpatarakāste ye prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caranto ghaṭamānā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyante /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ api alpebhyaḥ ulpatarakāḥ te ye prajñāpāramitāyām carantaḥ ghaṭamānāḥ a vinivartanīyāyām bodhisattva bhūmau avatiṣṭhante  tebhyaḥ api alpebhyaḥ ulpatarakāḥ te ye prajñāpāramitāyām carantaḥ ghaṭamānāḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyante
translated: Fewer than those are those who, practicing and striving in the perfection of wisdom, stand on the irreversible stage of a bodhisattva.🔽Fewer than those are those who, practicing and striving in the perfection of wisdom, will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: tebhyo'pyalpebhyo'lpatarakāste ye prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caranto ghaṭamānā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhyante /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ api alpebhyaḥ ulpatarakāḥ te ye prajñāpāramitāyām carantaḥ ghaṭamānāḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyante
translated: Fewer than those are those who, practicing and striving in the perfection of wisdom, fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: te te kauśika bodhisattvā mahāsattvā ye avinivartanīyāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthitvā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhya anyeṣāmadhyāśayasaṃpannānāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṝṇāṃ ca prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣamāṇānāṃ ghaṭamānānāṃ prajñāpāramitāmupadiśanti ca uddiśanti /
analyzed: te te kauśika bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ ye a vinivartanīyāyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitvā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhya anyeṣām adhyāśaya saṃpannānām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṝṇām ca prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣamāṇānām ghaṭamānānām prajñāpāramitām upadiśanti ca uddiśanti
translated: Those, Kauśika, are the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who, having stood on the irreversible stage of a bodhisattva, fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment and teach the perfection of wisdom and recite it to other sons of good family and daughters of good family who have a superior intention and are training and striving in the perfection of wisdom.

original: te codgṛhṇanti dhārayanti vācayanti paryavāpnuvanti pravartayanti upadeśayanti upadiśanti uddiśanti svādhyāyanti /
analyzed: te ca udgṛhṇanti dhārayanti vācayanti paryavāpnuvanti pravartayanti upadeśayanti upadiśanti uddiśanti su ādhyāyanti
translated: They take it up, bear it in mind, read it aloud, master it, teach it, explain it, recite it, and study it.

analyzed: tām ca enām prajñāpāramitām puṣpaiḥ dhūpaiḥ gandhaiḥ mālyaiḥ vilepa
translated: And they worship this perfection of wisdom with flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands, ointments,

analyzed: naiścūrṇaiḥ vastraiḥ chatraiḥ dhvajaiḥ ghaṇṭābhiḥ patākābhiḥ samantāt ca dīpa mālābhiḥ
translated: powders, clothes, parasols, flags, and banners, and all around with rows of lamps.

analyzed: bahuvidhābhiḥ ca pūjābhiḥ
translated: And with many kinds of worship.

original: satkurvanti gurukurvanti mānayanti pūjayanti arcayanti apacāyanti /
analyzed: satkurvanti gurukurvanti mānayanti pūjayanti arcayanti apacāyanti
translated: They honor it, revere it, respect it, make offerings to it, worship it, adore it, and venerate it.

original: santi khalu punaḥ kauśika aprameyā asaṃkhyeyāḥ sattvāḥ /
analyzed: santi khalu punar kauśika aprameyāḥ asaṃkhyeyāḥ sattvāḥ
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, there are immeasurable, incalculable beings

analyzed: ye bodhi cittam utpādayanti  bodhi cittam utpādya bodhi cittam upabṛṃhayanti
translated: who arouse the mind set on awakening.🔽Having aroused the mind set on awakening, they increase the mind set on awakening.

analyzed: bodhi cittam upabṛṃhayitvā bodhāya caranti
translated: Having increased the mind set on awakening, they practice for awakening.🔽Kauśika, of those immeasurable, incalculable beings who practice for awakening, if one or two remain on the irreversible bodhisattva stage

original: teṣāṃ khalu punaḥ kauśika aprameyāṇāmasaṃkhyeyānāṃ sattvānāṃ bodhāya caratāmapi yadyeko vā dvau vā avinivartanīyāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmāvavatiṣṭheyātām
analyzed: teṣām khalu punar kauśika aprameyāṇām asaṃkhyeyānām sattvānām bodhāya caratām api yadi ekaḥ vā dvau vā a vinivartanīyāyām bodhisattva bhūmau avatiṣṭheyātām
translated: toward unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: durabhisaṃbhavā hi kauśika anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ hīna vīryaiḥ kusīdaiḥ hīna sattvaiḥ hīna cittaiḥ hīna saṃjñaiḥ hīna adhimuktikaiḥ hīna prajñaiḥ
translated: For, Kauśika, unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment is difficult to believe in for those with weak effort, those who are lazy, those with inferior beings, those with inferior minds, those with inferior perceptions, those with inferior aspirations, and those with inferior wisdom.

original: tasmāttarhi kauśika kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā kṣipraṃ cānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃboddhukāmena iyameva prajñāpāramitā sukhaṃ abhīkṣṇaṃ śrotavyā udgrahītavyā dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā pravartayitavyā deśayitavyā upadeṣṭavyā uddeṣṭavyā svādhyātavyā paripraṣṭavyā /
