translated: Because for those former bodhisattvas with notions of objects, although they gave much, it was reckoned as much.

original: atha khalu cāturmahārājakāyikānāṃ devaputrāṇāṃ viṃśatisahasrāṇi prāñjalīni namasyanti bhagavantametadavocanmahāpariṇāmo'yaṃ bhagavan bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ yaduta prajñāpāramitopāyakauśalyaparigṛhītānāṃ kuśalamūlapariṇāmaḥ sarvajñatāyai /
analyzed: atha khalu cāturmahārājakāyikānām deva putrāṇām viṃśati sahasrāṇi prāñjalīni namasyanti bhagavantam etat avocat mahā pariṇāmaḥ yam bhagavan bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām yat uta prajñāpāramitā upāya kauśalya parigṛhītānām kuśala mūla pariṇāmaḥ sarvajña tāyai
translated: Then twenty thousand gods of the Four Great Kings, with folded hands, bowed to the Blessed One and said this: This is a great transformation, Blessed One, of the bodhisattva great beings, namely, the transformation of wholesome roots to all-knowledge by the bodhisattva great beings who are taken hold of by the perfection of wisdom and skill in means.

original: yatra hi nāma teṣāmaupalambhikānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ tāvantaṃ dānamayaṃ puṇyābhisaṃskāramabhibhavati /🔽atha khalu trāyastriṃśakāyikānāṃ devaputrāṇāṃ śatasahasrāṇi divyapuṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇavarṣairdivyai ratnavarṣairdivyaiśca vastravarṣairbhagavantamabhyavākirannabhiprākiran
analyzed: yatra hi nāma teṣām aupalambhikānām bodhisattvānām tāvantam dāna mayam puṇya abhisaṃskāram abhibhavati  atha khalu trāyastriṃśa kāyikānām deva putrāṇām śata sahasrāṇi divya puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa varṣaiḥ divyaiḥ ratna varṣaiḥ divyaiḥ ca vastra varṣaiḥ bhagavantam abhyavākiran abhiprākiran
translated: For in this way, the wholesome action of giving of those bodhisattvas who are attached to objects is surpassed.

original: divyaiśchatrairdivyairdhvajairdivyābhirghaṇṭābhirdivyābhiḥ patākābhiḥ samantācca divyadīpamālābhirbahuvidhābhiśca divyābhiḥ pūjābhirbhagavantaṃ satkurvanti sma /
analyzed: divyaiḥ chatraiḥ divyaiḥ dhvajaiḥ divyābhiḥ ghaṇṭābhiḥ divyābhiḥ patākābhiḥ samantāt ca divya dīpa mālābhiḥ bahuvidhābhiḥ ca divyābhiḥ pūjābhiḥ bhagavantam satkurvanti sma
translated: Then hundreds of thousands of gods of the Thirty-Three rained down divine flowers, incense, garlands, ointments, powders, and jewels, divine robes, and divine parasols, banners, and flags, and all around divine garlands of lamps, and with many kinds of divine worship they honored the Blessed One.

original: gurukurvanti sma mānayanti sma pūjayanti sma arcayanti sma apacāyanti sma /
analyzed: gurukurvanti sma mānayanti sma pūjayanti sma arcayanti sma apacāyanti sma
translated: They revered, honored, and worshipped them, and made offerings to them.

analyzed: divyāni ca vādyāni abhipravādayāmāsuḥ
translated: They also played divine musical instruments.

original: evaṃ ca vācamabhāṣantamahāpariṇāmo batāyaṃ bhagavan bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya yo'yaṃ dharmadhātupariṇāmaḥ /
analyzed: evam ca vācam abhāṣanta mahā pariṇāmaḥ bata ayam bhagavan bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya yaḥ yam dharmadhātu pariṇāmaḥ
translated: And they spoke these words: “This is a great transformation, Blessed One, of a bodhisattva great being, this transformation of the dharma-dhātu,

original: yatra hi nāma tatteṣāmaupalambhikānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ dānamayaṃ puṇyābhisaṃskāraskandhamabhibhavati yathāpi nāma prajñāpāramitopāyakauśalyaparigṛhītatvādasya mahāpariṇāmasya /
analyzed: yatra hi nāma tat teṣām aupalambhikānām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām dāna mayam puṇya abhisaṃskāra skandham abhibhavati yathā api nāma prajñāpāramitā upāya kauśalya parigṛhīta tvāt asya mahā pariṇāmasya
translated: in which the heap of merit that is the creation of merit from generosity of those bodhisattva great beings who have an object surpasses that, because of the great transformation, which is embraced by the perfection of wisdom and skillful means.”

original: evamanyebhyo'pi devanikāyebhyo devaputrā āgatya bhagavantaṃ parameṇa satkāreṇa parameṇa gurukāreṇa paramayā mānanayā paramayā pūjanayā paramayā arcanayā paramayā apacāyanayā satkṛtya gurukṛtya mānayitvā pūjayitvā arcayitvā apacāyya evameva śabdamudīrayanti sma /
analyzed: evam anyebhyaḥ api devanikāyebhyaḥ deva putrāḥ āgatya bhagavantam parameṇa satkāreṇa parameṇa gurukāreṇa paramayā mānanayā paramayā pūjanayā paramayā arcanayā paramayā apacāyanayā satkṛtya gurukṛtya mānayitvā pūjayitvā arcayitvā apacāyya evam eva śabdam udīrayanti sma
translated: In the same way, gods from other groups of gods also came, and after having honored the Lord with the highest worship, the highest service, the highest respect, the highest praise, the highest honor, and the highest reverence, and after having revered him, they also uttered these words:

analyzed: ghoṣam anuśrāvayanti sma
translated: and they made the sound of this proclamation:

analyzed: evam peyālena kartavyam
translated: This should be done in the same way with the rest.

original: yāmāstuṣitā nirmāṇaratayaḥ paranirmitavaśavartino brahmakāyikā brahmapurohitā brahmapārṣadyā mahābrahmāṇaḥ parīttābhā apramāṇābhā ābhāsvarāḥ parīttaśubhā apramāṇaśubhāḥ śubhakṛtsnā anabhrakāḥ puṇyaprasavā bṛhatphalā asaṃjñisattvā abṛhā atapāḥ sudṛśāḥ sudarśanā akaniṣṭhāśca devāḥ /
analyzed: yāmāḥ tuṣitāḥ nirmāṇaratayaḥ paranirmitavaśavartinaḥ brahmakāyikāḥ brahmapurohitāḥ brahmapārṣadyāḥ mahābrahmāṇaḥ parīttābhāḥ apramāṇābhāḥ ābhāsvarāḥ parīttaśubhāḥ apramāṇaśubhāḥ śubhakṛtsnāḥ anabhrakāḥ puṇyaprasavāḥ bṛhatphalāḥ asaṃjñisattvāḥ abṛhāḥ atapāḥ sudṛśāḥ sudarśanāḥ akaniṣṭhāḥ ca devāḥ
translated: The Yāma gods, Tuṣita gods, Nirmāṇarati gods, Paranirmitavaśavartin gods, Brahmakāyika gods, Brahmapurohita gods, Brahmapārṣadya gods, Mahābrahmā gods, Parīttābha gods, Apramāṇābha gods, Ābhāsvara gods, Parīttaśubha gods, Apramāṇaśubha gods, Śubhakṛtsna gods, Anabhraka gods, Puṇyaprasava gods, Bṛhatphala gods, Asaṃjñisattva gods, Avṛha gods, Atapa gods, Sudṛśa gods, Sudarśana gods, and Akaniṣṭha gods.

original: te'pyevamevāñjaliṃ kṛtvā bhagavantaṃ namasyanta etadavocanāścaryaṃ bhagavan yāvadayaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ prajñāpāramitopāyakauśalyaparigṛhītānāṃ
analyzed: te api evam eva añjalim kṛtvā bhagavantam namasyantaḥ etat avocan āścaryam bhagavan yāvat ayam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām prajñāpāramitā upāya kauśalya parigṛhītānām
translated: They too, having made such a gesture, bowed to the Blessed One and said this: It is wonderful, Blessed One, how much this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings, who are taken hold of by skill in means,

original: yasteṣāmupalambhasaṃjñināṃ bodhisattvānāṃ tāvaccirarātrasaṃcitamamapi tathā mahāvistarasamudānītamapi puṇyaskandhamabhibhavati //
analyzed: yaḥ teṣām upalambha saṃjñinām bodhisattvānām tāvat cira rātra saṃcitamam api tathā mahā vistara samudānītam api puṇya skandham abhibhavati
translated: surpasses the heap of merit of those bodhisattvas who have the notion of an object, which has been accumulated for a long time and is so very vast.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstān śuddhāvāsakāyikān devaputrānādīn kṛtvā sarvāṃstān devaputrānāmantrayate smatiṣṭhatu khalu punardevaputrā gaṅgānadīvālukopameṣu trisāhasramahāsāhasreṣu lokadhātuṣu sarvasattvānāmanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃprasthitānāmanuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ pratilambhāya dānaṃ dadatāṃ puṇyābhisaṃskāraḥ anena paryāyeṇa /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tān śuddhāvāsa kāyikān deva putrān ādīn kṛtvā sarvān tān deva putrān āmantrayate sma tiṣṭhatu khalu punar deva putrāḥ gaṅgā nadī vālukā upameṣu tri sāhasra mahā sāhasreṣu lokadhātuṣu sarva sattvānām anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃprasthitānām anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ pratilambhāya dānam dadatām puṇya abhisaṃskāraḥ anena paryāyeṇa
translated: Then the Blessed One, taking the lead of those gods of the Pure Abodes, addressed all those gods, saying: Let it be, gods, that the merit of all beings in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, who have set out for supreme perfect enlightenment and are giving gifts for the attainment of supreme perfect enlightenment, be multiplied by a hundred.

original: ye'pi te devaputrā anyeṣvanyeṣu gaṅgānadīvālukopameṣu trisāhasramahāsāhasreṣu lokadhātuṣu sattvāḥ /
analyzed: ye api te deva putrāḥ anyeṣu anyeṣu gaṅgā nadī vālukā upameṣu tri sāhasra mahā sāhasreṣu lokadhātuṣu sattvāḥ
translated: And let it be, gods, that the merit of all beings in other world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River,

original: te'pi sarve anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau praṇidhānaṃ kṛtvā bodhāya cittamutpādya anyeṣvanyeṣu gaṅgānadīvālukopameṣu trisāhasramahāsāhasreṣu lokadhātuṣu sarvasattvānāṃ cīvarapiṇḍapātaśayanāsanaglānapratyayabhaiṣajyapariṣkāraiḥ sarvasukhopadhānaiḥ sarvaiḥ sukhasparśavihārairekaiko bodhisattvo gaṅgānadīvālukopamān kalpāṃstiṣṭhan dānaṃ dadyāt /
analyzed: te api sarve anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau praṇidhānam kṛtvā bodhāya cittam utpādya anyeṣu anyeṣu gaṅgā nadī vālukā upameṣu tri sāhasra mahā sāhasreṣu lokadhātuṣu sarva sattvānām cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkāraiḥ sarva sukhopadhānaiḥ sarvaiḥ sukha sparśa vihāraiḥ ekaikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamān kalpān tiṣṭhan dānam dadyāt
translated: All of them, having made the aspiration for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, having generated the mind of enlightenment, in other and other trichiliochosmies as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, with robes, alms-food, bedding, seats, and medicines for curing the sick, with all the requisites for comfort, with all the pleasant objects of touch, each bodhisattva would stand for eons as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, giving gifts.

original: evaṃ sarve'pi yāvatte copalambhasaṃjñino dānaṃ dadyuḥ /
analyzed: evam sarve api yāvat te ca upalambha saṃjñinaḥ dānam dadyuḥ
translated: In the same way, all of them, up to those with the perception of objects, would give gifts.

original: etena paryāyeṇa tān sarvasattvānekaikaṃ parikalpya tāṃśca sarvabodhisattvānekaiko bodhisattvo yāvatsarve te bodhisattvā gaṅgānadīvālukopamān kalpāṃstiṣṭhantastān sarvasattvāṃścīvarapiṇḍapātaśayanāsanaglānapratyayabhaiṣajyapariṣkāraiḥ sarvasukhopadhānaiḥ sarvaiḥ sukhasparśavihārairupatiṣṭheyuḥ /
analyzed: etena paryāyeṇa tān sarva sattvān ekaikam parikalpya tān ca sarva bodhisattvān ekaikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ yāvat sarve te bodhisattvāḥ gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamān kalpān tiṣṭhantaḥ tān sarva sattvān cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkāraiḥ sarva sukhopadhānaiḥ sarvaiḥ sukha sparśa vihāraiḥ upatiṣṭheyuḥ
translated: By this method, having considered each of those beings, and having considered all those bodhisattvas, each bodhisattva, up to all those bodhisattvas, standing for eons as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, would serve those beings with robes, alms-food, bedding, seats, and medicines for curing the sick, with all the requisites for comfort, with all the pleasant objects of touch.

analyzed: tat ca dānam upalambha saṃjñinaḥ dadyuḥ
translated: And they would give that gift with the perception of a real object.

original: yaśca bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitopāyakauśalyaparigṛhīto'tītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ śīlaskandhaṃ samādhiskandhaṃ prajñāskandhaṃ vimuktiskandhaṃ vimuktijñānadarśanaskandhaṃ teṣāṃ ca bodhisattvapratyekabuddhaśrāvakayānikānāṃ pudgalānāṃ yaiśca tatra anyairapi sattvaiḥ kuśalamūlānyavaropitānyavaropayiṣyante'varopyante ca /
analyzed: yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitā upāya kauśalya parigṛhīta utīta anāgata pratyutpannānām buddhānām bhagavatām śīla skandham samādhi skandham prajñā skandham vimukti skandham vimukti jñāna darśana skandham teṣām ca bodhisattva pratyekabuddha śrāvaka yānikānām pudgalānām yaiḥ ca tatra anyaiḥ api sattvaiḥ kuśala mūlāni avaropitāni avaropayiṣyante varopyante ca
translated: And that bodhisattva mahāsattva, embraced by the perfection of wisdom and skillful means, rejoices in all the morality aggregates, concentration aggregates, wisdom aggregates, liberation aggregates, and knowledge and vision of liberation aggregates of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, of the past, future, and present, and of those individuals belonging to the Bodhisattva Vehicle, the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle, and the Śrāvaka Vehicle, and of those other beings who have planted wholesome roots there, who will plant, and who are planting.

original: tatsarvamekato'bhisaṃkṣipya piṇḍayitvā tulayitvā niravaśeṣya niravaśeṣamagrayā anumodanayā anumodate /
analyzed: tat sarvam ekatas abhisaṃkṣipya piṇḍayitvā tulayitvā niravaśeṣya niravaśeṣam agrayā anumodanayā anumodate
translated: Having collected all that together into one, having combined it, having weighed it, having left nothing out, he rejoices in it with the foremost rejoicing.

original: śreṣṭhayā jyeṣṭhayā varayā pravarayā praṇītayā uttamayā anuttamayā niruttamayā uttarottarayā asamayā asamasamayā apratisamayā acintyayā anumodanayā anumodate /
analyzed: śreṣṭhayā jyeṣṭhayā varayā pravarayā praṇītayā uttamayā anuttamayā niruttamayā uttarottarayā asamayā asamasamayā apratisamayā acintyayā anumodanayā anumodate
translated: He rejoices in it with the best, the highest, the most excellent, the supreme, the foremost, the unequalled, the unequaled, the incomparable, the inconceivable rejoicing.

original: anumodya anumodanāsahagataṃ puṇyakriyāvastu anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayatianuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodherāhārakaṃ bhavatviti /
analyzed: anumodya anumodanā sahagatam puṇya kriyā vastu anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayati anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ āhārakam bhavatu iti
translated: Having rejoiced, he dedicates the wholesome action associated with rejoicing to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, thinking, May it contribute to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: asyānumodanāpariṇāmanāsahagatasya puṇyakriyāvastunaḥ so'pi paurvaka aupalambhikānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ puṇyābhisaṃskāraḥ śatatamīmapi kalāṃ nopaiti /
analyzed: asya anumodanā pariṇāmanā sahagatasya puṇya kriyā vastunaḥ saḥ api paurvaka aupalambhikānām bodhisattvānām puṇya abhisaṃskāraḥ śatatamīm api kalām na upaiti
translated: Compared to the wholesome action associated with this rejoicing and dedication, that previous wholesome action of the bodhisattvas who practice with reference points does not reach even a hundredth part.

original: sahasratamīmapi śatasahasratamīmapi koṭītamīmapi koṭīśatatamīmapi koṭīsahasratamīmapi koṭīśatasahasratamīmapi koṭīniyutaśatasahasratamīmapi kalāṃ nopaiti /
analyzed: sahasratamīm api śata sahasratamīm api koṭītamīm api koṭī śatatamīm api koṭī sahasratamīm api koṭī śata sahasratamīm api koṭī niyuta śata sahasratamīm api kalām na upaiti
translated: It does not reach even a thousandth, a hundred thousandth, a koṭi-th, a koṭi-hundredth, a koṭi-thousandth, a koṭi-hundred-thousandth, a koṭi-nayu-hundred-thousandth part.

original: saṃkhyāmapi kalāmapi gaṇanāmapi upamāmapi aupamyamapi upanisāmapi upaniṣadamapi na kṣamate /
analyzed: saṃkhyām api kalām api gaṇanām api upamām api aupamyam api upanisām api upaniṣadam api na kṣamate
translated: It cannot bear comparison, counting, reckoning, simile, or example.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi te bodhisattvāḥ sarve'pyupalambhasaṃjñino dānaṃ dadati //
analyzed: tathā hi te bodhisattvāḥ sarve api upalambha saṃjñinaḥ dānam dadati
translated: Because those bodhisattvas, all of them, give gifts with the perception of reference points.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān subhūtirbhagavantametadavocatyadbhagavānevamāhaatītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ sarveṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ bodhisattvapratyekabuddhaśrāvakasaṃghānāṃ sarvasattvānāṃ ca atītānāgatapratyutpannaṃ yannāma kuśalamūlaṃ tatsarvamekato'bhisaṃkṣipya piṇḍayitvā tulayitvā niravaśeṣya niravaśeṣamanumodate agrayā anumodanayā /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat yat bhagavān evam āha atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām sarveṣām buddhānām bhagavatām bodhisattva pratyekabuddha śrāvaka saṃghānām sarva sattvānām ca atīta anāgata pratyutpannam yat nāma kuśala mūlam tat sarvam ekatas abhisaṃkṣipya piṇḍayitvā tulayitvā niravaśeṣya niravaśeṣam anumodate agrayā anumodanayā
translated: Then the venerable Subhuti said to the Lord: The Lord has said: 'The past, future, and present Buddhas, the Bodhisattvas, the Pratyekabuddhas, the Arhats, and all beings, whatever wholesome roots they have, all that one should bring together, collect, and heap up, and rejoice in it with the best rejoicing.'

original: śreṣṭhayā jyeṣṭhayā varayā pravarayā praṇītayā uttamayā anuttamayā niruttamayā uttarottarayā asamayā asamasamayā apratisamayā acintyayā anumodate iti /
analyzed: śreṣṭhayā jyeṣṭhayā varayā pravarayā praṇītayā uttamayā anuttamayā niruttamayā uttarottarayā asamayā asamasamayā apratisamayā acintyayā anumodate iti
translated: He rejoices in it with the best, the foremost, the highest, the most excellent, the unequalled, the unequaled, the incomparable, the inconceivable rejoicing.

analyzed: tatra kiyatā bhagavan agrā anumodanā bhavati
translated: There, Lord, how is the best rejoicing?

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocatyadi subhūte bodhisattvayānikaḥ pudgalo'tītāgatapratyutpannān gṛhṇīte na manyate nopalabhate na kalpayati na vikalpayati na paśyati na samanupaśyati /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat yadi subhūte bodhisattva yānikaḥ pudgala utīta āgata pratyutpannān gṛhṇīte na manyate na upalabhate na kalpayati na vikalpayati na paśyati na samanupaśyati
translated: When this had been said, the Lord said to the venerable Subhuti: If, Subhuti, a person belonging to the vehicle of the Bodhisattvas takes hold of the past, future, and present dharmas, does not imagine them, does not apprehend them, does not construct them, does not discriminate them, does not see them, does not review them,

analyzed: evam ca enān dharmān upaparīkṣate sarva dharmāḥ
translated: and if he reviews these dharmas in this way: 'All dharmas are imagined by conceptualization,

analyzed: a jātāḥ a nirjātāḥ anāgatikāḥ agatikāḥ
translated: unborn, not come forth, not passed on, not come, not gone,

original: nātra kaściddharma utpanno nāpi kaściddharma utpatsyate nāpi kaściddharma utpadyate /
analyzed: na atra kaścid dharmaḥ utpannaḥ na api kaścid dharmaḥ utpatsyate na api kaścid dharmaḥ utpadyate
translated: in this there is no dharma that has originated, nor will there be any dharma that originates, nor is there any dharma that originates;

original: nāpi kaściddharmo niruddho nāpi kaściddharmo nirutsyate nāpi kaściddharmo nirudhyate /
analyzed: nā api kaścid dharmaḥ niruddhaḥ nā api kaścid dharmaḥ nirutsyate nā api kaścid dharmaḥ nirudhyate
translated: nor is there any dharma that has ceased, nor will there be any dharma that will cease, nor is there any dharma that ceases;

original: ityevametān dharmānupaparīkṣya yathaiṣāṃ dharmāṇāṃ dharmatā tathānumodate /
analyzed: iti evam etān dharmān upaparīkṣya yathā eṣām dharmāṇām dharma tā tathā anumodate
translated: having reviewed these dharmas in this way, he approves of them in accordance with the true nature of these dharmas.

analyzed: anumodya tathā eva pariṇāmayati anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Having approved, he thus turns them over to full enlightenment.

original: iyatā subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya agrā anumodanā bhavati /
analyzed: iyatā subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya agrā anumodanā bhavati
translated: To this extent, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, has the foremost rejoicing.

original: asya subhūte kuśalamūlapariṇāmasya teṣāṃ paurvakāṇāṃ bodhisattvānāmupalambhasaṃjñināmupalambhadṛṣṭikāṇāṃ taddānamayaṃ puṇyakriyāvastu śatatamīmapi kalāṃ nopaiti /
analyzed: asya subhūte kuśala mūla pariṇāmasya teṣām paurvakāṇām bodhisattvānām upalambha saṃjñinām upalambha dṛṣṭikāṇām tat dāna mayam puṇya kriyā vastu śatatamīm api kalām na upaiti
translated: Subhuti, this transformation of the roots of virtue of those previous bodhisattvas who had the notion of an object and the view of an object, that gift-based meritorious action does not reach even a hundredth part of this.

original: sahasratamīmapi śatasahasratamīmapi koṭītamīmapi koṭīśatatamīmapi koṭīsahasratamīmapi koṭīśatasahasratamīmapi koṭīniyutaśatasahasratamīmapi kalāṃ nopaiti /
analyzed: sahasratamīm api śata sahasratamīm api koṭītamīm api koṭī śatatamīm api koṭī sahasratamīm api koṭī śata sahasratamīm api koṭī niyuta śata sahasratamīm api kalām na upaiti
translated: It does not reach even a thousandth, a hundred thousandth, a koṭi-th, a koṭi-hundred-th, a koṭi-thousand-th, a koṭi-hundred-thousand-th, a koṭi-lakṣa-hundred-thousand-th part.

original: saṃkhyāmapi kalāmapi gaṇanāmapi upamāmapi aupamyamapi upanisāmapi upaniṣadamapi na kṣamate //
analyzed: saṃkhyām api kalām api gaṇanām api upamām api aupamyam api upanisām api upaniṣadam api na kṣamate
translated: It cannot bear even a fraction, a number, a calculation, a comparison, a similitude, a resemblance, a basis, or a basis of comparison.

original: punaraparaṃ subhūte bodhisattvayānikena pudgalena atītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ sarveṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ dānamanumoditukāmena śīlamanumoditukāmena kṣāntimanumoditukāmena vīryamanumoditukāmena dhyānamanumoditukāmena prajñāmanumoditakāmena evamanumoditavyamyathā vimuktistathā dānam /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte bodhisattva yānikena pudgalena atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām sarveṣām buddhānām bhagavatām dānam anumoditu kāmena śīlam anumoditu kāmena kṣāntim anumoditu kāmena vīryam anumoditu kāmena dhyānam anumoditu kāmena prajñām anumodita kāmena evam anumoditavyam yathā vimuktiḥ tathā dānam
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, a person belonging to the bodhisattva-vehicle who wishes to rejoice in the gifts of all the Buddhas, Blessed Ones, of the past, future, and present, who wishes to rejoice in their morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom, should rejoice thus: 'Just as there is liberation, so is the gift.'

original: yathā vimuktistathā śīlaṃ /🔽yathā vimuktistathā kṣāntiḥ /🔽yathā vimuktistathā vīryam /
analyzed: yathā vimuktiḥ tathā śīlam  yathā vimuktiḥ tathā kṣāntiḥ  yathā vimuktiḥ tathā vīryam
translated: As is liberation, so is morality.🔽As is liberation, so is patience.🔽As is liberation, so is vigor.

analyzed: yathā vimuktiḥ tathā dhyānam  yathā vimuktiḥ tathā prajñā
translated: As is liberation, so is meditation.🔽As is liberation, so is wisdom.

analyzed: yathā vimuktiḥ tathā vimukti jñāna darśanam  yathā vimuktiḥ tathā anumodanā
translated: As is liberation, so is the knowledge and vision of liberation.🔽As is liberation, so is rejoicing.

analyzed: yathā vimuktiḥ tathā anumodanā sahagatam puṇya kriyā vastu
translated: As is liberation, so is the wholesome action of rejoicing.

analyzed: yathā vimuktiḥ tathā pariṇāmanā
translated: As is liberation, so is dedication.

analyzed: yathā vimuktiḥ tathā buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ pratyekabuddhāḥ ca
translated: As is liberation, so are the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, and the Pratyekabuddhas.

original: yathā vimuktistathā teṣāṃ śrāvakā ye parinirvṛtāḥ /🔽yathā vimuktistathā te dharmā ye'tītā niruddhāḥ /🔽yathā vimuktistathā te dharmā ye'nāgatā anutpannāḥ /
analyzed: yathā vimuktiḥ tathā teṣām śrāvakāḥ ye parinirvṛtāḥ  yathā vimuktiḥ tathā te dharmāḥ yā iti itāḥ niruddhāḥ  yathā vimuktiḥ tathā te dharmāḥ yena āgatāḥ anutpannāḥ
translated: As is liberation, so are their disciples who have attained final nirvana.🔽As is liberation, so are those dharmas that have passed away and ceased.🔽As is liberation, so are those dharmas that are future and have not yet arisen.

original: yathā vimuktistathā te dharmā ye etarhi pratyutpannā vartamānāḥ /
analyzed: yathā vimuktiḥ tathā te dharmāḥ ye etarhi pratyutpannāḥ vartamānāḥ
translated: As is liberation, so are those dharmas that are present and occurring right now.

original: yathā vimuktistathā te'tītā buddhā bhagavantasteṣāṃ ca śrāvakāḥ /
analyzed: yathā vimuktiḥ tathā buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ teṣām ca śrāvakāḥ
translated: As is liberation, so are those past Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, and their disciples.

original: yathā vimuktistathā te'nāgatā buddhā bhagavantasteṣāṃ ca śrāvakāḥ /
analyzed: yathā vimuktiḥ tathā tena āgatāḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ teṣām ca śrāvakāḥ
translated: As is liberation, so are those future Buddhas, Blessed Ones, and their disciples.

original: yathā vimuktistathā te pratyutpannā buddhā bhagavantasteṣāṃ ca śrāvakāḥ /
analyzed: yathā vimuktiḥ tathā te pratyutpannāḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ teṣām ca śrāvakāḥ
translated: As is liberation, so are those present Buddhas, Blessed Ones, and their disciples.

original: ye etarhyaprameyeṣvasaṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣu tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti /
analyzed: ye etarhi aprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣu tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti
translated: Who are now dwelling, maintaining themselves, and teaching the Dharma in immeasurable and incalculable world systems.

analyzed: yathā vimuktiḥ tathā atīta anāgata pratyutpannāḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ
translated: As is liberation, so are the past, future, and present Buddhas, Blessed Ones.

analyzed: evam eteṣām dharmāṇām abaddhānām amuktānām asaktānām yā dharma tā
translated: Thus, of these unattached, unbound, and unfettered dharmas,

analyzed: tām anuttarayā anumodanayā anumode
translated: I rejoice in their true nature with unsurpassed rejoicing.

original: anumodya anumodanāsahagataṃ puṇyakriyāvastu anuttarāya samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayāmi apariṇāmanāyogena asaṃkrāntito'viṃnāśata iti /
analyzed: anumodya anumodanā sahagatam puṇya kriyā vastu anuttarāya samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayāmi a pariṇāmanā yogena iti
translated: Having rejoiced, I dedicate the wholesome action associated with rejoicing to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, by the method of non-dedication, without transferring [the merit] and without destroying [it].

original: iyatā subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya agrā anumodanā bhavati /
analyzed: iyatā subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya agrā anumodanā bhavati
translated: To this extent, Subhūti, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva's foremost rejoicing becomes [the foremost].

original: tiṣṭhantu khalu punaḥ subhūte te'pi ye'nyeṣvanyeṣu gaṅgānadīvālukopameṣu trisāhasramahāsāhasreṣu lokadhātuṣu sarvasattvā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau
analyzed: tiṣṭhantu khalu punar subhūte te api gaṅgā nadī vālukā upameṣu tri sāhasra mahā sāhasreṣu lokadhātuṣu sarva sattvāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Let alone those beings in other world systems, in other world systems, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, in the great trichiliocosm, who have set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau saṃprasthāya anyeṣvanyeṣu gaṅgānadīvālukopameṣu trisāhasramahāsāhasreṣu lokadhātuṣu sarvasattvānāṃ bodhāya cittamutpādya sarve'pyekaiko bodhisattvaḥ ekaikasmai bodhisattvāya gaṅgānadīvālukopamān kalpāṃstiṣṭhan dānaṃ dadyādupalambhasaṃjñī cīvarapiṇḍapātaśayanāsanaglānapratyayabhaiṣajyapariṣkāraiḥ sarvasukhopadhānaiḥ sarvasukhasparśavihārairupatiṣṭhan /
analyzed: anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau saṃprasthāya anyeṣu anyeṣu gaṅgā nadī vālukā upameṣu tri sāhasra mahā sāhasreṣu lokadhātuṣu sarva sattvānām bodhāya cittam utpādya sarve api ekaikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ ekaikasmai bodhisattvāya gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamān kalpān tiṣṭhan dānam dadyāt upalambha saṃjñī cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkāraiḥ sarva sukha upadhānaiḥ sarva sukha sparśa vihāraiḥ upatiṣṭhan
translated: and let alone those beings in other world systems, in other world systems, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, in the great trichiliocosm, who have generated the thought of awakening and are bodhisattvas, and let alone all those bodhisattvas, each one of whom, for eons as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, would stand, giving gifts, perceiving objects, and attending with robes, alms-food, bedding, seats, remedies for exhaustion, and medicinal herbs, with all the requisites for comfort, with all the pleasant sensations of living,

original: anena paryāyeṇa sarve'pi te sarvebhya upatiṣṭhantaḥ upalambhasaṃjñino dānaṃ dadyuḥ /
analyzed: anena paryāyeṇa sarve api te sarvebhyaḥ upatiṣṭhantaḥ upalambha saṃjñinaḥ dānam dadyuḥ
translated: and let alone all of them, attending to all of them in this way, giving gifts with the perception of objects,

original: ye subhūte gaṅgānadīvālukopameṣu trisāhasramahāsāhasreṣu lokadhātuṣu sattvāḥ /
analyzed: ye subhūte gaṅgā nadī vālukā upameṣu tri sāhasra mahā sāhasreṣu lokadhātuṣu sattvāḥ
translated: those beings, Subhūti, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, in the great trichiliocosm,

analyzed: te sarve anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃpratiṣṭheran
translated: All of them would be established in unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃprasthāya gaṅgānadīvālukopamān kalpān kāyasucaritaṃ vāksucaritaṃ manaḥsucaritamupalambhasaṃjñinaḥ śīlaṃ samādāya varteran /
analyzed: anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃprasthāya gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamān kalpān kāya su caritam vāc su caritam manaḥ su caritam upalambha saṃjñinaḥ śīlam samādāya varteran
translated: Having set out for unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, for eons equal to the number of grains of sand in the Ganges River, they would practice good conduct with body, speech, and mind, upholding the precepts with the perception of objects.

original: anena paryāyeṇa sarve'pi te bodhisattvā ekaiko bodhisattvo gaṅgānadīvālukopamān kalpāṃstiṣṭhan gaṅgānadīvālukopamān kalpān kāyasucaritaṃ vāksucaritaṃ manaḥsucaritamupalambhasaṃjñī śīlaṃ samādāya varteta /
analyzed: anena paryāyeṇa sarve api te bodhisattvāḥ ekaikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamān kalpān tiṣṭhan gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamān kalpān kāya su caritam vāc su caritam manaḥ su caritam upalambha saṃjñī śīlam samādāya varteta
translated: In this way, all those bodhisattvas, each bodhisattva staying for eons equal to the number of grains of sand in the Ganges River, practicing good conduct with body, speech, and mind for eons equal to the number of grains of sand in the Ganges River, would uphold the precepts with the perception of objects.

original: etena paryāyeṇa sarve'pi te bodhisattvā upalambhasaṃjñinaḥ śīlaṃ samādāya varteran /
analyzed: etena paryāyeṇa sarve api te bodhisattvāḥ upalambha saṃjñinaḥ śīlam samādāya varteran
translated: In this way, all those bodhisattvas would uphold the precepts with the perception of objects.

original: yaśca bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitopāyakauśalyaparigṛhīto'tītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ śīlasamādhiprajñāvimuktivimuktijñānadarśanaskandhāṃsteṣāṃ ca pratyekabuddhānāṃ śīlasamādhiprajñāvimuktijñānadarśanaskandhāṃsteṣāṃ ca śrāvakāṇāṃ śīlasamādhiprajñāvimuktivimuktijñānadarśanaskandhān sarvasattvānāṃ ca atītānāgatapratyutpannaṃ kuśalamūlaṃ sarvamekato'bhisaṃkṣipya piṇḍayitvā tulayitvā niravaśeṣya niravaśeṣamanumodate'grayā anumodanayā /
analyzed: yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitā upāya kauśalya parigṛhīta utīta anāgata pratyutpannānām buddhānām bhagavatām śīla samādhi prajñā vimukti vimukti jñāna darśana skandhān teṣām ca pratyekabuddhānām śīla samādhi prajñā vimukti jñāna darśana skandhān teṣām ca śrāvakāṇām śīla samādhi prajñā vimukti vimukti jñāna darśana skandhān sarva sattvānām ca atīta anāgata pratyutpannam kuśala mūlam sarvam ekatas abhisaṃkṣipya piṇḍa
translated: And the bodhisattva mahāsattva who, endowed with the perfection of wisdom and skillful means, rejoices in all the aggregates of morality, concentration, wisdom, liberation, and the knowledge and vision of liberation of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, of the past, future, and present, and in the aggregates of morality, concentration, wisdom, liberation, and the knowledge and vision of liberation of those Pratyekabuddhas and Śrāvakas, and in the roots of virtue of all beings, past, future, and present, having combined and collected them all together, having weighed them, having left nothing out, rejoices in them with the highest rejoicing,

original: śreṣṭhayā jyeṣṭhayā varayā pravarayā praṇītayā uttamayā anuttamayā niruttamayā uttarottarayā asamayā asamasamayā apratisamayā acintayā anumodanayā anumodate /
analyzed: śreṣṭhayā jyeṣṭhayā varayā pravarayā praṇītayā uttamayā anuttamayā niruttamayā uttarottarayā asamayā asamasamayā apratisamayā acintayā anumodanayā anumodate
translated: with the best, the foremost, the most excellent, the most sublime, the supreme, the unsurpassed, the unequalled, the unequaled, the incomparable, the inconceivable rejoicing.

original: anumodya anumodanāsahagataṃ puṇyakriyāvastu anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayati /
analyzed: anumodya anumodanā sahagatam puṇya kriyā vastu anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayati
translated: Having rejoiced, he dedicates the wholesome action associated with rejoicing to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: asya subhūte anumodanāsahagatasya puṇyakriyāvastuno'sau paurvaka aupalambhikānāṃ bodhisattvāna śīlamayaḥ puṇyābhisaṃskāraḥ śatatamīmapi kalāṃ🔽sahasratamīmapi śatasahasratamīmapi koṭītamīmapi koṭīśatatamīmapi koṭīsahasratamīmapi koṭīśatasahasratamīmapi koṭīniyutaśatasahasratamīmapi kalāṃ nopaiti /
analyzed: asya subhūte anumodanā sahagatasya puṇya kriyā vastunā usau paurvaka aupalambhikānām bodhisattvāna śīla mayaḥ puṇya abhisaṃskāraḥ śatatamīm api kalām  sahasratamīm api śata sahasratamīm api koṭītamīm api koṭī śatatamīm api koṭī sahasratamīm api koṭī śata sahasratamīm api koṭī niyuta śata sahasratamīm api kalām na upaiti
translated: Subhūti, compared to that wholesome action associated with rejoicing, that wholesome action of the bodhisattvas who practice with reference points, consisting of morality,🔽does not reach even a hundredth part, does not reach even a thousandth part, does not reach even a hundred thousandth part, does not reach even a koṭi-th part, does not reach even a koṭi-hundredth part, does not reach even a koṭi-thousandth part, does not reach even a koṭi-hundred-thousandth part, does not reach even a koṭi-nayuta-hundred-thousandth part.

original: saṃkhyāmapi kalāmapi gaṇanāmapi upamāmapi aupamyamapi upanisāmapi upaniṣadamapi na kṣamate /
analyzed: saṃkhyām api kalām api gaṇanām api upamām api aupamyam api upanisām api upaniṣadam api na kṣamate
translated: It cannot bear even a fraction, even a hundredth, even a thousandth, even a hundred thousandth, even a koṭi-th, even a koṭi-hundredth, even a koṭi-thousandth, even a koṭi-hundred-thousandth, even a koṭi-nayuta-hundred-thousandth part.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is it so?

original: tathā hi te bodhisattvā upalambhasaṃjñinaḥ śīlaṃ samādāya vartanta iti /
analyzed: tathā hi te bodhisattvāḥ upalambha saṃjñinaḥ śīlam samādāya vartante iti
translated: Because those bodhisattvas, perceiving with reference points, undertake and abide in morality.

original: tiṣṭhantu khalu punaḥ subhūte gaṅgānadīvālukopameṣu trisāhasramahāsāhasreṣu lokadhātuṣu sarvasattvā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃprasthitāḥ /
analyzed: tiṣṭhantu khalu punar subhūte gaṅgā nadī vālukā upameṣu tri sāhasra mahā sāhasreṣu lokadhātuṣu sarva sattvāḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃprasthitāḥ
translated: Let alone, Subhūti, all beings in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River in the great trichiliocosm who have set out for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

original: anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃprasthāya gaṅgānadīvālukopamān kalpān kāyasucaritaṃ vāksucaritaṃ manaḥsucaritaṃ śīlaṃ samādāya vartamānā upalambhasaṃjñinaḥ /
analyzed: anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃprasthāya gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamān kalpān kāya su caritam vāc su caritam manaḥ su caritam śīlam samādāya vartamānāḥ upalambha saṃjñinaḥ
translated: and having set out for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, for eons as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, having taken up and practiced the good conduct of body, speech, and mind, and the precepts, with the perception of grasping.

original: ye subhūte gaṅgānadīvālukopameṣu trisāhasramahāsāhasreṣu lokadhātuṣu sattvāḥ /
analyzed: ye subhūte gaṅgā nadī vālukā upameṣu tri sāhasra mahā sāhasreṣu lokadhātuṣu sattvāḥ
translated: Those beings, Subhūti, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River in the great trichiliocosm,

analyzed: te sarve anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃpratiṣṭheran
translated: all of them would be established in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃprasthāya gaṅgānadīvālukopamān kalpāṃstiṣṭhanto'nyeṣvanyeṣu gaṅgānadīvālukopameṣu trisāhasramahāsāhasreṣu lokadhātuṣu sarvairekaiko bodhisattva ākruṣṭo'bhihataḥ paribhāṣitaḥ samāna eva /
analyzed: anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃprasthāya gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamān kalpān tiṣṭhantaḥ anyeṣu anyeṣu gaṅgā nadī vālukā upameṣu tri sāhasra mahā sāhasreṣu lokadhātuṣu sarvaiḥ ekaikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ ākruṣṭaḥ abhihataḥ paribhāṣitaḥ samānaḥ eva
translated: Having set out for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, standing for eons as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River in other great trichiliocosms as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, each and every bodhisattva would be reviled, struck, and abused by all.

original: sarve'pi te upalambhasaṃjñinaḥ kṣāntiṃ samādāya varteran /
analyzed: sarve api te upalambha saṃjñinaḥ kṣāntim samādāya varteran
translated: All of them would have the notion of objects and would practice patience.

original: yāvatsarve te bodhisattvāḥ kṣāntiṃ samādāya vartamānāḥ /
analyzed: yāvat sarve te bodhisattvāḥ kṣāntim samādāya vartamānāḥ
translated: As long as all those bodhisattvas, practicing patience,

original: etena paryāyeṇa sarve te bodhisattvā ekaiko bodhisattvo gaṅgānadīvālukopamān kalpāṃstiṣṭhan gaṅgānadīvālukopamān kalpānanyeṣvanyeṣu gaṅgānadīvālukopameṣu trisāhasramahāsāhasreṣu lokadhātuṣu sarvairākruṣṭo'bhihataḥ paribhāṣitaḥ samānaḥ upalambhasaṃjñī kṣāntiṃ samādāya varteta /
analyzed: etena paryāyeṇa sarve te bodhisattvāḥ ekaikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamān kalpān tiṣṭhan gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamān kalpān anyeṣu anyeṣu gaṅgā nadī vālukā upameṣu tri sāhasra mahā sāhasreṣu lokadhātuṣu sarvaiḥ ākruṣṭaḥ abhihataḥ paribhāṣitaḥ samānaḥ upalambha saṃjñī kṣāntim samādāya varteta

translated: Thus all of them, being reviled, struck, and abused by all, would practice patience with the notion of objects.

translated: And that bodhisattva mahāsattva who is endowed with this perfection of wisdom and skillful means, having combined, collected, weighed, and brought together all the wholesome roots of the past, future, and present Buddhas, Blessed Ones, in the aggregate of morality, the aggregate of concentration, the aggregate of wisdom, the aggregate of liberation, and the aggregate of the knowledge and vision of liberation, and the wholesome roots of those Pratyekabuddhas in the aggregates of morality, concentration, wisdom, liberation, and the knowledge and vision of liberation, and the wholesome roots of those Śrāvakas in the aggregates of morality, concentration, wisdom, liberation, and the knowledge and vision of liberation, and all the wholesome roots of all beings, having combined them all together, having collected them, weighed them, and brought them together without remainder, he rejoices in them without remainder with the foremost rejoicing,

original: śreṣṭhayā jyeṣṭhayā varayā pravarayā praṇītayā uttamayā anuttamayā niruttamayā uttarottarayā asamayā asamasamayā apratisamayā acintayā anumodanayā anumodate /

translated: Subhūti, this merit of rejoicing together does not approach even a hundredth part of the merit of rejoicing of those previous bodhisattvas who had conceptual thoughts and was made up of the four meditations.

original: sahasratamīmapi śatasahasratamīmapi koṭītamīmapi koṭīśatatamīmapi koṭīsahasratamīmapi koṭīśatasahasratamīmapi koṭīniyutaśatasahasratamīmapi kalāṃ nopaiti /
analyzed: sahasratamīm api śata sahasratamīm api koṭītamīm api koṭī śatatamīm api koṭī sahasratamīm api koṭī śata sahasratamīm api koṭī niyuta śata sahasratamīm api kalām na upaiti
translated: It does not approach even a thousandth, a hundred thousandth, a koṭi-th, a koṭi-hundredth, a koṭi-thousandth, a koṭi-hundred-thousandth, a koṭi-nayu-hundred-thousandth part.

original: saṃkhyāmapi kalāmapi gaṇanāmapi upamāmapi aupamyamapi upanisāmapi upaniṣadamapi na kṣamate /
analyzed: saṃkhyām api kalām api gaṇanām api upamām api aupamyam api upanisām api upaniṣadam api na kṣamate
translated: It cannot bear comparison, cannot bear calculation, cannot bear reckoning, cannot bear simile, cannot bear example, cannot bear analogy.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi te bodhisattvā upalambhasaṃjñino dhyānāni samāpadyante iti //
analyzed: tathā hi te bodhisattvāḥ upalambha saṃjñinaḥ dhyānāni samāpadyante iti
translated: Because those bodhisattvas, having conceptual thoughts, enter the meditations.

analyzed: ārya aṣṭasāhasrikāyām prajñāpāramitāyām anumodanāpariṇāmanāparivartaḥ nāma ṣaṣṭhaḥ
translated: In the noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines, the sixth chapter is called Rejoicing and Dedication.

analyzed: niraya parivartaḥ saptamaḥ
translated: Chapter 7: Hell

analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat sarvajña jñāna pariniṣpattiḥ bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is the complete accomplishment of omniscient knowledge.

analyzed: sarvajña tvam bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, omniscience is the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: bhagavān āha evam etat śāriputra
translated: The Blessed One said, So it is, Śāriputra.

analyzed: evam etat yathā vadasi
translated: It is just as you say.

original: śāriputra āhaavabhāsakarī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā /🔽namaskaromi bhagavan prajñāpāramitāyai /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha avabhāsa karī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā  namaskaromi bhagavan prajñāpāramitāyai
translated: Śāriputra said, Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom illuminates.🔽Blessed One, I pay homage to the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: namaskaraṇīyā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is to be paid homage to.

analyzed: an upaliptā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is unstained.

analyzed: sarva loka nirupalepā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is unstained by all worlds.

analyzed: āloka karī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is illuminating.

analyzed: sarva traidhātuka vitimira karī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom removes the darkness of the entire three realms.

analyzed: sarva kleśa dṛṣṭi andhakāra apanetrī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom removes the darkness of all afflictions and views.

analyzed: āśrayaṇīyā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is to be relied upon.

analyzed: agra karī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā bodhi pakṣāṇām dharmāṇām
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is the foremost of the factors of awakening.

analyzed: kṣema karī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom brings security.

analyzed: andhānām sattvānām āloka karī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is a light for beings who are blind.

analyzed: sarva bhaya upadrava prahīṇa āloka karī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is a light that eliminates all fears and calamities.

original: pañcacakṣuḥparigrahaṃ kṛtvā sarvasattvānāṃ mārgadarśayitrī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: pañca cakṣuḥ parigraham kṛtvā sarva sattvānām mārga darśayitrī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is a guide for all beings, having taken up the five eyes.

analyzed: cakṣuḥ bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is the eye.

analyzed: moha tamaḥ timira vikariṇī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is the dispeller of the darkness of delusion and cataracts.

analyzed: sarva dharmāṇām akaraṇī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is the non-maker of all dharmas.

analyzed: utpatha prayātānām sattvānām mārga avatāraṇī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is the guide on the path for beings who have gone astray.

analyzed: sarvajña tā eva bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is omniscience itself.

analyzed: sarva kleśa jñeya āvaraṇa vāsanā anusaṃdhi prahīṇa tām upādāya an utpādikā bhagavan sarva dharmāṇām prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is the non-producer of all dharmas, because of the abandonment of the latent tendencies of the obscurations of afflictions and knowables.

analyzed: a nirodhikā bhagavan sarva dharmāṇām prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is the non-stopper of all dharmas.

analyzed: anutpannā aniruddhā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is unborn and unceasing.

original: svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāmupādāya mātā bhagavan bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatām upādāya mātā bhagavan bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām prajñāpāramitā
translated: The perfection of wisdom, Blessed One, is the mother of the bodhisattva great beings, in terms of the emptiness of specific characteristics.

analyzed: sarva buddha dharma ratna dātṛ tvāt daśa bala karī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: The perfection of wisdom, Blessed One, is the one who gives birth to the jewels of all the buddhas' dharmas, in terms of being the one who gives rise to the ten powers.

analyzed: an avamardanīyā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: The perfection of wisdom, Blessed One, is invincible, in terms of being unassailable.

analyzed: catur vaiśāradya karī tvāt anāthānām sattvānām nātha karī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: The perfection of wisdom, Blessed One, is the protector of beings without a protector, in terms of being the one who gives rise to the four forms of fearlessness.

analyzed: saṃsāra pratipakṣā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: The perfection of wisdom, Blessed One, is the antidote to saṃsāra, in terms of being the one who gives rise to the four forms of fearlessness.

analyzed: a kūṭastha tām upādāya sarva dharma svabhāva vidarśanī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: The perfection of wisdom, Blessed One, is the one who shows the nature of all dharmas, in terms of being the one who gives rise to the four forms of fearlessness.

original: paripūrṇatriparivartadvādaśākāradharmacakrapravartanī bhagavan buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ prajñāpāramitā /🔽kathaṃ bhagavan bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ sthātavyam /
analyzed: paripūrṇa tri parivarta dvādaśa ākāra dharma cakra pravartanī bhagavan buddhānām bhagavatām prajñāpāramitā  katham bhagavan bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām sthātavyam
translated: The perfection of wisdom, Blessed One, is the one who turns the wheel of the Dharma with its three revolutions and twelve aspects, in terms of being the one who gives rise to the four forms of fearlessness.🔽Blessed One, how should the bodhisattva great beings stand in the perfection of wisdom?🔽Blessed One, how should the perfection of wisdom be kept in mind?

original: kathaṃ manasi kartavyā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā /🔽kathaṃ bhagavan namaskartavyā prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: katham manasi kartavyā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā 🔽katham bhagavat namaskartavyā prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, how should the perfection of wisdom be paid homage to?

analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat yathā śāriputra śāstari
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the Venerable Śāriputra, Just as you would to the Teacher, Śāriputra,

original: tathā prajñāpāramitāyāṃ sthātavyam /🔽tathaiva manasi kartavyā śāriputra prajñāpāramitā yathā śāstā /
analyzed: tathā prajñāpāramitāyām sthātavyam  tathā eva manasi kartavyā śāriputra prajñāpāramitā yathā śāstā
translated: should you stand in relation to the perfection of wisdom.🔽Just as you would to the Teacher, Śāriputra, should you keep the perfection of wisdom in mind.

original: tathaiva namaskartavyā śāriputra prajñāpāramitā yathā śāstā //
analyzed: tathā eva namaskartavyā śāriputra prajñāpāramitā yathā śāstā
translated: Just as you would to the Teacher, Śāriputra, should you pay homage to the perfection of wisdom.

original: atha khalu śakrasya devānāmindrasyaitadabhūtkuto nu bateyamāryasya śāriputrasya pṛcchā jātā /
analyzed: atha khalu śakrasya devānām indrasya etat abhūt kutas nu bata iyam āryasya śāriputrasya pṛcchā jātā
translated: Then this occurred to Śakra, Lord of the Gods: From where, now, has this question arisen for the noble Śāriputra?

analyzed: kiṃnidānā bata iyam āryasya śāriputrasya pṛcchā jātā
translated: What is the cause of this question of the noble Śāriputra?

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmindra āyuṣmantaṃ śāriputrametadavocatkuta iyamāryasya śāriputrasya pṛcchā jātā /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat kutas iyam āryasya śāriputrasya pṛcchā jātā
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Venerable Śāriputra: From where, noble Śāriputra, has this question arisen for you?

analyzed: kiṃnidānā bata iyam āryasya śāriputrasya pṛcchā jātā
translated: What is the cause of this question of yours, noble Śāriputra?

original: evamukte āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ śakraṃ devānāmindrametadavocatprajñāpāramitopāyakauśalyaparigṛhītaḥ kauśika bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'numodanāsahagataṃ puṇyakriyāvastu sarvajñatāyāṃ pariṇāmayaṃsteṣāṃ paurvakāṇāmaupalambhikānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ yaśca dānamayaḥ puṇyābhisaṃskāraḥ /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ śakram devānām indram etat avocat prajñāpāramitā upāya kauśalya parigṛhītaḥ kauśika bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ anumodanā sahagatam puṇya kriyā vastu sarvajña tāyām pariṇāmayan teṣām paurvakāṇām aupalambhikānām bodhisattvānām yaḥ ca dāna mayaḥ puṇya abhisaṃskāraḥ
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Śāriputra said to Śakra, Lord of the Gods, Kauśika, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who is embraced by the perfection of wisdom and skillful means, when dedicating the wholesome action associated with rejoicing to omniscience, surpasses the wholesome action in the form of giving,

original: yaśca śīlamayo yaśca kṣāntimayo yaśca vīryamayo yaśca dhyānamayaḥ puṇyābhisaṃskāraḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca śīla mayaḥ yaḥ ca kṣānti mayaḥ yaḥ ca vīrya mayaḥ yaḥ ca dhyāna mayaḥ puṇya abhisaṃskāraḥ
translated: the wholesome action in the form of morality, the wholesome action in the form of patience, the wholesome action in the form of vigor, and the wholesome action in the form of meditation of those previous bodhisattvas who practiced with reference points.

analyzed: tam sarvam abhibhavati iti
translated: He surpasses all of that.

analyzed: mama iyam etad nidānā pṛcchā jātā
translated: This question arose for me based on this.

original: api nu khalu punaḥ kauśika prajñāpāramitaiva pūrvaṃgamā pañcānāṃ pāramitānāṃ sarvajñatāmārgāvatārāya /
analyzed: api nu khalu punar kauśika prajñāpāramitā eva pūrvaṃgamā pañcānām pāramitānām sarvajña tā mārga avatārāya
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, is it not the perfection of wisdom itself that leads the five perfections, in order to enter the path to omniscience?

original: tadyathāpi nāma kauśika jātyandhānāṃ śataṃ vā sahasraṃ vā śatasahasraṃ vā apariṇāyakamabhavyaṃ mārgāvatārāya /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika jāti andhānām śatam vā sahasram vā śata sahasram vā apariṇāyakam abhavyam mārga avatārāya
translated: Kauśika, it is just as a hundred, a thousand, or a hundred thousand blind people, without a guide, are unable to enter a path,

original: abhavyaṃ grāmaṃ vā nagaraṃ vā nigamaṃ vā gantum /
analyzed: abhavyam grāmam vā nagaram vā nigamam vā gantum
translated: unable to go to a village, town, or city.

original: evameva kauśika dānaṃ śīlaṃ kṣāntivīryaṃ dhyānaṃ ca prajñāpāramitānāmadheyaṃ labhate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika dānam śīlam kṣānti vīryam dhyānam ca prajñāpāramitā nāmadheyam labhate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, giving, morality, patience, perseverance, and concentration obtain the name of perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: jāti andha bhūtam bhavati vinā prajñāpāramitayā apariṇāyaka tvāt
translated: It is like a person born blind without the perfection of wisdom, because it has no guide.

analyzed: abhavyam sarvajña tā mārga avatārāya
translated: It is not fit to enter the path to omniscience.

analyzed: kutas punar sarvajña tām anuprāpsyati
translated: How then will it attain omniscience?

original: yadā punaḥ kauśika dānaṃ śīlaṃ kṣāntirvīyaṃ dhyānaṃ ca prajñāpāramitāparigṛhītaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: yadā punar kauśika dānam śīlam kṣāntiḥ vīyam dhyānam ca prajñāpāramitā parigṛhītam bhavati
translated: But when, Kauśika, giving, morality, patience, perseverance, and concentration are embraced by the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: tadā pāramitā nāmadheyam pāramitā śabdam labhate
translated: then they obtain the name of perfection, the word perfection.

original: tadā hyāsāṃ cakṣuḥpratilambho bhavati pañcānāṃ pāramitānāṃ sarvajñatāmārgāvatārāya sarvajñatānuprāptaye //
analyzed: tadā hi āsām cakṣuḥ pratilambhaḥ bhavati pañcānām pāramitānām sarvajña tā mārga avatārāya sarvajña tā anuprāptaye
translated: For then there is the attainment of the eye of the five perfections for entering the path to omniscience and for attaining omniscience.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavantametadavocatkathaṃ bhagavan bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā abhinirhartavyā /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat katham bhagavan bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā abhinirhartavyā
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, how should a bodhisattva mahāsattva accomplish the perfection of wisdom?

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ śāriputrametadavocatrūpasya śāriputra abhinirhāro draṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat rūpasya śāriputra abhinirhāraḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Śāriputra, Śāriputra, the accomplishment of form should be seen.

analyzed: evam vedanāyāḥ saṃjñāyāḥ saṃskārāṇām
translated: Thus, it is for feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness.

analyzed: vijñānasya śāriputra abhinirhāraḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: Śāriputra, the accomplishment of consciousness should be seen.

analyzed: yaḥ śāriputra pañcānām skandhānām abhinirhāraḥ
translated: Śāriputra, this accomplishment of the five aggregates,

analyzed: ayam śāriputra prajñāpāramitāyāḥ abhinirhāraḥ iti ucyate
translated: Śāriputra, is called the accomplishment of the perfection of wisdom.

original: evamabhinirhāreṇa pañcānāṃ skandhānāmabhinirhāraḥ prajñāpāramitāyā abhinirhāro'bhinirhāra ityucyate //
analyzed: evam abhinirhāreṇa pañcānām skandhānām abhinirhāraḥ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ abhinirhāra ubhinirhāraḥ iti ucyate
translated: Thus, the accomplishment of the five aggregates through this accomplishment is called the accomplishment of the perfection of wisdom.

original: evamukte āyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavantametadavocatevamabhinirhāreṇa abhinirhṛtā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā katamaṃ dharmamarpayati /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat evam abhinirhāreṇa abhinirhṛtā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā katamam dharmam arpayati
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Śāriputra said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom accomplished in this way, what dharma does it point to?

analyzed: bhagavān āha evam abhinirhṛtā śāriputra prajñāpāramitā na kaṃcid dharmam arpayati
translated: The Blessed One said, Śāriputra, the perfection of wisdom accomplished in this way does not point to any dharma.

analyzed: yadā sā śāriputra na kaṃcid dharmam arpayati
translated: When, Śāriputra, it does not point to any dharma,

analyzed: tadā prajñāpāramitā iti saṃkhyām gacchati
translated: then it is reckoned as the perfection of wisdom.

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmindro bhagavantametadavocatkimiyaṃ bhagavan prajñāpāramitā sarvajñatāmapi nārpayati /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat kim iyam bhagavan prajñāpāramitā sarvajña tām api na arpayati
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, does this perfection of wisdom not even point to omniscience?

original: bhagavānāhayatkauśika evaṃ vadasikimiyaṃ prajñāpāramitā sarvajñatāmapi nārpayatīti /
analyzed: bhagavān āha yat kauśika evam vadasi kim iyam prajñāpāramitā sarvajña tām api na arpayati iti
translated: The Blessed One said, Kauśika, you say, 'Does this perfection of wisdom not even lead to the knowledge of all aspects?'

analyzed: na yathā upalambhaḥ tathā arpayati
translated: It leads in such a way that it does not lead.

analyzed: na yathā nāma tathā arpayati
translated: It leads in such a way that it does not lead to the name.

analyzed: na yathā abhisaṃskāraḥ tathā arpayati
translated: It leads in such a way that it does not lead to the volitional formation.

analyzed: śakraḥ āha katham tarhi bhagavan arpayati
translated: Śakra said, Well then, Blessed One, how does it lead?

analyzed: bhagavān āha yathā kauśika na arpayati tathā arpayati
translated: The Blessed One said, Kauśika, it leads in such a way that it does not lead.

original: śakra āhaāścaryaṃ bhagavan yāvadiyaṃ prajñāpāramitā na kaṃciddharmamutpādayati /
analyzed: śakraḥ āha āścaryam bhagavan yāvat iyam prajñāpāramitā na kaṃcid dharmam utpādayati
translated: Śakra said, It is amazing, Blessed One, how this perfection of wisdom does not produce any dharma,

analyzed: na kaṃcid dharmam nirodhayati
translated: does not stop any dharma.

analyzed: sarva dharmāṇām anutpādāya anirodhāya pratyupasthitā anupasthitā prajñāpāramitā
translated: The perfection of wisdom is present and not present for the non-production and non-stopping of all dharmas.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān subhūtirbhagavantametadavocatsacedevamapi bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvo saṃjñāsyate /🔽dūrīkariṣyati imāṃ prajñāpāramitām /🔽riktīkariṣyati imāṃ prajñāpāramitām /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat saced evam api bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ saṃjñāsyate  dūrīkariṣyati imām prajñāpāramitām  riktīkariṣyati imām prajñāpāramitām
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, if a bodhisattva mahāsattva thinks like this,🔽he will distance himself from this perfection of wisdom.🔽He will empty this perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: tucchīkariṣyati imām prajñāpāramitām
translated: He will make this perfection of wisdom void.

analyzed: na kariṣyati imām prajñāpāramitām
translated: will not practice this perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat evam etat subhūte evam etat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the Venerable Subhuti, So it is, Subhuti, so it is.

original: astyeṣa subhūte paryāyo yena paryāyeṇa dūrīkariṣyatīmāṃ prajñāpāramitām /🔽riktīkariṣyatīmāṃ prajñāpāramitām /
analyzed: asti eṣa subhūte paryāyaḥ yena paryāyeṇa dūrīkariṣyati imām prajñāpāramitām  riktīkariṣyati imām prajñāpāramitām
translated: Subhuti, there is this mode, by which mode one will relegate this perfection of wisdom,🔽will render this perfection of wisdom empty,

analyzed: tucchīkariṣyati imām prajñāpāramitām
translated: will render this perfection of wisdom void,

analyzed: na kariṣyati imām prajñāpāramitām
translated: will not practice this perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: prajñāpāramitāyāṃ hi subhūte paridīpitāyāṃ na rūpaṃ paridīpitaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām hi subhūte paridīpitāyām na rūpam paridīpitam bhavati
translated: Subhuti, when the perfection of wisdom is revealed, form is not revealed.

original: na vedanā na saṃjñā na saṃskārāḥ /
analyzed: na vedanā na saṃjñā na saṃskārāḥ
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional formations,

original: na vijñānaṃ paridīpitaṃ bhavati /🔽na srotaāpattiphalaṃ paridīpitaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: na vijñānam paridīpitam bhavati  na srotaāpatti phalam paridīpitam bhavati
translated: consciousness is not revealed.🔽The fruit of stream-entry is not revealed.

analyzed: na sakṛdāgāmi phalam paridīpitam bhavati
translated: The fruit of once-returning is not revealed.

analyzed: na anāgāmi phalam paridīpitam bhavati
translated: The fruit of non-returning is not revealed.

original: nārhattvaṃ paridīpitaṃ bhavati /🔽na pratyekabuddhatvaṃ paridīpitaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: na arhat tvam paridīpitam bhavati  na pratyekabuddha tvam paridīpitam bhavati
translated: Arhatship is not revealed.🔽Pratyekabuddhahood is not revealed.

analyzed: na buddha tvam paridīpitam bhavati
translated: Buddhahood is not revealed.

analyzed: sthaviraḥ subhūtiḥ āha mahā pāramitā iyam bhagavan yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: The elder Subhuti said, This perfection of wisdom, Blessed One, is a great perfection.

original: bhagavānāhatatkiṃ manyase subhūte katamena paryāyeṇa mahāpāramiteyaṃ yaduta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: bhagavān āha tat kim manyase subhūte katamena paryāyeṇa mahā pāramitā iyam yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: The Blessed One said, What do you think, Subhuti, by what method is this perfection of wisdom a great perfection?

original: sthaviraḥ subhūtirāhana bhagavan rūpaṃ mahatkaroti nālpīkaroti /
analyzed: sthaviraḥ subhūtiḥ āhana bhagavan rūpam mahatkaroti na alpīkaroti
translated: The elder Subhuti said, Blessed One, it is not that form is made great or made small.

analyzed: na rūpam saṃkṣipati na vikṣipati
translated: It is not that form is contracted or distracted.

original: evaṃ na vedanāṃ na saṃjñāṃ na saṃskārān /
analyzed: evam na vedanām na saṃjñām na saṃskārān
translated: And so it is not that feeling, perception, volitional formations, or consciousness are made great or made small.

analyzed: na bhagavan vijñānam mahatkaroti na alpīkaroti
translated: Blessed One, it is not that consciousness is made great or made small.

analyzed: na vijñānam saṃkṣipati na vikṣipati
translated: It is not that consciousness is contracted or distracted.

analyzed: yāni api tāni tathāgatasya tathāgata balāni
translated: And those powers of a Tathagata,

analyzed: tāni api na balīkaroti na durbalīkaroti
translated: they too are not made strong or made weak.

analyzed: na saṃkṣipati na vikṣipati
translated: They are not contracted or distracted.

analyzed: yā api sā sarvajña tā
translated: And that omniscience,

analyzed: tām api na mahatkaroti na alpīkaroti
translated: it too is not made great or made small.

analyzed: na saṃkṣipati na vikṣipati
translated: It is not contracted or distracted.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: asaṃkṣiptā avikṣiptā hi bhagavan sarvajña tā
translated: Because, Blessed One, omniscience is not contracted or distracted.

analyzed: saced evam api bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ saṃjānīte
translated: If, Blessed One, a bodhisattva great being cognizes it in this way,

analyzed: carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: He practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: kiṃ punarevaṃ saṃjānānaḥevamahaṃ sarvajñajñānasamanvāgata sattvebhyo dharmaṃ deśayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: kim punar evam saṃjānānaḥ evam aham sarvajña jñāna samanvāgata sattvebhyaḥ dharmam deśayiṣyāmi
translated: Moreover, thinking thus, In this way, endowed with omniscient knowledge, I will teach the Dharma to beings,

analyzed: evam imān sattvān parinirvāpayiṣyāmi iti
translated: In this way, I will bring these beings to complete nirvāṇa,

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: why is that?

original: na hyeṣa prajñāpāramitāniṣyando ya imān sattvān parinirvāpayiṣyāmīti sattvopalambhaḥ /
analyzed: na hi eṣa prajñāpāramitā nisyandaḥ yaḥ imān sattvān parinirvāpayiṣyāmi iti sattva upalambhaḥ
translated: For this is not the outflow of the perfection of wisdom, namely the perception of beings thinking I will bring these beings to complete nirvāṇa.

analyzed: eṣaḥ eva asya mahā anupalambhaḥ syāt
translated: This would be his great perception.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: sattva asvabhāva jātikā hi prajñāpāramitā veditavyā  sattva asvabhāva tayā prajñāpāramitā svabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be known as having the nature of beings.🔽The nature of the perfection of wisdom should be known as the nature of beings.

analyzed: sattva vivikta tayā prajñāpāramitā vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The isolation of the perfection of wisdom should be known as the isolation of beings.

analyzed: sattva acintya tayā prajñāpāramitā acintya tā veditavyā  sattva avināśa dharma tayā prajñāpāramitā vināśa dharma tā veditavyā
translated: The inconceivability of the perfection of wisdom should be known as the inconceivability of beings.🔽The imperishability of the perfection of wisdom should be known as the imperishability of beings.

analyzed: sattva an abhisaṃbodhana tayā prajñāpāramitā an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-enlightenment of the perfection of wisdom should be known as the non-enlightenment of beings.

analyzed: sattva yathābhūta artha an abhisaṃbodhana tayā prajñāpāramitā yathābhūta artha an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: It should be known that the non-realization of the suchness of beings is the non-realization of the suchness of the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: sattva bala samudāgamana tayā tathāgata bala samudāgamana tā veditavyā
translated: It should be known that the attainment of the power of beings is the attainment of the power of the Tathagata.

original: anena bhagavan paryāyeṇa mahāpāramiteyaṃ yaduta prajñāpāramitā //
analyzed: anena bhagavan paryāyeṇa mahā pāramitā iyam yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: By this method, Blessed One, this is a great perfection, namely the perfection of wisdom.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavantametadavocatyo bhagavan iha gambhīrāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'dhimokṣayiṣyati na kāṅkṣiṣyati na vicikitsiṣyati na dhandhāyiṣyati /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat yaḥ bhagavan iha gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ adhimokṣayiṣyati na kāṅkṣiṣyati na vicikitsiṣyati na dhandhāyiṣyati
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who will aspire to this profound perfection of wisdom, who will not doubt, not be uncertain, not be confused,

original: kutaḥ sa bhagavaṃścyuta ihopapanno veditavyaḥ /🔽kiyacciracaritāvī ca sa bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvo veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: kutas sa bhagavan cyutaḥ iha upapannaḥ veditavyaḥ  kiyat cira caritāvī ca sa bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: from where should it be known that he has passed away and been reborn here?

original: ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmarthataśca dharmataśca arthanayataśca dharmanayataśca anugamiṣyati anubhotsyate'nubodhayiṣyati ca /
analyzed: yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām arthataḥ ca dharmataḥ ca artha nayataḥ ca dharma nayataḥ ca anugamiṣyati ca
translated: How long has that bodhisattva mahāsattva practiced, Blessed One, who will follow, experience, and realize this perfection of wisdom according to its meaning, according to its Dharma, according to the method of meaning, and according to the method of Dharma?

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ śāriputrametadavocatsa śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'nyebhyo lokadhātubhyaścyuto buddhān bhagavataḥ paryupāsya paripṛcchya ihopapanno veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat sa śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ nyebhyaḥ lokadhātubhyaḥ cyutaḥ buddhān bhagavataḥ paryupāsya paripṛcchyaḥ iha upapannaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the Venerable Śāriputra: Śāriputra, that bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as one who has passed away from other world systems, has attended upon the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, and has come here after asking questions.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: yaḥ kaścicchāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'nyebhyo lokadhātubhyaścyuto buddhān bhagavataḥ paryupāsya paripṛcchaya ihopapanno bhavati /
analyzed: yaḥ kaścid śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ anyebhyaḥ lokadhātubhyaḥ cyutaḥ buddhān bhagavataḥ paryupāsya paripṛcchaye iha upapannaḥ bhavati
translated: Śāriputra, whatever bodhisattva mahāsattva has passed away from other world systems, has attended upon the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, and has come here after asking questions,

original: sa imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāṃ deśyamānāmupadiśyamānāmuddiśyamānāṃ śṛṇuyāt /
analyzed: saḥ imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām bhāṣyamāṇām deśyamānām upadiśyamānām uddiśyamānām śṛṇuyāt
translated: he will hear this profound perfection of wisdom being taught, being shown, being instructed, being pointed out.

original: imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ śrutvā atra śāstṛsaṃjñāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāmutpādayetśāstā me saṃmukhībhūt iti /
analyzed: imām prajñāpāramitām śrutvā atra śāstṛ saṃjñām prajñāpāramitāyām utpādayet śāstā me saṃmukhībhūt iti
translated: Having heard this perfection of wisdom, he will generate the notion of a teacher towards the perfection of wisdom, thinking 'The teacher has appeared to me.'

analyzed: śāstā me dṛṣṭaḥ iti cittam utpādayati
translated: He will generate the thought 'The teacher has been seen by me.'

analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām bhāṣyamāṇāyām deśyamānāyām upadiśyamānāyām uddiśyamānāyām śrotram avadadhāti
translated: When the perfection of wisdom is being taught, being shown, being instructed, being pointed out, he will lend an ear.

analyzed: satkṛtya śṛṇoti
translated: He will listen respectfully.

analyzed: kathām na upacchinatti
translated: He will not interrupt the story.

original: ciracaritāvī sa śāriputra tathārūpo bodhisattvo mahāsattvo veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: cira caritāvī sa śāriputra tathārūpaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: That bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as one who has practiced for a long time.

original: bahubuddhaparyupāsitaḥ sa śāriputra tathārūpo bodhisattvo mahāsattvo veditavyaḥ //
analyzed: bahu buddha paryupāsitaḥ sa śāriputra tathārūpaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: That bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as one who has attended many buddhas.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān subhūtirbhagavantametadavocatśakyā punarbhagavan prajñāpāramitā śrotuṃ vā upalakṣyayituṃ vā samanvāhartuṃ vā upapādayituṃ vā upadhārayituṃ vā /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat śakyā punar bhagavan prajñāpāramitā śrotum vā upalakṣyayitum vā samanvāhartum vā upapādayitum vā upadhārayitum vā
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, is it possible to hear, understand, comprehend, realize, or grasp the perfection of wisdom?

original: iyaṃ sā prajñāpāramitā /🔽iha vā sā prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: iyam sā prajñāpāramitā  iha vā sā prajñāpāramitā
translated: This is the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: amutra vā sā prajñāpāramitā
translated: Is it here, or is the perfection of wisdom there?

original: anena vā ākāreṇa liṅgena nimitteneti śakyā nirdeṣṭuṃ vā śrotuṃ vā /
analyzed: anena vai ākāreṇa liṅgena nimittena iti śakyāḥ nirdeṣṭum vā śrotum vā
translated: By this form, this mark, this sign, is it possible to indicate, hear, or understand?

analyzed: bhagavān āha no hi idam subhūte
translated: The Blessed One said, No, Subhūti.

original: neyaṃ subhūte prajñāpāramitā skandhaśo vā dhātuśo vā āyatanaśo vā śakyā nirdeṣṭuṃ vā śrotuṃ vā upalakṣayituṃ vā samanvāhartuṃ vā upapādayituṃ vā upadhārayituṃ vā /
analyzed: na iyam subhūte prajñāpāramitā skandhaśas vā dhātuśas vā āyatanaśas vā śakyā nirdeṣṭum vā śrotum vā upalakṣayitum vā samanvāhartum vā upapādayitum vā upadhārayitum vā
translated: Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom cannot be indicated, heard, understood, comprehended, realized, or grasped in terms of aggregates, elements, or sense fields.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

analyzed: sarva dharma vivikta tvāt subhūte
translated: Because all dharmas are isolated, Subhūti.

original: atyantaviviktatvātsubhūte sarvadharmāṇāṃ na śakyā prajñāpāramitā nirdeṣṭuṃ vā śrotuṃ vā upalakṣayituṃ vā samanvāhartuṃ vā upapādayituṃ vā upadhārayituṃ vā /
analyzed: atyanta vivikta tvāt subhūte sarva dharmāṇām na śakyā prajñāpāramitā nirdeṣṭum vā śrotum vā upalakṣayitum vā samanvāhartum vā upapādayitum vā upadhārayitum vā
translated: Because all dharmas are utterly isolated, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom cannot be demonstrated, or listened to, or grasped, or contemplated, or produced, or understood.

analyzed: na ca anyatra skandha dhātu āyatanebhyaḥ prajñāpāramitā avaboddhavyā
translated: And the perfection of wisdom should not be understood apart from the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: skandhadhātvāyatanameva hi subhūte śūnyaṃ viviktaṃ śāntam /
analyzed: skandha dhātu āyatanam eva hi subhūte śūnyam viviktam śāntam
translated: Subhūti, the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields themselves are empty, isolated, and peaceful.

original: iti hi prajñāpāramitā ca skandhadhātvāyatanaṃ ca advayametaedadvaidhīkāraṃ śūnyatvādviviktatvāt /
analyzed: iti hi prajñāpāramitā ca skandha dhātu āyatanam ca advayam etaeda dvaidhīkāram śūnya tvāt vivikta tvāt
translated: Thus, the perfection of wisdom and the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields are non-dual, not made dual, because of emptiness, because of isolation.

analyzed: evam śānta tvāt na upalabhyate
translated: In this way, because of peace, it is not perceived.

analyzed: yaḥ anupalambhaḥ sarva dharmāṇām
translated: That non-perception of all dharmas

analyzed: sā prajñāpāramitā iti ucyate
translated: is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: yadā na bhavati saṃjñā samajñā prajñaptirvyavahāraḥ /
analyzed: yadā na bhavati saṃjñā samajñā prajñaptiḥ vyavahāraḥ
translated: When there is no conception, right conception, designation, or convention,

analyzed: tadā prajñāpāramitā iti ucyate
translated: then it is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: sthaviaraḥ subhūtirāhakiyacciracaritāvī sa bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvo veditavyo ya iha gambhīrāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ yogamāpatsyate /
analyzed: sthaviaraḥ subhūtiḥ āha kiyat cira caritāvī sa bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ veditavyaḥ yaḥ iha gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām yogam āpatsyate
translated: The Elder Subhuti said: How long has that Bodhisattva, that great being, practised when he will take up this deep perfection of wisdom?

analyzed: bhagavān āha vibhajya vyākaraṇīyam etat subhūte bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām indriya adhimātra tayā
translated: The Lord: This must be declared in detail, Subhuti, according to the keenness of the faculties of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings.

original: syātkhalu punaḥ subhūte paryāyo yena paryāyeṇa bodhisattvā bahūni buddhaśatāni bahūni buddhasahasrāṇi bahūni buddhaśatasahasrāṇi dṛṣṭvā teṣāmantike brahmacaryaṃ caritvā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ na śraddadhyurnādhimuñceyuḥ /
analyzed: syāt khalu punar subhūte paryāyaḥ yena paryāyeṇa bodhisattvāḥ bahūni buddha śatāni bahūni buddha sahasrāṇi bahūni buddha śata sahasrāṇi dṛṣṭvā teṣām antike brahmacaryam caritvā imām prajñāpāramitām na śraddadhyuḥ na adhimuñceyuḥ
translated: It may be, Subhuti, that a Bodhisattva has seen many hundreds of Buddhas, many thousands of Buddhas, many hundreds of thousands of Buddhas, and has practised the holy life in their presence, and yet he will not believe in or understand this deep perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is it so?🔽Because in the past also he has not honoured, not served, not attended the Buddhas, the Lords.🔽And why? Because he has not honoured, not served, not attended the Buddhas, the Lords.🔽And why? Because he has not honoured, not served, not attended the Buddhas, the Lords.🔽And why? analyzed: pūrvam api teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām antikāt asyām gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām bhāṣyamāṇāyām deśyamānāyām upadiśyamānāyām agaurava tā abhūt  agaurava tayā a śuśrūṣaṇa tā  a śuśrūṣaṇa tayā a paryupāsana tā

Because he has not honoured, not served, not attended the Buddhas, the Lords.🔽And why? Because he has not honoured, not served, not attended the Buddhas, the Lords.
