translated: And why? Because he has not honoured, not served, not attended the Buddhas, the Lords.🔽And why? Because he has

analyzed: a paripṛcchana tayā a śraddadhāna tā
translated: Due to not asking, there is lack of faith.

analyzed: a śraddadhāna tayā tatas parṣaddhyā upakrāntāḥ
translated: Due to lack of faith, they then leave the assembly.

original: te tatonidānaṃ dharmavyasanasaṃvartanīyena karmaṇā kṛtena saṃcitena ācitena upacitena etarhyapi gambhīrāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāyāṃ deśyamānāyāmupadiśyamānāyāmapakrāmanti /
analyzed: te tatonidānam dharma vyasana saṃvartanīyena karmaṇā kṛtena saṃcitena ācitena upacitena etarhi api gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām bhāṣyamāṇāyām deśyamānāyām upadiśyamānāyām apakrāmanti
translated: Due to having created, accumulated, heaped up, and stored up karma that leads to the destruction of the Dharma, even now, when the profound perfection of wisdom is being taught, explained, and shown, they leave.

original: agauravatayā aśraddadhānā anadhimuñcanto na kāyena na cittena sāmagrīṃ dadati /
analyzed: agaurava tayā aśraddadhānāḥ an adhimuñcantaḥ na kāyena na cittena sāmagrīm dadati
translated: Due to lack of respect, they lack faith, do not aspire, and do not give mental attention.

original: te sāmagrīmadadānā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ na jānanti na paśyanti na budhyante na vedayante /
analyzed: te sāmagrīm a dadānāḥ imām prajñāpāramitām na jānanti na paśyanti na budhyante na vedayante
translated: Not giving mental attention, they do not know, do not see, do not understand, and do not experience this perfection of wisdom.

original: evaṃ te prajñāpāramitāṃ na śraddadhati /🔽aśraddadhānā na śṛṇvanti /
analyzed: evam te prajñāpāramitām na śraddadhati  a śraddadhānāḥ na śṛṇvanti
translated: Thus they do not have faith in the perfection of wisdom.🔽Lacking faith, they do not listen.

analyzed: a śṛṇvantaḥ na jānanti  a jānantaḥ na paśyanti
translated: Not listening, they do not know.🔽Not knowing, they do not see.

analyzed: a paśyantaḥ na budhyante
translated: Not seeing, they do not understand.

analyzed: a budhyamānāḥ dharma vyasana saṃvartanīyam karma kurvanti
translated: Not understanding, they create karma that leads to the destruction of the Dharma.

analyzed: saṃcinvanti ācinvanti upacinvanti
translated: They intend, accumulate, and heap it up.

original: te tena dharmavyasanasaṃvartanīyena karmaṇā kṛtena saṃcitena ācitena upacitena duṣprajñasaṃvartanīyaṃ karmābhisaṃskariṣyanti /
analyzed: te tena dharma vyasana saṃvartanīyena karmaṇā kṛtena saṃcitena ācitena upacitena duṣprajña saṃvartanīyam karma abhisaṃskariṣyanti
translated: They, having done, accumulated, heaped up, and collected that action which leads to the destruction of the Dharma, will create the action which leads to bad wisdom.

original: tena te duṣprajñasaṃvartanīyena karmaṇā abhisaṃskṛtena saṃcitenācitenopacitena imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāṃ deśyamānāmupadiśyamānāṃ pratyākhyāsyanti pratikṣepsyanti pratikrokṣyanti /
analyzed: tena te duṣprajña saṃvartanīyena karmaṇā abhisaṃskṛtena saṃcitena ācitena upacitena imām prajñāpāramitām bhāṣyamāṇām deśyamānām upadiśyamānām pratyākhyāsyanti pratikṣepsyanti pratikrokṣyanti
translated: By that action which leads to bad wisdom, which they have created, accumulated, heaped up, and collected, they will reject, deny, and oppose this perfection of wisdom when it is being taught, demonstrated, and explained.

analyzed: pratikṣipya ca apakramiṣyanti
translated: And having rejected it, they will go away.

original: asyāḥ khalu punaḥ subhūte prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pratyākhyānena pratikṣepeṇa pratikrośena atītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ sarvajñatā pratyākhyātā bhavati /🔽pratikṣiptā bhavati /
analyzed: asyāḥ khalu punar subhūte prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pratyākhyānena pratikṣepeṇa pratikrośena atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām buddhānām bhagavatām sarvajña tā pratyākhyātā bhavati  pratikṣiptā bhavati
translated: And, Subhuti, by rejecting, denying, and opposing this perfection of wisdom, the all-knowledge of the Buddhas, the Lords, of the past, future, and present is rejected, denied, and opposed.🔽It is rejected, denied, and opposed.

analyzed: pratikruṣṭā bhavati
translated: It is rejected, denied, and opposed.

original: te svasaṃtānānupahatya dagdhāḥ pareṣāmapyalpabuddhikānāmalpaprajñānāmalpapuṇyānāmalpakuśalamūlānāṃ pudgalānāṃ śraddhāmātrakasamanvāgatānāṃ premamātrakasamanvāgatānāṃ prasādamātrakasamanvāgatānāṃ chandamātrakasamanvāgatānāmādikarmikāṇāmabhavyarūpāṇāṃ tadapi śraddhāmātrakaṃ premamātrakaṃ prasādamātrakaṃ chandamātrakaṃ vicchandayiṣyanti vivecayiṣyanti vivartayiṣyanti /
analyzed: te sva saṃtānān upahatya dagdhāḥ pareṣām api alpabuddhikānām alpa prajñānām alpa puṇyānām alpa kuśala mūlānām pudgalānām śraddhā mātraka samanvāgatānām prema mātraka samanvāgatānām prasāda mātraka samanvāgatānām chanda mātraka samanvāgatānām ādi karmikāṇām abhavya rūpāṇām tat api śraddhā mātrakam prema mātrakam prasāda mātrakam chanda mātrakam vicchandayiṣyanti vivecayiṣyanti vivartayiṣyanti
translated: They will destroy their own continuums and burn, and they will also destroy and separate the faith, love, serene faith, and aspiration of other people of little understanding, little wisdom, little merit, and little wholesome roots, of individuals endowed with mere faith, endowed with mere love, endowed with mere serene faith, and endowed with mere aspiration, of beginners, and of those of the form of unfitness.

analyzed: na atra śikṣitavyam iti vakṣyanti
translated: They will say, 'One should not train in this.'

analyzed: na etat buddha vacanam iti vācam bhāṣiṣyante
translated: They will speak the words, 'This is not the word of the Buddha.'

original: evaṃ te ātmasaṃtānānupahatya vivecya parasaṃtānānapyupahatya vivecya prajñāpāramitāmabhyākhyāsyanti /
analyzed: evam te ātma saṃtānān upahatya vivecya para saṃtānān api upahatya vivecya prajñāpāramitām abhyākhyāsyanti
translated: Thus they will slander the perfection of wisdom, having destroyed and separated their own continuums, and having destroyed and separated the continuums of others.

analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām abhyākhyātāyām sarvajña tā abhyākhyātā bhavati
translated: When the perfection of wisdom is slandered, the knowledge of all aspects is slandered.

analyzed: sarvajña tāyām abhyākhyātāyām atīta anāgata pratyutpannāḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ abhyākhyātāḥ bhavanti
translated: When the knowledge of all aspects is slandered, the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones of the past, future, and present, are slandered.

analyzed: te buddhānām bhagavatām antikāt apakrāntāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will turn away from the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

analyzed: dharmāt parimuktāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will be separated from the Dharma.

analyzed: saṃghāt paribāhyāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will be outside the Saṅgha.

original: evaṃ teṣāṃ sarveṇa sarvaṃ sarvathā sarvaṃ triratnātparibāhyabhāvo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: evam teṣām sarveṇa sarvam sarvathā sarvam triratnāt paribāhya bhāvaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: In this way, they will be completely and totally separated from the Three Jewels in every way.

original: te sattvānāṃ hitasukhopacchedakriyayā mahānirayavipākasaṃvartanīyaṃ karma upaceṣyanti /
analyzed: te sattvānām hita sukha upaccheda kriyayā mahāniraya vipāka saṃvartanīyam karma upaceṣyanti
translated: Those beings, by cutting off what is beneficial and pleasant, will accumulate karma that leads to the ripening of great hells.

original: te anenaivaṃrūpeṇa karmābhisaṃskāreṇopasthāpitena samutthāpitena dharmavyasanasaṃvartanīyena duṣprajñasaṃvartanīyena karmaṇā bahūni varṣaśatāni bahūni varṣasahasrāṇi bahūni varṣaśatasahasrāṇi bahūni varṣakoṭīśatāni bahūni varṣakoṭīsahasrāṇi bahūni varṣakoṭīśatasahasrāṇi bahūni varṣakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi mahānirayeṣūpapatsyante /
analyzed: te anena evaṃrūpeṇa karma abhisaṃskāreṇa upasthāpitena samutthāpitena dharma vyasana saṃvartanīyena duṣprajña saṃvartanīyena karmaṇā bahūni varṣa śatāni bahūni varṣa sahasrāṇi bahūni varṣa śata sahasrāṇi bahūni varṣa koṭī śatāni bahūni varṣa koṭī sahasrāṇi bahūni varṣa koṭī śata sahasrāṇi bahūni varṣa koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi mahānirayeṣu upapatsyante
translated: By being established in and aroused by this kind of karmic formation that leads to falling away from the Dharma and to bad wisdom, they will be reborn in the great hells for many hundreds of years, many thousands of years, many hundreds of thousands of years, many hundreds of millions of years, many billions of years, many trillions of years, many quadrillions of years.

analyzed: te mahānirayāt mahānirayam saṃkramiṣyanti
translated: They will go from one great hell to another great hell.

original: teṣāṃ tathā suciraṃ mahānirayānmahānirayaṃ saṃkrāmatāṃ tejaḥsaṃvartanī prādurbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: teṣām tathā su ciram mahānirayāt mahānirayam saṃkrāmatām tejaḥ saṃvartanī prādurbhaviṣyati
translated: For them, thus passing from great hell to great hell for a very long time, a conflagration will appear.

analyzed: tejaḥ saṃvartanyām prādurbhūtāyām yena yeṣu lokadhātuṣu mahānirayāḥ
translated: When the conflagration appears, those in the great hells in other world systems

original: tatra te kṣepsyante /🔽te teṣu mahānireyaṣu upapatsyante /
analyzed: tatra te kṣepsyante  te teṣu mahānireyaṣu upapatsyante
translated: will be thrown there.🔽They will be reborn there in the great hells.

original: te tatra vikṣiptāsteṣu mahānirayeṣūpapannāḥ samānāstatrāpi mahānirayānmahānirayaṃ saṃkramiṣyanti /
analyzed: te tatra vikṣiptāḥ teṣu mahānirayeṣu upapannāḥ samānāḥ tatra api mahānirayāt mahānirayam saṃkramiṣyanti
translated: Having been thrown there and reborn in those great hells, they will pass from great hell to great hell.

original: teṣāṃ tatrāpi mahānirayānmahānirayaṃ saṃkrāmatāṃ tatrāpi punareva tathaiva tejaḥsaṃvartanī prādurbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: teṣām tatra api mahānirayāt mahānirayam saṃkrāmatām tatra api punar eva tathā eva tejaḥ saṃvartanī prādurbhaviṣyati
translated: For them, thus passing from great hell to great hell there, a conflagration will appear again just as before.

original: te tasyāṃ tejaḥsaṃvartanyāṃ prādurbhūtāyāṃ tataścyutāḥ samānāḥ punareva anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu ye mahānirayāstatra kṣepsyante /
analyzed: te tasyām tejaḥ saṃvartanyām prādurbhūtāyām tatas cyutāḥ samānāḥ punar eva anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu ye mahānirayāḥ tatra kṣepsyante
translated: When that conflagration appears, they, having fallen from there, will again be thrown into the great hells in other world systems.

analyzed: te teṣu mahānirayeṣu upapatsyante
translated: They will be reborn in those great hells.

analyzed: te tatra api tathā eva mahānirayāt mahānirayam saṃkramiṣyanti
translated: There also, they will pass from great hell to great hell in the same way.

original: teṣāṃ tatrāpi suciraṃ mahānirayānmahānirayaṃ saṃkrāmatāṃ tatrāpi tathaiva tejaḥsaṃvartanī prādurbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: teṣām tatra api su ciram mahānirayāt mahānirayam saṃkrāmatām tatra api tathā eva tejaḥ saṃvartanī prādurbhaviṣyati
translated: Even there, when they pass from one great hell to another great hell for a very long time, there will also appear a conflagration disaster just like that.

original: te tasyāṃ tejaḥsaṃvartanyāṃ prādurbhūtāyāṃ punareva tataścyutāstenaiva akṣīṇena sāvaśeṣeṇa karmaṇā ihaiva lokadhātau punaḥ kṣepsyante /
analyzed: te tasyām tejaḥ saṃvartanyām prādurbhūtāyām punar eva tatas cyutāḥ tena eva akṣīṇena sa avaśeṣeṇa karmaṇā iha eva lokadhātau punar kṣepsyante
translated: When that conflagration disaster appears, they will again fall from there, and by that karma which is not exhausted and has a remainder, they will be cast down again into this very world-system.

analyzed: kṣiptāḥ santaḥ mahānirayeṣu upapatsyante
translated: Having been cast down, they will be reborn in the great hells.

original: te punareva tāni mahānirayeṣu mahānti mahānirayaduḥkhāni pratyanubhaviṣyanti /🔽tāvatpratyanubhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: te punar eva tāni mahānirayeṣu mahānti mahāniraya duḥkhāni pratyanubhaviṣyanti  tāvat pratyanubhaviṣyanti
translated: They will again experience the great sufferings of the great hells.

analyzed: yāvat punar eva tejaḥ saṃvartanī prādurbhaviṣyati
translated: They will experience it for as long as a conflagration disaster will appear again.

analyzed: evam te bahu duḥkha vedanīyam karma pratyanubhaviṣyanti
translated: Thus they will experience karma that is to be felt as much suffering.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

analyzed: yathā api nāma durbhāṣita tvāt vācaḥ
translated: Namely, because of the bad speech of speech.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavantametadavocatpañca bhagavan ānantaryāṇi karmāṇi kṛtānyupacitāni asya manoduścaritasya vāgduścaritasya ca na prativarṇikānyapi na anurūpāṇyapi na pratirūpāṇyapi bhavanti /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat pañca bhagavan ānantaryāṇi karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni asya manaḥ duścaritasya vāc duścaritasya ca na na anurūpāṇi api na pratirūpāṇi api bhavanti
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, the five heinous actions that have been done and accumulated are not even similar to, not even comparable to, not even analogous to this mental misconduct and verbal misconduct.

analyzed: bhagavān āha evam etat śāriputra evam etat
translated: The Blessed One said, So it is, Śāriputra. So it is.

original: pañcānantaryāṇi śāriputra karmāṇi kṛtānyupacitānyasya manoduścaritasya ca vāgduścaritasya ca na prativarṇikānyapi na anurūpāṇyapi na pratirūpāṇyapi asya karmaṇaḥ kṛtasya saṃcitasya ācitasya upacitasya /
analyzed: pañca ānantaryāṇi śāriputra karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni asya manaḥ duścaritasya ca vāc duścaritasya ca na na anurūpāṇi api na pratirūpāṇi api asya karmaṇaḥ kṛtasya saṃcitasya ācitasya upacitasya
translated: Śāriputra, the five heinous actions that have been done and accumulated are not even similar to, not even comparable to, not even analogous to this action that has been done and accumulated, stored up, and heaped up.

original: ye kecidimāṃ gambhīrā prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāṃ deśyamānāmupadiśyamānāmuddiśyamānāṃ pratibādhitavyāṃ maṃsyante /🔽pratikṣepsyanti /
analyzed: ye kecid imām gambhīrā prajñāpāramitām bhāṣyamāṇām deśyamānām upadiśyamānām uddiśyamānām pratibādhitavyām maṃsyante  pratikṣepsyanti
translated: Those who, when this profound perfection of wisdom is being taught, explained, demonstrated, and pointed out, will think to oppose it,🔽will reject it,

analyzed: pratikrokṣyanti
translated: will turn away from it,

analyzed: na atra śikṣitavyam iti vakṣyanti
translated: will say 'one should not train in this,'

analyzed: na iyam tathāgata bhāṣitā iti vācam bhāṣiṣyante
translated: and will say 'this is not spoken by the Tathāgata,'

analyzed: tatonyān api sattvān vivecayiṣyanti  te sva saṃtānān upahatya para saṃtānān upahaniṣyanti
translated: Then they will mislead other beings.🔽They will harm their own continuums and harm the continuums of others.

original: te svasaṃtānān saviṣān kṛtvā parasaṃtānān saviṣān kariṣyanti /
analyzed: te sva saṃtānān sa viṣān kṛtvā para saṃtānān sa viṣān kariṣyanti
translated: Having made their own continuums poisonous, they will make the continuums of others poisonous.

analyzed: svayam naṣṭāḥ parān api nāśayiṣyanti
translated: Having themselves perished, they will cause others to perish.

original: svayaṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāmajānānā anavabudhyamānāḥ parānapi grāhayiṣyanti /
analyzed: svayam gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām a jānānāḥ an avabudhyamānāḥ parān api grāhayiṣyanti
translated: Not knowing and not understanding the profound perfection of wisdom themselves, they will cause others to grasp it.

analyzed: na atra śikṣitavyam iti vācam bhāṣiṣyante
translated: They will say, 'One should not train in this.'

analyzed: na aham śāriputra evaṃrūpāṇām pudgalānām darśanam api abhyanujānāmi
translated: Śāriputra, I do not even allow seeing such people,

original: kutastaiḥ saha saṃvāsaṃ kuto vā lābhasatkāraṃ kutaḥ sthānam /
analyzed: kutas taiḥ saha saṃvāsam kutas vā lābha satkāram kutas sthānam
translated: much less living with them, much less gain and honor, much less a seat.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: dharmadūṣakā hi te śāriputra tathārūpāḥ pudgalā veditavyā iti /
analyzed: dharma dūṣakāḥ hi te śāriputra tathārūpāḥ pudgalāḥ veditavyāḥ iti
translated: Śāriputra, such people should be known as corrupters of the Dharma.

analyzed: kasambakajātāḥ te śāriputra tathārūpāḥ pudgalāḥ veditavyāḥ
translated: Śāriputra, such people should be known as born from a mixture,

original: kṛṣṇānirjātikāḥ kṛṣṇāhijātikāste śāriputra tathārūpāḥ pudgalā veditavyāḥ /
analyzed: kṛṣṇā nirjātikāḥ kṛṣṇāhi jātikāḥ te śāriputra tathārūpāḥ pudgalāḥ veditavyāḥ
translated: born from a black womb, born from a black lineage.

original: teṣāṃ śāriputra tathārūpāṇāṃ pudgālānāṃ ye śrotavyaṃ maṃsyante /
analyzed: teṣām śāriputra tathārūpāṇām pudgālānām ye śrotavyam maṃsyante
translated: Śāriputra, all those who will think to listen to such persons

analyzed: sarve te anayena vyasanam āpatsyante
translated: will all come to ruin through this.

analyzed: ye ca śāriputra prajñāpāramitām dūṣayanti
translated: Śāriputra, those who slander the perfection of wisdom

original: ime te śāriputra dharmadūṣakāḥ pudgalā veditavyāḥ /🔽śāriputra āhana bhagavatā tasya pudgalasya tatropapannasya mahānirayagatasyātmabhāvasya pramāṇamākhyātam /
analyzed: ime te śāriputra dharma dūṣakāḥ pudgalāḥ veditavyāḥ  śāriputraḥ bhagavatā tasya pudgalasya tatra upapannasya mahāniraya gatasya ātma bhāvasya pramāṇam ākhyātam
translated: should be known, Śāriputra, as persons who slander the Dharma.🔽Śāriputra said, The Blessed One has not declared the measure of the body of that person who has been reborn there in the great hell.

original: bhagavānāhatiṣṭhatu śāriputra tasya pudgalasya tatropapannasya mahānirayagatasyātmabhāvasya pramāṇam /
analyzed: bhagavān āha tiṣṭhatu śāriputra tasya pudgalasya tatra upapannasya mahāniraya gatasya ātma bhāvasya pramāṇam
translated: The Blessed One said, Let that measure of the body of that person who has been reborn there in the great hell be set aside, Śāriputra.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: mā tathārūpasya pudgalasya tadātmabhāvasya pramāṇaṃ śrutvā uṣṇaṃ rūdhiraṃ mukhādāgacchet /
analyzed: mā tathārūpasya pudgalasya tad ātma bhāvasya pramāṇam śrutvā uṣṇam rūdhiram mukhāt āgacchet
translated: Do not let hot blood gush from the mouth upon hearing the measure of the body of such a person.

analyzed: maraṇam vā nigacchet
translated: Do not let him die.

analyzed: maraṇa mātrakam vā duḥkham āgāḍham ābādham spṛśet
translated: Do not let him experience intense suffering, sickness, or affliction.

analyzed: dahyeta vā
translated: Do not let him be burned.

analyzed: śoka śalyaḥ vai asya āviśet
translated: Do not let the dart of grief pierce him.

analyzed: mahā prapātam vā prapatet
translated: Do not let him fall into a great abyss.

analyzed: upaśuṣyeta vā mlāyeta vā
translated: Do not let him wither away or fade.

original: maiva mahāpratibhayaṃ tasyātmabhāvasya pramāṇamaśrauṣīdyasyeme doṣāḥ saṃvidyante //
analyzed: mā eva mahā pratibhayam tasya ātma bhāvasya pramāṇam aśrauṣīt yasya ime doṣāḥ saṃvidyante
translated: Do not think that the extent of the body of one in whom these faults exist is not extremely fearful.

original: na bhagavānāyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasyāvakāśaṃ karotiiyattasyātmabhāvasya pramāṇaṃ bhaviṣyatīti /
analyzed: na bhagavān āyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasya avakāśam karoti iyat tasya ātma bhāvasya pramāṇam bhaviṣyati iti
translated: The Blessed One does not give the venerable Śāriputra an opportunity to say, The extent of that body will be so much.

original: dvitīyakamapi tṛtīyakamapyāyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavantametadavocatākhyātu me bhagavāṃstasya pudgalasyātmabhāvasya pramāṇam /
analyzed: dvitīyakam api tṛtīyakam api āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocata ākhyātu me bhagavān tasya pudgalasya ātma bhāvasya pramāṇam
translated: For a second and third time, the venerable Śāriputra said to the Blessed One, May the Blessed One tell me the extent of that person's body.

original: paścimāyā janatāyā ālokaḥ kṛto bhaviṣyatianena vāṅbhanaḥkarmaṇā kṛtena saṃcitenopacitenopacitena evaṃ mahāntaṃ mahānirayeṣvātmabhāvaṃ parigṛhṇīteti
analyzed: paścimāyāḥ janatāyāḥ ālokaḥ kṛtaḥ bhaviṣyati anena vāc bhanaḥ karmaṇā kṛtena saṃcitena upacitena upacitena evam mahāntam mahānirayeṣu ātma bhāvam parigṛhṇīta iti
translated: It will be a light for future generations that by such verbal and mental misconduct, by such unwholesome actions, having done, accumulated, and increased them, one takes on such a great body in the great hells.

original: bhagavānāhaeṣa eva śāriputra paścimāyā janatāyā ālokaḥ kṛto bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: bhagavān āha eṣaḥ eva śāriputra paścimāyāḥ janatāyāḥ ālokaḥ kṛtaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: The Blessed One said, This alone, Śāriputra, will be a light for future generations.

original: yadanena vāṅbhanoduścaritena akuśalena karmābhisaṃskāreṇa abhisaṃskṛtena saṃcitenācitenopacitena iyacciraduḥkhaṃ pratyanubhaviṣyatīti /
analyzed: yat anena vāc bhanaḥ duścaritena akuśalena karma abhisaṃskāreṇa abhisaṃskṛtena saṃcitena ācitena upacitena iyat cira duḥkham pratyanubhaviṣyati iti
translated: That by such verbal and mental misconduct, by such unwholesome actions, having done, accumulated, and increased them, one will experience such long-lasting suffering.

original: yā etasyaiva śāriputra duḥkhasyāprameyatā bahuduḥkhatā vyākhyātā /
analyzed: yā etasya eva śāriputra duḥkhasya aprameya tā bahu duḥkha tā vyākhyātā
translated: Śāriputra, this very immeasurable suffering and great suffering has been explained.

original: eṣa eva śuklāṃśikasya kulaputrasya kuladuhiturvā saṃvego bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: eṣaḥ eva śukla aṃśikasya kula putrasya kula duhituḥ vā saṃvegaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: This very [immeasurable suffering] will be a cause of remorse for the son or daughter of good family who is on the side of virtue.

original: tataḥ sa tebhyo dharmavyasanasaṃvartanīyebhyaḥ karmabhyo vinivṛtya puṇyābhisaṃskārameva kuryāt /
analyzed: tatas sa tebhyaḥ dharma vyasana saṃvartanīyebhyaḥ karmabhyaḥ vinivṛtya puṇya abhisaṃskāram eva kuryāt
translated: Then, turning away from those actions that lead to the destruction of the Dharma, he should only create the accumulation of merit.

original: jīvitahetorapi saddharmaṃ na pratikṣepsyatimā bhūdasmākamapi tādṛśairduḥkhai samavadhānamiti //
analyzed: jīvita hetoḥ api saddharmam na pratikṣepsyati mā bhūt asmākam api tādṛśaiḥ duḥkhaiḥ samavadhānam iti
translated: Even for the sake of life, he should not reject the true Dharma, thinking that such suffering might befall us.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān subhūtirbhagavantametadavocatsusaṃvṛtakāyakarmavākkarmamanaskarmaṇā bhagavan kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā bhavitavyam /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat su saṃvṛta kāya karma vāc karma manaḥ karmaṇā bhagavan kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā bhavitavyam
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, a son or daughter of good family should be very restrained in body, speech, and mind.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: yatra hi nāma bhagavan evaṃrūpeṇa vāgdurbhāṣitena iyān mahāpuṇyaskandhaḥ prasūyate /
analyzed: yatra hi nāma bhagavan evaṃrūpeṇa vāc durbhāṣitena iyān mahā puṇya skandhaḥ prasūyate
translated: Blessed One, in this way, from such ill-spoken words, such a great mass of merit is produced.

original: katamena punarbhagavan karmaṇā iyān mahāpuṇyaskandhaḥ prasūyate /
analyzed: katamena punar bhagavan karmaṇā iyān mahā puṇya skandhaḥ prasūyate
translated: Blessed One, by which action is such a great mass of merit produced?

original: bhagavānāhaevaṃrūpeṇa subhūte vāgdurbhāṣitena iyān mahāpuṇyaskandhaḥ prasūyate /
analyzed: bhagavān āha evaṃrūpeṇa subhūte vāc durbhāṣitena iyān mahā puṇya skandhaḥ prasūyate
translated: The Blessed One said, Subhuti, such evil speech will produce such a great mass of merit.

original: ihaiva te subhūte mohapuruṣāḥ svākhyāte dharmavinaye pravrajitā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: iha eva te subhūte moha puruṣāḥ su ākhyāte dharma vinaye pravrajitāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Subhuti, right here in this well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya, those deluded people will become renunciants.

original: ya imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ dūṣayitavyāṃ maṃsyante /🔽pratikṣeptavyāṃ maṃsyante /
analyzed: ye imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām dūṣayitavyām maṃsyante  pratikṣeptavyām maṃsyante
translated: Those who will think to criticize this profound perfection of wisdom,🔽who will think to reject it,

analyzed: pratibādhitavyām maṃsyante
translated: who will think to oppose it.

original: prajñāpāramitāyāṃ ca pratibādhitāyāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ buddhabodhiḥ pratibādhitā bhavati /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām ca pratibādhitāyām buddhānām bhagavatām buddha bodhiḥ pratibādhitā bhavati
translated: And when the perfection of wisdom is opposed, the enlightenment of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, is opposed.

original: buddhabodhau pratibādhitāyāmatītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ sarvajñatā pratibādhitā bhavati /
analyzed: buddha bodhau pratibādhitāyām atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām buddhānām bhagavatām sarvajña tā pratibādhitā bhavati
translated: When the enlightenment of the Buddhas is opposed, the omniscience of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, of the past, future, and present is opposed.

analyzed: sarvajña tāyām pratibādhitāyām saddharmaḥ pratibādhitaḥ bhavati
translated: When omniscience is opposed, the true Dharma is opposed.

analyzed: saddharme pratibādhite tathāgata śrāvaka saṃghaḥ pratibādhitaḥ bhavati
translated: When the true Dharma is opposed, the Sangha of the Tathagata's disciples is opposed.

original: tathāgataśrāvakasaṃghe'pi pratibādhite evaṃ tasya sarveṇa sarvaṃ sarvathā sarvaṃ triratnātparibāhyabhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: tathāgata śrāvaka saṃghe api pratibādhite evam tasya sarveṇa sarvam sarvathā sarvam triratnāt paribāhya bhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: Similarly, when the Saṅgha of the Tathāgata's disciples is also obstructed, in that way he completely and totally becomes completely separated from the Three Jewels in every way.

analyzed: aprameya asaṃkhyeyataraḥ ca mahān akuśala karma abhisaṃskāraḥ parigṛhītaḥ bhavati
translated: And he takes on an immeasurable and incalculably great heap of demerit.

original: evamukte āyuṣmān subhūtirbhagavantametadavocatko'tra bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayo yatsa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ pratibādhitavyāṃ
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat kaḥ utra bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ yat sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām pratibādhitavyām
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One, What is the cause and what is the condition, Blessed One, for that son of a good family or daughter of a good family to obstruct this perfection of wisdom?

original: bhagavānāhamārādhiṣṭhito vā subhūte sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: bhagavān āham ārā dhiṣṭhitaḥ vā subhūte sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā bhaviṣyati
translated: The Blessed One said, Subhūti, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family will be possessed by Māra.

original: duṣprajñasaṃvartanīyena vā karmaṇā gambhīreṣu dharmeṣu nāsya śraddhā /
analyzed: duṣprajña saṃvartanīyena vā karmaṇā gambhīreṣu dharmeṣu na asya śraddhā
translated: Or he will have demerit-producing karma, and he will have no faith in the profound dharmas.

analyzed: na asya prasādaḥ
translated: He will have no serenity.

original: ābhyāṃ subhūte dvābhyāṃ pāpābhyāṃ dharmābhyāṃ samanvāgataḥ sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ pratibādhiṣyate /
analyzed: ābhyām subhūte dvābhyām pāpābhyām dharmābhyām samanvāgataḥ sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām pratibādhiṣyate
translated: Subhūti, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family, endowed with these two sinful dharmas, will obstruct this perfection of wisdom.

original: punaraparaṃ subhūte sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā pāpamitrahastagato vā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā pāpa mitra hasta gataḥ vā bhaviṣyati
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family will have fallen into the hands of bad friends.

analyzed: an abhiyuktaḥ vā bhaviṣyati
translated: Or they will be unengaged.

analyzed: skandha abhiniviṣṭaḥ vā bhaviṣyati
translated: Or they will be attached to the aggregates.

original: ātmotkarṣī pareṣāṃ paṃsako doṣāntaraprekṣī vā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ātma utkarṣī pareṣām paṃsakaḥ doṣa antara prekṣī vā bhaviṣyati
translated: Or they will be self-aggrandizing, disparaging others, and looking for faults in others.

original: ebhirapi subhūte caturbhirākāraiḥ sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā samanvāgato bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ebhiḥ api subhūte caturbhiḥ ākāraiḥ sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā samanvāgataḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Subhuti, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family will be endowed with these four aspects.

original: ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāṃ deśyamānāmupadiśyamānāṃ pratibādhitavyāṃ maṃsyate iti //
analyzed: yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām bhāṣyamāṇām deśyamānām upadiśyamānām pratibādhitavyām maṃsyate iti
translated: Who, when this perfection of wisdom is being taught, explained, and shown, will think to oppose it.

analyzed: ārya aṣṭasāhasrikāyām prajñāpāramitāyām nirayaparivartaḥ nāma saptamaḥ
translated: In the noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines, the seventh chapter is named The Chapter on Hells.

analyzed: viśuddhiparivartaḥ uṣṭamaḥ
translated: The eighth chapter is named The Chapter on Purity.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān subhūtirbhagavantametadavocatduradhimocā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā anabhiyuktena kuśalamūlavirahitena pāpamitrahastagatena
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat duradhimocā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā anabhiyuktena kuśala mūla virahitena pāpa mitra hasta gatena
translated: Then the Venerable Subhuti said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is difficult to fathom for one who is unengaged, devoid of wholesome roots, and in the hands of bad friends.

analyzed: bhagavān āha evam etat subhūte evam etat
translated: The Blessed One said: So it is, Subhuti, so it is.

original: duradhimocā subhūte prajñāpāramitā anabhiyuktena parīttakuśalamūlena durmedhasā anarthikena alpaśrutena hīnaprajñena pāpamitropastabdhena aśuśrūṣaṇāparipṛcchakajātīyena kuśaleṣu dharmeṣvanabhiyuktena //
analyzed: duradhimocā subhūte prajñāpāramitā anabhiyuktena parītta kuśala mūlena durmedhasā anarthikena alpa śrutena hīna prajñena pāpa mitra upastabdhena a śuśrūṣaṇa a paripṛcchaka jātīyena kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu anabhiyuktena
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom is difficult to comprehend for one who is not diligent, who has little wholesome root, who is of little intelligence, who is not interested, who has little learning, who has inferior wisdom, who is supported by bad friends, who is of a type that does not listen or ask questions, and who is not diligent in wholesome dharmas.

analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha kiyat gambhīrā bata iyam bhagavan prajñāpāramitā duradhimoca tayā
translated: Subhūti said, How profound, Blessed One, is this perfection of wisdom, in that it is difficult to comprehend.

analyzed: bhagavān āha rūpam subhūte abaddham amuktam
translated: The Blessed One said, Subhūti, form is not bound, not liberated.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: rūpa asvabhāva tvāt subhūte rūpam abaddham amuktam  evam vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ
translated: Subhūti, form is not bound, not liberated, because the intrinsic nature of form is empty.

analyzed: vijñānam subhūte abaddham amuktam
translated: Similarly, Subhūti, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not bound, not liberated.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: vijñāna asvabhāva tvāt subhūte vijñānam abaddham amuktam  rūpasya subhūte pūrva antaḥ
translated: Subhūti, consciousness is not bound, not liberated, because the intrinsic nature of consciousness is empty.

analyzed: baddhaḥ muktaḥ
translated: Subhūti, the prior limit of form is not bound, not liberated.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: pūrvāntāsvabhāvaṃ hi subhūte rūpam /🔽rūpasya subhūte aparānto'
analyzed: pūrva anta asvabhāvam hi subhūte rūpam  rūpasya subhūte
translated: Subhūti, the prior limit of form is empty of the intrinsic nature of the prior limit.

analyzed: baddhaḥ muktaḥ
translated: Subhūti, the later limit of form is not bound, not liberated.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: apara anta asvabhāvam hi subhūte rūpam
translated: Subhūti, the later limit of form is empty of the intrinsic nature of the later limit.

analyzed: pratyutpannam subhūte rūpam abaddha muktam
translated: Subhūti, present form is neither bound nor liberated.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

analyzed: pratyutpanna asvabhāvam hi subhūte pratyutpannam rūpam
translated: Subhūti, the present nature of form is the present form.

analyzed: evam vedanā saṃjñām saṃskārāḥ
translated: Similarly, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

analyzed: vijñānasya subhūte pūrva antaḥ
translated: Subhūti, the past of consciousness is

analyzed: baddhaḥ muktaḥ
translated: neither bound nor liberated.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: pūrvāntāsvabhāvaṃ hi subhūte vijñānam /🔽vijñānasya subhūte aparānto'
analyzed: pūrva anta asvabhāvam hi subhūte vijñānam  vijñānasya subhūte
translated: Subhūti, the past nature of consciousness is the past consciousness.🔽Subhūti, the future of consciousness is

analyzed: baddhaḥ muktaḥ
translated: neither bound nor liberated.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ  apara anta asvabhāvam hi subhūte vijñānam
translated: What is the reason for that?🔽Subhūti, the future nature of consciousness is the future consciousness.

analyzed: pratyutpannam subhūte vijñānam abaddham amuktam
translated: Subhūti, the present consciousness is neither bound nor liberated.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: pratyutpannāsvabhāvaṃ hi subhūte pratyutpannaṃ vijñānam //🔽subhūtirāhaduradhimocā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: pratyutpanna asvabhāvam hi subhūte pratyutpannam vijñānam  subhūtiḥ āha duradhimocā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: Subhūti, the present nature of consciousness is the present consciousness.🔽Subhūti said, The perfection of wisdom is difficult to comprehend, Blessed One.

original: paramaduradhimocā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā anabhiyuktena anavaropitakuśalamūlena pāpamitrahastagatena māravaśagatena kusīdena hīnavīryeṇa muṣitasmṛtinā duṣprajñena /
analyzed: parama duradhimocā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā anabhiyuktena an avaropita kuśala mūlena pāpa mitra hasta gatena māra vaśa gatena kusīdena hīna vīryeṇa muṣita smṛtinā duṣprajñena
translated: The perfection of wisdom is extremely difficult to comprehend, Blessed One, for one who is not diligent, who has not planted the roots of virtue, who is in the hands of bad friends, who is under the power of Māra, who is lazy, who has inferior vigor, who has lost mindfulness, and who has poor wisdom.

analyzed: bhagavān āha evam etat subhūte evam etat
translated: The Blessed One said, So it is, Subhuti! So it is!

analyzed: duradhimocā subhūte prajñāpāramitā
translated: The perfection of wisdom is difficult to comprehend, Subhuti.

original: paramaduradhimocā subhūte prajñāpāramitā anabhiyuktena anavaropitakuśalamūlena pāpamitrahastagatena māravaśagatena kusīdena hīnavīryeṇa muṣitasmṛtinā duṣprajñena /
analyzed: parama duradhimocā subhūte prajñāpāramitā anabhiyuktena an avaropita kuśala mūlena pāpa mitra hasta gatena māra vaśa gatena kusīdena hīna vīryeṇa muṣita smṛtinā duṣprajñena
translated: The perfection of wisdom is extremely difficult to comprehend for one who is not diligent, who has not planted wholesome roots, who is in the hands of bad friends, who is under the power of Mara, who is lazy, who has inferior vigor, who has lost mindfulness, and who has poor wisdom.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: yā subhūte rūpa viśuddhiḥ  sā phala viśuddhiḥ
translated: Subhuti, the purity of form🔽is the purity of the fruit.

analyzed: yā phala viśuddhiḥ
translated: The purity of the fruit

analyzed: sā rūpa viśuddhiḥ
translated: is the purity of form.

original: iti hi subhūte rūpaviśuddhiśca phalaviśuddhiśca advayametadadvaidhīkāramabhinnamacchinnam /
analyzed: iti hi subhūte rūpa viśuddhiḥ ca phala viśuddhiḥ ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram abhinnam acchinnam
translated: Thus, Subhuti, the purity of form and the purity of the fruit are non-dual, not divided, not discriminated, and not cut off.

original: iti hi subhūte phalaviśuddhito rūpaviśuddhī rupaviśuddhitaḥ phalaviśuddhiḥ /
analyzed: iti hi subhūte phala viśuddhitaḥ rūpa viśuddhiḥ rūpa viśuddhitaḥ phala viśuddhiḥ
translated: Thus, Subhuti, from the purity of the fruit comes the purity of form, and from the purity of form comes the purity of the fruit.

analyzed: evam vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ
translated: The same applies to feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

analyzed: yā subhūte vijñāna viśuddhiḥ
translated: Subhuti, the purity of consciousness

analyzed: sā phala viśuddhiḥ
translated: is the purity of the fruit.🔽The purity of the fruit

analyzed: yā phala viśuddhiḥ sā vijñāna viśuddhiḥ
translated: is the purity of consciousness.

original: iti hi subhūte vijñānaviśuddhiśca phalaviśuddhiśca advayametadadvaidhīkāramabhinnamacchinnam /
analyzed: iti hi subhūte vijñāna viśuddhiḥ ca phala viśuddhiḥ ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram abhinnam acchinnam
translated: Thus, Subhūti, the purity of consciousness and the purity of the fruit are non-dual, not divided, unbroken, and unconnected.

original: iti hi subhūte phalaviśuddhito vijñānaviśuddhirvijñānaviśuddhitaḥ phalaviśuddhiḥ /
analyzed: iti hi subhūte phala viśuddhitaḥ vijñāna viśuddhiḥ vijñāna viśuddhitaḥ phala viśuddhiḥ
translated: Thus, Subhūti, the purity of consciousness is from the purity of the fruit, and the purity of the fruit is from the purity of consciousness.

original: punaraparaṃ subhūte yā rūpaviśuddhiḥ sā sarvajñatāviśuddhiḥ /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte yā rūpa viśuddhiḥ sā sarvajña tā viśuddhiḥ
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, the purity of form is the purity of omniscience.

analyzed: yā sarvajña tā viśuddhiḥ sā rūpa viśuddhiḥ
translated: The purity of omniscience is the purity of form.

original: iti hi subhūte rūpaviśuddhiśca sarvajñatāviśuddhiśca advayametadadvaidhīkāramabhinnamacchinnam /
analyzed: iti hi subhūte rūpa viśuddhiḥ ca sarvajña tā viśuddhiḥ ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram abhinnam acchinnam
translated: Thus, Subhūti, the purity of form and the purity of omniscience are non-dual, not divided, unbroken, and unconnected.

analyzed: iti hi subhūte sarvajña tā viśuddhitaḥ rūpa viśuddhiḥ
translated: Thus, Subhūti, the purity of form is from the purity of omniscience.

analyzed: rūpa viśuddhitaḥ sarvajña tā viśuddhiḥ
translated: The purity of omniscience is from the purity of form.

analyzed: evam vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ
translated: The same is true for feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

analyzed: yā subhūte vijñāna viśuddhiḥ sā sarvajña tā viśuddhiḥ
translated: Subhūti, the purity of consciousness is the purity of omniscience.

analyzed: yā sarvajña tā viśuddhiḥ sā vijñāna viśuddhiḥ
translated: The purity of omniscience is the purity of consciousness.

original: iti hi subhūte vijñānaviśuddhiśca sarvajñatāviśuddhiśca advayametadadvaidhīkāramabhinnamacchinnam /
analyzed: iti hi subhūte vijñāna viśuddhiḥ ca sarvajña tā viśuddhiḥ ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram abhinnam acchinnam
translated: Thus, Subhūti, the purity of consciousness and the purity of omniscience are non-dual, not divided, unbroken, and unconnected.

analyzed: iti hi subhūte sarvajña tā viśuddhitaḥ vijñāna viśuddhiḥ
translated: Thus, Subhuti, the purification of consciousness is due to the purification of omniscience.

analyzed: atyanta viśuddham iti abhisaṃbhotsyate

analyzed: ākāśa viśuddhitaḥ subhūte pariśuddhā prajñāpāramitā

analyzed: bahūni subhūte tasya kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā devatā sahasrāṇi pṛṣṭhatas pṛṣṭhatas nubaddhāni bhaviṣyanti

translated: Moreover, Subhūti, there will be many obstacles for this deep perfection of wisdom when it is being written down, when it is being received, when it is being borne in mind, when it is being recited, when it is being mastered, when it is being made into a teaching, when it is being explained, when it is being expounded, when it is being properly attended to, and when it is being recited.

translated: They are present for the non-arising, non-cessation, non-defilement, and non-destruction of all dharmas.

analyzed: na ca subhūte prajñāpāramitā kaṃcid dharmam ālīyate

analyzed: na kaṃcid dharmam saṃkliśyate

analyzed: na kaṃcid dharmam parigṛhṇāti
translated: It does not grasp any dharma.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ

original: tathā hi subhūte sarve te dharmā na saṃvidyante nopalabhyante /🔽anupalabdhitaḥ subhūte anupaliptā prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: tathā hi subhūte sarve te dharmāḥ na saṃvidyante na upalabhyante  anupalabdhitaḥ subhūte an upaliptā prajñāpāramitā
translated: Subhūti, it is because all those dharmas do not exist and are not perceived.🔽Subhūti, due to non-perception, the perfection of wisdom is unstained.

analyzed: an upaliptā iti subhūte iyam prajñāpāramitā
translated: Subhūti, this is the unstained perfection of wisdom.

original: tathā hi subhūte rūpanirupalepatayā anupalipteyaṃ prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: tathā hi subhūte rūpa nirupalepa tayā an upaliptā iyam prajñāpāramitā

analyzed: evam vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ
translated: Likewise, it is because of the non-staining of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness that this perfection of wisdom is unstained.

analyzed: vijñāna nirupalepa tayā subhūte an upaliptā iyam prajñāpāramitā
translated: Subhūti, it is because of the non-staining of form that this perfection of wisdom is unstained.

original: sacedevamapi subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na saṃjānīte /
analyzed: saced evam api subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na saṃjānīte
translated: If, Subhūti, the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva does not cognize even in this way,

analyzed: carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: he practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: sā khalu punariyaṃ subhūte prajñāpāramitā na kasyaciddharmasyāveśikā vā niveśikā vā saṃdarśikā vā nidarśikā vā āvāhikā vā nirvāhikā vā //
analyzed: sā khalu punar iyam subhūte prajñāpāramitā na kasyacid dharmasya āveśikā vā niveśikā vā saṃdarśikā vā nidarśikā vā āvāhikā vā nirvāhikā vā
translated: Moreover, this perfection of wisdom does not cause the inclusion, or the exclusion, or the demonstration, or the indication, or the bringing in, or the taking away of any dharma at all.

original: atha khalu saṃbahulāni devaputrasahasrāṇi antarīkṣe kilakilāprakṣveḍitena cailavikṣepānakārṣuḥ /

translated: Then many thousands of gods in the sky shouted kīlikīla and waved their garments,

original: dvitīyaṃ batedaṃ dharmacakrapravartanaṃ jambūdvīpe paśyāma iti cāvocan /
analyzed: dvitīyam bata idam dharma cakra pravartanam jambūdvīpe paśyāmaḥ iti ca avocan
translated: saying, We see this second turning of the wheel of Dharma in Jambudvīpa.

original: atha khalu bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ subhūtiṃ sthavirametadavocatnedaṃ subhūte dvitīyaṃ dharmacakrapravartanaṃ nāpi kasyaciddharmasya pravartanaṃ vā nivartanaṃ vā /

translated: Then the Blessed One said to the elder Subhūti, Subhūti, this is not a second turning of the wheel of Dharma, nor is it the turning or the stopping of any dharma at all.

analyzed: evam iyam subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitā
translated: Thus, Subhūti, this is the perfection of wisdom of a bodhisattva-mahāsattva.

analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat mahā pāramitā iyam bhagavan tasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya

analyzed: yasya asaṅga tā sarva dharmeṣu

analyzed: yaḥ saḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhu kāmaḥ na ca kaṃcid dharmam abhisaṃbudhyate

analyzed: dharmacakram ca pravartayiṣyati

analyzed: na ca kaṃcid dharmam saṃdarśayiṣyati

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: na api kaścid dharmam pravartayiṣyati

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: na api kaṃcid dharmam nivartayiṣyati

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: prakṛti vivikta tvāt sarva dharmāṇām

analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat evam etat subhūte evam etat  na hi subhūte śūnyatā pravartate vā nivartate vā  na api subhūte ānimittam pravartate vā nivartate vā
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti, So it is, Subhūti, so it is.🔽Subhūti, emptiness does not turn or return.🔽Subhūti, the signless does not turn or return.

original: nāpi subhūte apraṇihitaṃ pravartate vā nivartate vā /
analyzed: na api subhūte apraṇihitam pravartate vā nivartate vā

analyzed: yā subhūte evam deśanā
translated: Subhūti, this kind of teaching

analyzed: iyam sā sarva dharmāṇām deśanā  na eva ca kenacid deśitā

analyzed: na api kenacid śrutā  na api kenacid pratīcchitā  na api kenacid sākṣātkṛtā
translated: nor is it heard by anyone,🔽nor is it accepted by anyone,🔽nor is it realized by anyone,

analyzed: na api kenacid sākṣātkriyate

analyzed: na api kenacid sākṣātkariṣyate

analyzed: na api anayā dharma deśanayā kaścid parinirvṛtaḥ na api parinirvāsyati na api parinirvāti

analyzed: na api anayā dharma deśanayā kaścid dakṣiṇīyaḥ kṛtaḥ

analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocata asat pāramitā iyam bhagavan ākāśa sattām upādāya

analyzed: asamasama tā pāramitā iyam bhagavan sarva dharma anupalabdhi tām upādāya

analyzed: vivikta pāramitā iyam bhagavan atyanta śūnyatām upādāya

analyzed: an avamṛdya pāramitā iyam bhagavan sarva dharma anupalabdhi tām upādāya

analyzed: a pada pāramitā iyam bhagavan a nāma a śarīra tām upādāya

analyzed: asvabhāva pāramitā iyam bhagavan anāgatim agatim upādāya

analyzed: avacana pāramitā iyam bhagavan sarva dharma a vikalpa tām upādāya

analyzed: anāma pāramitā iyam bhagavan skandha anupalabdhi tām upādāya  a gamana pāramitā iyam bhagavan sarva dharma āgamana tām upādāya
translated: This perfection is nameless, Blessed One, because of the non-apprehension of the aggregates.🔽This perfection is non-going, Blessed One, because of the non-going of all dharmas.

analyzed: asaṃhārya pāramitā iyam bhagavan sarva dharma agrāhya tām upādāya

analyzed: akṣaya pāramitā iyam bhagavan akṣaya dharma yoga tām upādāya

analyzed: anutpatti pāramitā iyam bhagavan sarva dharma an abhinirvṛtti tām upādāya

translated: This is the perfection of non-affliction, Blessed One, because of the nature of non-existence of passion, hatred, and delusion.🔽 This is the perfection of non-purification, Blessed One, because of the non-apprehension of a basis.

analyzed: anupalepa pāramitā iyam bhagavan ākāśa anupalepa tām upādāya

analyzed: a prapañca pāramitā iyam bhagavan sarva dharma manana samatikrama tām upādāya

analyzed: a manana pāramitā iyam bhagavan aniñjana tām upādāya
translated: This is the perfection of non-reflection, Blessed One, because of non-agitation.

analyzed: acalita pāramitā iyam bhagavan dharmadhātu sthiti tām upādāya  virāga pāramitā iyam bhagavan sarva dharma avitatha tām upādāya
translated: This is the perfection of non-movement, Blessed One, because of the stability of the dharma-element.🔽 This is the perfection of dispassion, Blessed One, because of the non-falseness of all dharmas.

analyzed: a samutthāna pāramitā iyam bhagavan sarva dharma nirvikalpa tām upādāya
translated: This is the perfection of non-arising, Blessed One, because of the non-discrimination of all dharmas.

analyzed: śānta pāramitā iyam bhagavan sarva dharma nimitta anupalabdhi tām upādāya
translated: This is the perfection of peace, Blessed One, because of the non-apprehension of the signs of all dharmas.

analyzed: nirdoṣa pāramitā iyam bhagavan guṇa pāramitām upādāya

analyzed: niḥkleśa pāramitā iyam bhagavan parikalpa asattām upādāya

analyzed: niḥsattva pāramitā iyam bhagavan bhūtakoṭi tām upādāya

analyzed: apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bhagavan sarva dharma samutthāna asamutthāna tām upādāya
translated: This perfection is immeasurable, Blessed One, because of the non-arising of all dharmas.

analyzed: anta dvaya ananugama pāramitā iyam bhagavan sarva dharma an abhiniveśana tām upādāya
translated: This perfection does not follow the two extremes, Blessed One, because of the non-fixation on all dharmas.

analyzed: asaṃbhinna pāramitā iyam bhagavan sarva dharma a saṃbhedana tām upādāya

analyzed: aparāmṛṣṭa pāramitā iyam bhagavan sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddha bhūmi a spṛhaṇa tām upādāya

analyzed: a vikalpa pāramitā iyam bhagavan vikalpa samatām upādāya  aprameya pāramitā iyam bhagavan apramāṇa dharmatām upādāya
translated: This perfection is without conceptualization, Blessed One, because of the equality of conceptualization.🔽This perfection is immeasurable, Blessed One, because of the immeasurable nature of dharmas.

analyzed: asaṅga pāramitā iyam bhagavan sarva dharma asaṅga tām upādāya
translated: This perfection is without attachment, Blessed One, because of the non-attachment of all dharmas.

analyzed: anitya pāramitā iyam bhagavan sarva dharma asaṃskṛta tām upādāya
translated: This perfection is impermanent, Blessed One, because of the unconditioned nature of all dharmas.

analyzed: duḥkha pāramitā iyam bhagavan ākāśa sama dharmatām upādāya
translated: This perfection is suffering, Blessed One, because of the nature of dharmas that is like space.

analyzed: śūnya pāramitā iyam bhagavan sarva dharma anupalabdhi tām upādāya  anātma pāramitā iyam bhagavan sarva dharma an abhiniveśana tām upādāya
translated: This is the perfection of emptiness, Blessed One, because of the non-apprehension of all dharmas.🔽This is the perfection of non-self, Blessed One, because of the non-fixation on all dharmas.

analyzed: alakṣaṇa pāramitā iyam bhagavan sarva dharma an abhinirvṛtti tām upādāya
translated: This is the perfection of the signless, Blessed One, because of the non-arising of all dharmas.

analyzed: sarva śūnyatā pāramitā iyam bhagavan ananta aparyanta tām upādāya
translated: This is the perfection of the emptiness of all, Blessed One, because of the endless and boundless.

analyzed: smṛti upasthāna ādi bodhi pakṣa dharma pāramitā iyam bhagavan teṣām anupalabdhi tām upādāya

analyzed: śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita pāramitā iyam bhagavan tri vimokṣa mukha anupalabdhi tām upādāya

analyzed: aṣṭa vimokṣa pāramitā iyam bhagavan teṣām anupalabdhi tām upādāya
translated: This is the perfection of the eight liberations, Blessed One, because of the non-apprehension of those.

analyzed: nava anupūrva vihāra pāramitā iyam bhagavan prathama dhyāna ādīnām anupalabdhi tām upādāya
translated: This is the perfection of the nine successive abodes, Blessed One, because of the non-apprehension of the first dhyana, etc.

analyzed: catur satya pāramitā iyam bhagavan duḥkha ādīnām anupalabdhi tām upādāya
translated: This is the perfection of the four truths, Blessed One, because of the non-apprehension of suffering, etc.

analyzed: daśa pāramitā iyam bhagavan dāna ādīnām anupalabdhi tām upādāya
translated: This is the perfection of the ten perfections, Blessed One, because of the non-apprehension of giving, etc.

analyzed: bala pāramitā iyam bhagavan an avamṛdya tām upādāya
translated: This is the perfection of power, Blessed One, because of being indestructible.

analyzed: vaiśāradya pāramitā iyam bhagavan atyanta anavalīna tām upādāya  pratisaṃvid pāramitā iyam bhagavan sarvajña tā saṅga a pratighāti tām upādāya
translated: This is the perfection of fearlessness, Blessed One, because of being completely fearless.🔽This is the perfection of analytical knowledge, Blessed One, because of being unobstructed in omniscience.

analyzed: sarva buddha dharma āveṇika pāramitā iyam bhagavan gaṇanā samatikrama tām upādāya
translated: This is the perfection of the unique qualities of all Buddhas, Blessed One, because of transcending counting.

analyzed: tathāgata tathatā pāramitā iyam bhagavan sarva dharma avitathatām upādāya
translated: This is the perfection of the suchness of the Tathagata, Blessed One, because of the non-falseness of all dharmas.

analyzed: svayaṃbhū pāramitā iyam bhagavan sarva dharma asvabhāva tām upādāya
translated: This is the perfection of self-existence, Blessed One, because of the naturelessness of all dharmas.

original: sarvajñajñānapāramiteyaṃ bhagavan yaduta prajñāpāramitā sarvadharmasvabhāvasarvākāraparijñānatāmupādāyeti //🔽āryāṣṭasāhasrikāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ stutiparivarto nāma navamaḥ //
analyzed: sarvajña jñāna pāramitā iyam bhagavan yat uta prajñāpāramitā sarva dharma svabhāva sarva ākāra parijñāna tām upādāya iti  ārya aṣṭasāhasrikāyām prajñāpāramitāyām stutiparivartaḥ nāma navamaḥ
translated: This is the perfection of omniscient knowledge, Blessed One, namely the perfection of wisdom, because of the complete knowledge of all aspects of the nature of all dharmas.🔽In the Noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines, the ninth chapter is called Praise.

analyzed: dhāraṇa guṇa parikīrtana parivartaḥ daśamaḥ
translated: The tenth chapter is called The Praise of the Qualities of Retention.

original: atha khalu śakrasya devānāmindrasyaitadabhūtpūrvajinakṛtādhikārāste kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaraśca bhaviṣyanti bahubuddhāvaropitakuśalamūlāḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu śakrasya devānām indrasya etat abhūt pūrva jina kṛta adhikārāḥ te kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ ca bhaviṣyanti bahu buddha avaropita kuśala mūlāḥ
translated: Then this occurred to Śakra, Lord of the Gods: “Those sons of good family and daughters of good family will have served the Victors of the past, and will have planted wholesome roots under many Buddhas.

analyzed: kalyāṇa mitra parigṛhītāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will have been taken hold of by spiritual friends.

original: yeṣāmiyaṃ prajñāpāramitā śrotrāvabhāsamapyāgamiṣyati /🔽kaḥ punarvādo ya enāmevaṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyantyupadekṣyantyuddekṣyanti svādhyāsyanti /
analyzed: yeṣām iyam prajñāpāramitā śrotra avabhāsam api āgamiṣyati  kaḥ punar vādaḥ ye enām evam gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyanti upadekṣyanti uddekṣyanti su ādhyāsyanti
translated: For those to whom this perfection of wisdom will come into the range of hearing,

original: udgṛhya dhārayitvā vācayitvā paryavāpya pravartya deśayitvopadiśyoddiśya svādhyāyya tathatvāya śikṣiṣyante /🔽tathatvāya pratipatsyante /
analyzed: udgṛhya dhārayitvā vācayitvā paryavāpya pravartya deśayitvā upadiśya uddiśya su ādhyāyya tathatvāya śikṣiṣyante  tathatvāya pratipatsyante
translated: how much more so those who will take up this perfection of wisdom, which is so deep, will bear it in mind, recite it, study it, spread it, teach it, explain it, expound it, repeat it, and after taking it up, bearing it in mind, reciting it, studying it, spreading it, teaching it, explaining it, expounding it, repeating it, they will train in it for suchness,🔽they will progress to suchness,

analyzed: tathatvāya yogam āpatsyante
translated: they will apply themselves to suchness.

original: na te avaramātrakeṇa kuśalamūlena samanvāgatā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: na te avara mātrakeṇa kuśala mūlena samanvāgatāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will not be endowed with just a little wholesome root.

analyzed: bahu buddha paryupāsitāḥ te kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: Those sons of good family and daughters of good family will have attended on many Buddhas.

original: paripṛṣṭāḥ paripraśnīkṛtāśca te buddhā bhagavanto bhaviṣyanti kulaputraiḥ kuladuhitṛbhiścaināmeva prajñāpāramitām /
analyzed: paripṛṣṭāḥ paripraśnīkṛtāḥ ca te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ bhaviṣyanti kula putraiḥ kula duhitṛbhiḥ ca enām eva prajñāpāramitām
translated: Those sons and daughters of good family will have asked questions and had their questions answered by those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, about just this perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: śrutā ca iyam paurvakāṇām api tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām antikāt
translated: This has been heard from the former Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones,

analyzed: ye enām prajñāpāramitām etarhi api śroṣyanti
translated: and those who will hear this perfection of wisdom now,

original: śrutvā codgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyantyupadekṣyantyuddekṣyanti svādhyāsyanti /
analyzed: śrutvā ca udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyanti upadekṣyanti uddekṣyanti su ādhyāsyanti
translated: having heard it, will take it up, bear it in mind, recite it, study it, master it, teach it, explain it, expound it, chant it, and repeat it.

analyzed: tathatvāya śikṣiṣyante  tathatvāya pratipatsyante
translated: They will train in accordance with the truth.🔽They will practice in accordance with the truth.

analyzed: tathatvāya yogam āpatsyante
translated: They will apply themselves in accordance with the truth.

analyzed: bahu buddha avaropita kuśala mūlāḥ te kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ ca veditavyāḥ
translated: Those sons and daughters of good family should be known as those who have planted wholesome roots under many Buddhas,

original: ya etasyāmeva gambhīrāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāyāṃ deśyamānāyāmupadiśyamānāyāmuddiśyamānāyāṃ svādhyāyyamānāyāṃ nāvaleṣyante na saṃleṣyante /
analyzed: ye etasyām eva gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām bhāṣyamāṇāyām deśyamānāyām upadiśyamānāyām uddiśyamānāyām su ādhyāyyamānāyām na avaleṣyante na saṃleṣyante
translated: if they do not waver, do not tremble, are not frightened, are not terrified, and do not become terrified when this deep perfection of wisdom is being taught, being shown, being expounded, being revealed, being shown forth, being mastered, being taught, being explained, being expounded, being chanted, and being repeated.

analyzed: na viṣatsyanti na viṣādam āpatsyante
translated: They will not be frightened, they will not be terrified, they will not be overcome by terror.

analyzed: na vipṛṣṭhīkariṣyanti mānasam
translated: They will not turn their minds away.

analyzed: na bhagnapṛṣṭhīkariṣyanti
translated: They will not turn their backs.

analyzed: na utrasiṣyanti na saṃtrasiṣyanti na saṃtrāsam āpatsyante
translated: They will not tremble, they will not be terrified, they will not be overcome by terror.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān śāriputraḥ śakrasya devānāmindrasya imamevaṃrūpaṃ caitasaiva cetaḥparivitarkamājñāya bhagavantametadavocatyo bhagavan ihaivaṃ gambhīrāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāyāṃ deśyamānāyāmupadiśyamānāyāṃ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā abhiśraddadhadavakalpayannadhimucya prasannacitto bodhāya cittamutpādya enāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyatyupadekṣatyuddekṣyati svādhyāsyati /🔽tathatvāya śikṣiṣyate /🔽tathatvāya pratipatsyate /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ śakrasya devānām indrasya imam evaṃrūpam caitasā eva cetaḥ parivitarkam ājñāya bhagavantam etat avocat yaḥ bhagavan iha evam gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām bhāṣyamāṇāyām deśyamānāyām upadiśyamānāyām kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā abhiśraddadhat avakalpayan adhimucya prasanna cittaḥ bodhāya cittam utpādya enām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati  tathatvāya śikṣiṣyate  tathatvāya pratipatsyate
translated: Then the Venerable Śāriputra, understanding with his own mind the thought in the mind of Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, when this profound perfection of wisdom is being taught, being shown, being expounded, if a son of good family or a daughter of good family, having faith, having conviction, having clear faith, having generated the thought of enlightenment, were to take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, master it, teach it, explain it, chant it, memorize it, and recite it to others,🔽they would train in accordance with reality.

analyzed: tathatvāya yogam āpatsyate
translated: They would practice in accordance with reality.🔽They would apply themselves in accordance with reality.

analyzed: yathā a vinivartanīyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tathā sa dhārayitavyaḥ
translated: As the irreversible bodhisattva mahāsattva should be borne in mind, so should he be borne in mind.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: gambhīrā bhagavan iyam prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom is profound.

original: na hi bhagavan parīttakuśalamūlenāparipṛcchakajātīyena aśrutvā buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ saṃmukhībhāvataḥ pūrvamacaritavatā ihaiveyamevaṃ gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā adhimoktuṃ śakyā /
analyzed: na hi bhagavan parītta kuśala mūlena a paripṛcchaka jātīyena a śrutvā buddhānām bhagavatām saṃmukhībhāvataḥ pūrvam a caritavatā iha eva iyam evam gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā adhimoktum śakyā
translated: Blessed One, it is not possible for one with limited wholesome roots, who is not of inquiring nature, who has not listened to the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, and has not attended on them, to have conviction in this very profound perfection of wisdom, which has not been practiced before.

analyzed: ye punar an adhimucya enām an avabudhyamānāḥ pratikṣeptavyām maṃsyante
translated: But those who do not have conviction in it, who do not understand it, will think of it as something to be rejected.

original: pūrvāntato'pi bhagavaṃstaiḥ kulaputraiḥ kuladuhitṛbhiśceyaṃ gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā bhāṣyamāṇā pratikṣiptā /
analyzed: pūrva antataḥ api bhagavan taiḥ kula putraiḥ kula duhitṛbhiḥ ca iyam gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā bhāṣyamāṇā pratikṣiptā
translated: Blessed One, those sons and daughters of good family have also rejected this profound perfection of wisdom when it was being taught in the past.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: yathā api nāma parītta tvāt kuśala mūlānām
translated: Namely, because of the limitedness of their wholesome roots.

original: na hi bhagavan acaritavadbhiḥ pūrvāntata iyaṃ gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā śakyā adhimoktum /
analyzed: na hi bhagavan acaritavadbhiḥ pūrva antataḥ iyam gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā śakyā adhimoktum
translated: Blessed One, it is not possible for those who have not practiced this profound perfection of wisdom in the past to have conviction in it.

original: ye'pi ca pratikṣepsyanti enāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāṣyamāṇām /
analyzed: ye api ca pratikṣepsyanti enām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām bhāṣyamāṇām
translated: And those who will reject this profound perfection of wisdom when it is being taught,

original: te'pyevaṃ veditavyāḥpūrvāntato'pyebhiriyaṃ gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā bhāṣyamāṇā pratikṣiptā /
analyzed: te api evam veditavyāḥ pūrva antataḥ pi ebhiḥ iyam gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā bhāṣyamāṇā pratikṣiptā
translated: They should be known in the same way. From the past, they have rejected this profound perfection of wisdom when it was being taught.

original: tathā hyeṣāmasyāṃ gambhīrāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāyāṃ nāsti śraddhāḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi eṣām asyām gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām bhāṣyamāṇāyām na asti śraddhāḥ
translated: For they have no faith in this profound perfection of wisdom when it is being taught.

original: nāsti kṣāntirnāsti rucirnāsti cchando nāsti vīryaṃ nāstyapramādo nāstyadhimuktiḥ /
analyzed: na asti kṣāntiḥ na asti ruciḥ na asti chandaḥ na asti vīryam na asti apramādaḥ na asti adhimuktiḥ
translated: They have no patience, no delight, no desire, no effort, no heedfulness, no devotion.

original: na caibhiḥ pūrvaṃ buddhā bhagavanto buddhaśrāvakā vā paripṛṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: na ca ebhiḥ pūrvam buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ buddha śrāvakāḥ vā paripṛṣṭāḥ
translated: And they have not previously asked the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, or the Buddhas' disciples.

analyzed: na ca paripraśnīkṛtāḥ iti
translated: And they have not inquired about it.

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmindra āyuṣmantaṃ śāriputrametadavocatgambhīrā ārya śāriputra prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat gambhīrā ārya śāriputra prajñāpāramitā
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Venerable Śāriputra: The perfection of wisdom is profound, Noble Śāriputra.

original: kimatrāścaryaṃ syādyadasyāṃ gambhīrāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāyāṃ pūrvamacaritāvī bodhisattvo mahāsattvo nādhimucyeta /
analyzed: kim atra āścaryam syāt yat asyām gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām bhāṣyamāṇāyām pūrvam acaritāvī bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na adhimucyeta
translated: What wonder would it be if a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who has not practiced before would not have faith in this profound perfection of wisdom when it is being taught?

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmindro bhagavantametadavocatnamaskaromi bhagavan prajñāpāramitāyai /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat namaskaromi bhagavan prajñāpāramitāyai
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, I pay homage to the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: sarvajña jñānasya sa bhagavat namaskāram karoti
translated: He pays homage to the omniscient wisdom of the Blessed One.

analyzed: yaḥ prajñāpāramitāyai namaskāram karoti
translated: He pays homage to the knowledge of omniscience, O Blessed One, who pays homage to the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: bhagavān āha evam eva kauśika evam etat
translated: The Blessed One said: Just so, Kauśika, just so.

original: sarvajñajñānasya sa kauśika namaskāraṃ karoti yaḥ prajñāpāramitāyai namaskāraṃ karoti /
analyzed: sarvajña jñānasya sa kauśika namaskāram karoti yaḥ prajñāpāramitāyai namaskāram karoti
translated: Kauśika, he pays homage to the knowledge of omniscience who pays homage to the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: atonirjātā hi kauśika buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ sarvajñatā /
analyzed: atonirjātā hi kauśika buddhānām bhagavatām sarvajña tā
translated: For, Kauśika, the omniscience of the Blessed Buddhas arises from this.

analyzed: sarvajña jñāna nirjātā ca punar prajñāpāramitā prabhāvyate
translated: And the perfection of wisdom is manifested from the knowledge of omniscience.

analyzed: evam asyām prajñāpāramitāyām caritavyam
translated: One should practice in this way in this perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: evam asyām prajñāpāramitāyām sthātavyam  evam asyām prajñāpāramitāyām pratipattavyam
translated: One should stand in this way in this perfection of wisdom.🔽One should engage in this way in this perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: evam asyām prajñāpāramitāyām yogam āpattavyam
translated: One should apply oneself to this perfection of wisdom in this way.

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmindro bhagavantametadavocatkathaṃ bhagavan prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ sthito
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat katham bhagavan prajñāpāramitāyām caran bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām sthitaḥ
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, how does a bodhisattva mahāsattva, practicing the perfection of wisdom, stand in the perfection of wisdom?

analyzed: katham prajñāpāramitāyām caran prajñāpāramitāyām yogam āpadyate

analyzed: sādhu khalu punar tvam kauśika yaḥ tvam tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham enam artham paripraṣṭavyam paripraśnīkartavyam manyase
translated: It is indeed good that you think to ask the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, about this matter, to question him.

analyzed: idam api te kauśika buddha anubhāvena pratibhānam utpannam
translated: This inspiration has arisen in you, Kauśika, through the Buddha's power.

analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat gambhīrā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā  duravagāhā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā

translated: Because, Śāriputra, consciousness does not engage as 'deep'.

translated: When this was said, the Venerable Śāriputra said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, the profound perfection of wisdom should be taught in the presence of a bodhisattva mahāsattva who has been prophesied as irreversible.

analyzed: na vicikitsiṣyati na dhaṃdhāyiṣyati na vivadiṣyati
translated: will not be uncertain, will not be confused, will not dispute.

translated: Then indeed Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Venerable Śāriputra: If, noble Śāriputra, this perfection of wisdom were to be taught in the presence of an uncommitted bodhisattva-mahāsattva,
