translated: what would be the fault?

original: evamukte āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ śakraṃ devānāmindrametadavocatdūrataḥ sa kauśika bodhisattvo mahāsattva āgato veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ śakram devānām indram etat avocat dūratas sa kauśika bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ āgataḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Śāriputra said this to Śakra, Lord of the Gods: Kauśika, that bodhisattva-mahāsattva should be known as having come from afar.

original: cirayānasaṃprasthitaḥ paripakvakuśalamūlaḥ sa kauśika bodhisattvo mahāsattvo veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: cira yāna saṃprasthitaḥ paripakva kuśala mūlaḥ sa kauśika bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: Kauśika, that bodhisattva-mahāsattva should be known as having set out in the vehicle for a long time and as having ripened wholesome roots,

original: yo'vyākṛta imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ lapsyate darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya śravaṇāya /
analyzed: yaḥ vyākṛtaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām lapsyate darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya śravaṇāya
translated: who, uncommitted, will obtain this perfection of wisdom for seeing, for paying homage, for attending, and for listening.

original: śrutvā ca notrasiṣyati na saṃtrasiṣyati na saṃtrāsamāpatsyate /
analyzed: śrutvā ca na utrasiṣyati na saṃtrasiṣyati na saṃtrāsam āpatsyate
translated: Having heard it, he will not tremble, will not be frightened, will not be terrified.

original: na cedānīmasau cireṇa vyākaraṇaṃ pratilapsyate'nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /
analyzed: na ca idānīm asau cireṇa vyākaraṇam pratilapsyate in uttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: And now he will soon obtain the prophecy of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: āsannam tasya vyākaraṇam veditavyam
translated: His prophecy should be known as imminent.

original: sa bodhisattvo mahāsattvo naikaṃ vā dvau vā trīn vā tathāgatānarhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhānatikramiṣyati /
analyzed: sa bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na ekam vā dvau vā trīn vā tathāgatān arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān atikramiṣyati
translated: That bodhisattva mahāsattva will not pass by one, two, or three tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas.

analyzed: tatas vyākaraṇam pratilapsyate in uttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: He will receive a prophecy of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: api tu tān ārāgayiṣyati
translated: Moreover, he will please them.

analyzed: ārāgayitvā tān tathāgatān arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān na virāgayiṣyati
translated: Having pleased those tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas, he will not displease them.

analyzed: tathāgata darśanam ca vyākaraṇena avandhyam kariṣyati
translated: And he will make the vision of the tathāgatas fruitful through the prophecy.

analyzed: tathāgata darśanāt ca tatas vyākaraṇam pratilapsyate in uttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And from the vision of the tathāgatas, he will receive a prophecy of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: yāvat ca vyākaraṇam pratilapsyate in uttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And as long as he receives a prophecy of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

analyzed: tāvat avandhyam kariṣyati tathāgata darśana vandana paryupāsana upasthānam yāvat na anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ iti
translated: for that long he will make the vision, worship, service, and offerings to the tathāgatas fruitful until he fully awakens to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavantametadavocatdūrataḥ sa bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattva āgato bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat dūratas sa bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ āgataḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, that bodhisattva mahāsattva will have come from far away.

analyzed: cira yāna saṃprasthitaḥ
translated: He will have set out on the vehicle for a long time.

original: paripakvakuśalamūlo hi bhagavan sa bodhisattvo mahāsattvo veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: paripakva kuśala mūlaḥ hi bhagavan sa bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: For, Blessed One, that bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as one whose wholesome roots are fully matured,

original: ya imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ lapsyate darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya śravaṇāya /
analyzed: yaḥ imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām lapsyate darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya śravaṇāya
translated: who will obtain this profound perfection of wisdom for the sake of seeing, worshipping, serving, and listening.

original: kaḥ punarvādo'tra yaḥ śrutvā codgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyatyupadekṣyatyuddekṣyati svādhyāsyati
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ utra yaḥ śrutvā ca udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati su ādhyāsyati
translated: How much more so for one who, having heard it, will take it up, bear it in mind, recite it, understand it, spread it, teach it, explain it, chant it,

analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat evam etat śāriputra evam etat
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Śāriputra, So it is, Śāriputra, so it is.

original: dūrataḥ sa śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattva āgato veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: dūratas sa śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ āgataḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: Śāriputra, that bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as having come from afar.

analyzed: cira yāna saṃprasthitaḥ
translated: He has set out in the vehicle for a long time.

original: paripakvakuśalamūlo hi sa śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: paripakva kuśala mūlaḥ hi sa śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: For, Śāriputra, that bodhisattva mahāsattva will have fully matured wholesome roots,

original: ya imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ lapsyate darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya śravaṇāya /
analyzed: yaḥ imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām lapsyate darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya śravaṇāya
translated: who will obtain this profound perfection of wisdom for the sake of seeing, worshipping, serving, and listening.

original: kaḥ punarvādo'tra yaḥ śrutvā codgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyatyupadekṣyatyuddekṣyati svādhyāsyati
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ utra yaḥ śrutvā ca udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati su ādhyāsyati
translated: How much more so for one who, having heard it, would take it up, bear it in mind, read it aloud, master it, teach it, explain it, expound it, recite it, and contemplate it?

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavantametadavocatpratibhāti me bhagavan /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat pratibhāti me bhagavan
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, it occurs to me.

analyzed: pratibhāti me sugata aupamya udāharaṇam
translated: Blessed One, it occurs to me to give an analogy.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhagavan yo'yaṃ bodhisattvayānikaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā svapnāntaragato'pi bodhimaṇḍe niṣīdet /🔽veditavyametadbhagavan /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhagavan yaḥ ayam bodhisattva yānikaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā svapna antara gataḥ api bodhimaṇḍe niṣīdet  veditavyam etat bhagavan
translated: Blessed One, just as this son or daughter of good family belonging to the vehicle of the bodhisattvas, even while dreaming, would sit on the seat of enlightenment.

analyzed: ayam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ āsannaḥ unuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodheḥ abhisaṃbodhāya iti
translated: Blessed One, it should be known that this bodhisattva mahāsattva is near to the realization of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: evameva bhagavan yaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ lapsyate darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya śravaṇāya /
analyzed: evam eva bhagavan yaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām lapsyate darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya śravaṇāya
translated: In the same way, Blessed One, that son or daughter of good family who will obtain this profound perfection of wisdom in order to see it, to pay homage to it, to attend to it, to listen to it,🔽Blessed One, it should be known that this son or daughter of good family is near to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: kaḥ punarvādaḥ śrutvā codgrahītuṃ dhārayituṃ vācayituṃ paryavāptuṃ pravartayituṃ deśayituṃ upadeṣṭuṃ uddeṣṭuṃ svādhyāpanāya /
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ śrutvā ca udgrahītum dhārayitum vācayitum paryavāptum pravartayitum deśayitum upadeṣṭum uddeṣṭum svādhyāpanāya
translated: How much more so if they hear it, take it up, bear it in mind, read it, study it, teach it, explain it, recite it, master it, and practice it!

analyzed: veditavyam etat bhagavan dūra toyam bodhisattva yānikaḥ pudgalaḥ āgataḥ cira yāna saṃprasthitaḥ
translated: Blessed One, it should be known that this person belonging to the Bodhisattva Vehicle who has come from afar has set out on the vehicle for a long time.

analyzed: āsannaḥ uyam bodhisattva yānikaḥ pudgalaḥ vyākaraṇasya
translated: This person belonging to the Bodhisattva Vehicle is near to receiving a prophecy.

original: vyākariṣyantyenaṃ buddhā bhagavanto bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamanuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodherabhisaṃbodhāyeti /
analyzed: vyākariṣyanti enam buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ bodhisattvam mahāsattvam anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ abhisaṃbodhāya iti
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, will prophesy that Bodhisattva Mahasattva for the supreme perfect enlightenment of perfect buddhahood.

original: cirayānasaṃprasthitaḥ paripakvakuśalamūlo hi sa bodhisattvo mahāsattvo veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: cira yāna saṃprasthitaḥ paripakva kuśala mūlaḥ hi sa bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: That Bodhisattva Mahasattva should be known to have set out on the vehicle for a long time and to have ripened wholesome roots,

analyzed: yasya iyam gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā upapatsyate intaśas śravaṇāya api
translated: in whom this profound perfection of wisdom will occur, even if only for the sake of hearing it.

original: kaḥ punarvādo'tra bhagavan yaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā enāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyatyupadekṣyatyuddekṣyati svādhyāsyati /
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādī utra bhagavan yaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā enām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati su ādhyāsyati
translated: What to speak of, Blessed One, the son or daughter of good family who will take up this deep perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite and study it, and will also progress to its completion, will teach it, will demonstrate, instruct, translate, and illuminate it, and will also properly pay attention to it.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: bhūyastvena hi bhagavan dharmavyasanasaṃvartanīyaiḥ sattvāḥ karmopacayairavihitāḥ /
analyzed: bhūyas tvena hi bhagavan dharma vyasana saṃvartanīyaiḥ sattvāḥ karma upacayaiḥ a vihitāḥ
translated: For the most part, Blessed One, beings are not endowed with the wholesome roots that lead to the decline of the Dharma.

original: teṣāṃ bhūyastvena asyāṃ gambhīrāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ cittāni pratikūlāni bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: teṣām bhūyaḥ tvena asyām gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām cittāni pratikūlāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: For the most part, their minds will be averse to this deep perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: cittāni parivellayiṣyanti
translated: Their minds will turn back from it.

original: na hyanupacitakuśalamūlāḥ sattvā asyāṃ bhūyastvena bhūtakoṭyāṃ praskandanti prasīdanti /🔽upacitakuśalamūlāḥ khalu punaste bhagavan sūpacitakuśalamūlāḥ kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaraśca veditavyāḥ /
analyzed: na hi anupacita kuśala mūlāḥ sattvāḥ asyām bhūyastvena bhūtakoṭyām praskandanti prasīdanti  upacita kuśala mūlāḥ khalu punar te bhagavan su upacita kuśala mūlāḥ kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ ca veditavyāḥ
translated: For the most part, beings who have not accumulated wholesome roots do not leap up to this limit of reality, do not trust it.

analyzed: yeṣām asyām bhūtakoṭyām cittam praskandati prasīdati
translated: But, Blessed One, those sons and daughters of good family who have accumulated wholesome roots, who have well accumulated wholesome roots, should be known to have a mind that leaps up to this limit of reality, to have a mind that trusts it.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhagavan puruṣo yojanaśatikādaṭavīkāntārād dviyojanaśatikādvā triyojanaśatikādvā caturyojanaśatikādvā pañcayojanaśatikādvā daśayojanaśatikādvā aṭavīkāntārānniṣkrāmet /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhagavan puruṣaḥ yojana śatikāt aṭavī kāntārāt dvi yojana śatikāt vā tri yojana śatikāt vā catur yojana śatikāt vā pañca yojana śatikāt vā daśa yojana śatikāt vā aṭavī kāntārāt niṣkrāmet
translated: Blessed One, it is as if a man were to leave a forest wilderness a hundred leagues across, or two hundred leagues across, or three hundred leagues across, or four hundred leagues across, or five hundred leagues across, or a thousand leagues across.

original: sa niṣkramya paśyetpūrvanimittāni gopālakān vā paśupālakān vā sīmā vā ārāmasaṃpado vā vanasaṃpado vā /🔽tato'nyāpi va nimittāni /🔽yairnimittairgrāmo vā nagaraṃ vā nigamo va sūcyeta /🔽tasya tāni pūrvanimittāni dṛṣṭaivaṃ bhavatiyathemāni pūrvanimittāni dṛśyante /
analyzed: sa niṣkramya paśyet pūrva nimittāni gopālakān vā paśu pālakān vā sīmāḥ vā ārāma saṃpadaḥ vā vana saṃpadaḥ vā  nimittāni  yaiḥ nimittaiḥ grāmaḥ vā nagaram vā nigamaḥ sūcyeta  tasya tāni pūrva nimittāni dṛṣṭā evam bhavati yathā imāni pūrva nimittāni dṛśyante
translated: For example, Blessed One, suppose a man were to leave a forest wilderness a hundred yojanas wide, or two hundred yojanas wide, or three hundred yojanas wide, or four hundred yojanas wide, or five hundred yojanas wide, or a thousand yojanas wide, and having left it, were to see previous signs, such as cowherds, shepherds, or the boundaries of villages, towns, or cities, or the signs of the abundance of parks, or the abundance of forests, or other signs, by which a village, town, or city would be indicated.

original: tathā āsanno me grāmo vā nagaraṃ vā nigamo vā iti /🔽sa āśvāsaprāpto bhavati /
analyzed: tathā āsannaḥ me grāmaḥ vā nagaram vā nigamaḥ vā iti  saḥ āśvāsa prāptaḥ bhavati
translated: Then, having seen those previous signs, he would think thus: 'As these previous signs are seen, so near is my village, town, or city.'

analyzed: na asya bhūyaḥ cora manasikāraḥ bhavati
translated: He would be comforted, and would no longer have the thought of a thief.

original: evameva bhagavan yasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyeyaṃ gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā upavartate /
analyzed: evam eva bhagavan yasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya iyam gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā upavartate
translated: In the same way, Blessed One, for that bodhisattva mahāsattva to whom this profound perfection of wisdom comes, and who also obtains the thought of the knowledge of all aspects, it should be known that he is near to the knowledge of all aspects.

analyzed: veditavyam tena bhagavan abhyāsannaḥ asmi anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: Blessed One, one should know that one is near to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

analyzed: nacireṇa vyākaraṇam pratilapsyen uttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ iti
translated: One will soon obtain the prophecy of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: nāpi tenotrasitavyaṃ na saṃtrasitavyaṃ na bhetavyaṃ śrāvakabhūmervā pratyekabuddhabhūmervā /
analyzed: na api tena utrasitavyam na saṃtrasitavyam na bhetavyam śrāvaka bhūmeḥ vā pratyekabuddha bhūmeḥ vā
translated: And one should not be afraid, terrified, or frightened of the level of the hearers or the level of the solitary buddhas.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi asyemāni pūrvanimittāni saṃdṛśyante yadutemāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ labhate darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya śravaṇāya /
analyzed: tathā hi asya imāni pūrva nimittāni saṃdṛśyante yat uta imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām labhate darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya śravaṇāya
translated: Because these are seen as the previous signs of that person, namely, that they obtain this profound perfection of wisdom for the sake of seeing, worshipping, attending, and listening.

analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat evam etat śāriputra evam etat
translated: When that was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Śāriputra, “So it is, Śāriputra. It is just as you have said.

analyzed: pratibhātu te śāriputra punar api etat sthānam
translated: May you, Śāriputra, speak about this topic again.

analyzed: yathā api nāma etat buddha anubhāvena vyāharasi vyāhariṣyasi ca
translated: Just as you speak and will speak by the power of the Buddha.”

original: evamukte āyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavantametadavocattadyathāpi nāma bhagavan iha kaścideva puruṣo mahāsamudraṃ draṣṭukāmo bhavet /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat tat yathā api nāma bhagavan iha kaścid eva puruṣaḥ mahā samudram draṣṭu kāmaḥ bhavet
translated: When that was said, the venerable Śāriputra said to the Blessed One, “Blessed One, it is just as if here some person would want to see the great ocean.

analyzed: sa gacchet mahā samudram darśanāya
translated: He would go to see the great ocean.

original: yathā yathā ca sa gacchenmahāsamudraṃ darśanāya /
analyzed: yathā yathā ca sa gacchet mahā samudram darśanāya
translated: And as he goes to see the great ocean,

original: tathā tathā sacetpaśyetstambaṃ vā stambanimittaṃ vā parvataṃ vā parvatanimittaṃ vā /
analyzed: tathā tathā saced paśyet stambam vā stamba nimittam vā parvatam vā parvata nimittam vā
translated: if he sees a tree or a sign of a tree, a mountain or a sign of a mountain,

original: tenaivaṃ veditavyaṃ dūre tāvadito mahāsamudra iti /
analyzed: tena evam veditavyam dūre tāvat itas mahā samudraḥ iti
translated: he should know thus: 'The great ocean is still far from here.'

original: sacenna bhūyaḥ paśyetstambaṃ vā stambanimittaṃ vā parvataṃ vā parvatanimittaṃ vā /
analyzed: saced na bhūyas paśyet stambam vā stamba nimittam vā parvatam vā parvata nimittam vā
translated: But if he does not see again a tree or a sign of a tree, a mountain or a sign of a mountain,

analyzed: tena evam veditavyam abhyāsannaḥ itas mahā samudraḥ iti
translated: he should know thus: 'The great ocean is near here.'

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: anupūrva nimnaḥ hi mahā samudraḥ
translated: Because the great ocean is sloping gradually.

original: na mahāsamudrasyābhyantare kaścitstambo vā stambanimittaṃ vā parvato vā parvatanimittaṃ veti /
analyzed: na mahā samudrasya abhyantare kaścid stambaḥ vā stamba nimittam vā parvataḥ vā parvata nimittam vā iti
translated: There is no tree or sign of a tree, mountain or sign of a mountain inside the great ocean.

original: kiṃcāpi sa na mahāsamudraṃ sākṣātpaśyati cakṣuṣā /
analyzed: kiṃca api sa na mahā samudram sākṣāt paśyati cakṣuṣā
translated: Although he does not directly see the great ocean with his eyes,

original: atha ca punaḥ sa niṣṭhāṃ gacchatiabhyāsanno'smi mahāsamudrasya /
analyzed: atha ca punar sa niṣṭhām gacchati abhyāsannaḥ asmi mahā samudrasya
translated: yet he reaches the conclusion: 'I am near the great ocean.

analyzed: na itas bhūyas dūre mahā samudraḥ iti
translated: It is not far from here to the great ocean.'

original: evameva bhagavan bodhisattvena mahāsattvenemāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ śṛṇvatā veditavyamkiṃcāpyahaṃ taistathāgatairarhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhairna saṃmukhaṃ vyākṛtaḥ /
analyzed: evam eva bhagavan bodhisattvena mahāsattvena imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām śṛṇvatā veditavyam kiṃca api aham taiḥ tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ na saṃmukham vyākṛtaḥ
translated: In the same way, Blessed One, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who hears this deep perfection of wisdom should know: 'Although I have not been directly prophesied by those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones,

analyzed: atha ca punar abhyāsannaḥ asmi anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ vyākaraṇasya
translated: nevertheless, I am close to the prophecy of unsurpassed, perfect awakening.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: tathā hyenāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ labhate darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya śravaṇāyeti /
analyzed: tathā hi enām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām labhate darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya śravaṇāya iti
translated: Because I have obtained this deep perfection of wisdom to see, to pay homage, to attend upon, and to listen to.'

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhagavan vasante pratyupasthite śīrṇaparṇapalāśeṣu nānāvṛkṣeṣu nānāpallavāḥ prādurbhavanti /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhagavan vasante pratyupasthite śīrṇa parṇa palāśeṣu nānā vṛkṣeṣu nānā pallavāḥ prādurbhavanti
translated: Blessed One, it is just as when spring has arrived and on the various trees with withered leaves, various sprouts appear.

original: pallaveṣu prādurbhūteṣvāttamanaskā bhavanti jāmbūdvīpakā manuṣyāḥ tāni pūrvanimittāni vaneṣu dṛṣṭvā nacirādvanapuṣpāṇi ca phalāni ca prādurbhaviṣyanti
analyzed: pallaveṣu prādurbhūteṣu ātta manaskāḥ bhavanti jāmbūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ tāni pūrva nimittāni vaneṣu dṛṣṭvā nacirāt vana puṣpāṇi ca phalāni ca prādurbhaviṣyanti
translated: When the sprouts have appeared, the people of Jambudvīpa, having seen those previous signs in the forests, become elated, thinking: 'Before long, the forest flowers and fruits will appear.'

analyzed: tat kasya heto
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: tathā hi imāni pūrvanimittāni stambeṣu dṛśyanta iti /
analyzed: tathā hi imāni pūrva nimittāni stambeṣu dṛśyante iti

original: evameva bhagavan yadā bodhisattvo mahāsattvo labhate imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya śravaṇāya /
analyzed: evam eva bhagavan yadā bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ labhate imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya śravaṇāya
translated: In the same way, Blessed One, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva obtains this profound perfection of wisdom for the sake of seeing, paying homage, attending, and listening,

analyzed: upavartate tasya iyam gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā
translated: this profound perfection of wisdom approaches him.

original: tadā paripakvakuśalaḥ sa bodhisattvo mahāsattvo veditavyaḥtenaiva pūrvakeṇa kuśalamūlenopanāmiteyaṃ tasmai gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: tadā paripakva kuśalaḥ sa bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ veditavyaḥ tena eva pūrvakeṇa kuśala mūlena upanāmitā iyam tasmai gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā
translated: Then that bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as one whose wholesome roots are mature, and this profound perfection of wisdom has been brought to him by that very previous wholesome root.

analyzed: tatra yāḥ devatāḥ pūrva buddha darśinyaḥ
translated: Among them, the deities who have seen previous Buddhas,

original: tāḥ pramuditā bhavanti prītisaumanasyajātāḥpaurvakāṇāmapi bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāmimānyeva pūrvanimittānyabhūvannanuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodhervyākaraṇāya
analyzed: tāḥ pramuditāḥ bhavanti prīti saumanasya jātāḥ paurvakāṇām api bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām imāni eva pūrva nimittāni abhūvan anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ vyākaraṇāya
translated: they become greatly delighted, joyful, and pleased. The previous bodhisattva mahāsattvas also had just these very same precursors for the prophecy of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: nacireṇa batāyaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattvo vyākaraṇaṃ pratilapsyate'nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheriti /
analyzed: nacireṇa bata ayam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ vyākaraṇam pratilapsyate in uttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ iti
translated: It will not be long before this bodhisattva mahāsattva will obtain the prophecy of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhagavan strī gurviṇī gurugarbhā /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhagavan strī gurviṇī guru garbhā

translated: Subhuti, for those sons of good family and daughters of good family who take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, read it aloud, master it, teach it, explain it, recite it, and write it out, there will be many obstacles.

translated: For thus, Subhūti, for those sons of good family and daughters of good family who are taking up, bearing in mind, reading aloud, mastering, teaching, explaining, expounding, reciting, and writing this perfection of wisdom, the evil Māra will be eager to create obstacles.

translated: If it is being written in a year or more than that,

analyzed: evam hi etat subhūte bhavati yat mahā ratnānām bahavaḥ antarāyāḥ utpadyante
translated: For this is how it is, Subhūti, that many obstacles arise for great jewels.

original: evamukte āyuṣmān subhūtirbhagavantametadavocatiha bhagavan prajñāpāramitāyāmudgṛhyamāṇāyāṃ dhāryamāṇāyāṃ vācyamānāyāṃ paryavāpyamānāyāṃ pravartyamānāyāṃ deśyamānāyāmupadiśyamānāyāmuddiśyamānāyāṃ svādhyāyyamānāyāṃ likhyamānāyāṃ ca māraḥ pāpīyān bahuprakāramautsukyamāpatsyate /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat iha bhagavan prajñāpāramitāyām udgṛhyamāṇāyām dhāryamāṇāyām vācyamānāyām paryavāpyamānāyām pravartyamānāyām deśyamānāyām upadiśyamānāyām uddiśyamānāyām su ādhyāyyamānāyām likhyamānāyām ca māraḥ pāpīyān bahu prakāram autsukyam āpatsyate
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Subhuti said to the Blessed One: Blessed One, when the perfection of wisdom is being taken up, borne in mind, recited, studied, contemplated, taught, explained, recited, mastered, and written out, Mara, the evil one, will become very anxious in many ways.

analyzed: antarāya karmaṇaḥ udyogam ca kariṣyati
translated: And he will strive to create obstacles.

original: bhagavānāhakiṃcāpi subhūte māraḥ pāpīyānudyogamāpatsyate antarāyakarmaṇaḥ asyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāmudgṛhyamāṇāyāṃ dhāryamāṇāyāṃ vācyamānāyāṃ paryavāpyamānāyāṃ pravartyamānāyāṃ deśyamānāyāmupadiśyamānāyāmuddiśyamānāyāṃ svādhyāyyamānāyāṃ likhyamānāyāṃ ca /
analyzed: bhagavān āha kiṃca api subhūte māraḥ pāpīyān udyogam āpatsyate antarāya karmaṇaḥ asyām prajñāpāramitāyām udgṛhyamāṇāyām dhāryamāṇāyām vācyamānāyām paryavāpyamānāyām pravartyamānāyām deśyamānāyām upadiśyamānāyām uddiśyamānāyām su ādhyāyyamānāyām likhyamānāyām ca
translated: The Blessed One said, Subhuti, even though Mara, the evil one, will strive to create obstacles to this perfection of wisdom being taken up, borne in mind, recited, studied, contemplated, taught, explained, recited, mastered, and written out,

original: atha ca punarna prasahiṣyate'cchidrasamādānasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyāntarāyaṃ kartum //
analyzed: atha ca punar na prasahiṣyate icchidra samādānasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya antarāyam kartum
translated: he will still not be able to create an obstacle for the bodhisattva mahasattva who has taken up the practice without a gap.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavantametadavocatyadā bhagavan imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgṛhṇatāṃ dhārayatāṃ vācayatāṃ paryavāpnuvatāṃ pravartayatāṃ deśayatāmupadiśatāmuddiśatāṃ svādhyāyatāṃ likhatāṃ ca kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṝṇāṃ ca māraḥ pāpīyānautsukyamāpatsyate antarāyakaraṇāya /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat adā bhagavan imām prajñāpāramitām udgṛhṇatām dhārayatām vācayatām paryavāpnuvatām pravartayatām deśayatām upadiśatām uddiśatām su ādhyāyatām likhatām ca kula putrāṇām kula duhitṝṇām ca māraḥ pāpīyān autsukyam āpatsyate antarāya karaṇāya
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, when Māra the Evil One becomes anxious to create obstacles for those sons of good family and daughters of good family who are taking up, bearing in mind, reading aloud, mastering, teaching, explaining, reciting from memory, reciting, and writing this perfection of wisdom,

original: tadā kathametarhi bhagavan kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaraśca imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyantyupadekṣyantyuddekṣyanti svādhyāsyanti likhiṣyanti ca /
analyzed: tadā katham etarhi bhagavan kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ ca imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyanti upadekṣyanti uddekṣyanti su ādhyāsyanti likhiṣyanti ca
translated: then how will those sons of good family and daughters of good family take up this perfection of wisdom now, bear it in mind, read it aloud, master it, teach it, explain it, recite it from memory, recite it, and write it?

original: kasya cānubhāvena bhagavaṃste kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaraśca imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyantyupadekṣyantyuddekṣyanti svādhyāsyanti likhiṣyanti ca /
analyzed: kasya ca anubhāvena bhagavan te kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ ca imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyanti upadekṣyanti uddekṣyanti su ādhyāsyanti likhiṣyanti ca
translated: By whose power, Blessed One, will those sons and daughters of good family take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, study it, spread it, teach it, explain it, chant it, and write it out?

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ śāriputrametadavocatbuddhānāṃ śāriputra bhagavatāṃ tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāmanubhāvena te kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaraśca imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyantyupadekṣyantyuddekṣyanti svādhyāsyanti likhiṣyanti ca /🔽tathatvāya śikṣiṣyante /🔽tathatvāya pratipatsyante /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat buddhānām śāriputra bhagavatām tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām anubhāvena te kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ ca imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyanti upadekṣyanti uddekṣyanti su ādhyāsyanti likhiṣyanti ca  tathatvāya śikṣiṣyante  tathatvāya pratipatsyante
translated: When this had been said, the Blessed One said to the Venerable Śāriputra: Śāriputra, by the power of the Blessed, Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened Buddhas, those sons and daughters of good family will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, study it, spread it, teach it, explain it, chant it, and write it out.🔽They will train in accordance with reality.

analyzed: tathatvāya yogam āpatsyante
translated: They will practice in accordance with reality.🔽They will apply themselves in accordance with reality.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

analyzed: eṣā hi śāriputra dharmāṇām dharma tā
translated: Śāriputra, this is the true nature of dharmas.

original: ye te'prameyeṣvasaṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhā bhagavantastiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti /
analyzed: ye te prameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti
translated: Those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, who are in immeasurable, incalculable world systems,

original: te imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ samanvāhariṣyanti parigrahīṣyanti bhāṣyamāṇāmudgṛhyamāṇāṃ dhāryamāṇāṃ vācyamānāṃ paryavāpyamānāṃ pravartyamānāṃ deśyamānāmupadiśyamānāmuddiśyamānāṃ svādhyāyyamānāṃ likhyamānāṃ ca /
analyzed: te imām prajñāpāramitām samanvāhariṣyanti parigrahīṣyanti bhāṣyamāṇām udgṛhyamāṇām dhāryamāṇām vācyamānām paryavāpyamānām pravartyamānām deśyamānām upadiśyamānām uddiśyamānām su ādhyāyyamānām likhyamānām ca
translated: they will recollect and accept this perfection of wisdom, when it is being taught, learned, borne in mind, recited aloud, mastered, expounded, demonstrated, explicated, repeated, recited, written, and written down.

original: ye caināṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaraścodgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyantyupadekṣyantyuddekṣyanti svādhyāsyanti ca /

translated: And those sons and daughters of good family who will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it aloud, master it, teach it, expound it, explain it, demonstrate it, repeat it, recite it, write it, and write it out,

analyzed: tathatvāya śikṣiṣyante  tathatvāya pratipatsyante
translated: they will train in suchness,🔽they will practice in suchness,

analyzed: tathatvāya yogam āpatsyante

original: tāṃśca te buddhā bhagavantaḥ samanvāhariṣyanti parigrahīṣyanti ca /
analyzed: tān ca te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ samanvāhariṣyanti parigrahīṣyanti ca
translated: And those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, will recollect and accept them.

original: na hi śāriputra buddhasamanvāhṛtānāṃ buddhaparigṛhītānāṃ ca kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṝṇāṃ ca śakyamantarāyaṃ kartum //🔽evamukte āyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavantametadavocatye'pi te bhagavan bodhisattvā mahāsattvā imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ śroṣyanti udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyantyupadekṣyantyuddekṣyanti svādhyāsyanti likhiṣyanti ca /

translated: For, Śāriputra, it is not possible to create an obstacle for those sons of a good family and those daughters of a good family who are attended to by the Buddhas, who are assisted by the Buddhas.”🔽When this was said, the venerable Śāriputra said to the Lord, “Those bodhisattva great beings, Lord, who will hear this deep perfection of wisdom, take it up, bear it in mind, recite it, master it, teach it, explain it, expound it, chant it, and write it out, and will train in it, set out for it, and apply themselves to it as it has been taught—will they be beginners or will they be irreversible?”🔽“They will be irreversible, Śāriputra.”🔽“They will be irreversible, Śāriputra.”

analyzed: tathatvāya śikṣiṣyante  tathatvāya pratipatsyante
translated: “They will be irreversible, Śāriputra.”🔽“They will be irreversible, Śāriputra.”

analyzed: tathatvāya yogam āpatsyante
translated: “They will be irreversible, Śāriputra.”

original: sarve te bhagavan buddhānubhāvena buddhādhiṣṭhānena buddhaparigraheṇa ca imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ śroṣyanti udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyantyupadekṣyantyuddekṣyanti svādhyāsyanti likhiṣyanti ca /

translated: All of them, Blessed One, by the Buddha's power, by the Buddha's blessing, and by the Buddha's support, will hear this perfection of wisdom, will take it up, will bear it in mind, will recite it, will master it, will propagate it, will teach it, will expound it, will expound it in detail, will chant it, will copy it, and will train in it for suchness.

translated: All those bodhisattva mahāsattvas, Śāriputra, through the Buddha's power, through the Buddha's blessing, through the Buddha's support, will hear this deep perfection of wisdom, will take it up, will bear it in mind, will recite it, will study it, will promulgate it, will teach it, will expound it, will explicate it, will repeat it, will write it,

analyzed: tathatvāya śikṣiṣyante  tathatvāya pratipatsyante
translated: they will train in accordance with reality.🔽They will practice in accordance with reality.

analyzed: tathatvāya yogam āpatsyante  jñātāḥ te śāriputra tathāgatena

translated: Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who will hear this perfection of wisdom, take it up, bear it in mind, recite it, master it, teach it, explain it, expound it, chant it, and write it out,

analyzed: tathatvāya yogam āpatsyante
translated: and apply themselves to it as it should be applied to,

original: śrutvo udgṛhya dhārayitvā vācayitvā paryavāpya pravartya deśayitvopadiśyoddiśya svādhyāyya likhitvā tathatvāya śikṣamāṇāstathatvāya pratipadyamānāstathatvāya yogamāpadyamānā āsannībhaviṣyantyanuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /
analyzed: udgṛhya dhārayitvā vācayitvā paryavāpya pravartya deśayitvā upadiśya uddiśya su ādhyāyya likhitvā tathatvāya śikṣamāṇāḥ tathatvāya pratipadyamānāḥ tathatvāya yogam āpadyamānāḥ āsannībhaviṣyanti anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: having heard it, taken it up, borne it in mind, recited it, mastered it, taught it, explained it, expounded it, chanted it, and written it out, training in it as it should be trained in, practicing it as it should be practiced, and applying themselves to it as it should be applied to, will draw near to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

translated: Those who, Śāriputra, having written out this perfection of wisdom, will bear it in mind, will recite it, will study it, will teach it, will explain it, will expound it, will repeat it, will write it out,🔽but will not train in suchness,

analyzed: na ca tathatvāya pratipatsyante

analyzed: na ca tathatvāya yogam āpatsyante

analyzed: te na tathatvāya śikṣamāṇāḥ na tathatvāya pratipadyamānāḥ na tathatvāya yogam āpadyamānāḥ na tathatāyām sthāsyanti anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: they, not training in suchness, not practicing in suchness, not applying themselves in yoga to suchness, will not stand in suchness in unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

translated: For them, Śāriputra, that exertion and that striving will be of great benefit, of great advantage, of great fruit, of great result.

translated: For thus, the perfection of wisdom, which is connected with the ultimate, is present for the thorough penetration of things as they really are for all beings.

analyzed: tasmin kāle ye imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti
translated: At that time, those who will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind,

analyzed: vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyanti upadekṣyanti uddekṣyanti su ādhyāsyanti
translated: recite it, master it, spread it, teach it, explain it, expound it, recite it to themselves,

analyzed: antaśas likhitvā pustaka gatām api kṛtvā dhārayiṣyanti
translated: and at least write it down and keep it in the form of a book,

analyzed: jñātāḥ te śāriputra tathāgatena
translated: they are known, Śāriputra, by the Tathāgata.

analyzed: adhiṣṭhitāḥ te śāriputra tathāgatena  dṛṣṭāḥ te śāriputra tathāgatena
translated: They are sustained by the Tathagata, Shariputra.🔽They are seen by the Tathagata, Shariputra.

analyzed: vyavalokitāḥ te śāriputra tathāgatena buddha cakṣuṣā
translated: They are looked upon by the Tathagata with the eye of a Buddha, Shariputra.

original: śāriputra āhaiyamapi bhagavan prajñāpāramitā evaṃgambhīrā paścime kāle paścime samaye vaistārikī bhaviṣyatyuttarasyāṃ diśi uttare digbhāge /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha eyam api bhagavan prajñāpāramitā evaṃgambhīrā paścime kāle paścime samaye vaistārikī bhaviṣyati uttarasyām diśi uttare digbhāge
translated: Shariputra said, Bhagavan, will this perfection of wisdom, which is so profound as this, spread in the northern direction, in the northern part of the country, in later times, in later generations?

original: bhagavānāhaye tatra śāriputra uttarasyāṃ diśyuttare digbhāge imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ śrutvā atra prajñāpāramitāyāṃ yogamāpatsyante /
analyzed: bhagavān āha ye tatra śāriputraḥ uttarasyām diśi uttare digbhāge imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām śrutvā atra prajñāpāramitāyām yogam āpatsyante
translated: The Bhagavan said, Shariputra, those who, having heard this profound perfection of wisdom in the northern direction, in the northern part of the country, will practice it in this perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: te vaistārikīm kariṣyati
translated: they will make it spread.

analyzed: cira yāna saṃprasthitāḥ te śāriputra bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ veditavyāḥ
translated: Shariputra, those bodhisattva mahasattvas should be known as having set out in the vehicle for a long time.

original: ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ śroṣyanti likhiṣyanti udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyantyupadekṣyantyuddekṣyanti
analyzed: ye imām prajñāpāramitām śroṣyanti likhiṣyanti udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyanti upadekṣyanti uddekṣyanti
translated: Those who will hear this perfection of wisdom, write it down, take it up, bear it in mind, recite it, study it, spread it, teach it, explain it, expound it,

analyzed: tathatvāya śikṣiṣyante
translated: and train in it for suchness.

analyzed: tathatvāya pratipatsyante
translated: They will practice for the sake of suchness.

analyzed: tathatvāya yogam āpatsyante
translated: They will apply themselves for the sake of suchness.

original: śāriputra āhakiyantaste bhagavan bodhisattvā mahāsattvā bhaviṣyanti uttarasyāṃ diśi uttare digbhāge /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha kiyantaḥ te bhagavan bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ bhaviṣyanti uttarasyām diśi uttare digbhāge
translated: Śāriputra said, Bhagavān, how many bodhisattva mahāsattvas will there be in the northern direction, in the northern regions?

analyzed: bahavaḥ uta aho alpakāḥ
translated: Are they many or few?

original: ya imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ śroṣyanti likhiṣyanti udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyanti upadekṣyantyuddekṣyanti svādhyāsyanti /🔽tathatvāya śikṣiṣyante /🔽tathatvāya pratipatsyante /
analyzed: ye imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām śroṣyanti likhiṣyanti udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyanti upadekṣyanti uddekṣyanti su ādhyāsyanti  tathatvāya śikṣiṣyante  tathatvāya pratipatsyante
translated: Those who will hear this profound perfection of wisdom, write it down, take it up, bear it in mind, recite it, master it, teach it, explain it, expound it, recite it from memory, and practice it for the sake of suchness,🔽practice for the sake of suchness,

analyzed: tathatvāya yogam āpatsyante
translated: apply themselves for the sake of suchness.

original: bhagavānāhabahavaste śāriputra subahavaḥ uttarāpathe uttarasyāṃ diśyuttare digbhāge bodhisattvā mahāsattvā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: bhagavān āha bahavaḥ te śāriputra su bahavaḥ uttarāpathe uttarasyām diśi uttare digbhāge bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: The Bhagavān said, Śāriputra, there will be many, very many, bodhisattva mahāsattvas in the northern direction, in the northern regions.

analyzed: kiṃca api śāriputra bahavaḥ te
translated: Śāriputra, although they are many,

analyzed: tebhyaḥ api bahubhyaḥ ulpakāḥ te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: among those many, few of those bodhisattva mahāsattvas will be.

original: ya imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ śroṣyanti likhiṣyantyudgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyanti upadekṣyantyuddekṣyanti svādhyāsyanti /
analyzed: ye imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām śroṣyanti likhiṣyanti udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyanti upadekṣyanti uddekṣyanti su ādhyāsyanti
translated: Those who, when this profound perfection of wisdom is being taught, will listen to it, will copy it, will take it up, will preserve it, will recite it, will learn it, will expound it, will teach it, will expound it, will announce it, will repeat it,

analyzed: tathatvāya śikṣiṣyante  tathatvāya pratipatsyante
translated: will train in it for suchness,🔽will practice for suchness,

analyzed: tathatvāya yogam āpatsyante
translated: will apply themselves to yoga for suchness,

original: prajñāpāramitāyāṃ ca bhāṣyamāṇāyāṃ nāvaleṣyante na saṃleṣyante /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām ca bhāṣyamāṇāyām na avaleṣyante na saṃleṣyante
translated: and when the perfection of wisdom is being taught, will not be discouraged, will not be cowed,

analyzed: na viṣatsyanti na viṣādam āpatsyante
translated: will not be frightened, will not be terrified,

analyzed: na vipṛṣṭhīkariṣyanti mānasam
translated: will not turn their minds away,

analyzed: na bhagnapṛṣṭhīkariṣyanti
translated: will not turn their backs,

analyzed: na utrasiṣyanti na saṃtrasiṣyanti na saṃtrāsam āpatsyante
translated: will not tremble, will not be frightened, will not be terrified,

analyzed: cira yāna saṃprasthitāḥ te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ veditavyāḥ
translated: those bodhisattva mahāsattvas should be known as having set out in the vehicle for a long time.

analyzed: anubaddhāḥ taiḥ paurvakāḥ tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: They have been attended by the past tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened buddhas.

analyzed: paripṛṣṭāḥ paripṛcchitāḥ paripraśnīkṛtāḥ
translated: They have been questioned, have asked questions, have inquired.

original: pūjitāśca taiḥ paurvakāstathāgatā arhanta samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ kulaputraiḥ kuladuhitṛbhiśca bodhisattvayānikaiḥ pudgalaiḥ /
analyzed: pūjitāḥ ca taiḥ paurvakāḥ tathāgatāḥ arhanta samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ kula putraiḥ kula duhitṛbhiḥ ca bodhisattva yānikaiḥ pudgalaiḥ
translated: They will have worshipped the tathāgatas, arhats, and samyaksaṃbuddhas, the sons of noble family and daughters of noble family who are followers of the vehicle of the bodhisattvas, and the individuals who are followers of the vehicle of the pratyekabuddhas and the vehicle of the śrāvakas.

analyzed: śīleṣu ca te paripūrṇa kāriṇaḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will have completed the perfections.

analyzed: bahu janasya ca tertham kariṣyanti
translated: They will have benefited many people,

analyzed: yat uta imām eva anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim ārabhya
translated: namely, by beginning with this unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi teṣāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṝṇāṃ ca mayaiva sarvajñatāpratisaṃyuktaiva kathā kṛtā /
analyzed: tathā hi teṣām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṝṇām ca mayā eva sarvajña tā pratisaṃyuktā eva kathā kṛtā
translated: It is because I have had conversations with those sons of noble family and daughters of noble family that are connected with omniscience.

original: teṣāṃ jātivyativṛttānāmapi eta eva sarvajñatāpratisaṃyuktāḥ prajñāpāramitāpratisaṃyuktāḥ samudācārā bhaviṣyanti /🔽enāmeva ca te kathāṃ kariṣyanti /
analyzed: teṣām jāti vyativṛttānām api ete eva sarvajña tā pratisaṃyuktāḥ prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktāḥ samudācārāḥ bhaviṣyanti  enām eva ca te kathām kariṣyanti
translated: Even when they have passed away, they will have thoughts that are connected with omniscience and connected with the perfection of wisdom.🔽They will have conversations about that.

analyzed: enām eva ca kathām abhinandiṣyanti
translated: They will delight in that conversation,

analyzed: yat uta anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim ārabhya
translated: namely, by beginning with this unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: teṣu ca susthitāḥ samāhitāśca bhaviṣyanti asyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyām /
analyzed: teṣu ca susthitāḥ samāhitāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti asyām prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: They will be well-established and concentrated in this perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: māreṇa api te na śakyāḥ bhedayitum
translated: They will not be able to be divided even by Māra.

analyzed: kutas punar anyaiḥ sattvaiḥ
translated: How much more so by others?

analyzed: yat uta chandataḥ vā mantrataḥ vā
translated: Namely, by those who have the aspiration or the mantra.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

analyzed: yathā api nāma tat dṛḍha sthāma tvāt anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: It is because of their firm strength in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: te ca kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaraśca śrutvā enāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudāraṃ prītiprāmodyaprasādaṃ pratilapsyante /
analyzed: te ca kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ ca śrutvā enām prajñāpāramitām udāram prīti prāmodya prasādam pratilapsyante
translated: And those sons and daughters of good family, having heard this perfection of wisdom, will attain vast joy, delight, and faith.

original: bahujanasya ca te kuśalamūlānyavaropayiṣyanti yadutānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: bahu janasya ca te kuśala mūlāni avaropayiṣyanti yat uta anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: They will plant the roots of virtue of many people in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: evaṃ hi taiḥ kulaputraiḥ kuladuhitṛbhiśca mamāntike saṃmukhaṃ vāgbhāṣitābahūni prāṇiśatāni bahūni prāṇisahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇiśatasahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇikoṭīśatāni bahūni prāṇikoṭīsahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇikoṭīśatasahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇikoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi bodhisattvacaryāṃ caranto vayamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau prasthāpayiṣyāmaḥ saṃdarśayiṣyāmaḥ samādāpayiṣyāmaḥ samuttejayiṣyāmaḥ saṃpraharṣayiṣyāmaḥ saṃprabhāvayiṣyāmaḥ saṃbodhaye pratiṣṭhāpayiṣyāma iti /
analyzed: evam hi taiḥ kula putraiḥ kula duhitṛbhiḥ ca mama antike saṃmukham vāc bhāṣitā bahūni prāṇi śatāni bahūni prāṇi sahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇi śata sahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇi koṭī śatāni bahūni prāṇi koṭī sahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇi koṭī śata sahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇi koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi bodhisattva caryām carantaḥ vayam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau prasthāpayiṣyāmaḥ saṃdarśayiṣyāmaḥ samādāpayiṣyāmaḥ samuttejayiṣy
translated: For thus those sons and daughters of good family have spoken these words in my presence: 'We, while practicing the bodhisattva conduct, will establish many hundreds of living beings, many thousands of living beings, many hundreds of thousands of living beings, many hundred of millions of living beings, many thousands of millions of living beings, many hundreds of thousands of millions of living beings, many hundred of thousands of millions of living beings in the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. We will cause them to enter, we will cause them to see, we will cause them to take up, we will cause them to be inspired, we will cause them to rejoice, we will cause them to be established in enlightenment.'

analyzed: a vinivartanīyān kariṣyāmaḥ iti
translated: We will make them irreversible.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: anumoditaṃ hi śāriputra mayā teṣāṃ bodhisattvayānikānāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṝṇāṃ ca cittena cittaṃ vyavalokya yairiyaṃ vāgbhāṣitābodhāya caranto vayaṃ bahūni prāṇiśatāni bahūni prāṇisahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇiśatasahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇikoṭīśatāni bahūni prāṇikoṭīsahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇikoṭīśatasahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇikoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau prasthāpayiṣyāmaḥ saṃdarśayiṣyāmaḥ samādāpayiṣyāmaḥ samuttejayiṣyāmaḥ saṃpraharṣayiṣyāmaḥ saṃprabhāvayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: anumoditam hi śāriputra mayā teṣām bodhisattva yānikānām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṝṇām ca cittena cittam vyavalokya yaiḥ iyam vāc bhāṣita ābodhāya carantaḥ vayam bahūni prāṇi śatāni bahūni prāṇi sahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇi śata sahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇi koṭī śatāni bahūni prāṇi koṭī sahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇi koṭī śata sahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇi koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau prasthāpayiṣyāmaḥ saṃda
translated: “Śāriputra, I have approved of those sons of a good family and daughters of a good family who have gone into homelessness in the vehicle of the Bodhisattvas, having looked at their minds with my mind, and they have spoken these words: ‘We, practicing for Awakening, will establish many hundreds of living beings, many thousands of living beings, many hundreds of thousands of living beings, many millions of living beings, many tens of millions of living beings, many billions of living beings, many tens of billions of living beings, many trillions of living beings in highest genuine full Awakening, and we will show them, inspire them, get them excited, make them want it, and settle them in it.’🔽🔽

analyzed: saṃbodhaye pratiṣṭhāpayiṣyāmaḥ iti
translated: Śāriputra, I have approved of those sons and daughters of good family who have gone forth in the Bodhisattva-yāna, having surveyed their minds with my mind, and to whom this speech has been spoken: We will establish, show, inspire, encourage, and make firm many hundreds of living beings, many thousands of living beings, many hundreds of thousands of living beings, many hundred of millions of living beings, many thousands of millions of living beings, many hundreds of thousands of millions of living beings, many hundred of thousands of niyutas of millions of living beings in unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, saying, We will establish them in unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: a vinivartanīyān kariṣyāmaḥ iti
translated: We will make them irreversible.

original: evaṃ ca te kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaraśca udārādhimuktikā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: evam ca te kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ ca udāra adhimuktikāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: And those sons and daughters of good family will have noble aspirations.

analyzed: yat anyāni api te buddhakṣetrāṇi adhyālambitavyāni maṃsyante
translated: And they will think, We should also take up other Buddha-fields.

original: yatra saṃmukhībhūtāstathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā dharmaṃ deśayiṣyanti /
analyzed: yatra saṃmukhībhūtāḥ tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ dharmam deśayiṣyanti
translated: Where the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones who have appeared will teach the Dharma.

original: tatra saṃmukhībhūtānāṃ tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāmantikātpunarevaināṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ vistareṇa śroṣyanti /
analyzed: tatra saṃmukhībhūtānām tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām antikāt punar eva enām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām vistareṇa śroṣyanti
translated: There, in the presence of the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones who have appeared, they will again hear this profound perfection of wisdom in detail.

original: teṣvapi te buddhakṣetreṣu bahūni prāṇiśatāni bahūni prāṇisahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇiśatasahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇikoṭīśatāni bahūni prāṇikoṭīsahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇikoṭīśatasahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇikoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau prasthāpayiṣyanti saṃdarśayiṣyanti samādāpayiṣyanti samuttejayiṣyanti saṃpraharṣayiṣyanti saṃprabhāvayiṣyanti /
analyzed: teṣu api te buddhakṣetreṣu bahūni prāṇi śatāni bahūni prāṇi sahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇi śata sahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇi koṭī śatāni bahūni prāṇi koṭī sahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇi koṭī śata sahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇi koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau prasthāpayiṣyanti saṃdarśayiṣyanti samādāpayiṣyanti samuttejayiṣyanti saṃpraharṣayiṣyanti saṃprabhāvayiṣyanti
translated: In those buddha-fields as well, they will establish many hundreds of living beings, many thousands of living beings, many hundreds of thousands of living beings, many millions of living beings, many tens of millions of living beings, many billions of living beings, many trillions of living beings in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening. They will show it, inspire it, inflame it, delight it, and make it grow.

analyzed: saṃbodhaye pratiṣṭhāpayiṣyanti
translated: They will establish them in complete awakening.

analyzed: a vinivartanīyān kariṣyanti
translated: They will make them irreversible.

original: evamukte āyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavantametadavocatāścaryaṃ bhagavan yāvadidaṃ tathāgatenārhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena atītānāgatapratyutpanneṣu dharmeṣu nāsti kiṃcidadṛṣṭaṃ vā aśrutaṃ vā aviditaṃ vā avijñātaṃ vā /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocata āścaryam bhagavan yāvat idam tathāgatena arhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena atīta anāgata pratyutpanneṣu dharmeṣu na asti kiṃcid adṛṣṭam vā aśrutam vā aviditam vā avijñātam vā
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Śāriputra said to the Blessed One, It is amazing, Blessed One, that the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, has nothing that is unseen, unheard, unsensed, or unknown regarding past, future, and present phenomena.

original: na sa kaściddharmo yo na jñāto na sa kāciccaryā sattvānāṃ yā na vijñātā /
analyzed: na sa kaścid dharmaḥ yaḥ na jñātaḥ na sa kācid caryā sattvānām yā na vijñātā
translated: There is no phenomenon that is unknown to him, no conduct of beings that is unknown to him.

original: yatra hi nāma anāgatānāmapi bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ caryāṃ jñātā bodhicchandikānāmadhyāśayasaṃpannānāmārabdhavīryāṇām /
analyzed: yatra hi nāma anāgatānām api bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām caryām jñātā bodhicchandikānām adhyāśaya saṃpannānām ārabdha vīryāṇām
translated: For he knows the conduct of future Bodhisattva Mahāsattvas who have the aspiration for enlightenment, who are endowed with the superior intention, and who have begun their effort.

original: ye tasmin kāle imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyanti upadekṣyantyuddekṣyanti svādhyāsyanti likhiṣyanti ca /
analyzed: ye tasmin kāle imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyanti upadekṣyanti uddekṣyanti su ādhyāsyanti likhiṣyanti ca
translated: Those who at that time will take up this profound perfection of wisdom, will bear it in mind, recite it, master it, teach it, explain it, chant it, memorize it, and write it.

original: ye ca tasmin kāle āsāṃ ṣaṇṇāṃ pāramitānāṃ kṛtaśaḥ sarvasattvānāmarthāya udyogamāpadya anveṣiṣyante paryeṣiṣyante /🔽gaveṣiṣyante /
analyzed: ye ca tasmin kāle āsām ṣaṇṇām pāramitānām kṛtaśas sarva sattvānām arthāya udyogam āpadya anveṣiṣyante paryeṣiṣyante  gaveṣiṣyante
translated: And those who at that time, for the sake of these six perfections, will strive, seek, and search for the benefit of all beings,🔽and those sons of good family and daughters of good family who, seeking, searching, and investigating,

translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, those individuals in the Bodhisattva Vehicle, having abandoned and rejected this perfection of wisdom, which brings about the knowledge of all aspects, will think that those sūtras which do not bring about the knowledge of all aspects should be sought after.

translated: Thus, those of little understanding, having abandoned and rejected the perfection of wisdom, the root of the correct knowledge of the worldly and supramundane, will think that the branches and leaves should be relied upon.

original: tadyathāpi nāma subhūte kukkuraḥ svāmino'ntikātpiṇḍāṃśchorayitvā karmakarasyāntikātkavalaṃ paryeṣitavyaṃ manyeta /

translated: Having abandoned this perfection of wisdom, the root of the knowledge of all modes, they will think that the essence should be sought after in the Sravakayana and Pratyekabuddhayana, which are like branches, leaves and foliage.

analyzed: idam api subhūte teṣām māra karma veditavyam

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: na hi subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena evam śikṣitavyam yathā śrāvaka yānikāḥ pratyekabuddha yānikāḥ vā pudgalāḥ śikṣante
translated: Because, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, should not train as the persons who belong to the vehicle of the Disciples and the vehicle of the Pratyekabuddhas train.

original: kathaṃ ca subhūte śrāvakayānikāḥ pratyekabuddhayānikā vā pudgalāḥ śikṣante /🔽teṣāṃ subhūte evaṃ bhavatiekamātmānaṃ damayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: katham ca subhūte śrāvaka yānikāḥ pratyekabuddha yānikāḥ vā pudgalāḥ śikṣante  teṣām subhūte evam bhavati ekam ātmānam damayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: And how, Subhuti, do the persons who belong to the vehicle of the Disciples and the vehicle of the Pratyekabuddhas train?🔽They think thus, Subhuti: 'We will tame only one self,🔽we will calm only one self,

analyzed: ekam ātmānam śamayiṣyāmaḥ 🔽ekam ātmānam parinirvāpayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: we will fully know only one self.'

analyzed: iti ātma dama śamatha parinirvāṇāya sarva kuśala mūla abhisaṃskāra prayogān ārabhante
translated: Thus, they undertake all the practices of creating wholesome roots for the sake of self-control, tranquility, and complete nirvāṇa.

original: na khalu punaḥ subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvenaivaṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: na khalu punar subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena evam śikṣitavyam
translated: However, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should not train like this.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvenaivaṃ śikṣitavyamātmānaṃ ca tathatāyāṃ sthāpayiṣyāmi sarvalokānugrahāya /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena evam śikṣitavyam ātmānam ca tathatāyām sthāpayiṣyāmi sarva loka anugrahāya
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should train like this: 'I will establish myself in suchness for the benefit of all worlds.

analyzed: sarva sattvān api tathatāyām sthāpayiṣyāmi
translated: I will establish all beings in suchness.

analyzed: aprameyam sattvadhātum parinirvāpayiṣyāmi iti
translated: I will bring to complete nirvāṇa an immeasurable realm of beings.'

analyzed: sarva kuśala mūla abhisaṃskāra prayogāḥ bodhisattvena mahāsattvena evam ārabdhavyāḥ
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva should begin all the practices of creating wholesome roots like this.

analyzed: na ca taiḥ mantavyam
translated: And they should not think about them.

original: tadyathāpi nāma subhūte kaścideva puruṣo hastinamapaśyan hastino varṇasaṃsthāne paryeṣeta /🔽so'ndhakāre hastinaṃ labdhvā yena prakāśaṃ tenopanidhyāyeta /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma subhūte kaścid eva puruṣaḥ hastinam a paśyan hastinaḥ varṇa saṃsthāne paryeṣeta  sa undhakāre hastinam labdhvā yena prakāśam tena upanidhyāyeta
translated: Just as, for example, some person, not seeing an elephant, would seek the color and form of an elephant.🔽Having obtained an elephant in the dark, he would contemplate it in the light.

analyzed: tena upanidhyāyan hasti padam paryeṣitavyam manyeta
translated: Contemplating it, he would think that he should seek the footprint of an elephant.

analyzed: hasti padāt ca hastinaḥ varṇa saṃsthāne grahītavye manyeta
translated: And from the elephant's footprint, he would think that the color and shape of the elephant should be understood.

original: tatkiṃ manyase subhūte api nu sa paṇḍitajātīyaḥ purūṣo bhavet /
analyzed: tat kim manyase subhūte api nu sa paṇḍita jātīyaḥ purūṣaḥ bhavet
translated: What do you think, Subhuti, would that man be of the type of a wise person?

analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha no hi idam bhagavan
translated: Subhuti said: So it is, Blessed One.

original: bhagavānāhaevameva subhūte tathārūpāste bodhisattvayānikāḥ pudgalā veditavyāḥ /
analyzed: bhagavān āha evam eva subhūte tathārūpāḥ te bodhisattva yānikāḥ pudgalāḥ veditavyāḥ
translated: The Blessed One said: In the same way, Subhuti, those persons who are in the Bodhisattva Vehicle should be known as being like that,

original: ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmajānānā aparipṛcchantastāṃ chorayitvā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃboddhukāmā ye te sūtrāntāḥ śrāvakabhūmimabhivadanti /
analyzed: ye imām prajñāpāramitām a jānānāḥ a paripṛcchantaḥ tām chorayitvā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhu kāmāḥ ye te sūtrāntāḥ śrāvaka bhūmim abhivadanti
translated: who, not knowing this perfection of wisdom, not asking about it, having abandoned it, desirous of fully awakening to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, will think that those Sutras which proclaim the level of the Disciples

analyzed: pratyekabuddha bhūmim abhivadanti
translated: and proclaim the level of the Solitary Sages,

analyzed: tān paryeṣitavyān maṃsyante
translated: should be sought after.

analyzed: idam api subhūte teṣām māra karma veditavyam
translated: This, Subhuti, should be known as a deed of Mara for them.

original: tadyathāpi nāma subhūte ratnārthikaḥ puruṣo mahāsamudraṃ dṛṣṭvā nāvagāheta /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma subhūte ratna arthikaḥ puruṣaḥ mahā samudram dṛṣṭvā na avagāheta
translated: Just as, for example, Subhuti, a man seeking jewels, having seen the great ocean, would not dive into it,

original: ratnāni na nidhyāyet nādhyālambeta /🔽sa ratnahetorgoṣpadaṃ paryeṣitavyaṃ manyeta /
analyzed: ratnāni na nidhyāyet na adhyālambeta  sa ratna hetoḥ goṣpadam paryeṣitavyam manyeta
translated: would not examine the jewels, would not take hold of them,🔽he would think that for the sake of the jewels, a cow's footprint should be sought after.

analyzed: sa goṣpada udakena mahā samudram samīkartavyam manyeta
translated: He would think that the water in a cow's footprint should be made equal to the great ocean.

original: tatkiṃ manyase subhūteapi nu sa paṇḍitajātīyaḥ puruṣo veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: tat kim manyase subhūte api nu sa paṇḍita jātīyaḥ puruṣaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: What do you think, Subhuti, is that man to be called wise?

original: subhūtirāhano hīdaṃ bhagavan /🔽bhagavānāhaevameva subhūte tathārūpāste bodhisattvayānikāḥ pudgalā veditavyāḥ /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha no hi idam bhagavan  bhagavān āha evam eva subhūte tathārūpāḥ te bodhisattva yānikāḥ pudgalāḥ veditavyāḥ
translated: Subhuti: Yes, O Lord.

original: ya imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ labdhvāpyanavagāhamānā avijānantastakṣyanti /🔽ye ca sūtrāntāḥ śrāvakabhūmimabhivadanti /
analyzed: ye imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām labdhvā api an avagāhamānāḥ a vijānantaḥ takṣyanti  ye ca sūtrāntāḥ śrāvaka bhūmim abhivadanti
translated: The Lord: In the same way, Subhuti, are those persons who belong to the vehicle of the Bodhisattvas to be known, who, having obtained this deep perfection of wisdom, will not penetrate it, will not understand it.

analyzed: pratyekabuddha bhūmim abhivadanti alpa utsuka vihāri tayā tān paryeṣitavyān maṃsyante
translated: And they will prefer those Sutras which proclaim the level of the Disciples, the level of the Pratyekabuddhas, the dwelling in a state of few desires,

analyzed: yatra bodhisattva yānam na saṃvarṇyate
translated: where the vehicle of the Bodhisattvas is not extolled,

analyzed: kevalam ātma dama śamatha parinirvāṇam eva iti api pratisaṃlayanam iti
translated: where only the calming of the self, the Parinirvana is extolled.

analyzed: srotaāpatti phalam prāpnuyām iti
translated: They will think: Here we can attain the fruit of a Streamwinner,

analyzed: sakṛdāgāmi phalam iti anāgāmi phalam iti arhat tvam prāpnuyām iti
translated: the fruit of a Once-Returner, the fruit of a Never-Returner, the fruit of an Arhat,

analyzed: pratyeka bodhim prāpnuyām iti
translated: we can attain Pratyekabuddhahood,

original: dṛṣṭa eva dharme anupādāya āsravebhyaścittaṃ vimocya parinirvāpayāmiti /
analyzed: dṛṣṭe eva dharme an upādāya āsravebhyaḥ cittam vimocya parinirvāpayām iti
translated: we can win final Nirvana in this very life, without any clinging.

analyzed: idam ucyate śrāvaka pratyekabuddha bhūmi pratisaṃyuktam iti
translated: This is called related to the stage of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: na atra bodhisattvaiḥ mahāsattvaiḥ evam cittam utpādayitavyam
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattvas should not arouse their minds in this way.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: mahāyānasaṃprasthitā hi subhūte bodhisattvā mahāsattvā mahāsaṃnāhasaṃnaddhā bhavanti /
analyzed: mahāyāna saṃprasthitāḥ hi subhūte bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ mahā saṃnāha saṃnaddhāḥ bhavanti
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have set out in the Great Vehicle are those who have donned the great armor.

analyzed: na taiḥ kadācid alpa utsuka tāyām cittam utpādayitavyam
translated: They should never arouse their minds in a state of little concern.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: lokapariṇāyakā hi bhavanti te satpuruṣā lokārthakarāḥ /
analyzed: loka pariṇāyakāḥ hi bhavanti te sat puruṣāḥ loka artha karāḥ
translated: Those good men are the guides of the world, the benefactors of the world.

analyzed: tasmāt taiḥ nityakālam satata samitam ṣaṣ pāramitāsu śikṣitavyam
translated: Therefore, they should always and constantly train in the six perfections.

original: ye ca khalu punaḥ subhūte aparipakvakuśalamūlāḥ parīttakubuddhikā mṛdukādhyāśayā bodhisattvayānikāḥ pudgalāḥ /
analyzed: ye ca khalu punar subhūte aparipakva kuśala mūlāḥ parītta ku buddhikāḥ mṛduka adhyāśayāḥ bodhisattva yānikāḥ pudgalāḥ
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, those individuals who are followers of the bodhisattva vehicle, whose wholesome roots are not yet ripe, whose understanding is limited, and whose superior intention is weak,

original: te ṣaṭpāramitāpratisaṃyuktān sūtrāntānajānānā anavabuddhyamānā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ chorayitvā ye te sūtrāntāḥ śrāvakapratyekabuddhabhūmimabhivandanti /
analyzed: te ṣaṣ pāramitā pratisaṃyuktān sūtrāntān a jānānāḥ an avabuddhyamānāḥ imām prajñāpāramitām chorayitvā ye te sūtrāntāḥ śrāvaka pratyekabuddha bhūmim abhivandanti
translated: not knowing and not understanding the sūtras connected with the six perfections, will abandon this perfection of wisdom, and will think that those sūtras which extol the stage of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas

analyzed: tān paryeṣitavyān maṃsyante
translated: should be sought after.

original: idamapi subhūte mārakarma veditavyaṃ teṣāṃ tathārūpāṇāṃ bodhisattvayānikānāṃ pudgalānām tadyathāpi nāma subhūte palagaṇḍo vā palagaṇḍāntevāsī vā vaijayantasya prāsādasya pramāṇena prāsādaṃ kartukāmo nirmātukāmaḥ syāt /🔽sa sūryācandramasorvimānapramāṇaṃ maṇḍalaṃ paryeṣeta /
analyzed: idam api subhūte māra karma veditavyam teṣām tathārūpāṇām bodhisattva yānikānām pudgalānām tat yathā api nāma subhūte palagaṇḍaḥ vā palagaṇḍa antevāsī vā vaijayantasya prāsādasya pramāṇena prāsādam kartu kāmaḥ nirmātu kāmaḥ syāt  sa sūryācandramasoḥ vimāna pramāṇam maṇḍalam paryeṣeta
translated: For example, Subhūti, a carpenter or a carpenter's apprentice, desiring to build or construct a palace equal in size to the Vaijayanta palace,🔽would seek out the size of the sphere of the sun and moon.

analyzed: paryeṣamāṇaḥ sa sūryācandramasoḥ vimānam paśyet
translated: Seeking, he would see the palace of the sun and moon.

analyzed: sa tatas pramāṇam grahītavyam manyate
translated: He would think that from that he should take the measure.

original: tatkiṃ manyase subhūte vaijayantaprāsādapramāṇaṃ prāsādaṃ kartukāmena nirmātukāmena sūryācandramasorvimānātpramāṇaṃ grahītavyaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: tat kim manyase subhūte vaijayanta prāsāda pramāṇam prāsādam kartu kāmena nirmātu kāmena sūryācandramasoḥ vimānāt pramāṇam grahītavyam bhavati
translated: What do you think, Subhūti, should the measure of the Vaijayanta palace be taken from the palace of the sun and moon by one who desires to build or construct a palace equal in size to the Vaijayanta palace?

analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha no hi idam bhagavan
translated: Subhūti said, No indeed, Blessed One.

original: bhagavānāhaevameva subhūte bhaviṣyantyanāgate'dhvani eke bodhisattvayānikāḥ pudgalāḥ /
analyzed: bhagavān āha evam eva subhūte bhaviṣyanti anāgata idhvani eke bodhisattva yānikāḥ pudgalāḥ
translated: The Blessed One said, In the same way, Subhūti, there will be some persons in the Bodhisattva Vehicle in the future time,

original: ye prajñāpāramitāṃ śrutvā prajñāpāramitāṃ labdhvā prajñāpāramitāṃ riñcitvā prajñāpāramitāmutsṛjya śrāvakapratyekabuddhabhūmipratisaṃyuktaiḥ sūtrāntaiḥ sarvajñatāṃ paryeṣitavyāṃ maṃsyante /
analyzed: ye prajñāpāramitām śrutvā prajñāpāramitām labdhvā prajñāpāramitām riñcitvā prajñāpāramitām utsṛjya śrāvaka pratyekabuddha bhūmi pratisaṃyuktaiḥ sūtrāntaiḥ sarvajña tām paryeṣitavyām maṃsyante
translated: Those who, having heard the perfection of wisdom, having obtained the perfection of wisdom, having rejected the perfection of wisdom, having abandoned the perfection of wisdom, will think that they should seek omniscience through sūtras connected with the stage of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: ye te sūtrāntāḥ evam abhivadanti ekam ātmānam damayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: Those sūtras that proclaim thus: 'We will tame the one self.

analyzed: ekam ātmānam śamayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will pacify the one self.

analyzed: ekam ātmānam parinirvāpayiṣyāmaḥ iti
translated: We will completely liberate the one self.'

analyzed: kevalam ātma dama śamatha parinirvāṇam eva upanayanti
translated: They lead only to the taming, pacification, and complete liberation of the self.

analyzed: tathārūpān sūtrāntān paryeṣyante
translated: They will seek out such sūtras.

analyzed: tathā ca śikṣitavyam maṃsyante
translated: And they will think that one should train in that way.

original: tatkiṃ manyase subhūte api nu te paṇḍitajātīyāḥ bodhisattvā veditavyāḥ /
analyzed: tat kim manyase subhūte api nu te paṇḍita jātīyāḥ bodhisattvāḥ veditavyāḥ
translated: What do you think, Subhūti, should those bodhisattvas be known as of the type of the wise?

analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha no hi idam bhagavan
translated: Subhūti said, No indeed, Blessed One.

analyzed: bhagavān āha edam api subhūte teṣām māra karma veditavyam
translated: The Blessed One said, Subhūti, this too should be known as the work of Māra for them.

original: tadyathāpi nāma subhūte kaścideva puruṣo rājānaṃ ca cakravartinaṃ bhraṣṭukāmo bhavet /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma subhūte kaścid eva puruṣaḥ rājānam ca cakravartinam bhraṣṭu kāmaḥ bhavet
translated: Subhūti, it is just as if some person, wishing to lose the king who is a wheel-turner,

analyzed: sa rājānam cakravartinam paśyet
translated: would look at the king who is a wheel-turner,

original: dṛṣṭvā ca īdṛśo rājā cakravartī varṇena saṃsthānena tejasā ṛddhyā ceti nimittaṃ gṛhītvā koṭṭarājaṃ paśyet /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca īdṛśaḥ rājā cakravartī varṇena saṃsthānena tejasā ṛddhyā ca iti nimittam gṛhītvā koṭṭarājam paśyet
translated: And having seen such a universal monarch, in terms of color, form, splendor, and prosperity, having taken that as a sign, he would look at the minor king.

original: sa tasya koṭṭarājasya varṇaṃ saṃsthānaṃ teja ṛddhiṃ ca nimittaṃ ca gṛhītvā apratibalo viśeṣagrahaṇaṃ prati evaṃ vadetīdṛśa eva sa rājā cakravartī varṇena saṃsthānena tejasā ṛddhyā ca nimittena ceti /
analyzed: sa tasya koṭṭarājasya varṇam saṃsthānam tejaḥ ṛddhim ca nimittam ca gṛhītvā apratibalaḥ viśeṣa grahaṇam prati evam vada iti īdṛśaḥ eva sa rājā cakravartī varṇena saṃsthānena tejasā ṛddhyā ca nimittena ca iti
translated: He, having taken the color, form, splendor, prosperity, and sign of that minor king, being unable to grasp the distinction, would say this: The universal monarch is just like that in terms of color, form, splendor, prosperity, and sign.

original: tatkiṃ manyase subhūte api nu sa paṇḍitajātīyaḥ puruṣo veditavyo yaścakravartinaṃ koṭṭarājena samīkartavyaṃ manyeta /
analyzed: tat kim manyase subhūte api nu sa paṇḍita jātīyaḥ puruṣaḥ veditavyaḥ yaḥ cakravartinam koṭṭarājena samīkartavyam manyeta
translated: What do you think, Subhuti, is that person of the class of the wise to be known, who would think to compare the universal monarch to a minor king?

analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha no hi idam bhagavan
translated: Subhuti said: So it is, Blessed One.

original: bhagavānāhaevameva subhūte bhaviṣyantyanāgate'dhvani eke bodhisattvayānikāḥ pudgalāḥ /
analyzed: bhagavān āha evam eva subhūte bhaviṣyanti anāgata idhvani eke bodhisattva yānikāḥ pudgalāḥ
translated: The Blessed One said: In the same way, Subhuti, there will be some individuals in the Bodhisattva vehicle in the future time.

original: ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ śrutvā prajñāpāramitāṃ labdhvā prajñāpāramitāṃ riñcitvā prajñāpāramitāmutsṛjya śrāvakapratyekabuddhabhūmipratisaṃyuktaiḥ sūtrāntaiḥ sarvajñatāṃ paryeṣitavyāṃ maṃsyante /
analyzed: yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām śrutvā prajñāpāramitām labdhvā prajñāpāramitām riñcitvā prajñāpāramitām utsṛjya śrāvaka pratyekabuddha bhūmi pratisaṃyuktaiḥ sūtrāntaiḥ sarvajña tām paryeṣitavyām maṃsyante
translated: Those who, having heard this perfection of wisdom, having obtained the perfection of wisdom, having rejected the perfection of wisdom, having abandoned the perfection of wisdom, will think that they should seek for full enlightenment by means of sūtras connected with the level of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: idam api subhūte teṣām māra karma veditavyam
translated: This, Subhūti, should be known as a deed of Māra.

original: na khalu punarahaṃ subhūte ebhirevaṃrūpaiḥ śrāvakapratyekabuddhabhūmipratisaṃyuktaiḥ sūtrāntairbodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya sarvajñatāṃ paryeṣitavyāṃ vadāmi /
analyzed: na khalu punar aham subhūte ebhiḥ evaṃrūpaiḥ śrāvaka pratyekabuddha bhūmi pratisaṃyuktaiḥ sūtrāntaiḥ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya sarvajña tām paryeṣitavyām vadāmi
translated: Subhūti, I do not say that the bodhisattva mahāsattva should seek for full enlightenment by means of sūtras connected with the level of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas of this kind.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ subhūte yattathāgatena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāmupāyakauśalyamākhyātam /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar subhūte yat tathāgatena prajñāpāramitāyām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām upāya kauśalyam ākhyātam
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the skill in means of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas in the perfection of wisdom has been taught by the Tathāgata.

original: tatrāśikṣitvā bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na niryāsyatyanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: tatra a śikṣitvā bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na niryāsyati anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Without training in that, the bodhisattva mahāsattva will not attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: dhandhakaḥ hi anyeṣu sūtrānteṣu bodhisattva samudāgamaḥ
translated: Because the attainment of the bodhisattva in other sūtras is slow.

original: tasmāttarhi subhūte tathāgata enāmanuśaṃsāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ paśyan anekaparyāyeṇa bodhisattvān mahāsattvānasyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ saṃdarśayati samādāpayati samuttejayati saṃpraharṣayati saṃniveśayati pratiṣṭhāpayatievaṃ bodhisattvā mahāsattvā avinivartanīyā bhaveyuranuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheriti tatkiṃ manyase subhūte api nu paṇḍitajātīyāste bodhisattvāḥ pratibhānti /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi subhūte tathāgataḥ enām anuśaṃsām prajñāpāramitāyām paśyan aneka paryāyeṇa bodhisattvān mahāsattvān asyām prajñāpāramitāyām saṃdarśayati samādāpayati samuttejayati saṃpraharṣayati saṃniveśayati pratiṣṭhāpayati evam bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ a vinivartanīyāḥ bhaveyuḥ anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ iti tat kim manyase subhūte api nu paṇḍita jātīyāḥ te bodhisattvāḥ pratibhānti
translated: Therefore, Subhuti, the Tathagata, seeing this benefit in the perfection of wisdom, in many ways reveals, encourages, exhorts, and establishes the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas in this perfection of wisdom, thinking, 'Thus will the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas become irreversible from supreme enlightenment.' What do you think, Subhuti, do those Bodhisattvas appear to be of the type of the wise,

original: ye avinivartanīyayānaṃ mahāyānamavāpya samāsādya punareva tadvivarjya vivartya hīnayānaṃ paryeṣitavyaṃ maṃsyante /
analyzed: ye a vinivartanīya yānam mahāyānam avāpya samāsādya punar eva tat vivarjya vivartya hīnayānam paryeṣitavyam maṃsyante
translated: who, having obtained and reached the irreversible vehicle, the great vehicle, will again abandon it, turn away from it, and think of seeking the Lesser Vehicle?

analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha no hi idam bhagavan
translated: Subhuti: Yes, Lord.

original: bhagavānāhatadyathāpi nāma subhūte bubhukṣitaḥ puruṣaḥ śatarasaṃ bhojanaṃ labdhvā hitavipākaṃ sukhavipākaṃ yāvadāyuḥparyantaṃ kṣutpipāsānivartakam /
analyzed: bhagavān āha tat yathā api nāma subhūte bubhukṣitaḥ puruṣaḥ śata rasam bhojanam labdhvā hita vipākam sukha vipākam yāvat āyuḥ paryantam kṣudh pipāsā nivartakam
translated: The Lord: It is just as if a hungry man, having obtained food of a hundred tastes, of beneficial ripening, of blissful ripening, which would last until the end of life, and would remove hunger and thirst,

analyzed: tat apāsya ṣaṣṭikā udanam paryeṣitavyam manyeta
translated: Having rejected the rice, he would think that he should search for the barley.

original: ṣaṣṭikodanaṃ labdhvā śatarasaṃ bhojanamutsṛjya vivarjya taṃ ṣaṣṭikodanaṃ paribhoktavyaṃ manyeta /
analyzed: ṣaṣṭikā udanam labdhvā śata rasam bhojanam utsṛjya vivarjya tam ṣaṣṭikā udanam paribhoktavyam manyeta
translated: Having obtained the barley, he would think that he should eat the barley, having abandoned and rejected the hundred-flavored food.

original: tatkiṃ manyase subhūte api nu sa puruṣaḥ paṇḍitajātīyo bhavet /
analyzed: tat kim manyase subhūte api nu sa puruṣaḥ paṇḍita jātīyaḥ bhavet
translated: What do you think, Subhūti? Would that man be of the type of a wise person?

analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha no hi idam bhagavan
translated: Subhūti said, No, Blessed One.

analyzed: bhagavān āha evam eva subhūte bhaviṣyanti anāgata idhvani eke bodhisattvāḥ
translated: The Blessed One said, In the same way, Subhūti, there will be some bodhisattvas in the future time
