analyzed: yathā vīrya pāramitā ca me tasmin samaye paripūrim gamiṣyati iti
translated: So that at that time the perfection of effort will be fulfilled for me.

original: punaraparaṃ śāriputra bubhukṣākāntāramadhyagatena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena notrasitavyaṃ na saṃtrasitavyaṃ na saṃtrāsamāpattavyam /
analyzed: punar aparam śāriputra bubhukṣā kāntāra madhya gatena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na utrasitavyam na saṃtrasitavyam na saṃtrāsam āpattavyam
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who has entered a desert of hunger should not be frightened, should not be terrified, should not be overcome by terror.

original: evaṃ cānena saṃnāhaḥ saṃnāhyaḥtathā dṛḍhaṃ vīryamārapsye /
analyzed: evam ca anena saṃnāhaḥ saṃnāhyaḥ tathā dṛḍham vīryam ārapsye
translated: And he should don the armor thus: Thus I will arouse firm effort.

analyzed: tathā ca svam buddhakṣetram pariśodhayiṣyāmi
translated: And thus I will purify my own buddha field.

original: yathā me anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhasya satastasmin buddhakṣetre evaṃrūpāṇi bubhukṣākāntārāṇi sarveṇa sarvaṃ sarvathā sarvaṃ na bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: yathā me anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhasya sataḥ tasmin buddhakṣetre evaṃrūpāṇi bubhukṣā kāntārāṇi sarveṇa sarvam sarvathā sarvam na bhaviṣyanti
translated: So that when I have attained supreme perfect enlightenment, in that buddha field such forms of hunger will not exist at all, in any way, at all.

analyzed: na prajñāsyante
translated: They will not be known.

original: sukhitā eva te sattvā bhaviṣyanti sukhasamaṅginaḥ sarvasukhasamarpitāḥ /
analyzed: sukhitāḥ eva te sattvāḥ bhaviṣyanti sukha samaṅginaḥ sarva sukha samarpitāḥ
translated: Those beings will be happy, endowed with happiness, filled with all forms of happiness.

analyzed: tathā ca kariṣyāmi
translated: I will do just that.

original: yathā teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ yo ya evābhiprāyo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yathā teṣām sattvānām yaḥ yaḥ eva abhiprāyaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And I will do it in such a way that whatever wish those beings may have,

analyzed: yat yat eva ākāṅkṣiṣyanti manasā
translated: whatever they may desire in their minds,

original: tattadeva prādurbhaviṣyati tadyathāpi nāma devānāṃ trāyastriṃśānāṃ manasaiva sarvamutpadyate /
analyzed: tat tat eva prādurbhaviṣyati tat yathā api nāma devānām trāyastriṃśānām manasā eva sarvam utpadyate
translated: that very thing will appear to them, just as for the gods of the Thirty-Three everything arises merely through the mind.

original: yathā teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ manasaiva sarvaṃ prādurbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yathā teṣām sattvānām manasā eva sarvam prādurbhaviṣyati
translated: In such a way, whatever those beings may wish for, it will all appear to them merely through the mind.

analyzed: manasā sarvam utpatsyate
translated: Everything will arise through the mind.

analyzed: tathā dṛḍham vīryam ārapsye
translated: I will arouse such firm diligence

original: yathā teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ dhārmikā abhiprāyāḥ paripūriṃ gamiṣyanti /
analyzed: yathā teṣām sattvānām dhārmikāḥ abhiprāyāḥ paripūrim gamiṣyanti
translated: that the virtuous aspirations of those beings will be fulfilled.

original: avaikalyaṃ ca jīvitapariṣkāraiḥ sarvasattvānāṃ bhaviṣyati sarvathā sarvataḥ sarvadā /
analyzed: a vaikalyam ca jīvita pariṣkāraiḥ sarva sattvānām bhaviṣyati sarvathā sarvatas sarvadā
translated: And all beings will have no lack of the requisites for life in every way, from every direction, and at all times.

original: tathā ca svacittapariśuddhaye vyāyaṃsye sarvasattvānāṃ kṛtaśaḥ /
analyzed: tathā ca sva citta pariśuddhaye vyāyaṃsye sarva sattvānām kṛtaśas
translated: And I will strive in that way for the purification of my own mind for the sake of all beings,

original: yathā dhyānapāramitā ca me tasmin samaye paripūriṃ gamiṣyatīti //
analyzed: yathā dhyāna pāramitā ca me tasmin samaye paripūrim gamiṣyati iti
translated: so that at that time the perfection of meditation will be fulfilled for me.

original: punaraparaṃ śāriputra vyādhikāntāramadhyagatena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena notrasitavyaṃ na saṃtrasitavyaṃ na saṃtrāsamāpattavyam /
analyzed: punar aparam śāriputra vyādhi kāntāra madhya gatena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na utrasitavyam na saṃtrasitavyam na saṃtrāsam āpattavyam
translated: Furthermore, Śāriputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who has entered the wilderness of sickness should not be frightened, should not be terrified, should not fall into terror.

original: evaṃ cānenopaparīkṣitavyaṃ cintayitavyaṃ tulayitavyamneha sa kaściddharmo yo vyādhyā bādhyate /
analyzed: evam ca anena upaparīkṣitavyam cintayitavyam tulayitavyam na iha sa kaścid dharmaḥ yaḥ vyādhyā bādhyate
translated: And he should investigate, contemplate, and weigh it thus: 'Here there is no dharma at all that is afflicted by sickness.

analyzed: nā api sa kaścid dharmaḥ yaḥ vyādhiḥ nāma
translated: Nor is there any dharma at all that is called sickness.'

analyzed: evam tena śūnyatā pratyavekṣitavyā
translated: Thus he should investigate emptiness.

original: na cotrasitavyaṃ na saṃtrasitavyaṃ na saṃtrāsamāpattavyam /
analyzed: na ca utrasitavyam na saṃtrasitavyam na saṃtrāsam āpattavyam
translated: And he should not be frightened, should not be terrified, should not fall into terror.

original: na ca śāriputra bodhisattvena mahāsattvenaivaṃ cittamutpādayitavyamcireṇānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsye iti notrasitavyaṃ na saṃtrasitavyaṃ na saṃtrāsamāpattavyam /
analyzed: na ca śāriputra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena evam cittam utpādayitavyam cireṇa anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsye iti na utrasitavyam na saṃtrasitavyam na saṃtrāsam āpattavyam
translated: And, Śāriputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva should not arouse the thought: 'I will attain supreme perfect enlightenment only after a long time.' He should not be frightened, should not be terrified, should not fall into terror.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: yaḥ hi citta kṣaṇaḥ
translated: Because that is a moment of mind.

analyzed: iyatī sā eṣā apūrvā koṭiḥ yat uta akoṭiḥ
translated: This is the unprecedented limit, namely, the non-limit.

original: evaṃ tena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na duṣkarasaṃjñotpādayitavyābahvī dīrghā caiṣā apūrvā koṭiriti /
analyzed: evam tena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na duṣkara saṃjñā utpādayitavyā abahvī dīrghā ca eṣā apūrvā koṭiḥ iti
translated: In this way, that bodhisattva mahāsattva should not give rise to the notion that it is difficult, thinking, This is a long, new beginning.

analyzed: eka citta kṣaṇa samāyuktā hi eṣā apūrvā koṭiḥ yat uta akoṭiḥ
translated: For this new beginning is connected with a single moment of thought, namely, the beginningless.

original: evaṃ śāriputra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena cireṇānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsye iti notrasitavyaṃ na saṃtrasitavyaṃ na saṃtrāsamāpattavyam
analyzed: evam śāriputra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena cireṇa anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsye iti na utrasitavyam na saṃtrasitavyam na saṃtrāsam āpattavyam
translated: In this way, Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should not be afraid, should not be terrified, should not be overcome by terror, thinking, 'I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment after a long time.'

original: yaḥ khalu punaḥ śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattva ebhyaścānyebhyaśca dṛṣṭaśrutamatavijñātebhyo bhayabhairavebhyo notrasyati na saṃtrasyati na
analyzed: yaḥ khalu punar śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ ebhyaḥ ca anyebhyaḥ ca dṛṣṭa śruta mata vijñātebhyaḥ bhaya bhairavebhyaḥ na utrasyati na saṃtrasyati na
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra, that bodhisattva mahāsattva who is not afraid, terrified,

original: jñātavyamidaṃ śāriputra bhavyo'yaṃ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃboddhumiti /
analyzed: jñātavyam idam śāriputra bhavyā iyam kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhum iti
translated: or frightened by these and other seen, heard, thought, and cognized fears and terrors, Śāriputra, it should be known that this noble son or noble daughter is capable of fully awakening to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.🔽In this way, Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should don the great armor thus:

original: evaṃ ca śāriputra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena mahāsaṃnāhaḥ saṃnaddhavyaḥtathā kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: evam ca śāriputra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena mahā saṃnāhaḥ saṃnaddhavyaḥ tathā kariṣyāmi
translated: 'I will practice thus.

analyzed: tathā dṛḍham vīryam ārapsye
translated: I will firmly generate diligence thus.

original: yathā me anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhasya satastasmin buddhakṣetre sarvasattvānāṃ sarveṇa sarvaṃ sarvathā sarvaṃ sarvavyādhayo na bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: yathā me anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhasya sataḥ tasmin buddhakṣetre sarva sattvānām sarveṇa sarvam sarvathā sarvam sarva vyādhayaḥ na bhaviṣyanti
translated: As I, having attained supreme perfect enlightenment, all diseases of all beings will not exist in any way at all in that Buddha-field.

analyzed: na prajñāsyante
translated: They will not be known.

analyzed: tathā kariṣyāmi
translated: I will do it in such a way.

analyzed: yathā tathāgatānām ukta vādī yathā ukta kārī ca bhaviṣyāmi
translated: I will be a speaker in accordance with the Tathagatas, and an actor in accordance with my words.

original: tathā ca prajñāpāramitāyāṃ parijayaṃ kariṣyāmi sarvasattvānāṃ kṛtaśaḥ /
analyzed: tathā ca prajñāpāramitāyām parijayam kariṣyāmi sarva sattvānām kṛtaśas
translated: And I will practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of all beings.

original: yathā prajñāpāramitāpi me tasmin samaye paripūriṃ gamiṣyatīti //
analyzed: yathā prajñāpāramitā api me tasmin samaye paripūrim gamiṣyati iti
translated: So that the perfection of wisdom will be fulfilled for me at that time.

original: atha khalu tatra parṣadi anyatarā strī saṃnipatitā saṃniṣaṇṇābhūt /
analyzed: atha khalu tatra parṣadi anyatarā strī saṃnipatitā saṃniṣaṇṇā abhūt
translated: Then in that assembly, a certain woman who had gathered and was seated,

original: sā utthāyāsanādekāṃsamuttarāsaṅgaṃ kṛtvā dakṣiṇaṃ jānumaṇḍalaṃ pṛthivyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavāṃstenāñjaliṃ praṇamya bhagavantametadavocatahaṃ bhagavan atra sthāne notrasiṣyāmi /🔽na saṃtrasiṣyāmi /
analyzed: sā utthāya āsanāt eka aṃsam uttarāsaṅgam kṛtvā dakṣiṇam jānu maṇḍalam pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavān tena añjalim praṇamya bhagavantam etat avocata ham bhagavan atra sthāne na utrasiṣyāmi  na saṃtrasiṣyāmi
translated: she rose from her seat, arranged her upper robe over one shoulder, placed her right knee on the ground, bowed to the Blessed One with folded hands, and said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, I will not be afraid in this place.🔽I will not be terrified.

analyzed: na saṃtrāsam āpatsye
translated: I will not fall into terror.

original: anutrastā ca asaṃtrastā ca sarvasattvebhyo dharmaṃ deśayiṣyāmīti /
analyzed: anutrastā ca asaṃtrastā ca sarva sattvebhyaḥ dharmam deśayiṣyāmi iti
translated: I will teach the Dharma to all beings without fear or trembling.'

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāṃ suvarṇavarṇasmitaṃ prādurakarot /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām suvarṇa varṇa smitam prādurakarot
translated: Then at that time the Blessed One manifested a golden-colored smile.

original: tadanantāparyantān lokadhātūnābhayā spharitvā yāvadbrahmalokamabhyudgamya punareva pratyudāvṛtya bhagavantaṃ triḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya bhagavata eva mūrdhni antaradhīyata /
analyzed: tat anantā paryantān lokadhātūn ābhayā spharitvā yāvat brahma lokam abhyudgamya punar eva pratyudāvṛtya bhagavantam tris pradakṣiṇīkṛtya bhagavataḥ eva mūrdhni antaradhīyata
translated: That light filled the endless and limitless world systems, reaching up to the Brahma world, and after circling around three times, disappeared back into the Blessed One's head.

original: samanantaraṃ prāduṣkṛte ca bhagavatā tasmin smite atha khalu sā strī suvarṇapuṣpāṇi gṛhītvā bhagavantaṃ suvarṇapuṣpairabhyavākiradabhiprākirat
analyzed: samanantaram prāduṣkṛte ca bhagavatā tasmin smite atha khalu sā strī suvarṇa puṣpāṇi gṛhītvā bhagavantam suvarṇa puṣpaiḥ abhyavākirat abhiprākirat
translated: Immediately after the Blessed One manifested that smile, the woman took golden flowers and scattered them over the Blessed One, sprinkling them.

original: atha khalu tāni suvarṇapuṣpāṇyasaktāni antarīkṣe vihāyasi sthitānyabhūvan //
analyzed: atha khalu tāni suvarṇa puṣpāṇi asaktāni antarīkṣe vihāyasi sthitāni abhūvan
translated: Then those golden flowers remained suspended in the sky without falling.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmānānanda utthāyāsanādekāṃsamuttarāsaṅgaṃ kṛtvā dakṣiṇaṃ jānumaṇḍalaṃ pṛthivyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavāṃstenāñjaliṃ praṇamya bhagavantametadavocatko bhagavan hetuḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān ānandaḥ utthāya āsanāt eka aṃsam uttarāsaṅgam kṛtvā dakṣiṇam jānu maṇḍalam pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavān tena añjalim praṇamya bhagavantam etat avocat kaḥ bhagavan hetuḥ
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda rose from his seat, put his upper robe over one shoulder, placed his right knee on the ground, bowed to the Blessed One with folded hands, and said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, what is the cause,

analyzed: kaḥ pratyayaḥ smitasya prāduṣkaraṇāya
translated: what is the reason for manifesting a smile?

original: nāhetukaṃ nāpratyayaṃ tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ smitaṃ prāduṣkurvanti /
analyzed: na ahetukam na apratyayam tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ smitam prāduṣkurvanti
translated: The Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones do not manifest a smile without a cause, without a reason.

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantamānandametadavocatiyamānanda gaṅgadevā bhaginī anāgate'dhvani suvarṇapuṣpo nāma tathāgato bhaviṣyati arhan samyaksaṃbuddho vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam etat avocat iyam ānanda gaṅgadevā bhaginī anāgata idhvani suvarṇapuṣpaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyati arhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda, Ānanda, this sister Gangadevā will in the future become a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Awakened One, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed Lord, named Suvarṇapuspa.

analyzed: buddhaḥ bhagavān loke utpatsyate
translated: He will appear in the world as a Buddha, a Blessed One.

analyzed: tāraka upame kalpena uttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: In the eon called Tāraka, he will fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: seyamānanda gaṅgadevā bhaginī strībhāvaṃ vivartya puruṣabhāvaṃ pratilabhya itaścyutvā akṣobhyasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya buddhakṣetre abhiratyāṃ lokadhātāvupapatsyate /
analyzed: sā iyam ānanda gaṅgadevā bhaginī strī bhāvam vivartya puruṣa bhāvam pratilabhya itas cyutvā akṣobhyasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya buddhakṣetre abhiratyām lokadhātau upapatsyate
translated: This sister of yours, Gangadeva, Ananda, having turned away from the female state, will attain the male state, and having passed away from here, will be reborn in the world system called Abhirati in the Buddha-field of the Tathagata Akshobhya, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: tatra copapannā akṣobhyasya tathāgatāsyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasyāntike brahmacaryaṃ cariṣyati /
analyzed: tatra ca upapannā akṣobhyasya tathāgatā asya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya antike brahmacaryam cariṣyati
translated: And having been reborn there, she will live the holy life in the presence of the Tathagata Akshobhya, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: tataścyutā satī buddhakṣetrādbuddhakṣetraṃ saṃkramiṣyati avirahitā tathāgatadarśanena /
analyzed: tatas cyutā satī buddhakṣetrāt buddhakṣetram saṃkramiṣyati avirahitā tathāgata darśanena
translated: And having passed away from there, she will go from Buddha-field to Buddha-field, never separated from the sight of the Tathagatas.

analyzed: tatas api buddhakṣetrāt buddhakṣetrāṇi saṃkramiṣyati
translated: And from that Buddha-field she will go to other Buddha-fields.

analyzed: yāni avirahitāni bhaviṣyanti buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ tatra tatra saṃkramiṣyati
translated: She will not be separated from the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, wherever she goes.

original: tadyathāpi nāma ānanda rājā cakravartīṃ prāsādātprāsādaṃ saṃkrāmet /🔽sa yāvajjīvaṃ pādatalābhyāṃ dharaṇītalaṃ nākrāmet /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma ānanda rājā cakravartīm prāsādāt prāsādam saṃkrāmet  sa yāvajjīvam pāda talābhyām dharaṇī talam na ākrāmet
translated: Just as, Ananda, a universal monarch would go from palace to palace,🔽so long as he does not tread upon the ground with the soles of his feet.

original: sa yāvanmaraṇāvasthāyāṃ bhūmitalaṃ pabhdyāmanākramya kālaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: sa yāvat maraṇa avasthāyām bhūmi talam pabhdyām an ākramya kālam kuryāt
translated: And so long as he does not die, he will not tread upon the ground with the soles of his feet.

original: evameva ānanda iyaṃ gaṅgadevā bhaginī buddhakṣetraṃ saṃkramiṣyati /
analyzed: evam eva ānanda iyam gaṅgadevā bhaginī buddhakṣetram saṃkramiṣyati
translated: In the same way, Ānanda, this sister Gaṅgadeva will go to the Buddha-field,

original: tatra ca avirahitā bhaviṣyati buddharbhagavadbhiryāvannānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhyate //
analyzed: tatra ca avirahitā bhaviṣyati buddhaḥ bhagavadbhiḥ yāvat na anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate
translated: and there she will not be separated from the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, until she fully awakens to highest genuine full Awakening.”

original: atha khalvāyuṣmata ānandasyaitadabhūtye tatrākṣobhyasya tathāgatāsyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasyāntike bodhisattvā mahāsattvā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmataḥ ānandasya etat abhūtye tatra akṣobhyasya tathāgata asya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya antike bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda thought this: “Those Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas will be in the presence of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Akṣobhya.

analyzed: tathāgata saṃnipātaḥ eva sa veditavyaḥ
translated: That assembly should be known as an assembly of Tathāgatas.”

original: atha khalu bhagavānāyuṣmata ānandasya imamevaṃrūpaṃ cetasaiva cetaḥparivitarkamājñāya āyuṣmantamānandametadavocatevametadānanda / evametat /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmataḥ ānandasya imam evaṃrūpam cetasā eva cetaḥ parivitarkam ājñāya āyuṣmantam ānandam etat avocat evam etat ānanda evam etat
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing this kind of thought in the mind of the venerable Ānanda, said to the venerable Ānanda, “So it is, Ānanda! So it is!

analyzed: uttīrṇa paṅkāḥ te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ
translated: Those Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas have crossed the mire.

original: ye akṣobhyasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya buddhakṣetre brahmacaryaṃ caranti /
analyzed: ye akṣobhyasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya buddhakṣetre brahmacaryam caranti
translated: Those who practice the holy life in the Buddha-field of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Akṣobhya.

analyzed: bodhi pariniṣpati upagatāḥ te ānanda bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ veditavyāḥ
translated: Ānanda, those Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas should be known as having attained the perfection of Awakening.

original: tasya khalu punarānanda suvarṇapuṣpasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya na pramāṇabaddhaḥ śrāvakasaṃgho bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tasya khalu punar ānanda suvarṇapuṣpasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya na pramāṇa baddhaḥ śrāvaka saṃghaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Ānanda, the community of hearers of that Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One Suvarṇapuṣpa will not be limited in number.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tāvanto hyānanda tatra śrāvakā bhaviṣyanti yeṣāṃ nāsti pramāṇam /
analyzed: tāvantaḥ hi ānanda tatra śrāvakāḥ bhaviṣyanti yeṣām na asti pramāṇam
translated: Ānanda, there will be that many hearers there whose number is unknown.

original: api tvaprameyā asaṃkhyeyā ityevaṃ saṃkhyāṃ gamiṣyanti /
analyzed: api tu aprameyāḥ asaṃkhyeyāḥ iti evam saṃkhyām gamiṣyanti
translated: Rather, they will be immeasurable and innumerable, and will be known as such.

original: tena khalu punarānanda kālena tena samayena tasmin buddhakṣetre na vyālakāntārāṇi bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: tena khalu punar ānanda kālena tena samayena tasmin buddhakṣetre na vyāla kāntārāṇi bhaviṣyanti
translated: Ānanda, at that time, at that moment, in that buddha-field there will be no dangers from wild animals,

original: na caurakāntārāṇi na pānīyakāntārāṇi na vyādhikāntārāṇi na durbhikṣakāntārāṇi bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: na caura kāntārāṇi na pānīya kāntārāṇi na vyādhi kāntārāṇi na durbhikṣa kāntārāṇi bhaviṣyanti
translated: no dangers from thieves, no dangers from water, no dangers from illness, and no dangers from famine.

original: etāni cānyāni ca ānanda asātakāntārāṇi tasmin buddhakṣetre sarveṇa sarvaṃ sarvathā sarvaṃ na bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: etāni ca anyāni ca ānanda asāta kāntārāṇi tasmin buddhakṣetre sarveṇa sarvam sarvathā sarvam na bhaviṣyanti
translated: Ānanda, all those and other dangers will be completely and totally absent in that buddha-field.

analyzed: na prajñāsyante
translated: They will not be known.

original: suvarṇapuṣpasya khalu punarānanda tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhasya imānyevaṃrūpāṇi bhayabhairavakāntārāṇi sarveṇa sarvaṃ sarvathā sarvaṃ tadānīṃ na bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: suvarṇapuṣpasya khalu punar ānanda tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhasya imāni evaṃrūpāṇi bhaya bhairava kāntārāṇi sarveṇa sarvam sarvathā sarvam tadānīm na bhaviṣyanti
translated: Ānanda, when the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Suvarṇapuṣpa attains supreme perfect enlightenment, all these kinds of fears, terrors, and dangers will not exist at all, in any way, at that time.

analyzed: na prajñāsyante
translated: They will not be known.

original: evamukte āyuṣmānānando bhagavantametadavocatanayā bhagavan gaṅgadevayā bhaginyā katamasya tathāgatasyāntike prathamacittotpādakuśalamūlamavaropitamanuttarāyāṃ
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavantam etat avocata ayā bhagavan gaṅgadevayā bhaginyā katamasya tathāgatasya antike prathama citta utpāda kuśala mūlam avaropitam anuttarāyām
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Ānanda said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, by what Tathāgata was the wholesome root first planted by the sister Gangadevā for supreme perfect enlightenment?

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantamānandametadavocatanayā ānanda gaṅgadevayā bhaginyā dīpaṃkarasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasyāntike prathamacittotpādakuśalamūlamavaropitam /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam etat avocat anayā ānanda gaṅgadevayā bhaginyā dīpaṃkarasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya antike prathama citta utpāda kuśala mūlam avaropitam
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the Venerable Ānanda, Ānanda, the wholesome root for supreme perfect enlightenment was first planted by the sister Gangadevā in the presence of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Dīpaṃkara.

analyzed: anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmitam ca
translated: And it was dedicated to supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: sa ca dīpaṃkarastathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ suvarṇapuṣpairevāvakīrṇo'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhiṃ prārthayamānayā /
analyzed: sa ca dīpaṃkaraḥ tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ suvarṇa puṣpaiḥ eva avakīrṇaḥ unuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim prārthayamānayā
translated: And that Tathāgata Dīpaṃkara, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, was worshipped with golden flowers by me, while I was aspiring for supreme perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: yadā mayā pañcabhiḥ utpalaiḥ dīpaṃkaraḥ tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddha uvakīrṇaḥ
translated: When I scattered five blue lotuses over the Tathāgata Dīpaṃkara, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One,

original: anutpattikeṣu ca mayā dharmeṣu kṣāntiḥ pratilabdhā /
analyzed: anutpattikeṣu ca mayā dharmeṣu kṣāntiḥ pratilabdhā
translated: I attained acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas.

original: tato'haṃ dīpaṃkareṇa tathāgatenārhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena vyākṛto'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhaubhaviṣyasi tvaṃ māṇavaka anāgate'dhvani śākyamunirnāma tathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca buddho bhagavāniti tadā etasyā bhaginyā mama vyākaraṇaṃ śrutvā evaṃ cittamudapādiaho bata ahamapyevaṃ vyākriyeya anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau yathāyaṃ māṇavako vyākṛto'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: tatas ham dīpaṃkareṇa tathāgatena arhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena vyākṛtaḥ unuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau bhaviṣyasi tvam māṇavaka anāgata idhvani śākyamuniḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca buddhaḥ bhagavān iti tadā etasyāḥ bhaginyāḥ mama vyākaraṇam śrutvā evam cittam udapādi aho bata aham api evam vyākriyeya anuttarāyām samya
translated: Then I was prophesied by the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One Dīpaṃkara: 'You, young man, in a future time, will become a Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed Lord, named Śākyamuni.' At that time, this sister, having heard my prophecy, gave rise to this thought: 'Oh, may I also be prophesied to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, just as this young man has been prophesied to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.'

original: evaṃ ca ānanda etasyā bhaginyā dīpaṃkarasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasyāntike prathamacittotpādakuśalamūlamavaropitamabhūdanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: evam ca ānanda etasyāḥ bhaginyāḥ dīpaṃkarasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya antike prathama citta utpāda kuśala mūlam avaropitam abhūt anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And so, Ānanda, this sister planted the root of merit of giving rise to the first thought of enlightenment in the presence of the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One Dīpaṃkara, for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: evamukte āyuṣmānānando bhagavantametadavocatkṛtaparikarmā bateyaṃ bhagavan kṛtaparyantā gaṅgadevā bhaginī vyākṛtā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat kṛta parikarmā bata iyam bhagavan kṛta paryantā gaṅgadevā bhaginī vyākṛtā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: When this was said, the venerable Ānanda said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, it is so, Blessed One. The sister Gangadevā has completed her preparations and has reached the end, and has been prophesied to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam etat avocat evam etat ānanda
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said this to the venerable Ānanda: So it is, Ānanda.

original: evametat yathā vadasikṛtaparikarmā bateyaṃ kṛtaparyantā gaṅgadevā bhaginī vyākṛtā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhāviti //
analyzed: evam etat yathā vadasi kṛta parikarmā bata iyam kṛta paryantā gaṅgadevā bhaginī vyākṛtā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau iti
translated: So it is, as you say. The sister Gangadevā has completed her preparations and has reached the end, and has been prophesied to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: ārya aṣṭasāhasrikāyām prajñāpāramitāyām gaṅgadevībhaginīparivartaḥ nāma ekonaviṃśatitamaḥ
translated: In the Noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines, the chapter called The Sister Gangadevā, the nineteenth.

analyzed: upāyakauśalyamīmāṃsā parivartaḥ viṃśatitamaḥ
translated: The twentieth chapter on the examination of skillful means.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān subhūtirbhagavantametadavocatprajñāpāramitāyāṃ bhagavaṃścaratā bodhisattvena mahāsattvena kathaṃ śūnyatāyāṃ parijayaḥ kartavyaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat prajñāpāramitāyām bhagavan caratā bodhisattvena mahāsattvena katham śūnyatāyām parijayaḥ kartavyaḥ
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva is practicing the perfection of wisdom, how should he master emptiness?

analyzed: katham vā śūnyatā samādhiḥ samāpattavyaḥ
translated: Or how should he enter the concentration on emptiness?

original: bhagavānāhaiha subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caratā rūpaṃ śūnyamiti pratyavekṣitavyam /🔽evaṃ vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ /
analyzed: bhagavān āha eha subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām caratā rūpam śūnyam iti pratyavekṣitavyam  evam vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ
translated: The Blessed One said, Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom should contemplate form as empty.

analyzed: vijñānam śūnyam iti pratyavekṣitavyam
translated: Likewise, he should contemplate feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness as empty.

original: tathā ca pratyavekṣitavyamavikṣiptayā cittasaṃtatyā yathā pratyavekṣamāṇo rūpamiti tāṃ dharmatāṃ dharmatayā na samanupaśyet /
analyzed: tathā ca pratyavekṣitavyam avikṣiptayā citta saṃtatyā yathā pratyavekṣamāṇaḥ rūpam iti tām dharmatām dharmatayā na samanupaśyet
translated: And he should contemplate in such a way with an undistracted mindstream that, while contemplating, he would not see that nature of phenomena as a nature of phenomena.

original: tāṃ ca asamanupaśyan dharmatāṃ na sākṣātkuryādbhūtakoṭim /
analyzed: tām ca a samanupaśyan dharmatām na sākṣātkuryāt bhūtakoṭim
translated: And not seeing that nature of phenomena, he would not realize the limit of reality.

original: evamukte āyuṣmān subhūtirbhagavantametadavocatyadbhagavānevamāhana bodhisattvena mahāsattvena śūnyatā sākṣātkartavyeti /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat yat bhagavān evam āha bodhisattvena mahāsattvena śūnyatā sākṣātkartavyā iti
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One, The Blessed One has said that the bodhisattva mahāsattva should realize emptiness.

original: kathaṃ bhagavan tasmin samādhau sthito bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ śūnyatāṃ na sākṣātkaroti /
analyzed: katham bhagavan tasmin samādhau sthitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ śūnyatām na sākṣātkaroti
translated: Blessed One, how does a bodhisattva mahāsattva dwelling in that samādhi not realize emptiness?

original: bhagavānāhayataḥ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvākāravaropetāṃ śūnyatāṃ pratyavekṣate /
analyzed: bhagavān āha yatas subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarva ākāra vara upetām śūnyatām pratyavekṣate
translated: The Blessed One said, Subhūti, it is because a bodhisattva mahāsattva contemplates emptiness endowed with all supreme aspects.

analyzed: na ca sākṣātkariṣyāmi iti pratyavekṣate
translated: He reflects, I will not realize it.

analyzed: na ca sākṣāt kartavyā iti pratyavekṣate
translated: He reflects, It should not be realized.

analyzed: parijayam kariṣyāmi iti pratyavekṣate
translated: He reflects, I will perfect it.

analyzed: parijayasya ayam kālaḥ
translated: This is the time for perfecting it.

analyzed: na ayam kālaḥ sākṣātkriyāyāḥ iti pratyavekṣate
translated: This is not the time for realization.

original: asamāhita evārambaṇe cittamupanibadhnātiprajñāpāramitā ca me parigṛhītā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: asamāhite eva ārambaṇe cittam upanibadhnāti prajñāpāramitā ca me parigṛhītā bhaviṣyati
translated: He fixes his mind on the object even in the uncollected state, thinking, The perfection of wisdom will be embraced by me.

analyzed: na ca sākṣātkṛtā iti
translated: And it will not be realized.

original: atrāntarā bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na parihīyate bodhipakṣairdharmaiḥ /
analyzed: atrā antarā bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na parihīyate bodhi pakṣaiḥ dharmaiḥ
translated: In the meantime, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva does not fall away from the factors of awakening.

analyzed: na ca āsrava kṣayam karoti
translated: And he does not bring about the destruction of the defilements.

analyzed: atra ca parijayam karoti
translated: And he perfects it here.

original: yasmin samaye bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ śūnyatāsamādhivimokṣamukhena viharati /
analyzed: yasmin samaye bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ śūnyatā samādhi vimokṣa mukhena viharati
translated: At that time when the bodhisattva-mahāsattva dwells by means of the liberation gate of the emptiness concentration,

original: tasmin samaye bodhisattvena mahāsattvena ānimittena ca samādhinā vihartavyam /
analyzed: tasmin samaye bodhisattvena mahāsattvena ānimittena ca samādhinā vihartavyam
translated: at that time the bodhisattva-mahāsattva should dwell in the signless concentration.

analyzed: na ca ā nimittam sākṣāt kartavyam
translated: And the signless should not be realized.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

analyzed: evam ārūḍha kuśala mūla dharma samanvāgataḥ hi bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ paripākasya ayam kālaḥ
translated: For the bodhisattva-mahāsattva who is endowed with the Dharma of having ascended the roots of merit, this is the time for ripening.

analyzed: na ayam kālaḥ sākṣātkriyāyāḥ iti pratyavekṣate
translated: He reflects, This is not the time for realization.

original: prajñāpāramitayā ca parigṛhīto bhūtakoṭiṃ na sākṣātkaroti /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitayā ca parigṛhītaḥ bhūtakoṭim na sākṣātkaroti
translated: And, upheld by the perfection of wisdom, he does not realize the limit of reality.

original: tadyathāpi nāma subhūte kaścideva puruṣaḥ paramaśūraśca bhavet /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma subhūte kaścid eva puruṣaḥ parama śūraḥ ca bhavet
translated: Just as, Subhuti, some man would be a supreme hero,

analyzed: parama vīrya samanvāgataḥ ca bhavet
translated: endowed with supreme courage,

analyzed: dṛḍha pratiṣṭhānaḥ ca bhavet  abhirūpaḥ ca bhavet
translated: firmly established,🔽handsome,

analyzed: prāsādikaḥ ca bhavet
translated: graceful,

analyzed: parama darśanīyaḥ ca bhavet
translated: supremely beautiful,

analyzed: bahu guṇa samanvāgataḥ ca bhavet
translated: endowed with many qualities,

analyzed: parama guṇa samanvāgataḥ ca bhavet
translated: endowed with supreme qualities,

analyzed: parama aiśvarya śīla śruta tyāga ādi guṇaiḥ ca samanvāgataḥ bhavet
translated: endowed with the qualities of supreme sovereignty, morality, learning, generosity, and so on,

analyzed: medhāvī ca bhavet  vacana samarthaḥ ca bhavet  pratibhāna saṃpannaḥ ca bhavet
translated: intelligent,🔽capable of speech,🔽endowed with eloquence,

analyzed: pratipatti saṃpannaḥ ca bhavet
translated: endowed with practice,

analyzed: kāla jñaḥ ca bhavet  deśa jñaḥ ca bhavet
translated: knowing the right time,🔽knowing the place,

analyzed: sthāna jñaḥ ca bhavet
translated: knowing the situation,

analyzed: iṣvastre ca parama gatim gataḥ bhavet
translated: having reached the highest skill in archery,

analyzed: bahu praharaṇa āvaraṇaḥ ca bhavet
translated: having many weapons and defenses,

analyzed: sarvāsu ca kalāsu parama kuśalaḥ bhavet
translated: supremely skilled in all the arts,

original: supariniṣpannatayā sarveṣveva ca śilpasthāneṣu paramagatiko bhavet /🔽smṛtimāṃśca bhavet /🔽matimāṃśca bhavet /
analyzed: su pariniṣpanna tayā sarveṣu eva ca śilpasthāneṣu parama gatikaḥ bhavet  smṛtimān ca bhavet  matimān ca bhavet
translated: By being well-accomplished, he would be one who has attained the highest stage in all the arts.🔽He would have mindfulness.🔽He would have intelligence.

analyzed: gatimān ca bhavet  dhṛtimān ca bhavet
translated: He would have understanding.🔽He would have firmness.

analyzed: nītimān ca bhavet
translated: He would have good judgment.

analyzed: sarva śāstra viśāradaḥ ca bhavet
translated: He would be skilled in all the scriptures.

analyzed: mitravān ca bhavet  arthavān ca bhavet
translated: He would have friends.🔽He would have wealth.

analyzed: balavān ca bhavet
translated: He would have strength.

analyzed: ahīna aṅgaḥ ca bhavet  paripūrṇa indriyaḥ ca bhavet
translated: He would have no missing limbs.🔽He would have complete faculties.

analyzed: sarva upakaraṇa saṃpannaḥ ca bhavet
translated: He would be endowed with all the necessary implements.

analyzed: bahu janasya ca priyaḥ manaāpaḥ ca bhavet
translated: He would be dear and pleasing to many people.

analyzed: sa yat yat eva kiṃcid kāryam ārabheta
translated: Whatever task he would undertake,

analyzed: tatra tatra sarvatra nistaraṇa samarthaḥ bhavet
translated: in that and everywhere he would be able to accomplish it.

analyzed: nayena ca vyavaharet
translated: He would conduct himself with good judgment.

analyzed: sarvatra ca asya mahā lābhaḥ bhavet
translated: Everywhere he would have great gain.

original: tena mahālābhena samanvāgataḥ san bahujanaṃ saṃvibhajet /🔽satkartavyaṃ ca satkuryāt /
analyzed: tena mahā lābhena samanvāgataḥ san bahu janam saṃvibhajet  satkartavyam ca satkuryāt
translated: Endowed with that great gain, he would share it with many people.🔽What should be honored, he would honor.

analyzed: gurukartavyam ca gurukuryāt  mānayitavyam ca mānayet
translated: What should be revered, he would revere.🔽What should be respected, he would respect.

analyzed: pūjayitavyam ca pūjayet
translated: What should be worshipped, he would worship.

original: tatkiṃ manyase subhūte api nu sa puruṣastatonidānaṃ bhūyasyā mātrayā āttamanasko bhavet /
analyzed: tat kim manyase subhūte api nu sa puruṣaḥ tatonidānam bhūyasyā mātrayā ātta manaskaḥ bhavet
translated: What do you think, Subhuti, would that man, for that reason, become even more elated,

analyzed: pramuditaḥ ca bhavet
translated: and would he become very joyful,

analyzed: prīti saumanasya jātaḥ ca bhavet  subhūtiḥ āha evam etat bhagavan
translated: and would he become filled with joy and gladness?

analyzed: evam etat sugata
translated: Subhuti: So it is, O Lord, so it is, O Sugata.

original: bhagavānāhasa khalu punaḥ subhūte puruṣastayā mahāsaṃpattyā samanvāgato mātāpitṛputradārān gṛhītvā kenacideva kāraṇasāmagrīyogena mahāṭavīkāntāraṃ pratipanno bhavet mahāpratibhayaṃ bālānāṃ bhīṣaṇaṃ romaharṣaṇam /🔽sa tatra praviṣṭaḥ saṃstān mātāpitṛputradārānabhayenābhinimantrayetmā bhaiṣṭa /
analyzed: bhagavān āha sa khalu punar subhūte puruṣaḥ tayā mahā saṃpattyā samanvāgataḥ mātā pitṛ putra dārān gṛhītvā kenacid eva kāraṇa sāmagrī yogena mahā aṭavī kāntāram pratipannaḥ bhavet mahā pratibhayam bālānām bhīṣaṇam roma harṣaṇam  sa tatra praviṣṭaḥ san tān mātā pitṛ putra dārān abhayena abhinimantrayet mā bhaiṣṭa
translated: The Lord: That man, Subhuti, endowed with that great fortune, would take his mother, father, son and wife, and for some reason or other would set out with them for a great forest wilderness, fearful, terrifying, and hair-raising to children.

analyzed: mā bhaiṣṭa
translated: And having entered it, he would invite his mother, father, son and wife to be fearless, saying: 'Do not be afraid, do not be afraid.

analyzed: aham itas yuṣmāt mahābhayabhairavāt aṭavī kāntārāt kṣemeṇa svastinā śīghram apakrāmayiṣyāmi
translated: I will quickly lead you out of this great forest wilderness, fearful, terrifying, and hair-raising to children, safely, securely, and without mishap.

analyzed: śīghram parimocayiṣyāmi iti
translated: I will quickly deliver you.'

original: tatra khalu punaḥ subhūte aṭavīkāntāre tasya puruṣasya bahavaḥ pratyarthikāḥ bahavaḥ pratyamitrāḥ pratyupasthitā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: tatra khalu punar subhūte aṭavī kāntāre tasya puruṣasya bahavaḥ pratyarthikāḥ bahavaḥ pratyamitrāḥ pratyupasthitāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: There, moreover, in that forest wilderness, many adversaries and many enemies would be present for that man.

original: tatkiṃ manyase subhūte api nu sa śūraḥ puruṣastaiḥ pratyarthikaiḥ pratyamitrairabhyutthitairavinivartyo dṛḍhavīryabalasamanvāgataḥ prajñāvānatisnigdhaḥ sānukrośo dhīro mahāsaṃbhārasamanvāgatastān mātāpitṛputradārān parityajya tato mahābhayabhairavādaṭavīkāntārādātmānamekamapakrāmayitavyaṃ manyeta /
analyzed: tat kim manyase subhūte api nu sa śūraḥ puruṣaḥ taiḥ pratyarthikaiḥ pratyamitraiḥ abhyutthitaiḥ a vinivartyaḥ dṛḍha vīrya bala samanvāgataḥ prajñāvān ati snigdhaḥ sa anukrośaḥ dhīraḥ mahā saṃbhāra samanvāgataḥ tān mātā pitṛ putra dārān parityajya tatas mahā bhaya bhairavāt aṭavī kāntārāt ātmānam ekam apakrāmayitavyam manyeta
translated: What do you think, Subhuti, would that heroic man, who is endowed with irreversible firm vigor and strength, who is wise, very affectionate, compassionate, and courageous, who is endowed with great resources, be able to abandon his parents, wife, and children, and think to escape from that great fearful and terrifying forest wilderness alone by himself, while those adversaries and enemies have arisen?

analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha no hi idam bhagavan
translated: Subhuti said: No indeed, Blessed One.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: tathā hi bhagavan tasya puruṣasya tat mātā pitṛ putra dāram a parityaktam
translated: Because, Blessed One, that man has not abandoned his parents, wife, and children.

analyzed: ādhyātmikaḥ ca bāhyaḥ ca balavān saṃbhāraḥ
translated: And he has a powerful internal and external resource.

original: tasya tatra aṭavīkāntāre bahutarakāśca śūratarakarāśca dṛḍhapraharaṇatarakarāśca teṣāṃ pratyarthikānāṃ pratyamitrāṇāmanye udāratarakāḥ pratyarthikāḥ pratyamitrāstiṣṭhanti rakṣanti /
analyzed: tasya tatra aṭavī kāntāre bahu tarakāḥ ca śūratara karāḥ ca dṛḍha praharaṇatara karāḥ ca teṣām pratyarthikānām pratyamitrāṇām anye udāratarakāḥ pratyarthikāḥ pratyamitrāḥ tiṣṭhanti rakṣanti
translated: In that forest wilderness, there are other enemies and adversaries of those enemies and adversaries who are more numerous, more heroic, and have stronger weapons.

original: te tasya pratyarthikāḥ pratyamitrā avatāraprekṣiṇo'vatāragaveṣiṇo'vatāraṃ na lapsyante /
analyzed: te tasya pratyarthikāḥ pratyamitrāḥ avatāra prekṣiṇaḥ uvatāra gaveṣiṇaḥ uvatāram na lapsyante
translated: Those enemies and adversaries, who are looking for an opportunity and searching for an opportunity, will not find an opportunity.

original: tena sa bhagavan pratibalaḥ puruṣo'kṣato'nupahatastanmātāpitṛputradāramātmānaṃ ca tato mahābhayabhairavādaṭavīkāntārācchaktaḥ kṣemeṇa svastinā śīghramapakrāmayituṃ yāvadgrāmaṃ vā nagaraṃ vā nigamaṃ vā anuprāptaḥ syāt //
analyzed: tena sa bhagavan pratibalaḥ puruṣa ukṣataḥ anupahataḥ tad mātā pitṛ putra dāram ātmānam ca tatas mahābhayabhairavāt aṭavī kāntārāt śaktaḥ kṣemeṇa svastinā śīghram apakrāmayitum yāvat grāmam vā nagaram vā nigamam vā anuprāptaḥ syāt
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, that able man, unharmed and uninjured, is able to quickly and safely lead out of that great and fearful forest wilderness his mother, father, son, wife, and himself, and arrive at a village, town, or city.

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocatevameva subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvasattvahitānukampī maitrīvihārī karuṇāvihārī muditāvihārī upekṣāvihārī upāyakauśalyena prajñāpāramitayā ca parigṛhītaḥ kuśalamūlāni samyagbuddhānujñātayā pariṇāmanayā pariṇāmya kiṃcāpi śūnyatāmānimittamapraṇihitaṃ ca samādhivimokṣamukhānyavatarati /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat evam eva subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarva sattva hita anukampī maitrī vihārī karuṇā vihārī muditā vihārī upekṣā vihārī upāya kauśalyena prajñāpāramitayā ca parigṛhītaḥ kuśala mūlāni samyak buddha anujñātayā pariṇāmanayā pariṇāmya kiṃca api śūnyatām ā nimittam apraṇihitam ca samādhi vimokṣa mukhāni avatarati
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the Venerable Subhuti, Just so, Subhuti, a bodhisattva mahasattva who is compassionate towards all beings, who dwells in loving-kindness, compassion, sympathetic joy, and equanimity, who is endowed with skillful means and the perfection of wisdom, having dedicated the roots of virtue with the transformation approved by the Buddhas, even though he enters the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness - the doors to liberation of samadhi -

analyzed: na tu eva bhūtakoṭim sākṣātkaroti
translated: he does not directly realize the peak of existence.

analyzed: yat uta śrāvaka bhūmau vā pratyekabuddha bhūmau vā
translated: Namely, in the stage of the sravakas or in the stage of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hyasya balavattamā dṛḍhatamāśca parigrāhakāḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi asya balavattamāḥ dṛḍhatamāḥ ca parigrāhakāḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

analyzed: yat uta prajñāpāramitā upāya kauśalyam ca
translated: Because his guardians are stronger and more firm, namely, the perfection of wisdom and skillful means.

analyzed: tena asya aparityaktāḥ sarva sattvāḥ
translated: Therefore, he has not abandoned all beings.

original: tenaiṣa pratibalaḥ svastinā kṣemeṇa anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃboddhum /
analyzed: tena eṣa pratibalaḥ svastinā kṣemeṇa anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhum
translated: Therefore, he is able to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment in a safe and secure way.

original: yasmin samaye subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvasattvānāmantike maitrīcittamārambaṇīkṛtya tān paramayā maitryā paribadhnāti /
analyzed: yasmin samaye subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarva sattvānām antike maitrī cittam ārambaṇīkṛtya tān paramayā maitryā paribadhnāti
translated: Subhūti, at that time, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva, having taken all sentient beings as the object of his mind of friendliness, binds them with the highest friendliness,

original: atrāntare bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ kleśapakṣaṃ mārapakṣaṃ cātikramya śrāvakabhūmiṃ pratyekabuddhabhūmiṃ cātikramya tatra samādhāvavatiṣṭhate
analyzed: atra antare bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ kleśa pakṣam māra pakṣam ca atikramya śrāvaka bhūmim pratyekabuddha bhūmim ca atikramya tatra samādhau avatiṣṭhate
translated: in the meantime, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, having transcended the side of afflictions and the side of Māra, having transcended the stage of śrāvakas and the stage of pratyekabuddhas, abides in that samādhi.

original: aprāptaśca sa subhūte āsravakṣayaṃ paramapāramitāyāṃ śūnyatāyāṃ parijayaṃ karoti /
analyzed: a prāptaḥ ca sa subhūte āsrava kṣayam parama pāramitāyām śūnyatāyām parijayam karoti
translated: And, Subhūti, he has not yet attained the destruction of the defilements, but he practices in the emptiness that is the highest perfection.

original: yasmin samaye subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ śūnyatāsamādhivimokṣamukhena viharati /
analyzed: yasmin samaye subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ śūnyatā samādhi vimokṣa mukhena viharati
translated: Subhūti, at that time, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva dwells by means of the emptiness samādhi gate to liberation,

original: atrāntare bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na cedānīṃ nānimittena samādhinā viharati /
analyzed: atrā antare bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na ca idānīm na animittena samādhinā viharati
translated: in the meantime, the bodhisattva mahāsattva does not now dwell in the signless samādhi,

original: na cānena ānimittaḥ samādhiḥ sākṣātkṛto bhavati /
analyzed: na ca anena ā nimittaḥ samādhiḥ sākṣātkṛtaḥ bhavati
translated: and he has not yet realized the signless samādhi.

original: tadyathāpi nāma subhūte pakṣī śakunirākāśe'ntarīkṣe carati /🔽na ca bhūmau patati /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma subhūte pakṣī śakuniḥ ākāśe ntarīkṣe carati  na ca bhūmau patati
translated: Just as, Subhūti, a bird, a flying creature, moves in the sky, in space,🔽but does not descend to the ground,

analyzed: na ca kaṃcid niśrayam niśritya tiṣṭhati
translated: and does not stand relying on any support,

analyzed: ākāśe eva antarīkṣe viharati
translated: He moves about in the sky,

original: na ca tatrāpi niśrito na pratiṣṭhitaḥ /
analyzed: na ca tatra api niśritaḥ na pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: but he is not dependent on it, nor is he established in it.

original: evameva subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ śūnyatāvihāreṇa viharati /
analyzed: evam eva subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ śūnyatā vihāreṇa viharati
translated: In the same way, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, moves about in the dwelling in emptiness.

original: śūnyatāyāṃ parijayaṃ karoti /🔽ānimittavihāreṇa ca viharati /🔽ānimitte ca parijayaṃ karoti /
analyzed: śūnyatāyām parijayam karoti  ā nimitta vihāreṇa ca viharati  ā animitte ca parijayam karoti
translated: He makes his dwelling in emptiness.🔽He moves about in the dwelling in the signless.🔽He makes his dwelling in the signless.

analyzed: apraṇihita vihāreṇa ca viharati
translated: He moves about in the dwelling in the wishless.

analyzed: a praṇihite ca parijayam karoti
translated: He makes his dwelling in the wishless.

original: na ca śūnyatāyāṃ vā ānimitte vā apraṇihite vā patatyaparipūrṇairbuddhadharmaiḥ /
analyzed: na ca śūnyatāyām vā ānimitte vā apraṇihite vā patati aparipūrṇaiḥ buddha dharmaiḥ
translated: But he does not fall into emptiness, the signless, or the wishless, with his Buddha-dharmas incomplete.

original: tadyathāpi nāma subhūte balavāniṣvastrācārya iṣvastraśikṣāyāṃ suśikṣitaḥ supariniṣṭhitaḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma subhūte balavān iṣvastra ācāryaḥ iṣvastra śikṣāyām su śikṣitaḥ su pariniṣṭhitaḥ
translated: Just as, Subhuti, a strong master of archery, well trained, well practiced,

analyzed: saḥ ūrdhvam kāṇḍam kṣipet
translated: would shoot an arrow upwards,

original: ūrdhvaṃ kāṇḍaṃ kṣiptvā tadanyaiḥ kāṇḍaistatkāṇḍaṃ bhūmau patat pratinivārayet /
analyzed: ūrdhvam kāṇḍam kṣiptvā tad anyaiḥ kāṇḍaiḥ tat kāṇḍam bhūmau patat pratinivārayet
translated: and having shot the arrow upwards, would follow it with other arrows so that the first arrow would not fall to the ground,

original: vārayet /🔽tasya paurvakasya kāṇḍasya kāṇḍaparaṃparayā bhūmau patanaṃ na dadyāt /
analyzed: vārayet  tasya paurvakasya kāṇḍasya kāṇḍa paraṃparayā bhūmau patanam na dadyāt
translated: he would prevent it.🔽He would not allow the first arrow to fall to the ground with a succession of arrows.

analyzed: tāvat tat kāṇḍam bhūmau na patat
translated: As long as that arrow would not fall to the ground,

analyzed: yāvat na ākāṅkṣeta ho bata idam kāṇḍam bhūmau patet iti
translated: until he thinks, 'Oh, this arrow will fall to the ground.'

original: evameva subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran upāyakauśalyaparigṛhītaḥ tāvattāṃ paramāṃ bhūtakoṭiṃ na sākṣātkaroti /🔽yāvanna tāni kuśalamūlānyanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau paripakvāni suparipakvāni /
analyzed: evam eva subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran upāya kauśalya parigṛhītaḥ tāvat tām paramām bhūtakoṭim na sākṣātkaroti  yāvat na tāni kuśala mūlāni anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau paripakvāni su paripakvāni
translated: In the same way, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, coursing in the perfection of wisdom, taken hold of by skill in means, does not yet realize that utmost, right, and perfect enlightenment,🔽until those wholesome roots have matured in him, have matured well, for full enlightenment.

original: yadā tāni kuśalamūlānyanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau paripakvāni bhavanti suparipakvāni /
analyzed: yadā tāni kuśala mūlāni anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau paripakvāni bhavanti su paripakvāni
translated: When those wholesome roots have matured in him, have matured well, for full enlightenment,

analyzed: tadā tām paramām bhūtakoṭim sākṣātkaroti
translated: then he realizes that utmost, right, and perfect enlightenment.

original: tasmāttarhi subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caratā prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāvayatā evameteṣāṃ dharmāṇāṃ gambhīradharmatā pratyavekṣitavyā
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām caratā prajñāpāramitām bhāvayatā evam eteṣām dharmāṇām gambhīra dharma tā pratyavekṣitavyā
translated: Therefore, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in the perfection of wisdom, who develops the perfection of wisdom, should thus contemplate the profound nature of these dharmas,

analyzed: na ca sākṣāt kartavyā
translated: but should not realize it.

analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat duṣkara kārakaḥ bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: When this had been said, the venerable Subhuti said to the Lord: The Bodhisattva, the great being, who acts with difficulty, O Lord,

analyzed: parama duṣkara kārakaḥ bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: Blessed One, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who performs what is extremely difficult is...

analyzed: yaḥ śūnyatāyām carati
translated: ...one who practices emptiness.

analyzed: śūnya tayā ca viharati
translated: ...and abides in emptiness.

analyzed: śūnyatām ca samādhim samāpadyate
translated: ...and enters the emptiness samādhi.

analyzed: na ca bhūtakoṭim sākṣātkaroti
translated: ...but does not actualize the peak of reality.

analyzed: ati āścaryam idam bhagavan
translated: This is a great wonder, Blessed One!

analyzed: parama āścaryam idam sugata
translated: This is a supreme wonder, Sugata!

analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat evam etat subhūte evam etat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti, So it is, Subhūti, so it is!

analyzed: duṣkara kārakaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who performs what is difficult is...

original: paramaduṣkarakārako bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ yaḥ śūnyatāyāṃ carati /
analyzed: parama duṣkara kārakaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ yaḥ śūnyatāyām carati
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva who performs what is extremely difficult is...one who practices emptiness.

analyzed: śūnyatāyām ca viharati
translated: ...and abides in emptiness.

analyzed: śūnyatām ca samādhim samāpadyate
translated: ...and enters the emptiness samādhi.

analyzed: na ca bhūtakoṭim sākṣātkaroti
translated: ...but does not actualize the peak of reality.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: tathā hi subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya sarvasattvā aparityaktāḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya sarva sattvāḥ a parityaktāḥ
translated: Subhūti, it is because the bodhisattva mahāsattva has not abandoned all beings.

original: tasyeme evaṃrūpāḥ praṇidhānaviśeṣā bhavantimayaite sarvasattvāḥ parimocayitavyā iti /
analyzed: tasya ime evaṃrūpāḥ praṇidhāna viśeṣāḥ bhavanti imayā ete sarva sattvāḥ parimocayitavyāḥ iti
translated: His special vows are of this kind: 'I must liberate all these beings.'

original: yadā bodhisattvo mahāsattva evaṃ cittamabhinirharatisarvasattvā mamāparityaktāḥ /
analyzed: yadā bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ evam cittam abhinirharati sarva sattvāḥ mama aparityaktāḥ
translated: When a bodhisattva great being generates this thought: 'All sentient beings are not abandoned by me.

analyzed: mayā ete parimocayitavyāḥ iti
translated: I must liberate them,'

analyzed: śūnyatām ca samādhi vimokṣa mukham abhinirharati  ānimittam ca samādhi vimokṣa mukham abhinirharati
translated: and generates the door of liberation of emptiness as a concentration,🔽and generates the door of liberation of signlessness as a concentration,

analyzed: apraṇihitam ca samādhi vimokṣa mukham abhinirharati
translated: and generates the door of liberation of wishlessness as a concentration,

original: tadā upāyakauśalyasamanvāgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvo veditavyaḥnāyamantarā bhūtakoṭiṃ sākṣātkariṣyatyaparipūrṇairbuddhadharmaiḥ /
analyzed: tadā upāya kauśalya samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ veditavyaḥ na ayam antarā bhūtakoṭim sākṣātkariṣyati a paripūrṇaiḥ buddha dharmaiḥ
translated: then that bodhisattva great being should be known as endowed with skillful means. He will not actualize the reality limit in between, with the qualities of a Buddha incomplete.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: tathā hi asya upāya kauśalyam rakṣām karoti
translated: Because that skillful means protects him.

original: sa caivāsya cittotpādo yattasya sarvasattvā aparityaktāḥ /
analyzed: sa ca eva asya citta utpādaḥ yat tasya sarva sattvāḥ a parityaktāḥ
translated: And that generation of mind is that he does not abandon all sentient beings.

original: sa evamanena cittotpādenopāyakauśalyena samanvāgato'ntarā bhūtakoṭiṃ na sākṣātkaroti //
analyzed: saḥ evam anena citta utpādena upāya kauśalyena samanvāgataḥ untarā bhūtakoṭim na sākṣātkaroti
translated: Endowed with that generation of mind and skillful means, he does not actualize the reality limit in between.

original: punaraparaṃ subhūte yadā bodhisattvo mahāsattva imāni gambhīrāṇi sthānāni pratyavekṣate /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte yadā bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ imāni gambhīrāṇi sthānāni pratyavekṣate
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, when a bodhisattva great being examines these profound subjects,

original: pratyavekṣitukāmo vā bhavatitadyathā śūnyatāṃ samādhivimokṣamukham /🔽ānimittaṃ samādhivimokṣamukham /
analyzed: pratyavekṣitu kāmaḥ vā bhavati tat yathā śūnyatām samādhi vimokṣa mukham  ānimittam samādhi vimokṣa mukham
translated: Or he wishes to investigate. For example, the emptiness meditative absorption door of liberation.🔽The signless meditative absorption door of liberation.

analyzed: apraṇihitam samādhi vimokṣa mukham
translated: The wishless meditative absorption door of liberation.

original: tenaivaṃ cittamabhinirhartavyamdīrgharātramamī sattvāḥ sattvasaṃjñayā upalambhe caranti /
analyzed: tena evam cittam abhinirhartavyam dīrgharātram amī sattvāḥ sattva saṃjñayā upalambhe caranti
translated: He should generate the mind in this way: 'For a long time, these beings have been practicing with the notion of beings and the notion of an object.

analyzed: teṣām sattvānām upalambha dṛṣṭikānām upalambha dṛṣṭi prahāṇāya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhya dharmam deśayiṣyāmi
translated: For the abandonment of the view of an object of those beings who have the view of an object, I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment and teach the Dharma.'

analyzed: iti saṃcintya śūnyatām samādhi vimokṣa mukham samāpadyate
translated: Having thought thus, he enters the emptiness meditative absorption door of liberation.

analyzed: na ca bhūtakoṭim sākṣātkaroti
translated: But he does not realize the limit of reality.

analyzed: ānimittam samādhi vimokṣa mukham samāpadyate
translated: He enters the signless meditative absorption door of liberation.

analyzed: na ca bhūtakoṭim sākṣātkaroti
translated: But he does not realize the limit of reality.

analyzed: apraṇihitam samādhi vimokṣa mukham samāpadyate
translated: He enters the wishless meditative absorption door of liberation.

analyzed: na ca bhūtakoṭim sākṣātkaroti
translated: But he does not realize the limit of reality.

original: evaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'nena cittotpādena anena copāyakauśalyena samanvāgato nāntarā bhūtakoṭiṃ sākṣātkaroti /
analyzed: evam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ ūnena citta utpādena anena ca upāya kauśalyena samanvāgataḥ na antarā bhūtakoṭim sākṣātkaroti
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, endowed with this generation of mind and this skillful means, does not realize the limit of reality in the meantime.

original: na ca parihīyate maitrīsamādhito na karuṇāmuditopekṣāsamādhitaḥ /
analyzed: na ca parihīyate maitrī samādhitaḥ na karuṇā muditā upekṣā samādhitaḥ
translated: And he does not fall away from the concentration of loving kindness, or from the concentration of compassion, joy, or equanimity.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: upāyakauśalyaparigṛhīto hi bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhūyasyā mātrayā vivardhate śuklairdharmaiḥ /
analyzed: upāya kauśalya parigṛhītaḥ hi bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhūyasyā mātrayā vivardhate śuklaiḥ dharmaiḥ
translated: Because the bodhisattva mahāsattva who is embraced by skillful means increases more and more in bright qualities.

analyzed: tīkṣṇatarāṇi ca asya śraddhā ādīni indriyāṇi bhavanti
translated: And his faculties of faith and so on become sharper.

analyzed: bala bodhya mārgam ca pratilabhate
translated: And he attains the path of the powers and the path of the factors of awakening.

original: punaraparaṃ subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyaivaṃ bhavatidīrgharātramamī sattvā dharmasaṃjñayā upalambhe caranti /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya evam bhavati dīrgharātram amī sattvāḥ dharma saṃjñayā upalambhe caranti
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva thinks like this: 'For a long time these beings have practiced with the notion of dharmas and with grasping, in grasping.

analyzed: teṣām upalambha dṛṣṭikānām upalambha dṛṣṭi prahāṇāya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhya dharmam deśayiṣyāmi iti
translated: For the abandonment of the view of grasping in those who have the view of grasping, I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment and teach the Dharma.'

original: so'nena cittotpādena paurvakeṇa copāyakauśalyena samanvāgataḥ śūnyatāṃ samādhivimokṣamukhaṃ samāpadyate /
analyzed: saḥ unena citta utpādena paurvakeṇa ca upāya kauśalyena samanvāgataḥ śūnyatām samādhi vimokṣa mukham samāpadyate
translated: Endowed with this thought and with skillful means from before, he enters the emptiness meditative stabilization, the door of liberation.

analyzed: na ca bhūtakoṭim sākṣātkaroti
translated: But he does not actualize the limit of reality.

analyzed: na ca parihīyate maitrī karuṇā muditā upekṣā samādhitaḥ
translated: And he does not fall away from the concentration of loving kindness, compassion, joy, or equanimity.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: upāyakauśalyaparigṛhīto bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhūyasyā mātrayā vivardhate śūklairdharmaiḥ /
analyzed: upāya kauśalya parigṛhītaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhūyasyā mātrayā vivardhate śūklaiḥ dharmaiḥ
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who is embraced by skillful means increases more and more in bright qualities.

analyzed: tīkṣṇatarāṇi ca asya śraddhā ādīni indriyāṇi bhavanti
translated: And his faculties of faith and so forth become sharper.

analyzed: bala bodhyaṅgāni mārgam ca pratilabhate
translated: He attains the powers, the factors of awakening, and the path.

original: punaraparaṃ subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyaivaṃ bhavatidīrgharātramamī sattvā nimittasaṃjñayā nimitte caranti /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya evam bhavati dīrgharātram amī sattvāḥ nimitta saṃjñayā nimitte caranti
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva thinks like this: 'For a long time, these beings have been practicing with signs due to the perception of signs.

original: teṣāṃ nimittasaṃjñāprahāṇāya anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhya dharmaṃ deśayiṣyāmīti /
analyzed: teṣām nimitta saṃjñā prahāṇāya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhya dharmam deśayiṣyāmi iti
translated: For the abandonment of their perception of signs, I will attain supreme perfect awakening and teach the Dharma.'

original: sa ānimittaṃ samādhivimokṣamukhaṃ samāpadyate sattvānāṃ kṛtaśaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ ā nimittam samādhi vimokṣa mukham samāpadyate sattvānām kṛtaśas
translated: For the sake of beings, he enters the door of liberation that is the concentration on signlessness.

original: so'nena cittotpādena paurvakeṇa copāyakauśalyena samanvāgataḥ ānimittaṃ samādhivimokṣamukhaṃ samāpadyate /
analyzed: saḥ unena citta utpādena paurvakeṇa ca upāya kauśalyena samanvāgataḥ ānimittam samādhi vimokṣa mukham samāpadyate
translated: Endowed with this thought and with skillful means from before, he enters the door of liberation that is the concentration on signlessness.

analyzed: na ca bhūtakoṭim sākṣātkaroti
translated: But he does not actualize the limit of reality.

original: na ca parihīyate maitryāḥ karuṇāyā muditāyā upekṣāyāḥ sarvasamādhitaḥ /
analyzed: na ca parihīyate maitryāḥ karuṇāyāḥ muditāyāḥ upekṣāyāḥ sarva samādhitaḥ
translated: And he does not fall away from loving-kindness, compassion, joy, or equanimity, from any concentration.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: upāyakauśalyaparigṛhīto hi bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhūyasyā mātrayā vivardhate śūklairdharmaiḥ /
analyzed: upāya kauśalya parigṛhītaḥ hi bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhūyasyā mātrayā vivardhate śūklaiḥ dharmaiḥ
translated: For a bodhisattva mahāsattva who is embraced by skillful means, the wholesome qualities increase more and more.

analyzed: tīkṣṇatarāṇi ca asya śraddhā ādīni indriyāṇi bhavanti
translated: And his faculties such as faith become sharper.

analyzed: balāni bodhyaṅgāni mārgam ca pratilabhate
translated: He attains the powers, the factors of awakening, and the path.

original: punaraparaṃ subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyaivaṃ bhavatidīrgharātramamī sattvā nityasaṃjñayā sukhasaṃjñayā ātmasaṃjñayā śubhasaṃjñayā ca viparyastāḥ /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya evam bhavati dīrgharātram amī sattvāḥ nitya saṃjñayā sukha saṃjñayā ātma saṃjñayā śubha saṃjñayā ca viparyastāḥ
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva thinks like this: 'For a long time, these beings have been deluded by the notion of permanence, the notion of happiness, the notion of self, and the notion of beauty.

original: tathā kariṣyāmi yathā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhya nityasaṃjñāyāḥ sukhasaṃjñāyāḥ ātmasaṃjñāyāḥ śubhasaṃjñāyā viparyāsasya prahāṇāya dharmaṃ deśayiṣyāmianityametatsarvaṃ na nityamiti /
analyzed: tathā kariṣyāmi yathā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhya nitya saṃjñāyāḥ sukha saṃjñāyāḥ ātma saṃjñāyāḥ śubha saṃjñāyāḥ viparyāsasya prahāṇāya dharmam deśayiṣyāmi anityam etat sarvam na nityam iti
translated: I will act in such a way that, having fully awakened to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, I will teach the Dharma for the abandonment of the notion of permanence, the notion of happiness, the notion of self, and the notion of beauty, for the abandonment of delusion. All this is impermanent, not permanent.

analyzed: duḥkham etat sarvam na sukham iti
translated: All this is suffering, not happiness.

analyzed: anātmakam etat sarvam na etat sātmakam iti
translated: All this is non-self, not self.

analyzed: aśubham etat sarvam na etat śubham iti
translated: All this is impure, not beautiful.

original: so'nena cittotpādena samanvāgataḥ paurvakeṇa copāyakauśalyena prajñāpāramitayā ca parigṛhīto nāntarā bhūtakoṭiṃ sākṣātkaroti aparipūrṇeṣu buddhadharmeṣu
analyzed: saḥ unena citta utpādena samanvāgataḥ paurvakeṇa ca upāya kauśalyena prajñāpāramitayā ca parigṛhītaḥ na antarā bhūtakoṭim sākṣātkaroti a paripūrṇeṣu buddha dharmeṣu
translated: He, endowed with this thought of enlightenment and with the skillful means of the past, and embraced by the perfection of wisdom, does not in the meantime realize the reality limit, with the Buddha dharmas incomplete.

analyzed: evam apraṇihitam samādhi vimokṣa mukham upasaṃpadya viharati
translated: Thus he attains and abides in the concentration gate of liberation called wishlessness.

analyzed: na ca bhūtakoṭim sākṣātkaroti
translated: But he does not realize the reality limit.

original: na ca parihīyate maitrīto vā karuṇāto vā muditāto vā upekṣāto vā /
analyzed: na ca parihīyate maitrītaḥ vā karuṇātaḥ vā muditātaḥ vā upekṣātaḥ vā
translated: And he does not fall away from loving-kindness, compassion, joy, or equanimity.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: upāyakauśalyaparigṛhīto bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhūyasyā mātrayā vivardhate śūklairdharmaiḥ /
analyzed: upāya kauśalya parigṛhītaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhūyasyā mātrayā vivardhate śūklaiḥ dharmaiḥ
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who is embraced by skillful means increases more and more in bright dharmas.

analyzed: tīkṣṇatarāṇi ca asya śraddhā ādīni indriyāṇi bhavanti
translated: And his faculties of faith and so on become sharper.

analyzed: balāni bodhyaṅgāni mārgam ca pratilabhate
translated: He attains the powers, the factors of awakening, and the path.

original: yo hi kaścitsubhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattva imaṃ cittotpādamutpādayati /
analyzed: yaḥ hi kaścid subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ imam citta utpādam utpādayati
translated: Subhūti, whatever bodhisattva mahāsattva arouses this thought of enlightenment:

original: ityapīme sattvā dīrgharātramupalambhe caritāvinaḥ etarhyupalambhe caranti /
analyzed: iti api ime sattvāḥ dīrgharātram upalambhe caritāvinaḥ etarhi upalambhe caranti
translated: For a long time these beings have practiced grasping, and now they practice grasping.

analyzed: nimitta saṃjñāyām caritāvinaḥ etarhi api nimitta saṃjñāyām caranti
translated: Those who practiced in the perception of signs are now practicing in the perception of signs.

analyzed: viparyāse caritāvinaḥ etarhi api viparyāse caranti
translated: Those who practiced in error are now practicing in error.

original: piṇḍasaṃjñāyāṃ caritāvinaḥ etarhyapi piṇḍasaṃjñāyāṃ caranti /🔽abhūtasaṃjñāyāṃ caritāvinaḥ etarhyapi abhūtasaṃjñāyāṃ caranti /
analyzed: piṇḍa saṃjñāyām caritāvinaḥ etarhi api piṇḍa saṃjñāyām caranti  abhūta saṃjñāyām caritāvinaḥ etarhi api abhūta saṃjñāyām caranti
translated: Those who practiced in the perception of a mass are now practicing in the perception of a mass.🔽Those who practiced in false perception are now practicing in false perception.

analyzed: mithyādṛṣṭau caritāvinaḥ etarhi api mithyādṛṣṭau caranti
translated: Those who practiced in wrong views are now practicing in wrong views.

original: tathā kariṣyāmi yathaiṣāmete doṣāḥ sarveṇa sarvaṃ sarvathā sarvaṃ na bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: tathā kariṣyāmi yathā eṣām ete doṣāḥ sarveṇa sarvam sarvathā sarvam na bhaviṣyanti
translated: I will act in such a way that all these faults will not exist at all, in any way, for them.

analyzed: na prajñāsyante
translated: They will not be known.

analyzed: iti evam sarva sattvān samanvāharati
translated: Thus he contemplates all beings in this way.

original: evaṃ ca bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'nena smṛtisamanvāhāreṇa anena cittotpādena samanvāgataḥ upāyakauśalyena ca samanvāgataḥ prajñāpāramitayā ca parigṛhītaḥ evameteṣāṃ gambhīrāṇāṃ dharmāṇāṃ dharmatāṃ pratyavekṣamāṇaḥ śūnyatāto vā ānimittato vā apraṇihitato vā anabhisaṃskārato vā anutpādato vā ajātito vā abhāvato vā /
analyzed: evam ca bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ ūnena smṛti samanvāhāreṇa anena citta utpādena samanvāgataḥ upāya kauśalyena ca samanvāgataḥ prajñāpāramitayā ca parigṛhītaḥ evam eteṣām gambhīrāṇām dharmāṇām dharmatām pratyavekṣamāṇaḥ śūnyatātaḥ vā ā nimittataḥ vā apraṇihitataḥ vā an abhisaṃskārataḥ vā anutpādataḥ vā ajātitaḥ vā abhāvataḥ vā
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, endowed with this mindfulness and this thought of enlightenment, endowed with skillful means, and embraced by the perfection of wisdom, thus contemplating the true nature of these profound dharmas as emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, non-composition, non-arising, non-birth, and non-existence,

analyzed: asthānam etat subhūtena avakāśaḥ
translated: This is impossible, Subhūti, there is no opportunity for this.

original: yatsa bodhisattvo mahāsattva evaṃ jñānasamanvāgato'nabhisaṃskāre vā patet /
analyzed: yat sa bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ evam jñāna samanvāgataḥ ūna abhisaṃskāre vā patet
translated: That the bodhisattva mahāsattva endowed with such knowledge would fall into non-composition,

analyzed: traidhātukena vā sārdham saṃvaset
translated: or associate with the three realms,

analyzed: na etat sthānam vidyate
translated: this is not possible.

original: evaṃ hi subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ paripraṣṭavyo bodhisattvena mahāsattvena anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃboddhukāmenakatameṣāṃ dharmāṇāṃ parijayaḥ kartavyaḥ /
analyzed: evam hi subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ paripraṣṭavyaḥ bodhisattvena mahāsattvena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhu kāmena katameṣām dharmāṇām parijayaḥ kartavyaḥ
translated: Thus, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment should be questioned by the bodhisattva mahāsattva: 'Which dharmas should be mastered?

analyzed: kiyat rūpāṇi ca cittāni abhinirhartavyāni
translated: How many kinds of thoughts should be manifested?'

original: yāni cittānyabhinirharan bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na śūnyatāṃ sākṣātkaroti /🔽na ānimittaṃ sākṣātkaroti /🔽na apraṇihitaṃ sākṣātkaroti /
analyzed: yāni cittāni abhinirharan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na śūnyatām sākṣātkaroti  na ā animittam sākṣātkaroti  na a praṇihitam sākṣātkaroti
translated: When a bodhisattva-mahāsattva is practicing these minds, he does not actualize emptiness,🔽he does not actualize signlessness,🔽he does not actualize wishlessness,

original: na anabhisaṃskāraṃ sākṣātkaroti /🔽na anutpādaṃ sākṣātkaroti /🔽na ajātiṃ sākṣātkaroti /
analyzed: na an abhisaṃskāram sākṣātkaroti  na anutpādam sākṣātkaroti  na ajātim sākṣātkaroti
translated: he does not actualize non-performance,🔽he does not actualize non-arising,🔽he does not actualize non-birth,

analyzed: na abhāvam sākṣātkaroti
translated: he does not actualize non-existence,

analyzed: prajñāpāramitām ca bhāvayati
translated: but he cultivates the perfection of wisdom.

original: sacetsubhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bodhisattvena mahāsattvenaivaṃ pṛṣṭa evaṃ vyākarotiśūnyataiva bodhisattvena mahāsattvena manasi kartavyā
analyzed: saced subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bodhisattvena mahāsattvena evam pṛṣṭaḥ evam vyākaroti śūnyatā eva bodhisattvena mahāsattvena manasi kartavyā
translated: Subhūti, if a bodhisattva-mahāsattva is asked by another bodhisattva-mahāsattva in this way, and answers like this: 'Emptiness alone should be kept in mind by a bodhisattva-mahāsattva,

original: ānimittameva apraṇihitameva anabhisaṃskāra eva anutpāda eva ajātireva abhāva eva bodhisattvena mahāsattvena manasi kartavya iti /
analyzed: ānimittam eva apraṇihitam eva an abhisaṃskāraḥ eva anutpādaḥ eva ajātiḥ eva abhāvaḥ eva bodhisattvena mahāsattvena manasi kartavyaḥ iti
translated: signlessness, wishlessness, non-performance, non-arising, non-birth, and non-existence alone should be kept in mind by a bodhisattva-mahāsattva.'

analyzed: saced tam sarva sattva aparityāga citta utpādam na upadarśayet
translated: If he does not demonstrate that thought of not abandoning all beings,

analyzed: upāya kauśalyam vā na vyākuryāt
translated: or does not explain skillful means,

original: veditavyametatsubhūte nāyaṃ vyākṛto bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhāvavinivartanīyatve taiḥ paurvakaistathāgatairarhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ
analyzed: veditavyam etat subhūte na ayam vyākṛtaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau a vinivartanīya tve taiḥ paurvakaiḥ tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ
translated: It should be known that this Bodhisattva-Mahasattva has not been predicted to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment by those past Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is it so?

analyzed: yaḥ hi asau a vinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya āveṇikaḥ dharmaḥ
translated: Because that unique Dharma of the irreversible Bodhisattva-Mahasattva,

analyzed: tam dharmam na sūcayati  na prabhāvayati
translated: that Dharma he does not point out,🔽does not make manifest,

analyzed: na upadarśayati
translated: does not demonstrate,

analyzed: na prajānāti
translated: does not understand,

analyzed: paripṛṣṭaḥ na vyākaroti
translated: when asked does not explain,

analyzed: na visarjayati
translated: does not resolve,

analyzed: na tām bhūmim avakrāmayati
translated: does not enter that stage,

original: yo'vinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya bhūmiriti //🔽subhūtirāhasyātpunarbhagavan paryāyo yena paryāyeṇa bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'vinivartanīyo bhavet /
analyzed: bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya bhūmiḥ iti  subhūtiḥ āha syāt punar bhagavan paryāyaḥ yena paryāyeṇa bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ vinivartanīyaḥ bhavet
translated: which is the stage of the irreversible Bodhisattva-Mahasattva.🔽Subhuti said, Could there be, O Lord, that mode by which a Bodhisattva-Mahasattva would be irreversible?

original: bhagavānāhasyātsubhūte sa paryāyo yena paryāyeṇa sa bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'vinivartanīyo bhavet /
analyzed: bhagavān āha syāt subhūte sa paryāyaḥ yena paryāyeṇa sa bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ vinivartanīyaḥ bhavet
translated: The Lord said, There could be, Subhuti, that mode by which that Bodhisattva-Mahasattva would be irreversible.

original: sacedbodhisattvo mahāsattva imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ śrutvā vā aśrutvā va evaṃ pratipadyeta /
analyzed: saced bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām śrutvā vā a śrutvā vaḥ evam pratipadyeta
translated: If a bodhisattva mahāsattva, having heard this perfection of wisdom or not having heard it, practices in this way,
