translated: and answers in this way, that bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as irreversible.

original: subhūtirāhatena hi bhagavan bahavo bodhāya caranti /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āhatena hi bhagavan bahavaḥ bodhāya caranti
translated: Subhūti said, Thus, Blessed One, many are practicing for enlightenment.

analyzed: alpakāḥ punar ye evam visarjayanti
translated: But few answer in this way.

original: bhagavānāhatathā hi subhūte alpakāste bodhisattvā mahāsattvā ye vyākṛtā avinivartanīyāyāṃ jñānabhūmau /
analyzed: bhagavān āha tathā hi subhūte alpakāḥ te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ ye vyākṛtāḥ a vinivartanīyāyām jñāna bhūmau
translated: The Blessed One said, Subhūti, it is because few of those bodhisattva mahāsattvas are prophesied to the irreversible stage of knowledge.

analyzed: ye punar te vyākṛtāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: But those who will be prophesied,

analyzed: te evam visarjayiṣyanti
translated: they will answer in this way.

original: te te bodhisattvā mahāsattvā uttaptāvaropitakuśalamūlā veditavyāḥ /
analyzed: te te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ uttapta avaropita kuśala mūlāḥ veditavyāḥ
translated: Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas should be known as having wholesome roots that are well-developed and planted.

original: te te bodhisattvā mahāsattvā asaṃhāryāḥ sadevamānuṣāsureṇa lokena /
analyzed: te te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ asaṃhāryāḥ sa deva mānuṣa asureṇa lokena
translated: Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas are unassailable by the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: sacetpunaḥ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ svapnāntaragato'pi svapnopamāḥ sarvadharmā iti vyavalokayati /
analyzed: saced punar subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ svapna antara gataḥ api svapna upamāḥ sarva dharmāḥ iti vyavalokayati
translated: If, Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva, even while dreaming, contemplates that all dharmas are like a dream,

analyzed: na ca sākṣātkaroti
translated: and does not realize them,

original: idamapi subhūte avinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya avinivartanīyalakṣaṇaṃ veditavyam //
analyzed: idam api subhūte a vinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya a vinivartanīya lakṣaṇam veditavyam
translated: This also, Subhuti, should be known as a mark of the irreversible Bodhisattva, the great being.

original: punaraparaṃ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ svapnāntaragato'pi śrāvakabhūmau vā pratyekabuddhabhūmau vā traidhātukāya ca spṛhāmanuśaṃsācittaṃ
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ svapna antara gataḥ api śrāvaka bhūmau vā pratyekabuddha bhūmau vā traidhātukāya ca spṛhām anuśaṃsa acittam
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, even when he has gone to sleep, does not dream that he is in the realm of the Disciples or the realm of the Pratyekabuddhas, or that he is in the triple world.

original: idamapi subhūte avinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya avinivartanīyalakṣaṇaṃ veditavyam //
analyzed: idam api subhūte a vinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya a vinivartanīya lakṣaṇam veditavyam
translated: This also, Subhuti, should be known as a mark of the irreversible Bodhisattva, the great being.

original: punaraparaṃ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ svapnāntaragato'pyanekaśatāyāḥ parṣado'nekasahasrāyā yāvadanekakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāyāḥ parṣado madhyagataṃ maṇḍalamāle niṣaṇṇaṃ bhikṣusaṃghaparivṛtaṃ bodhisattvasaṃghapuraskṛtaṃ dharmaṃ deśayantaṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhamātmānaṃ paśyati /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ svapna antara gataḥ api aneka śatāyāḥ parṣadaḥ aneka sahasrāyāḥ yāvat aneka koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāyāḥ parṣadaḥ madhya gatam maṇḍala māle niṣaṇṇam bhikṣu saṃgha parivṛtam bodhisattva saṃgha puraskṛtam dharmam deśayantam tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham ātmānam paśyati

original: idamapi subhūte avinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyāvinivartanīyalakṣaṇaṃ veditavyam //
analyzed: idam api subhūte a vinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya a vinivartanīya lakṣaṇam veditavyam
translated: This also, Subhuti, should be known as a mark of the irreversible Bodhisattva, the great being.

original: punaraparaṃ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ svapnāntaragato'pi vaihāyasamabhyudgamya sattvebhyo dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ svapna antara gataḥ api vaihāyasam abhyudgamya sattvebhyaḥ dharmam deśayati
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, even when he has gone to sleep, rises up in the air and preaches the Dharma to the beings.

analyzed: tām ca vyāma prabhām saṃjānīte
translated: And he perceives that light extending a full fathom.

analyzed: tān ca bhikṣūn abhinirmimīte
translated: And he creates those monks,

original: ye'nyāsu dikṣu gatvā anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhakṛtyaṃ kurvanti /
analyzed: yenyāsu dikṣu gatvā anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddha kṛtyam kurvanti
translated: who, having gone to other directions, in other world systems, perform the work of a Buddha.

analyzed: dharmam ca deśayanti
translated: And they preach the Dharma.

original: evamapi subhūte svapnāntaragatoa'vinivartanīyo bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ saṃjānīte /
analyzed: evam api subhūte svapna antara gataḥ avinivartanīyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ saṃjānīte
translated: Thus also, Subhuti, the irreversible Bodhisattva, the great being, perceives in his dream.

original: idamapi subhūte avinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya avinivartanīyalakṣaṇaṃ veditavyam //
analyzed: idam api subhūte a vinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya a vinivartanīya lakṣaṇam veditavyam
translated: This also, Subhuti, should be known as a mark of the irreversible Bodhisattva, the great being.

original: punaraparaṃ subhūte svapnāntaragato bodhisattvo mahāsattvo notrasyati /🔽na saṃtrasyati /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte svapna antara gataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na utrasyati  na saṃtrasyati
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, when he has gone to sleep, does not tremble,🔽does not quake,

analyzed: na saṃtrāsam āpadyate
translated: does not quake violently.

original: grāmaghāte vā nagaraghāte vā nigamaghāte vā janapadaghāte vā rāṣṭraghāte vā agnidāhe vā vartamāne vyālamṛgān vā tato'nyānapi vā kṣudramṛgajātīn dṛṣṭvā śiraśchede vā pratyupasthite tato'nyānyapi vā mahābhayabhairavāṇi duḥkhadaurmanasyāni vā prāpya tato'nyeṣāmapi vā sattvānāṃ mahābhayabhairavāṇi duḥkhāni dṛṣṭvā nāsya bhayabhairavamutpadyate /
analyzed: grāma ghāte vā nagara ghāte vā nigama ghāte vā janapada ghāte vā rāṣṭra ghāte vā agni dāhe vā vartamāne vyāla mṛgān vā tatonyān api vā kṣudra mṛga jātīn dṛṣṭvā śiraḥ chede vā pratyupasthite tatonyāni api vā mahā bhaya bhairavāṇi duḥkha daurmanasyāni vā prāpya tatonyeṣām api vā sattvānām mahā bhaya bhairavāṇi duḥkhāni dṛṣṭvā na asya bhaya bhairavam utpadyate
translated: Or when a village, town, city, country, or kingdom is being destroyed by fire, or when seeing wild animals or other small animal species, or when facing the cutting off of one's head or other great fears and terrors, or when experiencing great suffering and mental anguish, or seeing other beings experiencing great fears and terrors and suffering, he does not give rise to fear and terror.

analyzed: na utrasyati na saṃtrasyati na saṃtrāsam āpadyate
translated: Or when a village, town, city, country, or kingdom is being burned by fire, or when seeing wild animals or other small animal species, or when facing the cutting off of one's head or other great fears and terrors, or when experiencing sufferings and mental anguish, or seeing other beings experiencing great fears and terrors and sufferings, he does not become frightened or terrified, nor does he fall into terror.

original: tataśca svapnāntarātprativibuddhasya samanantaravyutthitasyaivaṃ bhavatisvapnopamamidaṃ sarvaṃ traidhātukam /
analyzed: tatas ca svapna antarāt prativibuddhasya samanantara vyutthitasya evam bhavati svapna upamam idam sarvam traidhātukam
translated: And immediately upon awakening from that dream, he thinks thus: 'All this triple world is like a dream.'

original: evaṃ ca mayā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhya samyagdeśayatā dharmo deśayitavya iti /
analyzed: evam ca mayā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhya samyak deśayatā dharmaḥ deśayitavyaḥ iti
translated: And he thinks: 'Having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, I should teach the Dharma correctly, having taught it correctly.'

original: idamapi subhūte avinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya avinivartanīyalakṣaṇaṃ veditavyam //
analyzed: idam api subhūte a vinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya a vinivartanīya lakṣaṇam veditavyam
translated: Subhūti, this should be known as a characteristic of an irreversible bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: punaraparaṃ subhūte avinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya svapnāntaragatasya nairayikān sattvān dṛṣṭvā evaṃ bhavatitathā kariṣyāmi yathā me'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhasya buddhakṣetre sarveṇa sarvaṃ sarvathā sarvaṃ sarve'pyapāyā na bhaviṣyantīti /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte a vinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya svapna antara gatasya nairayikān sattvān dṛṣṭvā evam bhavati tathā kariṣyāmi yathā me nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhasya buddhakṣetre sarveṇa sarvam sarvathā sarvam sarve api apāyāḥ na bhaviṣyanti iti
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, when a Bodhisattva-Mahasattva who is irreversible sees beings in the hells in a dream, he thinks, I will act in such a way that in my Buddha-field, when I have attained supreme enlightenment, all the evil destinies will be completely and totally eradicated in every way.

original: idamapi subhūte avinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya apāyapariśuddhilakṣaṇaṃ veditavyam //
analyzed: idam api subhūte a vinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya apāya pariśuddhi lakṣaṇam veditavyam
translated: Subhuti, this should be known as a characteristic of the purification of the evil destinies of an irreversible Bodhisattva-Mahasattva.

original: tatra subhūte kathaṃ vijñāyeta asyāvinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhasya buddhakṣetre sarveṇa sarvaṃ sarvathā sarvaṃ sarve'pyapāyā na bhaviṣyantīti /
analyzed: tatra subhūte katham vijñāyeta asya a vinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhasya buddhakṣetre sarveṇa sarvam sarvathā sarvam sarve api apāyāḥ na bhaviṣyanti iti
translated: Subhuti, how can it be known that in the Buddha-field of an irreversible Bodhisattva-Mahasattva who has attained supreme enlightenment, all the evil destinies will be completely and totally eradicated in every way?

original: sacetsubhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ svapnāntaragato'pi nirayagatāṃstiryakpretagatān vā sattvān dṛṣṭvā smṛtiṃ pratilabhate /
analyzed: saced subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ svapna antara gataḥ api niraya gatān tiryak preta gatān vā sattvān dṛṣṭvā smṛtim pratilabhate
translated: Subhuti, if a Bodhisattva-Mahasattva, even in a dream, sees beings in the hells, as animals, or as hungry ghosts, and regains mindfulness,

original: sa tāṃ smṛtiṃ pratilabhya evaṃ cintayatitathā kariṣyāmi yathā me'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhasya buddhakṣetre sarveṇa sarvaṃ sarvathā sarvaṃ sarve'pyapāyā na bhaviṣyantīti /
analyzed: sa tām smṛtim pratilabhya evam cintayati tathā kariṣyāmi yathā me nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhasya buddhakṣetre sarveṇa sarvam sarvathā sarvam sarve api apāyāḥ na bhaviṣyanti iti
translated: Having attained that mindfulness, he thinks like this: 'I will act in such a way that in my Buddha-field, when I have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, all the lower realms will be completely and totally absent in every way.'

original: evaṃ subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya apāyapariśuddhilakṣaṇaṃ veditavyam /
analyzed: evam subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya apāya pariśuddhi lakṣaṇam veditavyam
translated: Thus, Subhūti, the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva should know the characteristic of purification from the lower realms.

original: idamapi subhūte avivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya avinivartanīyalakṣaṇaṃ veditavyam //
analyzed: idam api subhūte a vivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya a vinivartanīya lakṣaṇam veditavyam
translated: Subhūti, this should also be known as a characteristic of the irreversible Bodhisattva Mahāsattva.

original: punaraparaṃ subhūte svapnāntaragato bodhisattvo mahāsattvo nagaradāhe vā grāmadāhe vā vartamāne prativibuddhaḥ saṃstataḥ svapnādevaṃ samanvāharati yathāmayā svapnāntaragatena ye ākārāḥ yāni liṅgāni yāni nimittāni dṛṣṭāni /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte svapna antara gataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ nagara dāhe vā grāma dāhe vā vartamāne prativibuddhaḥ san tatas svapnāt evam samanvāharati yathā mayā svapna antara gatena ye ākārāḥ yāni liṅgāni yāni nimittāni dṛṣṭāni
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva, while in a dream, has awakened from a dream in which a city was burning or a village was burning, he reflects on that dream like this: 'By what aspects, what signs, what indications were the aspects, signs, and indications seen by me while in a dream?'

analyzed: yaiḥ ākāraiḥ yaiḥ liṅgaiḥ yaiḥ nimittaiḥ a vivartanīyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ dhārayitavyaḥ
translated: By what aspects, what signs, what indications should an irreversible Bodhisattva Mahāsattva be held?

original: te ākārāstāni liṅgāni tāni nimittāni mama saṃvidyante /
analyzed: te ākārāḥ tāni liṅgāni tāni nimittāni mama saṃvidyante
translated: Those are the aspects, those are the signs, those are the indications that I have.

original: etena satyena satyavacanena ayaṃ nagaradāho vā grāmadāho vā vartamāna upaśāmyatu /
analyzed: etena satyena satya vacanena ayam nagara dāhaḥ vā grāma dāhaḥ vā vartamānaḥ upaśāmyatu
translated: By this truth, this truthful statement, may this burning of the city or village that is occurring be pacified.

analyzed: śītiḥ bhavatu
translated: May it cool down.

analyzed: astam gacchatu
translated: May it go out.

original: sacetsubhūte grāmadāho vā nagaradāho vā upaśāmyati /
analyzed: saced subhūte grāma dāhaḥ vā nagara dāhaḥ vā upaśāmyati
translated: If, Subhūti, the burning of the village or city is pacified,

analyzed: śītībhavati
translated: cools down,

analyzed: astam gacchati
translated: and goes out,

original: veditavyametatsubhūte vyākṛto'yaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattvastaiḥ paurvakaistathāgatairarhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhairavinivartanīyo'nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheriti
analyzed: veditavyam etat subhūte vyākṛtaḥ yam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ taiḥ paurvakaiḥ tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ a vinivartanīyaḥ unuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ iti
translated: Subhūti, you should know that this Bodhisattva Mahāsattva has been prophesied by those past Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones as irreversible from highest, complete enlightenment.

analyzed: saced na upaśāmyati
translated: If, on the other hand, it is not pacified,

analyzed: na śītībhavati
translated: does not cool down,

analyzed: na astas gacchati
translated: and does not go out,

original: veditavyametatsubhūte nāyaṃ vyākṛto bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhāviti /
analyzed: veditavyam etat subhūte na ayam vyākṛtaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau iti
translated: Subhūti, you should know that this Bodhisattva Mahāsattva has not been prophesied to highest, complete enlightenment.

original: sacetpunaḥ subhūte so'gnidāho'tikramya gṛhādgṛhaṃ rathyāyā rathyāmanyatarānyatarāṃ rathyāṃ vā gṛhaṃ vā gacchati /
analyzed: saced punar subhūte sa ugni dāhā utikramya gṛhāt gṛham rathyāyāḥ rathyām anyatara anyatarām rathyām vā gṛham vā gacchati
translated: If, Subhūti, that fire burns beyond the houses, from street to street, and goes to one street or house,

analyzed: dahati  na upaśāmyati
translated: and burns,🔽is not pacified,

analyzed: na śītībhavati
translated: does not cool down,

analyzed: na astam gacchati
translated: It does not set.

original: veditavyametatsubhūte dharmapratyākhyānaṃ duṣprajñasaṃvartanīyaṃ tena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena karmopacitam /🔽tato'syaitaddṛṣṭadharmasaṃvartanīyameva karma vipacyate /
analyzed: veditavyam etat subhūte dharma pratyākhyānam duṣprajña saṃvartanīyam tena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena karma upacitam  tatas asya etat dṛṣṭa dharma saṃvartanīyam eva karma vipacyate
translated: Subhūti, it should be known that this Dharma rejection has been accumulated by that bodhisattva mahāsattva as an action leading to bad wisdom.🔽Then, this action that ripens in this very life ripens for him.

analyzed: tatas eva dharma pratyākhyānāt sa avaśeṣam karma evam vipacyate
translated: Then, due to that very Dharma rejection, the action with remainder ripens in the same way.

original: ityayaṃ subhūte heturayaṃ pratyayo'sya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya avinivartanīyalakṣaṇatāyā iti /
analyzed: iti ayam subhūte hetuḥ ayam pratyayaḥ usya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya a vinivartanīya lakṣaṇa tāyāḥ iti
translated: Subhūti, this is the cause, this is the reason for that bodhisattva mahāsattva being a non-returner, the characteristic of irreversibility.

original: ayamapi subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'vinivartanīyo'nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodherdhārayitavyaḥ //🔽punaraparaṃ subhūte yairākārairyairliṅgairyairnimittairavinivartanīyo bodhisattvo mahāsattvo dhārayitavyaḥ /
analyzed: ayam api subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ vinivartanīyaḥ anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ dhārayitavyaḥ  punar aparam subhūte yaiḥ ākāraiḥ yaiḥ liṅgaiḥ yaiḥ nimittaiḥ a vinivartanīyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ dhārayitavyaḥ
translated: Subhūti, this bodhisattva mahāsattva too should be known as a non-returner from unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: tānākārāṃstāni liṅgāni tāni nimittāni deśayiṣyāmi /🔽tatsādhu ca suṣṭhu ca śṛṇu /
analyzed: tān ākārān tāni liṅgāni tāni nimittāni deśayiṣyāmi  tat sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca śṛṇu
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, I will teach the aspects, signs, and marks by which the irreversible bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known.

analyzed: manasi kuru
translated: Listen well and remember!

analyzed: bhāṣiṣye iham te
translated: I will teach them to you.

analyzed: sādhu bhagavan iti āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavataḥ pratyaśrauṣīt
translated: Very well, Blessed One, the Venerable Subhuti replied, and listened to the Blessed One.

original: bhagavānetadavocatsacetsubhūte kaścideva puruṣo vā strī vā dārako vā dārikā vā amanuṣyeṇa gṛhīto bhavedāviṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: bhagavān etat avocat saced subhūte kaścid eva puruṣaḥ vā strī vā dārakaḥ vā dārikā vā amanuṣyeṇa gṛhītaḥ bhavet āviṣṭaḥ
translated: The Blessed One said this: Subhuti, if a man or woman, boy or girl, is possessed or afflicted by a non-human being,

original: tatra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena upasaṃkramya evamadhiṣṭhānaṃ samanvāhartavyam /
analyzed: tatra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena upasaṃkramya evam adhiṣṭhānam samanvāhartavyam
translated: then a bodhisattva-mahasattva should approach them and bring to mind this consecration:

analyzed: saced aham haiḥ paurvakaiḥ tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ vyākṛtaḥ unuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: 'If I have been prophesied by the Tathagatas, Arhats, Samyaksambuddhas of the past to supreme, perfect enlightenment,

analyzed: pariśuddhaḥ medhya āśayaḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhum  yathā aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhu kāmaḥ
translated: and if my superior intention is pure to fully awaken to supreme, perfect enlightenment,🔽and if I desire to fully awaken to supreme, perfect enlightenment,

analyzed: pariśuddhaḥ me manasikāraḥ unuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: and if my mental activity towards supreme, perfect enlightenment is pure,

original: apagataṃ me śrāvakacittaṃ pratyekabuddhacittaṃ ca /🔽tena mayā anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhirabhisaṃboddhavyā /
analyzed: apagatam me śrāvaka cittam pratyekabuddha cittam ca  tena mayā anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ abhisaṃboddhavyā
translated: and if my mind of a Shravaka or Pratyekabuddha has departed,🔽then I must fully awaken to supreme, perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: na aham na anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsye
translated: I will not fail to fully awaken to supreme, perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: abhisaṃbhotsye eva aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim
translated: I will certainly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: ye'pi te aprameyeṣvasaṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhā bhagavantastiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti /
analyzed: ye api te aprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti
translated: And those Blessed Buddhas who are present, abiding, and living in immeasurable and incalculable world systems,

original: na teṣāṃ tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ kiṃcidajñātaṃ vā adṛṣṭaṃ vā aviditaṃ vā asākṣātkṛtaṃ vā anabhisaṃbuddhaṃ vā /
analyzed: na teṣām tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām kiṃcid ajñātam vā adṛṣṭam vā aviditam vā a sākṣātkṛtam vā an abhisaṃbuddham vā
translated: there is nothing unknown or unseen or uncognized or unactualized or unawakened to by those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones.

original: yathā te buddhā bhagavanto jānanto mamādhyāśayamityapyahamanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsye iti /
analyzed: yathā te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ jānantaḥ mama adhyāśayam iti api aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsye iti
translated: Just as those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, know my superior intention, I will certainly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: anena satyena satyavacanena iyaṃ strī vā puruṣo vā dārako vā dārikā vā yena amanuṣyagraheṇa gṛhīto vā āviṣṭo vā /
analyzed: anena satyena satya vacanena iyam strī vā puruṣaḥ vā dārakaḥ vā dārikā vā yena amanuṣya graheṇa gṛhītaḥ vā āviṣṭaḥ vā
translated: By this truth, this truthful statement, may this woman or man or boy or girl who is possessed by a non-human spirit, or who is seized or oppressed by it,

analyzed: sā upakrāmatu
translated: may it depart.

original: sacetso'manuṣyaḥ evaṃ bhāṣamāṇena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena nāpakrāmati /
analyzed: saced saḥ manuṣyaḥ evam bhāṣamāṇena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na apakrāmati
translated: If that non-human spirit does not depart when the Bodhisattva, the Great Being, speaks thus,

original: veditavyametatsubhūte nāyaṃ vyākṛto bodhisattvo mahāsattvastaiḥ paurvakaistathāgatairarhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhairanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhāviti
analyzed: veditavyam etat subhūte na ayam vyākṛtaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ taiḥ paurvakaiḥ tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau iti
translated: Subhūti, it should be known that this Bodhisattva Mahāsattva has not been predicted to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment by those past Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones.

original: sacetpunaḥ subhūte evaṃ bhāṣamāṇasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya so'manuṣyo'pakrāmati /
analyzed: saced punar subhūte evam bhāṣamāṇasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya saḥ manuṣya upakrāmati
translated: If, Subhūti, when the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva is speaking thus, that non-human departs,

original: vediṃtavyametatsubhūte vyākṛto'yaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattvastaiḥ paurvakaistathāgatairarhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhairanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhāviti
analyzed: vediṃtavyam etat subhūte vyākṛtaḥ yam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ taiḥ paurvakaiḥ tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau iti
translated: Subhūti, it should be known that this Bodhisattva Mahāsattva has been predicted by those past Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: ārya aṣṭasāhasrikāyām prajñāpāramitāyām upāyakauśalyamīmāṃsāparivartaḥ nāma viṃśatitamaḥ
translated: In the Noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines, the twentieth chapter is named The Examination of Skillful Means.

analyzed: māra karma parivartaḥ ekaviṃśatitamaḥ
translated: The twenty-first chapter is named The Chapter on the Activities of Māra.

original: tatra khalu punaḥ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattva evaṃ bhāṣiṣyateyena satyena satyavacanena ahaṃ vyākṛtaḥ taiḥ paurvakaistathāgatairarhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhairanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: tatra khalu punar subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ evam bhāṣiṣyate yena satyena satya vacanena aham vyākṛtaḥ taiḥ paurvakaiḥ tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: There, Subhūti, the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva will speak thus: By whatever truth, by whatever truthful statement, I have been predicted to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment by those past Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones,

analyzed: tena satyena satyavacena ayam amanuṣya upakrāmatu iti
translated: By that truth, by that truthful word, may this non-human being depart!'

original: tatra subhūte māraḥ pāpīyānautsukyamāpatsyate tasya amanuṣyasyāpakramaṇāya /
analyzed: tatra subhūte māraḥ pāpīyān autsukyam āpatsyate tasya amanuṣyasya apakramaṇāya
translated: There, Subhuti, Mara, the Evil One, will be eager for that non-human being to depart.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: māro hyatra pāpīyāṃstasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya cirayānasaṃprasthitasyāntike balavattaraṃ tejovattaraṃ codyogamāpatsyatekathamayamamanuṣyo'pakrāmediti
analyzed: māraḥ hi atra pāpīyān tasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya cira yāna saṃprasthitasya antike balavattaram tejovattaram ca udyogam āpatsyate katham ayam amanuṣya upakrāmet iti
translated: Because Mara, the Evil One, will exert himself even more strongly and vigorously towards that Bodhisattva, the great being, who has set out for a long time, thinking, 'How can this non-human being depart?'

analyzed: evam saḥ manuṣyaḥ māra adhiṣṭhānena apakramiṣyati
translated: And that non-human being will depart, empowered by Mara.

original: evaṃ ca tasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya bhaviṣyatimamaiṣo'nubhāvena amanuṣyo'pakrānta iti /
analyzed: evam ca tasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya bhaviṣyati mama eṣaḥ nubhāvena a manuṣya upakrāntaḥ iti
translated: And that Bodhisattva, the great being, will think, 'By my power that non-human being has departed.'

original: na punaḥ sa evaṃ jñāsyatimārasyaiṣo'nubhāvena amanuṣyo'pakrānta iti /
analyzed: na punar saḥ evam jñāsyati mārasya eṣaḥ nubhāvena amanuṣya upakrāntaḥ iti
translated: But he will not know that 'empowered by Mara that non-human being has departed.'

analyzed: sa tena tāvanmātrakeṇa autsukyam āpatsyate
translated: And he will be eager just because of that little bit.

original: sa tenautsukyena tato'nyān bodhisattvān mahāsattvānavamaṃsyate uccagdhayiṣyati ullāpayiṣyati kutsayiṣyati paṃsayiṣyatiahaṃ vyākṛtastaiḥ paurvakaistathāgatairarhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhairanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhāviti /
analyzed: sa tena autsukyena tatonyān bodhisattvān mahāsattvān avamaṃsyate uccagdhayiṣyati ullāpayiṣyati kutsayiṣyati paṃsayiṣyati aham vyākṛtaḥ taiḥ paurvakaiḥ tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau iti
translated: Due to that eagerness, he will despise other bodhisattva mahāsattvas, will speak ill of them, will revile them, will disparage them, will blame them, saying, 'I have been prophesied by those past tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.'

original: sa tena tāvanmātrakeṇa bhūyo mānaṃ janayiṣyati /🔽mānaṃ saṃjanayiṣyati /🔽mānaṃ vardhayiṣyati /
analyzed: sa tena tāvat mātrakeṇa bhūyas mānam janayiṣyati  mānam saṃjanayiṣyati  mānam vardhayiṣyati
translated: With just that much, he will generate pride further.🔽He will generate pride.🔽He will increase pride.

analyzed: mānam saṃvardhayiṣyati  mānam stambhayiṣyati
translated: He will develop pride.🔽He will make pride rigid.

analyzed: mānam upastambhayiṣyati  mānam bṛṃhayiṣyati
translated: He will make pride firm.🔽He will make pride swell.

analyzed: mānam upabṛṃhayiṣyati
translated: He will make pride grow.

analyzed: mānam utpādayiṣyati
translated: He will produce pride.

original: sa tena mānena atimānena mānātimānena mithyāmānena abhimānena dūrīkariṣyati sarvajñatām /
analyzed: sa tena mānena atimānena māna atimānena mithyāmānena abhimānena dūrīkariṣyati sarvajña tām
translated: Due to that pride, excessive pride, pride, false pride, and arrogant pride, he will distance himself from omniscience.

analyzed: dūrīkariṣyati anuttaram buddha jñānam
translated: He will distance himself from the unsurpassed wisdom of a buddha.
The self-arisen wisdom.
The wisdom of omniscience.

analyzed: dūrīkariṣyati anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim
translated: He will distance himself from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: sa tathārūpāṇi kalyāṇamitrāṇi kalyāṇadharmaṇa udārādhimuktikānadhyāśayasaṃpannānupāyakuśalānavinivartanīyadharmasamanvāgatāṃśca bodhisattvān mahāsattvān dṛṣṭvā abhimānamutpādya avamanyamānastathārūpāṇi kalyāṇamitrāṇi na seviṣyate /🔽na bhajiṣyate /🔽na paryupāsiṣyate /
analyzed: sa tathārūpāṇi kalyāṇa mitrāṇi kalyāṇa dharmaṇaḥ udāra adhimuktikān adhyāśaya saṃpannān upāya kuśalān a vinivartanīya dharma samanvāgatān ca bodhisattvān mahāsattvān dṛṣṭvā abhimānam utpādya avamanyamānaḥ tathārūpāṇi kalyāṇa mitrāṇi na seviṣyate  na bhajiṣyate  na paryupāsiṣyate
translated: Having seen such spiritual friends, who have good qualities, who have lofty aspirations, who are endowed with superior intention, who are skilled in means, and who are endowed with the Dharma of irreversibility, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, having given rise to pride and contempt, will not attend upon such spiritual friends.🔽They will not serve them.🔽They will not wait upon them.

analyzed: na pariprakṣyati
translated: They will not ask questions.

analyzed: tat eva māra bandhanam gāḍhīkariṣyati
translated: They will only tighten the bonds of Māra.

analyzed: tasya dve bhūmī pratikāṅkṣitavye śrāvaka bhūmiḥ vā pratyekabuddha bhūmiḥ vā
translated: Two levels should be expected for them: the level of the śrāvakas or the level of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: evaṃ subhūte satyādhiṣṭhānena māraḥ pāpīyānacirayānasaṃprasthitasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya alpaśraddhasya alpaśrutasya kalyāṇamitravirahitasya prajñāpāramitayā aparigṛhītasya upāyakauśalyavirahitasya antarāyaṃ kariṣyatyanuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /
analyzed: evam subhūte satya adhiṣṭhānena māraḥ pāpīyān acira yāna saṃprasthitasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya alpa śraddhasya alpa śrutasya kalyāṇa mitra virahitasya prajñāpāramitayā a parigṛhītasya upāya kauśalya virahitasya antarāyam kariṣyati anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: In this way, Subhūti, Māra the evil one will create obstacles for a bodhisattva mahāsattva who has newly set out in the vehicle, who has little faith and little learning, who is separated from good friends, who is not taken hold of by the perfection of wisdom, and who is devoid of skill in means, with regard to highest genuine full Awakening, by means of a basis in reality.

original: idamapi subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mārakarma veditavyam //
analyzed: idam api subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya māra karma veditavyam

original: punaraparaṃ subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya nāmāpadeśenāpi mārakarma bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya nāma apadeśena api māra karma bhaviṣyati

translated: Having approached in one guise or another, he will say thus: 'You have been predicted by the former Tathagatas, Arhats, Fully Enlightened Ones to full enlightenment.'

analyzed: upasaṃkramya evam vakṣyati vyākṛtaḥ tvam paurvakaiḥ tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau a vinivartanīyāyām bodhisattva bhūmau

translated: He will think: 'That name which I have thought of myself,🔽 and which that monk has declared,
