translated: I have been predicted by those former Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones, to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.’

original: yāni ca mayā subhūte avinivartanīyānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāmākārā liṅgāni nimittāni ākhyātāni /
analyzed: yāni ca mayā subhūte a vinivartanīyānām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām ākārāḥ liṅgāni nimittāni ākhyātāni
translated: And, Subhūti, the aspects, signs, and indications of the irreversible bodhisattva mahāsattvas that I have taught,

analyzed: tāni tasya na bhaviṣyanti
translated: those will not be in him.

analyzed: sa taiḥ virahitaḥ ūnena nāma apadeśena nāma vyākaraṇena manyanām utpādayiṣyati
translated: Being devoid of them, through the proclamation of that name, he will give rise to conceit.

original: sa manyanāmutpādya tato'nyān bodhisattvān mahāsattvānavamaṃsyateahaṃ vyākṛto'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: sa manyanām utpādya tatonyān bodhisattvān mahāsattvān avamaṃsyate aham vyākṛtaḥ unuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Having given rise to conceit, he will then despise other bodhisattva mahāsattvas, thinking ‘I have been predicted to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.’

analyzed: na ete vyākṛtāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau iti
translated: They have not been predicted to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: evaṃ sa tena mānena atimānena mānātimānena abhimānena mithyāmānena ca tadanyān bodhisattvān mahāsattvānavamanyamāno dūrīkariṣyati sarvajñatām /
analyzed: evam sa tena mānena atimānena māna atimānena abhimānena mithyāmānena ca tad anyān bodhisattvān mahāsattvān avamanyamānaḥ dūrīkariṣyati sarvajña tām
translated: In this way, through that pride, excessive pride, pride that is worse than pride, pride, and false pride, they will despise other bodhisattva mahāsattvas and will turn away from omniscience.

analyzed: dūrīkariṣyati buddha jñānam
translated: They will turn away from the knowledge of a buddha.

original: tasya prajñāpāramitayā aparigṛhītasya upāyakauśalyavirahitasya kalyāṇamitravirahitasya pāpamitraparigṛhītasya dvayorbhūmyoranyatarā bhūmiḥ pratikāṅkṣitavyāśrāvakabhūmirvā pratyekabuddhabhūmirvā /
analyzed: tasya prajñāpāramitayā a parigṛhītasya upāya kauśalya virahitasya kalyāṇa mitra virahitasya pāpa mitra parigṛhītasya dvayoḥ bhūmyoḥ anyatarā bhūmiḥ pratikāṅkṣitavyā āśrāvaka bhūmiḥ vā pratyekabuddha bhūmiḥ vā
translated: If they are not taken hold of by the perfection of wisdom, if they are devoid of skillful means, if they are devoid of a spiritual friend, if they are taken hold of by a bad friend, they should expect one of two levels, either the śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level.

original: sacetpunaściraṃ suciraṃ saṃdhāvya saṃsṛtya enāmeva prajñāpāramitāmāgamya anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃboddhukāmo bhavet /
analyzed: saced punar ciram su ciram saṃdhāvya saṃsṛtya enām eva prajñāpāramitām āgamya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhu kāmaḥ bhavet
translated: If, after wandering for a long time in samsara, they want to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by coming to just this perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: yadi ca asau upasarpet kalyāṇa mitrāṇi
translated: and if they approach spiritual friends,

analyzed: abhīkṣṇam ca tāni upasaṃkramiṣyati
translated: and if they frequently go to them,

analyzed: tena eva ca ātma bhāva pratilambhena tāvat pūrvakān citta utpādān vigarhiṣyati
translated: then by just that attainment of a body they will condemn those former thoughts,

analyzed: vāntīkariṣyati
translated: and will vomit them up.

analyzed: jugupsiṣyati  pratiniḥsrakṣyati
translated: will be ashamed of it,🔽will renounce it,

analyzed: pratideśayiṣyati
translated: and will confess it.

analyzed: tathā api buddha bhūmiḥ tasya durlabhā bhaviṣyati
translated: Even so, the Buddha ground will be difficult for him to attain.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tāvadgurutaraṃ hi subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mananāpattisthānam /
analyzed: tāvat gurutaram hi subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mananā āpatti sthānam
translated: Subhuti, the place of transgression through pride is much more serious for a bodhisattva-mahāsattva.

original: tadyathāpi nāma subhūte bhikṣoḥ śrāvakayānikasya śrāvakabhūmau catasro mūlāpattayo gurvyo bhavanti /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma subhūte bhikṣoḥ śrāvaka yānikasya śrāvaka bhūmau catasraḥ mūla āpattayaḥ gurvyaḥ bhavanti
translated: Subhuti, it is just as for a monk in the Śrāvaka Vehicle, the four grave offenses in the Śrāvaka ground are serious.

analyzed: yatas anyatarā anyatarā mā āpattim adhyāpadya abhikṣuḥ bhavati a śramaṇa u śākyaputrīyaḥ
translated: From which, having committed any one offense, one becomes no longer a monk, no longer an ascetic, no longer a son of the Śākya.

analyzed: iyam eva tābhyaḥ catasṛbhyaḥ āpattibhyaḥ gurutarā āpattiḥ
translated: This very offense is more serious than those four offenses.

analyzed: yaḥ ayam māna citta utpādaḥ
translated: This is the production of a mind of pride,

original: yaduta nāmāpadeśena bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyāvamānanayā mahānakuśalaścittotpāda utpannaḥ /
analyzed: yat uta nāma apadeśena bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya avamānanayā mahān akuśalaḥ citta utpādaḥ utpannaḥ
translated: namely, through the pretense of a name, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva has produced a very unwholesome mind of contempt.

analyzed: ayam tābhyaḥ catasṛbhyaḥ āpattibhyaḥ gurutaraḥ citta utpādaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: This production of a mind should be known as more serious than those four offenses.

analyzed: tiṣṭhantu subhūte catasraḥ gurvyaḥ mūla āpattayaḥ
translated: Subhuti, let alone the four grave offenses.

original: pañcabhyo'pi subhūte ānantaryebhyaḥ karmabhyo gurutaro'yaṃ cittotpādaḥ /🔽yo'yaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya nāmāpadeśena mānasahagataścittotpāda utpannaḥ /
analyzed: pañcabhyaḥ api subhūte ānantaryebhyaḥ karmabhyaḥ gurutaraḥ yam citta utpādaḥ  yaḥ uyam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya nāma apadeśena māna sahagataḥ citta utpādaḥ utpannaḥ
translated: “Subhūti, this thought that has arisen in the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva, accompanied by pride, on account of the announcement of his name, is more serious than the five heinous actions.

original: ayaṃ tebhyaḥ pañcabhya ānantaryebhyaḥ karmabhyo gurutaraścittotpādo veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: ayam tebhyaḥ pañcabhyaḥ ānantaryebhyaḥ karmabhyaḥ gurutaraḥ citta utpādaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: This thought that has arisen in the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva, accompanied by pride, on account of the announcement of his name, should be known as more serious than those five heinous actions.

original: iti hi subhūte anenāpi nāmāpadeśena sūkṣmasūkṣmāṇi mārakarmāṇyutpatsyante /
analyzed: iti hi subhūte anena api nāma apadeśena sūkṣma sūkṣmāṇi māra karmāṇi utpatsyante
translated: Thus, Subhūti, even through this announcement of his name, subtle and subtle Māra-actions will arise.

analyzed: tāni bodhisattvena mahāsattvena boddhavyāni
translated: Those should be understood by the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva.

analyzed: anyebhyaḥ ca avabodhayitavyāni
translated: And they should be made known to others.

original: buddhvā ca vivarjayitavyāni //🔽punaraparaṃ subhūte māraḥ pāpīyān vivekaguṇena bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamupasaṃkramya codayiṣyati smārayiṣyati /
analyzed: buddhvā ca vivarjayitavyāni  punar aparam subhūte māraḥ pāpīyān viveka guṇena bodhisattvam mahāsattvam upasaṃkramya codayiṣyati smārayiṣyati
translated: And having understood, they should be abandoned.”🔽“Furthermore, Subhūti, Māra the Evil One, approaching a Bodhisattva Mahāsattva with the quality of solitude, will admonish and remind him.

original: kathaṃ ca subhūte māraḥ pāpīyān vivekaguṇena bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamupasaṃkramya codayiṣyati smārayiṣyati /
analyzed: katham ca subhūte māraḥ pāpīyān viveka guṇena bodhisattvam mahāsattvam upasaṃkramya codayiṣyati smārayiṣyati
translated: And how, Subhūti, will Māra the Evil One, approaching a Bodhisattva Mahāsattva with the quality of solitude, admonish and remind him?

original: iha subhūte māraḥ pāpīyān bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamupasaṃkramiṣyati /
analyzed: iha subhūte māraḥ pāpīyān bodhisattvam mahāsattvam upasaṃkramiṣyati
translated: Here, Subhūti, Māra the wicked one will approach a bodhisattva mahāsattva.

analyzed: upasaṃkramya evam vakṣyati vivekasya tathāgataḥ varṇa vādī araṇya vana prastha giri guhā śmaśāna palāla puñja ādiṣu vihartavyam iti
translated: Having approached, he will say, 'The Tathāgata praises solitude. One should dwell in forests, groves, on mountain peaks, in caves, in charnel grounds, in heaps of straw, and so on.'

original: na cāhaṃ subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya evaṃvidhaṃ vivekaṃ vadāmi /🔽yaduta āraṇyakāni prāntāni śayanāsanāni vijanapadāni viviktāni /
analyzed: na ca aham subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya evaṃvidham vivekam vadāmi  yat uta āraṇyakāni prāntāni śayanāsanāni vijanapadāni viviktāni
translated: But, Subhūti, I do not speak of such a kind of solitude for a bodhisattva mahāsattva,

analyzed: vividhāni vana prastha giri guhā śmaśāna palāla puñja ādīni
translated: namely, solitary places such as forests, groves, mountain peaks, caves, charnel grounds, heaps of straw, and so on.🔽[If] he does not dwell in those [places].

original: subhūtirāhakatamaḥ punaḥ sa bhagavan bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya anyo viveko yadi vā āraṇyakāni prāntāni śayanāsanāni vijanapadāni viviktāni vividhāni vanaprasthagiriguhāśmaśānapalālapuñjādīni /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha katamaḥ punar sa bhagavan bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya anyaḥ vivekaḥ yadi vā āraṇyakāni prāntāni śayana āsanāni vijanapadāni viviktāni vividhāni vanaprastha giri guhā śmaśāna palāla puñja ādīni
translated: Subhūti said, But what, Blessed One, is that other kind of solitude for a bodhisattva mahāsattva, if not solitary places such as forests, groves, mountain peaks, caves, charnel grounds, heaps of straw, and so on,

analyzed: yadi tāni na adhyāvasati
translated: if he does not dwell in those [places]?

analyzed: kiyat rūpaḥ punar bhagavan bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya anyaḥ vivekaḥ
translated: To what extent, Blessed One, is there another kind of solitude for a bodhisattva mahāsattva?

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocatsacetsubhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo vivikto bhavati śrāvakapratisaṃyuktairmanasikāraiḥ /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat saced subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ viviktaḥ bhavati śrāvaka pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti, “Subhūti, if a bodhisattva mahāsattva is secluded from mental activities associated with the śrāvakas,

analyzed: viviktaḥ bhavati pratyekabuddha pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ
translated: and is secluded from mental activities associated with the pratyekabuddhas,

original: evaṃ sa bodhisattvo mahāsattvo vivikto viharati /
analyzed: evam sa bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ viviktaḥ viharati
translated: then that bodhisattva mahāsattva dwells in seclusion.

original: grāmānte'pi hi viharan prajñāpāramitopāyakauśalyaparigṛhītaḥ sarvasattvamaitrīmahākaruṇāvihāreṇa viharet /
analyzed: grāma ante api hi viharan prajñāpāramitā upāya kauśalya parigṛhītaḥ sarva sattva maitrī mahā karuṇā vihāreṇa viharet
translated: Even if he dwells near a village, if he is embraced by the perfection of wisdom and skillful means, he dwells in the dwelling of great compassion and friendliness towards all beings.

original: anena vihāreṇa viharan vivikta eva sa viharati /
analyzed: anena vihāreṇa viharan viviktaḥ eva sa viharati
translated: Dwelling in this dwelling, he dwells in seclusion itself.

original: ayaṃ khalu punaḥ subhūte mayā bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya śrāvakapratyekabuddhapratisaṃyuktamanasikāraviveko'nujñātaḥ /
analyzed: ayam khalu punar subhūte mayā bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya śrāvaka pratyekabuddha pratisaṃyukta manasikāra vivekaḥ anujñātaḥ
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, this seclusion of the bodhisattva mahāsattva from mental activities associated with the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas has been allowed by me for the bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: anena vivekena viharan bodhisattvo mahāsattvo rātriṃdivānyatināmayati /
analyzed: anena vivekena viharan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ rātriṃdivāni atināmayati
translated: Dwelling in this seclusion, the bodhisattva mahāsattva spends his days and nights.

analyzed: viviktaḥ viharati
translated: He dwells in seclusion.

analyzed: saced bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ uraṇya vana prastha giri guhā śmaśāna prānta śayana āsaneṣu anena vihāreṇa viharati
translated: If a bodhisattva mahāsattva dwells in the wilderness, in a forest, in a remote place, in a mountain cave, in a charnel ground, or in a place with few noises, with this dwelling,

analyzed: viviktaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ viharati
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva dwells in solitude.

original: yaṃ punaḥ subhūte māraḥ pāpīyān vivekamupadekṣyati araṇyavanaprasthagiriguhāśmaśānaprāntaśayanāsanavihārān /
analyzed: yam punar subhūte māraḥ pāpīyān vivekam upadekṣyati araṇya vana prastha giri guhā śmaśāna prānta śayana āsana vihārān
translated: But, Subhūti, that which Māra, the evil one, teaches as solitude, the wilderness, the forest, the remote place, the mountain cave, the charnel ground, or the place with few noises,

original: sa tena vivekena śrāvakapratyekabuddhapratisaṃyuktairmanasikāraiḥ saṃkīrṇa eva san prajñāpāramitāyāmanabhiyujyamāno na sarvajñajñānaṃ paripūrayati
analyzed: sa tena vivekena śrāvaka pratyekabuddha pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ saṃkīrṇaḥ eva san prajñāpāramitāyām an abhiyujyamānaḥ na sarvajña jñānam paripūrayati
translated: dwelling in that solitude, mixed with thoughts connected with the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, not applying himself to the perfection of wisdom, does not fulfill the knowledge of all modes.

original: evaṃ sa saṃkīrṇavihāreṇa viharan so'pariśuddhena manasikāreṇa viharan apariśuddhakāyavāṅmanaḥkarmāntaḥ eva bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: evam sa saṃkīrṇa vihāreṇa viharan sa upari śuddhena manasikāreṇa viharan a pariśuddha kāya vāc manaḥ karmāntaḥ eva bhaviṣyati
translated: Thus, dwelling in a mixed dwelling, dwelling with impure thoughts, he will only have impure physical, verbal, and mental actions.

original: apariśuddhakāyavāṅmanaḥkarmānta eva saṃstato'nyānapi bodhisattvān mahāsattvān grāmāntavihāriṇo'saṃkīrṇān śrāvakapratyekabuddhapratisaṃyuktairmanasikāraiḥ prajñopāyamahākaruṇāvihāravihāriṇo'vamaṃsyate /
analyzed: a pariśuddha kāya vāc manaḥ karmāntaḥ eva san tatas nyān api bodhisattvān mahāsattvān grāma anta vihāriṇaḥ u saṃkīrṇān śrāvaka pratyekabuddha pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ prajñā upāya mahā karuṇā vihāra vihāriṇaḥ uvamaṃsyate
translated: Having impure bodily, verbal, and mental actions, he will despise other bodhisattva mahāsattvas who dwell in villages, who are unmixed, who dwell in the practice of wisdom, means, and great compassion, who are free from thoughts related to śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: araṇye'pi viharan so'pariśuddhakāyavāṅmanaḥkarmāntaḥ san saṃkīrṇavihāryeva bhavati /
analyzed: araṇye api viharan sa upari śuddha kāya vāc manaḥ karmāntaḥ san saṃkīrṇa vihārī eva bhavati
translated: Even if he dwells in the forest, having impure bodily, verbal, and mental actions, he will still be dwelling in a mixed way.

analyzed: na vivikta vihārī
translated: He will not be dwelling in solitude.

original: sa prajñopāyamahākaruṇāvihāravihāriṇo grāmānte viharataḥ pariśuddhakāyavāṅmanaḥkarmasamudācārān śrāvakapratyekabuddhapratisaṃyuktamanasikāraviviktānasaṃkīrṇān śrāvakapratyekabuddhapratisaṃyuktairmanasikāraistāṃstāvatso'vamanyamāno na dhyānasamādhisamāpattivimokṣābhijñānāṃ lābhī bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: sa prajñā upāya mahā karuṇā vihāra vihāriṇaḥ grāma ante viharataḥ pariśuddha kāya vāc manaḥ karma samudācārān śrāvaka pratyekabuddha pratisaṃyukta manasikāra viviktān asaṃkīrṇān śrāvaka pratyekabuddha pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ tān tāvat saḥ u vamanyamānaḥ na dhyāna samādhi samāpatti vimokṣa abhijñānām lābhī bhaviṣyati
translated: Despising those who dwell in the practice of wisdom, means, and great compassion while dwelling in villages, who have pure bodily, verbal, and mental conduct, who are free from thoughts related to śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, who are unmixed with thoughts related to śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, he will not attain the dhyānas, samādhis, samāpattis, liberations, and higher knowledges.

analyzed: na ca asya tāḥ paripūrim gamiṣyanti
translated: And they will not be perfected for him.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: tathā hi saḥ unupāya kuśalaḥ bhavati
translated: Because he is unskilled in means.

original: kiṃcāpi subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo yojanaśatikeṣvaṭavīkāntāreṣu viharedapagatavyālamṛgapakṣisaṃgheṣu apagatakṣudramṛgavyālayakṣarākṣasānuvicariteṣu apagatacaurakāntārabhayabhairavopadraveṣu saṃtiṣṭhet /🔽varṣaṃ vā varṣaśataṃ vā varṣasahasraṃ vā varṣaśatasahasraṃ vā varṣakoṭīṃ vā varṣakoṭīśataṃ vā varṣakoṭīsahasraṃ vā varṣakoṭīśatasahasraṃ vā varṣakoṭīniyutaśatasahasraṃ vā /
analyzed: kiṃca api subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ yojana śatikeṣu aṭavī kāntāreṣu viharet apagata vyāla mṛga pakṣi saṃgheṣu apagata kṣudra mṛga vyāla yakṣa rākṣasa anuvicariteṣu apagata caura kāntāra bhaya bhairava upadraveṣu saṃtiṣṭhet  varṣam vā varṣa śatam vā varṣa sahasram vā varṣa śata sahasram vā varṣa koṭīm vā varṣa koṭī śatam vā varṣa koṭī sahasram vā varṣa koṭī śata sahasram vā varṣa koṭī niyuta śata sahasram vā
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, if a Bodhisattva, a great being, were to dwell in forests, in desolate places, in empty dwellings, in places where there are no human beings, for one yojana, or two yojanas, or up to one hundred yojanas, or even more, for one year, or one hundred years, or one thousand years, or up to one hundred thousand years, or one koṭi of years, or one hundred koṭis of years, or one thousand koṭis of years, or one hundred thousand koṭis of years, or even more than that,

analyzed: tatas vai upari
translated: and if he were to dwell there without fear, terror, or trembling, and without any fear of wild animals, birds, or other creatures, and without any fear of thieves, robbers, or other dangers,

original: imaṃ ca vivekaṃ mayopadiṣṭaṃ na jānīyāt /🔽yena vivekena bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'dhyāśayasaṃprasthito'dhyāśayasaṃpanno viharati /🔽taṃ so'nupāyakuśalo bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'jānannaraṇyaparamo viharati /
analyzed: imam ca vivekam mayā upadiṣṭam na jānīyāt  yena vivekena bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ udhyāśaya saṃprasthitaḥ udhyāśaya saṃpannaḥ viharati  tam saḥ nu pāya kuśalaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ jānan araṇya paramaḥ viharati
translated: and if he were to dwell there without knowing the solitude that I have taught,🔽then that Bodhisattva, that great being, who dwells in solitude with a superior intention, endowed with a superior intention, through that solitude would not be skilled in means.

analyzed: tatra ca viveke niśritaḥ ālīna udhyavasita udhyavasāyam āpannaḥ
translated: That Bodhisattva, that great being, who dwells in solitude without skill in means, not knowing that solitude, would dwell in solitude with a superior intention, attached to it, clinging to it, and would fall into a wrong path.

original: naiva me subhūte etāvatā sa bodhisattvaścittamārādhayati /
analyzed: na eva me subhūte etāvatā sa bodhisattvaḥ cittam ārādhayati
translated: Subhūti, I do not think that bodhisattva has pleased the mind by that much.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: yaḥ subhūte viveko bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ mayā ākhyātaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ subhūte vivekaḥ bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām mayā ākhyātaḥ
translated: Subhūti, the solitude of bodhisattva mahāsattvas that I have taught,

original: tena vivekena viharannasmin viveke na saṃdṛśyate /
analyzed: tena vivekena viharan asmin viveke na saṃdṛśyate
translated: while dwelling in that solitude, is not seen in this solitude.

original: tamenaṃ māraḥ pāpīyānupasaṃkramya uparyantarīkṣe vihāyasi sthitvā evaṃ vakṣyatisādhu sādhu kulaputra /
analyzed: tam enam māraḥ pāpīyān upasaṃkramya upari antarīkṣe vihāyasi sthitvā evam vakṣyati sādhu sādhu kula putra
translated: Then Māra the Evil One, having approached, standing in the sky above, will say this: 'Excellent, excellent, son of good family!

original: eṣa bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ tathāgatena viveka ākhyātaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tathāgatena vivekaḥ ākhyātaḥ
translated: This is the solitude taught by the Tathāgata for bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

analyzed: anena eva tvam kula putra vivekena vihara
translated: Son of good family, dwell in just this solitude.

analyzed: evam tvam kṣipram anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: In this way, you will quickly fully awaken to unsurpassed complete enlightenment.'

original: sa tato vivekātpunareva araṇyādgrāmāntamavatīrya tadanyān bodhisattvān mahāsattvān peśalān bhikṣūn sabrahmacāriṇaḥ kalyāṇadharmaṇo'saṃkīrṇān śrāvakapratyekabuddhapratisaṃyuktairmanasikāraiḥ pariśuddhakāyavāṅmanaḥkarmāntān jīvānavamaṃsyate /
analyzed: sa tatas vivekāt punar eva araṇyāt grāma antam avatīrya tad anyān bodhisattvān mahāsattvān peśalān bhikṣūn sabrahmacāriṇaḥ kalyāṇa dharmaṇā usaṃkīrṇān śrāvaka pratyekabuddha pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ pariśuddha kāya vāc manaḥ karmāntān jīvān avamaṃsyate
translated: Then, having descended from that solitude, from the forest, into the vicinity of the village, he will despise other bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are skillful, monks, celibate practitioners, who have good qualities, who are unmixed, whose physical, verbal, and mental actions are pure with respect to the attentions associated with śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: sa evaṃ vakṣyatisaṃkīrṇavihāreṇa bateme āyuṣmanto viharanti /
analyzed: saḥ evam vakṣyati saṃkīrṇa vihāreṇa bata ime āyuṣmantaḥ viharanti
translated: He will say, 'Venerable ones, you are living in a mixed dwelling,

analyzed: na vivikta vihāreṇa
translated: not in a secluded dwelling.

analyzed: ākīrṇa vihāreṇa bata ime āyuṣmantaḥ viharanti
translated: Venerable ones, you are living in a crowded dwelling,

analyzed: na vivikta vihāreṇa viharanti iti
translated: not in a secluded dwelling.'

original: ye te bodhisattvā mahāsattvā viviktavihāreṇa viharanti /🔽tān saṃkīrṇavihāreṇa codayiṣyati /
analyzed: ye te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ vivikta vihāreṇa viharanti  tān saṃkīrṇa vihāreṇa codayiṣyati
translated: Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are living in a secluded dwelling,🔽he will accuse them of living in a mixed dwelling.

analyzed: ākīrṇa vihāreṇa codayiṣyati
translated: He will accuse them of living in a crowded dwelling.

analyzed: ye ca te saṃkīrṇa vihāreṇa viharanti
translated: And those who are living in a mixed dwelling,

analyzed: tān sa vivikta vihāreṇa samudācariṣyati
translated: he will practice with them in a secluded dwelling.

analyzed: tatra gauravam utpādayiṣyati
translated: He will generate respect there.

analyzed: yatra ca gauravam utpādayitavyam
translated: And where respect should be generated,

analyzed: tatra mānam utpādayiṣyati
translated: there he will generate pride.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

analyzed: aham amanuṣyaiḥ codye
translated: I am accused by non-humans.

analyzed: aham amanuṣyaiḥ smārye
translated: I am reminded by non-humans.

original: eṣa subhūte vihāro yenāhaṃ vihāreṇa viharāmi /
analyzed: eṣa subhūte vihāraḥ yena aham vihāreṇa viharāmi
translated: This is the dwelling, Subhūti, by which I dwell.

analyzed: kam grāma anta vihāriṇam amanuṣyāḥ codayiṣyanti
translated: Which one living in a village will non-humans accuse?

analyzed: kam grāma antare viharantam amanuṣyāḥ smārayiṣyanti
translated: Which one living in another village will non-humans remind?

analyzed: iti evam hi bodhisattva yānikān pudgalān avamaṃsyate
translated: Thus he will despise those individuals who follow the vehicle of the bodhisattvas.

analyzed: ayam subhūte bodhisattva caṇḍālaḥ veditavyaḥ  bodhisattva dūṣī veditavyaḥ
translated: This, Subhūti, should be known as a bodhisattva outcast.🔽He should be known as a bodhisattva corrupter.

analyzed: bodhisattva pratirūpakaḥ veditavyaḥ  bodhisattva prativarṇikaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: He should be known as a bodhisattva impostor.🔽He should be known as a bodhisattva pretender.

analyzed: bodhisattva kāraṇḍavakaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: He should be known as a bodhisattva charlatan.

analyzed: cauraḥ śramaṇa veṣeṇa  cauraḥ bodhisattva yānikānām pudgalānām
translated: He is a thief in the guise of an ascetic.🔽He is a thief of those who have set out in the Great Vehicle.

analyzed: cauraḥ sa devakasya lokasya
translated: He is a thief of the world with its gods.

original: tajjātīyaḥ khaluḥ punaḥ subhūte pudgalo na sevitavyo na bhaktavyo na paryupāsitavyaḥ /
analyzed: tad jātīyaḥ khalu punar subhūte pudgalaḥ na sevitavyaḥ na bhaktavyaḥ na paryupāsitavyaḥ
translated: Subhūti, such a person should not be attended upon, should not be served, should not be honored.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: abhimānapatitā hi te tathārūpāḥ pudgalā veditavyāḥ /
analyzed: abhimāna patitāḥ hi te tathārūpāḥ pudgalāḥ veditavyāḥ
translated: Those people should be known as fallen into pride.

original: anyeṣāmapi tathārūpāṇāmalpa sthāmānācirayānasaṃprasthitānāṃ saṃdūṣaṇaṃ kuryuḥ /🔽aviśuddhadharmāṇo hi te tathārūpāḥ pudgalāḥ veditavyāḥ /🔽anāryā hi te tathārūpāḥ pudgalā veditavyāḥ /
analyzed: anyeṣām api tathārūpāṇām alpa sthāmāna acira yāna saṃprasthitānām saṃdūṣaṇam kuryuḥ  aviśuddha dharmāṇaḥ hi te tathārūpāḥ pudgalāḥ veditavyāḥ  anāryāḥ hi te tathārūpāḥ pudgalāḥ veditavyāḥ
translated: They would corrupt others like themselves who have little faith and have newly set out in the vehicle.🔽Those people should be known as having impure qualities.🔽Those people should be known as not being noble.

original: anāryadharmāṇo hi te tathārūpāḥ pudgalā veditavyāḥ /
analyzed: anārya dharmāṇaḥ hi te tathārūpāḥ pudgalāḥ veditavyāḥ
translated: Those people should be known as having non-noble qualities.

original: yasya khalu punaḥ subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya aparityaktāḥ sarvasattvāḥ /
analyzed: yasya khalu punar subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya a parityaktāḥ sarva sattvāḥ
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who has not abandoned all beings,

analyzed: a parityaktā sarvajña tā
translated: who has not abandoned omniscience,

analyzed: a parityaktā anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ
translated: who has not abandoned unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

original: tena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena adhyāśayena anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃboddhukāmena sarvasattvānāmarthaṃ kartukāmena tajjātīyāḥ pudgalā na sevitavyāḥ /
analyzed: tena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena adhyāśayena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhu kāmena sarva sattvānām artham kartu kāmena tad jātīyāḥ pudgalāḥ na sevitavyāḥ
translated: that bodhisattva mahāsattva, with a superior intention, who wishes to fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, who wishes to benefit all beings, should not attend to, should not serve, should not honor,

analyzed: na bhaktavyāḥ  na paryupāsitavyāḥ
translated: those kinds of people.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ subhūte sarvasattvānāmarthāya abhyutthitena eteṣāṃ ca anyeṣāṃ ca mārakarmaṇāmavabodhāya nityamevodvignacittena bhavitavyaṃ sarvasattvānāṃ mārgamapratilabhamānānāmupadeṣṭumutrastamānasena asaṃsṛṣṭena traidhātukena /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar subhūte sarva sattvānām arthāya abhyutthitena eteṣām ca anyeṣām ca māra karmaṇām avabodhāya nityam eva udvigna cittena bhavitavyam sarva sattvānām mārgam a pratilabhamānānām upadeṣṭum utrasta mānasena asaṃsṛṣṭena traidhātukena
translated: But, Subhūti, for the sake of all beings, having arisen for the benefit of these and other activities of Māra, one should always have an anxious mind, for the sake of all beings who have not attained the path, with a fearful mind, unassociated with the three realms.

original: tatrāpi tāvanmaitrāyamāṇena karuṇāyamānena mahākaruṇāmutpādya anukampāmupādāya samyakpratipanneṣu sattveṣu muditacittenānupalabdhidharmatayā dharmāṇāmupekṣakeṇa evaṃ cittamutpādayitavyamtathā kariṣyāmi yathā sarve mārakarmadoṣāḥ sarveṇa sarvaṃ sarvathā sarvaṃ sarvatra sarvadā ca na bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: tatra api tāvat maitrāyamāṇena karuṇāyamānena mahā karuṇām utpādya anukampām upādāya samyak pratipanneṣu sattveṣu mudita cittena anupalabdhi dharma tayā dharmāṇām upekṣakeṇa evam cittam utpādayitavyam tathā kariṣyāmi yathā sarve māra karma doṣāḥ sarveṇa sarvam sarvathā sarvam sarvatra sarvadā ca na bhaviṣyanti
translated: There too, one should be friendly, compassionate, and having generated great compassion, having taken pity, with a joyful mind towards beings who are practicing correctly, and with equanimity towards phenomena due to the nature of non-apprehension, one should generate this thought: I will act in such a way that all the faults of Māra's actions will never exist in any way, at all, everywhere, and at all times.

analyzed: na utpatsyante
translated: They will not arise.

analyzed: saced utpatsyante
translated: If they were to arise,

analyzed: kṣipram eva pratigamiṣyanti
translated: they will quickly depart.

analyzed: evam śikṣiṣye iti
translated: I will train like this.

original: ayamapi bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ svayamabhijñāya parākramo veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: ayam api bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām svayam abhijñāya parākramaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: This should be known as the bodhisattvas', the great beings', own superknowledge and valor.

original: idamapi subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena vivekaguṇena mārakarma veditavyamiti //
analyzed: idam api subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena viveka guṇena māra karma veditavyam iti
translated: This, Subhūti, should be known by the bodhisattva, the great being, as the deed of Māra through the quality of solitude.

analyzed: ārya aṣṭasāhasrikāyām prajñāpāramitāyām mārakarmaparivartaḥ nāma ekaviṃśatitamaḥ
translated: In the Noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines, the chapter called The Deeds of Māra, the twenty-first.

analyzed: kalyāṇamitra parivartaḥ dvāviṃśatitamaḥ
translated: Chapter Twenty-Two: The Good Spiritual Friend

original: atha khalu bhagavān punarapyāyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimāmantrayate smaiha subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena adhyāśayasaṃprasthitena anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃboddhukāmena ādita evaṃ kalyāṇamitrāṇi sevitavyāni bhaktavyāni paryupāsitavyāni /🔽subhūtirāhakatamāni tāni punarbhagavan bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya kalyāṇamitrāṇi veditavyāni /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān punar api āyuṣmantam subhūtim āmantrayate sma eha subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena adhyāśaya saṃprasthitena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhu kāmena āditas evam kalyāṇa mitrāṇi sevitavyāni bhaktavyāni paryupāsitavyāni  subhūtiḥ āha katamāni tāni punar bhagavan bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya kalyāṇa mitrāṇi veditavyāni
translated: Then the Blessed One again addressed the Venerable Subhuti: Subhuti, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who has set out with the superior intention, who wishes to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, should first serve, venerate, and attend upon spiritual friends.🔽Subhuti said, Blessed One, which are the spiritual friends of a bodhisattva-mahāsattva that should be known?

original: yāni bodhisattvena mahāsattvena adhyāśayasaṃprasthitena anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃboddhukāmena ādita eva kalyāṇamitrāṇi sevitavyāni bhaktavyāni
analyzed: yāni bodhisattvena mahāsattvena adhyāśaya saṃprasthitena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhu kāmena āditas eva kalyāṇa mitrāṇi sevitavyāni bhaktavyāni
translated: Those spiritual friends that a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who has set out with the superior intention, who wishes to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, should first serve, venerate, and attend upon.

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocatbuddhā eva subhūte bhagavantaḥ /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat buddhāḥ eva subhūte bhagavantaḥ
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the Venerable Subhuti: Subhuti, the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones,

original: ye ca te'vinivartanīyā bodhisattvā mahāsattvā bodhisattvacaryākuśalāḥ /
analyzed: ye ca te vinivartanīyāḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ bodhisattva caryā kuśalāḥ
translated: and those irreversible bodhisattva-mahāsattvas who are skilled in the bodhisattva practice,

analyzed: ye enam pāramitāsu avavadanti anuśāsati
translated: who instruct and admonish in the perfections,

analyzed: ye smai prajñāpāramitām deśayanti upadiśanti
translated: Those who teach and instruct him in the perfection of wisdom.

original: imāni tāni subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya kalyāṇamitrāṇi veditavyāni /
analyzed: imāni tāni subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya kalyāṇa mitrāṇi veditavyāni
translated: These, Subhuti, should be known as the spiritual friends of the Bodhisattva, the great being.

original: prajñāpāramitaiva subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya kalyāṇamitraṃ veditavyam /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā eva subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya kalyāṇa mitram veditavyam
translated: The perfection of wisdom alone, Subhuti, should be known as the spiritual friend of the Bodhisattva, the great being.

original: sarvā eva ca subhūte ṣaṭ pāramitā bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya kalyāṇamitrāṇi veditavyāni /
analyzed: sarvāḥ eva ca subhūte ṣaḍ pāramitāḥ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya kalyāṇa mitrāṇi veditavyāni
translated: And all the six perfections, Subhuti, should be known as the spiritual friends of the Bodhisattva, the great being.

analyzed: ṣaḍ eva pāramitāḥ śāstā  ṣaṭ pāramitā mārgaḥ
translated: The six perfections are the Teacher.🔽The six perfections are the Path.

original: ṣaṭ pāramitā ālokaḥ /🔽ṣaṭ pāramitā ulkā /🔽ṣaṭ pāramitāḥ avabhāsaḥ /🔽ṣaṭ pāramitāstrāṇam /
analyzed: ṣaṭ pāramitā ālokaḥ  ṣaṭ pāramitā ulkā  ṣaṭ pāramitāḥ avabhāsaḥ  ṣaṭ pāramitāḥ trāṇam
translated: The six perfections are the Light.🔽The six perfections are the Torch.🔽The six perfections are the Illumination.

original: ṣaṭ pāramitāḥ śaraṇam /🔽ṣaṭ pāramitā layanam /🔽ṣaṭ pāramitāḥ parāyaṇam /
analyzed: ṣaṭ pāramitāḥ śaraṇam  ṣaṭ pāramitā layanam  ṣaḍ pāramitāḥ parāyaṇam
translated: The six perfections are the Refuge.🔽The six perfections are the Shelter.🔽The six perfections are the Retreat.

analyzed: ṣaṭ pāramitāḥ dvīpaḥ  ṣaṭ pāramitā mātā
translated: The six perfections are the Island.🔽The six perfections are the Mother.

analyzed: ṣaḍ pāramitāḥ pitā
translated: The six perfections are the Father.

original: ṣaṭ pāramitā jñānāya bodhāya anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye saṃvartante /
analyzed: ṣaṭ pāramitā jñānāya bodhāya anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye saṃvartante
translated: The six perfections lead to knowledge, to enlightenment, to full enlightenment.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: atra hi subhūte prajñāpāramitā pariniṣṭhitā bhavati yaduta ṣaṭpāramitāsu /
analyzed: atra hi subhūte prajñāpāramitā pariniṣṭhitā bhavati yat uta ṣaṣ pāramitāsu
translated: For here, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is perfected, namely in the six perfections.

original: ye'pi te subhūte atīte'dhvani tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhya parinirvṛtāḥ /🔽teṣāmapi buddhānāṃ bhagavatāmitonirjātaiva sarvajñatā /
analyzed: ye api te subhūte atīta idhvani tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhya parinirvṛtāḥ  teṣām api buddhānām bhagavatām itas nirjātā eva sarvajña tā
translated: Those also, Subhuti, who in the past period fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, the Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones, who have attained final nirvāṇa,

analyzed: yat uta ṣaḍbhyaḥ pāramitābhyaḥ
translated: for those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, all-knowledge has arisen from this, namely from the six perfections.

original: ye'pi te subhūte bhaviṣyantyanāgate'dhvani tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyante /🔽teṣāmapi buddhānāṃ bhagavatāmitonirjātaiva sarvajñatā /
analyzed: ye api te subhūte bhaviṣyanti anāgata idhvani tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyante  teṣām api buddhānām bhagavatām itas nirjātā eva sarvajña tā
translated: Those also, Subhuti, who in the future period will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, the Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones,

analyzed: yat uta ṣaḍbhyaḥ pāramitābhyaḥ
translated: for those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, all-knowledge will arise from this, namely from the six perfections.

original: ye'pi te subhūte aprameyeṣvasaṃkhyeyeṣvaparimāṇeṣvacintyeṣu lokadhātuṣu tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā etarhyanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhāstiṣṭhanti /🔽dhriyante /
analyzed: ye api te subhūte aprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu aparimāṇeṣu acintyeṣu lokadhātuṣu tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ etarhi anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhāḥ tiṣṭhanti  dhriyante
translated: Those also, Subhuti, who in the present period in the innumerable, countless, immeasurable, inconceivable world systems fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, the Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones,

analyzed: yāpayanti
translated: who have attained final nirvāṇa,🔽who are now attaining final nirvāṇa,

analyzed: dharmam ca deśayanti
translated: who will teach the Dharma,

analyzed: teṣām api buddhānām bhagavatām itas nirjātā eva sarvajña tā
translated: The omniscience of those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, also arises from this.

analyzed: yat uta ṣaḍbhyaḥ pāramitābhyaḥ
translated: For those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, omniscience also arises from these, namely, the six perfections.

original: ahamapi subhūte tathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddha etarhyanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhaḥ /🔽mamāpi hi subhūte itonirjātaiva sarvajñatā /
analyzed: aham api subhūte tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ etarhi anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ  mama api hi subhūte itas nirjātā eva sarvajña tā
translated: I, Subhūti, having now fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, am also a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Enlightened One.

analyzed: yat uta ṣaḍbhyaḥ pāramitābhyaḥ
translated: For me too, Subhūti, omniscience arises from these, namely, the six perfections.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: āsu hi subhūte ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣā dharmā antargatāḥ /
analyzed: āsu hi subhūte ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣāḥ dharmāḥ antargatāḥ
translated: Subhūti, because the thirty-seven factors of awakening, the four formless absorptions,

analyzed: catvāraḥ brahmavihārāḥ
translated: the four immeasurables,

analyzed: saṃgraha vastūni
translated: the four means of gathering students,

analyzed: yāvān ca kaścid buddha dharmaḥ buddha jñānam svayaṃbhū jñānam acintya jñānam atulya jñānam aprameya jñānam asaṃkhyeya jñānam asama jñānam asamasama jñānam sarvajña jñānam
translated: and whatever other qualities of the Buddha there are, the knowledge of a Buddha, self-arisen knowledge, inconceivable knowledge, incomparable knowledge, immeasurable knowledge, innumerable knowledge, unequaled knowledge, knowledge equal to the unequaled, omniscience,

analyzed: sarvam tat ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu antargatam
translated: all that is included in the six perfections.

original: tasmāttarhi subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya ṣaṭ pāramitā eva kalyāṇamitrāṇi veditavyāni /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya ṣaḍ pāramitāḥ eva kalyāṇa mitrāṇi veditavyāni
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, the six perfections should be known as the spiritual friends of the bodhisattva mahāsattva.

analyzed: ṣaḍ eva pāramitāḥ śāstā
translated: The six perfections are the teacher.

original: ṣaṭ pāramitā mārgaḥ /🔽ṣaṭ pāramitā ālokaḥ /🔽ṣaṭ pāramitā ulkā /
analyzed: ṣaṭ pāramitā mārgaḥ  ṣaṭ pāramitā ālokaḥ  ṣaṭ pāramitā ulkā
translated: The six perfections are the path.🔽The six perfections are the light.🔽The six perfections are the torch.

analyzed: ṣaṭ pāramitā avabhāsaḥ  ṣaṭ pāramitāḥ trāṇam
translated: The six perfections are the illumination.🔽The six perfections are the protection.

original: ṣaṭ pāramitāḥ śaraṇam /🔽ṣaṭ pāramitā layanam /🔽ṣaṭ pāramitāḥ parāyaṇam /
analyzed: ṣaṭ pāramitāḥ śaraṇam  ṣaṭ pāramitā layanam  ṣaḍ pāramitāḥ parāyaṇam
translated: The six perfections are the refuge.🔽The six perfections are the shelter.🔽The six perfections are the final relief.

analyzed: ṣaṭ pāramitāḥ dvīpaḥ  ṣaṭ pāramitā mātā
translated: The six perfections are the island.🔽The six perfections are the mother.

analyzed: ṣaḍ pāramitāḥ pitā
translated: The six perfections are the father.

original: ṣaṭ pāramitā jñānāya bodhāya sarvajñatāyai anuttarasamyaksaṃbodhiprāptaye saṃvartante /
analyzed: ṣaṭ pāramitāḥ jñānāya bodhāya sarvajña tāyai anuttara samyaksaṃbodhi prāptaye saṃvartante
translated: The six perfections lead to knowledge, to awakening, to omniscience, to the attainment of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: sarva sattvānām apratyupakāriṇām api upakāri bhūtaḥ bhavati
translated: Even to all beings who do not repay kindness, he becomes a benefactor.

analyzed: yadā bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ ṣaṣ pāramitāsu śikṣate
translated: When the bodhisattva mahāsattva trains in the six perfections,

original: āsu khalu punaḥ subhūte ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu śikṣitukāmena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena iyameva prajñāpāramitā śrotavyā udgrahītavyā dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā pravartayitavyā deśayitavyā upadeṣṭavyā uddeṣṭavyā svādhyātavyā /
analyzed: āsu khalu punar subhūte ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu śikṣitu kāmena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena iyam eva prajñāpāramitā śrotavyā udgrahītavyā dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā pravartayitavyā deśayitavyā upadeṣṭavyā uddeṣṭavyā su ādhyātavyā
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to train in these six perfections should listen to, take up, keep, recite, master, and teach this very perfection of wisdom, should explain it, proclaim it, chant it, meditate on it with a mind free from grasping, and cultivate it.

original: arthataśca dharmataśca nayataścopaparīkṣitavyā upanidhyātavyā paripraṣṭavyā paripraśnayitavyā /
analyzed: arthataḥ ca dharmataḥ ca nayataḥ ca upaparīkṣitavyā upanidhyātavyā paripraṣṭavyā paripraśnayitavyā
translated: They should be examined, contemplated, questioned, and inquired into in terms of meaning, truth, and principle.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: eṣā hi prajñāpāramitā ṣaṇṇāṃ pāramitānāṃ pūrvaṃgamā nāyikā pariṇāyikā saṃdarśikā avadarśikā janayitrī dhatrī /
analyzed: eṣā hi prajñāpāramitā ṣaṇṇām pāramitānām pūrvaṃgamā nāyikā pariṇāyikā saṃdarśikā avadarśikā janayitrī dhatrī
translated: Because this perfection of wisdom is the forerunner and leader of the six perfections, guiding them, showing them, teaching them, and giving birth to them.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: prajñāpāramitāvirahitā hi pañca pāramitā na prajñāyante /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā virahitāḥ hi pañca pāramitāḥ na prajñāyante
translated: Because the five perfections are not recognized without the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: na api pāramitā nāmadheyam labhante
translated: And they do not obtain the name of perfections.

original: tasmāttarhi subhūte aparapraṇeyatāṃ gantukāmena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena aparapraṇeyatāyāṃ sthātukāmena ihaiva prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣitavyam
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi subhūte apara praṇeya tām gantu kāmena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena apara praṇeya tāyām sthātu kāmena iha eva prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to not be led by others, who wishes to stand in not being led by others, should train in just this perfection of wisdom.

original: subhūtirāhakiṃlakṣaṇā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā /🔽evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocatasaṅgalakṣaṇā subhūte prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha kiṃlakṣaṇā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā  evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat asaṅga lakṣaṇā subhūte prajñāpāramitā
translated: Subhūti said, Blessed One, what are the characteristics of the perfection of wisdom?🔽When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom has the characteristic of non-attachment.

original: subhūtirāhasyādbhagavan paryāyo yena paryāyeṇa yenaivāsaṅgalakṣaṇena prajñāpāramitā saṃvidyate /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha syāt bhagavan paryāyaḥ yena paryāyeṇa yena eva asaṅga lakṣaṇena prajñāpāramitā saṃvidyate
translated: Subhūti said, Blessed One, there is a method by which the perfection of wisdom exists through the characteristic of non-attachment.

analyzed: tena eva asaṅga lakṣaṇena sarva dharmāḥ saṃvidyeran
translated: By that very characteristic of non-attachment, all dharmas would exist.

analyzed: bhagavān āha evam etat subhūte evam etat
translated: The Blessed One said, So it is, Subhuti. So it is.

original: syātsubhūte paryāyo yena paryāyeṇa yenaiva asaṅgalakṣaṇena prajñāpāramitā saṃvidyate /
analyzed: syāt subhūte paryāyaḥ yena paryāyeṇa yena eva asaṅga lakṣaṇena prajñāpāramitā saṃvidyate
translated: Subhuti, there could be a way in which by that very characteristic of non-attachment, the perfection of wisdom exists,

analyzed: tena eva asaṅga lakṣaṇena sarva dharmāḥ saṃvidyante
translated: by that very characteristic of non-attachment, all dharmas exist.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ  sarva dharmāḥ hi subhūte viviktāḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?🔽Subhuti, all dharmas are indeed secluded.

analyzed: sarva dharmāḥ hi subhūte śūnyāḥ
translated: Subhuti, all dharmas are indeed empty.

original: tasmāttarhi subhūte yenaiva asaṅgalakṣaṇena prajñāpāramitā viviktā śūnyā /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi subhūte yena eva asaṅga lakṣaṇena prajñāpāramitā viviktā śūnyā
translated: Therefore, Subhuti, by that very characteristic of non-attachment, by which the perfection of wisdom is secluded, empty,

analyzed: tena eva asaṅga lakṣaṇena sarva dharmāḥ viviktāḥ śūnyāḥ
translated: by that very characteristic of non-attachment, all dharmas are secluded, empty.

analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha yadi bhagavan sarva dharmāḥ viviktāḥ
translated: Subhuti said, If, Blessed One, all dharmas are secluded,

analyzed: sarva dharmāḥ śūnyāḥ
translated: all dharmas are empty,

analyzed: katham bhagavan sattvānām saṃkleśaḥ prajñāyate
translated: how, Blessed One, is the defilement of beings known?

original: kathaṃ bhagavan sattvānāṃ vyavadānaṃ prajñāyate /🔽na ca bhagavan viviktaṃ saṃkliśyate /
analyzed: katham bhagavan sattvānām vyavadānam prajñāyate  na ca bhagavan viviktam saṃkliśyate
translated: How, Blessed One, is the purification of beings known?🔽And, Blessed One, the secluded is not defiled,

analyzed: na bhagavan viviktam vyavadāyati
translated: the secluded does not become purified, Blessed One.

analyzed: na ca bhagavan śūnyam saṃkliśyate
translated: And emptiness, Blessed One, is not defiled.

analyzed: na ca bhagavan śūnyam vyavadāyati
translated: And emptiness, Blessed One, is not purified.

original: na ca bhagavan viviktaṃ vā śūnyaṃ vā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhyate /🔽anyatrāpi bhagavan śūnyatāyāḥ sarvadharmo nopalabhyate /
analyzed: na ca bhagavan viviktam vā śūnyam vā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate  anyatra api bhagavan śūnyatāyāḥ sarva dharmaḥ na upalabhyate
translated: And emptiness, Blessed One, does not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: yaḥ unuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ vā  abhisaṃbhotsyate vā  abhisaṃbudhyate vā
translated: And, Blessed One, apart from emptiness, no dharma can be apprehended in which unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment might be attained.

original: kathaṃ vā vayaṃ bhagavan asya bhāṣitasyārthamājānīmaḥ /
analyzed: katham vā vayam bhagavan asya bhāṣitasya artham ājānīmaḥ
translated: Blessed One, how should we understand the meaning of what you have said?

analyzed: deśayatu bhagavan
translated: Please teach us, Blessed One.

original: deśayatu sugata /🔽evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocattatkiṃ manyase dīrgharātraṃ sattvā ahaṃkāre mamakāre caranti /
analyzed: deśayatu sugata  evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat tat kim manyase dīrgharātram sattvāḥ ahaṃkāre mamakāre caranti
translated: Please teach us, Sugata.

analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha evam etat bhagavan
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the Venerable Subhuti: What do you think, Subhuti? For a long time have beings wandered about in samsara through the notion of 'I' and the notion of 'mine'.🔽Subhuti said: So it is, Blessed One.

analyzed: evam etat sugata
translated: So it is, Sugata.

analyzed: dīrgharātram sattvāḥ ahaṃkāre mamakāre caranti
translated: For a long time have beings wandered about in samsara through the notion of 'I' and the notion of 'mine'.

original: bhagavānāhatatkiṃ manyase subhūte api nu ahaṃkāramamakārau śūnyau /🔽subhūtirāhaśūnyau bhagavan /
analyzed: bhagavān āha tat kim manyase subhūte api nu ahaṃkāra mamakārau śūnyau  subhūtiḥ āha śūnyau bhagavan
translated: The Blessed One said: What do you think, Subhuti? Are the notion of 'I' and the notion of 'mine' empty?🔽Subhuti said: Empty, Blessed One.

analyzed: śūnyau sugata
translated: Empty, Sugata.

original: bhagavānāhatatkiṃ manyase subhūte ahaṃkāreṇa mamakāreṇa ca sattvāḥ saṃsāre saṃsaranti /
analyzed: bhagavān āha tat kim manyase subhūte ahaṃkāreṇa mamakāreṇa ca sattvāḥ saṃsāre saṃsaranti
translated: The Blessed One said, What do you think, Subhuti, do beings wander in cyclic existence because of the notions of 'I' and 'mine'?

analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha evam etat bhagavan
translated: Subhuti said, So it is, Blessed One.

analyzed: evam etat sugata
translated: So it is, Well-Gone One.

original: ahaṃkāreṇa mamakāreṇa ca sattvāḥ saṃsāre saṃsaranti /
analyzed: ahaṃkāreṇa mamakāreṇa ca sattvāḥ saṃsāre saṃsaranti
translated: Beings wander in cyclic existence because of the notions of 'I' and 'mine'.

original: bhagavānāhaevaṃ khalu subhūte sattvānāṃ saṃkleśaḥ prajñāyate /
analyzed: bhagavān āha evam khalu subhūte sattvānām saṃkleśaḥ prajñāyate
translated: The Blessed One said, Thus, Subhuti, the defilement of beings is recognized.

analyzed: yathā sattvānām udgrahaḥ abhiniveśaḥ
translated: As there is grasping and attachment for beings,

analyzed: tathā saṃkleśaḥ
translated: so there is defilement.

analyzed: na ca atra kaścid saṃkliśyate
translated: And yet, in this there is no one who is defiled.

analyzed: yathā ca subhūte anudgahaḥ ūna abhiniveśaḥ
translated: And, Subhuti, as there is no grasping and no attachment,

analyzed: tathā na ahaṃkāra mamakārau prajñāyete
translated: so the notions of 'I' and 'mine' are not recognized.

original: evaṃ khalu subhūte sarvasattvānāṃ vyavadānaṃ prajñāyate /
analyzed: evam khalu subhūte sarva sattvānām vyavadānam prajñāyate
translated: Thus, Subhuti, the purification of all beings is recognized.

analyzed: yathā sattvānām anudgrahaḥ ūna abhiniveśaḥ
translated: As there is no grasping and no attachment for beings,

analyzed: tathā vyavadānam
translated: so there is purification.

analyzed: na ca atra kaścid vyavadāyati
translated: And yet, in this there is no one who is purified.

original: evaṃ khalu subhūte caran bodhisattvo mahāsattvaścarati prajñāpāramitāyām /
analyzed: evam khalu subhūte caran bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: Thus, Subhuti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices in this way practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: evaṃ khalu subhūte sarvadharmeṣu vivikteṣu sarvadharmeṣu śūnyeṣu sattvānāṃ saṃkleśo vyavadānaṃ ca prajñāyate /
analyzed: evam khalu subhūte sarva dharmeṣu vivikteṣu sarva dharmeṣu śūnyeṣu sattvānām saṃkleśaḥ vyavadānam ca prajñāyate
translated: Thus, Subhuti, in all dharmas which are isolated, in all dharmas which are empty, the defilement and purification of beings is seen.

original: subhūtirāhaāścaryaṃ bhagavan yāvadyadidaṃ sarvadharmeṣu vivikteṣu sarvadharmeṣu śūnyeṣu sattvānāṃ saṃkleśo vyavadānaṃ ca prajñāyate /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha āścaryam bhagavan yāvat yat idam sarva dharmeṣu vivikteṣu sarva dharmeṣu śūnyeṣu sattvānām saṃkleśaḥ vyavadānam ca prajñāyate
translated: Subhuti said: It is wonderful, O Lord, that in all dharmas which are isolated, in all dharmas which are empty, the defilement and purification of beings is seen.

original: evaṃ ca bhagavaṃścaran bodhisattvo mahāsattvaścarati prajñāpāramitāyām /
analyzed: evam ca bhagavan caran bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: And thus, O Lord, the Bodhisattva, the great being, courses in the perfection of wisdom.

original: evaṃ hi caran bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na rūpe carati /🔽na vedanāyāṃ na saṃjñāyāṃ na saṃskāreṣu /
analyzed: evam hi caran bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na rūpe carati  na vedanāyām na saṃjñāyām na saṃskāreṣu
translated: Thus coursing, the Bodhisattva, the great being, does not course in form,

analyzed: na vijñāne carati
translated: does not course in feeling, perception, impulse, or consciousness.

original: evaṃ caran bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'navamardanīyo bhavati sadevamānuṣāsureṇa lokena /
analyzed: evam caran bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na avamardanīyaḥ bhavati sa deva mānuṣa asureṇa lokena
translated: Thus coursing, the Bodhisattva, the great being, is not overcome by the world with its gods, men, and Asuras.

original: evaṃ caran bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarveṣāṃ śrāvakayānikānāṃ pratyekabuddhayānikānāṃ ca pudgalānāṃ caryāmabhibhavati /
analyzed: evam caran bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarveṣām śrāvaka yānikānām pratyekabuddha yānikānām ca pudgalānām caryām abhibhavati
translated: Thus coursing, the Bodhisattva, the great being, surpasses all the world with its gods, men, and Asuras.

analyzed: an abhibhūtam ca sthānam pratilabhate
translated: He obtains a position which is not common to all.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: anabhibhūtaṃ hi bhagavan buddhatvaṃ tathāgatatvaṃ svayaṃbhūtvaṃ sarvajñatvam /
analyzed: an abhibhūtam hi bhagavan buddha tvam tathāgata tvam svayaṃbhū tvam sarvajña tvam
translated: Because, Blessed One, Buddhahood, Tathāgatahood, Self-Arisenhood, and Omniscience are not overwhelmed.

original: anenāpi bhagavan manasikāreṇa prajñāpāramitāpratisaṃyuktena vihāreṇa viharan bodhisattvo mahāsattvo rātriṃdinānyatināmayet /
analyzed: anena api bhagavat manasikāreṇa prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktena vihāreṇa viharan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ rātriṃdināni atināmayet
translated: Blessed One, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who spends day and night with this mental activity, dwelling in union with the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: āsannaḥ syāt anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: would be close to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

analyzed: kṣipram ca anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeta
translated: And would quickly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat evam etat subhūte evam etat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti, So it is, Subhūti, it is so!

original: evaṃ caran subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaścarati prajñāpāramitāyām /
analyzed: evam caran subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices like this practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: evaṃ hi caran subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na rūpe carati /🔽na vedanāyāṃ na saṃjñāyāṃ na saṃskāreṣu /
analyzed: evam hi caran subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na rūpe carati  na vedanāyām na saṃjñāyām na saṃskāreṣu
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices like this does not practice in form.

analyzed: na vijñāne carati
translated: He does not practice in feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.🔽He does not practice in the eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, or mind.

original: evaṃ caran subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'navamardanīyo bhavati sadevamānuṣāsureṇa lokena /
analyzed: evam caran subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na avamardanīyaḥ bhavati sa deva mānuṣa asureṇa lokena
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices like this cannot be crushed by the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: evaṃ caran subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarveṣāṃ śrāvakayānikānāṃ pratyekabuddhayānikānāṃ ca pudgalānāṃ caryāmabhibhavati /
analyzed: evam caran subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarveṣām śrāvaka yānikānām pratyekabuddha yānikānām ca pudgalānām caryām abhibhavati
translated: Subhuti, a Bodhisattva-Mahasattva who practices like this surpasses the practice of all the Shravaka-Yana and Pratyekabuddha-Yana individuals.

analyzed: an abhibhūtam ca sthānam pratilabhate
translated: And he attains the unsurpassed state.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: anabhibhūtaṃ hi subhūte buddhatvaṃ tathāgatatvaṃ svayaṃbhūtvaṃ sarvajñatvam /
analyzed: an abhibhūtam hi subhūte buddha tvam tathāgata tvam svayaṃbhū tvam sarvajña tvam
translated: Subhuti, Buddhahood, Tathagatahood, Self-Existent Onehood, and Omniscience are unsurpassed.

original: anenāpi subhūte manasikāreṇa prajñāpāramitāpratisaṃyuktena vihāreṇa viharan bodhisattvo mahāsattvo rātriṃdinānyatināmayet /🔽āsannaḥ syādanuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /
analyzed: anena api subhūte manasikāreṇa prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktena vihāreṇa viharan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ rātriṃdināni atināmayet  āsannaḥ syāt anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: Subhuti, a Bodhisattva-Mahasattva who dwells with this kind of mental activity connected with the perfection of wisdom, who dwells with this kind of dwelling, spends his days and nights.🔽He would be close to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: kṣipram ca anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeta
translated: And he would quickly fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: sacetkhalu punaḥ subhūte ye jambūdvīpe sattvāḥ /
analyzed: saced khalu punar subhūte ye jambūdvīpe sattvāḥ
translated: Subhuti, if all the beings in Jambudvipa

analyzed: te sarvepūrvācaramam mānuṣyakam ātmabhāvam pratilabheran
translated: were to obtain a human body for the first and last time,

analyzed: mānuṣyakam ātma bhāvam pratilabhya anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayeran
translated: and having obtained a human body, were to arouse the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

analyzed: anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādya yāvajjīvam tiṣṭheyuḥ
translated: and having generated the thought of highest, complete enlightenment, they would remain for as long as they live.

original: yāvajjīvaṃ tiṣṭhanto yāvajjīvaṃ sarvatathāgatān satkuryurgurukuryurmānayeyuḥ pūjayeyurarcayeyurapacāyeyuḥ /
analyzed: yāvajjīvam tiṣṭhantaḥ yāvajjīvam sarva tathāgatān satkuryuḥ gurukuryuḥ mānayeyuḥ pūjayeyuḥ arcayeyuḥ apacāyeyuḥ
translated: And while remaining for as long as they live, they would honor, revere, respect, and worship all the Tathāgatas for as long as they live.

analyzed: evam sarva sattvebhyaḥ api dānam dadyuḥ
translated: In the same way, they would give gifts to all sentient beings.

analyzed: tat ca dānam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayeyuḥ
translated: And they would dedicate that gift to highest, complete enlightenment.

original: tatkiṃ manyase subhūte api nu te bodhisattvā mahāsattvāstatonidānaṃ bahu puṇyaṃ prasaveyuḥ /
analyzed: tat kim manyase subhūte api nu te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ tatonidānam bahu puṇyam prasaveyuḥ
translated: What do you think, Subhūti? Would those bodhisattva mahāsattvas generate a lot of merit on that basis?

analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha bahu bhagavan
translated: Subhūti said, A lot, Blessed One.

analyzed: bahu sugata
translated: A lot, Sugata.

original: bhagavānāhaataḥ khalu punaḥ subhūte sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati /
analyzed: bhagavān āha atas khalu punar subhūte sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā bahutaram puṇyam prasavati
translated: The Blessed One said, Subhūti, for this reason, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family generates even more merit.

analyzed: yaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ untataḥ eka divasam api prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ viharati
translated: That bodhisattva mahāsattva who dwells for even one day with mental activities connected with the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: yathā yathā hi subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāpratisaṃyuktairmanasikārai rātriṃdivaṃ viharati /
analyzed: yathā yathā hi subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ rātriṃdivam viharati
translated: As a bodhisattva mahāsattva dwells day and night with mental activities connected with the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: tathā tathā sarva sattvānām dakṣiṇīya tām gacchati
translated: to that extent he becomes worthy of offerings from all beings.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi subhūte nāsti tadanyeṣāṃ sattvānāṃ tādṛśaṃ maitrīsahagataṃ cittam /
analyzed: tathā hi subhūte na asti tad anyeṣām sattvānām tādṛśam maitrī sahagatam cittam
translated: Subhūti, it is because there is no such mind endowed with friendliness in other beings,

analyzed: yathā tasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya
translated: like that of that bodhisattva mahāsattva.

analyzed: sthāpayitvā buddhān bhagavataḥ
translated: Except for the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ  apratipudgalāḥ hi subhūte tathāgatāḥ
translated: Why is that?🔽Subhūti, the Tathāgatas are without a peer.

analyzed: nirupamāḥ hi subhūte tathāgatāḥ
translated: Subhūti, the Tathāgatas are incomparable.

original: acintyadharmasamanvāgatā hi subhūte tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ //
analyzed: acintya dharma samanvāgatāḥ hi subhūte tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: Subhūti, the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones are endowed with inconceivable qualities.

original: kathaṃ ca subhūte sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tāvattatpuṇyamabhinirharati /
analyzed: katham ca subhūte sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tāvat tat puṇyam abhinirharati
translated: And how, Subhūti, does that son of a good family or daughter of a good family generate that much merit?

original: tādṛśyā subhūte prajñayā samanvāgataḥ sa bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhavati /
analyzed: tādṛśyā subhūte prajñayā samanvāgataḥ sa bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhavati
translated: Subhūti, that bodhisattva mahāsattva becomes endowed with such wisdom.

original: yādṛśyā prajñayā samanvāgato vadhyagatāniva sarvasattvān paśyati /
analyzed: yādṛśyā prajñayā samanvāgataḥ vadhya gatān iva sarva sattvān paśyati
translated: With such wisdom he sees all beings as if they were being led to the slaughter.

analyzed: tena tasyām velāyām mahā karuṇā parigṛhītaḥ bhavati
translated: At that time, he is embraced by great compassion.

original: sa divyena cakṣuṣā vyavalokayan aprameyānasaṃkhyeyānaparimeyānaparimāṇān sattvānānantaryakarmasamanvāgatān paśyati /
analyzed: sa divyena cakṣuṣā vyavalokayan aprameyān asaṃkhyeyān aparimeyān aparimāṇān sattvān ānantarya karma samanvāgatān paśyati
translated: Looking with the divine eye, he sees immeasurable, incalculable, unfathomable, limitless beings who possess the karma for immediate [rebirth in the hells],

original: akṣaṇaprāptāṃśca vihanyamānāṃśca dṛṣṭijālapraticchannāṃśca mārgamapratilabhamānān /🔽aparāṃśca kṣaṇaprāptān paśyati /
analyzed: akṣaṇa prāptān ca vihanyamānān ca dṛṣṭi jāla praticchannān ca mārgam a pratilabhamānān  aparān ca kṣaṇa prāptān paśyati
translated: who have attained unfavorable [rebirths], who are being harmed, who are covered by the net of views, who do not obtain the path,🔽and he sees others who have attained favorable [rebirths].

analyzed: kṣaṇān ca virāgayataḥ paśyati
translated: He sees those who are detached from the favorable [rebirths].

original: tasya tasyāṃ velāyāṃ mahān saṃvega utpadyate /
analyzed: tasya tasyām velāyām mahān saṃvegaḥ utpadyate
translated: At that time, a great sense of urgency arises in him.

original: te cāsya sarvasattvāstayā mahāmaitryā tayā ca mahākaruṇayā sphāritvā manasikṛtā bhavantiahameteṣāṃ sarveṣāṃ sattvānāṃ nātho bhaviṣyāmi /
analyzed: te ca asya sarva sattvāḥ tayā mahā maitryā tayā ca mahā karuṇayā sphāritvā manasi kṛtāḥ bhavanti aham eteṣām sarveṣām sattvānām nāthaḥ bhaviṣyāmi
translated: And those beings of his, pervaded by that great friendliness and that great compassion, become objects of his attention. I shall be the protector of all those beings.

analyzed: aham enān sarva sattvān sarva duḥkhebhyaḥ mocayiṣyāmi iti
translated: I shall liberate all those beings from all suffering.

original: na ca tena vā anyena vā nimittena sārdhaṃ saṃvasati /
analyzed: na ca tena vā anyena vā nimittena sārdham saṃvasati
translated: And he does not dwell together with that or any other sign.

original: ayamapi subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahān prajñāloko'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃboddhum /
analyzed: ayam api subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahān prajñā lokaḥ unuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhum
translated: This, too, is a great light of wisdom for a bodhisattva great being to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: anena hi subhūte vihāreṇa viharanto bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ sarvalokasya dakṣiṇīyatāṃ parigṛhṇanti /
analyzed: anena hi subhūte vihāreṇa viharantaḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ sarva lokasya dakṣiṇīya tām parigṛhṇanti
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who live with this kind of dwelling take hold of being worthy of offerings from the whole world.

analyzed: na ca vivartante in uttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: And they do not turn back from unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: yeṣāṃ ca dāyakānāṃ dānapatīnāṃ ca paribhuñjate cīvarapiṇḍapātaśayanāsanaglānapratyayabhaiṣajyapariṣkārān /
analyzed: yeṣām ca dāyakānām dānapatīnām ca paribhuñjate cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkārān
translated: And they enjoy the Dharma robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, medicines for curing the sick, and other personal belongings of those donors and patrons.

analyzed: asyām prajñāpāramitāyām su upasthita cittāḥ
translated: With their minds well-established in this perfection of wisdom,

original: teṣāṃ dāyakānāṃ dānapatīnāṃ ca dānadakṣiṇāṃ viśodhayanti /
analyzed: teṣām dāyakānām dānapatīnām ca dāna dakṣiṇām viśodhayanti
translated: they purify the generosity and offerings of those donors and patrons.

analyzed: sarvajña tā ca eṣām āsannībhavati
translated: And they come close to omniscience.

original: tasmāttarhi subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena amoghaṃ rāṣṭraṃ piṇḍaṃ paribhoktukāmena sarvasattvānāṃ mārgamupadeṣṭukāmena vipulamavabhāsaṃ kartukāmena saṃsāragatān sattvān saṃsārātparimocayitukāmena sarvasattvānāṃ cakṣurviśodhayitukāmena anena prajñāpāramitāpratisaṃyuktena manasikāreṇa vihartavyam /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena amogham rāṣṭram piṇḍam paribhoktu kāmena sarva sattvānām mārgam upadeṣṭu kāmena vipulam avabhāsam kartu kāmena saṃsāra gatān sattvān saṃsārāt parimocayitu kāmena sarva sattvānām cakṣuḥ viśodhayitu kāmena anena prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktena manasikāreṇa vihartavyam
translated: Therefore, Subhuti, a Bodhisattva, a great being, who wishes to enjoy the alms of a country without fail, who wishes to teach the path to all beings, who wishes to make a vast illumination, who wishes to liberate beings in the world from the world, who wishes to purify the eye of all beings, should dwell with this thought associated with the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: saced anena manasikāreṇa vihartum icchati
translated: If he wishes to dwell with this thought,

analyzed: tena prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktāḥ manasikārāḥ samanvāhartavyāḥ
translated: he should concentrate on thoughts associated with the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: yaḥ hi enān samanvāhartavyān maṃsyate
translated: For he who will concentrate on them,

analyzed: saḥ eva asya manasikāraḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: that itself will be his thought.

analyzed: tatonyeṣām manasikārāṇām prajñāpāramitā virahitānām avakāśaḥ na dātavyaḥ
translated: Then no opportunity should be given to other thoughts devoid of the perfection of wisdom.

original: tathā ca kartavyaṃ yathāyaṃ prajñāpāramitāpratisaṃyuktairmanasikārai rātriṃdivāni kṣapayet /
analyzed: tathā ca kartavyam yathā ayam prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ rātriṃdivāni kṣapayet
translated: And he should act in such a way that he may spend the days and nights with thoughts associated with the perfection of wisdom.

original: tadyathāpi nāma subhūte kenacideva puruṣeṇa maṇiratnajñāne vartamānena maṇiratnajātijñena apratilabdhapūrvaṃ mahāmaṇiratnaṃ pratilabdhaṃ bhavet
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma subhūte kenacid eva puruṣeṇa maṇi ratna jñāne vartamānena maṇi ratna jāti jñena a pratilabdha pūrvam mahā maṇi ratnam pratilabdham bhavet
translated: For example, Subhuti, suppose a certain man, skilled in the knowledge of precious gems, having obtained a great precious gem, which he had not obtained before,

original: sa tanmahāmaṇiratnaṃ pratilabhya mahatodāreṇa prītiprāmodyena samanvāgato bhavet /
analyzed: sa tat mahā maṇi ratnam pratilabhya mahatā udāreṇa prīti prāmodyena samanvāgataḥ bhavet
translated: would be endowed with great, vast joy and gladness.

analyzed: tasya tat mahā maṇi ratnam punar eva praṇaśyet
translated: And that great precious gem would be lost again.

analyzed: sa tatonidānam mahatā duḥkha daurmanasyena saṃyujyeta
translated: He would be joined with great suffering and sorrow on that account.

original: tasya satatasamitaṃ tanmahāmaṇiratnaṃ prati saṃyuktā eva manasikārāḥ pravarteranaho batāhaṃ tena mahāmaṇiratnena viprayukta iti hi sa puruṣastasya mahāmaṇiratnasya na vismaret yāvat tadvā anyadvā tadguṇaṃ tajjātikaṃ tena mahāmaṇiratnaṃ pratilabdhaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: tasya satata samitam tat mahā maṇi ratnam prati saṃyuktāḥ eva manasikārāḥ pravarteran aho bata aham tena mahā maṇi ratnena viprayuktaḥ iti hi sa puruṣaḥ tasya mahā maṇi ratnasya na vismaret yāvat tat vā anyat vā tad guṇam tad jātikam tena mahā maṇi ratnam pratilabdham bhavet
translated: And his thoughts would constantly and always be occupied with that great precious gem: 'Alas, I am separated from that great precious gem.' For that man would not forget that great precious gem, or its qualities, or its kind, until he had obtained that great precious gem or another of the same quality.

original: evameva subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāmahāmaṇiratnaparibhraṣṭena mahāmaṇiratnaparibhraṣṭeneva mahāmaṇiratnena ratnasaṃjñinā prajñāpāramitāmanasikārāviprayuktena prajñāpāramitāmanasikārāvirahitasarvajñatācittena tāvadanveṣṭavyā /🔽yāvatsā vā anyā vā pratilabdhā bhavati /
analyzed: evam eva subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā mahā maṇi ratna paribhraṣṭena mahā maṇi ratna paribhraṣṭena iva mahā maṇi ratnena ratna saṃjñinā prajñāpāramitā manasikāra a viprayuktena prajñāpāramitā manasikāra a virahita sarvajña tā cittena tāvat anveṣṭavyā  yāvat sā vai anyā vā pratilabdhā bhavati
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who has fallen away from the great jewel of the perfection of wisdom should seek it as long as he has not obtained that or another great jewel, thinking of it as a great jewel, not separated from the attention of the perfection of wisdom, not separated from the thought of omniscience.

analyzed: tāvat tena prajñāpāramitā mahā maṇi ratna pratilambha pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ sarvajña tā mahā maṇi ratna pratilambha pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ avirahitena bhavitavyam
translated: As long as he has not obtained that or another great jewel, he should not be separated from the attention connected with the acquisition of the great jewel of the perfection of wisdom, from the attention connected with the acquisition of the great jewel of omniscience.

original: subhūtirāhayatpunarbhagavan sarvadharmāḥ sarvamanasikārāḥ svabhāvena virahitāḥ śūnyā uktā bhagavatā /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha yat punar bhagavan sarva dharmāḥ sarva manasikārāḥ svabhāvena virahitāḥ śūnyāḥ uktāḥ bhagavatā
translated: Subhūti said, But, Blessed One, all dharmas and all mental activities are said by the Blessed One to be empty, devoid of intrinsic nature.

original: tatkathaṃ bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāpratisaṃyuktairmanasikāraiḥ sarvajñatāpratisaṃyuktairmanasikārairavirahito bhavati /
analyzed: tat katham bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ sarvajña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ avirahitaḥ bhavati
translated: So, Blessed One, how is a bodhisattva mahāsattva not separated from the attention connected with the perfection of wisdom and the attention connected with omniscience?

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocatsacetsubhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattva evaṃ manasi karotisarvadharmāḥ svabhāvena viviktāḥ /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat saced subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ evam manasi karoti sarva dharmāḥ svabhāvena viviktāḥ
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the Venerable Subhuti, Subhuti, if a bodhisattva mahasattva directs his mind thus: 'All dharmas are intrinsically isolated,'

analyzed: sarva dharmāḥ svabhāvena śūnyāḥ iti
translated: 'All dharmas are intrinsically empty,'

analyzed: evam etat manasi kurvan prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ sarvajña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ avirahitaḥ bhavati
translated: directing his mind thus, he is never separated from the mental activities associated with the perfection of wisdom, the mental activities associated with omniscience.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

analyzed: prajñāpāramitā hi subhūte śūnyā
translated: Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is empty.

analyzed: sā na eva vivardhate
translated: It does not increase.

analyzed: na ca parihīyate
translated: And it does not decrease.

analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha saced bhagavan prajñāpāramitā śūnyā
translated: Subhuti said, Blessed One, if the perfection of wisdom is empty,

original: sā naiva vivardhate na ca parihīyate /🔽kathaṃ bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'vivardhamānayā prajñāpāramitayā bodhaye samudāgacchati /
analyzed: sā na eva vivardhate na ca parihīyate  katham bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ vivardhamānayā prajñāpāramitayā bodhaye samudāgacchati
translated: it does not increase and it does not decrease.🔽Blessed One, how does a bodhisattva mahasattva, with the perfection of wisdom that does not increase, come to full realization for the sake of awakening?

analyzed: katham ca anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate
translated: And how does he fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment?

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocatna khalu punaḥ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran vivardhate vā parihīyate vā /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat na khalu punar subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran vivardhate vā parihīyate vā
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhuti, Subhuti, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom does not increase or decrease.

analyzed: yathā eva subhūte prajñāpāramitā śūnyā
translated: Just as, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is empty,

original: sā naiva vivardhate na ca parihīyate /
analyzed: sā na eva vivardhate na ca parihīyate
translated: it does not increase or decrease.

analyzed: evam eva subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ śūnyaḥ
translated: In the same way, Subhuti, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva is empty.

analyzed: sa na eva vivardhate
translated: He does not increase

analyzed: na ca parihīyate
translated: and does not decrease.

analyzed: yatas subhūte yathā eva prajñāpāramitā śūnyā
translated: Subhuti, because just as the perfection of wisdom is empty,

original: sā naiva vivardhate na ca parihīyate /
analyzed: sā na eva vivardhate na ca parihīyate
translated: it does not increase or decrease,

analyzed: evam eva subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ śūnyaḥ
translated: in the same way, Subhuti, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva is empty.

analyzed: sa na eva vivardhate
translated: He does not increase

analyzed: na ca parihīyate
translated: and does not decrease.

analyzed: tatas bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bodhaye samudāgacchati
translated: Therefore, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva comes to enlightenment.

analyzed: evam ca anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate
translated: And thus he fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: sacetsubhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ evaṃ bhāṣyamāṇe notrasyati na saṃtrasyati na saṃtrāsamāpadyate na saṃsīdati /
analyzed: saced subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ evam bhāṣyamāṇe na utrasyati na saṃtrasyati na saṃtrāsam āpadyate na saṃsīdati
translated: Subhuti, if a bodhisattva-mahāsattva, when this is being taught, is not frightened, does not tremble, does not become terrified, does not become cowed,

analyzed: veditavyam etat subhūte carati ayam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām iti
translated: Subhūti, it should be known that this bodhisattva mahāsattva is practicing the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha kim punar bhagavan prajñāpāramitā carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: Subhūti said, Again, Blessed One, does the perfection of wisdom practice the perfection of wisdom?

original: bhagavānāhano hīdaṃ subhūte /🔽āhakiṃ punarbhagavan yā prajñāpāramitāyāḥ śūnyatā /
analyzed: bhagavān āha no hi idam subhūte  āha kim punar bhagavan yā prajñāpāramitāyāḥ śūnyatā
translated: The Blessed One said, No, Subhūti.

analyzed: sā carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: He said, Again, Blessed One, is that emptiness of the perfection of wisdom practicing the perfection of wisdom?

original: bhagavānāhano hīdaṃ subhūte /🔽āhakiṃ punarbhagavan anyatra prajñāpāramitāśūnyatāyāḥ sa kaściddharma upalabhyate /
analyzed: bhagavān āha no hi idam subhūte  āha kim punar bhagavan anyatra prajñāpāramitā śūnyatāyāḥ sa kaścid dharmaḥ upalabhyate
translated: The Blessed One said, No, Subhūti.

analyzed: yaḥ carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: He said, Again, Blessed One, is any dharma whatsoever found apart from the emptiness of the perfection of wisdom, which practices the perfection of wisdom?

original: kaḥ punarvādo ye śrutvā udgṛhya dhārayitvā vācayitvā paryavāpya pravartya deśayitvopadiśyoddiśya svādhyāyya likhitvā tathatvāya śikṣiṣyante /🔽tathatvāya pratipatsyante /

translated: How much more so for those who, having heard it, will take it up, bear it in mind, recite it, study it, spread it, teach it, explain it, expound it, chant it, write it, and train in it as it should be trained in.🔽They will train in it as it should be trained in.

analyzed: tathatvāya yogam āpatsyante
translated: They will apply themselves to it as it should be applied to.

original: te sadevamānuṣāsuraṃ lokamabhibhavanto gamiṣyanti bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ /
analyzed: te sa deva mānuṣa asuram lokam abhibhavantaḥ gamiṣyanti bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ
translated: Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas will go surpassing the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: na kevalaṃ te sadevamānuṣāsuraṃ lokamabhibhavanto gamiṣyanti /
analyzed: na kevalam te sa deva mānuṣa asuram lokam abhibhavantaḥ gamiṣyanti
translated: Not only will they go surpassing the world with its gods, humans, and asuras,

analyzed: ye api te srotaāpannāḥ sakṛdāgāminaḥ unāgāminoḥ hantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: but also those who are stream-enterers, once-returners, non-returners, arhats, and perfectly awakened buddhas.

original: tānapi te sarvānabhibhavanto gamiṣyanti bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ /
analyzed: tān api te sarvān abhibhavantaḥ gamiṣyanti bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ
translated: Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas will go surpassing all of them.

original: na kevalaṃ srotaāpannān sakṛdāgāmino'nāgāmino'rhataḥ pratyekabuddhānabhibhavanto gamiṣyanti /
