analyzed: na kevalam srotaāpannān sakṛdāgāminaḥ unāgāminoḥ hataḥ pratyekabuddhān abhibhavantaḥ gamiṣyanti
translated: They will not only surpass the stream-enterers, once-returners, non-returners, arhats, and pratyekabuddhas.

original: ye'pi te bodhisattvā mahāsattvā mahādānapatayaḥ prajñāpāramitopāyakauśalyavirahitāḥ /
analyzed: ye api te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ mahā dānapatayaḥ prajñāpāramitā upāya kauśalya virahitāḥ
translated: Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are great donors, but are devoid of the perfection of wisdom and skillful means,

original: tānapi te sarvānabhibhavanto gamiṣyanti bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ /
analyzed: tān api te sarvān abhibhavantaḥ gamiṣyanti bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ
translated: those bodhisattva mahāsattvas will surpass them all.

original: na kevalaṃ tān mahādānapatīn bodhisattvānabhibhavanto gamiṣyanti /
analyzed: na kevalam tān mahā dānapatīn bodhisattvān abhibhavantaḥ gamiṣyanti
translated: They will not only surpass those great donors.

original: ye'pi te bodhisattvā mahāsattvā pariśuddhaśīlā akhaṇḍena śīlaskandhenācchidreṇākalmaṣeṇa paripūrṇena pariśuddhena aśabalena śīlaskandhena samanvāgatāḥ
analyzed: ye api te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ pariśuddha śīlāḥ akhaṇḍena śīla skandhena acchidreṇa akalmaṣeṇa paripūrṇena pariśuddhena aśabalena śīla skandhena samanvāgatāḥ
translated: Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have pure morality, who are endowed with the aggregate of morality that is unbroken, without holes, without blemish, complete, pure, and unadulterated,

original: tānapi te sarvānabhibhavanto gamiṣyanti bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ /
analyzed: tān api te sarvān abhibhavantaḥ gamiṣyanti bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ
translated: those bodhisattva mahāsattvas will surpass them all.

original: na kevalamakhaṇḍenācchidreṇākalmaṣeṇa paripūrṇena pariśuddhena aśabalena śīlaskandhena samanvāgatān bodhisattvān mahāsattvānabhibhavanto gamiṣyanti /
analyzed: na kevalam akhaṇḍena acchidreṇa akalmaṣeṇa paripūrṇena pariśuddhena a śabalena śīla skandhena samanvāgatān bodhisattvān mahāsattvān abhibhavantaḥ gamiṣyanti
translated: They will not only surpass the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are endowed with the aggregate of morality that is unbroken, without holes, without blemish, complete, pure, and unadulterated.

original: ye'pi te bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ kṣāntisaṃpannā upaśamasaṃpannā apratihatacittā antato dagdhasthūṇāyāmapyāghātacittaṃ notpādayanti prajñāpāramitopāyakauśalyavirahitāḥ /
analyzed: ye api te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ kṣānti saṃpannāḥ upaśama saṃpannāḥ a pratihata cittāḥ antatas dagdha sthūṇāyām api āghāta cittam na utpādayanti prajñāpāramitā upāya kauśalya virahitāḥ
translated: Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are endowed with patience, endowed with tranquility, with minds free from obstruction, who do not give rise to thoughts of anger even towards a burnt log, but are devoid of the perfection of wisdom and skillful means -

original: tānapi te sarvānabhibhavanto gamiṣyanti bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ /
analyzed: tān api te sarvān abhibhavantaḥ gamiṣyanti bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ
translated: those bodhisattva mahāsattvas will surpass them all and go beyond.

analyzed: na kevalam kṣānti saṃpanna an upaśama saṃpanna an apratihata cittān bodhisattvān mahāsattvān abhibhavantaḥ gamiṣyanti
translated: Not only will they surpass and go beyond the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are endowed with patience, endowed with tranquility, with minds free from obstruction.

original: ye'pi te bodhisattvā mahāsattvā ārabdhavīryā anikṣiptadhurā akusīdā anavalīnakāyavāṅmanaḥkarmāntāḥ prajñāpāramitopāyakauśalyavirahitāḥ /
analyzed: ye api te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ ārabdha vīryāḥ a nikṣipta dhurāḥ akusīdāḥ an avalīna kāya vāc manaḥ karmāntāḥ prajñāpāramitā upāya kauśalya virahitāḥ
translated: Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are energetic, not shirking the task, not lazy, not lax in their physical, verbal, and mental actions, but are devoid of the perfection of wisdom and skillful means -

original: tānapi te sarvānabhibhavanto gamiṣyanti bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ /
analyzed: tān api te sarvān abhibhavantaḥ gamiṣyanti bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ
translated: those bodhisattva mahāsattvas will surpass them all and go beyond.

analyzed: na kevalam ārabdha vīryān a nikṣipta dhurān a kusīdān an avalīna kāya vāc manaḥ karmāntān bodhisattvān mahāsattvān abhibhavantaḥ gamiṣyanti
translated: Not only will they surpass the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are energetic, not shirking the task, not lazy, not lax in their physical, verbal, and mental actions.

original: ye'pi te bodhisattvā mahāsattvā dhyānārāmā dhyānaratā dhyānabalino dhyānabalavanto dhyānapratiṣṭhitā dhyānavaśinaḥ prajñāpāramitopāyakauśalyavirahitāḥ /
analyzed: ye api te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ dhyāna ārāmāḥ dhyāna ratāḥ dhyāna balinaḥ dhyāna balavantaḥ dhyāna pratiṣṭhitāḥ dhyāna vaśinaḥ prajñāpāramitā upāya kauśalya virahitāḥ
translated: Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who delight in meditation, who are devoted to meditation, who are strong in meditation, who are powerful in meditation, who are established in meditation, who have mastery in meditation, but who are devoid of the perfection of wisdom and skillful means,

original: tānapi te sarvānabhibhavanto gamiṣyanti bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ /
analyzed: tān api te sarvān abhibhavantaḥ gamiṣyanti bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ
translated: those bodhisattva mahāsattvas will surpass them all.

original: yathānirdiṣṭāyāṃ hi prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sadevamānuṣāsuralokaṃ sarvān śrāvakapratyekabuddhayānikānanupāyakuśalāṃśca bodhisattvān mahāsattvānabhibhavati /
analyzed: yathā nirdiṣṭāyām hi prajñāpāramitāyām caran bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sa deva mānuṣa asura lokam sarvān śrāvaka pratyekabuddha yānikān an upāya kuśalān ca bodhisattvān mahāsattvān abhibhavati
translated: For a bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom as it has been explained, who follows the perfection of wisdom, that bodhisattva mahāsattva surpasses the world with its gods, humans, and asuras, all those in the vehicles of the hearers and solitary buddhas, and also the bodhisattvas who are not skilled in means.

analyzed: teṣām ca an abhibhūtaḥ bhavati
translated: And he is not surpassed by them.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: yo hi bodhisattvo mahāsattvo yathānirdiṣṭāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carati /
analyzed: yaḥ hi bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ yathānirdiṣṭāyām prajñāpāramitāyām carati
translated: Because the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom as it has been explained,

original: prajñāpāramitāmanuvartate /🔽ayaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvajñavaṃśasyānupacchedāya sthito bhavati /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitām anuvartate  ayam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarvajña vaṃśasya an upacchedāya sthitaḥ bhavati
translated: who follows the perfection of wisdom,🔽that bodhisattva mahāsattva remains for the non-interruption of the lineage of the Omniscient One.

analyzed: ayam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tathāgatān na dūrīkariṣyati
translated: That bodhisattva mahāsattva does not distance himself from the Tathāgatas.

original: ayaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattva evaṃ pratipadyamāno nacirādgamiṣyati bodhimaṇḍam /
analyzed: ayam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ evam pratipadyamānaḥ nacirāt gamiṣyati bodhimaṇḍam
translated: This bodhisattva mahāsattva, practicing in this way, will soon go to the seat of awakening.

original: ayaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattva evaṃ śikṣamāṇaḥ sattvān kleśapaṅke saṃsīdamānānuddhariṣyati /
analyzed: ayam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ evam śikṣamāṇaḥ sattvān kleśa paṅke saṃsīdamānān uddhariṣyati
translated: This bodhisattva mahāsattva, training in this way, will rescue beings who are sinking in the mud of afflictions.

original: ayaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattva evaṃ śikṣamāṇo bodhisattvaśikṣāyāṃ śikṣate /
analyzed: ayam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ evam śikṣamāṇaḥ bodhisattva śikṣāyām śikṣate
translated: This bodhisattva mahāsattva, training in this way, trains in the training of a bodhisattva.

analyzed: na śrāvaka śikṣāyām śikṣate
translated: He does not train in the training of a śrāvaka.

analyzed: na pratyekabuddha śikṣāyām śikṣate
translated: He does not train in the training of a pratyekabuddha.

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇaṃ ca prajñāpāramitāyāṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvaṃ catvāro lokapālā mahārājāna upasaṃkramyaivaṃ vakṣyantikṣipraṃ tvaṃ kulaputra asyāṃ bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣasva /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇam ca prajñāpāramitāyām bodhisattvam mahāsattvam catvāraḥ lokapālāḥ mahā rājānaḥ upasaṃkramya evam vakṣyanti kṣipram tvam kula putra asyām bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣasva
translated: The four great kings, the world guardians, having approached the bodhisattva mahāsattva who is training in this way in the perfection of wisdom, will say to him: 'Quickly, son of noble family, train in this bodhisattva conduct.

analyzed: laghu śikṣasva
translated: Train quickly.

original: imāni te catvāri pātrāṇi yāni tvayā bodhimaṇḍe niṣadya anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhena pratigrahītavyānīti /
analyzed: imāni te catvāri pātrāṇi yāni tvayā bodhimaṇḍe niṣadya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhena pratigrahītavyāni iti
translated: These four bowls of yours, which you will receive when you sit at the seat of awakening and attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.'

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvaṃ yathānirdiṣṭāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ na kevalaṃ catvāro lokapālā mahārājāna upasaṃkramitavyaṃ maṃsyante /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam yathā nirdiṣṭāyām prajñāpāramitāyām na kevalam catvāraḥ lokapālāḥ mahā rājānaḥ upasaṃkramitavyam maṃsyante
translated: If the Bodhisattva, the great being, who is thus instructed in the perfection of wisdom as it has been explained, if he is thus instructed in the perfection of wisdom as it has been explained, then not only will the Four Great Kings, the great kings, think of coming to him,

analyzed: aham api bhagavan tam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam upasaṃkramiṣyāmi
translated: but I also, Blessed One, will come to that Bodhisattva, the great being.

analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ tad anye deva putrāḥ
translated: How much more so the other gods!

original: tathāgatairapi so'rhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhairnityameva samanvāhṛto bhaviṣyati bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ /
analyzed: tathāgataiḥ api saḥ ūrhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ nityam eva samanvāhṛtaḥ bhaviṣyati bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: And that Bodhisattva, the great being, will always be remembered by the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the fully enlightened Buddhas.

original: evaṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carato bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya yāni kānicillaukikāni duḥkhāni paropakramikāṇi vā anyāni vā utpadyeran /
analyzed: evam prajñāpāramitāyām carataḥ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya yāni kānicid laukikāni duḥkhāni paropakramikāṇi vā anyāni vā utpadyeran
translated: For the Bodhisattva, the great being, who thus courses in the perfection of wisdom, whatever sufferings there are in the world, whether inflicted by others or whether they arise by themselves,

original: tānyasya sarveṇa sarvaṃ sarvathā sarvaṃ notpatsyante /
analyzed: tāni asya sarveṇa sarvam sarvathā sarvam na utpatsyante
translated: all of them will not arise at all, in any way, for him.

original: ayamapi bhagavan dṛṣṭadhārmiko guṇastasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carato bhavati //
analyzed: ayam api bhagavan dṛṣṭa dhārmikaḥ guṇaḥ tasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyām carataḥ bhavati
translated: This, Blessed One, is a visible good quality of that Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in the perfection of wisdom.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmata ānantasyaitadabhavatkimayaṃ śakro devānāmindraḥ svakena pratibhānena bhāṣate /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmataḥ ānantasya etat abhavat kim ayam śakraḥ devānām indraḥ svakena pratibhānena bhāṣate
translated: Then indeed this occurred to the Venerable Ānanda: Is this Śakra, Lord of the Gods, speaking through his own inspiration,

analyzed: uta aho buddha anubhāvena iti
translated: or through the Buddha's power?

original: atha khalu buddhānubhāvena śakro devānāmindra āyuṣmata ānandasya cetasaiva cetaḥparivitarkamājñāya āyuṣmantamānandametadavocatbuddhānubhāvo'yamāryānanda
analyzed: atha khalu buddha anubhāvena śakraḥ devānām indraḥ āyuṣmataḥ ānandasya cetasā eva cetaḥ parivitarkam ājñāya āyuṣmantam ānandam etat avocat buddha anubhāvaḥ yam ārya ānanda
translated: Then, through the Buddha's power, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, knowing the thought that had occurred to the Venerable Ānanda, said this to the Venerable Ānanda: This, Venerable Ānanda,

analyzed: buddha adhiṣṭhānam idam api ārya ānanda veditavyam
translated: is the Buddha's power, this is the Buddha's authority, Venerable Ānanda, it should be known.

analyzed: apratibalaḥ hi aham ārya ānanda bodhisattvān mahāsattvān ārabhya vyāhartum
translated: For I am unable, Venerable Ānanda, to speak about the bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam āmantrayate sma evam etat ānanda
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the Venerable Ānanda: So it is, Ānanda,

analyzed: evam etat yathā śakreṇa devānām indreṇa bhāṣitam  tathāgatasya eṣaḥ nubhāvaḥ
translated: so it is as Śakra, Lord of the Gods, has said.🔽This is the Tathāgata's power,

analyzed: tathāgatasya etat adhiṣṭhānam
translated: this is the Tathāgata's authority,

analyzed: yat śakreṇa devānām indreṇa bhāṣitam iti
translated: that which was spoken by Śakra, Lord of the Gods.

analyzed: ārya aṣṭasāhasrikāyām prajñāpāramitāyām śakraparivartaḥ nāma trayoviṃśatitamaḥ
translated: In the Noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines, the chapter called Śakra is the twenty-third.

analyzed: abhimāna parivartaḥ caturviṃśatitamaḥ
translated: Chapter 24: On Arrogance

original: atha khalu bhagavān punarapyāyuṣmantamānandamāmantrayate smayasmin khalu punarānanda samaye bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣate /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān punar api āyuṣmantam ānandam āmantrayate sma yasmin khalu punar ānanda samaye bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣate
translated: Then the Blessed One again addressed the Venerable Ānanda: Ānanda, when at that time the bodhisattva mahāsattva trains in the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām yogam āpadyate
translated: applies himself to the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: prajñāpāramitām bhāvayati
translated: and cultivates the perfection of wisdom,

original: tasmin ānanda samaye ye trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau mārāḥ pāpīyāṃsaḥ /
analyzed: tasmin ānanda samaye ye tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau mārāḥ pāpīyāṃsaḥ
translated: at that time, Ānanda, all the Māras, the evil ones, in the great trichiliocosm

original: te sarve saṃśayitā bhavantikimayaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'ntarā bhūtakoṭiṃ sākṣātkariṣyati śrāvakabhūmau vā pratyekabuddhabhūmau vā /
analyzed: te sarve saṃśayitāḥ bhavanti kim ayam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ antarā bhūtakoṭim sākṣātkariṣyati śrāvaka bhūmau vā pratyekabuddha bhūmau vā
translated: become doubtful, wondering whether this bodhisattva mahāsattva will directly realize the reality limit in the meantime, or the level of the śrāvakas, or the level of the pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: uta aho anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate iti
translated: Or whether he will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: punaraparamānanda tasmin samaye mārāḥ pāpīyāṃsaḥ śokaśalyaviddhā bhavanti yasmin samaye bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāvihāreṇa viharati
analyzed: punar aparam ānanda tasmin samaye mārāḥ pāpīyāṃsaḥ śoka śalya viddhāḥ bhavanti yasmin samaye bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitā vihāreṇa viharati
translated: Moreover, Ānanda, at that time the Māras, the evil ones, become pierced by the dart of sorrow when the bodhisattva mahāsattva dwells by means of the dwelling in the perfection of wisdom.

original: punaraparamānanda yasmin samaye bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carati /🔽prajñāpāramitāyāṃ yogamāpadyate /
analyzed: punar aparam ānanda yasmin samaye bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām carati  prajñāpāramitāyām yogam āpadyate
translated: Moreover, Ananda, at whatever time a bodhisattva mahāsattva practices the perfection of wisdom,🔽strives in the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: prajñāpāramitām bhāvayati
translated: cultivates the perfection of wisdom,

original: tasmin samaye mārāḥ pāpīyāṃso bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya viheṭhāmupasaṃharanti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye mārāḥ pāpīyāṃsaḥ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya viheṭhām upasaṃharanti
translated: at that time the evil Māras create obstacles for the bodhisattva mahāsattva.

analyzed: bhayam saṃjanayanti
translated: They generate fear.

analyzed: ulkā pātān diśi diśi utsṛjanti
translated: They hurl meteors in all directions.

original: digdāhānupadarśayantiapyeva nāma ayaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'valīyeta vā romaharṣo vā asya bhavet /
analyzed: digdāhān upadarśayanti api eva nāma ayam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ vā alīyeta vā romaharṣaḥ vā asya bhavet
translated: They display conflagrations, thinking 'Perhaps this bodhisattva mahāsattva will cower or his hair will stand on end,

analyzed: yena asya eka citta utpādaḥ api kṣīyeta anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodheḥ iti
translated: so that even a single thought of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment will be destroyed.'

original: tatra ānanda na sarvasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya māraḥ pāpīyānupasaṃkrāmati viheṭhanābhiprāyaḥ /🔽api tu kasyacidupasaṃkrāmati /
analyzed: tatra ānanda na sarvasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya māraḥ pāpīyān upasaṃkrāmati viheṭhana abhiprāyaḥ  api tu kasyacid upasaṃkrāmati
translated: There, Ānanda, Māra the evil one does not approach all bodhisattva mahāsattvas with the intention to harm.🔽But he approaches some,

analyzed: kasyacid na upasaṃkrāmati
translated: and he does not approach others.

original: ānanda āhakiyadrūpasya bhagavan bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya upasaṃkrāmati māraḥ pāpīyān viheṭhanābhiprāyaḥ /🔽bhagavānāhayena ānanda bodhisattvena mahāsattvena pūrvāntataḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāyāmadhimukticittaṃ notpāditaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: ānandaḥ āha kiyat rūpasya bhagavan bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya upasaṃkrāmati māraḥ pāpīyān viheṭhana abhiprāyaḥ  bhagavān āha yena ānanda bodhisattvena mahāsattvena pūrva antataḥ prajñāpāramitāyām bhāṣyamāṇāyām adhimukti cittam na utpāditam bhavati
translated: Ananda said, Blessed One, what kind of bodhisattva-mahāsattva does Māra, the evil one, approach with the intention to harm?

original: asya ānanda bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya māraḥ pāpīyānupasaṃkrāmati viheṭhanābhiprāyaḥ /
analyzed: asya ānanda bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya māraḥ pāpīyān upasaṃkrāmati viheṭhana abhiprāyaḥ
translated: The Blessed One said, Ananda, Māra, the evil one, approaches with the intention to harm that bodhisattva-mahāsattva who has not given rise to the mind of faith in the perfection of wisdom when it was being taught in the past.

analyzed: avatāram ca asya labhate
translated: Ananda, he finds an opportunity to harm him.

original: punaraparamānanda yo bodhisattvo mahāsattvo gambhīrāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāyāṃ saṃśayaprāpto bhavati /
analyzed: punar aparam ānanda yaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām bhāṣyamāṇāyām saṃśaya prāptaḥ bhavati
translated: Moreover, Ananda, that bodhisattva-mahāsattva who becomes doubtful when the profound perfection of wisdom is being taught,

analyzed: vimatim utpādayati syāt vā iyam prajñāpāramitā
translated: and gives rise to uncertainty, thinking Is this the perfection of wisdom?

analyzed: evam na vā syāt iti
translated: Or is it not?

original: asyāpyānanda bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya māraḥ pāpīyānupasaṃkrāmati viheṭhanābhiprāyaḥ /
analyzed: asya api ānanda bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya māraḥ pāpīyān upasaṃkrāmati viheṭhana abhiprāyaḥ
translated: Ananda, Māra, the evil one, also approaches with the intention to harm that bodhisattva-mahāsattva.

analyzed: avatāram ca asya labhate
translated: And he finds an opportunity to harm him.

original: punaraparamānanda yo bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ kalyāṇamitravirahito bhavati /
analyzed: punar aparam ānanda yaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ kalyāṇa mitra virahitaḥ bhavati
translated: Moreover, Ananda, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who is separated from a spiritual friend,

analyzed: pāpa mitra parigṛhītaḥ ca bhavati
translated: and is seized by evil friends,

original: sa gambhīrāṇi gambhīrāṇi sthānāni prajñāpāramitāyāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāyāṃ na śṛṇoti /
analyzed: sa gambhīrāṇi gambhīrāṇi sthānāni prajñāpāramitāyām bhāṣyamāṇāyām na śṛṇoti
translated: he does not hear the profound and profound topics when the perfection of wisdom is being taught.

analyzed: a śṛṇvan na jānāti
translated: Not hearing, he does not know.

analyzed: a jānan na paripṛcchati katham prajñāpāramitā bhāvayitavyā iti
translated: Not knowing, he does not ask how the perfection of wisdom should be cultivated.

original: asyāpyānanda bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya māraḥ pāpīyānupasaṃkrāmati viheṭhanābhiprāyaḥ /
analyzed: asya api ānanda bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya māraḥ pāpīyān upasaṃkrāmati viheṭhana abhiprāyaḥ
translated: For this bodhisattva-mahāsattva also, Ananda, Māra, the evil one, approaches with the intention to harm,

analyzed: avatāram ca asya labhate
translated: and finds an opportunity to harm him.

original: punaraparamānanda yo bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'saddharmaparigrāhakamālīno bhavatieṣa mama sahāyakaḥ /
analyzed: punar aparam ānanda yaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattva ūsaddharma parigrāhaka mālīnaḥ bhavati eṣa mama sahāyakaḥ
translated: Moreover, Ananda, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who is attached to the acceptance of bad dharmas, thinking This one is my companion.

analyzed: sarva artheṣu mām na parityajati
translated: He does not abandon me in all matters.

original: bahavo'pi bodhisattvā mahāsattvā mamānye'pi sahāyakāḥ santi /
analyzed: bahavaḥ api bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ mama anye api sahāyakāḥ santi
translated: There are many other bodhisattva-mahāsattvas who are also my companions.

analyzed: na ca punar te mama abhiprāyam paripūrayanti
translated: But they do not fulfill my intentions.

original: ayaṃ tu mayā pratirūpaḥ sahāyo labdhaḥ /
analyzed: ayam tu mayā pratirūpaḥ sahāyaḥ labdhaḥ
translated: But this one has been found by me to be a suitable companion.

analyzed: ayam mama abhiprāyam paripūrayiṣyati
translated: This one will fulfill my intentions.

original: asyāpyānanda bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya māraḥ pāpīyānupasaṃkrāmati viheṭhanābhiprāyaḥ /
analyzed: asya api ānanda bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya māraḥ pāpīyān upasaṃkrāmati viheṭhana abhiprāyaḥ
translated: Ananda, Mara, the evil one, also approaches this Ananda Bodhisattva Mahasattva with the intention of harming him,

analyzed: avatāram ca asya labhate
translated: and finds an opportunity to harm him.

original: punaraparamānanda yo bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'syāṃ gambhīrāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāyāmanyaṃ bodhisattvamevaṃ vadetgambhīrā bateyaṃ prajñāpāramitā
analyzed: punar aparam ānanda yaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ usyām gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām bhāṣyamāṇāyām anyam bodhisattvam evam vadet gambhīrā bata iyam prajñāpāramitā
translated: Moreover, Ananda, if a Bodhisattva Mahasattva, when this profound perfection of wisdom is being taught, were to say to another Bodhisattva: 'Oh! This perfection of wisdom is indeed profound!

analyzed: kim tava enayā śrutayā
translated: What is the use of listening to it?

original: na hyevamatra yujyamānamanyeṣu sūtrānteṣu yathā tathāgatena bhāṣitam /
analyzed: na hi evam atra yujyamānam anyeṣu sūtrānteṣu yathā tathāgatena bhāṣitam
translated: It is not taught in this way in other sutras, as taught by the Tathagata.

analyzed: aham api asyām agādham āsvādam na labhe
translated: I myself do not find any deep taste in it.

analyzed: kim tava enayā śrutayā likhitayā vā iti
translated: What is the use of listening to it or writing it down?'

analyzed: evam anyān api bodhisattvān mahāsattvān vivecayate
translated: In this way, he causes other Bodhisattvas to be separated from it.

original: asyāpyānanda bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya māraḥ pāpīyānupasaṃkrāmati viheṭhanābhiprāyaḥ /
analyzed: asya api ānanda bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya māraḥ pāpīyān upasaṃkrāmati viheṭhana abhiprāyaḥ
translated: Ananda, Mara, the evil one, also approaches this Bodhisattva Mahasattva with the intention of harming him,

analyzed: avatāram ca asya labhate
translated: and finds an opportunity to harm him.

original: punaraparamānanda yasmin samaye bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'nyān bodhisattvānavamanyateahaṃ vivekavihāreṇa viharāmi /
analyzed: punar aparam ānanda yasmin samaye bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ anyān bodhisattvān avamanyate aham viveka vihāreṇa viharāmi
translated: Moreover, Ananda, when a bodhisattva-mahāsattva despises other bodhisattvas, thinking 'I dwell in solitude,

analyzed: na anye viveka vihāreṇa viharanti
translated: but others do not dwell in solitude,

analyzed: na anyeṣām viveka vihārāḥ saṃvidyante iti
translated: others do not have the practice of solitude,'

original: tasminnānanda samaye māraḥ pāpīyāṃstuṣṭa udagra āttamanāḥ pramuditaḥ prītisaumanasyajāto bhavati /
analyzed: tasmin ānanda samaye māraḥ pāpīyān tuṣṭaḥ udagraḥ ātta manāḥ pramuditaḥ prīti saumanasya jātaḥ bhavati
translated: then, Ananda, at that time Māra the evil one becomes pleased, elated, joyful, and delighted.

analyzed: saṃharṣa jātaḥ harṣita cittaḥ prīti prāmodya jātaḥ bhavati
translated: He becomes elated, his mind is elated, he becomes joyful and jubilant.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: dūrīkaroti eṣaḥ unuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim iti
translated: Because he thinks 'This one is distancing himself from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.'

original: punaraparamānanda yasmin samaye bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya nāmagrahaṇaṃ vā gotragrahaṇaṃ vā dhutaguṇaparikīrtanaṃ vā bhavati /
analyzed: punar aparam ānanda yasmin samaye bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya nāma grahaṇam vā gotra grahaṇam vā dhuta guṇa parikīrtanam vā bhavati
translated: Moreover, Ananda, when the name or clan of a bodhisattva-mahāsattva is mentioned, or when his praise of the virtues of austerity is proclaimed,

original: evaṃ sa tāvanmātrakeṇa tato'nyān bodhisattvān mahāsattvān peśalān kalyāṇadharmaṇo'vamanyate /
analyzed: evam sa tāvanmātrakeṇa tatonyān bodhisattvān mahāsattvān peśalān kalyāṇa dharmaṇā uvamanyate
translated: he, with just that much, despises other skillful bodhisattva-mahāsattvas with wholesome qualities.

original: te ca tasya guṇā na saṃvidyante /
analyzed: te ca tasya guṇāḥ na saṃvidyante
translated: And those qualities do not exist in him.

original: ye'vinivartanīyānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caratāṃ guṇāḥ /
analyzed: bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām prajñāpāramitāyām caratām guṇāḥ
translated: Those are the qualities of the irreversible bodhisattva mahāsattvas practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: te ākārāstāni liṅgāni tāni nimittāni tasya na saṃvidyante /
analyzed: te ākārāḥ tāni liṅgāni tāni nimittāni tasya na saṃvidyante
translated: Those aspects, those signs, those indications are not found in him.

analyzed: saḥ u saṃvidyamāneṣu a vinivartanīya guṇeṣu kleśam utpādayati
translated: He, not finding the qualities of irreversibility, gives rise to afflictions.

analyzed: yat uta ātmānam utkrośayati
translated: Namely, he extols himself.

original: parān paṃsayatina khalvete teṣu dharmeṣu saṃdṛśyante /
analyzed: parān paṃsayati na khalu ete teṣu dharmeṣu saṃdṛśyante
translated: He disparages others, saying, 'Those are not seen in those dharmas,

analyzed: yatra aham saṃdṛśyaḥ iti
translated: where I am seen.'

original: tatra mārāṇāṃ pāpīyasāmevaṃ bhavati na śūnyāni mārabhavanāni bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: tatra mārāṇām pāpīyasām evam bhavati na śūnyāni māra bhavanāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: Then the evil Māras think thus: 'The abodes of Māra will not be empty.

analyzed: utsadāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will be full.

original: mahānirayāstiryañcaḥ pretaviṣayā āsurāśca kāyā utsadā bhaviṣyantīti /
analyzed: mahānirayāḥ tiryañcaḥ preta viṣayāḥ āsurāḥ ca kāyāḥ utsadāḥ bhaviṣyanti iti
translated: The great hells, the animal realm, the ghost realm, and the demon realms will be full.'

analyzed: tathā ca māraḥ pāpīyān adhiṣṭhāsyati
translated: And Māra, the evil one, will preside over them,

original: yathā te bodhisattvā mahāsattvā evaṃ pravṛttā adhyākrāntā lābhasatkāreṇa bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: yathā te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ evam pravṛttāḥ adhyākrāntāḥ lābha satkāreṇa bhaviṣyanti
translated: so that those bodhisattva mahāsattvas, engaged in that way, will be overcome by gain and honor.

analyzed: ādeya vacanāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: And they will have acceptable speech.

analyzed: te tayā ādeya vacana tayā bahu janam grāhayiṣyanti
translated: And through that acceptable speech they will convince many people.

original: teṣāṃ ca sa mahājanaḥ śrotavyaṃ śraddhātavyaṃ maṃsyate /🔽te dṛṣṭvā śrutvā ca teṣāmanukṛtimāpatsyante /
analyzed: teṣām ca sa mahā janaḥ śrotavyam śraddhātavyam maṃsyate  te dṛṣṭvā śrutvā ca teṣām anukṛtim āpatsyante
translated: And that great multitude will think that what they say should be listened to and believed in.🔽Having seen and heard that, they will imitate them.

original: te dṛṣṭaśrutānukṛtimāpadyamānā na tathatvāya śikṣiṣyante /🔽na tathatvāya pratipatsyante /
analyzed: te dṛṣṭa śruta anukṛtim āpadyamānāḥ na tathatvāya śikṣiṣyante  na tathatvāya pratipatsyante
translated: Having imitated what they have seen and heard, they will not train in accordance with reality.🔽They will not practice in accordance with reality.

analyzed: na tathatvāya yogam āpatsyante
translated: They will not apply themselves in accordance with reality.

original: evaṃ te na tathatāyāṃ śikṣamāṇā na tathatāyāṃ pratipadyamānā na tathatāyāṃ yogamāpadyamānāḥ saṃkleśaṃ vivardhayiṣyanti /
analyzed: evam te na tathatāyām śikṣamāṇāḥ na tathatāyām pratipadyamānāḥ na tathatāyām yogam āpadyamānāḥ saṃkleśam vivardhayiṣyanti
translated: Thus, not training in reality, not practicing in reality, not applying themselves in reality, they will increase their defilements.

original: evaṃ te viparyastayā cittasaṃtatyā yadyadeva karma ārapsyante kāyena vā vācā vā manasā vā /
analyzed: evam te viparyastayā citta saṃtatyā yat yat eva karma ārapsyante kāyena vā vācā vā manasā vā
translated: Thus, with their mind-streams distorted, whatever action they undertake by body, speech, or mind

analyzed: tat sarvam anirdiṣṭa tvāya akānta tvāya apriya tvāya amanaāpa tvāya saṃvartsyate
translated: will all lead to unpleasant, disagreeable, and undesirable results.

analyzed: evam te mahānirayāḥ utsadāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Thus, the great hells will become crowded.

analyzed: tiryañcaḥ preta viṣayāḥ āsurāḥ ca kāyāḥ
translated: The animal realms, the realms of hungry ghosts, and the demon realms

analyzed: māra bhavanāni ca utsadāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: and the abodes of Mara will become crowded.

original: imamapyānanda arthavaśaṃ saṃpaśyan māraḥ pāpīyāṃstuṣṭa udagra āttamanāḥ pramuditaḥ prītisaumanasyajāto bhavati //
analyzed: imam api ānanda artha vaśam saṃpaśyan māraḥ pāpīyān tuṣṭaḥ udagraḥ ātta manāḥ pramuditaḥ prīti saumanasya jātaḥ bhavati
translated: Ānanda, seeing this situation, the evil Māra becomes satisfied, elated, joyful, and delighted, and he experiences pleasure and happiness.

original: punaraparamānanda yasmin samaye bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ śrāvakayānikena pudgalena sārdhaṃ kalahāyati vivadati vigṛhṇīte ākrośet paribhāṣeta vyāpadyeta doṣamutpādayati /
analyzed: punar aparam ānanda yasmin samaye bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ śrāvaka yānikena pudgalena sārdham kalahāyati vivadati vigṛhṇīte ākrośet paribhāṣeta vyāpadyeta doṣam utpādayati
translated: Moreover, Ānanda, when a bodhisattva-mahāsattva quarrels, disputes, and argues with a person of the Śrāvakayāna, and abuses, reviles, and becomes angry and gives rise to hatred,

original: tasmin samaye mārasya pāpīyasa evaṃ bhavatidūrīkariṣyati batāyaṃ kulaputraḥ sarvajñatām /
analyzed: tasmin samaye mārasya pāpīyasaḥ evam bhavati dūrīkariṣyati bata ayam kula putraḥ sarvajña tām
translated: at that time the evil Māra thinks like this: 'This noble son will distance himself from omniscience.

original: atidūre sthāsyati sarvajñatāyāḥ sacetpunarbodhisattvayānikaḥ pudgalo'nyena bodhisattvayānikena pudgalena sārdhaṃ kalahāyati vivadati vigṛhṇīte ākrośati paribhāṣate vyāpadyate doṣamutpādayati /
analyzed: atidūre sthāsyati sarvajña tāyāḥ saced punar bodhisattva yānikaḥ pudgalaḥ ūnyena bodhisattva yānikena pudgalena sārdham kalahāyati vivadati vigṛhṇīte ākrośati paribhāṣate vyāpadyate doṣam utpādayati
translated: He will stand far away from omniscience.' But if a person belonging to the Bodhisattvayāna quarrels, disputes, and argues with another person belonging to the Bodhisattvayāna, and abuses, reviles, and becomes angry and gives rise to hatred,

original: tatra māraḥ pāpīyān bhūyasyā mātrayā tuṣṭo bhavati /
analyzed: tatra māraḥ pāpīyān bhūyasyā mātrayā tuṣṭaḥ bhavati
translated: then the evil Māra becomes even more satisfied.

analyzed: udagraḥ ātta manāḥ pramuditaḥ prīti saumanasya jātaḥ bhavati
translated: He becomes elated, joyful, delighted, and experiences pleasure and happiness.

original: evaṃ cāsya bhavatiubhāvapyetau bodhisattvau dūre sthāsyataḥ sarvajñatāyā iti //
analyzed: evam ca asya bhavati ubhau api etau bodhisattvau dūre sthāsyataḥ sarvajña tāyāḥ iti
translated: And he thinks like this: ‘Both of these bodhisattvas will be far from omniscience.’

original: punaraparamānanda yo bodhisattvo mahāsattvo vyākṛto'vyākṛtena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sārdhaṃ kalahāyet vivadet vigṛhṇīyāt ākrośet paribhāṣeta vyāpadyeta doṣamutpādayet /
analyzed: punar aparam ānanda yaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ vyākṛtaḥ vyākṛtena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sārdham kalahāyet vivadet vigṛhṇīyāt ākrośet paribhāṣeta vyāpadyeta doṣam utpādayet
translated: Moreover, Ānanda, if a bodhisattva mahāsattva who has received a prophecy were to quarrel, dispute, argue, get angry, and give rise to resentment with a bodhisattva mahāsattva who has not received a prophecy,

analyzed: cittam ca āghātayet
translated: and were to arouse ill will,

original: tena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena cittotpāde tāvata eva kalpān saṃnāhaḥ saṃnāhyaḥ /
analyzed: tena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena citta utpāde tāvataḥ eva kalpān saṃnāhaḥ saṃnāhyaḥ
translated: then that bodhisattva mahāsattva would have to don the armor for as many eons as there were moments of arousing ill will.

analyzed: saced asya a parityaktā sarvajña tā
translated: If omniscience is not abandoned,

original: evamukte āyuṣmānānando bhagavantametadavocatasti bhagavaṃsteṣāṃ cittotpādānāṃ kiṃcinniḥsaraṇam /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavantam etat avocata asti bhagavan teṣām citta utpādānām kiṃcid niḥsaraṇam
translated: When this was said, the venerable Ānanda said to the Blessed One, “Blessed One, is there any escape from those moments of arousing ill will?

original: utāho tāvata eva kalpānavaśyaṃ tena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena saṃnāhaḥ saṃnahyaḥ /
analyzed: uta aho tāvataḥ eva kalpān avaśyam tena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena saṃnāhaḥ saṃnahyaḥ
translated: Or must that bodhisattva mahāsattva necessarily don the armor for as many eons as there are moments of arousing ill will?”

original: bhagavānāhasaniḥsaraṇamānanda mayā dharmo deśitaḥ śrāvakayānikānāṃ pratyekabuddhayānikānāṃ bodhisattvayānikānāṃ ca pudgalānām /
analyzed: bhagavān āhasa niḥsaraṇam ānanda mayā dharmaḥ deśitaḥ śrāvaka yānikānām pratyekabuddha yānikānām bodhisattva yānikānām ca pudgalānām
translated: The Blessed One said, “Ānanda, I have taught the Dharma with an escape for individuals in the Śrāvakayāna, the Pratyekabuddhayāna, and the Bodhisattvayāna.

original: tatra ānanda yo'yaṃ bodhisattvayānikaḥ pudgalo bodhisattvayānikena pudgalena sārdhaṃ kalahāyitvā vivaditvā vigṛhya ākruśya paribhāṣya vyāpadya doṣamutpādya na pratideśayati /
analyzed: tatra ānanda yaḥ ayam bodhisattva yānikaḥ pudgalaḥ bodhisattva yānikena pudgalena sārdham kalahāyitvā vivaditvā vigṛhya ākruśya paribhāṣya vyāpadya doṣam utpādya na pratideśayati
translated: There, Ananda, the person belonging to the Bodhisattva Vehicle who, having quarreled, disputed, and argued with a person belonging to the Bodhisattva Vehicle, having reviled, abused, and slandered him, having aroused resentment and hatred, does not confess,

analyzed: na āyatyām saṃbarāya pratipadyate  anuśayam vahati
translated: does not undertake restraint for the future,🔽carries the latent tendency,

analyzed: anuśaya baddhaḥ viharati
translated: lives bound by the latent tendency,

analyzed: na aham ānanda tasya pudgalasya niḥsaraṇam vadāmi
translated: I do not declare, Ananda, any escape for that person.

original: avaśyaṃ tena ānanda pudgalena punareva tāvata eva kalpān saṃnāhaḥ saṃnahyaḥ /
analyzed: avaśyam tena ānanda pudgalena punar eva tāvataḥ eva kalpān saṃnāhaḥ saṃnahyaḥ
translated: Ananda, that person must necessarily don the armor again for just as many eons.

original: yaḥ punarānanda bodhisattvayānikaḥ pudgalo bodhisattvayānikena pudgalena sārdhaṃ kalahāyitvā vivaditvā vigṛhya ākruśya paribhāṣya vyāpadya doṣamutpādya
analyzed: yaḥ punar ānanda bodhisattva yānikaḥ pudgalaḥ bodhisattva yānikena pudgalena sārdham kalahāyitvā vivaditvā vigṛhya ākruśya paribhāṣya vyāpadya doṣam utpādya
translated: But, Ananda, the person belonging to the Bodhisattva Vehicle who, having quarreled, disputed, and argued with a person belonging to the Bodhisattva Vehicle, having reviled, abused, and slandered him, having aroused resentment and hatred,

analyzed: pratideśyaḥ āyatyām saṃvarāya pratipadyate
translated: confesses, and undertakes restraint for the future,

original: evaṃ ca cittamutpādayatiyena mayā sarvasattvānāṃ vigrahā vivādā virodhā utsārayitavyā nidhyāpayitavyāḥ praśamayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: evam ca cittam utpādayati yena mayā sarva sattvānām vigrahāḥ vivādāḥ virodhāḥ utsārayitavyāḥ nidhyāpayitavyāḥ praśamayitavyāḥ
translated: should arouse the following thought: 'I should dispel, remove, and pacify all the quarrels, disputes, and disagreements of all sentient beings.

analyzed: sā uham nāma svayam eva vivadāmi
translated: I myself am arguing with my own name.

analyzed: lābhāḥ me durlabdhāḥ na sulabdhāḥ
translated: My gains are ill-gained, not well-gained.

analyzed: yaḥ ham jalpite pratijalpāmi
translated: I am arguing back to what is being said.

analyzed: yena mayā sarva sattvānām saṃkrama bhūtena bhavitavyam
translated: By whom I should become a bridge for all beings.

analyzed: sā u ham pareṣu tvam iti api vācam bhāṣe
translated: I speak to others even with the word 'you'.

original: paruṣaṃ vā karkaśaṃ vā prativaco dadāmi /
analyzed: paruṣam vā karkaśam vā prativacaḥ dadāmi
translated: Or I give a harsh or rough reply.

analyzed: idam api mayā na eva vaktavyam
translated: This too should not be spoken by me.

analyzed: jaḍa sadṛśena eḍa mūka samena mayā kalaha vigraha vivādeṣu bhavitavyam
translated: By me who is like a block of wood, who is like a dumb sheep, there should be quarrels, disputes, and arguments.

original: parato duruktāni durāgatāni durbhāṣitāni bhāṣyamāṇāni śṛṇvatā cittaṃ nāghātayitavyam /
analyzed: paratas duruktāni durāgatāni durbhāṣitāni bhāṣyamāṇāni śṛṇvatā cittam na āghātayitavyam
translated: Hearing unpleasant, ill-spoken, and badly-spoken words spoken by others, the mind should not be agitated.

analyzed: pareṣām antike na mama etat sādhu
translated: This is not good for me in the presence of others.

analyzed: na ca etat mamām pratirūpam
translated: And this is not fitting for me.

analyzed: yā uham parasya doṣa antaram saṃjāne
translated: I who know another's fault.

analyzed: etat api me na pratirūpam
translated: This too is not fitting for me.

analyzed: yat aham doṣa antaram api śrotavyam manye
translated: That I think of hearing another's fault.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

analyzed: na mayā adhyāśayaḥ vikopayitavyaḥ
translated: My superior intention should not be disturbed.

analyzed: yena mayā sarva sattvāḥ sarva sukhopadhānaiḥ sukhayitavyāḥ
translated: By whom I should make all beings happy with all the requisites of happiness.

analyzed: parinirvāpayitavyāḥ ca anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhya
translated: and should attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, and should attain nirvāṇa.

analyzed: sa nāma aham vyāpadye
translated: I would be angry.

original: na ca mayā svaparāddheṣvapi pareṣu vyāpattavyam /
analyzed: na ca mayā su aparāddheṣu api pareṣu vyāpattavyam
translated: But I should not be angry with others, even if they offend me.

analyzed: sa nāma aham kṣobham gacchāmi
translated: I would be agitated.

analyzed: idam mayā na karaṇīyam
translated: This should not be done by me.

analyzed: dṛḍha parākrama tayā parākrāntavyam
translated: I should be courageous with firm courage.

original: na ca mayā jīvitāntarāye'pi kriyamāṇe kṣobhaḥ karaṇīyaḥ /
analyzed: na ca mayā jīvita antarāye pi kriyamāṇe kṣobhaḥ karaṇīyaḥ
translated: And even if my life is endangered, I should not be agitated.

analyzed: na bhrukuṭiḥ mukhe utpādayitavyā iti
translated: I should not make a frown on my face.'

analyzed: asya aham ānanda bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya niḥsaraṇam vadāmi
translated: Ānanda, I declare this to be the deliverance of that bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: evaṃ cānanda bodhisattvena mahāsattvena śrāvakayānikānāmapi pudgalānāmantike sthātavyam /
analyzed: evam ca ānanda bodhisattvena mahāsattvena śrāvaka yānikānām api pudgalānām antike sthātavyam
translated: Ānanda, a bodhisattva mahāsattva should stand in the presence of even those individuals who follow the vehicle of the hearers

analyzed: yathā na kasyacid sattvasya antike kṣubhyeta
translated: so as not to be agitated in the presence of any being.

analyzed: evam eva ca sarva sattvānām antike sthātavyam
translated: And he should stand in the presence of all beings in just this way.

original: kathaṃ cānanda bodhisattvena mahāsattvena apareṣāṃ bodhisattvayānikānāṃ pudgalānāmantike sthātavyam /
analyzed: katham ca ānanda bodhisattvena mahāsattvena apareṣām bodhisattva yānikānām pudgalānām antike sthātavyam
translated: And how, Ānanda, should a bodhisattva mahāsattva stand in the presence of other individuals who follow the vehicle of the bodhisattvas?

analyzed: tat yathā api nāma ānanda śāstari
translated: Just as, Ānanda, toward a teacher,

original: ete mama bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ śāstāra ityevaṃ sthātavyam /🔽ekayānasamārūḍhā bateme mama bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ /
analyzed: ete mama bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ śāstāraḥ iti evam sthātavyam  eka yāna samārūḍhāḥ bata ime mama bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ
translated: These bodhisattva mahāsattvas of mine are my teachers. Thus should one stand.🔽These bodhisattva mahāsattvas of mine are mounted on the one vehicle.

analyzed: eka mārga samārūḍhāḥ bata ime mama bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ
translated: These bodhisattva mahāsattvas of mine are mounted on the one path.

analyzed: samāna abhiprāyāḥ bata ime mama bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ
translated: These bodhisattva mahāsattvas of mine have the same intention.

analyzed: sama yāna saṃprasthitāḥ bata ime mama bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ
translated: These bodhisattva mahāsattvas of mine are set out on the one vehicle.

analyzed: yatra ebhiḥ śikṣitavyam
translated: Where they should train,

analyzed: tatra mayā śikṣitavyam
translated: there I should train.

analyzed: yathā eva ca ebhiḥ śikṣitavyam
translated: And just as they should train,

analyzed: tathā eva mayā śikṣitavyam
translated: so should I train.

analyzed: saced punar eṣām kaścid vyavakīrṇa vihāreṇa vihariṣyati
translated: If, on the other hand, someone among them should dwell in a scattered manner,

analyzed: na mayā vyavakīrṇa vihāreṇa vihartavyam
translated: I should not dwell in a scattered manner.

analyzed: saced punar ete vyavakīrṇa vihāreṇa vihariṣyanti sarvajña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ
translated: If, on the other hand, they should dwell in an unscattered manner, with thoughts connected with omniscience,

analyzed: mayā api evam śikṣitavyam
translated: I should also train in just that way.

original: evaṃ sarvajñatāyāṃ śikṣamāṇasya ānanda bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya antarāyo na bhavatyanuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /
analyzed: evam sarvajña tāyām śikṣamāṇasya ānanda bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya antarāyaḥ na bhavati anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: Thus, Ananda, for a bodhisattva mahāsattva who trains in omniscience, there is no obstacle to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: kṣipram ca anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate iti
translated: And he quickly attains unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: ārya aṣṭasāhasrikāyām prajñāpāramitāyām abhimānaparivartaḥ nāma caturviṃśatitamaḥ
translated: In the Noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines, the twenty-fourth chapter is named Conceit.

analyzed: śikṣā parivartaḥ pañcaviṃśatitamaḥ
translated: The twenty-fifth chapter is named Training.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān subhūtirbhagavantametadavocatkva punarbhagavan śikṣamāṇo bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvajñatāyāṃ śikṣate /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat kva punar bhagavan śikṣamāṇaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarvajña tāyām śikṣate
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, where does a bodhisattva mahāsattva who is training train in omniscience?

analyzed: bhagavān āha saced subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ kṣaye śikṣate
translated: The Blessed One said, Subhūti, if a bodhisattva mahāsattva trains in cessation,

analyzed: sarvajña tāyām śikṣate
translated: he trains in omniscience.

original: evamanutpāde'nirodhe'jātau abhāve viveke virāge ākāśe dharmadhātau /
analyzed: evam anutpāde nirodhe jātau abhāve viveke virāge ākāśe dharmadhātau
translated: Similarly, in non-arising, non-ceasing, non-birth, non-existence, separation, dispassion, space, and the dharma-realm.

analyzed: saced subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ nirvāṇe śikṣate
translated: Subhūti, if a bodhisattva mahāsattva trains in nirvāṇa,

analyzed: sarvajña tāyām śikṣate
translated: he trains in omniscience.

original: subhūtirāhakiṃ kāraṇaṃ bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ kṣaye śikṣamāṇaḥ śikṣate sarvajñatāyām /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha kim kāraṇam bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ kṣaye śikṣamāṇaḥ śikṣate sarvajña tāyām
translated: Subhuti: Why, O Lord, does the Bodhisattva, the great being, who trains in the perfection of wisdom, train in the knowledge of all modes?

original: evamanutpāde'nirodhe'jātau abhāve viveke virāge ākāśe dharmadhātau nirvāṇe śikṣamāṇaḥ śikṣate sarvajñatāyām /
analyzed: evam anutpāde nirodhe jātau abhāve viveke virāge ākāśe dharmadhātau nirvāṇe śikṣamāṇaḥ śikṣate sarvajña tāyām
translated: And so for non-production, non-stopping, non-defilement, non-purification, non-existence, isolation, non-appearance, space, the Dharma-element, and Nirvana.

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocatyatsubhūte evaṃ vadasikiṃ kāraṇaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ kṣaye śikṣamāṇaḥ śikṣate sarvajñatāyām🔽evamanutpāde'nirodhe'jātau abhāve viveke virāge ākāśe dharmadhātau nirvāṇe śikṣamāṇaḥ śikṣate sarvajñatāyāmiti /🔽tatkiṃ manyase subhūte yā tathāgatasya tathatā yayā tathatayā tathāgatastathāgata iti prabhāvyate /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat yat subhūte evam vadasi kim kāraṇam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ kṣaye śikṣamāṇaḥ śikṣate sarvajña tāyām  evam anutpāde nirodhe jātau abhāve viveke virāge ākāśe dharmadhātau nirvāṇe śikṣamāṇaḥ śikṣate sarvajña tāyām iti  tat kim manyase subhūte yā tathāgatasya tathatā yayā tathatayā tathāgataḥ tathāgataḥ iti prabhāvyate
translated: The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti, is that Suchness of the Tathagatas, by which Suchness the Tathagata is revealed as a Tathagata, is that Suchness produced or stopped, defiled or purified, existent or non-existent?🔽Subhuti: No, O Lord.

analyzed: api nu sā kṣīyate
translated: The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti, is that Suchness of the Tathagatas, by which Suchness the Tathagata is revealed as a Tathagata, is that Suchness something that can be appropriated?

analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha no hi idam bhagavan
translated: Subhuti: No, O Lord.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /🔽na hi bhagavan kṣayaḥ kṣīyate /🔽akṣayo hi bhagavan kṣayaḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ 🔽na hi bhagavan kṣayaḥ kṣīyate 🔽akṣayaḥ hi bhagavan kṣayaḥ
translated: The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti, is that Suchness of the Tathagatas, by which Suchness the Tathagata is revealed as a Tathagata, is that Suchness something that can be appropriated?

original: bhagavānāhatatkiṃ manyase subhūte yā tathāgatasya tathatā yayā tathatayā tathāgatastathāgata iti prabhāvyate /
analyzed: bhagavān āha tat kim manyase subhūte yā tathāgatasya tathatā yayā tathatayā tathāgataḥ tathāgataḥ iti prabhāvyate
translated: The Blessed One said, What do you think, Subhuti, is that suchness of the Tathagata by which suchness the Tathagata is manifested as suchness?

original: api nu sā utpadyate vā nirudhyate vā jāyate vā bhavati vā vibhavati vā vivicyate vā rajyate vā virajyate vā ākāśībhavati vā dharmībhavati vā /
analyzed: api nu sā utpadyate vā nirudhyate vā jāyate vā bhavati vā vibhavati vā vivicyate vā rajyate vā virajyate vā ākāśībhavati vā dharmībhavati vā
translated: Is it produced or does it cease, is it born or does it perish, is it defiled or is it purified, is it increased or is it diminished, is it accumulated or is it dispersed, is it burned or is it not burned?

analyzed: āhanaḥ hi idam bhagavan
translated: He said, No, Blessed One.

original: bhagavānāhatakiṃ manyase subhūte yā tathāgatasya tathatā yayā tathatayā tathāgatastathāgata iti prabhāvyate /
analyzed: bhagavān āhatakim manyase subhūte yā tathāgatasya tathatā yayā tathatayā tathāgataḥ tathāgataḥ iti prabhāvyate
translated: The Blessed One said, What do you think, Subhuti, is that suchness of the Tathagata by which suchness the Tathagata is manifested as suchness?

analyzed: api nu sā nirvāti
translated: Is it extinguished?

analyzed: āhanaḥ hi idam bhagavan
translated: He said, No, Blessed One.

original: bhagavānāhatasmāttarhi subhūte evaṃ śikṣamāṇo bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ na tathatā kṣīyate ityevaṃ śikṣate /
analyzed: bhagavān āha tasmāt tarhi subhūte evam śikṣamāṇaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na tathatā kṣīyate iti evam śikṣate
translated: The Blessed One said, Therefore, Subhuti, the bodhisattva, the great being, who trains thus, 'I will train in such a way that suchness will not be extinguished,' trains in the perfection of wisdom.

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ śikṣate sarvajñatāyām /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ śikṣate sarvajña tāyām
translated: Subhuti, the bodhisattva, the great being, who trains thus trains in omniscience.

analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇaḥ śikṣate prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: One who trains thus trains in the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: śikṣate buddha bhūmau
translated: One trains in the stage of a Buddha.

analyzed: śikṣate baleṣu
translated: One trains in the powers.

analyzed: śikṣate vaiśāradyeṣu
translated: He trains in the fearlessnesses.

analyzed: śikṣate sarva buddha dharmeṣu
translated: He trains in all the Buddha-dharmas.

analyzed: śikṣate sarvajña jñāne
translated: He trains in the knowledge of all knowledge.

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvaśikṣāpāramitāmanuprāpsyati /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarva śikṣā pāramitām anuprāpsyati
translated: Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who trains thus, will reach the perfection of all trainings.

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na śakyo māreṇa vā māraparṣadā vā mārakāyikābhirvā devatābhirabhimarditum /🔽evaṃ śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ kṣipramavinivartanīyadharmatāmanuprāpsyati /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na śakyaḥ māreṇa vā māra parṣadā vā māra kāyikābhiḥ vā devatābhiḥ abhimarditum  evam śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ kṣipram avinivartanīya dharmatām anuprāpsyati
translated: Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who trains thus, cannot be overcome by Mara or the host of Mara or the Maras' deities.🔽Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who trains thus, will quickly reach the state of non-retrogression.

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ kṣipraṃ bodhimaṇḍe niṣatsyati /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ kṣipram bodhimaṇḍe niṣatsyati
translated: Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who trains thus, will quickly sit on the terrace of enlightenment.

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ svake gocare carati /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ svake gocare carati
translated: Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who trains thus, goes about in his own domain.

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ śikṣate nāthakarakeṣu dharmeṣu /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ śikṣate nātha karakeṣu dharmeṣu
translated: Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who trains thus, trains in the dharmas which are helpful.

analyzed: śikṣate mahāmaitryām  mahā karuṇāyām śikṣate  mahāmuditāyām śikṣate
translated: He trains in great friendliness.🔽He trains in great compassion.🔽He trains in great sympathetic joy.

analyzed: mahā upekṣāyām śikṣate
translated: He trains in great equanimity.

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ śikṣate triparivartasya dvādaśākārasya dharmacakrasya pravartanāya /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ śikṣate tri parivartasya dvādaśa ākārasya dharmacakrasya pravartanāya
translated: Subhuti, a Bodhisattva who trains thus trains in order to turn the wheel of Dharma with its three revolutions and twelve aspects.

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvadhātuṃ nonīkariṣyāmīti śikṣate /🔽evaṃ śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvastathāgatavaṃśasyānupacchedāya śikṣate /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarva dhātum nonīkariṣyāmi iti śikṣate  evam śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tathāgata vaṃśasya an upacchedāya śikṣate
translated: Subhuti, a Bodhisattva who trains thus trains in order to make all worlds into no-worlds.🔽Subhuti, a Bodhisattva who trains thus trains in order to not cut off the lineage of the Tathagatas.

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'mṛtadhātudvāraṃ vivariṣyāmīti śikṣate /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ umṛta dhātu dvāram vivariṣyāmi iti śikṣate
translated: Subhuti, a Bodhisattva who trains thus trains in order to open the door to the deathless.

original: neyaṃ subhūte udārā śikṣā śakyā hīnasattvena śikṣitum /
analyzed: na iyam subhūte udārā śikṣā śakyā hīna sattvena śikṣitum
translated: Subhuti, this exalted training cannot be trained in by a being of low status.

original: na hi alpasthāmnā śakyamasyāṃ śikṣāyāṃ śikṣitum /
analyzed: na hi alpa sthāmnā śakyam asyām śikṣāyām śikṣitum
translated: One of little power cannot train in this training.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ  sarva sattva sārāḥ hi te subhūte
translated: Why is that?🔽Subhuti, they are the essence of all beings.

analyzed: sarva sattva nātha kāmāḥ hi te subhūte
translated: Subhuti, they desire to be the protector of all beings.

analyzed: śikṣāyām śikṣante
translated: Those who train in this training.

analyzed: sarva sattva abhyudgata tām tena prāptu kāmāḥ
translated: They desire to attain superiority over all beings.

analyzed: ye iha śikṣante
translated: Those who train here.

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na nirayeṣūpapadyate /🔽na tiryagyoniṣūpapadyate /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na nirayeṣu upapadyate  na tiryagyoniṣu upapadyate
translated: Subhuti, a Bodhisattva, a great being who trains like this, does not take rebirth in the hells.🔽He does not take rebirth among animals.

analyzed: na preta viṣayeṣu upapadyate
translated: He does not take rebirth in the realm of hungry ghosts.

analyzed: na asureṣu kāyeṣu upapadyate  na pratyanta janapadeṣu upapadyate
translated: He does not take rebirth in the bodies of Asuras.🔽He does not take rebirth in border regions.

analyzed: na caṇḍāla kuleṣu upapadyate  na śākunika kuleṣu upapadyate
translated: He does not take rebirth in families of outcastes.🔽He does not take rebirth in families of fowlers.

analyzed: na niṣāda dhīvara aurabhrika kuleṣu upapadyate
translated: He does not take rebirth in families of hunters, fishermen, pig-butchers, or bird-catchers.

analyzed: na api anyeṣu evaṃrūpeṣu hīna jātikeṣu hīna karma seviṣu vā kuleṣu upapadyate
translated: He does not take rebirth in other such low-caste families that engage in lowly occupations.

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo nāndho bhavati /🔽na badhiro bhavati /🔽na kāṇo bhavati /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na andhaḥ bhavati  na badhiraḥ bhavati  na kāṇaḥ bhavati
translated: Subhuti, a Bodhisattva, a great being who trains like this, is not blind.🔽He is not deaf.🔽He is not squint-eyed.

original: na kuṇṭho bhavati /🔽na kubjo bhavati /🔽na kuṇirbhavati /
analyzed: na kuṇṭhaḥ bhavati  na kubjaḥ bhavati  na kuṇiḥ bhavati
translated: He is not lame.🔽He is not hunchbacked.🔽He is not crippled.

original: na laṅgo bhavati /🔽na khañjo bhavati /🔽na jaḍo bhavati /
analyzed: na laṅgaḥ bhavati  na khañjaḥ bhavati  na jaḍaḥ bhavati
translated: He is not a dwarf.🔽He is not crippled.🔽He is not stupid.

original: na lolo bhavati /🔽na lollo bhavati /🔽na kallo bhavati /
analyzed: na lolaḥ bhavati  na lollaḥ bhavati  na kallaḥ bhavati
translated: He is not restless.🔽He is not a stammerer.🔽He is not a stutterer.

analyzed: na hīna aṅgaḥ bhavati  na vikala aṅgaḥ bhavati
translated: He is not of low caste.🔽He is not of incomplete faculties.

analyzed: na vikṛta aṅgaḥ bhavati
translated: He is not of deformed faculties.

analyzed: na durbalaḥ bhavati
translated: He is not weak.

analyzed: na durvarṇaḥ bhavati
translated: He does not become ugly.

analyzed: na duḥsaṃsthānaḥ bhavati  na hīna indriyaḥ bhavati
translated: He does not become badly formed.🔽He does not become deficient in faculties.

analyzed: na vikala indriyaḥ bhavati
translated: He does not become defective in faculties.

analyzed: sarva ākāra paripūrṇa indriyaḥ bhavati
translated: He becomes complete in all aspects of faculties.

analyzed: svara saṃpannaḥ bhavati
translated: He becomes endowed with a good voice.

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na prāṇātipātī bhavati /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na prāṇa atipātī bhavati
translated: Subhuti, a Bodhisattva-mahāsattva who trains like this does not kill living beings.

analyzed: na a datta ādāyī bhavati
translated: He does not take what is not given.

analyzed: na kāma mithyā cārī bhavati
translated: He does not engage in sexual misconduct.

original: na mṛṣāvādī bhavati /🔽na piśunavāgbhavati /🔽na paruṣavāgbhavati /🔽na saṃbhinnapralāpī bhavati /
analyzed: na mṛṣāvādī bhavati  na piśuna vāc bhavati  na paruṣa vāc bhavati  na saṃbhinna pralāpī bhavati
translated: He does not speak falsely.🔽He does not speak divisively.🔽He does not speak harshly.

analyzed: na abhidhyāluḥ bhavati  na vyāpanna cittaḥ bhavati
translated: He does not engage in idle chatter.🔽He is not covetous.🔽He does not have a malicious mind.

analyzed: na mithyādṛṣṭikaḥ bhavati
translated: He does not have wrong views.

analyzed: na mithyājīvena jīvikām kalpayati
translated: He does not make a living through wrong livelihood.

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na dīrghāyuṣkeṣu deveṣūpapadyate /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na dīrgha āyuṣkeṣu deveṣu upapadyate
translated: Subhuti, a Bodhisattva-mahāsattva who trains like this is not reborn among the long-lived devas.

analyzed: na duḥśīla parigrāhakaḥ bhavati
translated: He does not take up those with bad conduct.

analyzed: na a bhūta dharma parigrāhakaḥ bhavati
translated: He does not take up those with false teachings.

analyzed: na dhyāna samāpatti vaśena upapadyate
translated: He is not reborn through the power of meditation and concentration.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: asti hi tasyopāyakauśalyaṃ yenopāyakauśalyena samanvāgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na dīrghāyuṣkeṣu deveṣūpapadyate /
analyzed: asti hi tasya upāya kauśalyam yena upāya kauśalyena samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na dīrgha āyuṣkeṣu deveṣu upapadyate
translated: For he has the skillful means by which, endowed with those skillful means, the bodhisattva mahāsattva is not reborn among the long-lived devas.

original: tatpunaḥ subhūte upāyakauśalyaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya katamat /
analyzed: tat punar subhūte upāya kauśalyam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya katamat
translated: And what, Subhūti, is that skillful means of the bodhisattva mahāsattva?

analyzed: yat uta iyam eva prajñāpāramitā
translated: It is this perfection of wisdom itself.

analyzed: tathā ca atra upāya kauśalye yogam āpadyate
translated: And he applies himself to this skillful means

original: yathā anyenopāyakauśalyena samanvāgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvo dhyānāni ca samāpadyate /
analyzed: yathā anyena upāya kauśalyena samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ dhyānāni ca samāpadyate
translated: in such a way that, endowed with other skillful means, the bodhisattva mahāsattva enters the meditative absorptions

analyzed: na ca dhyāna vaśena upapadyate
translated: but is not reborn under the influence of the meditative absorptions.

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo balapariśuddhiṃ nigacchati /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bala pariśuddhim nigacchati
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who trains like this attains the purification of the powers,

analyzed: vaiśāradya pariśuddhim nigacchati
translated: attains the purification of the fearlessnesses,

analyzed: sarva buddha dharma pariśuddhim nigacchati
translated: attains the purification of all the buddhadharmas,

analyzed: tām anuprāpnoti
translated: and attains that.

original: āyuṣmān subhūtirāhayadā bhagavan sarvadharmā evaṃ prakṛtipariśuddhāḥ /
analyzed: āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ āha yadā bhagavan sarva dharmāḥ evam prakṛti pariśuddhāḥ
translated: The Venerable Subhūti said, Blessed One, when all dharmas are thus pure by nature,

original: tatkatamasya bhagavan dharmasya bodhisattvo mahāsattvo balapariśuddhiṃ nigacchati /
analyzed: tat katamasya bhagavan dharmasya bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bala pariśuddhim nigacchati
translated: Blessed One, which dharma does the bodhisattva mahāsattva attain the purification of the powers in?

analyzed: vaiśāradya pariśuddhim nigacchati
translated: One attains the purification of fearlessness.

analyzed: sarva buddha dharma pariśuddhim nigacchati
translated: One attains the purification of all the Buddha-dharmas.

analyzed: tām anuprāpnoti
translated: One attains that.

analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat evam etat subhūte evam etat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhuti, So it is, Subhuti, so it is.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is it so?

analyzed: sarva dharmāḥ hi subhūte prakṛtyā eva pariśuddhāḥ
translated: Subhuti, all dharmas are pure by nature.

original: evaṃ subhūte prakṛtipariśuddheṣu sarvadharmeṣu bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣamāṇasya yā asaṃsīdanatā anavalīnatā /
analyzed: evam subhūte prakṛti pariśuddheṣu sarva dharmeṣu bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣamāṇasya yā a saṃsīdana tā an avalīna tā
translated: Subhuti, in this way, for the bodhisattva mahasattva who is training in the perfection of wisdom, in all dharmas that are pure by nature, this non-discouragement, this non-dejection,

analyzed: iyam sā subhūte prajñāpāramitā
translated: this, Subhuti, is the perfection of wisdom.

original: evaṃ subhūte bālapṛthagjanā enān dharmānajānanto'paśyanto dharmāṇāṃ dharmatāṃ na jānanti /
analyzed: evam subhūte bāla pṛthagjanāḥ enān dharmān a jānanta upaśyantaḥ dharmāṇām dharma tām na jānanti
translated: Subhuti, in this way, foolish ordinary people, not knowing these dharmas, not seeing the nature of dharmas, do not know

analyzed: na paśyanti
translated: and do not see.

original: teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ kṛtaśaḥ subhūte bodhisattvā mahāsattvā vyāyacchante /🔽vīryamārabhantevayamevamajānakān sattvān jānayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: teṣām sattvānām kṛtaśas subhūte bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ vyāyacchante  vīryam ārabhante vayam evam ajānakān sattvān jānayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: Subhuti, for the sake of those beings, the bodhisattva mahasattvas strive,🔽exert vigor, thinking, We will make those beings who do not know this know it.

original: vayamevamapaśyakān sattvān paśyayiṣyāmaḥ ityatra śikṣāyāṃ śikṣante /
analyzed: vayam evam apaśyakān sattvān paśyayiṣyāmaḥ iti atra śikṣāyām śikṣante
translated: We will make those beings who do not see this see it. They train in this training.

original: atra śikṣāyāṃ śikṣamāṇā bodhisattvā mahāsattvā balānyanuprāpnuvanti /
analyzed: atra śikṣāyām śikṣamāṇāḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ balāni anuprāpnuvanti
translated: Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas who train in this training attain the powers,

analyzed: vaiśāradyāni anuprāpnuvanti
translated: attain the fearlessnesses,

analyzed: sarva buddha dharmān anuprāpnuvanti
translated: and attain all the buddhadharmas.

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇāḥ subhūte bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ parasattvānāṃ parapudgalānāṃ cittacaritavispanditāni yathābhūtaṃ prajānanti /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇāḥ subhūte bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ para sattvānām para pudgalānām citta carita vispanditāni yathābhūtam prajānanti
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva-mahāsattvas who train like this understand as it truly is the mental activities, movements, and strivings of other beings, other persons.

analyzed: yathābhūtam prajānantaḥ para citta carita jña tāyāḥ pāram gacchanti
translated: Understanding as it truly is, they reach the other shore of the knowledge of the mental activities of others.

original: tadyathāpi nāma subhūte alpakāste mahāpṛthivyāṃ pṛthivīpradeśāḥ ye'pagatapāṣāṇāḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma subhūte alpakāḥ te mahā pṛthivyām pṛthivī pradeśāḥ yepagata pāṣāṇāḥ
translated: Subhūti, just as on the great earth there are few places where gold, silver, or jewels are produced,

original: yatra suvarṇaṃ vā jātarūpaṃ vā rajataṃ votpadyate /
analyzed: yatra suvarṇam vā jātarūpam vā rajatam vā utpadyate
translated: and those places where gold, silver, or jewels are produced are few,

analyzed: atha khalu punar bahutarakāḥ te mahā pṛthivyām pṛthivī pradeśāḥ
translated: but on the great earth there are many more places

analyzed: ye ūṣarāḥ ujjaṅgalāḥ vividha tṛṇa kāṇḍa kaṇṭaka ādhānāḥ
translated: that are barren, rocky, overgrown with various grasses, reeds, and thorns,

original: evameva subhūte alpakāste bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ sattvanikāye saṃvidyante /
analyzed: evam eva subhūte alpakāḥ te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ sattva nikāye saṃvidyante
translated: in the same way, Subhūti, there are few bodhisattva-mahāsattvas in the assembly of beings🔽who

analyzed: ye syām sarvajña tā śikṣāyām śikṣante yat uta prajñāpāramitā śikṣāyām
translated: Those who train in this training in omniscience, namely the training in the perfection of wisdom.

original: atha khalu bahutarakāste sattvāḥ sattvanikāye saṃvidyante /
analyzed: atha khalu bahutarakāḥ te sattvāḥ sattva nikāye saṃvidyante
translated: But, Subhūti, there are even more beings in the world-system of a billion worlds who

analyzed: ye śrāvaka pratyekabuddha śikṣāyām śikṣante
translated: train in the training of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: punaraparaṃ subhūte tadyathāpi nāma alpakāste sattvāḥ sattvanikāye saṃvidyante /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte tat yathā api nāma alpakāḥ te sattvāḥ sattva nikāye saṃvidyante
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, just as there are few beings in the world-system of a billion worlds

analyzed: ye cakravarti rājya saṃvartanīyam karma samādāya vartante
translated: who undertake and abide by the karma that leads to the sovereignty of a wheel-turning king,

original: atha khalu bahutarakāste sattvāḥ sattvanikāye saṃvidyante /
analyzed: atha khalu bahutarakāḥ te sattvāḥ sattva nikāye saṃvidyante
translated: but there are even more beings in the world-system of a billion worlds

analyzed: ye koṭṭa rājya saṃvartanīyam karma samādāya vartante
translated: who undertake and abide by the karma that leads to the sovereignty of a minor king,

original: evameva subhūte alpakāste bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ sattvanikāye saṃvidyante /
analyzed: evam eva subhūte alpakāḥ te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ sattva nikāye saṃvidyante
translated: in the same way, Subhūti, there are few bodhisattva mahāsattvas in the world-system of a billion worlds

analyzed: ye imam mārgam ārūḍhāḥ yat uta prajñāpāramitā mārgam
translated: who have mounted this path, namely the path of the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyāmahe iti
translated: thinking 'We will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.'

original: atha khalu bahutarakāste sattvāḥ sattvanikāye saṃvidyante /
analyzed: atha khalu bahutarakāḥ te sattvāḥ sattva nikāye saṃvidyante
translated: But there are even more beings in the world-system of a billion worlds

analyzed: ye śrāvaka pratyekabuddha mārgam ārūḍhāḥ
translated: who have mounted the path of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: punaraparaṃ subhūte tadyathāpi nāma alpakāste sattvāḥ sattvanikāye saṃvidyante /🔽ye śakrasaṃvartanīyaṃ karma samādāya vartante /🔽atha khalu bahutarakāste sattvāḥ sattvanikāye saṃvidyante /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte tat yathā api nāma alpakāḥ te sattvāḥ sattva nikāye saṃvidyante  ye śakra saṃvartanīyam karma samādāya vartante  atha khalu bahutarakāḥ te sattvāḥ sattva nikāye saṃvidyante
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, just as there are few beings in the world who undertake actions that lead to becoming Shakra,

original: ye devalokasaṃvartanīyaṃ karma samādāya vartante /🔽evameva subhūte alpakāste bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ sattvanikāye saṃvidyante /
analyzed: ye deva loka saṃvartanīyam karma samādāya vartante  evam eva subhūte alpakāḥ te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ sattva nikāye saṃvidyante
translated: but there are many more beings who undertake actions that lead to becoming a god in the world of the gods,

original: ye'syāṃ prajñāpāramitāśikṣāyāṃ śikṣante /🔽atha khalu bahutarakāste bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ sattvanikāye saṃvidyante /
analyzed: yesyām prajñāpāramitā śikṣāyām śikṣante  atha khalu bahutarakāḥ te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ sattva nikāye saṃvidyante
translated: in the same way, Subhuti, there are few Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas in the world who train in this training of the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: ye śrāvaka pratyekabuddha śikṣāyām śikṣante
translated: but there are many more Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas who train in the training of the Shravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: punaraparaṃ subhūte tadyathāpi nāma alpakāste sattvāḥ sattvanikāye saṃvidyante /🔽ye brahmasaṃvartanīyaṃ karma samādāya vartante /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte tat yathā api nāma alpakāḥ te sattvāḥ sattva nikāye saṃvidyante  ye brahmasaṃvartanīyam karma samādāya vartante
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, just as there are few beings in the world who undertake actions that lead to becoming Brahma,

original: atha khalu bahutarakāste sattvāḥ sattvanikāye saṃvidyante /
analyzed: atha khalu bahutarakāḥ te sattvāḥ sattva nikāye saṃvidyante
translated: but there are many more beings who undertake actions that lead to becoming a god in the Brahma world,

analyzed: ye brahma pārṣadya saṃvartanīyam karma samādāya vartante
translated: Those who undertake and engage in actions that lead to rebirth in the retinue of Brahmā.

original: evameva subhūte alpakāste bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ sattvanikāye saṃvidyante /
analyzed: evam eva subhūte alpakāḥ te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ sattva nikāye saṃvidyante
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, there are few of those bodhisattva-mahāsattvas who exist in the assembly of beings,

analyzed: anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: who are irreversible from highest complete enlightenment.

original: atha khalu bahutarakāste bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ sattvanikāye saṃvidyante /
analyzed: atha khalu bahutarakāḥ te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ sattva nikāye saṃvidyante
translated: But there are many more of those bodhisattva-mahāsattvas who exist in the assembly of beings,

analyzed: ye vivartante in uttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: who turn back from highest complete enlightenment.

original: tasmāttarhi subhūte alpakāste sattvāḥ sattvanikāye saṃvidyante /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi subhūte alpakāḥ te sattvāḥ sattva nikāye saṃvidyante
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, there are few of those beings who exist in the assembly of beings,

analyzed: yena uttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau saṃprasthitāḥ
translated: who have set out for highest complete enlightenment.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ api subhūte alpebhyaḥ ulpatarakāḥ te sattvāḥ
translated: Subhūti, even fewer than those are the beings

analyzed: ye tathatvāya pratipadyante
translated: who practice for suchness.

original: tebhyo'pi subhūte alpatarakebhyastathatvāya pratipadyamānebhyo'lpatamāste ye prajñāpāramitāyāṃ yogamāpadyante /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ api subhūte alpatarakebhyaḥ tathatvāya pratipadyamānebhyaḥ ulpatamāḥ te ye prajñāpāramitāyām yogam āpadyante
translated: Subhūti, even fewer than those who practice for suchness are the very few who apply themselves to the perfection of wisdom.

original: tebhyo'pi subhūte alpatamebhyaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ yogamāpadyamānebhyo'lpatamāste bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ /🔽ye'vinivartanīyā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /🔽tasmāttarhi subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena ya ete'lpatamebhyo'lpatamā avinivartanīyā bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ api subhūte alpatamebhyaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām yogam āpadyamānebhyaḥ ulpatamāḥ te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ  anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodheḥ  tasmāt tarhi subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena ye ete ilpatamebhyaḥ ulpatamāḥ a vinivartanīyāḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ
translated: Subhuti, even fewer than those are the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas who apply themselves to the perfection of wisdom, and even fewer than those are the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas who are irreversible from the utmost, right, and perfect enlightenment.

original: teṣu gaṇanāṃ gantukāmena ihaiva prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: teṣu gaṇanām gantu kāmena iha eva prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: Therefore, Subhuti, a Bodhisattva-Mahasattva who wishes to be counted among those irreversible Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas who are the least of the least should train in just this perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: yogam āpattavyam
translated: He should apply himself to it.

original: punaraparaṃ subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya evaṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣamāṇasya na khilasahagataṃ cittamutpadyate /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya evam prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣamāṇasya na khila sahagatam cittam utpadyate
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, for a Bodhisattva-Mahasattva who trains in the perfection of wisdom in this way, a mind accompanied by resentment does not arise.

original: na vicikitsāsahagataṃ cittamutpadyate /🔽nerṣyāmātsaryasahagataṃ cittamutpadyate /🔽na dauḥśīlyasahagataṃ cittamutpadyate /
analyzed: na vicikitsā sahagatam cittam utpadyate  na īrṣyā mātsarya sahagatam cittam utpadyate  na dauḥśīlya sahagatam cittam utpadyate
translated: A mind accompanied by doubt does not arise.🔽A mind accompanied by envy and stinginess does not arise.

analyzed: na vyāpāda sahagatam cittam utpadyate  na kausīdya sahagatam cittam utpadyate
translated: A mind accompanied by immorality does not arise.🔽A mind accompanied by malice does not arise.🔽A mind accompanied by laziness does not arise.

analyzed: na vikṣepa sahagatam cittam utpadyate
translated: A mind accompanied by distraction does not arise.

analyzed: na dauṣprajña sahagatam cittam utpadyate
translated: a mind accompanied by lack of wisdom does not arise.

original: evaṃ hi subhūte prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣamāṇena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sarvāḥ pāramitā saṃgṛhītā bhavanti /🔽sarvāḥ pāramitā udgṛhītā bhavanti /
analyzed: evam hi subhūte prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣamāṇena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sarvāḥ pāramitā saṃgṛhītāḥ bhavanti  sarvāḥ pāramitāḥ udgṛhītāḥ bhavanti
translated: In this way, Subhūti, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva trains in the perfection of wisdom, all the perfections are included.🔽All the perfections are grasped.

analyzed: sarvāḥ pāramitāḥ anugatāḥ bhavanti
translated: All the perfections are followed.

analyzed: sarvāḥ pāramitāḥ antargatāḥ bhavanti
translated: All the perfections are internalized.

original: tadyathāpi nāma subhūte satkāyadṛṣṭau dvāṣaṣṭidṛṣṭigatānyantargatāni bhavanti /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma subhūte satkāya dṛṣṭau dvāṣaṣṭi dṛṣṭi gatāni antargatāni bhavanti
translated: Just as, Subhūti, the sixty-two views are internalized in the view of the real existence of the body.

original: evameva subhūte prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣamāṇasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya tasyāṃ sarvāḥ pāramitā antargatā bhavanti /
analyzed: evam eva subhūte prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣamāṇasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya tasyām sarvāḥ pāramitāḥ antargatāḥ bhavanti
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva trains in the perfection of wisdom, all the perfections are internalized.

original: tadyathāpi nāma subhūte puruṣasya jīvitendriye pravartamāne sarvāṇīndriyāṇyantargatāni bhavanti /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma subhūte puruṣasya jīvita indriye pravartamāne sarvāṇi indriyāṇi antargatāni bhavanti
translated: Just as, Subhūti, when a person's life faculty is functioning, all the faculties are internalized.

original: evameva subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣamāṇasya sarvakuśalā dharmā antargatā bhavanti /
analyzed: evam eva subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣamāṇasya sarva kuśalāḥ dharmāḥ antargatāḥ bhavanti
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva trains in the perfection of wisdom, all wholesome dharmas are internalized.

original: tadyathāpi nāma subhūte puruṣasya jīvitendriye niruddhe sarvāṇīndriyāṇi niruddhāni bhavanti /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma subhūte puruṣasya jīvita indriye niruddhe sarvāṇi indriyāṇi niruddhāni bhavanti
translated: Just as, Subhuti, when the life faculty of a man ceases, all his faculties cease,

original: evameva subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣamāṇasya ajñāne niruddhe sarve'kuśalā dharmā niruddhā bhavanti /
analyzed: evam eva subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣamāṇasya ajñāne niruddhe sarve kuśalāḥ dharmāḥ niruddhāḥ bhavanti
translated: just so, Subhuti, when ignorance ceases, all the unwholesome dharmas cease,

original: sarvāśca tadanyāḥ pāramitā antargatāḥ parigṛhītā bhavanti /
analyzed: sarvāḥ ca tad anyāḥ pāramitāḥ antargatāḥ parigṛhītāḥ bhavanti
translated: and all the other perfections are included and comprised in it.

original: tasmāttarhi subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sarvāḥ pāramitāḥ parigrahītukāmena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sarvāḥ pāramitāḥ parigrahītu kāmena prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: Therefore, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who wants to grasp all the perfections should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvasattvānāmagratāyāṃ śikṣate /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣamāṇaḥ subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarva sattvānām agra tāyām śikṣate
