translated: Having confidence that this is just as it was taught by the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, they will listen in detail.

original: evaṃ ca cittamutpādayiṣyantiimāṃ vayaṃ prajñāpāramitāmakṣobhyasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasyāntikādvistareṇa śṛṇuyāmeti /
analyzed: evam ca cittam utpādayiṣyanti imām vayam prajñāpāramitām akṣobhyasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya antikāt vistareṇa śṛṇuyāma iti
translated: And they will arouse the thought, 'We will listen in detail to this perfection of wisdom from the presence of the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Akṣobhya.'

original: teṣāṃ ca bodhisattvayānikānāṃ pudgalānāṃ ye cāsya buddhakṣetre brahmacaryaṃ caranti /
analyzed: teṣām ca bodhisattva yānikānām pudgalānām ye ca asya buddhakṣetre brahmacaryam caranti
translated: And those individuals who are in the Bodhisattva Vehicle and who practice the holy life in that Buddha-field,

analyzed: teṣām ca antikāt imām eva prajñāpāramitām śrutvā adhimokṣyanti
translated: having heard this very perfection of wisdom from them, will have confidence.

original: te'pyenāṃ prajñāpāramitāmadhimucyamānā yathā tathāgatena bhāṣitā tathā cādhimokṣyante /
analyzed: te pi enām prajñāpāramitām adhimucyamānāḥ yathā tathāgatena bhāṣitā tathā ca adhimokṣyante
translated: They, having confidence in this perfection of wisdom, will have confidence in it just as it was taught by the Tathagata.

analyzed: tathā ca adhimucyamānāḥ a vinivartanīya tāyām sthāsyanti
translated: Having confidence in it in that way, they will stand in irreversibility.

original: evaṃ subhūte bahukaraṃ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ śravaṇamapi vadāmi /
analyzed: evam subhūte bahukaram prajñāpāramitāyāḥ śravaṇam api vadāmi
translated: In this way, Subhūti, I say that hearing the perfection of wisdom is very helpful.

analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ ye enām adhimokṣyanti
translated: How much more so for those who will have confidence in it!

analyzed: adhimucya tathatvāya sthāsyanti
translated: Having confidence, they will stand in suchness.

analyzed: tathatvāya pratipatsyante
translated: They will practice for the sake of suchness.

original: tathatvāya sthitvā tathatvāya pratipadya tiṣṭhanti tathatāyām /
analyzed: tathatvāya sthitvā tathatvāya pratipadya tiṣṭhanti tathatāyām
translated: Having stood for the sake of suchness, having practiced for the sake of suchness, they stand in suchness.

original: tathatāyāṃ tiṣṭhantaḥ sarvajñatāyāṃ ca dharmaṃ deśayanti //
analyzed: tathatāyām tiṣṭhantaḥ sarvajña tāyām ca dharmam deśayanti
translated: Standing in suchness, they teach the Dharma for the sake of omniscience.

analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha yadā bhagavan tathatā vinirmuktaḥ na anyaḥ kaścid dharmaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Subhuti said, Blessed One, when apart from suchness no other dharma is apprehended,

original: tadā ko'yaṃ bhagavan dharmaḥ sthāsyati tathatāyām /
analyzed: tadā kaḥ ayam bhagavan dharmaḥ sthāsyati tathatāyām
translated: then Blessed One, which dharma will stand in suchness?

analyzed: kaḥ vai ayam anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: Who will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment?

analyzed: kaḥ vai ayam imam dharmam deśayiṣyati
translated: Who will teach this Dharma?

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocatyatsubhūte evaṃ vadasiyadā tathatāvinirmukto nānyaḥ kaściddharma upalabhyate /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat yat subhūte evam vadasi yadā tathatā vinirmuktaḥ na anyaḥ kaścid dharmaḥ upalabhyate
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the Venerable Subhuti, Subhuti, when you say, 'When apart from suchness no other dharma is apprehended,

analyzed: tadā kaḥ ayam bhagavan dharmaḥ tathatāyām sthāsyati
translated: then Blessed One, which dharma will stand in suchness?'

analyzed: kaḥ vācam anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: 'Who will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment?'

analyzed: kaḥ vā ayam imam dharmam deśayiṣyati iti
translated: 'Who will teach this Dharma?'

analyzed: na subhūte tathatā vinirmuktaḥ nyaḥ kaścid dharmaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Subhuti, apart from suchness no other dharma is apprehended.

analyzed: yaḥ dharmaḥ tathatāyām sthāsyati
translated: The Dharma that will abide in suchness.

analyzed: tathatā eva tāvat subhūte na upalabhyate
translated: Subhūti, suchness itself is not even perceived,

analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ yaḥ tathatāyām sthāsyati
translated: how much less so the one who will abide in suchness.

analyzed: na subhūte tathatā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate
translated: Subhūti, suchness does not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: so'pi subhūte dharmo na kaścidupalabhyate /🔽yo'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddho vā /🔽abhisaṃbhotsyate vā /
analyzed: saḥ api subhūte dharmaḥ na kaścid upalabhyate  yaḥ unuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ vā  abhisaṃbhotsyate vā
translated: Subhūti, that Dharma is also not perceived at all,

analyzed: abhisaṃbudhyate vā
translated: which has fully awakened, will fully awaken, or is fully awakening to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: na subhūte tathatā dharmaṃ deśayati /🔽so'pi subhūte nopalabhyate /
analyzed: na subhūte tathatā dharmam deśayati  sā upi subhūte na upalabhyate
translated: Subhūti, suchness does not teach the Dharma.

analyzed: yaḥ dharmaḥ deśyeta
translated: Subhūti, that which would be taught as the Dharma is also not perceived.

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmindro bhagavantametadavocatgambhīrā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā /🔽duṣkarakārakā bhagavan bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat gambhīrā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā  duṣkara kārakāḥ bhagavan bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is profound.

analyzed: yena uttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhu kāmāḥ
translated: Blessed One, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are doers of the difficult are those who wish to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: na ca nāma bhagavan kaściddharmastathatāyāṃ tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: na ca nāma bhagavan kaścid dharmaḥ tathatāyām tiṣṭhati
translated: Blessed One, indeed no Dharma whatsoever abides in suchness,

analyzed: na api kaścid dharmaḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate
translated: and no Dharma whatsoever fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: na api kaścid dharmam deśayati
translated: Nor does anyone teach the Dharma.

analyzed: atra ca te na avalīyante  na api kāṅkṣanti
translated: And in this they do not become discouraged.🔽Nor do they doubt,

original: nāpi dhandhāyante //🔽atha khalvāyuṣmān subhūtiḥ śakraṃ devānāmindrametadavocatyatkauśika evaṃ vadasiduṣkarakārakā bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ /
analyzed: na api dhandhāyante  atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ śakram devānām indram etat avocat yat kauśika evam vadasi duṣkara kārakāḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ
translated: Nor do they become confused.

original: yeṣāmevaṃ gambhīreṣu dharmeṣu bhāṣyamāṇeṣu na bhavati /🔽kāṅkṣāyitatvaṃ dhandhāyitatvaṃ veti /
analyzed: yeṣām evam gambhīreṣu dharmeṣu bhāṣyamāṇeṣu na bhavati  kāṅkṣāyita tvam dhandhāyita tvam vā iti
translated: Then the Venerable Subhuti said to Shakra, Lord of the Gods, Kausika, you say, 'The bodhisattva-mahāsattvas who practice what is difficult to do are those who, when these profound dharmas are being taught, do not become doubtful or confused.'

original: sarvadharmeṣu kauśika śūnyeṣu kasyātra kāṅkṣāyitatā vā bhavati dhandhāyitatā vā bhavati /
analyzed: sarva dharmeṣu kauśika śūnyeṣu kasya atra kāṅkṣāyita tā vā bhavati dhandhāyita tā vā bhavati
translated: In all dharmas, Kausika, which are empty, who here would become doubtful or confused?

analyzed: śakraḥ āha yat yat eva ārya usubhūtiḥ nirdiśati
translated: Shakra said, Whatever the noble Subhuti explains,

analyzed: tat tat eva śūnyatām ārabhya nirdiśati
translated: he explains it all in terms of emptiness.

analyzed: na ca kvacid sajjati
translated: And he does not get stuck anywhere.

original: tadyathāpi nāma antarīkṣe iṣuḥ kṣipto naiva kvacitsajjati /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma antarīkṣe iṣuḥ kṣiptaḥ na eva kvacid sajjati
translated: Just as an arrow shot into the sky does not get stuck anywhere,

analyzed: evam eva ārya subhūteḥ dharma deśanā na kvacid sajjati
translated: in the same way, the noble Subhuti's teaching of the Dharma does not get stuck anywhere.

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmindro bhagavantametadavocatkaccidahaṃ bhagavan subhūtiṃ sthaviramārabhya evaṃ bhāṣamāṇaṃ evaṃ nirdiśaṃstathāgatasyoktavādī bhavāmi dharmavādī ca /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat kaccit aham bhagavan subhūtim sthaviram ārabhya evam bhāṣamāṇam evam nirdiśan tathāgatasya ukta vādī bhavāmi dharma vādī ca
translated: Then indeed Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, when I speak and teach like this, referring to the elder Subhūti, am I speaking the Tathāgata's words and am I a Dharma teacher?

analyzed: dharmasya ca anudharmam vyākurvan vyākaromi
translated: When I explain in accordance with the Dharma, am I explaining?

original: evamukte bhagavān śakraṃ devānāmindrametadavocatyatkhalu tvaṃ kauśika evaṃ bhāṣaseevametatkauśika / evametat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān śakram devānām indram etat avocat yat khalu tvam kauśikaḥ evam bhāṣase evam etat kauśika evam etat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said this to Śakra, Lord of the Gods: Kauśika, as for what you say, 'It is so, Kauśika. It is so.

original: evaṃ bhāṣamāṇaṃ evaṃ nirdiśaṃstathāgatasyoktavādī bhavasi dharmavādī ca /
analyzed: evam bhāṣamāṇam evam nirdiśan tathāgatasya ukta vādī bhavasi dharma vādī ca
translated: When I speak and teach like this, referring to the elder Subhūti, I am speaking the Tathāgata's words and I am a Dharma teacher.

analyzed: dharmasya ca anudharmam vyākurvan vyākaroṣi
translated: When I explain in accordance with the Dharma, I am explaining.'

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: yadyadeva hi kauśika subhūteḥ sthavirasya pratibhāti /
analyzed: yat yat eva hi kauśika subhūteḥ sthavirasya pratibhāti
translated: Whatever the elder Subhūti has insight into,

analyzed: tat tat eva kauśika śūnyatām ārabhya pratibhāti
translated: Kauśika, that is all insight into emptiness.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: subhūtirhi kauśika sthaviraḥ prajñāpāramitāmapi tāvanna samanupaśyati /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ hi kauśika sthaviraḥ prajñāpāramitām api tāvat na samanupaśyati
translated: Kauśika, the elder Subhūti does not even see the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: na upalabhate
translated: does not apprehend it.

analyzed: kutas punar yaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām carati
translated: How much less so one who practices the perfection of wisdom!

analyzed: bodhim eva tāvat na upalabhate
translated: He does not even perceive awakening.

analyzed: kim punar yaḥ bodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: How much less one who will awaken to complete awakening?

analyzed: sarvajña tām eva tāvat na upalabhate
translated: He does not even perceive omniscience.

analyzed: kutas punar yaḥ sarvajña tām anuprāpsyati
translated: How much less one who will attain omniscience?

analyzed: tathatām eva tāvat na upalabhate
translated: He does not even perceive suchness.

analyzed: kutas punar yaḥ tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: How much less a Tathāgata who will come to be?

analyzed: anutpādam eva tāvat na upalabhate
translated: He does not even perceive non-arising.

analyzed: kim punar yaḥ unutpādam sākṣātkariṣyati
translated: How much less one who will directly perceive non-arising?

analyzed: bodhisattvam eva tāvat na upalabhate
translated: He does not even perceive a bodhisattva.

analyzed: kutas punar yaḥ bodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: How much less one who will awaken to complete awakening?

analyzed: balāni eva tāvat na upalabhate
translated: He does not even perceive the powers.

analyzed: kutas punar yaḥ bala samaṅgī bhaviṣyati  vaiśāradyāni eva tāvat na upalabhate
translated: How much less one who will be endowed with the powers?🔽He does not even perceive the grounds of self-confidence.

analyzed: kutas punar yaḥ viśāradaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: How much less one who will be fearless?

analyzed: dharmam eva tāvat na upalabhate
translated: He does not even perceive the Dharma.

analyzed: kutas punar yaḥ dharmam deśayiṣyati
translated: How much less one who will teach the Dharma?

original: sarvadharmaviviktavihāreṇa sarvadharmānupalambhavihāreṇa hi kauśika subhūtiḥ sthaviro viharati /
analyzed: sarva dharma vivikta vihāreṇa sarva dharma anupalambha vihāreṇa hi kauśika subhūtiḥ sthaviraḥ viharati
translated: Kauśika, the elder Subhūti dwells by means of the dwelling of the isolation of all phenomena, by means of the dwelling of the non-apprehension of all phenomena.

original: yaḥ khalu punarayaṃ kauśika subhūteḥ sthavirasya sarvadharmaviviktavihāraḥ sarvadharmānupalambhavihāraśca /
analyzed: yaḥ khalu punar ayam kauśika subhūteḥ sthavirasya sarva dharma vivikta vihāraḥ sarva dharma anupalambha vihāraḥ ca
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, this dwelling of the elder Subhūti in the seclusion of all dharmas and in the non-apprehension of all dharmas,

original: eṣa kauśika vihāro bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carato viharataḥ śatatamīmapi kalaṃ nopaiti /
analyzed: eṣa kauśika vihāraḥ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyām carataḥ viharataḥ śatatamīm api kalam na upaiti
translated: this dwelling, Kauśika, of the bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom, does not approach even a hundredth part of the dwelling of the Tathāgata.

original: sahasratamīmapi śatasahasratamīmapi koṭītamīmapi koṭīśatatamīmapi koṭīsahasratamīmapi koṭīśatasahasratamīmapi koṭīniyutaśatasahasratamīmapi kalāṃ nopaiti /
analyzed: sahasratamīm api śata sahasratamīm api koṭītamīm api koṭī śatatamīm api koṭī sahasratamīm api koṭī śata sahasratamīm api koṭī niyuta śata sahasratamīm api kalām na upaiti
translated: It does not approach even a thousandth, a hundred thousandth, a koṭi-th, a koṭi-hundredth, a koṭi-thousandth, a koṭi-hundred-thousandth, a koṭi-nayo-hundred-thousandth part.

original: saṃkhyāmapi kalāmapi gaṇanāmapi upamāmapi aupamyamapi upanisāmapi upaniṣadamapi na kṣamate /
analyzed: saṃkhyām api kalām api gaṇanām api upamām api aupamyam api upanisām api upaniṣadam api na kṣamate
translated: It cannot bear comparison, calculation, reckoning, simile, or illustration.

original: tathāgatavihāraṃ hi kauśika sthāpayitvā tato'nyān sarvān vihārānabhibhavatyayaṃ vihāraḥ /
analyzed: tathāgata vihāram hi kauśika sthāpayitvā tatonyān sarvān vihārān abhibhavati ayam vihāraḥ
translated: Kauśika, except for the dwelling of the Tathāgata, this dwelling surpasses all other dwellings.

original: yo'yaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carato viharato vihāraḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ uyam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyām carataḥ viharataḥ vihāraḥ
translated: This is the dwelling of the bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: ayam kauśika teṣām sarva vihārāṇām agre ākhyāyate
translated: Kauśika, this is declared to be the foremost of all dwellings.

analyzed: śreṣṭhaḥ ākhyāyate  jyeṣṭhaḥ ākhyāyate  varaḥ ākhyāyate
translated: It is called the best.

original: pravara ākhyāyate /🔽praṇīta ākhyāyate /🔽uttama ākhyāyate /🔽anuttama ākhyāyate /🔽niruttara ākhyāyate /🔽asama ākhyāyate /
analyzed: pravaraḥ ākhyāyate  praṇītaḥ ākhyāyate  uttamaḥ ākhyāyate  anuttamaḥ ākhyāyate  niruttaraḥ ākhyāyate  asamaḥ ākhyāyate
translated: It is called the eldest.🔽It is called the excellent.

analyzed: asamasamaḥ ākhyāyate
translated: It is called the most excellent.

analyzed: sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddha vihārān ayam vihāraḥ abhibhavati
translated: It surpasses all the abodes of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: yo'yaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carato viharato vihāraḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ uyam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyām carataḥ viharataḥ vihāraḥ
translated: This is the abode of the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: tasmāttarhi kauśika sarvasattvānāmagratāṃ gantukāmena śreṣṭhatāṃ gantukāmena jyeṣṭhatāṃ gantukāmena varatāṃ gantukāmena pravaratāṃ gantukāmena praṇītatāṃ gantukāmena uttamatāṃ gantukāmena anuttamatāṃ gantukāmena niruttaratāṃ gantukāmena asamatāṃ gantukāmena asamasamatāṃ gantukāmena kauśika kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā anena vihāreṇa vihartavyam /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi kauśika sarva sattvānām agra tām gantu kāmena śreṣṭha tām gantu kāmena jyeṣṭha tām gantu kāmena vara tām gantu kāmena pravara tām gantu kāmena praṇīta tām gantu kāmena uttama tām gantu kāmena anuttama tām gantu kāmena niruttara tām gantu kāmena asama tām gantu kāmena asamasama tām gantu kāmena kauśika kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā anena vihāreṇa vihartavyam
translated: Therefore, Kauśika, a son of good family or daughter of good family who wishes to be foremost among all beings, who wishes to be the best, the eldest, the excellent, the most excellent, the sublime, the supreme, the unsurpassed, the unequaled, the unequaled of the unequaled, Kauśika, should dwell in this abode.

original: yo'yaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caratāṃ viharatāṃ vihāra iti //
analyzed: yaḥ uyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām prajñāpāramitāyām caratām viharatām vihāraḥ iti
translated: This is the dwelling of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice and abide in the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: ārya aṣṭasāhasrikāyām prajñāpāramitāyām sāraparivartaḥ nāma saptaviṃśatitamaḥ
translated: In the Noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines, the twenty-seventh chapter is named The Chapter on the Essence.

analyzed: avakīrṇakusuma parivartaḥ uṣṭāviṃśatitamaḥ
translated: The twenty-eighth chapter is named The Chapter on Scattered Flowers.

original: atha khalu tasmin samaye'nyataro devaputrastrāyastriṃśairdevaputraiḥ sārdhaṃ māndāravāṇi mahāmāndāravāṇi ca puṣpāṇi gṛhītvā yena bhagavāṃstenopasaṃkrāntaḥ
analyzed: atha khalu tasmin samayenyataraḥ deva putraḥ trāyastriṃśaiḥ deva putraiḥ sārdham māndāravāṇi mahā māndāravāṇi ca puṣpāṇi gṛhītvā yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: Then at that time, a certain god together with the gods of the Thirty-Three, having taken mandāra flowers and great mandāra flowers, approached the Blessed One.

original: ṣaṣṭhaṃ śataṃ ca bhikṣūṇāṃ tasminneva samaye tasyāmeva parṣadi saṃnipatitaṃ saṃniṣaṇṇaṃ cābhūt /
analyzed: ṣaṣṭham śatam ca bhikṣūṇām tasmin eva samaye tasyām eva parṣadi saṃnipatitam saṃniṣaṇṇam ca abhūt
translated: And six hundred monks at that very time were assembled and seated in that very assembly.

original: te utthāyāsanebhya ekāṃsānyuttarāsaṅgāni kṛtvā dakṣiṇāni jānumaṇḍalāni pṛthivyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavāṃstenāñjaliṃ praṇamayāmāsuḥ /
analyzed: te utthāya āsanebhyaḥ eka aṃsāni uttarāsaṅgāni kṛtvā dakṣiṇāni jānu maṇḍalāni pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavān tena añjalim praṇamayāmāsuḥ
translated: They rose from their seats, put their upper robes over one shoulder, placed their right knees on the ground, bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined,

original: teṣā bhikṣūṇāṃ buddhānubhāvena te'ñjalipragrahā māndāravamahāmāndāravāṇāṃ puṣpāṇāṃ paripūrṇā abhūvan /
analyzed: teṣām bhikṣūṇām buddha anubhāvena te añjali pragrahāḥ māndārava mahāmāndāravāṇām puṣpāṇām paripūrṇāḥ abhūvan
translated: and by the Buddha's power, those palms filled with mandāra and great mandāra flowers.

analyzed: te taiḥ māndāravaiḥ mahā māndāravaiḥ ca puṣpaiḥ tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham avākiran  abhyavākiran
translated: They scattered the great coral tree flowers and great māndārava flowers on the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.🔽They scattered them again.

analyzed: abhiprākiran
translated: They scattered them once more.

original: evaṃ ca vācamabhāṣantavayaṃ bhagavan asyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ cariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: evam ca vācam abhāṣantau ayam bhagavan asyām prajñāpāramitāyām cariṣyāmaḥ
translated: And they spoke these words: Blessed One, we will practice this perfection of wisdom.

original: vayaṃ bhagavan anena anuttareṇa prajñāpāramitāvihāreṇa vihāriṣyāma iti //
analyzed: vayam bhagavan anena anuttareṇa prajñāpāramitā vihāreṇa vihāriṣyāmaḥ iti
translated: Blessed One, we will dwell in this unsurpassed dwelling of the perfection of wisdom.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāṃ smitaṃ prādurakarot /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām smitam prādurakarot
translated: Then at that time the Blessed One manifested a smile.

original: dharmatā khalu punareṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatām yadā smitaṃ prāduṣkurvanti /
analyzed: dharmatā khalu punar eṣām buddhānām bhagavatām yadā smitam prāduṣkurvanti
translated: It is the nature of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, that when they manifest a smile,

original: atha tadā nānāvarṇā anekavarṇā raśmayo bhagavato mukhadvārānniścarantitadyathā nīlapītalohitāvadātamāñjiṣṭhasphaṭikarajatasuvarṇavarṇāḥ /
analyzed: atha tadā nānā varṇāḥ aneka varṇāḥ raśmayaḥ bhagavataḥ mukha dvārāt niścaranti tat yathā nīla pīta lohita avadāta māñjiṣṭha sphaṭika rajata suvarṇa varṇāḥ
translated: then at that time rays of light of various colors, of many colors, issued forth from the mouth of the Blessed One, namely blue, yellow, red, white, crimson, crystal, silver, and golden colors.

original: te niścarya anantāparyantān lokadhātūnābhayā avabhāsya yāvadbrahmalokamabhyudgamya punareva pratyudāvṛtya bhagavantaṃ triḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya bhagavato mūrdhanyantardhīyante //
analyzed: te niścarya ananta aparyantān lokadhātūn ābhayā avabhāsya yāvat brahma lokam abhyudgamya punar eva pratyudāvṛtya bhagavantam tris pradakṣiṇīkṛtya bhagavataḥ mūrdhani antardhīyante
translated: They emerged and illuminated the infinite and limitless world systems with their radiance, ascended as far as the Brahma world, and then returned again. They circled the Blessed One three times and disappeared into the Blessed One's head.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmānānanda utthāyāsanādekāṃsamuttarāsaṅgaṃ kṛtvā dakṣiṇaṃ jānumaṇḍalaṃ pṛthivyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavāṃstenāñjaliṃ praṇamayya bhagavantametadavocat nāhetukaṃ nāpratyayaṃ tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ smitaṃ prāduṣkurvanti /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān ānandaḥ utthāya āsanāt eka aṃsam uttarāsaṅgam kṛtvā dakṣiṇam jānu maṇḍalam pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavān tena añjalim praṇamayya bhagavantam etat avocat na ahetukam na apratyayam tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ smitam prāduṣkurvanti
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda rose from his seat, placed his upper robe over one shoulder, placed his right knee on the ground, bowed to the Blessed One with his palms together, and said to the Blessed One, The Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones do not smile without a cause or condition.

analyzed: kaḥ bhagavan hetuḥ
translated: What is the cause, Blessed One?

analyzed: kaḥ pratyayaḥ smitasya prāduṣkaraṇāya
translated: What is the condition for smiling?

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantamānandametadavocatidamānanda bhikṣūṇāṃ ṣaṣṭhaṃ śatamanāgate'dhvani tārakopame kalpe anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyate /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam etat avocat idam ānanda bhikṣūṇām ṣaṣṭham śatam anāgata idhvani tāraka upame kalpe anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda, Ānanda, in the future, in the eon named Tāraka, these six hundred monks will fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: abhisaṃbudhya ca sattvebhyaḥ dharmam deśayiṣyati
translated: And having fully awakened, they will teach the Dharma to beings.

analyzed: sarve ca eka nāmānaḥ bhaviṣyanti yat uta avakīrṇa kusuma nāmānaḥ
translated: And all of them will have the same name, which will be Avakiṛṇakusuma.

original: tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ śāstāro loke bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ śāstāraḥ loke bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will be Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened Ones, Teachers, in the world.

original: teṣāṃ khalu punarānanda avakīrṇakusumanāmnāṃ tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ sarveṣāṃ samaḥ śrāvakasaṃgho bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: teṣām khalu punar ānanda avakīrṇakusuma nāmnām tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām sarveṣām samaḥ śrāvaka saṃghaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And, Ānanda, the Saṅgha of hearers of all those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened Ones named Avakiṛṇakusuma will be the same.

original: sarveṣāṃ ca teṣāmavakīrṇakusumanāmnāṃ tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ samamevāyuḥpramāṇaṃ bhaviṣyati viṃśatikalpasahasrāṇi /
analyzed: sarveṣām ca teṣām avakīrṇakusuma nāmnām tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām samam eva āyuḥ pramāṇam bhaviṣyati viṃśati kalpa sahasrāṇi
translated: And the lifespan of all those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened Ones named Avakiṛṇakusuma will be the same, twenty thousand eons.

original: sarveṣāmeva caikaikasya vaistārikaṃ pravacanaṃ bhaviṣyati pṛthuvaipulyaprāptaṃ devamanuṣyeṣu /
analyzed: sarveṣām eva ca ekaikasya vaistārikam pravacanam bhaviṣyati pṛthu vaipulya prāptam deva manuṣyeṣu
translated: And the teaching of each and every one of them will be extensive, widespread, and well-known among gods and humans.

analyzed: sarveṣām eva ca saddharmaḥ samam sthāsyati
translated: And the True Dharma of all of them will remain the same.

analyzed: viṃśatim eva kalpa sahasrāṇi ekaikasya
translated: For twenty thousand eons each.

original: sarve ca te yato yata eva grāmanagaranigamajanapadarāṣṭrarājadhānīto'bhiniṣkramiṣyanti /
analyzed: sarve ca te yatas yatas eva grāma nagara nigama janapada rāṣṭra rājadhānī itas abhiniṣkramiṣyanti
translated: And wherever they will go forth from villages, towns, cities, countries, kingdoms, and capitals,

analyzed: abhiniṣkramya yatra yatra dharmacakram pravartayiṣyanti
translated: and having gone forth, wherever they will turn the wheel of Dharma,

original: pravartya ca yatra yatra ca vihariṣyanti /🔽yato yataśca yatra yatraiva ca pravekṣanti /
analyzed: pravartya ca yatra yatra ca vihariṣyanti  yatas yatas ca yatra yatra eva ca pravekṣanti
translated: And wherever they will dwell,🔽and from wherever and wherever they will enter,

original: yena yena ca yato yata eva cābhiniṣkramiṣyanti /
analyzed: yena yena ca yatas yatas eva ca abhiniṣkramiṣyanti
translated: and by whatever and from wherever they will emerge,

original: tatastatastatra tatra teṣāṃ praviśatāmabhiniṣkrāmatāṃ viharatāṃ ca pañcavarṇikānāṃ puṣpāṇāṃ puṣpavarṣāḥ pravartiṣyante /
analyzed: tatas tatas tatra tatra teṣām praviśatām abhiniṣkrāmatām viharatām ca pañca varṇikānām puṣpāṇām puṣpa varṣāḥ pravartiṣyante
translated: from there and there, there and there, as they enter, emerge, and dwell, there will fall a rain of flowers of five colors.

original: tasmāttarhi ānanda bodhisattvairmahāsattvairuttamena vihāreṇa vihartukāmaiḥ prajñāpāramitāvihāreṇa vihartavyam /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi ānanda bodhisattvaiḥ mahāsattvaiḥ uttamena vihāreṇa vihartu kāmaiḥ prajñāpāramitā vihāreṇa vihartavyam
translated: Therefore, Ānanda, bodhisattva mahāsattvas who wish to dwell in the supreme dwelling should dwell in the dwelling of the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: tathāgata vihāreṇa ānanda vihartu kāmaiḥ prajñāpāramitā vihāreṇa vihartavyam
translated: Ānanda, those who wish to dwell in the Tathāgata's dwelling should dwell in the dwelling of the perfection of wisdom.

original: ye hi kecidānanda bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ cariṣyanti /
analyzed: ye hi kecid ānanda bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyām cariṣyanti
translated: Ānanda, those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who will practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: niṣṭhā tatra gantavyā manuṣyebhya evaite cyutā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: niṣṭhā tatra gantavyā manuṣyebhyaḥ eva ete cyutāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: it should be concluded that they have died from among humans and will be reborn here.

original: te ihopapannāstuṣitebhya eva vā devanikāyebhyaścyutā bhaviṣyanti manuṣyeṣvevopapannāḥ /
analyzed: te iha upapannāḥ tuṣitebhyaḥ eva vā devanikāyebhyaḥ cyutāḥ bhaviṣyanti manuṣyeṣu eva upapannāḥ
translated: They will be reborn here, having died from among the Tuṣita gods or other classes of gods, and will be reborn among humans.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: tathā hi manuṣyeṣu tuṣiteṣu ca deveṣu iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā vistareṇa pracariṣyatīti /
analyzed: tathā hi manuṣyeṣu tuṣiteṣu ca deveṣu iyam prajñāpāramitā vistareṇa pracariṣyati iti
translated: For thus this perfection of wisdom will be practiced extensively among humans and gods in the Tuṣita heaven.

original: tathāgatāvalokitāḥ khalu punarānanda te bodhisattvā mahāsattvā veditavyāḥ /🔽ya iha prajñāpāramitāyāṃ cariṣyanti /
analyzed: tathāgata avalokitāḥ khalu punar ānanda te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ veditavyāḥ  ye iha prajñāpāramitāyām cariṣyanti
translated: Ānanda, those bodhisattva mahāsattvas should be known as having been looked at by the Tathāgata.🔽Those who will practice this perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: ye imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyanti
translated: those who will take up this perfection of wisdom,

original: dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyantyupadekṣyantyuddekṣyanti svādhyāsyanti /
analyzed: dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyanti upadekṣyanti uddekṣyanti su ādhyāsyanti
translated: those who will bear it in mind, recite it, master it, teach it, explain it, expound it, proclaim it, chant it, and study it,

analyzed: antaśas likhiṣyanti
translated: even those who will write it out,

original: udgṛhya dhārayitvā vācayitvā paryavāpya pravartya deśayitvopadiśyoddiśya svādhyāyya antaśo likhitvā bodhisattvān mahāsattvānavavadiṣyanti anuśāsiṣyanti saṃdarśayiṣyanti samādāpayiṣyanti samuttejayiṣyanti saṃpraharṣayiṣyanti /
analyzed: udgṛhya dhārayitvā vācayitvā paryavāpya pravartya deśayitvā upadiśya uddiśya su ādhyāyya antaśas likhitvā bodhisattvān mahāsattvān avavadiṣyanti anuśāsiṣyanti saṃdarśayiṣyanti samādāpayiṣyanti samuttejayiṣyanti saṃpraharṣayiṣyanti
translated: having taken it up, borne it in mind, recited it, mastered it, taught it, explained it, expounded it, proclaimed it, chanted it, and studied it, even having written it out, will instruct, teach, and demonstrate to the bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: avaropitakuśalamūlāste ānanda bodhisattvā mahāsattvā veditavyāstathāgateṣvarhatsu samyaksaṃbuddheṣu /
analyzed: avaropita kuśala mūlāḥ te ānanda bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ veditavyāḥ tathāgateṣu arhatsu samyaksaṃbuddheṣu
translated: Ānanda, those bodhisattva mahāsattvas should be known as having planted wholesome roots with the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones.

original: na kevalaṃ śrāvakapratyekabuddhānāmantike taiḥ kuśalamūlānyavaropitāni iha prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣitum /
analyzed: na kevalam śrāvaka pratyekabuddhānām antike taiḥ kuśala mūlāni avaropitāni iha prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣitum
translated: Not only did they plant wholesome roots in the presence of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas in order to train in this perfection of wisdom.

original: niḥsaṃśayaṃ khalu punarānanda tathāgateṣvarhatsu samyaksaṃbuddheṣu taiḥ kuśalamūlānyavaropitāni bodhisattvairmahāsattvaiḥ /
analyzed: niḥsaṃśayam khalu punar ānanda tathāgateṣu arhatsu samyaksaṃbuddheṣu taiḥ kuśala mūlāni avaropitāni bodhisattvaiḥ mahāsattvaiḥ
translated: But, Ānanda, without a doubt, those bodhisattva mahāsattvas have planted wholesome roots in the presence of the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened buddhas,

analyzed: ye iha prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣante
translated: who train in this perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: na ca utrāsam āpadyante
translated: And they do not become frightened.

original: ye ca ānanda enāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyantyupadekṣyantyuddekṣyanti svādhyāsyanti likhiṣyanti ca /
analyzed: ye ca ānanda enām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyanti upadekṣyanti uddekṣyanti su ādhyāsyanti likhiṣyanti ca
translated: And, Ānanda, those who will receive this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, understand it, teach it, explain it, chant it, memorize it, write it,

analyzed: arthataḥ ca dharmataḥ ca nayataḥ ca anugamiṣyanti
translated: and follow it in terms of its meaning, its teaching, and its principle,

original: niṣṭhā ānanda tatra gantavyāsaṃmukhībhūtāste abhūvan bodhisattvā mahāsattvāstathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāmiti /
analyzed: niṣṭhā ānanda tatra gantavyā a saṃmukhībhūtāḥ te abhūvan bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām iti
translated: Ānanda, you should conclude that they have been face-to-face with the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened buddhas.

analyzed: ye ca enām prajñāpāramitām na pratikrośanti
translated: And those who do not revile this perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: na prativahanti
translated: who do not oppose it,

analyzed: na pratikopayanti
translated: They do not oppose.

analyzed: na pratisaṃharanti  na pratiṣedhayanti
translated: They do not withdraw.🔽They do not prohibit.

analyzed: na pratikṣipanti
translated: They do not reject.

analyzed: na pratibādhitavyām maṃsyante
translated: They will not consider it to be something to be opposed.

analyzed: te api ānanda bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ pūrva jina kṛta adhikārāḥ veditavyāḥ
translated: Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas, Ānanda, should be known as those who have served the victorious ones in the past.

original: kiṃcāpyānanda bodhisattvena mahāsattvena tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāmantike kuśalamūlamavaropitam /
analyzed: kiṃca api ānanda bodhisattvena mahāsattvena tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām antike kuśala mūlam avaropitam
translated: Moreover, Ānanda, the bodhisattva mahāsattva has planted roots of virtue in the presence of the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones.

original: evaṃ hi tanna śrāvakapratyekabuddhatvāya dāsyati vipākam /
analyzed: evam hi tat na śrāvaka pratyekabuddha tvāya dāsyati vipākam
translated: Thus, it will not give a ripening for the state of a śrāvaka or pratyekabuddha.

original: sacedbodhisattvo mahāsattvo'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau na visaṃvādayiṣyati praṇidhānam /
analyzed: saced bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ unuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau na visaṃvādayiṣyati praṇidhānam
translated: If the bodhisattva mahāsattva does not go back on his vow for highest genuine full Awakening,

original: api tu khalu punarānanda prāyeṇa tena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena kṛtajñena bhavitavyaṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caritavatā /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar ānanda prāyeṇa tena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena kṛtajñena bhavitavyam prajñāpāramitāyām caritavatā
translated: and moreover, Ānanda, the bodhisattva mahāsattva has generally become grateful, having practiced the perfection of wisdom.

original: tasmāttarhi te ānanda parīndāmi anuparīndāmi imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ bhūyasyā mātrayā akṣarasaṃnipātādudgrahaṇāya dhāraṇāya vācanāya paryavāptaye pravartanāya cirasthitaye yatheyaṃ nāntardhīyeta /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi te ānanda parīndāmi anuparīndāmi imām prajñāpāramitām bhūyasyā mātrayā akṣara saṃnipātāt udgrahaṇāya dhāraṇāya vācanāya paryavāptaye pravartanāya cira sthitaye yathā iyam na antardhīyeta
translated: Therefore, Ananda, I entrust, I fully entrust this perfection of wisdom to you, for the sake of its being taken up, borne in mind, recited, mastered, promulgated, and for the sake of its long duration, in even more letters than it has now.

original: sacettvamānanda yo mayā te dharmo deśitaḥ sākṣāt sthāpayitvā prajñāpāramitām /🔽tāṃ sarvāṃ dharmadeśanāmudgṛhya punareva vipraṇāśayeḥ /
analyzed: saced tvam ānanda yaḥ mayā te dharmaḥ deśitaḥ sākṣāt sthāpayitvā prajñāpāramitām  tām sarvām dharma deśanām udgṛhya punar eva vipraṇāśayeḥ
translated: If you, Ananda, were to take up and then lose again,🔽give up again, forget again,

analyzed: punar eva utsṛjeḥ vismārayeḥ
translated: all the Dharma that I have taught, except for the perfection of wisdom,

original: na me tvamānanda etāvatā aparāddhaḥ syāḥ /
analyzed: na me tvam ānanda etāvatā aparāddhaḥ syāḥ
translated: you would not thereby offend against me, Ananda.

original: yatkhalu punastvamānanda prajñāpāramitāpratisaṃyuktaṃ padaṃ vā padasāmantakaṃ vā nāśayeḥ /
analyzed: yat khalu punar tvam ānanda prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktam padam vā pada sāmantakam vā nāśayeḥ
translated: But if you, Ananda, were to destroy even a single word or a half-line of the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: utsṛjeḥ
translated: give it up,

analyzed: vismārayeḥ
translated: forget it,

analyzed: tāvatā tvam ānanda mama aparāddhaḥ syāḥ
translated: you would thereby offend against me, Ananda.

analyzed: na ca me tvam cittam ārādhayeḥ
translated: You would not please me.

analyzed: saced punar tvam ānanda prajñāpāramitām udgṛhya punar eva nāśayeḥ  punar eva utsṛjeḥ
translated: If you, Ananda, were to take up the perfection of wisdom, and then lose it again,🔽give it up again,

analyzed: vismārayeḥ
translated: forget it again,

analyzed: na tvayā aham satkṛtaḥ gurukṛtaḥ syām
translated: You have not honored me, made me your guru,

original: na mānito na pūjito nārcito nāpacāyitaḥ syām /
analyzed: na mānitaḥ na pūjitaḥ na arcitaḥ na apacāyitaḥ syām
translated: nor have you respected, revered, worshiped, or served me.

original: ye'pi te ānanda atītānāgatapratyutpannā buddhā bhagavantaḥ /
analyzed: ye pi te ānanda atīta anāgata pratyutpannāḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ
translated: Ānanda, those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, who have passed away, are yet to come, and who are present,

original: te'pi tvayā ānanda na satkṛtā na gurukṛtā na mānitā na pūjitā nārcitā nāpacāyitā bhavanti /
analyzed: te api tvayā ānanda na satkṛtāḥ na gurukṛtāḥ na mānitāḥ na pūjitāḥ na arcitāḥ na apacāyitāḥ bhavanti
translated: they also have not been honored, made gurus, respected, revered, worshiped, or served by you.

analyzed: saced punar tvam ānanda prajñāpāramitām udgṛhya punar eva nāśayeḥ
translated: Ānanda, if you were to take up the perfection of wisdom, and then destroy it,

analyzed: punar eva utsṛjeḥ
translated: then let it go,

analyzed: vismārayeḥ
translated: forget it,

analyzed: tāvatā tvam ānanda mama aparāddhaḥ syāḥ
translated: to that extent you would have offended against me.

analyzed: na ca me tvam cittam ārādhayeḥ
translated: And you would not have pleased my mind.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: uktametadānanda tathāgatenaprajñāpāramitā atītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ mātā jananī janayitrī sarvajñatāyā āhāriketi /
analyzed: uktam etat ānanda tathāgatena prajñāpāramitā atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām mātā jananī janayitrī sarvajña tāyāḥ āhārikā iti
translated: Ānanda, this has been said by the Tathāgata: 'The perfection of wisdom is the mother, the progenitor, the producer of the past, future, and present Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones, and it provides the knowledge of all modes.'

original: tasmāttarhi ānanda parīndāmi anuparīndāmi te imāṃ prajñāpāramitām /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi ānanda parīndāmi anuparīndāmi te imām prajñāpāramitām
translated: Therefore, Ānanda, I entrust, I fully entrust to you this perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: yathā iyam na antardhīyeta
translated: so that it will not disappear.

analyzed: udgrahītavyā iyam ānanda prajñāpāramitā
translated: Ānanda, this perfection of wisdom should be taken up.

analyzed: dhārayitavyā iyam ānanda prajñāpāramitā
translated: Ananda, this perfection of wisdom should be borne in mind.

analyzed: vācayitavyā iyam ānanda prajñāpāramitā  paryavāptavyā iyam ānanda prajñāpāramitā
translated: Ananda, this perfection of wisdom should be recited.🔽Ananda, this perfection of wisdom should be fully grasped.

analyzed: pravartayitavyā iyam ānanda prajñāpāramitā  deśayitavyā iyam ānanda prajñāpāramitā  upadeṣṭavyā iyam ānanda prajñāpāramitā
translated: Ananda, this perfection of wisdom should be practiced.🔽Ananda, this perfection of wisdom should be taught.🔽Ananda, this perfection of wisdom should be instructed in.

analyzed: uddeṣṭavyā iyam ānanda prajñāpāramitā  su ādhyātavyā iyam ānanda prajñāpāramitā
translated: Ananda, this perfection of wisdom should be expounded.🔽Ananda, this perfection of wisdom should be recited to oneself.

analyzed: likhitavyā iyam ānanda prajñāpāramitā  bhāvayitavyā iyam ānanda prajñāpāramitā
translated: Ananda, this perfection of wisdom should be written.🔽Ananda, this perfection of wisdom should be contemplated.

original: sumanasikṛtā ca sudhṛtā ca suparyavāptā ca supravartitā ca tvayā ānanda iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā kartavyā /
analyzed: su manasi kṛtā ca su dhṛtā ca su paryavāptā ca su pravartitā ca tvayā ānanda iyam prajñāpāramitā kartavyā
translated: Ananda, this perfection of wisdom should be well attended to, well borne in mind, well grasped, well practiced by you.

analyzed: su parivyaktena akṣara pada vyañjanena su niruktā ca udgrahītavyā
translated: It should be well-defined in terms of letters, words, and syllables, and well-grasped in terms of good definitions.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: atītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ hi ānanda tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ dharmakāyateti tāṃ dharmatāṃ pramāṇīkṛtya /
analyzed: atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām hi ānanda tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām dharmakāya tā iti tām dharmatām pramāṇīkṛtya
translated: Because, Ananda, the Dharma body of the past, future, and present Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones is that reality, having taken that reality as authoritative.

original: yathā tattvamānanda etarhi me tathāgatasya tiṣṭhato dhriyamāṇasya yāpayato hitaiṣitayā premato vā gauravato vā kalyāṇato vā sparśavihārato vā kartavyaṃ vā dātavyaṃ vā samanvāhartavyaṃ vā manyase /
analyzed: yathā tattvam ānanda etarhi me tathāgatasya tiṣṭhataḥ dhriyamāṇasya yāpayataḥ hita eṣitayā premataḥ vā gauravataḥ vā kalyāṇataḥ vā sparśa vihārataḥ vā kartavyam vā dātavyam vā samanvāhartavyam vā manyase
translated: Just as you think now, For the benefit of the Tathāgata who abides, supports, and endures, out of love, affection, respect, and the wish for what is wholesome, I should do this, give this, or pay attention to this,

original: tathaiva tvayā ānanda iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā udgrahītavyā dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā pravartayitavyā deśayitavyā upadeṣṭavyā uddeṣṭavyā svādhyātavyā likhitavyā bhāvayitavyā satkartavyā gurukartavyā mānayitavyā pūjayitavyā arcayitavyā apacāyitavyā /
analyzed: tathā eva tvayā ānanda iyam prajñāpāramitā udgrahītavyā dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā pravartayitavyā deśayitavyā upadeṣṭavyā uddeṣṭavyā su ādhyātavyā likhitavyā bhāvayitavyā satkartavyā gurukartavyā mānayitavyā pūjayitavyā arcayitavyā apacāyitavyā
translated: in the same way, Ānanda, you should take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, understand it, teach it, transmit it, chant it, memorize it, write it, contemplate it, honor it, respect it, revere it, make offerings to it, and venerate it.

original: tayā hitaiṣitayā tena premṇā tena gauraveṇa tayā guṇavattayā /
analyzed: tayā hita eṣitayā tena premṇā tena gauraveṇa tayā guṇavat tayā
translated: With that wish for benefit, that love, that respect, and that possession of virtues,

original: evaṃ tvayā ānanda ahaṃ pūjito bhavāmi /
analyzed: evam tvayā ānanda aham pūjitaḥ bhavāmi
translated: in that way, Ānanda, you honor me.

analyzed: te ca bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ
translated: And those bodhisattva mahāsattvas,

original: atītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ ca buddhānāṃ bhagavatāmantike prema ca prasādaśca gauravaṃ cotpāditaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām ca buddhānām bhagavatām antike prema ca prasādaḥ ca gauravam ca utpāditam bhavati
translated: and you generate love, faith, and respect for the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, of the past, future, and present.🔽And you will not be separated from the perfection of wisdom, and you will not be separated from the perfection of concentration, perfection of perseverance, perfection of patience, perfection of morality, and perfection of giving.

original: yadi te ānanda ahaṃ priyo manaāpo'parityaktastathāgataḥ /
analyzed: yadi te ānanda aham priyaḥ manaāpa uparityaktaḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: If, Ananda, you love and delight in me, and do not abandon the Tathagata,

original: tataste ānanda iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā priyā manaāpā aparityajanīyā bhavatu /
analyzed: tatas te ānanda iyam prajñāpāramitā priyā manaāpā a parityajanīyā bhavatu
translated: then, Ananda, this perfection of wisdom should be loved and delighted in, and not abandoned by you.

analyzed: yathā te eka padam api na praṇaśyet
translated: So that not even a single word of it may be lost.

analyzed: yathā na antardhīyeta
translated: So that it may not disappear.

original: bahvapi te ānanda ahaṃ bhāṣeyaṃ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ parīndanāmāramya kalpaṃ vā kalpāvaśeṣaṃ vā kalpaśataṃ vā kalpasahasraṃ vā kalpaśatasahasraṃ vā kalpakoṭīṃ vā kalpakoṭīśataṃ vā kalpakoṭīsahasraṃ vā kalpakoṭīśatasahasraṃ vā tato vā upari /🔽saṃkṣepeṇa ānanda yādṛśastavāhaṃ śāstā /
analyzed: bahu api te ānanda aham bhāṣeyam prajñāpāramitāyāḥ parīndanām āramya kalpam vā kalpa avaśeṣam vā kalpa śatam vā kalpa sahasram vā kalpa śata sahasram vā kalpa koṭīm vā kalpa koṭī śatam vā kalpa koṭī sahasram vā kalpa koṭī śata sahasram vā tatas vā upari  saṃkṣepeṇa ānanda yādṛśaḥ tava aham śāstā
translated: Even if I were to speak, Ananda, for an eon or the remainder of an eon, or for a hundred or a thousand or a hundred thousand eons, or for a koṭi of eons, or a hundred or a thousand or a hundred thousand koṭis of eons, or even more than that, about the entrusting of the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: tādṛśī te prajñāpāramitā śāstā
translated: in brief, Ananda, the perfection of wisdom is your teacher, just as I am your teacher.

original: yādṛśāste atītānāgatapratyutpannā buddhā bhagavantaḥ sadevamānuṣāsurasya lokasya śāstāraḥ /
analyzed: yādṛśāḥ te atīta anāgata pratyutpannāḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ sa deva mānuṣa asurasya lokasya śāstāraḥ
translated: The perfection of wisdom is your teacher, just as the Buddhas, the Lords of the past, future, and present, are the teachers of the world with its gods, men, and Asuras.

analyzed: tādṛśī prajñāpāramitā sa deva mānuṣa asurasya lokasya śāstā
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the teacher of the world with its gods, men, and Asuras, just as those Buddhas, the Lords, are.

analyzed: tasmāt tarhi ānanda aparimāṇā prajñāpāramitā
translated: Therefore, Ananda, the perfection of wisdom is immeasurable.

original: aparimāṇayā parīndanayā prajñāpāramitāṃ te parīndāmyanuparīndāmi sadevamānuṣāsurasya lokasya hitāya sukhāya /
analyzed: aparimāṇayā parīndanayā prajñāpāramitām te parīndāmi anuparīndāmi sa deva mānuṣa asurasya lokasya hitāya sukhāya
translated: I entrust, I fully entrust the perfection of wisdom to you, Ananda, with an immeasurable entrusting, for the benefit and happiness of the world with its gods, men, and Asuras.

analyzed: yasya ānanda tathāgataḥ na parityaktaḥ
translated: Ananda, he who has not abandoned the Tathagata,

analyzed: dharmaḥ na parityaktaḥ
translated: who has not abandoned the Dharma,

analyzed: saṃghaḥ na parityaktaḥ
translated: who has not abandoned the Sangha,

analyzed: atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām buddhānām bhagavatām bodhiḥ na parityaktā
translated: who has not abandoned the enlightenment of the Buddhas, the Lords, of the past, future, and present,

analyzed: tasya prajñāpāramitā a parityaktā bhavatu
translated: for him the perfection of wisdom will not be abandoned.

analyzed: iyam asmākam anuśāsanī
translated: This is our instruction.

analyzed: yaḥ api kaścid ānandaḥ enām prajñāpāramitām udgṛhṇīyāt dhārayet paryat vācayet āpnuyāt pravartayet deśayet upadiśet uddiśet su ādhyāyet likhet bhāvayet
translated: And whoever, Ananda, would take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite and study it, be devoted to it as written, and meditate on it as well,

original: atītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ tena bodhiranuparigṛhītā bhavet /
analyzed: atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām buddhānām bhagavatām tena bodhiḥ anuparigṛhītā bhavet
translated: he would take hold of the enlightenment of the Buddhas, the Lords, of the past, future, and present.

original: yo hi kaścidānanda enāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ pralujyamānāmanuparigṛhṇīte /
analyzed: yaḥ hi kaścid ānandaḥ enām prajñāpāramitām pralujyamānām anuparigṛhṇīte
translated: Whoever, Ananda, would take hold of this perfection of wisdom when it is being destroyed,

original: atītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ tena bodhiranuparigṛhītā bhavati /
analyzed: atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām buddhānām bhagavatām tena bodhiḥ anuparigṛhītā bhavati
translated: he would take hold of the enlightenment of the Buddhas, the Lords, of the past, future, and present.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: prajñāpāramitānirjātā hi ānanda buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ bodhiḥ /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā nirjātā hi ānanda buddhānām bhagavatām bodhiḥ
translated: Ānanda, the enlightenment of the Blessed Buddhas is born from the perfection of wisdom.

original: ye'pi te ānanda abhūvannatīte'dhvani tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ /
analyzed: ye api te ānanda abhūvan atīta idhvani tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: Ānanda, those who were Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones in the past,

original: teṣāmapyānanda buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ prajñāpāramitānirjātaiva anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhirabhūt /
analyzed: teṣām api ānanda buddhānām bhagavatām prajñāpāramitā nirjātā eva anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ abhūt
translated: Ānanda, the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment of those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, was also born from the perfection of wisdom.

original: te'pi te ānanda anāgate'dhvani bhaviṣyanti tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ /
analyzed: te api te ānanda anāgata idhvani bhaviṣyanti tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: Ānanda, those who will be Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones in the future,

original: teṣāmapyānanda buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ prajñāpāramitānirjātaiva anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhirbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: teṣām api ānanda buddhānām bhagavatām prajñāpāramitā nirjātā eva anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Ānanda, the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment of those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, will also be born from the perfection of wisdom.

original: ye'pi te ānanda aprameyeṣvasaṃkhyeṣu lokadhātuṣu tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā etarhi tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti /
analyzed: ye api te ānanda aprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeṣu lokadhātuṣu tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ etarhi tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti
translated: Ānanda, those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones who are now present, alive, and well, in immeasurable and incalculable world systems,

original: teṣāmapyānanda buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ prajñāpāramitānirjātaiva anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ /
analyzed: teṣām api ānanda buddhānām bhagavatām prajñāpāramitā nirjātā eva anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ
translated: Ānanda, the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment of those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, is also born from the perfection of wisdom.

original: tasmāttarhi ānanda bodhisattvena mahāsattvena anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃboddhukāmena ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu śikṣitukāmena iyameva prajñāpāramitā śrotavyā udgrahītavyā dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā pravartayitavyā deśayitavyopadeṣṭavyoddeṣṭavyā svādhyātavyā likhitavyā /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi ānanda bodhisattvena mahāsattvena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhu kāmena ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu śikṣitu kāmena iyam eva prajñāpāramitā śrotavyā udgrahītavyā dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā pravartayitavyā deśayitavyā upadeṣṭavyā uddeṣṭavyā su ādhyātavyā likhitavyā
translated: Therefore, Ānanda, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, who wishes to train in the six perfections, should listen to, take up, keep, recite, master, and teach this perfection of wisdom. It should be explained, expounded, recited, and written out.

analyzed: iha eva prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣitavyam yogam āpattavyam
translated: One should train in this very perfection of wisdom and apply oneself to it.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: eṣā hi ānanda prajñāpāramitā bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ mātā jananī janayitrī /
analyzed: eṣā hi ānanda prajñāpāramitā bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām mātā jananī janayitrī
translated: Because, Ānanda, this perfection of wisdom is the mother, the progenitor, of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: ye'pi kecidānanda bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu śikṣitvā niryātāḥ /
analyzed: ye api kecid ānanda bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu śikṣitvā niryātāḥ
translated: Ānanda, those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have trained in the six perfections and have gone forth,

original: niryāsyanti niryānti ca anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /🔽sarve te ānanda prajñāpāramitāmāgamya ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu śikṣitāḥ /
analyzed: niryāsyanti niryānti ca anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau  sarve te ānanda prajñāpāramitām āgamya ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu śikṣitāḥ
translated: will go forth, and are going forth to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,🔽Ānanda, all of them have trained in the six perfections by relying on this perfection of wisdom.

original: te'pi sarve enāmeva prajñāpāramitāmāgamya ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu nirjātāḥ /
analyzed: te api sarve enām eva prajñāpāramitām āgamya ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu nirjātāḥ
translated: All of them, having relied on just this perfection of wisdom, have gone forth in the six perfections.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: prajñāpāramitānirjātā hi ānanda sarvāḥ pāramitāḥ āhārikā bhavantyanuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā nirjātāḥ hi ānanda sarvāḥ pāramitāḥ āhārikāḥ bhavanti anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: Ānanda, all the perfections are born from the perfection of wisdom and are the providers of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: tasmāttarhi ānanda bhūyasyā mātrayā enāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ dvitīyakamapi tṛtīyakamapi parīndāmyanuparīndāmi te /🔽yatheyaṃ nāntardhīyeta /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi ānanda bhūyasyā mātrayā enām prajñāpāramitām dvitīyakam api tṛtīyakam api parīndāmi anuparīndāmi te  yathā iyam na antardhīyeta
translated: Therefore, Ānanda, I entrust and re-entrust this perfection of wisdom to you even a second and a third time, so that it may not disappear.

original: eṣā hi ānanda tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāmakṣayo dharmakoṣaḥ /
analyzed: eṣā hi ānanda tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām akṣayaḥ dharma koṣaḥ
translated: For this, Ānanda, is the inexhaustible Dharma treasure of the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones.

analyzed: yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: Namely, the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: yo hi ānanda atīte'dhvani anavarāgre saṃsāre sattvānāṃ buddhairbhagavadbhirdharmo deśitaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ hi ānanda atīta idhvani an avara agre saṃsāre sattvānām buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ dharmaḥ deśitaḥ
translated: Ānanda, the Dharma that was taught by the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, for the sake of beings in the past, in the beginningless continuum of saṃsāra,

analyzed: sarvaḥ saḥ itas eva dharma koṣāt
translated: all of that is from this very Dharma treasure.

analyzed: yat uta prajñāpāramitātaḥ
translated: Namely, from the perfection of wisdom.

original: ye'pi te ānanda anāgate'dhvani buddhā bhagavanto'parimite saṃsāre'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhya sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayiṣyanti /
analyzed: ye api te ānanda anāgata idhvani buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ uparimite saṃsāre anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhya sattvānām dharmam deśayiṣyanti
translated: Ānanda, those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who in the future will fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in the limitless continuum of saṃsāra, and will teach the Dharma for the sake of beings,

original: te'pi buddhā bhagavanta ita eva dharmakoṣāt /
analyzed: te api buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ itas eva dharmakoṣāt
translated: those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, will also be from this very Dharma treasure.

analyzed: yat uta prajñāpāramitātaḥ
translated: Namely, from the perfection of wisdom.

original: ye'pi te ānanda etarhi aprameyeṣvasaṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhā bhagavantastiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti /
analyzed: ye api te ānanda etarhi aprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti
translated: And, Ananda, those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who at present dwell, maintain themselves, and live in immeasurable and incalculable world systems,

analyzed: dharmam ca deśayanti
translated: and teach the Dharma,

original: teṣāmapyānanda buddhānāṃ bhagavatāmita eva dharmakoṣātprabhāvanā bhavati /
analyzed: teṣām api ānanda buddhānām bhagavatām itas eva dharma koṣāt prabhāvanā bhavati
translated: from them, too, Ananda, the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have this very Dharma treasure been manifested,

analyzed: yat uta prajñāpāramitātaḥ
translated: namely, from the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: na dharma adharmān paśyanti

analyzed: na dharma adharmān jānanti

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: sarva dharmāḥ hi ānanda a jānakāḥ a paśyakāḥ

analyzed: na kārya samarthāḥ
translated: They are not capable of action.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: nirīhakā hi ānanda sarvadharmā agrāhyā ākāśanirīhakatayā /

analyzed: acintyāḥ hi ānanda sarva dharmāḥ māyā puruṣa upamāḥ

analyzed: a vedakāḥ hi ānanda sarva dharmāḥ asadbhāva tām upādāya
translated: All phenomena are non-perceiving, Ānanda, because of their non-existence.

original: evaṃ caranta ānanda bodhisattvā mahāsattvāścaranti prajñāpāramitāyam /
analyzed: evam carantaḥ ānanda bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ caranti prajñāpāramitā ayam
translated: Behaving like this, Ānanda, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas behave in the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: na kaṃcid dharmam abhiniviśante
translated: They do not settle down on any dharma at all.

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇā ānanda bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ śikṣante prajñāpāramitāyām /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇāḥ ānanda bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ śikṣante prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: Training like this, Ānanda, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: sarvaśikṣāparamapāramitāṃ mahābodhiṃ prāptukāmena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: sarva śikṣā parama pāramitām mahā bodhim prāptu kāmena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: A bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to attain the great enlightenment, the supreme perfection of all trainings, should train in the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ

original: eṣā hyānanda śikṣā sarvaśikṣāṇāmagrā ākhyāyate /🔽śreṣṭhā ākhyāyate /
analyzed: eṣā hi ānanda śikṣā sarva śikṣāṇām agre ākhyāyate  śreṣṭhā ākhyāyate
translated: This training, Ānanda, is declared to be the foremost of all trainings.🔽It is declared to be the best.

analyzed: jyeṣṭhāḥ ākhyāyate  varā ākhyāyate  pravarāḥ ākhyāyate
translated: It is declared to be the most excellent.🔽It is declared to be the most sublime.🔽It is declared to be the most exalted.

analyzed: praṇītāḥ ākhyāyate
translated: It is declared to be the most refined.

analyzed: uttamā ākhyāyate
translated: It is declared to be the highest.

analyzed: anuttamā ākhyāyate  niruttarā ākhyāyate
translated: It is said to be unsurpassed.🔽It is said to be unexcelled.

analyzed: asamā ākhyāyate
translated: It is said to be unequaled.

analyzed: asamasamāḥ ākhyāyate
translated: It is said to be unequaled by equals.

original: sarvalokahitāvahā sarvalokasukhāvahā anāthānāṃ nāthakarī buddhānujñātā buddhapraśastā /
analyzed: sarva loka hita āvahā sarva loka sukha āvahā anāthānām nātha karī buddha anujñātā buddha praśastā
translated: It brings benefit to the whole world, it brings happiness to the whole world, it is a protector for those without a protector, it is approved by the Buddhas, it is praised by the Buddhas.

original: asyāmānanda prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣitvā atra śikṣāyāṃ sthitvā tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā imaṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasraṃ lokadhātumekena padāṅguṣṭhenotkṣipya punareva nikṣipeyuḥ /
analyzed: asyām ānanda prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣitvā atra śikṣāyām sthitvā tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ imam tri sāhasra mahā sāhasram lokadhātum ekena padāṅguṣṭhena utkṣipya punar eva nikṣipeyuḥ
translated: Ānanda, having trained in this perfection of wisdom, having abided in this training, the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones, could lift up this great trichiliocosm with a single toe and then put it down again.

original: na ca teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāmevaṃ syātutkṣipto vāyaṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasro lokadhātuḥ nikṣipto veti /
analyzed: na ca teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām evam syāt utkṣiptaḥ vā ayam tri sāhasra mahā sāhasraḥ lokadhātuḥ nikṣiptaḥ vā iti
translated: But it would not occur to those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, that 'this great trichiliocosm has been lifted up' or 'it has been put down again.'

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: aprameya asaṃkhyeya guṇa samanvāgatā hi prajñāpāramitā
translated: Because the perfection of wisdom is endowed with immeasurable and incalculable qualities.

original: asyāmānanda prajñāpāramitāśikṣāyāṃ śikṣitvā buddhā bhagavanto'tītānāgatapratyutpanneṣu dharmeṣvasaṅgatāmanuprāptāḥ /
analyzed: asyām ānanda prajñāpāramitā śikṣāyām śikṣitvā buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ utīta anāgata pratyutpanneṣu dharmeṣu asaṅga tām anuprāptāḥ
translated: Ānanda, the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, having trained in this training of the perfection of wisdom, have attained non-attachment regarding past, future, and present phenomena.

analyzed: yāvatyaḥ ānanda kāścid śikṣāḥ atīta anāgata pratyutpanna idhvani
translated: Ānanda, as many trainings as there are in the past, future, and present,

original: sarvāsāṃ tāsāmānanda śikṣāṇāmiyameva prajñāpāramitāśikṣā agrā ākhyāyate /🔽śreṣṭhā ākhyāyate /
analyzed: sarvāsām tāsām ānanda śikṣāṇām iyam eva prajñāpāramitā śikṣā agrā ākhyāyate  śreṣṭhā ākhyāyate
translated: Among all those teachings, this very perfection of wisdom is declared to be the foremost teaching.🔽It is declared to be the best.

analyzed: jyeṣṭhāḥ ākhyāyate  varā ākhyāyate  pravarāḥ ākhyāyate
translated: It is declared to be the most excellent.🔽It is declared to be the supreme.🔽It is declared to be the most excellent.

analyzed: praṇītāḥ ākhyāyate  uttamā ākhyāyate  anuttamā ākhyāyate
translated: It is declared to be the most refined.🔽It is declared to be the highest.

analyzed: niruttarā ākhyāyate  asamā ākhyāyate
translated: It is declared to be unsurpassed.🔽It is declared to be unequaled.

original: asamasamā ākhyāyate /🔽apramāṇā hyānanda prajñāpāramitā /🔽akṣayā hyānanda prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: asamasamāḥ ākhyāyate  apramāṇā hi ānanda prajñāpāramitā  akṣayā hi ānanda prajñāpāramitā
translated: It is declared to be unequaled by any other.🔽Ananda, the perfection of wisdom is immeasurable.🔽Ananda, the perfection of wisdom is inexhaustible.

analyzed: aparyantā hi ānanda prajñāpāramitā
translated: Ananda, the perfection of wisdom is limitless.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

analyzed: asattvāt eva prajñāpāramitāyāḥ
translated: Because the perfection of wisdom itself does not exist.

original: ākāśasya hi sa ānanda pramāṇaṃ vā kṣayaṃ vā paryantaṃ vā grahītavyaṃ manyetaḥ /
analyzed: ākāśasya hi saḥ ānanda pramāṇam vā kṣayam vā paryantam vā grahītavyam manyetaḥ
translated: Ananda, one might think that one could grasp the measure, the end, or the limit of space.

original: yaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ vā kṣayaṃ vā paryantaṃ vā grahītavyaṃ manyeta /
analyzed: yaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pramāṇam vā kṣayam vā paryantam vā grahītavyam manyeta
translated: One might think that one could grasp the measure, the end, or the limit of the perfection of wisdom.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /🔽apramāṇā hyānanda prajñāpāramitā /🔽akṣayā hyānanda prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ  apramāṇā hi ānanda prajñāpāramitā  akṣayā hi ānanda prajñāpāramitā
translated: What is the reason for that?🔽Ananda, the perfection of wisdom is immeasurable.🔽Ananda, the perfection of wisdom is inexhaustible.

analyzed: aparyantā hi ānanda prajñāpāramitā
translated: Ananda, the perfection of wisdom is limitless.

original: na mayā ānanda prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ vā kṣayo vā paryanto vā ākhyātaḥ /
analyzed: na mayā ānanda prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pramāṇam vā kṣayaḥ vā paryantaḥ vā ākhyātaḥ
translated: Ananda, I have not declared the measure, the destruction, or the limit of the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: nāma kāya pada kāya vyañjana kāyāḥ khalu punar ānanda pramāṇa baddhāḥ
translated: Ananda, the collections of names, phrases, and syllables are indeed bound by measure.

analyzed: na iyam ānanda prajñāpāramitā pramāṇa baddhā
translated: But this perfection of wisdom, Ananda, is not bound by measure.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ  na hi ānanda nāma kāya pada kāya vyañjana kāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā
translated: What is the reason for that?🔽Ananda, the collections of names, phrases, and syllables are not the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: na hi pramāṇavatī iyam ānanda prajñāpāramitā
translated: Ananda, this perfection of wisdom is not subject to measure.

analyzed: aparimāṇā hi ānanda prajñāpāramitā
translated: Ananda, the perfection of wisdom is immeasurable.

original: ānanda āhakena punaḥ kāraṇena bhagavan bhagavatā prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nākhyātam /🔽bhagavānāhaakṣayatvādānanda prajñāpāramitāyāstathāgataḥ pramāṇaṃ na nirdiśati /
analyzed: ānandaḥ āha kena punar kāraṇena bhagavan bhagavatā prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pramāṇam na ākhyātam  bhagavān āha akṣaya tvāt ānanda prajñāpāramitāyāḥ tathāgataḥ pramāṇam na nirdiśati
translated: Ananda said: For what reason, Blessed One, has the Blessed One not declared the measure of the perfection of wisdom?🔽The Blessed One said: Because of the inexhaustibility of the perfection of wisdom, the Tathagata does not point out a measure.

analyzed: vivikta tvāt ānanda prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pramāṇam tathāgatena na ākhyātam
translated: Ananda, because of the seclusion of the perfection of wisdom, the measure has not been pointed out by the Tathagata.

analyzed: na hi ānanda viviktasya dharmasya vivikta tā api upalabhyate
translated: Ananda, the seclusion of a secluded dharma is not even perceived.

analyzed: kutas punar asya pramāṇam bhaviṣyati
translated: How much less could there be a measure of it?

analyzed: evam ānanda prajñāpāramitā aprameya tvāt apramāṇā aparimāṇā
translated: Thus, Ānanda, the perfection of wisdom is immeasurable, unlimited, and boundless.

original: ye'pi te ānanda atīte'dhvanyabhūvaṃstathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ /
analyzed: ye api te ānanda atīte idhvani abhūvan tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: Ānanda, those who were Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones in the past,

analyzed: te api ānanda itas eva prajñāpāramitātaḥ prabhāvitāḥ
translated: Ānanda, they too were revealed from just this perfection of wisdom.

original: na cānanda iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā kṣīṇā vā parikṣīṇā vā /

analyzed: te api ānanda itas eva prajñāpāramitātaḥ prabhāvayiṣyante
translated: Ānanda, they too will be revealed from just this perfection of wisdom.

original: na cānanda iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā kṣeṣyate vā parikṣeṣyate vā /
analyzed: na ca ānanda iyam prajñāpāramitā kṣeṣyate vā parikṣeṣyate vā
translated: And, Ānanda, this perfection of wisdom is not exhausted or completely exhausted.

original: ye'pi te ānanda etarhyaprameyeṣvasaṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣu tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāstiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti /
analyzed: ye api te ānanda etarhi aprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣu tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti
translated: Ānanda, those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones who at present dwell, maintain themselves, and live in immeasurable, incalculable world systems,

analyzed: te api ānanda itas eva prajñāpāramitātaḥ prabhāvyante
translated: Ānanda, they too are revealed from just this perfection of wisdom.

original: na ceyamānanda prajñāpāramitā kṣīyate vā parikṣīyate vā /
analyzed: na ca iyam ānanda prajñāpāramitā kṣīyate vā parikṣīyate vā
translated: And, Ānanda, this perfection of wisdom is not exhausted or completely exhausted.

analyzed: aham api ānandaḥ etarhi tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: I, Ananda, am now also a Tathagata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One.

analyzed: mama api ānanda itas eva prajñāpāramitātaḥ prabhāvanā
translated: And it is from this very Perfection of Wisdom, Ananda, that I have been empowered.

original: na cānanda iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā kṣīyate vā parikṣīyate vā /

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
