translated: May we attain the dharmas that this bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata has attained.

analyzed: evam eva ca prajñāpāramitām satkuryāma gurukuryāma
translated: In the same way, may we honor and respect the perfection of wisdom.

original: yathāyaṃ dharmodgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ satkaroti gurukaroti /
analyzed: yathā ayam dharmodgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ satkaroti gurukaroti
translated: Just as this bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata honors and respects it.”

original: bahujanasya ca saṃprakāśayema yathāyaṃ dharmodgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ saṃprakāśayati /
analyzed: bahu janasya ca saṃprakāśayema yathā ayam dharma udgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ saṃprakāśayati
translated: And we would teach it to many people, just as this Bodhisattva Mahasattva Dharmodgata teaches it.

original: evameva ca prajñāpāramitayā upāyakauśalyena ca samanvāgatā bhavema /
analyzed: evam eva ca prajñāpāramitayā upāya kauśalyena ca samanvāgatāḥ bhavema
translated: And we would be endowed with the perfection of wisdom and skillful means,

original: pariniṣpadyemahi ca yathāyaṃ dharmodgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitayā upāyakauśalyena ca samanvāgataḥ pariniṣpannaśca //
analyzed: pariniṣpadyemahi ca yathā ayam dharma udgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitayā upāya kauśalyena ca samanvāgataḥ pariniṣpannaḥ ca
translated: and we would be accomplished, just as this Bodhisattva Mahasattva Dharmodgata is endowed with the perfection of wisdom and skillful means, and is accomplished.

original: atha khalu sadāprarudito bodhisattvo mahāsattvastāni ca śreṣṭhidārikāpramukhāni pañca dārikāśatāni prajñāpāramitāṃ pūjayitvā dharmodgataṃ ca bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvaṃ satkṛtya dharmodgatasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya pādau śirasābhivandya ekānte sagauravāḥ sapratīkṣāḥ prāñjalīn kṛtvātiṣṭhan /
analyzed: atha khalu sadāpraruditaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tāni ca śreṣṭhi dārikā pramukhāni pañca dārikā śatāni prajñāpāramitām pūjayitvā dharmodgatam ca bodhisattvam mahāsattvam satkṛtya dharmodgatasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya pādau śirasā abhivandya ekānte sa gauravāḥ sa pratīkṣāḥ prāñjalīn kṛtvā atiṣṭhan
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Sadaprarudita, together with the five hundred maidens headed by the merchant's daughter, having worshipped the perfection of wisdom and having honored the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Dharmodgata, having bowed his head at the feet of the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Dharmodgata, stood to one side with palms joined in respect and reverence.

original: ekānte sthitaśca sadāprarudito bodhisattvo mahāsattvo dharmodgataṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvametadavocatihāhaṃ kulaputra prajñāpāramitāṃ gaveṣamāṇo'raṇyagato nirghoṣamaśrauṣamgaccha kulaputra pūrvāṃ diśam /
analyzed: ekānte sthitaḥ ca sadāpraruditaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ dharmodgatam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam etat avocat iha aham kula putra prajñāpāramitām gaveṣamāṇa uraṇya gataḥ nirghoṣam aśrauṣam gaccha kula putra pūrvām diśam
translated: Standing to one side, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita said this to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata: Son of good family, when I was seeking the perfection of wisdom, I heard a voice in the forest. It said, 'Go, son of good family, to the east.

analyzed: tatas prajñāpāramitām śroṣyasi iti
translated: There you will hear the perfection of wisdom.'

original: so'haṃ samyak taṃ nirghoṣaṃ śrutvā yena pūrvā dik tena saṃprasthitaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ uham samyak tam nirghoṣam śrutvā yena pūrvā diś tena saṃprasthitaḥ
translated: Having heard that voice well, I set out in the direction of the east.

original: tasya me etadabhūtsamyak ca mayā nirghoṣaḥ śrutaḥ /
analyzed: tasya me etat abhūt samyak ca mayā nirghoṣaḥ śrutaḥ
translated: I thought this: 'I have heard that voice well.

original: na ca mayā sa nirghoṣaḥ paripṛṣṭaḥ kiyaddūraṃ mayā gantavyam /
analyzed: na ca mayā sa nirghoṣaḥ paripṛṣṭaḥ kiyat dūram mayā gantavyam
translated: But I did not ask that voice how far I should go,

original: kasya vā antikātprajñāpāramitāṃ śroṣyāmi lapsye veti /🔽tasya me mahaddaurmanasyamabhūt /
analyzed: kasya vā antikāt prajñāpāramitām śroṣyāmi lapsye vā iti  tasya me mahat daurmanasyam abhūt
translated: or from whom I will hear and obtain the perfection of wisdom.'🔽I had great dejection.

original: so'haṃ tena daurmanasyena mahatīmutkaṇṭhāṃ paritapanaṃ cāpanno'bhūvam /
analyzed: saḥ uham tena daurmanasyena mahatīm utkaṇṭhām paritapanam ca apannobhūvam
translated: I became greatly anxious and distressed by that dejection.

analyzed: tasmin eva pṛthivī pradeśe sapta rātriṃdivāni atināmayāmi utkaṇṭhitaḥ
translated: I spent seven nights and days right there on that spot, anxious.

analyzed: na āhāra samudācāram utpādayāmi
translated: I did not produce the practice of eating.

original: api tu prajñāpāramitāmeva manasi karomikiyaddūraṃ mayā gantavyam /
analyzed: api tu prajñāpāramitām eva manasi karomi kiyat dūram mayā gantavyam
translated: But I was thinking only of the perfection of wisdom: 'How far do I have to go?

analyzed: kutas vā prajñāpāramitām lapsye śravaṇāya
translated: And where will I find the perfection of wisdom to listen to it?

original: na ca mayā sa nirghoṣaḥ paripṛṣṭaḥ iti /
analyzed: na ca mayā sa nirghoṣaḥ paripṛṣṭaḥ iti
translated: And I did not ask that voice.'

analyzed: tatas me tathāgata vigrahaḥ puratas prādurbhūtaḥ
translated: Then the form of a Tathagata appeared before me.

original: sa māmevamāhagaccha kulaputra itaḥ pañcabhiryojanaśatairanupūrveṇa gandhavatī nāma nagarī /
analyzed: sa mām evam āha gaccha kula putraḥ itas pañcabhiḥ yojana śataiḥ anupūrveṇa gandhavatī nāma nagarī
translated: He said to me, 'Go, son of good family! From here, after five hundred yojanas, there is a city called Gandhavati.

original: tatra drakṣyasi dharmodgataṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvaṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ deśayantaṃ prakāśayantamiti /
analyzed: tatra drakṣyasi dharma udgatam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam prajñāpāramitām deśayantam prakāśayantam iti
translated: There you will see the bodhisattva mahasattva Dharmodgata teaching and illuminating the perfection of wisdom.'

analyzed: tatas ham mahatā udāreṇa prīti prāmodyena samanvāgataḥ
translated: Then I was filled with great joy and delight.

original: so'haṃ tenaiva mahatodāreṇa prītiprāmodyena sphuṭastataḥ pṛthivīpradeśānna calitaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ uham tena eva mahatā udāreṇa prīti prāmodyena sphuṭaḥ tatas pṛthivī pradeśāt na calitaḥ
translated: And I, being filled with that great joy and delight, did not move from that place on the ground.

analyzed: tava ca prajñāpāramitām deśayataḥ śṛṇomi
translated: And I heard you teaching the perfection of wisdom.

original: tasya me śṛṇvato bahūni samādhimukhāni prādurbhūtāni /
analyzed: tasya me śṛṇvataḥ bahūni samādhi mukhāni prādurbhūtāni
translated: While listening to it, many doors of samadhi appeared to me.

original: tatra sthitaṃ māṃ daśadiglokadhātusthitā buddhā bhagavantaḥ samāśvāsayanti /
analyzed: tatra sthitam mām daśa diś lokadhātu sthitāḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ samāśvāsayanti
translated: While dwelling in them, the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, dwelling in the world systems of the ten directions, comforted me.

analyzed: sādhukāram ca dadati sādhu sādhu kula putra
translated: and they gave their approval, saying, Excellent, excellent, O son of good family!

analyzed: ete samādhayaḥ prajñāpāramitā nirjātāḥ
translated: These are the samadhis born from the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: yatra sthitaiḥ asmābhiḥ sarva buddha dharmāḥ pariniṣpāditāḥ iti
translated: in which we have accomplished all the qualities of the Buddhas.

original: te māṃ tathāgatāḥ sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca saṃdarśya samādāpya samuttejya saṃpraharṣya antarhitāḥ /
analyzed: te mām tathāgatāḥ sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca saṃdarśya samādāpya samuttejya saṃpraharṣya antarhitāḥ
translated: Those Tathagatas, having well and truly instructed, inspired, encouraged, and delighted me, disappeared.

analyzed: aham ca tatas samādheḥ vyutthitaḥ
translated: And I arose from that samadhi.

original: tasya me etadabhūtkuto nu te tathāgatā āgatāḥ /
analyzed: tasya me etat abhūt kutas nu te tathāgatāḥ āgatāḥ
translated: I thought, From where did those Tathagatas come?

original: kva vā te tathāgatā gatā iti /
analyzed: kva vā te tathāgatāḥ gatāḥ iti
translated: Where did those Tathagatas go?

original: tasya ca me etadabhūtāryo dharmodgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvo dhāraṇīpratilabdhaḥ pañcābhijñaḥ pūrvajinākṛtādhikāro'varopitakuśalamūlaḥ /
analyzed: tasya ca me etat abhūt āryaḥ dharma udgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ dhāraṇī pratilabdhaḥ pañca abhijñaḥ pūrva jina a kṛta adhikāraḥ varopita kuśala mūlaḥ
translated: And I thought, The noble Dharmodgata Bodhisattva Mahasattva has attained the dharani, has the five superknowledges, has served the former Victors, has planted the roots of virtue,

analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām upāya kauśalye ca su śikṣitaḥ
translated: is well trained in the perfection of wisdom and in skillful means.

analyzed: sa me enam artham yathāvat vicariṣyati
translated: He will investigate this matter for me as it truly is:

original: yataste tathāgatā āgatā yatra vā te tathāgatā gatā iti /
analyzed: yatas te tathāgatāḥ āgatāḥ yatra vā te tathāgatāḥ gatāḥ iti
translated: from where those Tathagatas came and where those Tathagatas went.

original: so'haṃ tasya tathāgatavigrahasya nirghoṣaṃ śrutvā yathānuśiṣṭaṃ yena pūrvāṃ dik tena saṃprasthitaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ uham tasya tathāgata vigrahasya nirghoṣam śrutvā yathā anuśiṣṭam yena pūrvām diś tena saṃprasthitaḥ
translated: Having heard that voice of the Tathāgata's body, I went in the eastern direction as instructed.

analyzed: āgacchan ca aham dūratas eva āryam adrākṣam dharmam deśayantam
translated: And as I was coming, I saw the noble one from afar, teaching the Dharma.

analyzed: saha darśanāt ca mama īdṛśam sukham prādurabhūt
translated: And upon seeing him, such bliss arose in me

analyzed: tat yathā api nāma prathama dhyāna samāpannasya bhikṣoḥ ekāgra manasikārasya
translated: as when a bhikṣu who has attained the first concentration has one-pointed attention.

original: so'haṃ tvāṃ kulaputra pṛcchāmikutaste tathāgatā āgatāḥ /
analyzed: sa u ham tvām kula putra pṛcchāmi kutas te tathāgatāḥ āgatāḥ
translated: Therefore, noble one, I ask you: from where did those Tathāgatas come?

analyzed: kutra te tathāgatāḥ gatāḥ iti
translated: Where did those Tathāgatas go?

original: deśaya me kulaputra teṣāṃ tathāgatānāmāgamanaṃ gamanaṃ ca /
analyzed: deśaya me kula putra teṣām tathāgatānām āgamanam gamanam ca
translated: Noble one, teach me the coming and going of those Tathāgatas,

original: yathā vayaṃ teṣāṃ tathāgatānāmāgamanaṃ gamanaṃ ca jānīma /
analyzed: yathā vayam teṣām tathāgatānām āgamanam gamanam ca jānīma
translated: so that we may know the coming and going of those Tathāgatas.

analyzed: avirahitāḥ ca bhavema tathāgata darśanena iti
translated: And may we never be separated from seeing the Tathāgatas.

analyzed: ārya aṣṭasāhasrikāyām prajñāpāramitāyām sadāpraruditaparivartaḥ nāma triṃśattamaḥ
translated: In the Noble Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines, the thirtieth chapter is called Always Weeping.

analyzed: dharmodgata parivartaḥ ekatriṃśattamaḥ
translated: Chapter Thirty-One: Dharmodgata

original: evamukte dharmodgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sadāpraruditaṃ bodhisattva mahāsattvametadavocatna khalu kulaputra tathāgatāḥ kutaścidāgacchanti vā gacchanti vā /
analyzed: evam ukte dharmodgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sadāpraruditam bodhisattva mahāsattvam etat avocat na khalu kula putra tathāgatāḥ kutaścid āgacchanti vā gacchanti vā
translated: When this was said, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita: 'Son of noble family, the Tathāgatas do not come from anywhere or go anywhere.

analyzed: acalitā hi tathatā  yā ca tathatā
translated: For suchness is unmoving.

analyzed: sa tathāgataḥ
translated: And suchness is the Tathāgata.

original: na hi kulaputra anutpāda āgacchati vā gacchati vā /🔽yaśca anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: na hi kula putra anutpādaḥ āgacchati vā gacchati vā  yaḥ ca anutpādaḥ
translated: Son of noble family, the unarisen does not come or go.

analyzed: sa tathāgataḥ
translated: And the unarisen is the Tathāgata.

original: na hi kulaputra bhūtakoṭyā āgamanaṃ vā gamanaṃ vā prajñāyate /🔽yā ca bhūtakoṭiḥ /
analyzed: na hi kula putra bhūta koṭyāḥ āgamanam vā gamanam vā prajñāyate  yā ca bhūtakoṭiḥ
translated: Son of noble family, coming or going is not known in the reality-limit.

analyzed: sa tathāgataḥ
translated: And the reality-limit is the Tathāgata.

original: na hi kulaputra śūnyatāyā āgamanaṃ vā gamanaṃ vā prajñāyate /
analyzed: na hi kula putra śūnyatāyāḥ āgamanam vā gamanam vā prajñāyate
translated: Son of noble family, coming or going is not known in emptiness.

analyzed: yā ca śūnyatā
translated: And emptiness is the Tathāgata.🔽Son of noble family, coming or going is not known in reality.

analyzed: sa tathāgataḥ
translated: And reality is the Tathāgata.

original: na hi kulaputra yathāvattāyā āgamanaṃ vā gamanaṃ vā prajñāyate /🔽yā ca yathāvattā /
analyzed: na hi kula putra yathāvat tāyāḥ āgamanam vā gamanam vā prajñāyate  yā ca yathāvattā
translated: Son of noble family, coming or going is not known in dispassion.

analyzed: sa tathāgataḥ
translated: And dispassion is the Tathāgata.'

original: na hi kulaputra virāgasyāgamanaṃ vā gamanaṃ vā prajñāyate /🔽yā ca virāgatā /
analyzed: na hi kula putra virāgasya āgamanam vā gamanam vā prajñāyate  yā ca virāga tā
translated: 'Son of noble family, coming or going is not known in cessation.

analyzed: sa tathāgataḥ
translated: And cessation is the Tathāgata.'

original: na hi kulaputra nirodhasyāgamanaṃ vā gamanaṃ vā prajñāyate /
analyzed: na hi kula putra nirodhasya āgamanam vā gamanam vā prajñāyate
translated: For, noble sir, no coming or going of cessation can be discerned.

analyzed: yaḥ ca nirodhaḥ
translated: And cessation

analyzed: sa tathāgataḥ
translated: is the Tathāgata.

original: na hi kulaputra ākāśadhātorāgamanaṃ vā gamanaṃ vā prajñāyate /
analyzed: na hi kula putraḥ ākāśa dhātoḥ āgamanam vā gamanam vā prajñāyate
translated: For, noble sir, no coming or going of the element of space can be discerned.

analyzed: yaḥ ca ākāśa dhātuḥ
translated: And the element of space

analyzed: sa tathāgataḥ
translated: is the Tathāgata.

original: na hi kulaputra anyatra ebhyo dharmebhyastathāgataḥ /
analyzed: na hi kula putra anyatra ebhyaḥ dharmebhyaḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: For, noble sir, the Tathāgata is not other than these dharmas.

original: yā ca kulaputra eṣāmeva dharmāṇāṃ tathatā /
analyzed: yā ca kula putre eṣām eva dharmāṇām tathatā
translated: And, noble sir, the suchness of these dharmas

analyzed: yā ca sarva dharma tathatā
translated: is the suchness of all dharmas.🔽And the suchness of all dharmas

analyzed: yā ca tathāgata tathatā
translated: is the suchness of the Tathāgata.

analyzed: ekā eva eṣā tathatā
translated: This suchness is one and the same.

analyzed: na asti kula putra tathatāyāḥ dvaidhīkāraḥ
translated: There is no duality in suchness, noble sir.

analyzed: ekā eva eṣā tathatā kula putra
translated: This suchness is one and the same, noble sir,

analyzed: tathatā na dve na tisraḥ
translated: not two or three.

analyzed: gaṇanā vyativṛttā kula putrā tathatā yat uta asattvāt
translated: Noble sir, suchness is beyond number, because it is non-existent.

original: tadyathāpi nāma kulaputra puruṣo grīṣmābhitapto grīṣmāṇāṃ paścime māse'bhigate madhyāhnakālasamaye marīcikāṃ paśyet syandamānām /🔽sa tena tena pradhāvetatrodakaṃ pāsyāmi /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kula putra puruṣaḥ grīṣma abhitaptaḥ grīṣmāṇām paścime māsa abhigate madhyāhna kāla samaye marīcikām paśyet syandamānām  sa tena tena pradhāva itatra udakam pāsyāmi
translated: For example, noble sir, a man scorched by a hot season, in the last month of summer, at midday in the bright half of the month, might see a mirage moving along.🔽He would run towards it, thinking,

analyzed: apānīyam pāsyāmi iti
translated: “I will drink water,” or “I will drink non-water.”

original: tatkiṃ manyase kulaputra kuta etadudakamāgataṃ kva vā tadudakaṃ gacchati /
analyzed: tat kim manyase kula putra kutas etat udakam āgatam kva vā tat udakam gacchati
translated: What do you think, noble sir? Where does that water come from and where does it go?”

original: pūrvaṃ vā mahāsamudraṃ dakṣiṇaṃ vā paścimaṃ vā uttaraṃ vā /
analyzed: pūrvam vā mahā samudram dakṣiṇam vā paścimam vā uttaram vā
translated: “Does it come from the east or west, or from the south or the north?”

original: sadāprarudita āhana hi kulaputra marīcikāyāmudakaṃ saṃvidyate /
analyzed: sadā praruditaḥ āha na hi kula putra marīcikāyām udakam saṃvidyate
translated: Sadāprarudita said, “Noble sir, there is no water in a mirage.

original: kiṃ punarasyāgamanaṃ vā gamanaṃ vā prajñāyate /
analyzed: kim punar asya āgamanam vā gamanam vā prajñāyate
translated: How much less could one find its coming or going!”

original: sa khalu punaḥ kulaputra puruṣo grīṣmābhitapto bālajātīyo duṣprajñajātīyo marīcikāṃ dṛṣṭvā anudake udakasaṃjñāmutpādayati /
analyzed: sa khalu punar kula putra puruṣaḥ grīṣma abhitaptaḥ bāla jātīyaḥ duṣprajña jātīyaḥ marīcikām dṛṣṭvā anudake udaka saṃjñām utpādayati
translated: “That man, tormented by the heat of summer, foolish, of poor intellect, sees a mirage as water, and thinks that there is water there.

analyzed: na punar tatra udakam svabhāvataḥ saṃvidyate
translated: But there is no water there by its very nature.”

analyzed: dharmodgataḥ āha evam etat kula putra evam etat
translated: “It is just so, noble sir, just so!” said Dharmodgata.

original: evameva kulaputra ye kecittathāgatarūpeṇa vā ghoṣeṇa vā abhiniviṣṭāḥ /🔽te tathāgatasyāgamanaṃ ca gamanaṃ ca kalpayanti /
analyzed: evam eva kula putra ye kecid tathāgata rūpeṇa vā ghoṣeṇa vā abhiniviṣṭāḥ  te tathāgatasya āgamanam ca gamanam ca kalpayanti
translated: “In just the same way, noble sir, those who are attached to the Tathāgata as a physical body or as voice,🔽they imagine the Tathāgata’s coming and going.

original: ye ca tathāgatasyāgamanaṃ ca gamanaṃ ca kalpayanti /
analyzed: ye ca tathāgatasya āgamanam ca gamanam ca kalpayanti
translated: And those who imagine the Tathāgata’s coming and going,

original: sarve te bālajātīyā duṣprajñajātīyā iti vaktavyāḥ /
analyzed: sarve te bāla jātīyāḥ duṣprajña jātīyāḥ iti vaktavyāḥ
translated: they should all be called foolish, of poor intellect.”

original: tadyathāpi nāma sa eva puruṣo yo'nudake udakasaṃjñāmutpādayati /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma saḥ eva puruṣaḥ udaka saṃjñām utpādayati
translated: It is just as that same man who produces the notion of water in regard to what is not water.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: na hi tathāgataḥ rūpa kāyataḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: The Tathāgata should not be seen in terms of the body of form.

analyzed: dharmakāyāḥ tathāgatāḥ
translated: The Tathāgatas are the body of the Dharma.

original: na ca kulaputra dharmatā āgacchati vā gacchati vā /
analyzed: na ca kula putra dharmatā āgacchati vā gacchati vā
translated: And, noble sir, the nature of reality does not come or go.

original: evameva kulaputra nāsti tathāgatānāmāgamanaṃ vā gamanaṃ vā /
analyzed: evam eva kula putra na asti tathāgatānām āgamanam vā gamanam vā
translated: In the same way, noble sir, the Tathāgatas do not come or go.🔽It is just as, noble sir, an illusory elephant created by a magician does not come or go,

original: tadyathāpi nāma kulaputra māyākāranirmitasya hastikāyasya vā aśvakāyasya vā rathakāyasya vā pattikāyasya vā nāstyāgamanaṃ vā gamanaṃ vā /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kula putra māyākāra nirmitasya hasti kāyasya vā aśva kāyasya vā ratha kāyasya vā patti kāyasya vā na asti āgamanam vā gamanam vā
translated: and an illusory army of elephants, cavalry, chariots, and infantry created by a magician does not come or go.

original: evameva kulaputra nāsti tathāgatānāmāgamanaṃ vā gamanaṃ vā /
analyzed: evam eva kula putra na asti tathāgatānām āgamanam vā gamanam vā
translated: In the same way, noble sir, the Tathāgatas do not come or go.

original: tadyathāpi nāma kulaputra puruṣaḥ suptaḥ svapnāntaragata ekaṃ vā tathāgataṃ paśyet /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kula putra puruṣaḥ suptaḥ svapna antara gataḥ ekam vā tathāgatam paśyet
translated: It is just as, noble sir, a man who is asleep might see one Tathāgata in a dream,🔽or two, or three, or four, or five, or six, or seven, or eight, or nine, or ten,

original: dvau vā trīn vā caturo vā pañca vā ṣaḍvā sapta vā aṣṭau vā nava vā daśa vā viṃśatiṃ vā triṃśadvā catvāriṃśadvā pañcāśadvā śataṃ vā sahasraṃ
analyzed: dvau vā trīn vā caturaḥ vā pañca vā ṣaṭ vā sapta vai aṣṭau vā nava vā daśa vā viṃśatim vā triṃśat vā catvāriṃśat vā pañcāśat vā śatam vā sahasram
translated: or twenty, or thirty, or forty, or fifty, or a hundred, or a thousand,

analyzed: tatas vai uttare
translated: or more.

original: sa prativibuddhaḥ san ekamapi tathāgataṃ na paśyet /
analyzed: sa prativibuddhaḥ san ekam api tathāgatam na paśyet
translated: When he awakens, he does not see even one Tathāgata.

original: tatkiṃ manyase kulaputra kutaste tathāgatā āgatāḥ kva vā te tathāgatā gatā iti /
analyzed: tat kim manyase kula putra kutas te tathāgatāḥ āgatāḥ kva vā te tathāgatāḥ gatāḥ iti
translated: What do you think, son of noble family? From where did those Tathāgatas come, and where did they go?”

original: sadāprarudita āhana khalu punaḥ kulaputra svapne kasyaciddharmasya pariniṣpattiḥ prajñāyate /
analyzed: sadā praruditaḥ āha na khalu punar kula putra svapne kasyacid dharmasya pariniṣpattiḥ prajñāyate
translated: Sadāprarudita said, “Son of noble family, in a dream, the establishment of any dharma is not known.

analyzed: mṛṣāvādaḥ hi
translated: A dream is a false statement.”

original: dharmodgata āhaevameva kulaputra sarvadharmāḥ svapnopamā uktā bhagavatā /
analyzed: dharmodgataḥ āha evam eva kula putra sarva dharmāḥ svapna upamāḥ uktāḥ bhagavatā
translated: Dharmodgata said, “In the same way, son of noble family, the Blessed One has said that all dharmas are like a dream.

original: ye kecitkulaputra svapnopamān sarvadharmāṃstathāgatena nirdeśitān yathābhūtaṃ na prajānanti /
analyzed: ye kecid kula putra svapna upamān sarva dharmān tathāgatena nirdeśitān yathābhūtam na prajānanti
translated: Those who do not know as it really is that all dharmas are taught by the Tathāgata to be like a dream,

original: te tathāgatān nāmakāyena vā rūpakāyena vā abhiniviśya tathāgatānāmāgamanaṃ vā gamanaṃ vā kalpayanti /
analyzed: te tathāgatān nāma kāyena vā rūpa kāyena vā abhiniviśya tathāgatānām āgamanam vā gamanam vā kalpayanti
translated: they, clinging to the Tathāgatas by way of the name-body or the form-body, imagine the coming or going of the Tathāgatas.

original: yathāpi nāma dharmatāmaprajānanto ye ca tathāgatānāmāgamanaṃ vā gamanaṃ vā kalpayanti /
analyzed: yathā api nāma dharmatām a prajānantaḥ ye ca tathāgatānām āgamanam vā gamanam vā kalpayanti
translated: Namely, not knowing the real nature, they imagine the coming or going of the Tathāgatas.

analyzed: sarve te bāla jātīyāḥ pṛthagjanāḥ
translated: All of them are of the class of fools, ordinary people.

analyzed: sarve te ṣaṣ gatikam saṃsāram gatāḥ
translated: All of them have gone to the six destinies of saṃsāra.

analyzed: gacchanti gamiṣyanti ca
translated: They have gone and will go.

analyzed: sarve te prajñāpāramitāyāḥ dūre
translated: All of them are far from the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: sarve te buddha dharmāṇām dūre
translated: All of them are far from the qualities of a Buddha.

original: ye khalu punaḥ kulaputra svapnopamān sarvadharmān svapnopamāḥ sarvadharmā iti tathāgatena deśitān yathābhūtaṃ prajānanti /
analyzed: ye khalu punar kula putra svapna upamān sarva dharmān svapna upamāḥ sarva dharmāḥ iti tathāgatena deśitān yathābhūtam prajānanti
translated: But, son of noble family, those who truly understand that all dharmas taught by the Tathāgata as being like a dream are indeed like a dream,

original: na te kasyaciddharmasyāgamanaṃ vā gamanaṃ vā kalpayanti /
analyzed: na te kasyacid dharmasya āgamanam vā gamanam vā kalpayanti
translated: they do not imagine the coming or going of any dharma.

analyzed: utpādam vā nirodham vā
translated: Nor do they imagine arising or cessation.

original: ye ca na kasyaciddharmasyāgamanaṃ vā gamanaṃ vā kalpayanti /
analyzed: ye ca na kasyacid dharmasya āgamanam vā gamanam vā kalpayanti
translated: And those who do not imagine the coming or going of any dharma,

analyzed: utpādam vā nirodham vā
translated: nor do they imagine arising or cessation,

analyzed: te dharma tayā tathāgatam prajānanti
translated: they know the Tathāgata through his true nature.

analyzed: ye ca tathāgatam dharma tayā prajānanti
translated: And those who know the Tathāgata through his true nature,

original: na te tathāgatānāmāgamanaṃ vā gamanaṃ vā kalpayanti /
analyzed: na te tathāgatānām āgamanam vā gamanam vā kalpayanti
translated: they do not imagine the coming or going of the Tathāgatas.

analyzed: ye ca tathāgatasya īdṛśīm dharmatām prajānanti
translated: And those who know the suchness of the Tathāgata in this way,

analyzed: te āsannāḥ anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ caranti
translated: they are close to the highest complete enlightenment, and they practice.

analyzed: te ca prajñāpāramitāyām caranti
translated: And they practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: te ca bhagavataḥ śrāvakāḥ amoghaṃ rāṣṭrapiṇḍaṃ paribhuñjate /
analyzed: te ca bhagavataḥ śrāvakāḥ amogham rāṣṭra piṇḍam paribhuñjate
translated: And those disciples of the Blessed One enjoy the alms of the country without fail.

analyzed: te ca lokasya dakṣiṇīyāḥ
translated: And they are worthy of offerings from the world.

original: tadyathāpi nāma kulaputra mahāsamudre ratnāni na pūrvasyā diśa āgacchanti /🔽na dakṣiṇasyāḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kula putra mahā samudre ratnāni na pūrvasyāḥ diśaḥ āgacchanti  na dakṣiṇasyāḥ
translated: “Noble sir, the jewels in the ocean do not come from the east side of the ocean,🔽nor from the west side,

analyzed: na paścimāyāḥ
translated: nor from the south side,

analyzed: na uttarasyāḥ
translated: nor from the north side,

original: na vidigbhyo nādhastānnopariṣṭānna kutaściddeśebhyo digbhya āgacchanti /
analyzed: na vidigbhyaḥ na adhastāt na upariṣṭāt na kutaścid deśebhyaḥ digbhyaḥ āgacchanti
translated: nor from the intermediate directions, nor from above, nor from below, nor do they come from any of the directions.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ sattvānāṃ kuśalamūlānyupādāya mahāsamudre ratnānyutpadyante /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar sattvānām kuśala mūlāni upādāya mahā samudre ratnāni utpadyante
translated: However, the jewels in the ocean come into existence because of the roots of goodness of beings.

analyzed: na tāni ahetukāni utpadyante
translated: Those jewels do not come into existence without a cause.

analyzed: hetu pratyaya kāraṇa adhīnāni pratītyasamutpannāni
translated: They come into existence through the power of causes and conditions, and they come into existence through the power of dependent origination.

original: nirudhyamānāni ca tāni ratnāni ca kvaciddaśadiśi loke saṃkrāmanti /
analyzed: nirudhyamānāni ca tāni ratnāni ca kvacid daśa diśi loke saṃkrāmanti
translated: When those jewels disappear, they do not go anywhere in the ten directions.🔽However, when the conditions for the jewels to appear are present,

original: api tu khalu punaryeṣāṃ pratyayānāṃ satāṃ tāni ratnāni prabhāvyante /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar yeṣām pratyayānām satām tāni ratnāni prabhāvyante
translated: then the jewels appear.

original: teṣāṃ pratyayānāmasatāṃ na teṣāṃ ratnānāṃ prabhāvanā bhavati /
analyzed: teṣām pratyayānām asatām na teṣām ratnānām prabhāvanā bhavati
translated: When the conditions for the jewels to appear are not present, then the jewels do not appear.

original: evameva kulaputra teṣāṃ tathāgatānāṃ kāyapariniṣpattirna kutaściddaśadiśi lokādāgatā /
analyzed: evam eva kula putra teṣām tathāgatānām kāya pariniṣpattiḥ na kutaścid daśa diśi lokāt āgatā
translated: “In the same way, noble sir, the perfection of the body of those tathāgatas does not come from any of the ten directions of the world,

analyzed: na api kvacid daśa diśi loke gacchati
translated: nor does it go to any of the ten directions of the world.

original: na ca ahetuko buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ kāyaḥ /
analyzed: na ca ahetukaḥ buddhānām bhagavatām kāyaḥ
translated: And the body of the Blessed Buddhas is not without a cause.

analyzed: pūrva caryā pariniṣpannaḥ hetu pratyaya adhīnaḥ kāraṇa samutpannaḥ pūrva karma vipākāt utpannaḥ
translated: It is accomplished by previous conduct, dependent on causes and conditions, arisen from causes, arisen from the ripening of previous karma.

analyzed: sa na kvacid daśa diśi
translated: It does not exist anywhere in the ten directions of the world.

original: api tu khalu punaryeṣāṃ pratyayānāṃ satāṃ kāyābhiniṣpattirbhavati /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar yeṣām pratyayānām satām kāya abhiniṣpattiḥ bhavati
translated: However, when those conditions exist, the manifestation of the body occurs.

analyzed: teṣām pratyayānām asatām kāya abhiniṣpattiḥ na prajñāyate
translated: When those conditions do not exist, the manifestation of the body is not known.

original: tadyathāpi nāma kulaputra vīṇāyāḥ śabda utpadyamāno na kutaścidāgacchati /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kula putra vīṇāyāḥ śabdaḥ utpadyamānaḥ na kutaścid āgacchati
translated: For example, noble sir, the sound that arises from a vīṇā does not come from anywhere.

analyzed: nirudhyamānaḥ api na kvacid gacchati
translated: And when it ceases, it does not go anywhere.

analyzed: na kvacid saṃkrāmati
translated: It does not pass on to anything.

analyzed: pratītya ca hetu pratyaya sāmagrīm utpadyate hetu adhīnaḥ pratyaya adhīnaḥ
translated: And it arises in dependence on the collection of causes and conditions, dependent on causes, dependent on conditions.

original: tadyathāpi nāma droṇīṃ ca pratītya carma ca pratītya tantrīśca pratītya daṇḍaṃ ca pratītya upadhānīśca pratītya koṇaṃ ca pratītya puruṣasya ca tajjavyāyāmaṃ pratītya evamayaṃ vīṇāyāḥ śabdo niścarati hetvadhīnaḥ pratyayādhīnaḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma droṇīm ca pratītya carma ca pratītya tantrīḥ ca pratītya daṇḍam ca pratītya upadhānīḥ ca pratītya koṇam ca pratītya puruṣasya ca tajja vyāyāmam pratītya evam ayam vīṇāyāḥ śabdaḥ niścarati hetu adhīnaḥ pratyaya adhīnaḥ
translated: For example, a sound from a vīṇā arises in dependence on a container, a skin, strings, a stick, a bridge, a sound box, a peg, and a person’s effort.

original: sa ca śabdo na droṇyā niścarati /
analyzed: sa ca śabdaḥ na droṇyāḥ niścarati
translated: And that sound does not come from the container,

original: na carmaṇo na tantrībhyo na daṇḍānnopadhānībhyo na koṇānna puruṣasya tajjavyāyāmataḥ śabdo niścarati /
analyzed: na carmaṇaḥ na tantrībhyaḥ na daṇḍāt na upadhānībhyaḥ na koṇāt na puruṣasya tajja vyāyāmataḥ śabdaḥ niścarati
translated: nor from the skin, nor from the strings, nor from the stick, nor from the bridge, nor from the sound box, nor from the peg, nor from the person’s effort.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ sarveṣāṃ samāyogācchabdaḥ prajñapyate /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar sarveṣām samāyogāt śabdaḥ prajñapyate
translated: But rather, the sound is designated from the combination of all of them.

analyzed: nirudhyamānaḥ api śabdaḥ na kvacid gacchati
translated: And when the sound ceases, it does not go anywhere.

original: evameva kulaputra buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ kāyaniṣpattirhetvadhīnā pratyayādhīnā anekakuśalamūlaprayogapariniṣpannā ca /
analyzed: evam eva kula putra buddhānām bhagavatām kāya niṣpattiḥ hetu adhīnā pratyaya adhīnā aneka kuśala mūla prayoga pariniṣpannā ca
translated: In just the same way, noble sir, the manifestation of the bodies of the Lord Buddhas is dependent on causes and conditions, and is perfected by the application of many roots of virtue.

original: na caikato hetuto na caikataḥ pratyayato na caikataḥ kuśalamūlato buddhakāyaprabhāvanā /
analyzed: na ca ekatas hetutaḥ na ca ekatas pratyayataḥ na ca ekatas kuśala mūlataḥ buddhakāya prabhāvanā
translated: But it is not manifested by a single cause, nor by a single condition, nor by a single root of virtue.

analyzed: na ca nairhetukī
translated: And it is not causeless.

analyzed: bahu hetu pratyaya sāmagryām samutpannā sā na kutaścid āgacchati
translated: Arisen from the collection of many causes and conditions, it does not come from anywhere.

analyzed: hetu pratyaya sāmagryām asatyām na kvacid gacchati
translated: When the collection of causes and conditions is absent, it does not go anywhere.

original: evaṃ tvayā kulaputra teṣāṃ tathāgatānāmāgamanaṃ ca gamanaṃ ca draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: evam tvayā kula putra teṣām tathāgatānām āgamanam ca gamanam ca draṣṭavyam
translated: Son of noble family, you should see the coming and going of those Tathāgatas in this way.

original: sarvadharmāṇāmapi kulaputra tvayā iyameva dharmatā anugantavyā /
analyzed: sarva dharmāṇām api kula putra tvayā iyam eva dharmatā anugantavyā
translated: Son of noble family, you should understand this very nature of phenomena with regard to all phenomena.

original: yataḥ kulaputra tvamevaṃ tathāgatāṃśca sarvadharmāṃśca anutpannānaniruddhāṃśca saṃprajñāsyasi /
analyzed: yatas kula putra tvam evam tathāgatān ca sarva dharmān ca anutpannān aniruddhān ca saṃprajñāsyasi
translated: Son of noble family, when you thus understand the Tathāgatas and all phenomena to be unborn and unceasing,

analyzed: tatas tvam niyataḥ bhaviṣyasi anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: then you will certainly attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām upāya kauśalye ca niyatam cariṣyasi
translated: You will certainly practice the perfection of wisdom and skillful means.

original: asmin khalu punastathāgatānāmanāgatyagamananirdeśe bhāṣyamāṇe mahān bhūmicālo'bhūt /
analyzed: asmin khalu punar tathāgatānām anāgatya gamana nirdeśe bhāṣyamāṇe mahān
translated: Moreover, when this teaching on the Tathāgatas' coming and going was being given, there was a great earthquake.

original: sarvaśca trisāhasramahāsāhasro lokadhātuḥ ṣaḍvikāramahādaśamahānimittaṃ kampate prakampate saṃprakampate /
analyzed: sarvaḥ ca tri sāhasra mahā sāhasraḥ lokadhātuḥ ṣaṣ vikāra mahā daśa mahā nimittam kampate prakampate saṃprakampate
translated: The entire great trichiliocosm shook in six ways, with great signs and tremors.

analyzed: calati pracalati saṃpracalati
translated: It trembled, trembled strongly, and trembled intensely.

original: vedhate pravedhate saṃpravedhate /🔽raṇati praraṇati saṃpraraṇati /🔽kṣubhyati prakṣubhyati saṃprakṣubhyati /
analyzed: vedhate pravedhate saṃpravedhate  raṇati praraṇati saṃpraraṇati  kṣubhyati prakṣubhyati saṃprakṣubhyati
translated: It shook, shook strongly, and shook intensely.🔽It trembled, trembled strongly, and trembled intensely.🔽It quaked, quaked strongly, and quaked intensely.

analyzed: garjati pragarjati saṃpragarjati sma
translated: It roared, roared strongly, and roared intensely.

original: sarvāṇi ca mārabhavanāni saṃkṣobhitāni jihmībhūtāni cābhūvan /
analyzed: sarvāṇi ca māra bhavanāni saṃkṣobhitāni jihmībhūtāni ca abhūvan
translated: And all the abodes of Mara were disturbed and became dim.

analyzed: ye kecana tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau tṛṇa gulma oṣadhi vanaspatayaḥ
translated: Whatever grass, bushes, herbs, and forests there were in the great trichiliocosm,

original: te sarve yena dharmodgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvastena praṇatā abhūvan /
analyzed: te sarve yena dharmodgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tena praṇatāḥ abhūvan
translated: they all inclined towards the bodhisattva mahasattva Dharmodgata.

analyzed: akāla puṣpāṇi ca utsṛjanti sma
translated: And they released untimely flowers.

analyzed: upariṣṭāt ca antarīkṣāt mahā puṣpa varṣaḥ prāvarṣat
translated: And a great rain of flowers fell from the sky above.

original: śakraśca devānāmindraścatvāraśca mahārājāno dharmodgataṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvaṃ divyaiścandanacūrṇairdivyaiśca puṣpairavākiran abhyavākiran abhiprākiran /
analyzed: śakraḥ ca devānām indraḥ catvāraḥ ca mahā rājānaḥ dharmodgatam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam divyaiḥ candana cūrṇaiḥ divyaiḥ ca puṣpaiḥ avākiran abhyavākiran abhiprākiran
translated: And Shakra, lord of the gods, and the four great kings sprinkled and scattered divine sandalwood powder and divine flowers on the bodhisattva mahasattva Dharmodgata.

analyzed: evam ca vācam abhāṣanta sādhu sādhu kula putra
translated: And they spoke these words: Excellent, excellent, son of good family!

original: tava kulaputra anubhāvena adyāsmābhiḥ paramārthanirjātā kathā deśyamānā śrutā sarvalokavipratyanīkā /
analyzed: tava kula putra anubhāvena adya asmābhiḥ parama artha nirjātā kathā deśyamānā śrutā sarva loka vipratyanīkā
translated: By your power, noble sir, we have today heard a discourse on the ultimate truth being given, which is contrary to the whole world, and which we have never heard before.

analyzed: sarva satkāya dṛṣṭi pratiṣṭhitānām sarva asat dṛṣṭi abhiviniviṣṭānām sattvānām
translated: It is not the sphere of any beings who stand upon any false view, or who are attached to any false view.

original: atha khalu sadāprarudito bodhisattvo mahāsattvo dharmodgataṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvametadavocatkaḥ punaḥ kulaputra atra hetuḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu sadāpraruditaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ dharmodgatam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam etat avocat kaḥ punar kula putra atra hetuḥ
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata, What is the cause, noble sir,

original: kaḥ pratyayo'sya mahataḥ pṛthivīcālasya loke prādurbhāvāya /
analyzed: kaḥ pratyayaḥ usya mahataḥ pṛthivīcālasya loke prādurbhāvāya
translated: what is the reason for this great earthquake that has appeared in the world?

original: dharmodgato bodhisattvo mahāsattva āhaimaṃ kulaputra tathāgatānāmanāgatyagamananirdeśaṃ tava ca pṛcchato mama ca nirdiśato'ṣṭānāṃ prāṇisahasrāṇāmanutpattikadharmakṣāntipratilambho'bhūt
analyzed: dharmodgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ āha emam kula putra tathāgatānām anāgatya gamana nirdeśam tava ca pṛcchataḥ mama ca nirdiśatā uṣṭānām prāṇi sahasrāṇām anutpattikadharmakṣānti pratilambhaḥ bhūt
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata said, Noble sir, it is because of the Tathāgatas' teaching of the non-coming and non-going, and because of your asking and my explaining, that eight thousand beings have attained receptivity to the non-arising of dharmas,

analyzed: aśīteḥ ca prāṇi niyutānām anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpannāni
translated: and the thought of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment has arisen for eight quintillion beings.🔽 Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata, Noble sir, what is the name of this samādhi of the bodhisattva mahāsattva by which the bodhisattva mahāsattva has such great power and strength?

original: catuḥṣaṣṭeśca prāṇisahasrāṇāṃ virajāṃsi vigatamalāni dharmeṣu dharmacakṣūṃṣi viśuddhāni //
analyzed: catuḥṣaṣṭeḥ ca prāṇi sahasrāṇām virajāṃsi vigata malāni dharmeṣu dharma cakṣūṃṣi viśuddhāni
translated: And sixty-four thousand beings, their defilements extinguished, their impurities gone, gained the pure Dharma-eye in regard to dharmas.

original: atha khalu sadāprarudito bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ paramodāreṇa prītiprāmodyena samanvāgato'bhūtlābhā me paramasulabdhāḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu sadāpraruditaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ parama udāreṇa prīti prāmodyena samanvāgataḥ bhūt lābhāḥ me parama su labdhāḥ
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita became endowed with the highest and most vast joy and delight, thinking, I have gained the highest gain.

original: yasya me prajñāpāramitāmimaṃ ca tathāgatānāmanāgatyagamananirdeśaṃ paripṛcchataḥ iyatāṃ sattvānāmarthaḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: yasya me prajñāpāramitām imam ca tathāgatānām anāgatya gamana nirdeśam paripṛcchataḥ iyatām sattvānām arthaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: For the sake of those beings who asked me about the perfection of wisdom and this teaching of the Tathāgatas on coming and going, I have done this much.

original: etadevāsmākaṃ paryāptaṃ kuśalaṃ bhavedanuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ pariniṣpattaye /
analyzed: etat eva asmākam paryāptam kuśalam bhavet anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ pariniṣpattaye
translated: This alone will be sufficient for us to accomplish unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: na ca me bhūyo vicikitsā pravartate'nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /
analyzed: na ca me bhūyas vicikitsā pravartate in uttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: And I no longer have any doubt about unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: niḥsaṃśayam aham tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyāmi arhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: Without a doubt I will become a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: sa tenaiva prītiprāmodyena samanvāgataḥ saptatālaṃ vihāyasamabhyudgamya saptatāle sthitvā evaṃ cintayati smakenāhametarhi antarīkṣe sthitaḥ dharmodgataṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvaṃ satkuryāmiti /
analyzed: sa tena eva prīti prāmodyena samanvāgataḥ sapta tālam vihāyasam abhyudgamya sapta tāle sthitvā evam cintayati smakena aham etarhi antarīkṣe sthitaḥ dharma udgatam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam satkuryām iti
translated: He, endowed with that very joy and gladness, rose up into the sky to the height of seven palm trees, and standing there, thought thus: 'How can I, standing here in the sky, honor the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Dharmodgata?'

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmindra sadāpraruditaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamabhyudgataṃ dṛṣṭvā cetasaiva cāsya cittamājñāya divyāni cāsmai māndāravāṇi puṣpāṇyupanāmayati sma /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indra sadāpraruditam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam abhyudgatam dṛṣṭvā cetasā eva ca asya cittam ājñāya divyāni ca asmai māndāravāṇi puṣpāṇi upanāmayati sma
translated: Then Sakra, Lord of the Gods, seeing the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Sadaprarudita risen up, and knowing his mind, offered him divine coral tree flowers,

original: evaṃ cāvocatebhistvaṃ kulaputra divyaiḥ puṣpairdharmodgataṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvaṃ satkuru /
analyzed: evam ca avocat ebhiḥ tvam kula putra divyaiḥ puṣpaiḥ dharma udgatam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam satkuru
translated: and said this: 'With these divine flowers, son of good family, honor the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Dharmodgata.

analyzed: satkartavyaḥ hi kula putra asmābhiḥ tava parigrāhakaḥ
translated: For, son of good family, we must honor your supporter.

original: tava hi kulaputra anubhāvena adya bahūnāṃ prāṇisahasrāṇāmarthaḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: tava hi kula putra anubhāvena adya bahūnām prāṇi sahasrāṇām arthaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: For, son of good family, by your power, today the welfare of many thousands of beings has been accomplished.

analyzed: durlabhāḥ kula putra evaṃrūpāḥ sattvāḥ
translated: Son of good family, beings of such a kind are rare.

original: ye sarvasattvānāṃ kṛtaśo'prameyānasaṃkhyeyān kalpānutsahante mahāntaṃ bhāramudvoḍhuṃ yathā tvayā utsoḍham //
analyzed: ye sarva sattvānām kṛta śoprameyān asaṃkhyeyān kalpān utsahante mahāntam bhāram udvoḍhum yathā tvayā utsoḍham
translated: They are able to carry a great burden for immeasurable and incalculable eons for the sake of all beings, just as you have done.”

original: atha khalu sadāprarudito bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ śakrasya devānāmindrasyāntikānmāndāravāṇi puṣpāṇi gṛhītvā dharmodgataṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamavākirat /🔽abhyavākirat /
analyzed: atha khalu sadāpraruditaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ śakrasya devānām indrasya antikāt māndāravāṇi puṣpāṇi gṛhītvā dharmodgatam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam avākirat  abhyavākirat
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita, having taken the divine flowers from Śakra, Lord of the Devas, scattered them over the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata.🔽He scattered them.

analyzed: abhiprākirat
translated: He sprinkled them.

original: svakena ca kāyena dharmodgataṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamabhicchādayati sma /
analyzed: svakena ca kāyena dharmodgatam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam abhicchādayati sma
translated: And he covered the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata with his own body.

original: evaṃ ca vācamabhāṣataeṣo'haṃ kulaputra adyāgreṇa tavātmānaṃ niryātayāmi upasthānaparicaryāyai /
analyzed: evam ca vācam abhāṣata eṣā uham kula putra adya agreṇa tava ātmānam niryātayāmi upasthāna paricaryāyai
translated: And he spoke these words: Noble sir, from now on I offer myself to you for service and attendance.

original: sa ātmānaṃ niryātya dharmodgatasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya purataḥ prāñjaliṃ kṛtvāsthāt //
analyzed: saḥ ātmānam niryātya dharmodgatasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya puratas prāñjalim kṛtvā asthāt
translated: Having offered himself, he stood in front of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata with palms joined.

original: atha khalu sā śreṣṭhidārikā tāni ca pañca dārikāśatāni sadāpraruditaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvametadavocatetā vayamapi kulaputra tavātmānaṃ niryātayāmaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu sā śreṣṭhi dārikā tāni ca pañca dārikā śatāni sadāpraruditam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam etat avocata itāḥ vayam api kula putra tava ātmānam niryātayāmaḥ
translated: Then the merchant’s daughter and the five hundred girls said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita, ‘Noble sir, we also offer ourselves to you.

original: vayamapyanena kuśalamūlena eteṣāmeva dharmāṇāṃ lābhinyo bhavema /
analyzed: vayam api anena kuśala mūlena eteṣām eva dharmāṇām lābhinyaḥ bhavema
translated: By this root of merit, may we obtain these dharmas.

original: tvayaiva ca sārdhaṃ punaḥ punarbuddhāṃśca bhagavato bodhisattvāṃśca satkuryāma gurukuryāma /
analyzed: tvayā eva ca sārdham punar punar buddhān ca bhagavataḥ bodhisattvān ca satkuryāma gurukuryāma
translated: Together with you, we will again and again honor and respect the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, and the bodhisattvas.

analyzed: āsannībhūtāḥ ca tava eva bhavema
translated: May we be close to you.’

original: atha khalu sadāprarudito bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ śreṣṭhidārikāṃ tāni ca pañca dārikāśatānyetadavocatyadi me yūyaṃ dārikā adhyāśayamanuvartadhvam /
analyzed: atha khalu sadāpraruditaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ śreṣṭhi dārikām tāni ca pañca dārikā śatāni etat avocat yadi me yūyam dārikāḥ adhyāśayam anuvartadhvam
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita said to the merchant’s daughter and the five hundred girls, ‘If you, girls, follow my superior intention,

analyzed: adhyāśayena ca mahyam ātmānam niryātayata
translated: and with a superior intention offer yourselves to me,

analyzed: evam aham yuṣmān pratīccheyam
translated: then I will accept you.’

analyzed: dārikāḥ āhuḥ anuvartiṣyāmahe tava vayam āśayena adhyāśayena ca
translated: The girls said, ‘We will follow your intention with a superior intention.

analyzed: vayam tava ātmānam niryātayāmaḥ yathā icchā karaṇīya tāyai
translated: We offer ourselves to you to do as you wish.’

original: atha khalu sadāprarudito bodhisattvo mahāsattvastāni śreṣṭhidārikāpramukhāni pañca dārikāśatāni sarvālaṃkārabhūṣitāni kṛtvā tāni ca pañca rathaśatānyalaṃkṛtya sarvāṇi ca tāni dharmodgatāya bodhisattvāya mahāsattvāya niryātayati sma upasthānaparicaryāyaiḥimāḥ kulaputra ahaṃ tavopasthāyikā niryātayāmi /
analyzed: atha khalu sadāpraruditaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tāni śreṣṭhi dārikā pramukhāni pañca dārikā śatāni sarva alaṃkāra bhūṣitāni kṛtvā tāni ca pañca ratha śatāni alaṃkṛtya sarvāṇi ca tāni dharmodgatāya bodhisattvāya mahāsattvāya niryātayati smaḥ upasthāna paricaryā yaiḥ imāḥ kula putra aham tava upasthāyikāḥ niryātayāmi
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita, having adorned those five hundred girls headed by the merchant's daughter with all ornaments, and having adorned those five hundred chariots, dedicated them all to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata for service and attendance, saying, Son of good family, I dedicate these as your attendants.

original: imāni ca pañca rathaśatāni niryātayāmi paribhogāyeti //
analyzed: imāni ca pañca ratha śatāni niryātayāmi paribhogāya iti
translated: And I dedicate these five hundred chariots for your enjoyment.

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmindrastasmai kulaputrāya sādhukāramadātsādhu sādhu kulaputra /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ tasmai kula putrāya sādhukāram adāt sādhu sādhu kula putra
translated: Then Śakra, lord of the gods, applauded that son of good family, saying, Excellent, excellent, son of good family!

analyzed: bodhisattvaiḥ mahāsattvaiḥ sarva sva parityāgibhiḥ bhavitavyam
translated: Bodhisattva mahāsattvas should give up everything.

original: evaṃrūpeṇa ca tyāgacittena bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ kṣipramanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhyate /
analyzed: evaṃrūpeṇa ca tyāga cittena bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ kṣipram anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate
translated: With such a mind of generosity, a bodhisattva mahāsattva quickly awakens to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: evaṃ ca dharmabhāṇakāṇāṃ pūjāṃ kṛtvā śakyaṃ prajñāpāramitāmupāyakauśalyaṃ ca śrotum /
analyzed: evam ca dharma bhāṇakāṇām pūjām kṛtvā śakyam prajñāpāramitām upāya kauśalyam ca śrotum
translated: And having made offerings to Dharma teachers in this way, one is able to hear the perfection of wisdom and skill in means.

original: tairapi kulaputra paurvakaistathāgatairarhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ pūrvaṃ bodhisattvacaryāṃ caradbhirevaṃrūpa eva tyāge sthitvā anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ samudānītā prajñāpāramitāmupāyakauśalyaṃ ca paripraśnayadbhiriti //
analyzed: taiḥ api kula putra paurvakaiḥ tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ pūrvam bodhisattva caryām caradbhiḥ evaṃrūpe eva tyāge sthitvā anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ samudānītā prajñāpāramitām upāya kauśalyam ca paripraśnayadbhiḥ iti
translated: Those previous Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened Ones, while practicing the conduct of Bodhisattvas in the past, attained supreme perfect enlightenment by abiding in such generosity, and by inquiring about the perfection of wisdom and skillful means.

original: atha khalu dharmodgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvastāni śreṣṭhidārikāpramukhāni pañca dārikāśatāni pañca rathaśatāni sadāpraruditasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya kuśalaparipūrimupādāya pratigṛhṇīte sma /
analyzed: atha khalu dharmodgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tāni śreṣṭhi dārikā pramukhāni pañca dārikā śatāni pañca ratha śatāni sadāpraruditasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya kuśala paripūrim upādāya pratigṛhṇīte sma
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Dharmodgata accepted those five hundred maidens headed by the merchant's daughter and the five hundred chariots for the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Sadaprarudita, in order to complete his wholesome actions.

analyzed: pratigṛhya ca sadāpraruditāya eva kula putrāya pratiniryātayāmāsa
translated: Having accepted them, he returned them to the son of noble family Sadaprarudita.

original: atha khalu dharmodgato bodhisattvo mahāsattva utthāyāsanāt svakaṃ gṛhaṃ prāvikṣat sūryasya cāstaṃgamanakālo'bhūt //
analyzed: atha khalu dharmodgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ utthāya āsanāt svakam gṛham prāvikṣat sūryasya ca astaṃgamana kālaḥ bhūt
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Dharmodgata rose from his seat and entered his own house, and it was the time of sunset.

original: atha khalu sadāpraruditasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyaitadabhūtnaitanmama sādhu pratirūpaṃ bhavet /🔽yadahaṃ dharmakāmatayā āgatya niṣīdeyam /
analyzed: atha khalu sadāpraruditasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya etat abhūt na etat mama sādhu pratirūpam bhavet  yat aham dharma kāma tayā āgatya niṣīdeyam
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita thought, It is not right for me to sit down here out of desire for the Dharma.

analyzed: śayyām ca parikalpayeyam
translated: Having come here out of desire for the Dharma, it would not be right for me to lie down.

original: yannvahaṃ dvābhyāmeva īryāpathābhyāṃ sthitvā sthānena caṃkrameṇa ca kālamatināmayeyam /
analyzed: yat nu aham dvābhyām eva īryāpathābhyām sthitvā sthānena caṃkrameṇa ca kālam atināmayeyam
translated: Therefore, I should spend my time standing and walking, using only two postures,

original: yāvaddharmodgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ svakādgṛhānnirgato bhaviṣyati yaduta dharmasaṃprakāśanāyeti //
analyzed: yāvat dharma udgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ svakāt gṛhāt nirgataḥ bhaviṣyati yat uta dharma saṃprakāśanāya iti
translated: until the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata comes out of his house in order to teach the Dharma.

original: atha khalu dharmodgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sapta varṣāṇyekasamādhisamāpanna evābhūt /
analyzed: atha khalu dharmodgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sapta varṣāṇi eka samādhi samāpannaḥ eva abhūt
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata remained in a single samādhi for seven years,

analyzed: aprameyaiḥ asaṃkhyeyaiḥ bodhisattva samādhi sahasraiḥ prajñāpāramitā upāya kauśalya nirjātaiḥ vyāhārṣīt
translated: practicing with immeasurable and countless thousands of bodhisattva samādhis born from the perfection of wisdom and skillful means.

original: sadāprarudito'pi bodhisattvo mahāsattva sapta varṣāṇi dvābhyāmeva īryāpathābhyāṃ kālamatināmayan na styānamiddhamavakrāmayāmāsa /
analyzed: sadāpraruditaḥ api bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattva sapta varṣāṇi dvābhyām eva īryāpathābhyām kālam atināmayan na styānam iddham avakrāmayāmāsa
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita also spent seven years passing the time using only two postures, neither becoming drowsy nor sleepy.

analyzed: sapta varṣāṇi ca kāma vitarkam utpādayāmāsa
translated: For seven years he did not give rise to thoughts of desire,

analyzed: na vyāpāda vitarkam na vihiṃsā vitarkam utpādayāmāsa
translated: did not give rise to thoughts of malice or harm,

analyzed: na rasa gṛddhim na citta audbilyam utpādayāmāsa
translated: did not give rise to attachment to taste or delight in his mind.

original: api tu kadā nāma dharmodgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'smātsamādhervyutthāsyati /
analyzed: api tu kadā nāma dharma udgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ ūṣmāt samādheḥ vyutthāsyati
translated: But he thought, When will the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata emerge from this samādhi?

original: yannu vayaṃ dharmodgatasya bodhisattva mahāsattvasya dharmāsanaṃ prajñapayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: yat nu vayam dharmodgatasya bodhisattva mahāsattvasya dharma āsanam prajñapayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: Let us prepare a Dharma seat for the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata,

analyzed: yatra asau kula putraḥ niṣadya dharmam deśayiṣyati iti
translated: where that noble son will sit and teach the Dharma.

original: taṃ ca pṛthivīpradeśaṃ susiktaṃ sumṛṣṭaṃ ca kariṣyāmo nānāpuṣpābhikīrṇam /
analyzed: tam ca pṛthivī pradeśam su siktam su mṛṣṭam ca kariṣyāmaḥ nānā puṣpa abhikīrṇam
translated: And let us make that place well-watered and well-swept, strewn with various flowers.

original: yatra pṛthivīpradeśe dharmodgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāmupāyakauśalyaṃ ca saṃprakāśayiṣyatīti cintayāmāsa /
analyzed: yatra pṛthivī pradeśe dharma udgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitām upāya kauśalyam ca saṃprakāśayiṣyati iti cintayāmāsa
translated: Where the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata will teach the perfection of wisdom and skillful means.

original: tānyapi śreṣṭhidārikāpramukhāni pañca dārikāśatāni sadāpraruditasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyānuśikṣamāṇāni dvābhyāmeva īryāpathābhyāṃ kālamatināmayāmāsuḥ sarvāḥ kriyāstasyānuvartamānāḥ //
analyzed: tāni api śreṣṭhi dārikā pramukhāni pañca dārikā śatāni sadāpraruditasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya anuśikṣamāṇāni dvābhyām eva īryāpathābhyām kālam atināmayāmāsuḥ sarvāḥ kriyāḥ tasya anuvartamānāḥ
translated: Those five hundred girls headed by the merchant's daughter, also training in imitation of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita, spent their time in just those two modes of conduct, following all his actions.

original: atha khalu sadāprarudito bodhisattvo mahāsattvo divyaṃ nirghoṣamaśrauṣītitaḥ saptame divase dharmodgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'smātsamādhervyutthāsyati /
analyzed: atha khalu sadāpraruditaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ divyam nirghoṣam aśrauṣi ititas saptame divase dharmodgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ ūṣmāt samādheḥ vyutthāsyati
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita heard a divine voice saying, In seven days from now, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata will arise from that samādhi.

original: vyutthāya ca madhyenagarasya niṣadya dharmaṃ deśayiṣyatīti /
analyzed: vyutthāya ca madhyenagarasya niṣadya dharmam deśayiṣyati iti
translated: Having arisen, he will sit in the middle of the city and teach the Dharma.

original: atha khalu sadāprarudito bodhisattvo mahāsattvastaṃ divyaṃ nirghoṣaṃ śrutvā tuṣṭa udagra āttamanāḥ pramuditaḥ prītisaumanasyajātastaṃ pṛthivīpradeśaṃ śodhayāmāsa sārdhaṃ śreṣṭhidārikāpramukhaiḥ pañcadārikāśataiḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu sadāpraruditaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tam divyam nirghoṣam śrutvā tuṣṭaḥ udagraḥ ātta manāḥ pramuditaḥ prīti saumanasya jātaḥ tam pṛthivī pradeśam śodhayāmāsa sārdham śreṣṭhi dārikā pramukhaiḥ pañca dārikā śataiḥ
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita, having heard that divine voice, was satisfied, elated, delighted, and overjoyed. He was filled with joy and happiness and, together with the five hundred girls headed by the merchant's daughter, he cleaned that place on the ground.

analyzed: dharma āsanam ca prajñapayāmāsa sapta ratna mayam
translated: He prepared a Dharma seat made of the seven precious substances.

original: svakaṃ cottarāsaṅgaṃ kāyādavatārya tasyāsanasyopari prajñapayati sma /
analyzed: svakam ca uttarāsaṅgam kāyāt avatārya tasya āsanasya upari prajñapayati sma
translated: He took off his upper robe from his body and spread it out on that seat.

original: atha khalu tā dārikāḥ svakasvakānuttarāsaṅgān kāyādavatārya pañcottarāsaṅgaśatāni tatrāsane prajñapayāmāsuḥ atrāsane dharmodgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvo niṣadya dharmaṃ deśayiṣyatīti /
analyzed: atha khalu tāḥ dārikāḥ svaka svakān uttarāsaṅgān kāyāt avatārya pañca uttarāsaṅga śatāni tatra āsane prajñapayāmāsuḥ atra āsane dharma udgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ niṣadya dharmam deśayiṣyati iti
translated: Then those girls, taking off their own upper robes from their bodies, spread out five hundred upper robes on that seat, thinking, On this seat the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata will sit and teach the Dharma.

original: evaṃ tāśca sarvā dārikā dharmodgatasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya dharmāsanamāstīrya tuṣṭā udagrā āttamanasaḥ pramuditāḥ prītisaumanasya jātā abhūvan //
analyzed: evam tāḥ ca sarvāḥ dārikāḥ dharmodgatasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya dharma āsanam āstīrya tuṣṭāḥ udagrāḥ ātta manasaḥ pramuditāḥ prīti saumanasya jātāḥ abhūvan
translated: In this way, all those girls, having spread out the Dharma seat for the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata, were satisfied, elated, delighted, and overjoyed, and became happy and joyful.

original: atha khalu sadāprarudito bodhisattvo mahāsattvastaṃ pṛthivīpradeśaṃ sektukāmaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu sadāpraruditaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tam pṛthivī pradeśam sektu kāmaḥ
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita, desiring to sprinkle that place on the ground,

analyzed: na ca udakam samantāt paryeṣamāṇaḥ api labhate
translated: but not finding water anywhere,

analyzed: yena tam pṛthivī pradeśam siñcet
translated: with which to sprinkle that place on the ground,

analyzed: yathā api nāma māreṇa pāpīyasā tat sarvam udakam antardhāpitam abhūt
translated: it was as if all that water had been made to disappear by the evil Māra.

original: apyeva nāma asya sadāpraruditasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyodakamalabhamānasya cittaṃ khidyeta /
analyzed: api eva nāma asya sadāpraruditasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya udakam alabhamānasya cittam khidyeta
translated: He thought, What if the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita, not finding water, were to have a troubled mind?

analyzed: duḥkha daurmanasyam ca bhavet
translated: Or if he were to have suffering and mental anguish,

analyzed: cittasya vā anyathātvam bhavet
translated: or if his mind were to change,

analyzed: yena asya kuśala mūlasya antardhānam bhavet
translated: so that his roots of virtue would disappear,

analyzed: na vā pūjāḥ bhrājeran
translated: or if the offerings would not shine.

original: atha khalu sadāpraruditasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyaitadabhūtyannvahamātmanaḥ kāyaṃ viddhvā imaṃ pṛthivīpradeśaṃ rudhireṇa siñceyam /
analyzed: atha khalu sadāpraruditasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya etat abhūti annu aham ātmanaḥ kāyam viddhvā imam pṛthivī pradeśam rudhireṇa siñceyam
translated: Then this occurred to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita: I will pierce my own body and sprinkle this place with blood.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: ayam hi pṛthivī pradeśaḥ uddhata rajaskaḥ
translated: This place is dusty.

original: mā rajodhāturito bhūpredeśāddharmodgatasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya kāye nipatet /
analyzed: mā rajaḥ dhātuḥ itas bhū predeśāt dharma udgatasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya kāye nipatet
translated: Let no dust from this place fall on the body of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata.

analyzed: kim vā anena ātma bhāvena avaśyam bhedana dharmiṇā kuryām
translated: What should I do with this body, which is bound to be destroyed?

original: varaṃ khalu punarmamāyaṃ kāya evaṃrūpayā kriyayā vinaśyatu /
analyzed: varam khalu punar mama ayam kāyaḥ evaṃrūpayā kriyayā vinaśyatu
translated: It is better that this body of mine be destroyed in such a way,

analyzed: na tu niḥsāmarthya kriyayā
translated: rather than by the action of impotence.

original: api ca kāmahetoḥ kāmanidānaṃ bahūni me ātmabhāvasahasrāṇi punaḥ punaḥ saṃsāre saṃsarato bhinnāni /
analyzed: api ca kāma hetoḥ kāma nidānam bahūni me ātma bhāva sahasrāṇi punar punar saṃsāre saṃsarataḥ bhinnāni
translated: Moreover, for the sake of desire, for the sake of the cause of desire, many thousands of my bodies have been broken again and again while wandering in cyclic existence.

analyzed: na punar evaṃrūpeṣu sthāneṣu saddharma parigrahasya kṛtaśas
translated: But not for the sake of upholding the true Dharma in such places.

analyzed: yadi punar bhidyante
translated: If they are to be broken again,

analyzed: kāmam evaṃrūpeṣu bhidyantām iti
translated: let them be broken in such places.

original: atha khalu sadāprarudito bodhisattvo mahāsattva iti pratisaṃkhyāya tīkṣṇaṃ śastraṃ gṛhītvā svakāyaṃ samantato viddhvā taṃ pṛthivīpradeśaṃ svarudhireṇa sarvamasiñcat /
analyzed: atha khalu sadāpraruditaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ iti pratisaṃkhyāya tīkṣṇam śastram gṛhītvā sva kāyam samantataḥ viddhvā tam pṛthivī pradeśam sva rudhireṇa sarvam asiñcat
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita, having reflected thus, took a sharp weapon, pierced his own body all over, and sprinkled that place on the ground with his own blood.

original: tānyapi śreṣṭhidārikāpramukhāni pañcadārikāśatāni sadāpraruditasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyānuśikṣamāṇāni sarvāṇi tāni tīkṣṇāni śastrāṇi gṛhītvā svakasvakāni śarīrāṇi viddhvā taṃ pṛthivīpradeśaṃ svakasvakairlohitaiḥ sarvamasiñcan /
analyzed: tāni api śreṣṭhi dārikā pramukhāni pañca dārikā śatāni sadāpraruditasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya anuśikṣamāṇāni sarvāṇi tāni tīkṣṇāni śastrāṇi gṛhītvā svaka svakāni śarīrāṇi viddhvā tam pṛthivī pradeśam svaka svakaiḥ lohitaiḥ sarvam asiñcan
translated: Those five hundred maidens headed by the merchant's daughter, emulating the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita, all took sharp weapons, pierced their own bodies, and sprinkled that place on the ground with their own blood.

original: na ca sadāpraruditasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya tāsāṃ vā sarvāsāṃ dārikāṇāṃ cittasyānyathātvamabhūt /
analyzed: na ca sadāpraruditasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya tāsām vā sarvāsām dārikāṇām cittasya anyathātvam abhūt
translated: And the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita and all those girls did not have any other thought,

original: yatra sa māraḥ pāpīyānavatāraṃ labhet kuśalamūlāntarāyakaraṇāya //
analyzed: yatra sa māraḥ pāpīyān avatāram labhet kuśala mūla antarāya karaṇāya
translated: where that evil Māra could find an opportunity to create an obstacle to the roots of merit.”

original: atha khalu śakrasya devānāmindrasyaitadabhūtāścaryaṃ yāvaddharmakāmaścāyaṃ sadāprarudito bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu śakrasya devānām indrasya etat abhūta āścaryam yāvat dharma kāmaḥ ca ayam sadāpraruditaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, thought this: “How amazing! How much he desires the Dharma, this Sadāprarudita, the bodhisattva mahāsattva!

original: yāvaddṛḍhasamādānaśca yāvanmahāsaṃnāhasaṃnaddhaśca anapekṣaḥ kāye jīviteṣu bhogeṣu ca /
analyzed: yāvat dṛḍha samādānaḥ ca yāvat mahā saṃnāha saṃnaddhaḥ ca anapekṣaḥ kāye jīviteṣu bhogeṣu ca
translated: How firm his commitment! How he has donned the great armor! He is indifferent to body, life, and possessions.

analyzed: anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ adhigamāya adhyāśaya saṃprasthitaḥ
translated: He has set out with the superior intention to attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: yat uta sarva sattvān mocayiṣyāmi aparimāṇataḥ saṃsāra duḥkhāt anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhya iti
translated: Namely, ‘I will liberate all beings from immeasurable suffering in saṃsāra and attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.’

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmidrastatsarvaṃ lohitodakaṃ divyaṃ candanodakamadhyatiṣṭhat /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānāmidraḥ tat sarvam lohita udakam divyam candana udakam adhyatiṣṭhat
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, transformed all that blood and water into divine sandalwood water.

original: samantācca tasya pṛthivīpradeśasya acintyaṃ paramodāraṃ gandhaṃ yasya divyasya candanodakasya paripūrṇam /
analyzed: samantāt ca tasya pṛthivī pradeśasya acintyam parama udāram gandham yasya divyasya candana udakasya paripūrṇam
translated: And all around that place of earth there was an inconceivable, supremely vast fragrance of the divine sandalwood water that filled it.

analyzed: yojana śatam gandhaḥ vāti
translated: The fragrance spread for one hundred leagues.

original: atha śakro devānāmindraḥ sadāpraruditaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvametadavocatsādhu sādhu kulaputra /
analyzed: atha śakraḥ devānām indraḥ sadāpraruditam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam etat avocat sādhu sādhu kula putra
translated: Then Śakra, lord of the gods, said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita, Excellent, excellent, O son of noble family!

analyzed: sādhu te kula putra acintyam vīryam
translated: Excellent is your inconceivable diligence, O son of noble family!

original: sādhvī ca te anuttarā dharmakāmatā dharmaparīṣṭiśca /
analyzed: sādhvī ca te anuttarā dharma kāma tā dharma parīṣṭiḥ ca
translated: Excellent is your unsurpassed desire for the Dharma and your search for the Dharma!

original: evaṃrūpeṇa kulaputra adhyāśayena evaṃrūpeṇa vīryeṇa evaṃrūpayā ca dharmakāmatayā taiḥ paurvakaistathāgatairarhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhairanuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ samudānītā //
analyzed: evaṃrūpeṇa kula putra adhyāśayena evaṃrūpeṇa vīryeṇa evaṃrūpayā ca dharma kāma tayā taiḥ paurvakaiḥ tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ samudānītā
translated: O son of noble family, the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment was attained by those past tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened ones through such an aspiration, such diligence, and such a desire for the Dharma.

original: atha khalu sadāpraruditasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyaitadabhūtprajñaptaṃ mayā dharmodgatasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya dharmāsanam /
analyzed: atha khalu sadāpraruditasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya etat abhūt prajñaptam mayā dharmodgatasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya dharma āsanam
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita thought, I have prepared a Dharma seat for the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata.

original: ayaṃ ca pṛthivīpradeśaḥ susiktaḥ susaṃmṛṣṭaśca kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: ayam ca pṛthivī pradeśaḥ su siktaḥ su saṃmṛṣṭaḥ ca kṛtaḥ
translated: And this place of earth has been well-watered and well-swept.

original: kuto nu khalvahaṃ puṣpāṇi labheyam /🔽yairahamimaṃ pṛthivīpradeśaṃ puṣpābhikīrṇaṃ kuryām /
analyzed: kutas nu khalu aham puṣpāṇi labheyam  yaiḥ aham imam pṛthivī pradeśam puṣpa abhikīrṇam kuryām
translated: “Where can I find flowers?🔽With which I can cover this place with flowers?”

original: dharmodgataṃ ca bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvaṃ dharmaṃ deśayantaṃ dharmāsane niṣaṇṇamabhyavakireyam /
analyzed: dharma udgatam ca bodhisattvam mahāsattvam dharmam deśayantam dharma āsane niṣaṇṇam abhyavakireyam
translated: “Where can I get flowers so that I can strew them on this place on the ground and strew them on the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Dharmodgata when he is sitting on the Dharma seat teaching the Dharma?”

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmindraḥ sadāpraruditaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvametadavocat imāni te kulaputra pratigṛhāṇa divyāni māndāravāṇi puṣpāṇi🔽ebhistvamimaṃ pṛthivīpradeśaṃ puṣpābhikīrṇaṃ kuru /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ sadāpraruditam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam etat avocat imāni te kula putra pratigṛhāṇa divyāni māndāravāṇi puṣpāṇi  ebhiḥ tvam imam pṛthivī pradeśam puṣpa abhikīrṇam kuru
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita, “Noble one, accept these divine māndārava flowers.

original: dharmodgataṃ ca bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvaṃ dharmaṃ deśayantaṃ dharmāsane niṣaṇṇamabhyavakira /
analyzed: dharma udgatam ca bodhisattvam mahāsattvam dharmam deśayantam dharma āsane niṣaṇṇam abhyavakira
translated: With these you can strew them on this place on the ground and strew them on the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Dharmodgata when he is sitting on the Dharma seat teaching the Dharma.”

original: sa tasmai divyaṃ khārīsahasraṃ divyānāṃ māndāravapuṣpāṇāmupanāmayati sma /
analyzed: sa tasmai divyam khārī sahasram divyānām māndārava puṣpāṇām upanāmayati sma
translated: He offered him a thousand khārīs of divine māndārava flowers.

original: atha khalu sadāprarudito bodhisattvo mahāsattvastāni puṣpāṇi gṛhītvā anyataraiḥ puṣpaistaṃ pṛthivīpradeśaṃ puṣpābhikīrṇamakārṣīt /
analyzed: atha khalu sadāpraruditaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tāni puṣpāṇi gṛhītvā anyataraiḥ puṣpaiḥ tam pṛthivī pradeśam puṣpa abhikīrṇam akārṣīt
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita took those flowers and scattered them on that place on the ground with some of the flowers.

analyzed: anyataraiḥ ca puṣpaiḥ dharmodgatam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam abhyavākirat
translated: and with other flowers he scattered them over the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Dharmodgata.

original: atha khalu dharmodgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ saptānāṃ varṣāṇāmatyayena tataḥ samādhervyutthāya yena dharmāsanaṃ tenopasaṃkramya prajñapta evāsane nyaṣīdat /
analyzed: atha khalu dharmodgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ saptānām varṣāṇām atyayena tatas samādheḥ vyutthāya yena dharma āsanam tena upasaṃkramya prajñapte eva āsane nyaṣīdat
translated: Then, after seven years had passed, the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Dharmodgata arose from that samādhi, approached the Dharma seat, and sat down on the prepared seat.

original: anekaśatasahasrayā parṣadā parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ prajñāpāramitāṃ deśayāmāsa //
analyzed: aneka śata sahasrayā parṣadā parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ prajñāpāramitām deśayāmāsa
translated: Surrounded and revered by an assembly of many hundreds of thousands, he taught the perfection of wisdom.

original: atha khalu sadāprarudito bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sahadarśanenaiva dharmodgatasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya tādṛśaṃ sukhaṃ pratilabhate sma /
analyzed: atha khalu sadāpraruditaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ saha darśanena eva dharmodgatasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya tādṛśam sukham pratilabhate sma
translated: Then, as soon as the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Sadāprarudita saw the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Dharmodgata, he attained such bliss.

original: tadyathāpi nāma prathamadhyānasamāpanna ekāgramanasikāro bhikṣuḥ /🔽tatreyaṃ dharmodgatasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitādeśanāyaduta sarvadharmasamatayā prajñāpāramitāsamatā /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma prathama dhyāna samāpannaḥ ekāgra manasikāraḥ bhikṣuḥ  tatra iyam dharma udgatasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitā deśanā yat uta sarva dharma samatayā prajñāpāramitā samatā
translated: It was just like a bhikṣu who has attained the first dhyāna and has one-pointed attention.🔽There, this is the teaching of the perfection of wisdom by the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Dharmodgata: namely, the equality of the perfection of wisdom through the equality of all dharmas.

analyzed: sarva dharma vivikta tayā prajñāpāramitā vivikta tā
translated: The isolation of the perfection of wisdom through the isolation of all dharmas.

analyzed: sarva dharma acalana tayā prajñāpāramitā acalana tā  sarva dharma āmanana tayā prajñāpāramitā manana tā
translated: The non-wavering of the perfection of wisdom is due to the non-wavering of all dharmas.🔽The non-mentation of the perfection of wisdom is due to the non-mentation of all dharmas.

analyzed: sarva dharma āstambhita tayā prajñāpāramitā āstambhita tā  sa vadharma eka rasa tayā prajñāpāramitā eka rasa tā  sarva dharma aparyanta tayā prajñāpāramitā paryanta tā
translated: The immobility of the perfection of wisdom is due to the immobility of all dharmas.🔽The single taste of the perfection of wisdom is due to the single taste of all dharmas.🔽The boundlessness of the perfection of wisdom is due to the boundlessness of all dharmas.

analyzed: sarva dharma anutpāda tayā prajñāpāramitā anutpāda tā
translated: The non-arising of the perfection of wisdom is due to the non-arising of all dharmas.

analyzed: sarva dharma anirodha tayā prajñāpāramitā nirodha tā
translated: The non-cessation of the perfection of wisdom is due to the non-cessation of all dharmas.

analyzed: gagana aparyanta tayā prajñāpāramitā paryanta tā
translated: The boundlessness of the perfection of wisdom is due to the boundlessness of space.

analyzed: samudra a paryanta tayā prajñāpāramitā paryanta tā
translated: The boundlessness of the perfection of wisdom is due to the boundlessness of the ocean.

analyzed: meru vicitra tayā prajñāpāramitā vicitra tā  gagana a kalpana tayā prajñāpāramitā kalpana tā
translated: The variety of the perfection of wisdom is due to the variety of Mount Meru.🔽The non-imagination of the perfection of wisdom is due to the non-imagination of space.

analyzed: rūpa aparyanta tayā prajñāpāramitā paryanta tā
translated: The boundlessness of the perfection of wisdom is due to the boundlessness of form.

analyzed: evam vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ  vijñāna aparyanta tayā prajñāpāramitā paryanta tā
translated: Likewise, it is due to the boundlessness of feeling, perception, volitional formations,🔽and consciousness.

analyzed: pṛthivī dhātu aparyanta tatā prajñāpāramitā paryanta tā
translated: The boundlessness of the perfection of wisdom is due to the boundlessness of the earth element.

analyzed: evam ap dhātu tejaḥ dhātu vāyu dhātu ākāśa dhātu aparyanta tayā prajñāpāramitā paryanta tā
translated: In the same way, the perfection of wisdom is boundless because of the boundlessness of the water element, fire element, wind element, space element, and consciousness element.

analyzed: vijñāna dhātu aparyanta tayā prajñāpāramitā paryanta tā
translated: The perfection of wisdom is boundless because of the boundlessness of the consciousness element.

analyzed: vajra upama dharma sama tayā prajñāpāramitā sama tā  sarva dharma a saṃbhedana tayā prajñāpāramitā saṃbhedana tā
translated: The equality of the perfection of wisdom is the equality of the diamond-like Dharma.🔽The indivisibility of the perfection of wisdom is the indivisibility of all dharmas.

analyzed: sarva dharma anupalabdhi tayā prajñāpāramitā anupalabdhi tā  sarva dharma abhibhāvanā sama tayā prajñāpāramitā abhibhāvanā sama tā
translated: The non-apprehension of the perfection of wisdom is the non-apprehension of all dharmas.🔽The equality of the perfection of wisdom in overpowering all dharmas is the equality of all dharmas in overpowering.

analyzed: sarva dharma niśceṣṭa tayā prajñāpāramitā niśceṣṭa tā
translated: The inactivity of the perfection of wisdom is the inactivity of all dharmas.

analyzed: sarva dharma acintya tayā prajñāpāramitā acintya tā veditavyā iti
translated: The inconceivability of the perfection of wisdom should be known as the inconceivability of all dharmas.

original: atha khalu sadāpraruditasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya tathāniṣaṇṇasyaiva tasyāṃ belāyāṃ sarvadharmasamatā nāma samādhirājo jātaḥ /🔽yataḥ sarvadharmaviviktaśca nāma samādhiḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu sadāpraruditasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya tathā niṣaṇṇasya eva tasyām belāyām sarvadharmasamatā nāma samādhi rājaḥ jātaḥ  yatas sarvadharmaviviktaḥ ca nāma samādhiḥ
translated: Then, at that time, when the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita was seated in that way, the samādhi called King of the Equality of All Dharmas arose.🔽From which arose the samādhi called Separation from All Dharmas,

analyzed: sarvadharmācalanaḥ ca nāma samādhiḥ
translated: the samādhi called Immobility of All Dharmas,

analyzed: sarva dharma āmananaḥ ca nāma samādhiḥ  sarvadharmāstambhitaḥ ca nāma samādhiḥ
translated: The samādhi named Non-contemplation of All Dharmas.🔽The samādhi named Immovable of All Dharmas.

original: sarvadharmaikarasaśca nāma samādhiḥ /🔽sarvadharmāparyantaśca nāma samādhi /🔽sarvadharmānutpādaśca nāma samādhiḥ /
analyzed: sarva dharma ekarasaḥ ca nāma samādhiḥ  sarva dharma aparyantaḥ ca nāma  sarva dharma anutpādaḥ ca nāma samādhiḥ
translated: The samādhi named Single Flavor of All Dharmas.🔽The samādhi named Boundless of All Dharmas.🔽The samādhi named Non-arising of All Dharmas.

analyzed: sarva dharma anirodhaḥ ca nāma samādhiḥ  gaganāparyataḥ ca nāma samādhiḥ
translated: The samādhi named Non-cessation of All Dharmas.🔽The samādhi named Boundless Space.

analyzed: samudrāparyantaḥ ca nāma samādhiḥ  meruvicitraḥ ca nāma samādhiḥ
translated: The samādhi named Boundless Ocean.🔽The samādhi named Varied Like Mount Meru.

analyzed: gaganākalpaḥ ca nāma samādhiḥ
translated: The samādhi named Like Space.

analyzed: rūpāparyantaḥ ca nāma samādhiḥ
translated: The samādhi named Boundless Form.

analyzed: evam vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ
translated: Likewise, the samādhi named Boundless Feeling, Perception, and Formation.

analyzed: vijñāna aparyantaḥ ca nāma samādhiḥ  nāma samādhiḥ
translated: The samādhi named Boundless Consciousness.🔽The samādhi named Boundless Earth Element.

analyzed: evam ap dhātu tejaḥ dhātu vāyu dhātu ākāśa dhātu aparyantaḥ ca nāma samādhiḥ
translated: Likewise, the samādhi named Boundless Water Element, Fire Element, Wind Element, and Space Element.

analyzed: vijñāna dhātu aparyantaḥ ca nāma samādhiḥ
translated: The samādhi named Boundless Consciousness Element.

analyzed: vajropamaḥ ca nāma samādhiḥ  sarva dharma asaṃbhedaḥ ca nāma samādhiḥ
translated: The samādhi named Diamond-like.🔽The samādhi named Non-distinction of All Dharmas.

analyzed: sarva dharma anupalabdhiḥ ca nāma samādhiḥ
translated: The samādhi named Non-apprehension of All Dharmas.

original: sarvadharmāvibhāvanāsamatā ca nāma samādhiḥ /🔽sarvadharmaniśceṣṭaśca nāma samādhiḥ /
analyzed: sarva dharma a vibhāvanā sama tā ca nāma samādhiḥ  sarvadharmaniśceṣṭaḥ ca nāma samādhiḥ
translated: The samādhi called Equality of the Non-Appearance of All Dharmas.🔽The samādhi called All Dharmas are Without Effort.

analyzed: sarva dharma acintyaḥ ca nāma samādhiḥ
translated: The samādhi called All Dharmas are Inconceivable.

original: evaṃpramukhāni ṣaṣṭiḥ samādhimukhaśatasahasrāṇi sadāpraruditena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena pratilabdhānyabhūvanniti //
