analyzed: evaṃpramukhāni ṣaṣṭiḥ samādhi mukha śata sahasrāṇi sadāpraruditena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena pratilabdhāni abhūvan iti
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita attained these and other such sixty hundred thousand samādhi doors.

analyzed: ārya aṣṭasāhasrikāyām prajñāpāramitāyām dharmodgataparivartaḥ nāma ekatriṃśattamaḥ
translated: In the noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines, the chapter named The Section of Dharmodgata, the thirtieth.

analyzed: parīndanā parivartaḥ dvātriṃśattamaḥ
translated: The Thirty-Second Chapter: The Chapter on Entrusting.

original: sahapratilabdhānāṃ ca subhūte ṣaṣṭyāḥ samādhimukhaśatasahasrāṇāṃ sadāprarudito bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ pūrvasyāṃ diśi /
analyzed: saha pratilabdhānām ca subhūte ṣaṣṭyāḥ samādhi mukha śata sahasrāṇām sadāpraruditaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ pūrvasyām diśi
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita attained the sixty hundred thousand samādhi doors simultaneously in the east,

analyzed: dakṣiṇasyām paścimāyām uttarasyām diśi
translated: in the south, in the west, in the north,

original: vidikṣu adha ūrdhvaṃ ca diśi daśasu dikṣu gaṅgānadīvālukopameṣu trisāhasramahāsāhasreṣu lokadhātuṣu gaṅgānadīvālukopamān buddhān bhagavataḥ paśyati sma bhikṣusaṃghaparivṛtān bodhisattvaguṇapuraskṛtān etaireva nayairebhireva nāmabhiretairevākṣarairimāmeva prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāṣamāṇān tadyathāpi nāma ahametarhi asminneva trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau dharmaṃ deśayāmi bhikṣusaṃghaparivṛto bodhisattvagaṇapuraskṛtaḥ /
analyzed: vidikṣu adhas ūrdhvam ca diśi daśasu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālukā upameṣu tri sāhasra mahā sāhasreṣu lokadhātuṣu gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamān buddhān bhagavataḥ paśyati sma bhikṣu saṃgha parivṛtān bodhisattva guṇa puraskṛtān etaiḥ eva nayaiḥ ebhiḥ eva nāmabhiḥ etaiḥ eva akṣaraiḥ imām eva prajñāpāramitām bhāṣamāṇān tat yathā api nāma aham etarhi asmin eva tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau dharmam deśayāmi bhikṣu saṃgha parivṛta
translated: In the intermediate directions, below and above, in the ten directions, in world systems numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, in great trichiliocosms, he saw buddhas, bhagavats, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, surrounded by assemblies of monks, with bodhisattvas in the lead, teaching precisely this perfection of wisdom through these very methods, with these very names, with these very syllables, just as I am now teaching the Dharma in this very great trichiliocosm, surrounded by an assembly of monks, with a group of bodhisattvas in the lead.🔽🔽

analyzed: ebhiḥ eva nayaiḥ ebhiḥ eva nāmabhiḥ ebhiḥ eva akṣaraiḥ imām eva prajñāpāramitām bhāṣe
translated: In the intermediate directions, below, and above, in the ten directions, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, in the great trichiliocosm, he saw buddhas, bhagavats, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, surrounded by assemblies of monks, with bodhisattvas in the lead, teaching precisely this perfection of wisdom through these very methods, these very names, and these very letters, just as I am now teaching the Dharma in this very great trichiliocosm, surrounded by an assembly of monks, with a host of bodhisattvas in the lead, through these very methods, these very names, and these very letters, precisely this perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: saḥ ucintyena bāhuśrutyena śruta sāgara tayā ca samanvāgataḥ bhūt
translated: He was endowed with inconceivable erudition and an ocean of learning.

original: sarvāsu ca jātiṣu na jātu buddhavirahito'bhūt /
analyzed: sarvāsu ca jātiṣu na jātu buddha virahitaḥ bhūt
translated: And in all his births he was never separated from the Buddha.

original: yatra yatra buddhā bhagavantaḥ saṃmukhībhūtā bhavanti /
analyzed: yatra yatra buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ saṃmukhībhūtāḥ bhavanti
translated: Wherever the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, were present,

analyzed: tatra tatra upapadyate sma
translated: there he was reborn.

analyzed: avirahitaḥ ca bhavati sma buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ
translated: And he is never separated from the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones,

analyzed: antatas svapna antara gataḥ api
translated: even when he is in the intermediate state after death, let alone while awake.

analyzed: sarve ca anena akṣaṇāḥ vivarjitāḥ
translated: And he has abandoned all unfavorable conditions,

analyzed: kṣaṇa saṃpad ca a rāgi tā
translated: and has attained the favorable conditions.

original: tatra khalu punarbhagavānāyuṣmantamānandamāmantrayate smatadanenāpi te ānanda paryāyeṇa evaṃ veditavyamityapīyaṃ prajñāpāramitā bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ sarvajñajñānasyāhāriketi /
analyzed: tatra khalu punar bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam āmantrayate sma tat anena api te ānanda paryāyeṇa evam veditavyam iti api iyam prajñāpāramitā bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām sarvajña jñānasya āhārikā iti
translated: There the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda, By this method also, Ānanda, you should know that this perfection of wisdom brings about the knowledge of all modes of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings.

original: tasmāttarhi ānanda bodhisattvairmahāsattvaiḥ sarvajñajñānaṃ pratilabdhukāmairasyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caritavyam /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi ānanda bodhisattvaiḥ mahāsattvaiḥ sarvajña jñānam pratilabdhu kāmaiḥ asyām prajñāpāramitāyām caritavyam
translated: Therefore, Ānanda, the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, who want to win the knowledge of all modes, should course in this perfection of wisdom.

original: iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā śrotavyā udgrahītavyā dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā pravartayitavyā deśayitavyopadeṣṭavyoddeṣṭavyā svādhyātavyā likhitavyā /
analyzed: iyam prajñāpāramitā śrotavyā udgrahītavyā dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā pravartayitavyā deśayitavyā upadeṣṭavyā uddeṣṭavyā su ādhyātavyā likhitavyā
translated: This perfection of wisdom should be listened to, etc. to: one should exert oneself in writing, etc. it.

original: tathāgatādhiṣṭhānena mahāpustake pravyaktapravyaktairakṣaraiḥ sulikhitāṃ kṛtvā satkartavyā gurukartavyā mānayitavyā pūjayitavyā arcayitavyā apacāyitavyā puṣpairdhūpairgandhairmālyairvilepanaiścūrṇaiścīvarairvādyairvastraiśchatrairdhvajairghaṇṭābhiḥ patākābhiḥ /
analyzed: tathāgata adhiṣṭhānena mahā pustake pravyakta pravyaktaiḥ akṣaraiḥ su likhitām kṛtvā satkartavyā gurukartavyā mānayitavyā pūjayitavyā arcayitavyā apacāyitavyā puṣpaiḥ dhūpaiḥ gandhaiḥ mālyaiḥ vilepanaiḥ cūrṇaiḥ cīvaraiḥ vādyaiḥ vastraiḥ chatraiḥ dhvajaiḥ ghaṇṭābhiḥ patākābhiḥ
translated: Having written it out well, with clear and distinct letters, on a large piece of paper, it should be treated well, treated as venerable, honored, worshipped, revered, esteemed, with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, flags, bells, banners,

analyzed: samantāt ca dīpa mālābhiḥ
translated: and with garlands of lamps all around,

analyzed: bahuvidhābhiḥ ca pūjābhiḥ
translated: and with many kinds of worship.

analyzed: iyam asmākam antikāt ānanda anuśāsanī
translated: This, Ānanda, is our instruction to you.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: atra hi prajñāpāramitāyām sarvajña jñāna pariniṣpattiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Because in this perfection of wisdom the full attainment of the knowledge of all knowledge will come about.

original: tatkiṃ manyase ānanda śāstā te tathāgataḥ /🔽ānanda āhaśāstā me bhagavan /
analyzed: tat kim manyase ānanda śāstā te tathāgataḥ  ānandaḥ āha śāstā me bhagavan
translated: What do you think, Ānanda, is the Tathāgata your teacher?

analyzed: śāstā me sugata
translated: Ānanda said, The Blessed One is my teacher, the Well-Gone One is my teacher.

analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam etat avocat śāstā te ānanda tathāgataḥ
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda, The Tathāgata is your teacher, Ānanda.

analyzed: paricaritaḥ asmi ānanda tvayā maitreṇa kāya karmaṇā manaāpena
translated: You have served me, Ānanda, with a friendly bodily action, with a pleasing bodily action,

analyzed: maitreṇa vāc karmaṇā manaāpena
translated: with a friendly verbal action, with a pleasing verbal action,

analyzed: maitreṇa manaḥ karmaṇā manaāpena
translated: With a friendly mental action, pleasing to the mind.

original: tasmāttarhi ānanda yathaiva tvayā mamaitarhi tiṣṭhato dhriyamāṇasya yāpayato'smin samucchraye prema ca prasādaśca gauravaṃ ca kṛtam /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi ānanda yathā eva tvayā mama etarhi tiṣṭhataḥ dhriyamāṇasya yāpayataḥ smin samucchraye prema ca prasādaḥ ca gauravam ca kṛtam
translated: Therefore, Ananda, just as you have now, while I am abiding, upholding, and maintaining this exalted status, generated love, faith, and respect,

original: tathaiva tvayā ānanda mamātyayādasyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ kartavyam /
analyzed: tathā eva tvayā ānanda mama atyayāt asyām prajñāpāramitāyām kartavyam
translated: in the same way, Ananda, after my passing, you should do so towards this perfection of wisdom.

original: dvirapi trirapi te ānanda parīndāmi anuparīndāmi enāṃ prajñāpāramitām /
analyzed: dvis api tris api te ānanda parīndāmi anuparīndāmi enām prajñāpāramitām
translated: For a second and a third time, Ananda, I entrust and fully entrust this perfection of wisdom to you,

analyzed: yathā iyam na antardhīyeta
translated: so that it may not disappear.

analyzed: yathā na asyām tvam anyaḥ puruṣaḥ syāḥ
translated: So that you, Ananda, may not be another man in this matter.

analyzed: yāvat ānanda iyam prajñāpāramitā loke pracariṣyati
translated: As long as, Ananda, this perfection of wisdom circulates in the world,

analyzed: tāvat tathāgataḥ tiṣṭhati iti veditavyam
translated: for that long the Tathagata should be known as abiding.

analyzed: tāvat tathāgataḥ dharmam deśayati iti veditavyam
translated: For that long the Tathagata should be known as teaching the Dharma.

original: avirahitāste ānanda sattvā buddhadarśanena dharmaśravaṇena saṃghopasthānena ca veditavyam /
analyzed: avirahitāḥ te ānanda sattvāḥ buddha darśanena dharma śravaṇena saṃgha upasthānena ca veditavyam
translated: Those beings, Ananda, should be known as not separated from seeing the Buddha, hearing the Dharma, and attending to the Sangha.

analyzed: tathāgata antika avacarāḥ te ānanda sattvāḥ veditavyāḥ
translated: Those beings, Ananda, should be known as dwelling in the presence of the Tathagata.

original: ya enāṃ prajñāpāramita śroṣyantyudgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyantyupadekṣyantyuddekṣyanti svādhyāsyanti likhiṣyanti satkariṣyanti gurukariṣyanti mānayiṣyanti pūjayiṣyantyarcayiṣyantyapacāyiṣyanti puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajaghaṇṭāpatākābhiḥ /🔽samantācca dīpamālābhiḥ /
analyzed: ye enām prajñāpāramita śroṣyanti udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyanti upadekṣyanti uddekṣyanti su ādhyāsyanti likhiṣyanti satkariṣyanti gurukariṣyanti mānayiṣyanti pūjayiṣyanti arcayiṣyanti apacāyiṣyanti puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja ghaṇṭā patākābhiḥ  samantāt ca dīpa mālābhiḥ
translated: Those who will hear this perfection of wisdom, take it up, bear it in mind, recite it, study it, spread it, teach it, explain it, expound it, chant it, write it, honor it, revere it, respect it, make offerings to it, worship it, and venerate it with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, flags, and rows of lamps all around,

analyzed: bahuvidhābhiḥ ca pūjābhiḥ iti  idam avocat bhagavān ātta manāḥ
translated: and with many kinds of offerings.

original: te ca maitreyapramukhā bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ āyuṣmāṃśca subhūtirāyuṣmāṃśca śāriputraḥ āyuṣmāṃścānandaḥ śakraśca devānāmindraḥ sadevamānuṣāsuragaruḍagandharvaśca loko bhagavato bhāṣitamabhyanandanniti //
analyzed: te ca maitreya pramukhāḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ āyuṣmān ca subhūtiḥ āyuṣmān ca śāriputraḥ āyuṣmān ca ānandaḥ śakraḥ ca devānām indraḥ sa deva mānuṣa asura garuḍa gandharvaḥ ca lokaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhyanandan iti
translated: Thus spoke the Blessed One, and the Bodhisattva Mahasattvas headed by Maitreya, the Venerable Subhuti, the Venerable Shariputra, the Venerable Ananda, Shakra the Lord of the Gods, and the world with its gods, humans, asuras, Garudas, Gandharvas and all beings rejoiced in the Blessed One's words.

analyzed: ārya aṣṭasāhasrikāyām prajñāpāramitāyām parīndanāparivartaḥ nāma dvātriṃśattamaḥ
translated: In the noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines, the chapter named Entrusting is the thirty-second.

original: samāptā ceyaṃ bhagavatyā āryāṣṭasāhasrikāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā sarvatathāgatajananī bodhisattvapratyekajinaśrāvakāṇāṃ mātā /
analyzed: samāptā ca iyam bhagavatyāḥ ārya aṣṭasāhasrikāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā sarva tathāgata jananī bodhisattva pratyeka jina śrāvakāṇām mātā
translated: And this is the end of the Blessed One's Noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines, the mother of all Tathagatas, the mother of Bodhisattvas, Pratyekabuddhas, and Sravakas.

original: dharmamudrā dharmolkā dharmanābhirdharmabherī dharmanetrī dharmaratnanidhānam akṣayo dharmaḥ acintyādbhutadarśananakṣatramālā sadevamānuṣāsuragandharvalokavanditā sarvasukhaheturiti //
analyzed: dharma mudrā dharma ulkā dharma nābhiḥ dharma bherī dharma netrī dharma ratna nidhānam akṣayaḥ dharmaḥ acintya adbhuta darśana nakṣatra mālā sa deva mānuṣa asura gandharva loka vanditā sarva sukha hetuḥ iti
translated: It is the Dharma seal, the Dharma torch, the Dharma navel, the Dharma drum, the Dharma eye, the Dharma jewel treasure, the inexhaustible Dharma, the inconceivable and wondrous star garland, revered by the world of gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas, the cause of all happiness.

original: prajñāpāramitāṃ samyagudgṛhya paryavāpya ca dhārayitvā pravartya enāṃ viharantu sadārthina iti //
analyzed: prajñāpāramitām samyak udgṛhya paryavāpya ca dhārayitvā pravartya enām viharantu sadā arthinaḥ iti
translated: Having properly received and mastered the Perfection of Wisdom, having upheld and spread it, may those who seek it always dwell in it.

original: ye dharmā hetuprabhāvā hetusteṣāṃ tathāgato hyavadat /
analyzed: ye dharmāḥ hetu prabhāvāḥ hetuḥ teṣām tathāgataḥ hi avadat
translated: Those dharmas that arise from the power of causes, the Tathagata has declared their cause.

original: teṣāṃ ca yo nirodha evaṃvādī mahāśramaṇaḥ //
analyzed: teṣām ca yaḥ nirodhaḥ evaṃvādī mahā śramaṇaḥ
translated: And the cessation of those, thus has the great ascetic spoken.

analyzed: deya dharmaḥ yam pravara mahāyāna yāyinyāḥ parama upāsika saurājra suta lakṣmīdharasya
translated: This is a gift of Dharma, of the foremost great vehicle traveler, the supreme laywoman, the daughter of the king, the bearer of Lakshmi.

analyzed: yat atra puṇyam tat bhavatu ācārya upādhyāya mātā pitṛ pūrvaṃgamam kṛtvā sakala sattva rāśeḥ anuttara jñāna avāptaye iti
translated: Whatever merit there is in this, may it be for the attainment of unsurpassed knowledge by the entire multitude of beings, with the teacher, preceptor, mother, and father at the forefront.
